Maybe my misinterpretation was that I had envisaged a studio in a Sheoak forest on the edge of a vineyard. Also there is a major highway about 100 metres from the studio with constant trucks and vehicle noise whizzing past. It didnt bother me as I still slept well but I was surprised that it was right there as the garden view. All in all, I had a fab stay for what I needed and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the studio.

Great place to stay! Used it as a place to sleeping during the Medieval Fair in Lyndoch. Nice little kitchen with all the essentials and plenty of heating options for the cold weather. Everything was very clean and tidy. Lovely view of the sunrise. Lots of privacy, check in and out was completely contactless and really easy.

Highway noise was noticeable at night but didn't disturb me, and I'm a fairly light sleeper. With some music or the TV running you won't hear it at all.

Great location for the event we had booked for the weekend. Recommend taking your enough food supplies for your stay as the supermarket is not just down the road. Was nice and warm in winter. Only big enough for a couple. Hosts very nice and more than happy to help. Well priced.
Convenient base to explore the Barossa. Very comfy & clean. The studio shed had everything we needed for our 4 night stay.
What a lovely, homey, modern, light-filled place to stay. So peaceful and relaxing amongst the fields and sheep/horses. And I loved the blossom trees so much!!

Kylie and Toms studio was a perfect place to relax, and their communication with us was excellent. The studio was bigger than I expected and it was lovely and clean! Only a 10 minute drive from Tanunda. Would definitely stay again!
great location,and great communication

We enjoyed staying at The Shed which was scrupulously clean and functional. The kitchen/fridge was stocked with handy items including various sauces and some breakfast makings. It was more spacious than anticipated and attractively furnished with some interesting handmade items of decor. We were impressed with Kylie's quick responses to messages and the assistance provided to operate the oven (it needed resetting after a recent power loss).
The bed was super comfortable.
We also enjoyed meeting the sheep in the paddock next door and they seemed to enjoy meeting us :)
Thank you for a lovely comfortable stay
Great communication. Great location for touring around the area. You can hear the road noise, but not when inside and listening to music. Comfortable and well equipped.
Lovely simple, comfortable accommodation in a great location for exploring the Barossa. Kylie and Tom are accommodating and communicate well from beginning to end
This is an amazing little getaway that is easily accessible, clean and near enough to town, but far enough to feel free.
The studio was perfect for a one night stay in the Barossa.

Great little place. Very relaxing.
Lovely bedroom.
Perfect quiet place to say, absolutely true to description and a very pleasant all around.
Lovely self-contained granny flat, with all you need to stay comfortably.  Beautiful scenery around you and there's even a couple goat neighbours!
A gorgeous homely cabin on a beautiful farm

We stayed here for 3 nights as two adults couples. This is a great apartment just off the Main Street of Tanunda. It is well appointed and clean with access to a laundry and pool which is great. The kitchen was perfect for light dinners, after big lunches in the region.
Communication and checking in and out were easy.
The only thing I would say, is that for international travelers, the lack of free wifi ($10/day instead) may be a drawback. Being from Australia we could use our own internet, but it seems like something that could be easily fixed.
We would definitely stay again.

What a lovely place to stay, the apartment was & loooked better than the online photos. The location was perfect, it was clean and well appointed. The only negative for me was that for the price I think the pillows could have been better. I would stay here again.
Thank you Kym.

This is a great apartment, spacious and well maintained.
I would say they only thing lacking is WIFI.
Very good location for exploring the Barossa.
Beautiful stay everything we needed and hot air balloons overhead in the morning. Would definitely stay again .

Tanunda and Barossa Valley are so very lovely, especially the people. So warm and welcoming, to be sure.

Our rental was situated in a prime location, downtown Tanunda. The check-in process was easy, always a plus.

I would recommend the Valley Apartments for a stay in the Barossa.

Very efficient process in order to obtain the key.
Lovely, clean and modern apartments very central to the main street.
Absolutely loved them and we would definitely stay there again. Thank you

The apartment was spacious, clean and well equipped. There were fresh towels and sheets and hotel-like toiletries. Kim was helpful and quick to respond to our needs.

The apartment would have been better if there was a little bit more entertainment such as a selection of DVDs, an Apple TV (or equivalent) and some cards or board games.
Fantastic, clean apartment in a fabulous location! Nice and private off the Main Street. Will definitely stay again!
Nice and clean. Staff were very nice and prompt with communications and helpful in assisting to enquires. Quiet spot in a nice small town. Good stopover for exploring the wine region.
Great location and warm modern unit. Would stay their again

Was a nice comfortable place to stay. Only two of us stayed so Apartment was too big but none the less was nice. I believe the apartment was a little bit over priced but that's just personal preference.
Great apartment
A well appointed and well located place close to shops, cafes and restaurants. Would stay there again, especially with a second couple.
Well located apartment a couple of mins walk to the centre of Tanunda
Great location
Excellent accomodation

Great location, very easy to walk to restaurants and shops. Booking and check in process was very easy. Accomodation was clean. Unfortunately it was very overpriced. $500 for one night on a Thursday in early December. It felt like boutique accomodation prices for a motel feel experience.
We enjoyed our stay, beautiful quiet farm house.

Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations.  Our hosts were extremely friendly, hospitable and informative.  Bill even took us out to help feed the sheep on his farm!  If you're looking to stay on a peaceful farm in a homely granny flat that is just a short drive from Adelaide and Barossa Valley, Bill's place is perfect.

Bill and Angela made us feel very welcome and were accommodating of an unexpectedly late arrival. The bungalow was comfortable and cosy and set in the midst of their large farm but close to Gawler. We enjoyed our stay.

Bill and Angela are very nice and prepared all the things we need, with sunny smile and local knowledge.

The whole family enjoyed the quiet farm, sighting the new lambs being born, sunrise.

Great experience and thanks a lot!

The kindest people. Angela made sure we settled in warmly. Bill took time off work on his farm to plan our day trip. We had the honour of meeting their friends too. One of the good fellows even followed up with an itinerary for our trip to KI.

(The sweetest dogs too. Millie came to sit with us often. Max was always ready to play.)

The property sits within an hour from Adelaide CBD and Gawler Town, and approximately two hours to Cape Jervis (if you're heading over to KI). You will need a car and to drive on unsurfaced road to reach the farm. (Website hidden by Airbnb) The room with ensuite bathroom is fitted with a very comfortable queen bed (with electric blanket), one extra single bed, heater in both rooms, television and fridge. There were also bread, cereal, juice and milk, on top of cutlery and dishware.

I would say the pictures are an understatement of how beautiful the property is, especially with the view outside. You will also wake up to the sheep bleating and birds chirping. The perfect getaway with wonderful hosts.
A pleasant stay on a working farm the highlight of which was the opportunity to see a shearer in action.

A warm and welcoming couple that we enjoyed chatting with.

A very pleasant little slice of country life, with all care taken to provide homely comforts.
What a truly wonderful and relaxing experience! Bill and Angela are both delightful, the views are stunning and  Bills homemade bread in the morning just topped it off. Will definitely be back!

Hosts Bill and Angela are congenial hosts making us most welcome on arrival and providing helpful advice in advance.
Our nine night stay, covering the final week of December, was very comfortable even with the seasonally high temps. As listed, the unit is well appointed. The unit and it's outside seating make for a most relaxing view of an attractive ornamental garden and views extending across the fields to the hills of the nearby Barossa.
It is only a short distance of unsealed road to access the property and the reward of experiencing the comforts and hospitality offered are well worth a return visit.

Bill and Angela ( and wonder dog Max!) were fabulous hosts we arrived in time to watch some of the shearing of their stud sheep and were then shown through our self sufficient accomodation adjacent to the house in a lovely garden aspect. We had heard all about Bills home made bread from previous vistor reviews and weren't disappointed every morning a couple of large thick slices were waiting for us in the fridge, along with, jam, fresh orange juice, milk and a selection of cereals plus tea and coffee. The location was perfect for us a short drive across the main highway to Gawler and our family we came to visit but quiet enough for us who usually live in the country. Highly recommend and look forward to staying again when we next return to SA.

Bill and Angela welcomed us warmly. Angela pointed out the location of the food and amenities that they had provided for our breakfasts. As it was late and the shops closed she suggested a local tavern where we could  get some dinner. We really appreciated Angela's advice. Bill was very busy with lambing but took time out to talk with us and explain the operations of the farm. Our flat was very cosy, clean and comfortable. We really felt "at home"and would love to return some time. Bill's bread made for nice crispy toast!! We really enjoyed being in a country farm environment. Thanks Angela and Bill.

Angel and bill were so nice , we had a perfect dinner , share our story and country curtlure , we were really enjoyable , beautiful house , beautiful view ! I think I will never forget this day , thanks so much ! Hope can see u guys in somewhere again !

Bill and angela are just good  decent country people that would take the shirt off their backs for you. My visit was short but amazing, they feed me at short notice after the weather turn rather horrible as i was heading out  but decided not to. Bills bread that he cooks fresh for breakfast is amazing. Wish i had more time to spend with them and would of loved to see more of there beautiful property. If im ever in the area again i would be staying with them with out a doubt. Thanks again for my lovely stay.

Thankyou Bill and Angela for being so accomodating. I had a lovely, short stay- wish it was longer! The space was clean, bed was super comfortable and there was lots of goodies provided.
Thankyou once again for a good, carefree stay.

I am glad that I found this property and met Bill and Angela.  They made my weekend of having to work locally much more bearable.  Very welcoming and comfortable place to stay.  I hope to be back again and bring hubby with me next time for a longer stay.  Even the family dog made me feel very welcome.

We really enjoyed our stay on the farm and Bill and Angela were excellent hosts.  They were very friendly and helpful, ensuring we enjoyed our stay.  We would really recommend this accommodation for anyone wanting a quiet country escape.  Max the dog was a real plus!
We bad a lovely stay at Bill and Angela's. Angela was very obliging when we needed a couple of things. Thanks Bill and Angela for your hospitality.
Had a great stay, very comfortable and clean. Hosts both very accommodating and friendly

Bill and Angela are exceptional hosts. They made us feel at home and looked after us well. I'm a single dad with primary school age children who love farms and animals. Bill let us join in all his farm work and he was brilliant with the kids - so patient and inclusive. We visited in time for the start of the lambing season. Bottle feeding lambs was a treat for the kids.
The farm is absolutely beautiful. We were lucky enough to see a lot of the land and some of the old buildings made of local materials.
Comfortable beds and quality linen had us sleeping well after our days of fun, fresh air and exercise. The cottage is very clean and was freshly painted before our visit.
Finding the farm was easy. Bill's directions are accurate and the address is easy to find on (Hidden by Airbnb) maps also.
We will be back for sure.

This place is a real get-away from everything, very relaxing and super friendly hosts. Especially good if you want to experience some farm-life. Nice B&B style, and not too far to drive for dinner etc.

This was my second visit with my kids. We loved our first visit so much the kids were begging me to go back. This place is so pretty in the winter when it's all green. Bill and Angela are wonderful hosts and made us feel very welcome once again.
Great self contained room - brought my own food which I didn't have to as there was breakfast laid on every day which I didn't use.
Bill’s place was just magnificent, you get the idea of peace and serenity immediately you arrive, we will be looking forward to another stay in future.

Bill and Angela are fantastic hosts; they are friendly and hospitable and I found the farming operation very interesting. They look after you well with home-baked bread and condiments, and are very happy to share their local knowledge. The cottage is very comfortable with lovely views out across the countryside, and a very pleasant outdoor patio to enjoy "sundowners" and snacks in the evening. The trip into the northern parts of Adelaide is quick and convenient (approx 30 mins). The proximity to the Barossa is an added bonus. I would definitely recommend this Airbnb.

Small space but perfect for 2-3 people. About 30 mins from Tanunda (main town of the Barossa Valley). They have kettle and tea/coffee but no microwave or kitchen amenities. Hosts are wonderful and very friendly and helpful :) the accommodation is on their farm next to their house but still feels private.

We really enjoyed the location and beautiful surroundings of the property. The apartment is small but cosy. The proximity to the main house is very close but we happened to stay while the owners were away which made it very quiet and private. Unfortunately the wifi only worked for the first night and then would not work again. Also the apartment was quite dusty and had cobweb corners. But everything else was clean and tidy. The continental breakfast provided was very nice and it was nice to have our dishes cleaned up for us each day. Overall we did enjoy our stay and found it comfortable.
Great little space with beautiful views and beautiful hosts.

Bill and Angela’s hospitality was outstanding, they helped us during the stress of moving house. Their beautiful home has helped us de-stress and relax during this crazy time, fresh bread everyday and a little tour of the farm made our stay extra special.
Great location to explore the mid North from. Very friendly hosts and generous continental breakfast.

We had an excellent experience staying at Bill's place. The place was very relaxing and provided my husband and myself a much needed break. His two dogs provided excellent pet therapy! Bill & his wife were very friendly and offered plenty of suggestions for places to eat, things to do etc. The daily provision of freshly baked bread was just the icing on the cake! We look forward to staying here again when we visit next.
So comfortable and great views
Great farm stay, bill and his wife were very hospitable. The fresh baked bread was delicious and the dogs were a great addition

I stayed at their place with my 2 kids
to visit my friend lives nearby.
They all are very beautiful, my kids could have a precious farm experience and we really loved everything.

The room is not so big, no kicthen amenity, but good enough for us,
we had great scenery from the window and it was greater experience for kids than to stay luxually hotel!

Will visit again!!
Thank you!
If you are staying in Angle Vale is it very close to shops and entertainment . I do recommend it.
was a lovely place to stay. very nice little granny flat seperate to the house. would definitely stay there again.
Awesome location, wide open country views and the room was beautiful and clean! Very easy to find and Bill and his family were extremely lovely.
Bill,Angela and family were such wonderful host. Thoughtful and so welcoming the kids did not want to leave.
Great experience for a recharge. Very clean and tidy place. Max the sheep-dog is addicted to a tummy rub, so be ready to give some love and receive some.

We had a wonderful time staying at Bill's place. We especially loved the farm tour. It was amazing! We learned a lot about sheep and farming. The room was great as well. Space greatly used. Perfect for a family or a group of friends. Super comfy beds and the shower pressure is outstanding! It definitely felt like a home away from home. And the surroundings are beautiful. Bill and Angela were such warm and welcoming host. Thank you!

Bill's place is a lovely quiet space right next to his home but overlooking the patio, grape arbour and distant hills. Bill welcomed our young son to feed the sheep which was special. We really looked forward to going 'home' to the farm after long touristy days.

We booked this accommodation for two of our workers who needed to complete a job in the area.  The location was excellent and as far as I can ascertain, all went without a hitch with the booking.  There were no complaints from our guys and the accommodation worked out well.
Excellent spot for star gazing!!!

A cute little place with outstanding hospitality, and an excellent taste of farm life. Close enough to explore around the Barossa Valley by car. I would definitely recommend a stay with Bill & Angela.

We stayed for 2 nights at Bill and Angela’s. My daughter said the best holiday ever and must stay place at Adelaide. Really loved farm staying, appreciated Bill and Angela’s great hospitality. hopefully we visit you sometime soon!
Love the country setting. It was peaceful and would definitely go back if I am in the area. The host were very generous!!
it is really a good choice

Bill, Angela and family are fantastic hosts. They are extremely welcoming, they offer local knowledge and are great to talk to. The country home is clean, welcoming, spacious and has a real country touch to it. As an animal person I loved being able to play with the dogs each night when I got home. I would definitely recommend staying at Bill and Angela’s.

We really enjoyed staying in the guest cabin, with Bill and Angela as our hosts. They could not have been better hosts, providing us with an experience well above our expectations.
We were particularly pleased with the help Bill and Angela provided with an unexpected complication. Nothing was too much trouble. given the property was a very busy working farm, Bill was only too happy to explain how the property operated and it has given us a more informed view of farm life in Australia.

We will happily seek to stay here again when visiting SA.

An added bonus is the two dogs we got to play with, Max and Rosi. We thought about taking Max home with us but decided Max would miss being a sheepdog. Bill told us that Max thinks he's a sheep dog but he's not very good at it. Nevertheless , it was fun to see Max jump onto the hay ute each morning, chase the sheep and think he's doing a great job. And Rosie is just a little sweetie who likes a bit of attention.

We would recommend this stay to anybody who seeks a totally different AirBnB experience in SA.

And the bread Bill makes each day for breakfast is simply the best toast we have ever had.

The thoughtfulness, kindness, generosity and hospitality was amazing. Beautiful location, lovely accomodation and the going above and beyond was heart warming. Bill and Angela , thank you so much for a lovely experience.

Great Host, very friendly and helpful. gave us lot of information about barossa valley
couldn't have asked for more!

Bill and Angela are great hosts. Nothing is too much trouble. An added benefit is that the property is a substantial working sheep farm. So quiet, yet located very close to the famous Barossa Valley where there is no end of interesting places to visit.  This is our second stay with Bill and Angela and we will not hesitate to stay again when next in the area.
Bill and Angela were amazing hosts. The scenery was beautiful and they have lovely animals! Awesome hospitality and location.

Bill’s a great host and greeted us with fresh home baked bread on arrival! The accomodation for my son and I was perfect as we used the place as a base for a local event we were at. My only regret is that we didn’t get a chance to look around Bill’s farm.  We’ll be back next year for sure, thanks Bill.

The place has everything you need, nice and cosy. Breakfast provided. The guest suite is quite close to the main house so there’s not much privacy. Bill and Angela were friendly and helpful. The dogs are cute!

This was a very peaceful stay on a working farm. The room is very comfy and warm, particularly cosy in the cold winter weather. The family are very friendly and helpful.
Thank you for our stay!
Perfect in every way. We were welcomed by every member of the family and we felt so comfortable. Truly recommend to anyone wanting a short or longer stay.
Great b&b when traveling through Adelaide. Very clean and tidy with breakfast/amenities provided. Highly recommend

Our Stay with Bill and Angela was Good, Quiet and had Great views
Friendly Animals :)
Home Made Bread for breakfast was a really nice touch :)

would recommend.

Thankyou.

Nice little granny flat to stay in especially if you want to see a real working farm in action. The dogs are beautiful and friendly and greet you on arrival along with the hosts. Thank you for a relaxing stay.

Warm friendly and down to earth people who work hard on their farm. So fascinating to see how life on a farm really is. Not your average City accommodation but everything works and provides a unique experience
A comfortable and cosy place to stay in a delightful rural setting.
Beautiful farm - the serenity is magic!  We will be back.
Peaceful, quiet country Farmstay. Easy to find, easy check in and farmstyle hospitality with generous breakfast supplies. Thanks Bill.

As described. Very easy for me as I could check in and out when I wanted.
Road track to access the farm.
I had the chance to see a large kangarroo early morning in the field
That was a great experience of my stay...

Bill and his wife were very friendly and welcoming, the accommodation was clean and tidy, the best thing was they accommodated for our baby. Would definitely stay again 10/10, thank you Bill we had a great stay 😊
Bill’s place in the true farm stay experience in Barossa. Some great recommendations and comfortable accommodation. Loved the interaction with the dogs at the property. Will book again/recommend

A return stay for me and once again I had a lovely stay with such a welcoming family.  It feels like a home away from home and even though my stay was for work-related purposes again, it didn't take long to relax and unwind in a comfortable farm setting.  Seeing Max the Border Collie again and newborn triplet lambs a highlight!

Bill's place is about 10 minutes out of Gawler so is handy to all amenities.   We loved staying on a working farm and the farm tour was a highlight.  Bill's home baked bread was also a highlight for us.  Yum!

Doors / window overlooks to east and you can enjoy sunrise right from your bed.
Bill has 2 grandkids and thus a lot of scooters, bikes, toys you can use, so our 2 kids were happy to play.
Bill showed around his farm, told about its history, how things are done - that was interesting and I got what I was hoping for.

In reality stains on carpet and white cover spoiled first impression.
This is a guesthouse with a metallic roof, as in garage.
Spider webs in some corners. Different type of bugs notices in the house and one in bed.
Bed was way too soft for me. First morning was harsh after such bed, second one was ok, as I slept only on my back.
No wifi signal in the guesthouse or even on a patio by it. Had to use my mobile as a hotspot.

Comparatively, it was far from worth of $290 for 2 nights (because of the cleaning fee $30 and Airbnb commission). However, $90 is a good price.

Bill's place was so nice. The place wasn't not only for staying, the whole area was amazing wildpark. I feel. Guests can be experienced real farm life such as feeding lambs.
I was so happy to stay there.
A nice peaceful getaway place. Perfect if you love farm stays and being surrounded by animals.
Had a lovely stay
Very nice host, help where they can, nice area and animals, recommend.

Thanks for our stay bill! We enjoyed sitting on the couch and looking out at the beautiful farm property. We loved the very generous & specific breakfast supplies for our dietary requirements  & you accomodating our baby with a high chair & cot was very handy.
Very nice place

A hidden little gem, we only wish we could have stayed longer. The view is amazing, it was lovely to lay in bed and look out over the fields and the sheep ‘alarm clocks’ were nice to wake up to.

We were welcomed and made to feel at home straight away. The accommodation was perfect for us and had everything we needed. They may just have one of the the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in.

My 10 year old loved the games and movies. He’s already asking when we can go back.

Perfect location for us, close to family and we will be repeat visitors.

We so enjoyed stay at Bill and Angela's place. Lovely hosts. We appreciated being accommodated at late notice. It was perfect for our needs and we will be back next time we are passing through. Thank you. :)

Bill's place was a lovely and relaxing rest stop for us on a long journey. It was comfortable, clean and cosy, and it was lovely to wake up to the sunrise over the farmland. The resident dogs were particularly welcoming and ridiculously cute! Would recommend :)
A real farm stay!

Bill's place was lovely and very comfortable. My partner and I enjoyed our stay and found Bill to be an accommodating host. I recommend his place to anyone looking to stay out of relatively busy town and/or cityscapes while travelling.
Thanks Bill had a great stay!

We were only at Bill's place for a short time as we had a horse comp nearby so we weren't at Bill's for much of the time. The time we did have there however, was wonderful. Check in was super easy and it was lovely to fall asleep to the sheep and the lambs. It was also great that we didn't have to worry about breakfast as it was supplied and delicious. We would love to stay again next competition.

our stay at the sheep farm was amazing. Our timing couldn’t be better as it was lambing time, and our hosts were accommodating and allowed us to get as involved as we wanted. We could not recommend this any higher to those looking for a true farm stay.
Clean, good value, friendly and very cute lambs

A great farmstay, warm and inviting host with invitation for interaction with the sheep (Lambing season & in abundance. Accomm has everything required and provides a relaxing space. Breakfast supplies also a plus
Felt more remote than it actually is - a bit of a gem considering the location and proximity to ADL.
A very enjoyable way to end the week for us.
Perfect location for day trips around the area. Bill is a wonderful host
Very quaint little place comfortable and warm.
Bills place is very neat and tidy and super quaint! we really enjoyed our stay there. Bill was lovely and very helpful with anything that we might need.

Beautiful location
Great communication
Easy to find, simple room with everything you need for a short stay.
Super stay
Nice little cabin, especially if you want a rural retreat. Close to Gawler and Barossa for day trips.

Bill's space is perfect if you are after a small space with the all the basics you need.
Bill was also a lovely host who greeted us, and then put the heater and electric blankets on for us to make sure we were comfortable.
Great place, close to gawler and not far from barossa valley
Nice little retreat. Very comfy bed.
Lovely farm stay close enough to the city to be convenient but far enough away to be peaceful - nice thoughtful touches to feel secure and comfortable
An easy stay on a lovely farm. Bill was good at communicating and check in was very straightforward. Would stay there again.
Very easy very accommodating host. had a wonderful stay and will be sure to check for availabilities here if back in the area. thank you
If you looking for a hide out from the city lights this is a perfect & peaceful place to be to relax n reflect.

We spent the most fabulous weekend in the stunning Miners cottage in an idyllic setting, overlooking a beautiful creek, gum trees and teeming with indigenous wild life.
The cottage was very well appointed with a good eye to detail and very comfortable beds. We received a warm welcome and great hospitality with a well stocked fridge and provisions, even down to home made bread . If one wants to combine a true getaway and authentic experience in the Barossa this is your answer.

Rebecca and Nick are wonderful hosts. In the evening you are treated to Kangaroos just outside your door, in the morning Rebecca has all of the fixings for a wonderful farm-fresh breakfast.

The cottage is wonderfully restored, and beautifully decorated. It's a great place to relax, or as a base to see the Barossa Valley.
Great location, great food. A pleasure to stay here, especially seeing the kangaroos on the lawn at night.
Dealing with Rebecca was very easy and effortless. She was able to answer any queries I had - in a timely manner as well.

We enjoyed a wonderful few days here, clean, cosy and well appointed cottage oozing 1870's charm but with all the modern "necessities". Rebecca was polite and respectful of our space yet always attentive to any needs.
Well positioned to explore the Barossa region. A++
We enjoyed a "mini moon" for a couple of nights post our wedding. The miners cottage was perfect accommodation. Beautiful outlook, enjoyed dining outside, breakfasts were amazing and the bath lovely.

Wow what a fabulous place for a cousin retreat. We had such a lovely time. Rebecca made sure we had everything plus some for relaxing getaway. The property is amazing, the gardens, the pool, the claw foot bath, and the outdoor setting. We can't wait to go back again. Thank you Rebecca

The miners cottage " experience " is just perfect. Lovely accommodation in a beautiful garden. Beautiful brecky provisions and lots of other touches. Close to all the attractions of the Barossa but it is hard to leave the accommodation.
Great stay in a great place. Beautiful cottage, fantastic hosts and a fantastic location. The wonderful breakfast produce was an added bonus. Our only regret was not staying more days.

10/10 weekend...
Our intentions were to have a romantic weekend away and not be tied up with a busy schedule. Upon being greeted by Rebecca when my partner and I walked into the cottage we instantly said the photos don't do it justice. Even though on the website it's a beautiful cottage the warmth and the atmosphere was amazing.

We were greeted with decanted port, fresh eggs, chocolates, breakfast, candles, we made our own bread and enjoyed an amazing open fire place. Highly recommended and Rebecca was a great host whenever we needed. Will be staying again for sure.
Absolutely fantastic.

I surprised my husband with a stay at the miner's cottage for 30th and it was perfect. We really enjoyed our stay, it was so comfortable and was a great couple of days of relaxation. Rebecca was a fantastic host, very accomodating and thought of every little detail. It is a beautiful property in Barossa Valley and we loved meeting dog, cat and goats. We would definitely recommend the cottage to others and believe rooms such as the bathroom looked better than the photos.
Great work Rebecca and family.

The cottage was beyond expectations and absolutely gorgeous. The milky way shone brightly at night, the garden grounds and birds chirped cheerily at the back, the comfortable bed was a refuge for dreams and the gorgeous bath a relaxation space in the warm bathroom. Every little detail has been thought through...including the delicious fresh bread! An incredible place to stay.

What a great location. Rebecca and Nick were great hosts. The cottage was very romantic. Loved the fireplace. The extra things like fresh milk, bacon and eggs, coffee machine were a bonus. Thanks guys it was great.

Rebecca and Nick were A1 hosts if you needed it they were there.
The Miners cottage was absolutely beautiful great place to unwind and to get back to nature. The kangaroos and kookaburras were a plenty.
We would definitely recommend this cottage.

Great little spot to get away
Pretty, quiet, relaxing

The Miner's Cottage is the perfect getaway location whilst being handy to all of the attractions and facilities the Barossa offers. The ambiance, facilities and surroundings are spectacular. Everything we needed was provided. Rebecca & Nick are absolutely fantastic hosts.

We loved our stay at The Miners Cottage. Everything about this place is so peaceful and relaxing. We particularly enjoyed warm fires at night and our private tour around the property with Emmy (the dog) as our guide!

Definitely one of the most romantic getaways in South Australia.

The Miner's Cottage is a lovely, quiet place to stay. A bit outside of the main towns, but a really pretty area to relax and have a BBQ out back! We enjoyed the fireplace and making some fresh baked bread in the mornings for breakfast. Rebecca and Nick were really friendly and communicative - we had no troubles checking in or sorting anything that we needed. Would recommend their place for sure!

An amazing experience! Perfectly picturesque with every imaginable comfort of a 5 star accommodation. Rebecca made us feel very welcome indeed and it is a rare slice of paradise.  I would recommend Rebecca's BnB as THE place to stay to experience the Barossa

This cosy cottage is packed with personality. Close to everything you need as a home base whilst exploring the local area. Rebecca was our gorgeous host who greeted us upon arrival and then came back with lovely fresh flowers to brighten the cottage. Thank you.

Cute cottage in a gorgeous amongst nature and kangaroos! Rebecca’s place was lovely, updated yet with the charm and character you’d hope for. And, pet friendly on top of all that!!

Breakfast came with fruit, yogurt, cereal, bacon and more. High end bathroom amenities, plush comfy bed and a beautiful, peaceful setting. Great place to getaway and de-stress.

The only suggest I would make to future guests is to use plenty of bug repellent as there are lots of mosquitoes. (Rebecca does provide bug repellent though).

All in all, there isn’t much else I could have asked for.
Lovely place. Beautiful grounds, much more impressive than pictures suggest!

This really was a bed and breakfast in the traditional sense. I was so very happy with the breakfast provided. And the view, and the friendly dog to greet you when you arrive. The cottage is adorable. And frankly my dream destination. Will never stop telling people about this place.
We had a great weekend in the Barossa based at the Miner's Cottage. It was a quiet, well provisioned place to relax in a lovely location.

A charming cottage in Cockatoo Valley, perfect for a getaway weekend in the Barossa Valley. Rebecca has thought of everything for her guests. Breakfast was plentiful and there was even a bread maker in the barn kitchen to whip up a loaf for the morning. Kangaroos grazing out the front and nothing but birdsong to disturb the peace. A lovely break!

A spacious house set on a hill overlooking the valleys and majestic gums. Perfect base to explore the hills, we stayed with 5 of us, 2 couples and a single, and it was ideal for us.
Well appointed throughout, comfortable beds, we'll be back.

My family and I (5 people) had an awesome time up at this residence. It was the true Barossa experience we were wanting... being in the middle of nowhere with all the scenery!
Phillip was very hospitable even before we got there and made sure we were comfortable throughout the whole stay.
We had the whole place to ourselves and it was truly relaxing. We would sleep to the sounds of the sheep, and wake up to the birds chirping.
The house had everything we needed plus more... plenty of space!
We definitely know where we'll stay again when we return to the Barossa.
This place is highly recomended.

My family and I (5 of us) had such a great time staying in the Barossa at Phil's place! Phil met us at the house and quickly showed us around, and pointed us in the direction of some travel guides which had recommendations of the area.

The house was well equipped with everything you need for preparing a meal with everything you pick up at the nearby Farmer's Markets. The rooms were comfortable and there was plenty of space for everyone. We would definitely go back!

No drawbacks at all, but given the location if you're staying here you'll definitely want a car. We booked knowing this, and made plenty of use of my parent's car. That said - there are lots of wine tour guides that will pick you up too :)
We enjoyed our stay immensely, the property was clean and suited our needs. Phil was super helpful and very welcoming. Would recommend as a great base for exploring the barossa.

The house was perfectly equipped for us and Phil was very helpful. It was a great location being a bit off track for quiet times in the countryside and then to head in wine tasting. Great value for money, thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

My friends and I stayed at this beautiful property for a bit of R&R during our Dragon Boat racing. It was exactly what we expected, nice quiet retreat to get away from it all but very handy to explore the wineries in this region. One of my friends accidentally left a bag of clothes behind and Phillip was kind enough to bring it back to him in the city. Wonderful place to stay, loads of room, everything you would need or want.

Our final day at Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm summed up our experience = NO ONE WANTED TO LEAVE!!! We were all too comfortable, too relaxed, & too 'at home'. Having the whole home to ourselves (4 people) was a spacious treat. Everything was available for use (bathroom & kitchen) - we really didn't need to bring anything along in advance. The isolated & rustic environment transpired into a peaceful & tranquil existence after each day's hard work sampling wine, cheese & treats in the Eden & Barossa Valleys! Very pleased we stayed here, rather than on a main road or in a busier urban area. The property caters for all ages & would be ideal for a family - sheep, kangaroos, abundance of bird life & I even thought I saw a rabbit! Highly recommended.

Thankyou very much for a lovely stay in your spacious home.
We loved the extensive views, sense of isolation, prolific birdlife and proximity to the Lavender Federation Trail (our aim of completing the Springton to Truro section was easily met).

The house was clean, comfortable, and very generously supplied with everything one could possibly need/want.

It was lovely to meet Mary (and discover we had been fellow walkers many many years ago!)

Phillip and his wife met us on arrival abs showed us around the house. They made us feel very welcome and the house was lovely. Plenty of space which was great with 6 of us sharing. The surrounds were peaceful but not too far from anywhere in the Barossa. The bird life in particular was a delight for me. We would definitely stay again.

Despite our late arrival, Mary was gracious enough to wait for us patiently and provide us with helpful information about the location. The property is beautiful and the home is welcoming, spacious and well looked after.

This beautiful Mt McKenzie property is the perfect retreat - spacious rooms with plenty of natural light, modern kitchen and bathrooms, comfortable beds, outdoor seating areas to enjoy the sunshine and an incredible view. Phil is very helpful and welcoming. It's an easy drive to Barossa towns and wineries. My friends and I loved our stay and left feeling refreshed and relaxed. We highly recommend this property.
An amazing stay in a beautiful location.

We loved our time at the Mt Mckenzie raspberry farm. Phillip was very easy to communicate with and friendly. He greeted us on arrival, was very welcoming and introduced us to what we needed to know about the log cabin. The pictures are an understatement to the beauty that surrounds this property and we were happy to share the experience with the wildlife. Apart from this, the cabin is well equipped with everything you need. Excellent fire and a homely feel! The nearest town Angaston is also a treat and only ten minutes down the road with nice restaurants, a grocery store and a the famous Barossa cheese company shop. A relaxing getaway in a beautiful region! Thanks again Phillip! Much appreciated! :)

We were met by Mary, who did an excellent job of telling us about the place and the surrounding areas including some great wineries.

The place was tidy and clean and well equipped. It is very large and comfortable. As the pictures show, it's in a beautiful setting.
Phil was there to greet us when we arrived and helped us via a phone call when we got lost! He had the fire going and gave us some helpful advice about some of the local wineries
Very comfortable, fully equipped kitchen, great views and wildlife. Overall I would stay there again.

We had a really lovely stay at Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm. Phil and Mary were lovely, and most accommodating of our late arrival. The property is wonderful; beautiful views and very comfortable, so much so that we felt no need to leave during our stay...and we probably wouldn't have, had the attractions of the Barossa not been so accessible. We will definitely return!

Phil was very friendly and prompt in all his communications. The place was exactly as is in the pictures!  views and surrounds were beautiful. Gorgeous property and a very good price for the Barossa. Wouldn't definite stay here again!

We had a great stay! Phil made us feel very welcome. The location was very picturesque and peaceful but also quite close to Angaston, great restaurants and wineries. The house facilities were great and very cosy with the wood burning stove.

Raspberry Farm is a stunning location. Guests are met with magical views across the valley, an abundance of bird and wild life and an utter sense of tranquility.

The house itself is very comfortable, tastefully designed and well equipped with everything you may need for a getaway.

We arrived on Monday afternoon and were met by Mary who welcomed us and showed us around her lovely home.   The home was so clean, fresh and very warm with the log fire going.  Our host was always quick to get back to us with any questions we had, and his directions to get there were spot on. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook each night, everything was easy to find. The farm was a lovely base to come back to as we toured around the Barossa or just going for long walks during the day.  Evenings were spent around the fabulous dining table where our family just spent the night talking away, it really felt like home.  We really did get value for money and this is a place that we would love to return to one day and it was sad to leave on the Saturday. It really was a perfect place for the six of us just to enjoy, relax and spend time together. Our family wholeheartedly recommends staying at the Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm.  Thanks to Phillip and Mary.

This is a very spacious cabin suitated within a beautiful surroundings. Getting up in the morning and having breakfast at the dining table over looking the surroundings is a wonderful experience. There was a friendly kangeroo roaming in the yard too. If we werent so busy running around the Barossa visiting wineries, it would have been a wonderful place to have a relaxing slow day and have a BBQ and relax.
Phil was there waiting for us on time (we were 10min late) on the arrival date.
We are very pleased with the place
It was a lovely getaway with a lovely view and really enjoyed our stay. We stayed with another couple and there was plenty of space.  I would highly recommend this place to others.

Raspberry farm is set a short way up a dirt road in the idyllic BarossaValley. Mary met us and showed us the well set up house and fabulous kitchen. Everything was exactly as described including the beautiful views across the valley.
Fantastic house - private yet rural and close to all the wineries and highlights in the beautiful Barossa - we loved our stay - highly recommended

A wonderful place to stay.
An impeccable attention to detail.
In beautiful rural setting.

We had four adults and an 18 month old and found the place great.  Lots of space and great layout for multiple families.  No cot but we managed just fine.  The place was comfortable and quiet in a secluded area but convenient to wineries and restaurants.  We hope to be back again.
We loved this house! Great location to visit the wineries by day, and then relax outside in the evening enjoying the view! I'd love to come back during winter to enjoy the fire and chimenea.
Fantastic location to enjoy the Barossa and Eden Valley. Beautiful view and comfortable home with all the staples you need to enjoy your stay.
A great place to stay and fantastic hosts!
Recommend for a quiet break in a lovely house and grounds

Would absolutely recommend this place to anyone. My friends and I had a lovely time on the farm, fantastic views, very clean house, close to heaps of wineries, the fire place was bliss and check in was a breeze. Thanks so much for the stay 👍🏼

Couldn't have asked for a better place to celebrate my birthday with a small group of friends. We had three couples in total and we felt at home, surrounded by beautiful scenery and a fully catered to kitchen, which allowed us to cook our own meals. Other than the beautiful sounds of nature, there were no noisiness from passing cars or commuters. A highly recommended place for a quiet getaway.

Beyond our expectations! Three generations suited us all! Perfect quality spilling from every corner of the house! Gorgeous walking areas, peaceful tranquil and just so ideal! More like a fully equipped home away from home ! Wanted for nothing , many thanks just awesome, taste of Euroaussie
A beautiful place..everything you need and more...beds comfortable...beautiful fire...outlook amazing..phil very very helpful
Photos don't do this place justice, absolutely stunning, incredible views, stunning sunrises & a very comfortable BnB providing a great homely vibe.

Lovely house in beautiful countryside, within good distance of the Barossa wineries. A great weekend away with friends, 7 people fit in the house well with3 doubles, 1 single, 2 bathrooms and a large living space. House is nicely furnished and very clean and well equipped.
Great location,Phil and Mary are lovely host and the fireplace is a big bonus!
We loved our stay at Rasberry Farm. The house was very well appointed with beautiful views. Hosts were friendly and communicated well.

A wonderful place to stay, beautifully presented and clean and with a wonderfully stocked pantry. We had a great time relaxing, walking and visiting various parts of the Barossa. We highly recommend Phillip's Place, we had a very memorable time.
An amazing house in a great location not to far from Angaston with a great outlook. 😊

Phillip is a lovely host and made us feel very welcome. This cottage is set beautifully in the hills of the Barossa Valley, not far from a small town with nice restaurants and shops, and many, many vineyards! Also very close to the Collingrove Hill Climb Track.

It is just as described, cosy and welcoming. It was lovely waking up to the sounds of wildlife. Highly recommend it!

If you are looking for a quiet retreat where the only sound is the birds tweeting and the sheep bleeting then look no further. A beautiful space with a wonderful panoramic valley view. Well appointed and equipped accommodation in easy reach of local amenities and the wonders of The Barossa. We will definitely be back!

Even If the star rating options were higher than those shown - we would score Philip and Mary’s place the max possible.
The attention to detail and the amenities offered are truly above and beyond.
Everything is so close to Mt Mckenzie that any Drive to wineries even the ‘far’ ones like Seppeltsfield or Wolf Blass are only ~15-20mins away.
There is nothing a traveler could want for by staying at this wonderful log cabin which is so cosy and yet so spacious with more than enough accommodation for a family of 5 or 3 couples.
Cannot reccomend Rasberry Farm high enough

Thanks again to Philip and Mary - excellent hosts

Fantastic place to stay - location was perfect with just a short drive to Angaston, house was beautifully clean and tidy and very well equipped with everything needed for some relaxing time away. Very spacious, even for a group of 5 adults and lovely surroundings. Phil was a great host and made us very welcome. Highly recommended!!

Beautiful views & lovely hosts. The place is set up high on a hill & it feels very private. Phillip & Mary were easy to communicate with & welcomed us on arrival. Well appointed kitchen & eating areas. Can thoroughly recommend.

Raspberry Farm is comfortable and well appointed with tasteful decor.

Highly recommend!
An acheivement in tranquillity, the sights, sounds, scenery and stay was lovely. Perfect location for our needs...the house itself was just lovely, Highly recommended.
Wonderful location, stunning picture window, clean and well appointed.

Absolutely beautiful location and place. Philips place was everything we expected and more. It was also really nice to meet Philip when we arrived and his tips on wineries to visit in the Barossa Valley were spot on. The place was clean and well kept. Beds were comfortable and the sunrise was spectacular from the front porch. Loved watching the kangaroos hopping around in the valley.
Couldn’t recommend more highly. The place is lovely and homely and has a great view. It is very close to Angaston and all the wineries. Phil is an excellent host, he is very responsive and helpful!
Beautiful home with a fantastic view-lots of bird-and kangaroo-watching! Very close to Angaston and a perfect base for touring the Barossa with overseas visitors. Hope to be back again soon!

Great location for exploring the Barossa from quite special accomodation. Nice to be met by hosts on arrival too. Happily recommend to others and would be a priority selection if we come this way again.

Such a lovely remote cottage with great character, we loved the peacefulness and watching the roos bounce by each morning. The fireplace was wonderful to snuggle up in front of too.
Everything was very clean and the kitchen well stocked with everything we needed.
Very quick and friendly communication with hosts. Thanks Phil.
Just gorgeous, and absolutely everything you need.

What a magical experience, would go back again and again. Beautiful hosts who did everything and beyond to make the colder weather more enjoyable. Electric blankets, eggs and milk in the fridge, home made jams! Absolutely awesome.

Thank you for having us, we will be back!

Great communication. Loved our stay and especially enjoyed the beautiful views. Sipping wine in front of a burning wood fire at night made our stay as did eating around the large family table. Great location and we are already spreading the word to friends and family to stay here when they visit the Barossa Valley.
Great house to stay with friends for an enjoyable Barossa Valley wine tasting holiday!

Thank you Phillip and Mary for sharing your special place. It was perfect to bring our overseas visitors to and to come home to after busy days exploring the Barossa. Everything we needed was there and we easily self catered each evening. The ability to be outside, walk, hear the birds and lambs, pick a lemon of the tree, and just be, was awesome. A perfect getaway space in close proximity to all we wanted to do. We hope to be back. THank you
Great house in an idyllic setting. Loved our stay!
Couldn’t give a high enough recommendation. Simply loved it!

We have stayed here twice & love the view & the peaceful surroundings. The birds that come to the garden are lovely to watch and the house has everything you could possibly need. A wonderful place to stay close to everything in the Barossa
You couldn't ask for better peace and quiet than at this beautiful farmhouse! The views are stellar, the amenities are thoughtful and the comfort is unmatched. We would definitely return.

Phil and Mary gave us a friendly welcome and gave us lots of ideas of places to visit during our stay in the Barossa.  The house was large and comfortable and set in beautiful countryside. We loved the tranquility of the setting. The house was so well equipped and the availability of pantry staples was great. Thank you so much for letting us stay in your home while we explored this vibrant and historic region.
We had a very enjoyable stay - the house was spacious and homely with everything we required and only a five minute drive to the nearest town. We would definately stay there again.
Lovely peaceful stay
Phillip's place was fantastic, held a group of 5 of us very comfortably and the hospitality of Phillip and his wife was exceptional
Great location to experience life in the Barossa Valley farming area
Fantastic location, quiet, comfortable with all you need to make a trip to the Barossa amazing. We highly recommend this place and the owner was great with being available when we had questions.

Lovely rustic home with fabulous views and all our needs exceeded, close to everything in the Barossa with lots of birds and wildlife. We travelled for a month and this was my favourite place to stay.
A unique large home situated on a hill with a panorama of the valley and hills including kangaroos and many birds. Ideally located on the edge of the Barossa Valley. Well worth a stay.
Wonderfully well appointed, spacious and very clean space with scenic outlook. A great base to explore the Barossa.
Spectacular views, serene atmosphere, lots of space and great kitchen facilities. Lots of space for the family. Spectacular sunrise!

Our group of two couples had a great stay at Phil’s place. We loved the view from the house, the extra homely touches, and the location being only 10 minutes drive from Angaston was perfect. The house was sparkling clean, and Phil was very easy to communicate with, happy to offer his local tips. We will be recommending our friends and family to stay here, and hope to be back ourselves!

This was our first Air BnB experience, and very successful it was. Our hosts ensured we were able to find the house, waited for us to arrive in the evening with the lights on and heater going. The bottle of wine from their own small vineyard, was an unexpected touch and greatly appreciated by the wine drinkers in our group. The kitchen was stocked with useful items, like herbs and spices, milk, jams and sauces etc. A big collection of DVDs and CDs to handle anybody's taste. Lots of towels. Lots of nicknaks and photos on the walls gave a very homely feel. We really enjoyed our stay.

We had a pleasant surprise when we arrived. The cottage is situated on a lovely spot, it was spacious, well equipped and very comfortable. Our hosts are gracious genuine people. I would love to come back to stay again.
Phillips place offered us a great opportunity to stay in  the wine regions of SA. His cottage was well appointed clean and cosy. A perfect getaway for two retired couples.

Wow, what a great spot. Beautiful views of the valley with grazing sheep and kangaroos. Phil has thought of everything, milk, butter and eggs in the fridge. High quality bed linen on comfortable beds and lots of wood for the wood heater.
Alison

Phil is an outstanding host who really goes above and beyond to make his guests feel at home. His house is located in an absolutely beautiful area of the Barossa, and we were only a stone's throw from major points of interest and towns where we could stock up on basic necessities. The perfect getaway and host for anyone, from families to couples to a getaway with close friends.
We had a fabulous time at Phil & Mary's.  The house is beautiful and the setting so serene.  We'll be back!  Thanks again, Megan & Robyn
A gorgeous rustic house, with a well-organised open plan arrangement.  Postcard views over rolling hills. We loved our stay. Thanks Phillip.
Fabulous location - beautiful views - ancient trees - so connected to nearby villages - great amenities and a generous host

A fantastic place to stay and a wonderful host! Philip and his wife made us feel at home from the moment we walked in the door. The house is absolutely stunning and particularly snug with a toasty fire to keep you warm if you happen to stay on a particularly rainy weekend (like we did). We had six people in our group and felt like there was lots of space for everyone to do their own thing, whether it was cooking, playing card games, reading or watching a film. The wonderful little extras that we found in the house made our stay truly memorable. Cannot wait to come back again and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to stay somewhere magical in the Barossa.
Great cabin in peaceful location. Great for our group of 3 couples. Lots of room for us all. Would recommend!
Really enjoyable easy place to be!
Perfect location to explore the barossa from. Welcomed in person with a log fire pre prepared to keep us warm. Thank you
Very comfortable spacious accommodation . Beautiful peaceful views. Spotlessly clean . Very well equipped. Perfect location for visiting Barossa Valley, wine farms and markets.

If your looking for a peaceful place to disconnect look no further, beautiful place close to everything you could possibly need or want for a lovely getaway. Phil was so accommodating and helpful for our stay, would definitely stay again in the future. Thanks for a great weekend Phil!

Phil’s house was a wonderful place for the 6 of us to unwind and enjoy the peace and quiet. It had everything we needed and allowed us all enough space so that we were not on top of each other.

Phil met us on checkin and was great with information with the house and the local wineries.

Phil's place is a great space for a family or group of friends. It's well located for tours of the Barossa Valley. He was a great host with some good local tips, and he was really flexible with check in even though our plane was delayed. Would definitely stay again.

It’s an exceptional location, close to Angaston and the wineries of the Barossa, yet rural and peaceful enough to feel like you’re away from it all. The property is beautifully presented, with everything you could need to be comfortable. We would love to visit again next time we’re in the Barossa!
Phillips place is lovely- we had a great stay. So much beautiful nature and good wineries to explore nearby! Phillip was a great host - would highly recommend.
Quiet place with all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay . Very close to Angaston . Highly recommended

What a lovely spacious log cabin with views over the North Para River. Angaston, Nuriootpa and other villages in the Barossa wine region are within very easy reach. Phil and Mary have a well supplied kitchen, with breakfast supplies, including some homemade goodies like jam, marmalade, sauces, and they even gave us a bottle of their wine. Lots of wildlife, bird book plus leaflets for local exploring.
A gorgeous spot to really soak in. Gorgeous views - a lovely welcome bottle of wine that was crafted by Phil himself. A lovely detail and communication was perfect. Definitely will look to go back!

Fantastic property. So cosy with everything you need. Gorgeous views and close to Angaston wine region . My family loved it (particularly the electric blankets) . Would recommend Rasberry Farm to others . Thank you Philip for wonderful stay.

What an amazing place to be. Our experience started with Phillip welcoming us in a very friendly manner. There already was fire in the fire-pit and the house was really warm and cozy, which gave us a real feel of being away from the city and close to nature.
On the following day we woke up to an amazing view of the mountains. We went on nature walks, saw some sheep and kangaroos and had an amazing stay. Thank you Phillip!

Phillip’s place was a hidden gem! Raspberry Farm is the perfect getaway if you are looking to switch off and unwind. The scenery is breath taking and felt immediately relaxed as soon as we arrived. We definitely recommend this place to everyone. It’s clean, spacious and has a warm homey feeling. Thanks Phillip for sharing your beautiful home with us.
Log cabin loveliness surrounded by green. A rustic getaway!

Couldn't have asked for a better getaway! Great location and stunning views. Phil greeted us with a lovely bottle of wine and a toasty fire. All bedrooms also had electric blankets. Well equipped kitchen and great location, only a short drive to wineries. Will definitely be back!
Fantastic House, Location and Host!

Great location and absolutely great ambiance of estate! Thoroughly enjoyed our time here and it is definitely a place worth going back and recommending it to people who are looking for a secluded and quiet place to hang out, chill and relax.

Host was great and very welcoming! The place was well kept and clean and all amenities were great.

The Mt Mackenzie Raspberry Farm is a very special place. Wonderful view, very relaxing, & a house that has everything that you could possibly need. Our family have enjoyed many visits & we hope we will have many more it is a home away from home. Thanks Phillip for another very happy family holiday.
Lovely rustic cabin, close to all the Barossa has to offer. Tasteful furniture, beautiful views. We enjoyed our stay.

Andrew's place offers an authentic Australian shed add-on experience - clean, comfortable, convenient, with all the basics (en suite bathroom, tea and coffee making facilities, bar fridge, TV, wifi). Andrew is a friendly, helpful host with a great knowledge of the local area. Andrew and Belinda were happy to provide anything extra I needed. As I was their first guest, they were still putting the final touches to the accommodation. Andrew's place was good value for money, especially for a budget conscious traveller.
Friendly & generous host.  All needs were met with ease. Perfect for the Traveller or for business. Will be back.

We couldn't have had a more friendly or helpful host, he made us very welcome. We only stayed for one night when we went to 'a day on the green' and what do you need the most? A comfy bed for a good nights sleep - and that's what we had. In the morning we discovered that the fridge had fresh fruit and milk (the things we needed for breakfast) and a host of other options. Recommend if you need good clean friendly accomodation.

Andrew and family were lovely! Friendly, helpful and made us feel very welcome. Located in the heart of the Barossa, the separate backyard unit had everything we needed during our stay. Would definitely stay here again!

Andrew and Belinda were both very welcoming and friendly. Their room had everything my partner and I needed and we felt very comfortable there during our stay. On top of that, we had a lot of privacy because it was a separate building from the house.

We were visiting the Barossa for the weekend and we found that all the places we wanted to visit were only 15 minute drives away, which made getting around very convenient. If we visit the barossa again, we will definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

Andrew was very friendly and helpful, even showing me the way to a meeting the day before so I wouldn't get lost on the day. Close to town too.
The shed was just as you see it on the web and the only thing that I would have liked would have been a little outdoor sitting space. Otherwise I would recommend this accommodation.
Thanks Andrew
The accommodation was great. Immaculate, great facilities, and friendly hosts. Would happily stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. Central location in the Barossa too!
Awesome overnight stay - the sheets were SO clean and fresh and the bed super comfy.  Very helpful friendly host. Will be using again when in the area for business again :)

Andrew and Belinda were great hosts!

They made us feel very welcome and were very helpful. The room is in a wonderful location and had all the facilities we needed including great heating. We would definitely stay there again.

I really appreciated staying at Andrew and Belinda's because it was totally private, and suited me. My stay was 2 x longer term stays. I found Andrew very helpful, and Belinda made sure I had clean sheets and towels weekly.
The area is very nice, and is close to Linear Park, which was lovely for walks, even in the wintertime.

Comfortable overnight stay. Very suitable for my requirements.
Thank you

Stayed one very cold night. No electric blankets but Andrew did have the room heated prior to our arrival. No crockery or proper cutlery and an antique pantry/meat safe was not appropriate in the sleeping area. Overall, we left awfully early as we were not going to drink tea/coffee from plastic cups.

These are hosts that really care. The accommodation is simple but very comfortable and caters for any needs you might have. The room, kitchenette and bathroom were all very clean and the bed was very comfortable. It was the little things that really made the stay great though. The towels and face washers were folded and arranged neatly on the bed, the end of the toilet paper was folded into a triangle and a list of useful numbers (such as where to get the best pizza) was provided. Further from this, the greeting was warm, friendly and sincere and the hosts made themselves very easy to contact if there was any need. I felt like a cherished guest, being welcomed into their home and will definitely be back.

Andrew & Belinda made us feel really welcome.  Everything was set up ready for our arrival, and they had been in contact with us promptly on booking.  A very smooth stay - top hospitality.  Everything was clean and tidy.  It was also great fun staying in a garage conversion - exactly as described.

Well located in the centre of the Barossa Valley, we were welcomed by Andrew and started our exploration nicely. The shed was good and clean. Unfortunately, we had a lot of wind and rain and you can hear it during the night. A little minus point was a bit of insects around but didn't bother us too much.

We stayed with Andrew and Belinda for one night. The converted garage room was self contained, comfortable and private. As our stay was short so we didn't meet Belinda but Andrew was friendly and accommodating. A great place to stay if you would like to spend a few days exploring SA's beautiful Barossa Valley.
Well place in the centre of Nuriootpa, was a good place to base myself for the wedding that I was attending.

Andrew and Belinda are fabulous hosts who will bend over backwards to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Accommodation is private, practical and clean and there are lots of extras included such as breakfast supplies and fresh fruit. This little gem is a rare find in the centre of the Barossa. Thank you Andrew and Belinda!
Room was as advertised, clean and tidy.
Very good communication, off street parking, private place outside of the main house. Brekky was nice surprice. Very nice and welcoming hosts. Tip for Stein's Taphouse was spot on! Recommended!

With such a quirky description we did not know what to expect - but it was as described. A B&B in a shed! Once inside we forgot that. Plenty of room, comfortable bed, good bathroom and well equipped kitchen.

Andrew and Belinda are warm friendly people and true to their nature they provided a comprehensive do-it-yourself breakfast. Great value and we will return!
Andrew and Belinda a very friendly hosts. The room was very clean and welcoming. We loved the breakfast they left for us, very much appreciated. Overall very good value for money.
Thanks Andrew & Belinda for being so accommodating. Your local knowledge was fantastic. The room was clean & warm. Perfect for that 1 night stay.

Andrew and Belinda are very friendly and welcoming. Their cosy queen size seperate from the main house accommodation is well fitted with heating/cooling, small kitchenette and seperate bathroom with adjustable hot water temperature. It's about a 10-15mim walk into the shops/restaurants and on a lovely quiet residential street. Highly recommended

Lovely place in the heart of the Barossa. The place is nicely set-up, very clean and all is provided for (good private space, nice breakfast, clean towels and linen). Andrew and Belinda are great hosts, always up for a chat and providing great tips and places to visit in the region. From their place it's a short walk to the Vine Inn, great restaurant for dinner at a reasonable price. It is also a strategic location to visit the wineries in the Barossa Valley.

We will definitely recommend their place to fellow travelers and we will book it again for our next trip to the Barossa!
Very comfortable accommodation in an excellent location. A very warm welcome from Andrew had us settled in quickly. The facilities were ideal for our requirements and we would be happy to stay again.
Comfortable, cosy and a pleasant surprise! Good value for money!

Andrew and Belinda were great hosts. A self contained unit that is part of a garage/shed. Good shower pressure, a comfy bed and some food there for breakfast - muesli, bread, fruit and water. Air conditioning keeps the place as warm or cool as needed. Great location in the heart of Nuriootpa. Close to all amenities. Wifi can be a tad touch and go with reception. A great place to stay overall. Thank you!

Great value, convenient location and fantastic hosts. Lots of great advice about local things to do. I was there for a sporting event - Andrew even helped me out with some tools and workshop facilities. How cool is that? 👍.
Fantastic accommodation - very comfortable and everything you need. It exceeded my expectations and I would not hesitate to recommend Andrew & Belinda's place for your Barossa stay!

Simple but fantastic accommodation. Andrew was extremely helpful and accommodating. He made regular contact leading up to ensure I knew exactly what the arrangements were. Kitchen has a bar fridge, single pot/pan induction hot plate, microwave, kettle and toaster. Great heating and cooling in the bedroom if needed (although is well insulated), with a sizeable TV and comfy queen bed. Bathroom and all areas were spotless. Would definitely use again and highly recommend. Can’t ask for any more at this bargain price.
Ideal accommodation in the centre of the barossa
Good value for money, friendly hosts, convenient location. Had everything I needed.

Andrew and Belinda's place was in a great location. They were great at communicating and gave us a flexible check in time. They were welcoming and we had a very comfortable stay. We stayed one night whilst touring the Barossa. We recommend staying here! Great hosts and great location!
Another perfect stay with a friendly welcome and lots of extras included. Highly recommend their home away from home. Thank you Andrew and Belinda!
Private, clean, comfortable and affordable space in the heart of the Barossa region. Highly recommended!
Good basic accommodation at a good price. Everything we needed was there,  also good heating for a cold night
Great stay!
We had a great stay at The Shed, communication was lightening fast, the place was clean and tidy and the bed was super comfy to come home to after a day of wine tasting! Thanks guys!
Great spot, secluded and quiet
Really lovely host, great tips on the local area. Good value for money.
Better than the pictures! Yes it’s simple accomodation but it has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Bigger rooms than expected and excellent hot water. Thanks Belinda and Andrew!
We had a great stay. It is is a lovely private space with all that we needed. And only a short distance into town!
We enjoyed our stay there. Andrew is a great host. Highly recommended

Great place, very good value !
The perfumed bed linen.. we were so comfortable after a day in the car going around wineries.
Breakfast provided, yummy muffins, yogurt as well as tea and coffee. Great privacy but closed from the host when needed.
Andrew was so hospitable, he even offered us a bottle of wine from the winery he works at we didn’t had a chance to visit !
Thanks for a very short but very great stay !
Andrew and Belinda's property is a simple but cozy little place with everything you need for a comfortable night's rest.
Quiet & comfortable with all you need. Great value.
Very nice little shed, well prepared!
A very welcoming family and a really comfy place equipped with everything you need. Definitely recommend everyone to stay there :)

Honest, good bed for the night and great hosts
💕
Very handy and comfortable
Andrew & Belinda’s place has everything we needed to stay for a night. Thank you for having us.

The description is pretty clear - it's a shed at the back of a house on a quiet road in Nuriootpa. The centre of Nuriootpa is easily walkable from the house, but from anywhere in Nuriootpa you'll need a car or a taxi to get to Tanunda or our dinner destination Hently Farm.

The shed has everything you need for a couple - really good aircon; a nice light and airy bathroom; a fridge for storing wine, milk and water; and good stable wifi. There is a cupboard full of crockery, cutlery and glassware. It's not designed to cook in but you could happily have a deli platter, light breakfast or takeaway meal there.
Very lovely. We enjoyed our stay, would definitely recommend.

Great beddings, soft pillows, great cable & internet connections.  Compact but cozy, just enough for our needs.  Great location, safe & convenient.  Superb hospitality & seamless communication by Andrew & Belinda.   Would definitely come back!
It just looks like a shed from the outside, but very comfortably fitted out inside. Very nice stay & hosts were really friendly & helpful.

You will find an extraordinary host in Andrew (we didn't meet Belinda).  Andrew went out of his way to make sure that our overnight stay was everything and more.  The accommodation is small but had everything we needed and is set in a very quiet location in Nuriootpa.
Perfect location to visit various wineries etc.  Communication from Andrew and Bel was fantastic!  Felt very comfortable and welcomed.

The listing was as described.  Andrew and Belinda were very welcoming and helpful.  While they are not trying to compete with the Hilton, it was clean, warm and adequately furnished.  Lovely hot shower and breakfast was provided.  Makes a great base from which to explore the Barossa Valley.  Thank you!
Great cosy place. It is a shed but has everything you need. Hosts are super friendly and genuine.
A great and cosy place for hassle free visits to the Barossa.  Andrew and Belinda are very welcoming host with some great local tips.
Clean and tidy
Very private clean and comfortable. Great location with easy access to property.
Lovely people and great place to stay. Would certainly stay there again.
Clean, comfortable and cosy. Suited our needs perfectly
The place was, as described, really good, comfortable, clean, and had everything we needed. Great location, nice neighbourhood.
Ideal if you are looking for a private retreat. Location in walking distance close to the parklands, bush chapel, bush gardens and labyrinth.

Andrew and Belinda’s place was comfy and cosy, exactly as pictured, such a great use of space. The bathroom is super spacious and exactly what we needed. Easy self check in and chilled check out. Thank you for such a great space.
Lovely host, comfy little place. Easy to get around the hills.
Perfect little spot for exploring the Barossa . Clean and comfortable with lovely hosts . 👍

The Shed exceeded our expectations - very spacious, clean and well equipped with everything we needed. We thought the breakfast supplies were a nice touch. Belinda and Andrew went above and beyond as hosts - they are super knowledgeable about the area and were great people to share a wine and chat with! We appreciate their generosity and wish we could have stayed for longer.
No-frills, clean, convenient location, cosy and had everything I needed. Recommended! Cheers
Andrew and Belinda have created an amazing, unique space. Perfect for couples wanting to explore the Barossa Valley and great value for money. Highly recommend!
Excellent location as a base to explore the Barrossa
Great little place!! Andrew and Belinda were lovely and gave us some good tips! The shed was great for our 2 night stay, close to town and the wineries, very clean and comfy too!! Thanks!
Great location and great accommodation

Very nice speared little house.
Tidy and clean.
Worth to stay also Andrew and Belinda are very friendly
"The Shed" was a very clean comfortable stay. Lovely hosts, very accommodating.
Great value for money and wonderful hosts.
Great for a short stay..Everything you need , especially Breakfast being provided...

Andrew & Belinda are great,fun,generous hosts who made our stay more enjoyable.
“The Shed”does exactly what it says with a comfy bed and great shower within a quiet location.
Great, private, neat and tidy accommodation. Perfect for us after an afternoon and night out. Served it’s purpose and it didn’t feel like you were in a shed! Great value for money.
Great location and amazing value. Perfect for a night or a week. Andy and Belinda are great hosts.
Super clean, easy check in, Andrew and Belinda were very responsive and easy to deal with.

Quirky, comfortable place to stay. Reminiscent of the Crashpadder/Airbnb I used to know. Now sadly mostly ousted by the commercialism of current business. Excellent value for money, well located for exploring the Barossa wine region. If you don't want luxury, this place will suit you fine.
Good value, easy check in. For what we needed it was great and easy to find
Lovely host with great local tips! Linkes metwurst is the best! Will be back next time in the barossa valley!
Excellent, great place to stay, close to everything
