We definitely recommend borrowing the bikes - the bike path is beautiful (slightly challenging for a wine lover but definitely worth it for the view - and the wineries along the way!). The Stables was the epitome of country charm - it was lovely to wake up with a view into the private gardens, enjoy a long hot soak in the claw foot bath, and partake in a leisurely breakfast of local produce including home-made preserves and fresh eggs! We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this AirBnB and hope to visit again soon.

Kay's place is a perfect base for your visit to the Barossa Valley. The cottage was small but perfectly self-contained. The heating was very warm, the bath was big, the bed was snuggly and she even provided a simple breakfast for us. The location is ideal and very close to many excellent wineries. Kay can give you suggestions for where to go and if you want to stay put then she has a pretty deck overlooking a creek, perfect for afternoon drinks. We can't wait to come back.

Kay and Mads were sensational hosts with the most beautiful property. We loved the high standard of this gorgeous little cottage from the roll top bath through to the kitchen amenities. We would absolutely stay again!

This place is beautiful and Kay and Madeleine were so welcoming. We got there late but they were around with the electric blanket and heater on:) There was coffee, muesli eggs and bread in the fridge for breakfast and a carafe of Barossa port to ease us into it.

This is a great location if you have an event at the Novotel as it's walking distance. Kay hires out bikes and you can easily ride or drive to Tanunda and a whole bunch of great restaurants and wineries.

We had a great stay, highly recommended.

A fantastic little spot in the Barossa! Exactly what we were after end a great little stay. Kay and Madeline are great people and offer a wonderful stay. A highlight is their private deck area by the Jacob's Creek River. Perfect!

The most beautiful little farm house! Kay was such a great host, providing us with fresh produce from her farm for breakfast.  A very cosy and inviting place to stay. Thanks for making our Barossa experience even more memorable!

The Stables is an absolute delight - straight out of the pages of 'Country Style' magazine.  Kay is a wonderful host and couldn't do enough for us, from homegrown oranges, lemons, eggs, jam, wine to name but a few!  The location is peaceful and beautiful - we would love to return someday, in the summertime, to take full advantage of the lovely garden and pool set amongst the vines.

This place is FABULOUS. Close to everything important but removed enough to feel like a  true getaway. Chooks, a horse and beautiful (Website hidden by Airbnb) truly a fairytale. The bed is super comfy and the home is equipped with everything you'll need, not to mention a deep claw foot tub with homemade bath salts and candles. The place backs up onto a sprawling vineyard and a short walk takes you to a verandah overhanging a beautiful river below. It's a little paradise. Kay is absolutely fabulous and even left us fresh eggs and bread and port. We had a lovely stay and are dreaming of returning one day.

Thanks so much Kay and Madeline,
Your little BnB is just so perfect, from the produce in the fridge, loaded citrus trees and little extras everywhere. A perfect place to unwind and enjoy another tranquil world for a while. We enjoyed walking and riding the nearby trail, enjoyed the river views, their dogs and friendly horse.
Looking forward to returning one day
A beautiful property - very homely and satisfying. Kay and Madeleine were wonderful to get to know and we will back again - no doubt!
Thanks so much! A beautiful little getaway and we will surely be back in the future for our annual trip 😊

My wife and I enjoyed our stay immensely, we were very well looked after. Favourite part would be having fresh eggs to cook for breakfast, this was amazing along with fresh herbs and fruit from the garden surroundings.

Was well worth it.

We felt instantly at home the minute we pulled up at The Stables, especially after the very warm welcome we received from Kay and Madeline. Such lovely hosts, its hard not to feel like you are visiting old friends.
Its the little things that make The Stables special - the provisions left in the fridge, home made bath salts, the ironed bed linen (AMAZING!), cosy decor, gardens and surrounding views, the list could easily go on! We can't wait to return, perhaps in the summer when the pool is in action.
Great place to stay and lovely hosts. We will definitely be back!

Loved the atmosphere and location of this place. Modern facilities and the garden was wonderful. Definitely recommend​ walking up to the deck area for an afternoon chill. Loved seeing all the animals too.

Kay and Madeleine were the perfect hosts for an amazing weekend stay! The place was so nice and well put together, surrounded by amazing gardens and farmland. From the awesome deck overlooking the river to the little touches like fresh eggs in the kitchen (delicious by the way), I would highly recommend The Stables to anyone looking for a getaway in the Barossa. Thanks for all the great local tips as well!

Welcoming and very friendly.
Great location and full of character.
Will return one day
The Stables provided us a super comfortable and aesthetically delightful sanctuary to enjoy our Barossa getaway from. So much more than we expected- we look forward to returning again.

I can highly recommend The Stables. Kay is a great host who really makes you feel welcome. The property is great with a highlight being the deck that overlooks the creek. We found the location very convenient too.
Kay & Madeline were wonderful hosts. Their property is beautiful and the cottage is just perfect. Tanunda is also a lovely town.

After a liesurely cruise through the barossa vineyards we found our secluded retreat nestled serenely in the beautiful australian landscape. Kay greeted us with the warmth of an old friend and provided us with a continental breakfast and complimentary port. The place was quaint yet spacious, heritage yet contemporary and with plenty to explore including an intimate meeting with a beautiful horse. We've fallen in love with the place and know we'll be back. We just hope the secret of this enchanting place doesnt catch on too much.
We would highly this accommodation. Beautiful place in a beautiful area. The personal touches really made the difference.

Kay and Madeline offer a true Airbnb experience. The Stables is a unique accommodation destination that reflects the style of these two amazing women. It is both quirky and stylish and offers a truely great base from which to explore the delights of the Barossa. Kay is a wealth of knowledge from what restaurants to try to essentials like “the best bacon in Australia”.
There are delights around every corner for visitors to discover and I am sure we will return as we felt like old friends when we left,

This place is the best! Absolutely perfect to escape and slow down, relax and enjoy the beauty of the region. Gorgeous place and gorgeous hosts. We felt so welcome and loved the authenticity of the place. We loved it!

The photos don’t do it justice! It was a beautiful place to stay, despite the heat! Even so we were able to cool off in the pool with the vineyards as the backdrop. I would 100% recommended a trip up here and I will be going back again when ever I’m going to the Barossa.

In a word, "Perfect."  It was the little extra touches that made it special.  Home made bath salts, free range eggs and a wonderful welcome.  I can't wait to go back again.  I also received some wonderful tips for local wineries and restaurants. Thanks so much.
Kay is a wonderful host and made us feel most welcome. Some lovely thoughtful touches including the choccies and those wonderful eggs from her chucks! We will remember our stay for a long while

Kay's place is stunning, Kay was an excellent host - showing us around and suggesting the best places to go. The place we stayed in was perfect, great spot which is close to all the best winery's, the apartment/little house was gorgeous, clean and had special little touches left by Kay. 100% best place to stay in the Barossa Valley! :)

Kay and Madeleine are wonderful welcoming women with a super space for rent.  The place is really well equipped and stylish and comfy.  The bbq, river deck and pool are real bonuses.  And the chocolates were great!  Highly recommended.  Thanks ladies!  Had a lot of laughs.
Lovely place! Would recommend!

Kay and Madeline were absolutely wonderful hosts and the B&B an absolute gem. Between the fruit trees, vines, dogs, horses and chickens - what a fun experience. And the stable cottage was beautiful with small touches everywhere - including apple juice, chocolates and a tasty dessert liqueur. I rented a bike and hopped on the convenient bike trail (literally along their property) and easily toured the local wineries and road into town for some food.  After a long day of riding, I came home and took a bath in their amazing clawfoot bathtub with some provided bath salts. What a great place. Highly, highly recommend!

Great host. Beautiful property.
We had a great time relaxing at Kay's Barossa hide-away. Would definitely recommend to a couple

Beautiful and charming little studio cottage, only a short drive from many of the exquisite cellar doors in the Barossa. Kay has been a wonderful host who welcomed us with warm and open arms. I would recommend anyone who is wanting to stay in the Barossa to stay with Kay, as the experience is one you won't be able to get anywhere else.

If you are looking to base yourself in barossa valley to explore the wineries etc in the area you will find this central and close to everything! There are bike trails near if you don’t want to drive but we did find having a car to get around very convenient..10 mins in any direction and we found ourselves in another awesome winery etc. the property is beautiful and serene and Kay is a brilliant host! Planning to return back to this place!
Lovely spot! Would highly recommend it!
Beautiful quiet little place! Kay is friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend

The whole premises is loaded with work of art, which gives the whole a very special character. We loved sitting on the terrasse and having a glas of wine. It’s a nice retreat for those who need a break from the everydays stress in the city for a view days. Kay was very nice and knows everything around this area, helping to find the places your looking for.
The Stables is a home away from home in stunning surroundings. Spacious, clean and well equipped. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Highly recommended.
Amazing place to stay. Kay is very welcoming and made us feel at home. Great location to lots of winery's.

Highly recommended - very comfortable with a warm host and friendly canines too. The stables have everything for a couple, even home grown eggs! A charming setting with a developing cottage garden. Handy to Tanunda and the Barossa.

Kay’s very cute little cottage was absolutely amazing. Stunning gardens, lovely homely interiors, gorgeous bath, great breakfast bar - it has everything you need for a truly comfortable getaway. Kay is definitely the nicest person in the Barossa (or maybe even Australia). From gorgeous homemade jams, fresh happy chicken eggs, homemade bath salts, and the list goes on, you won’t find anywhere better to stay in the Barossa. Kay and Madeleine (also equally nice) have two very cute dogs, two very friendly horses, their own vineyard, pool etc. In terms of location, the are very close to so many wineries and cute towns. Overall I already want to go back - Kay made her home feel like our home.

The Stables was a beautiful spot for my husband to be and for his groomsmen to get ready for our wedding in Lyndoch.

Kay the host was just lovely in every way and so welcoming and warm.
She gave us a little history tour of her land and it was very interesting.
She was fantastic and the house Our Best man stayed in was lovely and clean. Beautifully decorated and thoughtful touches everywhere.
Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here. Will be returning customers for sure!
Really enjoyed our stay at Kay’s beautiful place, thank you for being so welcoming

The Stables is a wonderful place to relax with easy access to the Barrossa's best wineries. We felt so comfortable there in the beautiful garden and bush surroundings. Everything was just perfect.  Highly recommended.

Kay was a wonderful host that was extremely welcoming and friendly. It is a beautiful little cottage on an amazing property with beautiful views. The deck overlooking the river was our favourite spot. We had a fabulous time exploring the area and even got engaged while we were there. Definitely will be coming back and recommending to friends and family!

We loved our two nights at Kay's place and next time we will stay longer. Kay has set up a beautiful place in a great location . Spacious for a couple with very comfortable and tasteful decor. Nice touches such as fresh eggs, quality bread and coffee. The surrounding property has lovely garden areas and a deck which overlooks the river at the back. We had some great chats with Kay who is super friendly. Highly recommend this little gem.

Kay’s place is perfect. From the beautiful fresh eggs to the lovely roll topped bath you could not ask for more. The location is fantastic and the farm animals are so cute especially the horses. We cannot recommend the Stables highly enough. You will love it.
Our holiday at Kays couldn't have been better. She absolutely went out of her way in every way to make it perfect. A great Barossa location!!

Beautiful accommodation, close enough to easily get to all the best vineyards and attractions but far enough away to get away, from city hustle and bustle. Lovely hosts, who were very helpful in suggesting where to go and what might be best to do.
If you intent to stay in the region I strongly recommend this Host and Accommodation.

This is a delightful property, luxurious and full of character and charm. The personal touches from our host Kay, such as the home made bath salts and eggs from her chooks, made us feel welcomed and valued. Kay is lovely, very friendly and open to sharing information about the history of her property. We can’t wait to visit again.

Kay was a wonderful host, very helpful , friendly and informative-the accommodation was absolute perfection, pristine and very welcoming, with a great deal of thought placed on creating a warm and inviting ambience. The surrounding gardens provide a beautiful, peaceful, and restful respite.
I would highly recommend Kays place, 'The Stables', at Rowland Flat.

We are blown away by Kay’s place the lovely personal touches and cosy cottage and gardens. Also a big thank you for the bottle of bubbles for us to celebrate our recent marriage . We fully recommend this heavenly place :-)

We had a wonderful stay at 'The Stables' and Kay was a wonderful, thoughtful and gracious host.  The cottage is surrounded by a beautiful garden, and beyond that vineyards and forest.  Whether sitting out under the verandah at the back of the cottage, or sitting at the kitchen bench top looking out the window, the views and general ambience are superb.  The cottage itself was well laid out, and very clean, and Kay's attention to detail and thoughtful touches - eggs from her own chickens and local milk in the fridge, ground coffee and quality muesli in the cupboard, chocolates and port - made for a thoroughly enjoyable stay from start to finish.  We cooked dinner each night on the BBQ at the back of the cottage, and also particularly enjoyed walking along the cycle/walking path that runs along the back of Kay's property, alongside a creek with wild olive trees and then on through the vineyards to Jacob's Creek and St Hugo's.  Highly recommended.

Excellent stay in the stables, Kay is a great host and super friendly the stables are well kitted out comfy bed nice bathroom and kitchen area. The property is fantastic with friendly animals and a nice deck overlooking stream. Great location to access the barossa highly recommend.

Wow, what a spot! I’ve had a lot of great AirBnB experiences, but this was the best yet. Fantastic location, well designed self contained enchanting space that overlooks a meticulously curated garden and rolling hills landscape. Generous and warm hosts that clearly care that their guests enjoy their time, fresh roses and lemons from the garden are a few of special detailed touches. Trail is great if you enjoy running through vineyards. 5 stars

Kay and Madeleine were incredibly warm, welcoming and hospitable. Kay communicated with us very responsively, and were overly accommodating with our arrival.
The Stables were serene, beautiful and idyllic, with a gorgeous surrounding garden. It was such a pleasure to come back to this cosy, warm setting as home, especially with the luxurious electric blankets!
We enjoyed our cosy stay at The Stables
Kay's place is beautiful! Stunning garden and a well decorated home. We really enjoyed our stay - particularly relaxing with a wine on the deck over looking the creek out the back!

We spent 2 night's at the stables and loved every second. There were so many lovely touches including fresh eggs, homemade jam and bathsalts, chocolate and detailed brochures. Everything is spotlessly clean, and the garden outside is just beautiful. We didn't get to meet Kay, but Madeline made us feel welcome and at home. We would highly recommend anyone stay here. We will be back for sure!

Lovely little cottage in the heart of the Barossa valley. We were very warmly welcomed by Kay. The stables were very stylish and comfortable. Everything you could want or need. The gardens and property were stunning, obviously a work of love by Kay and Madeleine. Make sure you enjoy a glass of wine on the deck overlooking the river. Enchanting spot. Thank you.

This is an amazing self contained cottage. Beautifully furnished inside and the garden is also stunning. The host also provided fresh eggs from her chooks, port wine, fresh milk as well as many other breakfast goodies. Really enjoyed our stay here

I just loved my stay at the stables. What Kay has done with the space is amazing. A delightful and heavenly experience. Just go and treat yourself
Kerry

What an amazing place!   Love love loved everything about it...from the gorgeous cottage to the fresh picked oranges and orange juice!  The most beautiful, warm welcoming Kay and Madeline ...thank you thank you thank you for sharing your incredible home x

The Stables is a gem of a spot in the Barossa. Kay was a great host who made you feel at home and offered many great local tips. The accommodation was clean and tidy and we were welcome to try some of the produce located on the farm such as eggs and oranges. The Stables is close enough to many of the wine farms and other attractions in the area. Highly recommend
Beautiful spot, incredibly relaxing and amazing hosts

This is a gem! A beautiful place, with lovely decor, a fantastic setting and wonderful hosts.
Very well situated to visit all the Barossa Valley has to offer. I would definitely recommend this fantastic place and would love to stay there again in the future.

Kay is the most thoughtful host and ensures that everything is available for a comfortable stay. The location of her home is just perfect, closely located to excellent wineries and the bike trail. Kay provided us with many local tips and her home is beautifully clean and well equipped. Highly recommend!
nice little place lovely people
Kay’s place is wonderful the photos don’t do it justice excellent views and host
Lovely cottage in a great location and Kay is a really warm engaging host. The stables is very neat and intimate with lots of character and charm. We had a 10/10 experience and we will be back!
Great accomodation and atmosphere. Great place to just slow down.

We could not fault this place! With a thoughtful host who goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect paired with a relaxing and inviting atmosphere, you cannot go wrong. The location is also ideal with wineries and townships only a few minutes drive away. We will be back!
Great place

As has been mentioned many times previously the additional little touches make this wonderful space even more special. The port, fresh eggs, bread and juices were lovely. Kay and Maddy were very welcoming and always keen to give us local advice. We decided to use public transport and the hire bikes which was a great way to get around, with the property backing on to the bike and walking path that links up to Tanunda and beyond. The space with a lovely wrought iron bed, big free-standing bathtub with legs and a breakfast spot overlooking the garden is the perfect opportunity for a very relaxing holiday. We had a really lovely stay.
Loved our stay! The cottage is so close to the wineries, and was very clean and well maintained. Thank you for your wonderful hospitality Kay!

Lovely accommodations, beautiful scenery, space to unwind, fun and friendly hosts — if you don’t find what you’re looking for at The Stables, then I’m pretty sure you are looking for the wrong things. Cannot recommend highly enough!
Kay place is just beautiful and a magical little cottage. me and my partner enjoyed our little stay so much that we will totally be back.

Do yourself a favour and don't hesitate to book here when looking for accom in the Barossa! Such a lovely little place, close to everything you'll need! Kay is a lovely host and makes you feel right at home and offers plenty of knowledge and tips for the area.
The Stables is super cozy and clean. A perfect little base to come back to after a day out.
A neat little pocket of the Barossa that you can explore and walk from or ride a bike.
We'll be back again for sure. Thanks Kay.

Our stay at Kay’s stables was just wonderful. The property is a beautiful and charming country cottage fitted out to perfection and set in the most beautiful vineyard alongside a creek which is overlooked from a secluded deck on the property. Kay is a wonderful host who is just full of fun and just couldn’t do more for us. We’ve stayed in quite a few AirBnB’s but in this one we found a favourite. I just couldn’t recommend it any more highly. Thanks Kay.
Kay’s place is an ABSOLUTE GEM. A glorious cottage in an enchanted garden. Definitely the best AirBnB experience I’ve ever had. Do it!

Kay was warm and welcoming. The plantings in her gardens with their metal sculptures are lovely. We did a great early morning walk (30-40 mins) through her paddock onto a bike / hiking trail that heads to Jacob's Creek winery that gave us some beautiful vistas over the vines. We had to cut our stay short due to family circumstances and Kay was very understanding. She gave us a list of villages to stop in on our way back to Adelaide, travelling through the Adelaide Hills which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Kay was a wonderful host, quick to communicate with and generous with sharing local tips and suggestions. Her friendliness and warmth made our stay comfortable from start to finish. The property was beautiful and serene, and surpassed all expectations.
purchased 2 night stay for my mother in law for a wedding present and they had the most amazing and relaxing time at The Stables.

Beautiful accommodation set in a rustic rural environment.
Kay was a fantastic, welcoming host and the cottage was immaculate and very comfortable.
Highly recommend and would love to stay again!
Wonderful hosts and a lovely warm cozy cottage, the location in easy reach of lots of vineyards and other tourist attractions

The Stables at Rowland Flats is the perfect place to stay, it is close to everything. The hosts are amazing, very Barossa wise & have a lovely garden surrounding this beautifully restored cottage. There is a deck about 150m away overlooking the creek, perfect for an evening glass of wine. Our only disappointment was that our stay was too short. Thank you girls for a fabulous stay & all the best for Christmas.

The Stables is a great place to stay - very convenient for The Barossa, and so wonderful to have that pool to swim in after a day’s touring. Lots of little touches make it even more special - great breakfast ingredients, chocolates,  port ..... Kay really is a super host!

It was an absolute delight staying at Kay’s place. She was so welcoming and her home is beautiful. Her personal touch makes the accommodation and gardens magical, so much care, so much creative energy - it’s a gift to all who experience it.
Kay was an amazing host, she has a lovely home.  She went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed.

Kay's amazing home will not disappoint! From the wonderful hosts, amazing accommodation and all the personal touches, our weekend was perfect. Kay provides a gorgeous supply of breakfast ingredients, all local or home made. the tranquillity of their home is food for the soul. Loved the deck area overlooking the creek too. The property is very close to enough wineries to fill at least a weekend, Jacob's Creek, Rockfords and Lou Miranda were our favourites. We cycled to the wineries as the property is very close to the bike track, which was quite challenging but worth it. One of the best airbnb properties we have stayed in and we have stayed in many, all over the world.
A great little space; cannot fault our time here. Kay is an excellent host who will make sure you get the most out of your time in the Barrossa and in her beautiful home.

We loved Kay and Madeline’s little cottage. A beautiful, quiet location but only minutes from the nearby towns. Great to have a private pool to yourself and the deck is a picturesque spot for evening drinks. The bed is firm if this is your thing and the cottage is very nicely styled and clean. We loved the friendly dogs and chickens! The hosts were great at giving local tips of where to go and what to see throughout our stay.

Kay was very hospitable, made our stay really enjoyable and made us feel like home straight away. She was extremely  knowledgeable of all the great spots to check out in the Barossa and lovely to have a chat with. We very much enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!
Kay's place is one of the best airbnb places I have ever stayed at. The place has everything you would need for a getaway trip to Barossa! Kay is a lovely host

We use Air BnB a lot for travel. The Stables  has been our best stay yet.  This property is second to none.  A truly unique experience.  Set amongst the vineyards and tucked away in a quiet spot just outside of Tanunda, but within a stone's throw of Australia's best wineries.  Chooks on site providing fresh eggs each morning.  A beautiful deck over the creek frontage.  Immaculate gardens.  Swimming pool.  A gorgeous cottage.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Kay and Mads were the best hosts we have encountered, providing wonderful tips about local restaurants and sites.   We felt like we were staying with old friends.   This property is the gateway to everything the Barossa has to offer.   Book!  It will far exceed your expectations
Lovely accommodation, beautiful spot and great service

We stayed in Kay’s cottage for 3 nights. Perfectly positioned just out of Tanunda, it’s a cute little place with chickens, dogs, a swimming pool (which was great when 40C), a veggie garden and deck overlooking the river. The place itself is super cute with everything you need, including eggs from the resident chickens for breakfast. Would stay again :)

We had a fantastic stay at The Stables. What a lovely, stylish place to rest after traveling and the hard work of visiting Barossa wineries. :-) Kay and Madeline are great hosts who are welcoming, have thought of everything you might need and are generous with local tips and sharing their beautiful property. Highly recommend!

We loved our stay at The Stables and Kay is a fantastic host. We felt at home from the minute we arrived and the beautiful bird life serenading us daily made our stay extra special. Great location, lovely cottage! Will be back!

We had an amazing time at The Stables and would definitely return. The photos don’t do the space justice it’s just gorgeous. We loved the walking track and the pool was beautiful to swim in! Bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the port! The Stables is perfectly situated to all of the best wineries and the hosts local knowledge was great. Thanks for having us!
Great venue for exploring Barossa Valley on Kay's bikes. Or if a partner likes to golf, there is a coure nearby. If this is the standard of Airbnb can't wait to book again.

The Stable is a well appointed and is a beautifully serene spot. Kay is an awesome host and we love staying here. The little touches like her home made bath salts, locally produced port and chocolates are amazing. We are looking forward to our next stay with Kay.
Kay's place is ideally situated for a wine tour of the region and proximity to great restaurants.  To begin the day with the sound of silence and later the native bird chatter was lovely!

Staying at Kay’s was the perfect way to end our time in SA. She is gorgeous and her little cottage was just divine, exceeded our expectations for sure. Kay is friendly, approachable and was so easy to communicate with. Highly recommend if visiting the Barossa. Ideal location and just so peaceful. Suggest making up a picnic and enjoying her beautiful decking out the back of her property. Stunning views! Missing it already x
Had a great stay, enjoyed the accomodation and the deck

Absolutely a great location and hosts!! Super helpful and friendly and they have an awesome little add on of a back patio deck at the back of the property that you can take a bottle of wine up and relax in the tranquility. AAA+++ recommend. These couple are a hoot and the property is really well appointed and has all the things you need. We hope to be back again some day!

Where to start....there are so many little things that made our stay amazing! The place is gorgeous, exceeded all our expectations and surrounded by beautiful gardens. The cottage has lots of little extra touches including bath salts,
Homemade jams,eggs etc. and is all within close proximity to great restaurants and wineries.
Kay provided great tips and provided lots of local knowledge and made you feel at home(we didn’t want to leave) !
We can’t stop telling our friends and can’t wait to be back again! Thanks Kay and Madeline for your beautiful hospitality and letting us enjoy your humble abode! Until text time ☺️

"The Stables" is an outstanding airbnb in the Barossa Valley. Easy to get around everywhere, beautiful grounds and Kay was nothing but fantastic. Amazing property and facilities, wonderful personal touches set amongst stunning surrounds. We can't thank Kay enough for making our stay incredible. We will definitely be back! Jess & Cam x

An amazing little space set in a wonderful garden and vineyard. Kay made us feel more than welcome. Such a beautiful home to be allowed to stay in. Plus the added bonus of a couple wonderful puppies too!

Kay's place was an absolute dream. Located on such a gorgeous property, its just as much of a Barossa experience as visiting all the wineries. Kay is a fabulous host, with great tips and hospitality. Also a wonderful place if you are craving canine companionship. Can't wait to visit again!
A nice place to stay.

An outstanding stay by any measure. We arrived and were immediately greeted by Kay, who was the consummate hostess throughout our visit. The accommodation was spotlessly clean and well appointed with amenities. The personal touches (like homemade jam and fresh eggs from the henhouse in the fridge) were an unexpected touch. The rural setting and farm property were a refreshing—and relaxing— change of pace after several days spent in city hotels. If not for the 14-hour plane flight, we'd be regular guests. Thank you, Kay, for such a wonderful stay!
Wonderful property, cute dogs and lots of lovely fruit to eat.
This is a gorgeous spot to stay in the Barossa. The beauty of the setting is exceptional. Great location, wonderful hosts - highly recommended.

Thank you so much for a wonderful stay in the Barossa! We just loved all the thoughtful touches - from the fresh eggs for breakfast to the homemade bath salts. A beautiful property & super hosts, we won’t hesitate to recommend this stunning BnB to friends and family!

What a beautiful place the Stables was to stay at for our visit to the Barossa Valley. Kay & Madeline made our stay so warm and comforting that we didn't want to leave. Their beautiful property was so peaceful and we loved playing with their gorgeous dogs. I would highly recommend staying at the Stables and if we're ever up in the Barossa again this is the first place we would seek accommodation. Thank you again Kay & Madeline for your great hospitality.
Outstanding location. Amazing accommodation and surrounds, particularly for those wanting something a little different

Such a beautiful space, on an amazing property! Kay and Madeline are perfect hosts, and have created a little piece of paradise for their guests. Everything we could possibly have needed and so much more were provided, they really have thought of everything. A really lovely place to explore the Barossa from. Thank you!

We had the most beautiful welcome and the loveliest time. Close to a whole range of experiences the accommodation is very comfortable and has those special touches which we really appreciated. We loved interacting with the animals and look forward to coming back when it is warmer to do more walks, and to swim in the pool. Kay is a lovely host, and it was wonderful to meet Madeline too.
Kay’s place is a lovely warm comfy retreat close to all places of interest in the Barossa. Kay was very hospitable & made us feel very welcome.
What a wonderful stay! Had a brilliant 2 nights here. Our accommodation had everything we needed and more! Kay was very welcoming and the property is amazing! Will definitely be back!
Absolutely amazing. Would recommend to anyone I know or otherwise. Fantastic hosts, beautiful property, nice and close to town in the Barossa - can’t rate high enough!!

A beautiful, scenic cabin on a sweeping vineyard. Three lovely dogs, a dozen timid chickens, and wonderful local atmosphere. 5 minutes from a drink and a meal, and a great place to unwind if you're feeling trapped in the city. Highly recommended!

This was my first air bnb experience and wow this cottage and Kay were just amazing. The fine details and extra touches such as fresh juice and eggs were just divine. You will not be disappointed staying at Kay's.

He had an amazing stay at The Stables, we had the warmest welcome on arrival and felt relaxed as soon as we stepped into the cozy house. Lots of beautiful little homely touches like fresh eggs from the hens and homemade bath salts. The place is lovely and comfortable and the location is close to wineries. Kay was the best host I have ever come across in my years of air bnb’ing, she made us feel so welcome. Definitely recommend and we would love to come back.
The Stables is like a home away from home. The lovely Kay (and Dixie dog and Mr Tibs) welcomed us with open arms and we just had the best stay. Kay has thought of everything. Thank you for having us!

Great spot in the Barossa with lovely
hosts

The two of us had such a peaceful and relaxing stay at The Stables. The property  exceeded our expectations and should not be looked past for any stay in the Barossa. The special and sophisticated touches in the accommodation made us feel right at home. Great to meet our lovely hosts Kay and Madeline who are kind, cheeky, joyful and wonderfully accommodating. We couldn’t fault our experience! Stay here. We’ll be back.

Such a gorgeous property in a perfect location close to all the local attractions and wineries, and yet so secluded. It’s as if your staying in your own little piece of paradise in the Barossa! Surrounded by vines, artwork and a beautiful creek and walkway not far away.
Both Kay and Madeline were super hosts providing information beforehand and all the best local tips. The property had everything you could need and was filled with beautiful and tasty little touches too! We loved our stay and cannot wait to go back again soon.
The Stables is a cosy spot in the heart of the Barossa. Kay is a lovely host with great tips  for visitors looking for  something special!

We had an incredible stay at Kay's place in Rowland Flat - Kay was extremely friendly and helpful with local things, and made us feel like we were simply at home and comfortable. Cannot recommend Kay's place enough - had an absolutely wonderful time
Great hospitality and stunning location!
ideal location and great facility for a couple

Kay was a pleasure to deal with. The location was perfect, the property was super clean and lots of little touches were in there which made it feel extra special. 10/10 would recommend and will be back for sure.
The super cute dogs at the property were a bonus!

We have loved our time at The Stables. It is our favorite of all stays ! The quiet location, the spectacular garden, a glass of wine on the deck, fresh eggs from the "girls" and especially the love from the Kelpies....
Wow ! Thanks so much !

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Stables, it's a little gem in the Barossa, closed to  some very nice vineyards including St Hugo's. Kay and Madeleine were great hosts, they took the time to chat with us, offered some local produce including  free range eggs from their chooks, and we were able to hire their bikes to cycle through the vineyards. Overall a very nice experience that we would like to repeat.

Kay’s place was beautiful and cosy, with lots of personal touches like homemade jam and bath salts, and eggs from her chickens! Kay and her two dogs were very welcoming. I would definitely recommend this lovely accommodation!

My husband and I had the privilege of staying at the stables for 3 nights. it is set in a beautiful location surrounded by vineyards and massive gum trees. The accomodation is surrounded by a delightful garden with vistas from every window.
Kay is an absolutely delightful host. She is exceptionally welcoming and helpful and passionate about her property. Her creative talent is evident both inside and out. The accommodation is spotlessly clean, full of character and has many homely touches.
For any intending to cycle, the property is situated within very easy access to the cycle path. We cycled the whole length of the Barossa Cycle Trail and this area is on a very picturesque section of it.
Highly recommended.

Wow one of the most amazing Airbnb’s we have stayed at, a wonderful setting in a beautiful garden with the most hospitable host. Its the little touches like the farm fresh eggs, picturesque terrace overlooking the river and the general ambiance of the accomodation that makes this place one I would recommend to all if visiting the Barossa.

It was an absolute pleasure to stay in this little hideaway with the most friendly hosts. This stay exceeded our expectations with extra thoughtful touches, generous breakfast and plunger coffee to start the day. The location is perfect with Tanunda a very short drive away. Make sure you walk around the gardens to experience the beauty of this little piece of heaven!
Lovely hosts. Beautiful garden setting. We loved the quirky decorating touches. Very inviting and relaxing.

Cosy stay at a lovely place central to all Barossa attractions. Loved the hospitality and the extra amenities (Kay’s farm eggs were the best we’ve ever had!). Would recommend to any prospective visitors!

Delightful, charming accommodation with all you could hope for from Barossa Valey mini break. Few minutes drive from Tunanda and Jacobs Creek. Welcoming, considerate hosts, who thought of special touches: eggs for breakfast from own chickens, homemade jams & bath salts. We loved our stay at The Stables and highly recommend it.

Loved staying here! Would recommend to all my friends and hoping to make it back there again. Great location, just out of the main town is the perfect distance away to have a relaxing get away. We made use of the gardens and pool during summer. The country style breakfast of fresh eggs and bread was a great touch.
Great location balances being close to things with excellent peace and tranquility

Beautiful cottage with friendly, helpful hosts and animals. We loved our few days at Kay and Madeline’s, their thoughtful touches made everything perfect. The cottage and the gardens are clean, tidy, full of treasures... you hardly need to leave to explore the gorgeous Barossa area. Highly recommended.
Definitely would recommend this place. We loved it and Kay was a wonderful host. The property was so comfortable and so much to do and see while you are there.
Perfect place to stay for a beautiful Barossa getaway!
A gorgeous little hideaway with the most thoughtful little touches! An excellent base for exploring the Barossa.

Kay and Madeline are such lovely thoughtful hosts. The extra little touches of fresh eggs from the chooks and homemade jam just made it extra special. The property is beautiful and the house so very clean.
We had a wonderful stay and will be definitely returning.

We loved The Stables and we’ll definitely be back. An easy drive to Tanunda, a short walk to Jacobs Creek winery and very convenient access to the bike path that runs through the Barossa. The accommodation was very comfortable and well appointed and situated in lovely gardens. The hosts were friendly and helpful. Thank you to Dixie and Tibs and their humans for such a lovely stay.

Kay and Madeline are the perfect hosts for a trip to the Barossa. Full of local knowledge and stories to make sure you have a great trip. The small touches make ‘The Stables’ an amazing place to stay with a very central location for you to explore the Barossa. We were treated with fresh eggs from the chooks, homemade jams and bath salts, local milk and plunger coffee! Dixie and Tibs (the dogs) were extremely friendly and loved meeting us at the gate for a pat. We can’t wait to visit another day and experience more of the Barossa.

A lovely quiet place to rest and relax, with a beautiful decking area overlooking the river where you can read a book over a glass of wine. Kay is great with her communication and offers a very friendly stay.
Lovely home in a beautiful setting. This was our second stay and we’ll be back again!

The most incredible stay with Kay and Madelyn. The perfect location nestled between wineries in the Barossa.
The cottage is perfect with so many cosy touches, making you feel so relaxed and at home.
The girls went out of there way to make our stay special.
We won’t ever forget our stay. Not to mention having the company of the most beautiful dogs, Dixie and Tibs.
Left with very full hearts.
Ideal spot. Lovely hosts. A lovely property with fantastic views. We will back.

Kay and Madeline were the perfect hosts. They made my partner and I feel right at home.
The property was so beautiful and it really was the perfect getaway.
I would highly recommend them!

Kay and Caroline were just the best hosts! We’re always up for a chat and had the most amazing tips about where to go for a good feed. The dogs Tibs and Dixie were so accomodating too. Perfect place for a romantic weekend and we will be back every year for our anniversary. Such beautiful giving people ❤️

You must try this place! A sparkling clean and well appointed character cottage, yet rustic and cosy. Gorgeous countryside surrounds with a beautiful private garden, surprise swimming pool, and a two minute walk to your own private deck high up overlooking the scenic creek (great for private nibbles and local wine in the evening as the sun goes down).
Kay was a fabulous host, welcoming and friendly but not intrusive - and there are some lovely treats provided. Our only disappointment ... we didn't stay longer. We'll be back!!
Although the cottage is quite small it's well appointed, and the location is beautiful. The pool is excellent and Kay is a friendly and informative host. Highly recommended.

Perfect place for a getaway to the Barossa. Everything you could need and a few hidden extras that come with this amazing property. Kay and Madeline are friendly and helpful. We loved our stay here and will be back.
Absolutely fantastic place to stay and such a beautiful property.

Beautiful place to stay, the garden and views are stunning. The pool is great to relax in after a busy day of sightseeing. So close to everything. Kay makes you feel welcome the minute you arrive. Highly recommend.
Beautiful property, the garden is special
Absolutely beautiful spot. Kay is so fantastic & she makes you feel right at home with small but delightful touches to the house. So many fun things to do at the b&b and the dogs are super cute!

Beautiful location. Very comfortable stone cottage.
Lovely pool and fantastic deck area overlooking riverbed. Great for pre dinner drinks. Perfect for two people.
Easy access to Barossa bike trail and close to wineries.
Kay and Madeleine make you feel at home with their gorgeous dogs Dixie and Tibs.

Thank you Kay & Madeline for a beautiful stay. The property is stunning and we loved all of the small touches you added. The deck area was our favourite part for a cheese board and some wine.

Jemma & Jack

The Stables was absolutely brilliant as a home base for our Barossa excursion and the hospitality from Kay and Madeline was second to none. They made us feel right at home - so much so that we didn't want to leave! From the thoughtful touches (fresh eggs, tasty port) to the amenities (refreshing pool, deck overlooking the back paddock), the stay was absolutely perfect.

Can't wait to come back soon, we'll be regulars!

We had a wonderful time at The Stables. The place is so quaint and offers many nice touches. We enjoyed having and afternoon drink on the deck and having breakky with the beautiful doggos in the garden.
Would recommend to anyone visiting Barossa for a local stay.

Kay’s place was outstanding and is highly recommended. Set in lovely gardens and with gorgeous decorating touches, this is a great place to stay in the Barossa. Comfortable, spotlessly clean, stylish. Kay herself is gracious and welcoming. Stay here; you’ll love it.
Fantastic - would highly recommend!
Lovely clean room with everything available for a comfortable stay. Hosts were amazing. Great place to stay while visiting the Barossa. Will be back again for sure

The Stables was the perfect base for our trip to the Barossa Valley - a quiet retreat that was only a short drive to all the cellar doors and main street of Tanunda. Kay (and her adorable pups) were the perfect hosts, and we loved all the extra touches - homemade bath salts and jams, and a bottle of tawny and chocolates to finish off our day of exploring... Be sure to check out the deck - overlooking the river to one side, and the vines, hills and Jacob's creek winery to the other - a great spot to sit and relax as the sun goes down. We would recommend to all!
Lovely little stay with a very cute welcoming committee (the owners lovely pets). Very conveniently located, just a short taxi/drive into main street. Everything was clean and nice.

Why would you stay anywhere else? Kay and Madeline will make you feel so welcome you won’t want to leave. Oh and the cottage (stables) is a divine place to chill out, perfectly positioned in beautiful  garden overlooking their vineyard. Indulgence. Enjoy - and thank you!

We had a lovely time at Kay's, perfectly situated on a beautiful property surrounded by vines and farms. The Stables cottage itself was super clean and comfortable, it contained everything that we could have wanted. Thanks again and we will be back!

Lovely location down the hill from Novotel. Greeted by the dogs & the chooks as well as Kay.
Beautiful garden with lots of sculptures which backs on to cycle path along south para river. I’m sure pool would be great in warmer weather.
The Stables was v well appointed & comfortable. Complementary port was lovely.
We’ll be back

Kay, is amazing.
The three S’s sums it all up.
“Sensational Stable Stay.”
Every thing is exactly how you see it on the Airbnb.
Clean, fresh, location is perfect, with all the comfortable trimmings to boot.
2 very happy tourists here.
Who ever is privileged to stay at the Stables won’t be disappointed!
Kindly,
Rell & Candy.
Great place to stay! We really enjoyed it! We will be back during the warm season

Awesome accommodation and an awesome host!

Great location for accessing all you want to see and do in the Barossa.

Thanks for having us Kay!

Honestly the best Airbnb I’ve ever stayed at! So many nice homey touches. There was port and chocolates, freshly laid eggs and filter coffee, just lots of extra little touches that made the whole stay special. Kay was a super friendly host and her dogs and chickens were adorable.
Incredible!!! Such a wonderful place to stay :)

Absolutely amazing stay. Kay and her partner were extremely accommodating and helpful with information about the area. The hard work they’ve put into their home shines through. Perfect couples weekend away.

From the moment we met our host Kay at the gate to the moment she waved us goodbye we knew we would not forget our time at The Stables. The cottage and its surrounds were peaceful, calming and beautiful. A surprise behind every gate and around every corner. From the special treats left in the fridge to the tasty local port this place will make you glad you didn’t go anywhere else. Kay and Madeline are lovely and full of local knowledge to guide you through their little part of heaven in the Barossa Valley.

The place is located 10 minutes from Tanunda. The location is amazing with beautiful views, 2 lovely dogs and lots of chickens. Jacobs Creek winery is 30 minutes away by hike. Overall we were amazed by the beauty of the Stables and we already planning visiting Kay again.
Gorgeous property, great location, and couldn't ask for a better host. You will not be disappointed!

Kay and Madeleine are delightful super hosts. They are passionate about their private piece of paradise and a wealth of knowledge for the local area. I recommend leaving some spare time to ponder their sensational garden, homegrown produce and enjoy a tipple on their deck, perched over the Para River. Their puppers are super friendly welcoming committee.

Perfect spot and a perfect room. We really enjoyed staying at the stables. Great welcoming hosts who have done an amazing job with this property. The dogs and chickens give the place a warm homely vibe. Delicious breakfasts and friendly pats.

Make sure you watch the sunset on the riverside deck for a perfect afternoon.
Thanks again Kay and co and hopefully we will see you again someday.
Brilliant accomodation and fabulous host! The house has so many beautiful touches including delicious breakfast! The surroundings of beautiful vineyards is an extra touch. Highly recommend!

Amazing place! Kay was a fantastic host, friendly, very responsive and great to have a few chats with while we were there. The cottage was set up very well with a well equipped kitchen. There were also some great personal touches throughout. And the property is great. The deck down the back, the gardens and plenty of space to explore and walk around. Plus Daisy and Tib were always there to welcome us back. Highly recommend and hope to be back again some day
We had such a lovely time at The Stables. Kay is a wonderful host. Highly recommend if your planning to visit the Barossa!

A wonderful place to stay. Close to the many great wineries in the area. The cottage is clean, cosy and comfortable. The gardens are superb. There is a wooden landing on the property, looking over the creek, complete with a hanging chair - so relaxing.

An incredible spot to stay for a weekend in the Barossa! So peaceful there and we spent more of our time relaxing and enjoying the beautiful  property and didn’t feel the need to do too much else, we will definitely recommend to our friends and family!
A wonderful spot to stay in the Barossa. Lots of thoughtful touches by the hosts, quiet and overlooking the lovely garden.

Kay's place was a fantastic base for all of our adventures in the Barossa. The place itself was lovely to stay in, and was not too far from Tanunda, and other areas of the Barossa we visited. Kay and her partner were extremely welcoming, and we absolutely look forward to a future stay at the Stables!

Cannot recommend The Stables more highly. A perfect place to set up and explore everything that the Barossa Valley has to offer. The private deck over the creek was a perfect spot for sundowners and a cheese board. The bike and walking trail through Jacobs Creek and St Hallets was gorgeous.

If you’re thinking about booking it, just book it! This is by far my favourite Air BnB. Not only is ita perfect location to explore the Barossa, but Kay and Madeline are the most beautiful hosts. The cottage is surrounded by the most stunning gardens (Kay has a brilliant green thumb) to enjoy relaxing, reading, a swim in the pool, or a wine on the deck. We’ll definitely be coming back hopefully soon.

Simply stunning is the only way to describe The Stables accommodation and it’s surrounds . We enjoyed 9 nights here and didn’t want to leave . This beautiful accommodation is enhanced by two brilliant hosts who are very accommodating. The Stables is a great place to enjoy all the Barossa has to offer .

Our stay in this lodge was just awesome! We were pleasantly surprised by how big the place was and all the lovely details that made it so pretty and cozy. Robyn and Andrew were very nice and warm, great hosts! Thanks so much Robyn, we will surely recommend this place to our friends!

Highly recommended accommodation!!! The interior is beautifully decorated...thank you Robyn and Andrew for thinking of everything and making our stay perfect. Would definitely come back for longer next time.

We have just had a wonderful stay at the Angaston Masonic Lodge !
Firstly we were welcomed by a cosy fire, a surprise platter and a bottle of wine . Then a spacious apartment that was both very comfortable and clean. We were really appreciative of off street parking being on the main strip of Angaston.
The Masonic Lodge was a perfect central location for the Barossa wineries and HOSPITABLE eateries as well.
We found Robyn to be a thoughtful host that is clearly passionate about creating an appealing , homely and relaxing "bnb". We look forward to returning to Angaston Masonic Lodge again !
Anna and Friends.

I am so excited to write this review. We had the most wonderful experience staying in Angaston at The Masonic Lodge - and it was all because of our host Robyn.
This was my first holiday travelling with Bub, 8 months old, and we were flying so I was pretty nervous.
When I told Robyn we were travelling with a baby, she went well above what I ever expected.
Robyn organised a high chair, change mat, helped me organise a portacot, made me feel confident there was a supermarket / chemist across the road that had everything I needed. Which was perfect we were flying.
We arrived to a smiling face and a welcome pack of nibbles, cheese and wine - aircon was on and the lodge just felt like a home.
We stayed for 5 nights and I just didn't want to leave! The bed was so unbelievably comfy!
It just kept shocking me of all the things Robyn thought of, from supplying absolutely everything we needed (shampoo/conditioner, body wash and I mean top quality products), to a little medical kit of panadol and bandaids!
As we were new to the area, I texted Robyn throughout our stay and she assisted with our every request.
The lodge had such a glorious heritage feeling and the styling just made me feel like I had stepped back in time, from the original piano (I think over 100 years old!) to the high ceiling (I mean very very high!)
I informed Robyn we wanted to have a BBQ so she set up an outdoor area with an umbrella with all utensils, oils etc.
I would highly recommend in staying here, we will definitely be back :)
Thank you Robyn for your incredible hospitality. Angaston is an incredible little town and The Masonic Lodge is right where you need to be.

The check in procedure, facilities and service was super!!
Loved the local wine and cheese board waiting for us along with food for a great cooked breakfast the next morning

Brilliant accomm, right in the middle of Angaston in the midst of the wineries, great, big, comfy space to relax, celebrate and have a great time! Thanks Robyn for all the extra little touches to make our time even more special, from the cheese board to the Easter eggs, it made our time even more enjoyable.

the house was great.   new, modern and had pretty much everything you needed.     the house was clean,  lots of space if you had a big group.   2 sitting areas, outdoor dining table, modern appliances.  it had clean modern bathrooms.    it was close to the main street of town and about 5 minutes to some of the best wineries.

The house, as well as the hosts' service and responsiveness, exceeded all our expectations. The house is quite large, easily fitting our group of 4 couples. And it was in immaculate condition. Only minutes drive from the best wineries in the region, this place makes a perfect base for a short holiday.
The hosts' responsiveness was also perfect, with communications prior and during our stay. In fact, during our stay the responses to our emails were almost immediate.
A 5 star experience all around.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Little House in Barossa. John and Bianca were very responsive throughout the booking process as well as being available for questions on arrival via text and phone. We certainly appreciated the welcoming bottle of wine they left for us!

The house itself is contemporary in style with all the convenience of new modern appliances. There is a washer and dryer in the huge laundry room for longer stays. More than enough room to accommodate our large family event with 3 queen bedrooms and one room with a bunk bed and trundle. Individualized heating for different zones of the house was nice as well. Very comfortable, clean and spacious.

The location is perfect for getting to wineries and activities inThe Barossa. We are extremely happy we found such a wonderful house.

Our only suggestions would be the following: in communications just prior to arrival it would be nice to have been given the house number. That or put a sign on the house saying 'Little House in the Barossa'.

Secondly. For the amount if money we spent per night, we feel that there should be wifi included in the price particularly in todays connected world.

Overall we rate this 5 stars and really loved our stay. Thank you John and Bianca

A fantastic little home in the heart of the Barossa. We had a group of 9 girls and there was plenty of room without feeling like we were constantly on top of one another. Everything was very clean and tidy and comfortable for our long weekend stay. John and Bianca were very friendly and accommodating prior to arrival and I would definitely recommend this place to others.
Bianca was very helpful. Had a great stay!

Great place in a safe and quiet location. The house is spacious and has an open plan kitchen/dining/lounge area that makes entertaining easy. The house was very clean, had nice range of kitchen appliances/crockery etc and featured contemporary decor throughout.

I really appreciated the prompt communication from the hosts. They happily provided a range of suggestions of places to eat whilst visiting the Barossa-and their suggestions did not disappoint! Thanks again Bianca & John.

The good:
*Great sized house for a family
*Excellent location
*Full kitchen with excellent facilities
*Beautifully presented

What could be improved
* Pest control a few too many spiders
* Make the outdoor area more inviting. The bbq was really dirty and we could not use it.
* Supply garbage bags and dish washing liquid as the ppl who would hire this house would more than likely use the kitchen.

Overall a great, comfortable home in the heart of the Barossa that is well suited to a family.

Had a great stay. Great communication with owners with great information about the area. Clean and comfortable. Would recommend others to stay during their time trying out the beautiful winery's in the Barrossa area.

The place is fantastic, very modern, and in a great location for those wishing to visit the (Website hidden by Airbnb) even walking distance to a few of the local wineries. There was plenty of space both inside and outside for our group of 6 and would highly recommend it to anyone coming this way.
Great modern new built house central to the wineries in he Barossa.
Beautifully furnished home, extremely comfortable and John and Bianca did everything to help us have a great stay. Just wish we could have stayed longer
The host canceled this reservation 89 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great spacious home.
Would stay again.

John and Bianca's home is centrally located to the Barossa's best and offers all modern amenities in a well appointed, clean and comfortable family environment. We loved our locally baked vegemite scrolls and our children loved the games room. We were not home much due to exploring the region but did miss free wifi. A dishwasher, washing machine, Weber Bbq lessened the cooking and cleaning load and with a well equipped kitchen cooking your meals at home saved us a few dollars (although we spent it all on wine). Gracious hosts with great communication and ease of check in and out made our week enjoyable....
incredible time!
A fantastic house in a great location!

Spacious and modern home on a quiet part of town. There was plenty of room for the 6 of us without being on top of one another. John and Bianca were great in their quick responses to my questions and queries.

Great space - bigger than in the photos. The bedrooms are spacious, there are 2 living areas which meant we could all spread out. Getting keys and checking out was a breeze. It's very modern with great facilities, but it is a 30 minute walk into the main strip of shops in Nuriootpa. Would definitely stay here again!
Perfect amount of space for 6 adults and two young children. Very clean and safe. An entertainers delight!
Great space plenty of room for all 7 of us.
This house is perfect for my family and I. Close to everything we needed and the amenities are great. Thanks so much.
Nice quiet place with great hosts
A lovely big house with great open space for all the guests to share. Plenty of amenities provided - even a coffee machine!

This is a great place to stay if you are touring the Barossa and need somewhere comfortable to lay your head and have breakfast. It is in a new housing estate so perhaps lacks some of the atmosphere of the area but  makes up for that in comfort and cleanliness
Great accommodation and location.
Great place we would come back here!
We loved our stay. House was clean and tidy, and had plenty of space for 6 adults.

Spacious, clean and well appointed home on the outskirts of Nuriootpa - perfect for our group of 7 adults. Located in the suburbs but a perfect launch pad for all the Barossa has to offer. The home was clean and bright on our arrival and had everything we needed. John and Bianca very easy hosts, and responsive to all messages.
Great house in great location.

John and Bianca's place was amazing. The house is very new with a lot of amenities  and very clean. Great location amongst all the wineries around. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone and would infidelity be back next time I'm in the Barossa!
Great home with lots space. Convenient area if travelling in the barossa

We had a lovely stay at John and Bianca’s house. It’s immaculately clean, very well set up, coffee machine, smart TV, wifi etc. There was great, speedy communication with the hosts
Probably not in the best spot for easy access to shops/restaurants etc, we had to drive everywhere which was fine in the end- apart from that it was a great little base for us to explore the Barossa
Lovely house great location all good
This is a really lovely home, the hosts were really easy to deal with.
A modern and spacious 4 bedroom home, with great facilities, in a quiet area.
Beautiful home in a great location. Perfect for big group accommodation and our wedding day bridal preparations.

This was the second time we have visited John and Biancas house, and it was just as pleasant as the first time.
I highly recommend the stay if you are in the barossa!
Excellent hosts and excellent accommodation!
Great property, great location for getting around the Barossa.  Good communication during booking.  Recommend this property to anyone travelling to the region.
John and Bianca had great communication. The place was plenty big enough for 5 guests! We had a great stay!
John's and Bianca's place is well-positioned to explore all the Barossa has to offer. Their place has lots of space for two families with two separate living areas. We enjoyed our stay,
John and Bianca are most welcoming hosts and respond promptly. Near new  house. Good location,only a  few minutes drive to Main Street.
House was very nice and roomy, clean as, in a great location and had everything we needed for our stay.
Beautiful place! Felt homely and had everything we could've needed!
Awesome location and cute little house! Warm winter house has lots of character, fire came stocked ready to go and modern bathrooms with spa

Loved our stay at the gorgeous little Tin House. Fireplace was set up ready to light. Very cool, quirky kitchen and modern luxurious bathrooms. Just a stroll to anywhere in Tanunda and a perfect base for visiting the surrounding wineries and Maggie's Farm. <3

This place is amazing! was a lot larger and more modern than expected. Plus very warm, central heating and fire place, with stocked wood pile. Fantastic location too. would definitely stay here again.
Very clean and comfortable house.  Loved the log fire as it was a cold wet night on arrival.
Close to main shops and cafes. Spacious
Beautifully set out house with Cosy fire and spa
awesome location! quaint and elegant with a few hidden secrets. great place to stay
Thanks for the stay - nice house
Great character house in convenient location.  Modern bathrooms and great yard for the kids.
Perfect retreat in Tanunda - felt like home, but being incredibly spoilt
We had a great stay at the Tin House. Very central and convenient with a great back yard to enjoy the afternoon sun
Clean, comfortable and charming. Perfect for a romantic or family getaway. Loved our stay.
Gorgeous house. Great for a lazy holiday. Walking distance from winery Chateau Tanunda.
great house, so much character and super central location

The tin house at tanunda is perfect for any kind of trio. We came for business but did not feel like we were working. Beautiful massive old house with all the mod cons. Amazing yard full of fruit trees, central to everything.. Could not have asked for any more. Thanks for opening your house to us.
Lovely home with every thing you need.

Brilliant getaway with friends, Inside is super cute and  cosy, however we spent most of our time enjoying the quiet under the vines at the back door, followed by a delightful snooze on the green lawn in the sun the next day. Highly recommend and we will return.
Great, centrally located house. Really lovely feel.

The house is in a great location. It's very quiet but only a short walk to the centre of town. It has a lot of lovely period features and a wonderful eating area out the back of the house under grape vines. The only problem was that the back bedroom bed is only a twin and it is uncomfortable.

We had a lovely stay in this beautiful house. So close to the main street, but quiet and peaceful. The kitchen was well equiped and there was plenty of wood for the open fire (the central heating was great too, but it Winter getaway and all). Thanks.

This house is gorgeous and roomy. There is a great large working fireplace in the lounge room which we took great advantage of and there is a pretty cool cellar underground in the kitchen which ties in so perfectly with the fact that you have tons of fantastic wineries at your doorstep. Unfortunately the beds weren't partically comfortable or long enough (I'm 5'10). Overall, great value for money, good spot for a family or a friend's weekend away!
Lovely place to stay with the family.  Very hand location as well.

A wonderful abode in the Barossa, perfectly located in a quiet street yet still just a quick stroll to all of the best locations in Tanunda. A delightful place to stay, uniting historic charm with renovated polish. We look forward to returning again soon!
The location was great, the house was fantastic and we are looking forward to the next visit when we can hopefully stay in Kym's Tin House again
Beautiful house in a great location. Perfect for a young family like ours - close park, comfortable beds and a backyard to explore. Thanks for having us!
The Tin House is in a great location with plenty of space for up to six people. Cosy lounge room with open fire, and fabulous gardens front and rear.  Would be great to see all the roses in bloom!
A beautiful place, spotlessly clean, great gardens and centrally located. We couldn't ask for more.
Lovely house - comfortable - clean - close to town - perfect....
Great location, only a short walk from the main street of Tunanda. Perfect for a weekend get away.
Convenient to all Tanunda and ideal for 2 - 3 couples to stay
Great house, near everything you need. Well equipped with all we needed.

Lovely period cottage in an excellent location - walking distance to cafes, wine bars and restaurants. Great size and facilities for 3 couples wanting an authentic Barossa experience. Cosy and warm with a wood fire and aircon. Responsive communication and customer service.

It would be hard to find a better located property in Tanunda. The Tin House was spacious, with a nice backyard to enjoy a morning coffee or a glass of vine in the afternoon. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the property again on our next visit. Thanks Kym! Michael

This is a great place, right in the heart of Tanunda! You are within a short walking distance of several great coffee shops and restaurants, that would satisfy even the most demanding tastes. At the same time, you are less than 10 min driving from most Barossa wineries, and some of them are actually within a short walking or biking distance. I couldn't have asked for a better place as a base camp for all our Barossa valley explorations!
Great location and very close to the centre of town...
Great central location. Recommended.
Great location, Squeaky clean, Amazing facilities, Cosy and Warm, Beautiful house, Spacious and comfortable

The house was clean, spacious and well-located. It looks nicer than in the pictures. The fireplace was pre-setup with firewood and kindling already built to use, which was great.

However - the house is advertised as having a spa, however when we went to shower there was no hot water. The management company rang us and gave us instructions to change the gas bottles, which we followed (this was outside in the cold late at night), but to no avail. They must have all been empty. Steve, who we spoke to on phone, was incredulous that they would all be empty, but he drove in to check/change them. He was working on them at midnight, and they must have turned out to be empty or some other issue, as he came back at 1am to continue/finish. This meant we slept very poorly despite the comfortable bedding (he tried to be quiet, but our room was on the same wall as the gas bottles...).
We had hot water the next morning, thanks to Steve, but didn't have time to use the spa as advertised. Also, when I finally got to have my shower, the nozzle adjustment module was broken so it sat at the bottom of the bar and I couldn't fit under it. I could only fit under it to wash by hair by holding it up with one hand.

I reached out to the management company before submitting my review, but they didn't respond to my email (I sent it 11 days ago at time of writing). Overall we didn't get the value and features of the house we paid for, and could have found more affordable accomodation.
A related-tip: these days there are many airbnbs run by accomodation managers, regardless of the listed owners. Many of them are also listed on (Website hidden by Airbnb) for much cheaper. I found some houses run by Getaways in Tanunda for $200 cheaper on (Website hidden by Airbnb) than airbnb (as in the same house is on both sites). Too late for me as I'd booked already. For the quality, the lower prices are probably fairer, not sure why airbnb has gotten so expensive.
Wow!  Amazing building, brilliant location, tip top hosts, and every conceivable extra.  Too many special touches to list.

Robyn was very welcoming, and provided delicious snacks, drinks and food for breakfast, which made our stay wonderful. The bedrooms were cosy and warm, and the main room was huge, with pool table, music and fire (but it was a bit smoky from opening the fire door). The location is easy to find and walking distance to many places in Angaston, and easy to access the rest of the Barossa with car or taxi.
Robyn was great to communicate with in the lead up to staying at the Angaston Masonic Lodge. This is a unique building and a comfortable place to stay in the heart of the Barossa.

The Masonic Lodge at Angaston was by far my best Air BnB experience yet. With a location as beautiful as this, you would expect a high quality stay, but Robyn truly went above and beyond to make our weekend spectacular. She made recommendations of what to do and where to go, and all the restaurants are within easy walking distance.
So many little touches made such a big difference to our stay, from the picnic that she organised for us to take on our bike ride around the Barossa, to stacking the fireplace, providing candles and a bath bomb for the spa, and supplying a beautiful fresh breakfast. You could not find better than this! 10/10

We booked the Masonic Lodge for a road cycling holiday base in the Barossa and it turned out to be perfect for our needs.  Robyn's communication was truly excellent and responsive.  The lodge was spacious, clean and had a real uniqueness to it.  We were welcomed by a well stocked fridge and a bottle of very good local Shiraz.  The local town of Angaston is quiet, but has good selection of restaurants and shops nearby.  The coffee from Blonds next door was excellent too.  We honestly could not have asked for much more out of this lovely place.

This place is amazing! Great little spot in the Barossa. Right in the center of Angaston and easy driving distance to all the great wineries. Robyn was a lovely host. If your looking for a historic stay in the Barossa - this is it!

Robyn went the extra mile (literally, she drove many extra country miles) to ensure my friends and I made the most of our short stay in the Barossa. From the initial engagement, to itinerary suggestions, locally-sourced food and beverage provisions, and personalised transport, we could not fault the spot-on service or the spacious setup. Would definitely recommend and return for a unique stay.

Robyn is a wonderful host and the lodge is a great space to stay in. Beautifully decorated and very large we felt very welcome and comfortable. Especially appreciated was the thoughtful yummy supplies that were left for us, after travelling for a while it was so nice to not have to go out for a meal.  Thank you :)
Fantastic location & so much charm!

This B and B is the best of many we have stayed in prior. The building was fascinating history, immaculately presented  and a pleasure to return home to after rambling through the beautiful countryside, classics Barossa towns and amazing wineries. Breakfast  and cheese provisions were very generous however with so many great eateries within a short walk we indulged in the local eateries often. Heating was great and furnished with stylish comfort in every room. . Robyn was very helpful in our planning and offered to drive and collect us to our restaurant for dinner just out of town,  I highly recommend this accomodation in beautiful Angaston. .

What an airbnb to stay at! Everything you need! Robyn was very easy to deal with! She showed us around the lodge. Included was fruit, breakfast and different chesses (thanks Robyn!) Everything you need was here! There was a wood heater that was very toasty! The bedrooms had heating and electric blankets. A pool table. And even make up wipes and hair spray! Very central to everythinf yoy need as well. Would recommend this airbnb to anyone and would stay here again!

Robyn was an excellent host and the lodge was perfect for our weekend in the barossa. Being mid-winter and with huge spaces to heat we were very pleasantly surprised at how effective the combustion heater was. The beds were comfy and breakfast provisions were phenomenal!

Easily one of the best Airbnb experiences I've ever had. Robyn was incredibly helpful, quick to respond to questions, and gave us amazing suggestions for things to see/do/taste in the region.

The building and amenities were absolutely stunning. The provided wine, cheese, and breakfast ingredients were wonderful. The wood fire was roaring before our arrival and the rooms were more than comfortable.

We lounged, played pool, had a game of chess, ate, drank, and relaxed, all in the utmost comfort. The region is stunning but the Angaston Masonic Lodge is even better. Our only regret that we didn't stay longer. Could not recommend this highly enough.
Gorgeous weekend, accommodation was perfect and the extra special touches of detail by Robyn were first class. Thank you Robyn we will certainly be back.
Beautiful home, fantastic location and delicious breakfast! Fire was perfect for a winter night.

Robyn's place was amazing and all the finer details were appreciated. I can't think of anything else that could be improved! The food was fresh, amazing and plentiful. Thanks Robyn for all your - everything that you could think of was there and the food stocks thoughtfulness I would not hesitate to recommend the Masonic Lodge and look forward to returning again soon.

What a wonderful place to stay in a beautiful part of the world
Highly recommend the walk to Thorn-clark winery
Robyn is a wonderful host and we highly recommend her fantastic Masonic Lodge with welcoming fireplace

Robyn's place at Angaston is amazing! My husband and I traveled with another couple, and we all had a very comfortable stay in this beautiful converted hall. The luxurious, warm bedrooms are at the front of the property, near the main street, but there was no real traffic noise. The back lounge room is truely enormous, and we loved sitting around the fireplace chatting and laughing after playing some very bad pool games on the pool table. Although we didn't get to meet Robyn, her communication was great; she had many suggestions for things to do in the Barossa region. We really appreciated her ideas and also the delicious breakfast supplies provided. This property is walking distance to cafes, shops and other places to eat. Thanks Robyn!
