We had the best time at their place, it’s a beautiful house, sparkling clean and equiped with all the required items that you could possibly need. We travelled with my two months old niece and Robyn & Andrew made sure she had all that she needed. We will definitely stay there again!

An amazing property. The second time now that I have stayed there. Robyn has thought of every little detail and supplies the house with great local produces. Very relaxing enjoying a wine in the spa or by the wooden fire. The photos really do not do the house justice. An amazing stay and Robyn is so helpful with suggestions. Will be booking again forsure.
Fabulous house with character and lots of features. Garden is beautiful- perfect for birdwatching from the veranda.
An amazing house oozing with character. Robyn was lovely and our stay was a delight.

This was a wonderful getaway with lots to enjoy in the accommodation - spa, fire pit, pretty outdoor areas. Food provisions were generous and extensive. It suited our family well with lots of rooms for everyone and facilities for little children available. Highly recommend!

Excellent location, lots to do nearby (Robyn gave us loads of options and ideas) or plenty of space to relax at the property (especially the spa). This was our return  girls trip for the second year ..very relaxing 😌 The side garden facing the creek was pure bliss...we all sat out there and became totally “zen” 👌🏻

What an incredible place. Fantastic location for wine touring, excellent communication and wonderful fresh, local produce provided for delicious breakfasts (and some wine for the spa). Beautiful gardens to relax in and karaoke box for a fun evening. Can't wait to stay again. Thanks for being a wonderful host Robyn.
Perfect little spot for a few nights away. Host is awesome. Spa is fun too. Clean and quaint house!

Lovely home, great location a short walk into town.  Robyn goes above and beyond to assist her guests, our fridge was stocked to the brim.  I would highly recommend staying here, it’s like having your own little oasis.

This place is spectacular. There were little touches everywhere that were great, like shampoo, soap, makeup remover in the main bathroom. The spa was fantastic and it was a bit too warm to have a fire but the fire pit was all set up for us anyways. We had a great time using the karaoke machine and it was so nice to be able to cook up a breakfast with the fully stocked fridge provided. The beds were so comfortable as well. Robyn even pointed us in the right direction for restaurants etc and kept communication with us the entire time in case we needed something. We will be back to the Barossa and will definitely book this home again.

Our stay here was wonderful! The hospitality provided by Robyn & Andrew was wonderful. Made for a great weekend in the Barossa!
The winery tour and grazing lunch was wonderful! They took us to a little ‘diamond in the rough’ winery which was very special! Would recommend!

Thank you Robyn for providing such a gorgeous property. Extremely spacious, very relaxing surroundings and conveniently close to the town centre (without feeling like it). All four of us who stayed for our girls weekend found the beds to be comfortable and the linen immaculately clean. The food that was left for us was amazing, we made up a wonderful platter to enjoy on the back deck. All in all we had a fantastic time and definitely recommend!!!
Really well equipped place, had everything you could possibly need and plenty more. Very accommodating host, great location and value for money with all the extras provided. Really enjoyed our stay.

Robyn provided us with beautiful local produce and a bottle of wine on arrival. We spent the day touring around Barossa with her suggestions and transport - lots of fun had. She made an amazing platter for lunch which was to die for! Highly recommend.

Good base for exploring the barossa. Clean and comfortable accomadation. Nice place with a private and spacious surrounding.

Nice touches throughout the home from the host.

Highly recommended.

Highly recommend this gorgeous house in its beautiful setting. Robyn was excellent to communicate with and the amenities were more than we expected. We thoroughly loved our stay and hope to be back one day soon. It's a credit to you Robyn.

This house was fabulous to stay in.  From the wood burning stove already stoked, and the hot spa, to the amazing breakfast supplies and wine and cheese platter.  Robyn is an amazing host, she met us at the house gave us a tour and explained how everything worked, and where to find things.  The house is in a great location with loads of wineries close by and the farmers markets.  Highly recommend it and would love to stay again!
Truly the best weekend of my life, cannot recommend highly enough. Book here if you want to have an amazing time.

Robyn's house in the Barossa is absolutely fabulous for a group.  It's so close to the gorgeous township of Angaston (literally 5 min walk if that).  Robyn is one of the most generous hosts, leaving delicious provisions and treats, ample towels (including spa towels), outdoor blankets, umbrellas (we didn't need them) and anything else you can think of to make your stay first class.  There was plenty of heating to keep us warm and the beds were comfortable and beautifully made-up.  We had a ball with 3 generations on the karaoke machine, playing coits, even got the twister game out!  So much fun, thanks so much Robyn.

Robyn was the perfect host!!! She organised us a beautiful tour through the Barossa, including wine tours, an amazing lunch and a gin tour!! Her welcome cheese platter was amazing, as was the ridiculously awesome local breakfast provisions.. the spa was great as was the fire - overall this was the best Airbnb I’ve ever been to, thank you!!!
Great location and very spacious place.
Robyn is a great host and truly is a wealth of information about the local area. We really enjoyed our stay!

We were blown away by all the extra touches Robyn left for us.  So many treats - we’ve stayed in a lot of Airbnb places but never had this before! The space was perfect for two families and Robyn provided a baby cot, high chair, changing mat and toys which were all in great condition.  Lovely comfy beds and bed linen, plenty of towels and thorough instructions on how everything works.   It’s a very homely log cabin - and perfectly warm for a cool spring weekend.  We loved it and would definitely recommend.
Robyn is a wonderful, thoughtful host. We were extremely comfortable in her house and were spoiled with all the treats she left for us. We couldn’t have asked for anything more! Thank you Robyn.
Really nice house. Right in the middle of everything.

Delightful stay for our 'home base' during a long weekend of family time and celebration.
Robyn and Andrew were ever so gracious and the local produce and treats were a lovely addition to what is already a perfect spot. Such a lovely time was had by all. Thank you!
We had an amazing time at Robyn’s place, we really enjoyed our stay. Thank you again.
We had a great getaway with our family for a few nights. The fire was very cozy and lots of space for the kids to run around outside
Lovely host lovely  place
A wonderful house in Angaston township. Beautiful garden, relaxing spa and loved the indoor fireplace. The extra touches of board games and amenities made the experience a fantastic Barossa getaway.

Robyn’s place was great for our stay, we were in the area for work but I’m planning to go back to beautiful Angaston and hopefully stay again, communication with Robyn was very easy and she was more then helpful, highly recommend Robyn’s beautiful home

This gem in Angaston is an amazing stay. The gardens and lawn are beautiful, the interior of the house is stunning, and the amenities such as the spa were incredible.

There were so many places locally to see and no shortage of things we could do. The town is beautiful and the local area around it hides some sweet spots in our stay like the Tanunda Bakery which had so many treats, we had to come back the next day.

After dark there was ample space to play board games with friends and spread out in the lounge and share a story or two. The spa was the icing on the cake and we used it both nights we stayed and even considered cheekily using it before we left.

Robyn was an outstanding host and went incredibly far to make us feel comfortable and to give us recommendations on great places to go while we were in Angaston.

If you're a group of people looking to get away for a weekend, you simply must stay here. It will be the highlight of your trip.
Very cute place, big open living spaces make nights in a breeze.
Great place, easy to get around. Very picturesque!

While this property offered plenty of accommodation and amenities for our family, we were disappointed in the lack of attention paid to cleaning, in particular, the oven. We found the decor tired and dingy rather than cosy and comfortable.
Some of the items left in the “complimentary breakfast” were past their used by date. It all added up to us feeling a bit “ripped off” as it wasn’t cheap accommodation. We can’t believe the comments by previous occupants. We’re we really staying in the same place!

The host is great, nothing too much trouble. Provided us with all the information we needed to enjoy our stay. The property is set in lovey grounds, the spa was great to relax in, there is a sound system inside and out so we were able to play music from our phones. Lovely quirky place perfect for a weekend getaway.
The perfect place to base yourself for a Barossa trip. The house has a lot of character and all the amenities you need. Loved the spa in particular!
A lovely and comfortable house to stay in and very nice welcome basket with lots of goodies to enjoy. Location is also great.
Robyn's place is beautifully nestled in Angaston, the pictures don't do it justice. We had a great relaxing weekend here, everyone loved it!
Thanks so much for having us stay Robyn, such a picturesque place! stunning gardens perfect for our wedding 2.0 photos. everyone loved the spa & all the little touches. Thanks again. Legend🤙😘🥂

We had a girls weekend away at this cosy two-story log cabin and we couldnt have been happier with our choice! Robyn was very helpful with local tips, and the house is an easy walk to the main street for some cafes. The lounge, dining and outdoor areas gives you ample space for a larger group (we had 3) or a family. Would love to come back again.
Beautiful and quiet, great base for a getaway!

We loved our stay at the property. It has a special homey feel to it that made everyone feel relaxed. My son enjoyed the collection of childrens books in the living room that kept him busy for hours, we loved our afternoon picnic at the garden and our breakfasts at the back. Its a great place to spend time with family and friends.
Cosy house with great outdoor space in a convenient location. The best wine/cheese plate and breakfast platter we’ve ever had at an airbnb! Very thoughtful touch.

What a great little getaway to Angaston! Loved the welcome platter and bottle of local Shiraz to start off our weekend away. Breakfast provisions were a fantastic to start our Saturday with a small feast.

Robyns home is a great location being so close to all the good wineries and restaurants not to mention just a short walk from the Main Street.

I would definitely recommend and be more than happy to stay again.
Robyn was an excellent host and the place itself was lovely. Additionally, Robyn was responsive to any queries we had :)
Absolute charming Place

Robyn puts the BnB part back into the platform. Upon arriving, we were greeted with a bottle of wine, some local cheeses, breakfast provisions, a fully set combustion heater and warm jacuzzi. Robyn was a delight to deal with and her house is beautifully kept - clean, plenty of extra blankets and a kitchen that's stocked just like you would keep at home. All these little touches, and a great location within striking distance of the Barossa wineries, really made the place stand out amongst all the other AirBnBs I've been to.

Oh, if you happen to leave the front door open during the day expect a visit from the friendly brown hens.

Loved our stay at Robyn's place in Angaston. We found the house to be very neat and well appointed, and close proximity to the town centre and vineyards pickup's and drop-offs. Additional touches like a breakfast hamper & complimentary wine went a long way in making us feel welcome. Would recommend!

We had an amazing stay at Angaston by the Winter Creek. 2 x couples enjoying a fantastic few days wine tasting in the Barossa.
Communication with Robyn was perfect on the lead up to the trip and Robyn was able to organise for us to be driven around for a few days by John with Barossa beyond
We all highly recommend Robyn and John . The house was amazing with so many little thoughtful touches like the welcome bottle of wine and cheeseboard. Breakfast basket was fantastic with local area products
We had lots of laughs and a great relax by the fire and a soak in the spa at night after all day wine tasting
5 stars doesn’t feel like enough for the fun we had ! We will definitely recommend Robyn and her amazing place to anybody our friends wanting an incredible time in the Barossa
Thanks for having us !

Robyn’s place was so much more spacious than we expected. It was like being in a Canadian ski lodge! There were so many  small, well considered touches that made it all feel very special. The place was well set up and we found it very easy to get settled in and enjoy the spa, fireplace, food and wine! Robyn provided a breakfast and we also purchased a bbq tray and picnic. These were sensational and I highly recommend them. There was  ample, high quality Barossa produce provided and we were more than satisfied! Robyns place was great for our family but it would also really suit larger families or groups of friends wanting to ‘lock in’. I can highly recommend this as a fantastic Barossa accommodation.

Such a lovely part of the Barossa to base yourself for a few days, to enjoy the wineries and great food. Large 4 bedroom home big enough for families or groups of friends. Very responsive host. Extremely clean and well stocked house that my family felt so comfortable and relaxed in.
Bigger and better than it looks in the photos. Great location.

Super clean and cosy. Great location!
Much better than the photos. We really enjoyed our long-weekend stay and would definitely recommend this lovely house to those who seek a relaxing holiday and want to get away from it all.

Loved it- an awesome place. Loved the location, the garden, the log fire and outdoor area.

Will stay again :-)

Perfect accommodation for a weekend away in the Barossa, we loved the indoor fire pit and comfortable chairs, as well as the spacious wooden lodge style house with its gorgeous outdoor garden area. Would definitely stay again!
Fantastic, quirky place to stay. This was my second stay at Robyn's house. It's a lovely large house with stunning gardens and the kids LOVE the spa. Location is great and we will be back again.

Rebekah and Ed's place was gorgeous. Simple yet stylish and as noted in the description based on the 1950's era. Very clean with all the things we required for our stay. Beck was easy to contact and her communication was very prompt. The main Street of Angaston was less than ten minutes walk and we enjoyed trying out some of the suggestions for dining including Roaring 40's pizza and Vintners Inn. Bed was brand new and very comfortable. Bathroom had just recently been renovated and was spotless. Would recommend this place for anyone visiting the Barossa.

This is a beautiful house in a quiet neighbourhood of the Barossa valley. The house is a good size for 2-4 guests with vintage furniture to complete the look. Rebekah was very helpful and quick to respond and was happy to leave us to our own devices. With a car it's very easy to get around the area but we recommend booking a tour if you want to indulge in the wine. We went for a fantastic dinner at Vintners Bar and Grill, just outside of Angaston.
The house is a short walk into town, where you will find a couple of pubs, cafes, a wine bar and food store.

What a delightfully gorgeous 50's house - so full of charm. Rebekah has prepared the house perfectly for guests - the style, cleanliness, little extras, comfortable beds and beautifully renovated bathroom and laundry are a delight.  We highly recommend it for anyone travelling in the region - close to the main street of Angaston and a few short kilometres from Tununda. Rebekah's hospitality was second to none. Thank you so much for sharing your home with us.

Rebekah is a fabulous host. Quick to respond when you need her. House is quiet and cosy. Heaps of space inside with lots of cute little outdoor spaces in the garden. Large bedrooms with extremely comfy beds. Very practical and clean kitchen, bathroom and laundry. Lovely walk into town. Slight hill coming back. Gas heater was much appreciated and warmed the house quickly. ❤️
Cool little house, clean and great location. Rebekah was very attentive to our needs. Highly recommended.

We had a lovely stay at the 1950s retro cottage hosted by Rebekah. Rebekah was very quick to respond and made sure everything was ok with our stay. There was a delicious bottle of red left for us and some breakfast provisions.
It's a short walk to the main street of Angaston with a good choice of restaurants and shops. Angaston is a pretty town and a great spot base a Barossa visit.
It's like stepping back into the 50's brought back many childhood memories. Good value for money
Lovely host, clean and tidy, nice set up.

Angaston is a great base to see the Barossa from  and this property is a total delight ! A short walk to the pretty township for a meal, drink and food shop. The Host is excellent to communicate with and offers a gorgeous 50/60's period decorated house, that s perfectly fitted out for a stay - good kitchen facilities and utensils for a night in with with great Barossa Produce.
Really great property. We loved the 1950's style. The place was very clean and we even got a little treat upon arrival. Next time we are in the area we would definitely stay there again

Accommodation as described
Very clean and functional Lovely retro furniture. Location easy 10 minute stroll to main street. Communication with Rebekah very easy. Highly recommend as barossa accommodation location. For me Angaston is the loveliest of the towns in barossa tegion

Perfect location for exploring all the Barossa has to offer. Easy walk into Angaston for restaurants, supermarket, etc. Great wineries and scenery within a short drive. Very clean and a cool decor, easy check-in. Well-equipped kitchen if you want to take advantage of the great local produce - check out the Farmers Market on Saturday mornings in Angaston. Highly recommended!
Nice place to stay when in the Barossa.  Very clean.  Comfy, warm bed.  Great hosts.
This is a great house to stay in, comfortable and close to shops. Rebekah is a great host and makes you feel welcome!
Perfect for weekend or week long getaway!

Lovely Retro house! The beds were super comfortable and the shower was amazing! Lots of space inside and out with a lovely big backyard full of beautiful roses. The house was in walking distance to Angaston town centre and a good area to stay to visit wineries in the region. Would definitely stay again!

Easy access to this property is so convenient and the yard is beautiful to sit and enjoy a glass of wine. Everything was immaculate. We made use of the washing machine and hung our clothes to dry, greatly appreciated after traveling for two weeks.  We spent three days at Rebekah’s and found it very central for exploring the Barossa Valley. Fantatic time, and if we are ever back this way would certainly stay here again
Very clean and beautiful space. Bed and sofa not very comfortable. Nice area for walks

This was our second visit to Angaston.Also our second stay at Rebekah’s beautiful Airbnb.
This place has Everything travellers need and more.
Lots of extra touches.
Very comfortable beds with quality bed linen and towels.
The garden has been transformed a lovely area to sit and have a glass of wine which Rebekah provides.
It’s in a quiet residential area but easy access to shops and wineries.
Great restaurants within easy driving or some walking distance.
Keep up the great standard us travellers really enjoy finding such comfortable places.
We will be back.

Our stay in this retro cottage was perfect. It was well appointed with everything that we needed for a comfortable stay; especially the beds! The house is a short stroll from the main street of Angaston and in the heart of the wineries. The kitchen had everything we needed for self-catering but we took the opportunity to enjoyed dinner at Vintners one night as well. Handy wifi and laundry facilities (with powder!). There are plenty of cafes in walking distance with great coffee.

The attention to detail was incredible. From the authentic 1950’s décor, through to the modern luxuries (love that they give you TWO kinds of pillow!) this place is a joy to stay in. Did I also mention there’s wine provided for you, that’s made personally by the winemaker owner?? Can’t wait to come back for a longer holiday!”

Can't recommend enough.
Lovely quiet place, had no issues with anything. Everything was exactly as described. Only a short drive (for the lazy) into town for dinner.

Spacious. Stylish. Spotless. So comfortable it was hard to leave. And that's just the inside. The garden areas are also a delight. Fantastic centrally-located tranquil home base for touring into the Barossa. And the cherry on top: Rebecca was a top notch host
Sweet stay for a weekend getaway to the barossa! Perfect location, super clean, funky, comfortable and personal touches. Thanks for having us stay Beck.
the 50's inspired decor was great, a perfect place to base yourself for a wine weekend.
Easy access process, comfortable and clean . Met our expectations. Loved the complimentary wine.

Great location - easy walk down to main street Angaston and just minutes drive from all the wonderful wineries, restaurants and other great sites and sights.  Beautiful house, and sooo stylish! Hope to make it back again sometime.
Extremely well appointed house located in the heart of the Barossa.  Local bread, jam and wine on arrival was a very nice touch. Will definitely stay again.

We stayed for 3 nights at Rebekah’s Airbnb and enjoyed our stay! It's great that she restored a classic/retro-style home and it was much more spacious than we anticipated. It had all the amenities one would hope for in an Airbnb, and she was kind enough to leave us some local welcome items (fresh bread, jam, milk, wine, etc.). These little touches improve the check-in experience, so it's great she adds that extra touch. The home is spacious, the location is central (close to what you'd want to explore in Barossa Valley), and Rebekah's communication was fantastic. Overall, a great experience and I'd recommend her place for anyone that needs a centrally-located home in the Barossa Valley.  Thanks!

Beautiful house and amazing hosts. The details and retro decor from the house are great. Thanks Rebekah for your assistance with our late check-in and for your hospitality. We would definitely stay again.

We stayed at Rebekah lovely house for two nights and absolutely loved all about it! Very clean, generous with towels and bathroom essentials and nice bedrooms with great quilts and pillows! Rebekah is also great host and very easy to communicate with! Will come back!
Really nice place, curated selection of furniture and really nice location, clean and very practical house

What a stylish and playfully decorated place! Every little touch has been carefully chosen and this makes for a lovely stay. The Continental breakfast provisions and complimentary wine made life easy within a fully stocked kitchen with any pan or utensil you could possibly need. The linens were good quality, especially the quilt, and the bed is best for those who prefer a firm mattress. It is in a quiet neighbourhood close to all the delights of the Barossa. Netflix on the big TV was a treat to wind down after being out and about. Rebecca communicated clearly and quickly and checked in during our stay that we had everything we needed. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend a stay at Rebecca’s place!
Adorable little house in a quiet back street of Angaston. Nicely renovated with lots of retro touches.
Great
Great little house in a pretty good position in Angaston. Very easy check in process and easy to get in touch with owners.
Bec's house is lovely and peaceful, and made for a very comfortable base for our explorations of the Barossa.
Highly recomend this lovely house - impecably clean, stylish retro touches and convenient spot

We have stayed here on a few occasions.
The place is spotless.
Everything you need to prepare your meals.
Rebekah is a great host is very hands on.She responds immediately if you have any questions.
We have stayed in many Airbnb’s having the owner so accessible and so interested in her home makes it special.
The garden is full of nooks and crannies with a beautiful rose garden and an outside barbecue area.
If you should want to venture out there are many good restaurants in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) of our favourites is Casa Carboni.
Keep up the good work We hope to return at some stage.
Thank you.
A beautiful space close to the town and Barossa vineyards. Beka and Ed were quick to respond and added homely touches that made us feel very welcome.

We really enjoyed staying in Beck's house. We felt extremely taken care of. Great touches like a bottle of wine, USB charger and fresh coffee made us feeling very welcome. Excellent location, very nice house, super clean and great organisation. Thank you very much.

This charming house on a quiet street in Angaston provided the perfect accommodation for our weekend in the Barossa.
Each room was well appointed within the theme of period 1950’s, but of course the modern conveniences there to remind you we are in the 21st century.
The bathroom was large and modern and offered all the necessary amenities. Beds were comfy and pillows cloud-like.
Although we didn’t make it out there for longer than a two-minute arrival sticky-beak, the backyard has massive potential if staying for longer - with BBQ area and beautiful garden beds full of life (the sunflowers were blooming when we were there 🌻)
It is a short, pleasant downhill walk through the recreation grounds to the Main Street - so despite feeling like you’re on the outskirts, the property is really well situated to everything.
Beck was supreme with her advice and communication - the ideal host!
If we make it back to Angaston, we’d love to retro-it-up again.

Wow, what an awesome experience! A gorgeous little place in immaculate condition with plenty of quirky retro charm. Loved the gardens both front and back, a short stroll from the Main Street, and a great base for a Barossa food and wine gorge!!!
Such a lovely place to stay. The 50s theme is done with absolute class. Very welcoming and comfortable space to enjoy Angaston and surrounds.

We enjoyed our stay in this very cute retro styled home - so clean .
Very thoughtful hosts who left some provisions for us on the public holiday. Lovely quiet location.
Lovely house, beautifully styled with gorgeous gardens. Rebekah was an excellent host - very helpful and left some nice touches in the house. Would definitely stay again.
Fabulous accommodation. Extremely helpful hosts. very close to main street within walking distance. loved the 1950's inspired decor'. Will reccomend to friends.

This is a wonderful place to stay.  The house is an original 1950s place, with a beautiful rose garden at the front.  The interior is beautifully done out in very stylish original (refurbished) 1950s furniture, and there is a fantastic, spacious modern bathroom with an excellent shower.  The location is terrific - just a few minute walk to the very picturesque centre of the town, a few minutes drive to the fantastic Saturday morning Barossa Farmers Market, and with vineyards and wineries (including the wonderful and historic Yalumba site) just minutes away.  As numerous people have commented, the house is spotlessly clean and Beck is a superb and friendly host.  There was a bottle of local Jersey milk in the fridge, coffee and tea, and breakfast provisions provided, together with oils, sauces, herbs and spices for cooking.  The kitchen itself is very well equipped with high quality equipment - a cook's kitchen that we very much enjoyed spending time and preparing meals in.  And the beds were particularly comfortable.  Altogether a wonderful base from which to explore the Barossa Valley.  Highly recommended!

We loved our couple of nights here. The house has gorgeous gardens, is immaculately clean and has a very comfortable bed.

The breakfast provisions are a lovely touch. It’s a great location, in a very quiet neighbourhood.

Thanks Beck and Ed!

We loved our stay and the amazing decor in pristine condition! Cosy living area, nice and warm with air con and Netflix, all required kitchen amenities for a weekend stay. Modern and sparkling clean bathroom, cosy and comfy bed, nice and close to Angaston town centre. Lovely host who made sure we found and got in the place with ease. Spacious backyard we wish we could have used more in warmer weather! Would definitely stay here again!
Rebekah's house is clean and comfortable in a great location - quiet but close to all of the major attractions in the Barossa. The house is spacious with all of the facilities that you will need.
The only regret we had is staying only for one night (we run out of vacations). This is a fantastic place, we loved every detail in the house and it was very comfortable.
A very clean & cosy home in a very central position. Our hosts Beck and Ed were very responsive and friendly.

This gorgeous house is newly renovated and sparkling clean!
Loved staying here and would recommend to anybody wanting to enjoy the Barossa!
This little cottage was absolutely amazing for a stay in the Barossa. The house has everything that you needed. It was beautifully presented, clean and comfy! Thank you!
Beautiful house! It was like stepping back in time. Very comfortable beds! Beck and Ed are lovely people and really easy to communicate with. We’ll be back for sure!

Beck and Ed’s place was so lovely. It was really like going back in time in a good way. Everything was very comfortable and walkable to Angaston town. Beck was great on communication throughout and there was breakfast and fresh jersey milk for our arrival. Would definitely recommend!
Fantastic little house in the perfect location. Thank you for the lovely touches.

We stayed for 2 nights while we explored the Barossa and couldn’t have asked for anything more. Such a cool and stylish setup, really thoughtful fun touches. Super comfy bed in the main room as well.
We would love to stay again if in the Barossa.

My friend and I stayed at Rebekah’s beautiful property for three nights. The property is really thoughtfully and beautifully furnished, and includes  cooking utensils and everything else you need. Rebekah was a true super host providing local tips, incredibly responsive to messages and included those small extra touches (like cereal,  milk and coffee) and personalised help, when needed. Would definitely recommend Rebekah’s place to everyone looking for a warm and beautiful getaway. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
We loved staying at Rebekah’s home and would most certainly stay again (hopefully one day soon!).
Lovely clean and stylish home with an old world homely feel. Great communication from the hosts too.
Lovely place, super clean with all the amenities you need. Would highly recommend!
Beautiful house in a cute little town! Beck and Edward were very friendly and helpful. Would come again :)
Beautifully kept retro cottage, decorated in style overlooking a lovely vibrant rose garden.
Great place convenient to everything in Angaston
Rebekah's house is lovely - such an amazing collection of vintage pieces, while also being a great place to relax after exploring the Barossa. We love it!

Rebekah’s house is beautifully decorated, with a stunning garden and helpful tips about local wineries and restaurants to visit. Rebekah’s communication was clear and detailed, which made checking in and out a seamless process. We will definitely visit again when we are back in the Barossa.
A stunning property!
The place was sparkling clean and provided everything we needed for our barossa valley getaway. Would recommend!
Great location, sparkling clean and a very cool retro fitout. Had everything you need for a comfortable stay and some lovely personal touches!
Gorgeous house and yard. Rebekah was wonderful to deal with and the facilities available were great.

Our five days at Retro Barossa exceeded all our hopes for a great place to stay while exploring the Barossa and tracing our family history. The cottage and gardens are BEAUTIFUL. Every possible need has been carefully thought out and provided for and gives the comfort of home. The great kitchen the  barbecue and pantry provisions allowed us to make the most of amazing local produce.  Beck is the best host. Angaston is the perfect base for a wonderful holiday. We hope to return. Thank you for everything.
Great house, spotlessly clean, very comfortable, stylish and a short walk from the Angaston main drag. Highly recommended.
Rebekah and Ed were amazing hosts and the house was incredible - completely my vibe and style. Wish we stayed longer because Angaston is so beautiful! Definitely coming back xx
Beck and Ed have done an incredible job with this stylish pad! So many thoughtful touches and very accommodating! The highlight of our interstate trip 👍🏼
Wonderful place, exceptionally clean with a unique atmosphere - a sense of moving back in time. Truly lovely stay... highly recommend.

Beautiful quirky property in a peaceful location in Angaston. Highly recommended for a short getaway in Barossa. Felt like home and have all that you need for a few nights stay. Thank you Rebekah for the efforts to make sure that our stay was a comfortable one. Lovely place. We would return again some day.

This was a wonderful, clean, quiet space to spend a few nights in and explore the surrounding region. We had no issues finding the house, a very easy check in and the hosts were easily contacted and friendly! Would definitely recommend ^_^

Amazing home in the middle of Barossa wine region. The house was really big for the four of us, and a great place to come back to after a day of wine tasting. Gorgeous styling and really clean. Walking distance to the local town and easy driving to nearby towns.

Bec was a fantastic host with great communication. We would definitely stay again!
Beautiful home and garden in a great location for everything the Barossa has to offer. Definitely recommend!!
It was great. Very clean and quirky place. Also super helpful with providing local information.
A beautifully presented and immaculately clean spacious house with amazing 1950s decor. Quiet and very comfortable.
A stylish space, great location and friendly hosts. Thanks for having us!
Lovely and quiet. Sparkling clean and crisp and loved the quirky 50’s touches. Location was perfect. Fantastic hosts who were quick to respond and made us feel welcome. Will def stay again!

Rebekah’s home was stylish, sleek and comfortable - everything you need to relax and take in the Barossa Valley! We really appreciated the added touches which made us feel incredibly welcomed. Thanks for letting us stay in your amazing space!

Beautiful mid century furniture, very comfy home and very clean. You can tell that the hosts are very detailed and take tons of effort to make the stay the best one you can have. Will not hesitate to stay here again

Absolutely beautiful and homely accommodation. We missed the roses but I think it would be incredible in that season. Rebekah was really accommodating and had some great locate insight. Highly recommend staying here.

A great place to stay. Clean , bright and warm (winter weekend getaway). Lovely little retro house with pretty garden spaces. Quiet street with nice views from all rooms. Communication with owners and check in could not have been easier. Easy walking distance to main road. Would not hesitate to recommend.
Absolutely lovely 50s getaway. Comfortable clean and perfect hosts.
A wonderful and stylish getaway; so cosy and comfortable on a very cold and wintry weekend; quiet, easy to get around the Barossa from here, would ove to go back when the roses are flowering.

The home is absolutely stunning and in a perfect location, was the most clean Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in, Beck and Ed were very friendly and easy to communicate with and I would definitely look into coming back again!

What a lovely retro house with just a short walk into Angaston Main Street. Very comfortable and warm, plenty of amenities and lots of character. Breakfast and fresh lemons were left for us which was a lovely touch. We will recommend to our friends and family for a great place to stay in the Barossa.

If you’re contemplating staying here, don’t hesitate and book now! Beck and Ed have set up a beautiful retro Air BnB. We spent a week here on our honeymoon, and we didn’t want to leave! The furniture and styling is incredible, the house is immaculate, and the garden is lovely for a vino in the sun in the afternoon. Beck sent us a message letting us know that she’d drop in midweek to refresh the towels, and we really appreciated that touch - being newly married, it was nice to have that privacy. We’d love to stay again sometime! Cass and Ben Measday

Rebekah and Ed have created a beautiful space to relax and unwind in the Barossa. Everything we needed to enjoy our stay was provided and the property was immaculate. It is perfectly located in the heart of the region, with restaurants and wineries nearby. Rebekah was a fantastic host who was quick to respond. Highly recommended!
Great place to stay
By far our favourite Airbnb stay - clean, tidy, immaculately styled with such gorgeous personalised touches. Loved it!! Highly recommend!!
A very clean and comfortable house with good facilities and a beautiful garden.
Beautiful 50s style home - Super clean and right in the heart of Anganston with only a short drive to Tunanda

Our stay at the Barossa 1950s house was amazing! The house was very clean and well appointed. We could tell the owners had put a lot of thought into decorating and making the house as accommodating as it could be. Thanks for turning on the heating and leaving some chocolates for trick-or-treaters (you truly considered everything).

Fantastic place! Great location to explore the Barossa region! The retro styled interiors are so fantastic and really makes you feel you've travelled back in time to the good'ol days! Very spacious and really feels like a home away from home! Highly recommended!

The house has the most beautiful garden which is full of flowers - something we really enjoyed. Inside the house was spotless and we loved all of the retro touches. It's in a very quiet area but it was convenient for us to get to the places we needed to go to. Everything we needed was provided. Thanks :)

one of the best airbnb stays we’ve had

great location, super clean, great local tips and an amazing house

loved the retro space and the stunning front and backyard

thanks guys
A beautiful house with an amazing back yard and the comfiest beds! Very homey and a great place to stay to just relax.

We had an amazing stay! The house is comfortable, clean and so funky. Great location. Amazing flexibility and communication from hosts. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the Barossa.
Great place, great location and amazing beds! Would recommend staying here.

Our stay here was wonderful thank you! The house was sparkling clean, a lot more bigger and spacious than we expected too. It had everything we needed, including Tupperware containers to store food, all types of cooking and kitchen appliances, a BBQ kit, even Netflix! You can tell a lot of thought has gone into the place and what guests may need. Rebekah was wonderful to chat to also, super responsive and very happy to answer any questions. The milk and cereal provided was a lovely touch, as well as being able to have access to basic food supplies you would not otherwise pack! E.g. olive oil, balsamic vinegar etc. We had a lovely lovely stay and will definitely book again if visiting the Barossa!
Quirky stay, immaculately clean and beautiful garden. No aircon unit in bedrooms however so unfortunately was very hot at night.
Great place - very quirky and well thought out space. Communication was great.
We highly recommend! Beautiful garden which was very well kept and a lovely interior at a good location. We loved our stay, thanks Rebekah!

A gorgeous property, with lovely amenities & beautiful large backyard and rose garden.
We had a wonderful stay, host was very quick to respond to messages and made our stay a delight.
A short walk to the Main Street and very close to local vineyards.
Very clean and check in was made extremely easy. Would definitely recommend.
Lovely house in a great central location. Could have easily stayed longer than the week I did. Beck was great too, perfect host and plenty of great local tips. Thanks :)
Uber cool, beautifully clean, great hospitality. Wish we could have stayed longer. Will definitely be back.
Beautiful home and garden. Spacious and included everything we needed. Perfect for a girls weekend away!
Lovely time at Rebekah’s place! Place was spotless with a magnificent garden and everything we needed for a weekend away!

Great place to stay in quiet Angaston.
Good amenities, lovely garden and easy access to the beautiful Barossa Valley.
Spotlessly clean, stylish place added a bit of charm to our trip.
Excellent stay. Really retro house. Close to cafes and super clean. Thanks Bec

What a cool place! Nothing better for a change of pace than being transported back to the 50's. Beck & Ed's place is super stylish but also comfortable, with a lovely garden and a short walking distance from the town centre. Excellent location to visit all the great vineyards that the region has to offer. Had a fabulous time :-)

Loved our stay.
This house is a credit to the owners. So clean and the attention to detail is incredible. Terrific location. Great communication and super easy checkin.

We loved our stay here. It was a great location, easy walk into Angaston and readily accessible to the rest of the Barossa. The home was spacious and very comfortable and the decor was perfect for the home. The retro look took us back! The garden was beautiful, lovely to go outside for a cup of tea. Everything was beautifully maintained and Rebekah was very responsive. Would definitely love to come back.
Loved this place! Perfect spot to base ourselves for wine and more wine! Would love to have all the furniture!
Owners were really nice and accomodating, Comfortable house and great location.
Beautiful place, uniquely styled  and has everything you need for a stay in Barossa. Would highly recommended we had a great stay
Perfect host, clear instructions and easy communication. Super clean, attention to retro detail, comfortable, cosy, well-equipped, neat and tidy, and gorgeous garden. Highly recommended!
Lovely place to stay, very clean, comfortable and in a great location. Also very friendly hosts and easy check in. Highly recommended.
Was a lovely stay and a nice weekend getaway. Very clean, cute and homely.

This charming house is the perfect base to explore the Barossa, but you could just as easily stay in the sunlit living room or beautiful big garden for hours. The collection of retro furnishings was in beautiful condition and thoughtfully curated.

The house was absolutely spotless (but without the smell of harsh cleaners that sometimes accompanies that!)

Bed was comfy, sheets and towels nice quality. The kitchen was noticeably well-equipped, mostly with retro wares. A/c worked a treat for winter nights. The hosts provided great recommendations and were very responsive. I'd certainly recommend a stay.
A really nice place to stay. Lots of thoughtful touches. All we needed, plus some. Also love Angaston.
Retro house spotlessly clean with everything you need to enjoy a few days in the beautiful Barossa Valley!
Rebekahs place was great, location was good being a 5 minute walk from some good restaurants and coffee places and it’s generally a good location to explore the Barossa.
Great base to explore the Barossa. Retro accommodation gives a quirky 50s vibe for your stay while still providing modern amenities. Highly recommend
A lovely place to stay, ideally located, with great hosts. Would definitely recommend staying here!
Wonderful clean place to stay in a great location!

Wonderful easy check in. Lovely garden. Easy communication. Close to the wonderful wine region. Anguston was a perfect place to explore the region, and foodland walking distance to the main st for everything you need.

Absolutely loved coming home to this place!
Beck and Ed were lovely hosts.
The house itself is beautiful, humble and wholesome. It was immaculately clean and had a great outdoor area, large bathroom and comfortable bed. The house had everything we needed, the little touches were helpful. The location was perfect and it was easy to walk into the main street of Angaston, if you don't mind a little incline here and there.
Thanks fo having us! Would stay here again for sure.
Beautiful home and Rebekah is great to communicate with. We loved staying there.
Cute house, very relaxed feel. Good vibes.

Immaculately presented and impeccably styled, this was the perfect base for our exploration of the Barossa - a real home away from home. Stocked with the essentials and a short walk from the main street stores and cafes. We would definitely stay again!
Super clean and great location

A wonderful stay for our weekend getaway. A house with so much character, and a beautiful garden. The house itself was clean, the beds were comfortable and the location was central to all the best bits of Barossa.

Rebekah and Ed were lovely and very communicative during the process which we so appreciated.

Thanks again for a great stay guys!

This was a fantastic little cottage I'd recommend to anyone heading to the Barossa. Great location with many restaurants and cafes in Angaston, very comfortable accommodation with so much space as well are extremely generous and welcoming hosts who were extremely flexible.

The cottage provided ample space for 2 couples with a full kitchen, laundry, 2 dining tables, 2 sitting areas, 2 bathrooms and a lovely outdoor seating area under the vine. The fresh local produce left for us was plentiful & delicious including wine and chocolates, and we knew there was always help at hand even though we had complete privacy. Both beds were really comfy with soft warm doonas as well as a lighter cotton blanket for warmer nights. There was a little bit of street noise from passing traffic but not enough to wake us up. It was ideally located in town within easy walking distance to cafes, pubs & places to eat. I'd love to come back in winter to enjoy the fireplace. What a gorgeous cottage! We loved our visit to Angaston which was made even better by our lovely hosts.
We had a lovely stay in this delightful cottage, Jim was very welcoming and gave us some good recommendations for our weekend in the Barossa Valley.

Jim and Jeanette are amazing hosts and the Bluebird Cottage is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley. We had so much fun checking out the wineries Jim told us about, and loved having the inside track on the valley from a tour and awesome maps he gave us! The cottage is cozy and super relaxing with a back patio to die for. The kitchen makes me want to be a master chef and was stocked with all sort of delicious goodies. Simply put, stay at the Bluebird—it was absolutely splendid!

Jim and Jeanette's home was a little bit of a surprise as we believe the photo's don't do it justice. What a cute little cottage, perfectly equipped with everything you could possibly need plus all the little extras thrown in. Bath robes, soaps, shampoo. A gorgeous breakfast (self cook) with beautiful local produce, wine... We could go on and on.

The location was perfect for our needs and our hosts were delightful and exceptional and went way above anything we expected. Highly recommended for anyone thinking of staying in Angaston.
Everything you’d expect of a delightful cottage and even more! So convenient.

Bluebird Cottage offered so much more than we expected. Bountiful provisions, warm and inviting hosts and an easy walk to the delightful town of Angaston.

The tour of surrounding wineries and places of interest with Jim was the icing on the cake. It’s a shame we live so far away, we’d be back in the beautiful Barossa in a heartbeat.

Thanks Jim and Jeanette for your wonderful hospitality.
Kind regards,
Sue and Bruce

What a beautiful find this lovely little cottage was.  Cosy, comfortable;e and central to everything we needed.  Jim and Jeanette were wonderful and thoughtful hosts.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with them.

What wonderful hosts and a sparkling clean, cosy & gorgeous cottage.  Excellent location very close to restaurants and shops. Jim and Jeanette went out of their way to ensure we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Bluebird Cottage. Thanks for everything including your Barossa recommendations & generous provisions!  We highly recommend your cottage!

The location is easy to get everything you need a short walk away while on holiday. Lets be honest its the winery's we were looking for and this is located perfectly for the region!

The accomodation is spacious, wonderful vintage furniture, an amazing outdoor entertaining area(felt like we could have been at a winery) with a selection of games and puzzles to do while you sip wines of the region. An adequately stocked kitchen to cook what you want/need.

There was a great plater of local foods for breakfast furthermore a cold bottle of bubbles on arrival! The hosts are fantastic with attention to detail, and the tour of the region Jim offered was personalised, knowledgable and easy; just what you want. Thank you! I will be coming again!!!
Thank you for a lovely weekend in the Barossa. A beautiful cottage and delicious breakfast provisions, as well as other special touches. And the fire is wonderful

Our stay within the Barossa Vineyard Cottages was excellent! The space was well stocked with modern features, but still provided a warm comfortable setting. The breakfast rations were generous and delicious - we would highly recommend to anyone looking to stay within the Barossa Valley!
The host canceled this reservation 43 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Fantastic location and the extra touches supplied by Sandra make it a special trip.
Top spot, delicious home baked bread and close to lovely Tanunda.

My partner and I had an amazing stay in our cottage over the long weekend. The photos can convey how nice and cosy this place is, the smell of fresh bread greeted us as we walked in, the place was spotless, and to get the fire going was as simple as striking a match and lighting the paper, everything was ready to go for us to enjoy. The beds had electric blankets so you could slide in for a toasty warm sleep. The bathroom, and in particular the spa bath, were awesome.
The location was just what we were after as well, the cottages are in the middle of the property so there was no traffic noise at all to interrupt the serenity, with beautiful views of the vineyards and surrounding hills.
Loved our stay, Sandra is an amazing host
The cottage is stunning! Very clean and cosy. So many thoughtful touches from breakfast provisions to a bottle of wine. We absolutely loved our stay and cannot wait to stay there again.
Our stay at the cottages was beautiful! Sandra was a great host and very friendly. Location was perfect and would recommend this stay to anyone looking for a peaceful getaway.

If you are looking for peace and quiet, for all the comforts of home with a bit extra thrown in, for fabulous hospitality and a whole lot more then THIS is the place for you! We loved our stay and will most definitely be back.
Such a relaxing and quiet spot to spend a romantic weekend. The breakfast provisions were plentiful and local and the location was so close to all of the places we wanted to visit.
Great host. Will be recommending to others

Lovely house with delicious breakfast provided  (Bacon, sausages, eggs, fresh baked bread, tomatoes, Mushrooms, OJ, cereals, yoghurt) house was very clean and large spa bath is a luxurious touch. Highly recommend
Such a lovely stay in our little cottage - would definitely recommend to others. Breakfast provisions were a really thoughtful touch!

A sweet little cottage perfect for a couple. Loved the fresh breakfast ingredients and the location in the Barossa Valley! Would love to come in winter when the fire place could be put to good use! Thanks so much 🙂

Beautiful little cottage stay in the heart of the Barossa Valley! Great provisions (fresh bread, milk, eggs, mushrooms and tomatoes as well as juice, tea and coffee) and daily restocking of the firewood!! Great view of sunrise and sunset also ;) we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - and Kora the owners dog was an adorable visitor in the mornings!

A very comfortable and warm cottage with panoramic views of vineyards and green hills.The host is very welcoming and considerate.The location is perfect.Situated just outside the hustle and bustle of Tanunda township but yet so close to all amenities.Easy access to another big town Nuri and charming Angaston.Seeking a peaceful stay?Do not look any further😊

Beautiful cottage and surroundings, better than we expected. Henri had thought of everything and left us so much food inc breakfast, cheese board, snacks we couldn't even get through it all. Great location on the edge of Barossa and easy to get around. There were a few millipedes around with the change of season but it was fantastic overall. Thanks Henri!
We enjoyed a cozy &  comfortable, scenic weekend at Barossa Glen. Henri was an exceedingly helpful host.
A gem of a place. Peaceful and very relaxing. The extras that were there just made our stay that much more special. Can't wait to go back again.
What a beautiful stone cottage Henri's place is! Fantastic secluded base for our weekend in the Barossa!!

Henri's place is just perfect! It's more than you can expect. The location is a bit isolated meaning beautiful sky nights full of stars and a peace sensation.
The house is very comfortable and spacious. Henri did spoiled us with lots of treats. The breakfast was amazing.
I totally recommend and hope to be back one day.

A beautiful secluded stone cottage surrounded by breathtaking views and only a short drive from town.
A warm personal welcome from Henri with great local knowledge, amazing cheese grazing platter and perfectly selected wine to compliment.
The cottage had so many thoughtful items and delightful surprises.
Henri's place provides a wonderful balance of hospitality and and we appreciated his eye for detail in each room. Fabulous stay in the Barossa SA and can't recommend this accommodation highly enough ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️.

Henri's property is beautiful! Well kept and his attention to detail is outstanding!
The location is great, just a bit on the edge of the main wine area but very easy to get around to everywhere you need to go.
Fridge was stocked with a great breakfast selection as well - more than we could finish! Thanks again for a great stay!

Character plus accom,with all the"bits" you could want.Considered and provided for ,food provision's beyond what anyone might expect. Little extra touch's galore.All located in a private ,peaceful & convenient location close to all the Barossa has to offer. A host in Henri that can provide info on what and where.
Excellent place to stay and Henri was extremely helpful with planning our outings and even arranged a picnic!
A definite pick if looking for comfort and attention to detail. Can not fault.
Fantastic place with an equally fantastic host!
Absolutely Amazing... My parents loved their surprise stay at Henri's place... Henri went above and beyond to make the weekend special for them...
Henri's cottage is a great private cottage for a romantic getaway. Kiychen was great and sypet welk stocked with food, some sparkles and cheese. Good location on the Barosssa. 5 out of 5
The quintessential Australian cottage, it doesn’t get much better than this. Henri’s hospitality was more than generous. Little surprises everywhere. I highly recommend!

We loved Henri’s cottage. We stayed for 3 nights for an anniversary.  It was clean, comfortable and private. Everything was as described, fabulous well equipped kitchen, bed was comfortable, plenty of fluffy white towels and the best little hairdryer!! But the thoughtful little touches are what set it apart. The fridge was so well stocked with treats, from the gorgeous cheese platter to the yoghurt, the wine , the orange juice and the bowl of strawberries. The chocolate treats were a lovely touch, as were the welcoming pastries. Henri’s breakfast provisions were outstanding as well. Meeting his guests and giving them a short history of the house is a nice touch . We loved the serenity after a hard days wine tasting. Great job Henri! Highly recommended .

Great place in a wonderful location away from anything, but so close to lots. Overwhelmed by the supplies for breakfast and snacks.
Just a really good setting for a quiet weekend. But only minutes from so much in the Barossa.
Lovely cottage in an idyllic setting. Definitely recommend. Henri is extremely kind and helpful.

Henri is an outstanding host, responsive, flexible, generous, and attentive - everything you’d hope for. The charming cottage is adorable, spacious, clean, bright, and very well appointed. Access is easy, and the setting is superb, flanked by vineyards on either side. Wi-fi 24/7 access is great, long walks up the unmade roads is a treat with stunning views. Overall experience was truly wonderful over our two-week stay.
Great place to stay

If you're seeking a cosy relaxing get-away in the Barossa you must stay at Henri's Cottage. It's quaint, quirky secluded, quiet and the historical background and renovation was fascinating to us. The King bed is comfy and the main bedroom quiet and relaxing. There are plenty of extras provided by Henri the ever attentive and exceptional host. The plentiful and thoughtful food supplies provided for guests are a wonderful surprise, the kitchen is spacious and the lounge room is equipped with books, board games, DVD's and of course a T.V. free WiFi. You will also find a collection of pamphlets providing information for sight-seeing we recommend going to the whispering wall and the historical goldfields, the township of Gawler is a short drive from the cottage. Henri is helpful and communicates well with guests.

My fiancée and I had an amazing stay at Henri’s Cottage. The place came jam packed with all these incredible extras! No need to do a shop once you get there!
We are very thankful for the hospitality he showed us. Will stay again!
Henri  is a most thoughtful and engaging host. So willing to share to share local knowledge and tips. Wonderful cottage close to the Best of Barossa.

We had an amazing experience at Henri’s place. The cottage is very private with lovely views over vineyards. Very well equipped kitchen stocked with loads of breakfast supplies and extra treats. Super comfortable king size bed with great linen. Henri is an excellent communicator and super lovely and accommodating host. We would stay here again and highly recommend to others.
Henri's attention to detail was first class, highly recommend the stay.
Wonderful place and fantastic host

A lovely little cottage perfectly placed for all the Barossa has to offer. The cottage was full of little extras we didn’t expect and the bed was amazingly comfortable! Henri is a knowledgeable host who was able to advise us on a good Mountain Bike trail with amazing views. We had a super couple of days and would stay there again. Thanks Henri!
The place was nice and clean. The food was fantastic and so much of it too. We felt very comfortable and there were many nice touches such as fresh flowers.
The host has thought of everything, there is no small detail missed.

Having stayed at lots of Air BnB places over the years I can without a doubt say that Henri is the best host I have come across.  He has thought of everything, from food and drink, tea coffee, local advice and tips he has everything covered.  The cottage is perfect for a quiet weekend away in the Barossa and has everything you could need or want.
We celebrated a lovely weekend away. The thoughtfulness that goes into make this place comfortable is outstanding. Will be back and recommending to others. Thank you Henri
Great little cottage in great location. Quiet, private and charming. So many extra touches. So thoughtful! The cheese platter and breakfast was awesome! Thank you so much- definitely will return

A return visit was just as great as the first visit. Wonderful local produce and welcoming warmth with the host having turned the heating one in advance for our comfort. Easy to get to, very private and so much locally to see and do. Great spot!
A charming place in a great location. Very cosy.
Beautiful setting! Great for a relaxing trip.

Beautiful spot in the heart of the Barossa, so many thoughtful touches and delicious food too! Henri meet us there and gave us a tour and told us about the history of the building too which was lovely. Thanks again Henri for having us!

WOW. Henri was a sensational host from the time of booking onwards.  I had difficulty finding the cottage( I drove past the clearly marked sign) and Henri was very prompt in calling when I asked for help.  On entering the property you quickly realise that you are dealing with a sensational host.  The little additions of biscuits, wine and the list goes on ( no spoilers here) will make your stay one of peacefulness and comfort.  The ambience and history of the cottage is first class, and please do not think stone cottage and dingy, this cottage is far from that.  Henri let us settle in and then offered to provide some local knowledge.  I would strong,y recommend you take him up on the offer because it will make your touring of the region that much better.  Thanks Henri, you are a great host and the cottage is fabulous.  We will see you again when we next travel to the Barossa or Clare valleys.
Outstanding hospitality. Thankyou Henri. Provisions way beyond anything we have experienced  before. Couldn't have asked for more.
Herni’s place is wonderful folks. History, ammenities and such a relaxing and beautiful location. Highly recommend!
Excellent place to stay, awsone food provisions provided, nice and quiet private location, close to all areas of interest. Will come again.

Henri's extra touches with bedside chocolates, a fully stocked fridge with breakfast (whether you want continental or full English) and a great wine and cheese platter were simply wonderful.  Short drives to all the wineries and major towns of the Barossa and a willingness to recommend great eateries/wineries and tours. Communication via the app/email was fast when I was delayed and had to get in well after dark.  The bed was super comfortable. Would stay again.

Henri went above any beyond to help me plan a suprise weekend away for my partner and helped with a few items for the proposal. The house was immaculate with some very nice touches. Such a perfect location and great views of surrounding vineyards. 11/10 on every aspect and I cannot wait to visit again. If you want a perfect place to stay for a romantic weekend in the Barossa, this is it.
Fantastic place to stay in the Barossa - would gladly recommend to anyone.

A beautiful little cottage all to yourselves in the middle of amazing vineyards. Close to everything you want in the Barossa. Henri was a great host and went above and beyond expectations. He left an amazing variety of food, taking into consideration my partner being coeliac and pregnant. Absolutely perfect weekend away.

Such a cute little relaxing cottage. Love the hospitality and everything he took into consideration to provide for us. Would love to come back again one weekend. Everything was clean and neat and had a great view from the backyard.

Amazing place, really enjoyed our stay
Highly recommend!

Absolute GEM! Must visit.
Henri left no stone unturned to ensure his guests can fully enjoy their stay without having to sweat the smaller stuff. Everything from the stocked up fridge filled with yummy cheese and fruits, to the chocolates next to the bed, it was perfect! The house is absolutely gorgeous and it felt like travelling back in time. We will most definitely love to return again someday :) Thanks heaps Henri!
Nice Cottage , lots of extras,good Host

Was an absolute joy to stay at Barossa Glen and Henri’s cottage is just a small slice of paradise in the Barossa. Henri gave us some great local tips on wineries and places to eat and these were fantastic. However we could have just spent two days relaxing in the cottage as Henri has everything anyone could need including breakfast, food wine and drinks.
I highly recommend this lovely romantic getaway and we will most certainly be coming back soon!
Five stars.
We had a fantastic time at Henri’s cottage. Hope we can stay again soon!

This place is amazing! Perfect little cottage for a peaceful weekend get away. Henri was the perfect host and did not miss a single detail from the multiple breakfast options to the wine and cheese platter organised for my husband and I! I can’t wait to come back and stay again in the future!
If you’re looking for a quiet country setting with all the mod-cons, you can’t beat Henri’s place.

Barossa Glen, Henri's Cottage was perfect with a mixture of being an historical stone house on the outside but deceptively roomy with all the comforts inside.
Henri was an awesome host who went above and beyond by personally welcoming us and helping us with our touring needs. He absolutely spoilt us with wine, port, chocolates, cheeseboard and every breakfast choice there is! We didn't need to waste time buying a single grocery item.
The king size bed was so comfortable.
The surroundings were so peaceful with not another house in sight. Just the outlook of a vineyard and lovely gardens.
We were lucky to find this slice of paradise!

Such an amazing place! Everything there was so lovely :) Such a tranquil place to get away from it all, such thoughtful touches, all the amenities, food absolutely incredible! You won’t regret your stay AT ALL

A beautiful, private place to stay.
A few minutes drive to some wonderful wineries, lookouts, and restaurants. Plenty of nice, thoughtful touches in the place as well. Highly recommend
Very comfortable house in a peaceful location. Henri has thought of every little details & touches in the house to make for a very enjoyable stay. Very responsive in his communications also.
Perfect place for a week-end in the heart of Barossa.

Henri's cottage is by far the best Airbnb that we have stayed at to-date. The place itself is stunning with so many facilities available. Henri added personal touches in preparation for our arrival which was very thoughtful. We enjoyed eating in at night and were able to use BBQ/oven to cook our locally bought supplies - yum! Very homely feeling.
His tips for things to do (highly recommend Daimler Winery Tour with John) and wineries to visit were spot on. We couldn't ask for anything more - the perfect place for us to enjoy our first visit to the Barossa Valley area. Thank you Henri.

This place is great for couples looking for a private retreat that's within driving distance to so many great wineries and hospitality venues, with a fantastic spa bath and cosy cottage vibes. Henri was a fantastic host, who had taken care to ensure we were comfortable and the details he had thought of were extraordinary! He had thought of everything for every guest, and was very friendly. The provided breakfast, variety of tea and coffee facilities, cheese platter and wine was all fantastic. Highly recommend staying here!
Henri’s cottage was cute and homely. There was more than enough food supplied and thoughtful touches everywhere you look. It was the perfect space to sit back and relax over our holiday period.

Barossa Glen was the perfect place for a weekend getaway. Everything we could have wanted was provided for us, so much so that we didn’t even need to leave the house! Definitely looking forward to staying again in future.

Henri is a truly incredible host; I don't think I've eaten so much in some time! Henri provided such a fantastic variety of breakfast foods, snacks, and provisions to last us the weekend. He was quick to respond to questions and went out of his way to make the experience as comfortable as possible for us. I don't think I've experienced such hospitality at an Airbnb before.
Seriously above and beyond, could have stayed at this gorgeous cottage for weeks! Such great value and the hospitality was amazing!! Thank you Henri!!
You can't fault this place. You have to stay here if visiting the Barossa. A gem of a place!

What a great place this is, set off the beaten track, this gorgeous cottage is a wonderful, cosy place to stay for a few days. It has a full kitchen / dinning, lounge, sunroom, bedroom and separate bathroom. Plenty of space and sparkling clean. Henri provides so many extras its hard to list, breakfast, wine, cheese plate, chocolate just to name a few. It's private location is lovely but you are still only mins drive from town and a heap of wineries. Highly recommend this gorgeous cottage. Our host Henri was lovely, answering all our questions and checking in on us to make sure we had arrived safely.  Great stay.
Awesome place

One of the best cottages we have been too. Great location to visit Barossa wineries. Very clean and there was excess amount of delicious food for our stay. So many thoughtful touches which made our stay a very memorable one. Would stay here again!
Expect the unexpected in the most beautiful way!!

This is a great place in a wonderful location, but what makes this stay extra special was Henri's thoughtfulness and  incredible hospitality. You don't need to look elsewhere, just book this place and like us you will be glad you did.
Thanks for the amazing stay Henri. Thanks also for the great food!
Beautiful cottage within the heart of the Barrossa. Thoughtful supplies and amenities. Cosy and comfortable, we really enjoyed our stay. Thank you.

Henri's is a charming cottage with fantastic amenities and generous provisions for breakfast and drinks. It has a beautiful quiet setting but is not too far away from the local attractions. We intended to eat out at night but decided to spend more time in the cottage instead. Henri went out of his way to cater for our needs.

My partner and I had a great time. The cottage was lovely, so much food, the amenities were comfortable and that spa bath was to die for. Henri gave us a tour of the cottage and told us about its heritage and stonework. We'll definitely recommend this place to family and friends and look forward to coming back again!

I can not recommend this bnb highly enough ! Henri’s cottage is cosy and charming and Henri has thought of absolutely EVERYTHING that will make your stay wonderful; from the vast selection of welcome nibbles to the amazingly stocked fridge and all the basic cooking essentials you could need . He has comfy robes and bubbles for the bath, books and games and DVDs and so the list goes on . He is also the ultimate foodie so he gave us fantastic recommendations that made our trip superb.
We will definitely be back 😁
This place is incredible. A proper cottage and b’n’b experience. We will be back 10/10
Henri's beautiful cottage and attentiveness made this stay amazing. We would highly recommend.
Exceeded expectations. Plentiful amenities and food/wine supplied, tranquil location and spotlessly clean. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

The cottage is in nice quite location and ideal for exploring the Barossa valley.
The supplies provided were a nice touch and very generous.
Henri was easy to communicate with and responded promptly to any questions we had.
The property was very clean and provided a great home away from home.
A chance at being spoilt rotten.

Barossa Glen is a welcoming haven nestled amongst farmland and vineyards. Henri, the host, has lovingly crafted a self contained home away from home. With care and attention to dietry requirements, necessities and delectible extras are provided to ensure a happy and contented stay. We would not consider staying anywhere else in the Barossa.

Our second stay in a few months - couldn't stay away for long! The spa bath is wonderful and the lovely spread of snacks and breakfast provisions Henri prepares are absolutely top notch. We'll be here again soon I'm sure!
We wanted to Thank Henri for the stay at his lovely cottage. The stay was memorable and one that we would love to repeat again.

Highly recommend this place!!! Henri was a fantastic host making us feel right at home and giving us lots of tips and suggestions for places to explore during our stay! From
the moment we stepped in the door we felt very welcomed into a warm cozy cabin with great amenities and a lovely selection of food for breakfast (and more!). This is a wonderful place to stay for a little getaway to explore the Barossa Valley from! Our only regret is not staying longer!! Thanks again!😄

Henri's cottage was a hidden gem.  From the moment we walked through the door, we felt like we were looked after and catered for.  Every detail was taken into consideration and you could really tell he'd put lots of thought into what what's really important.  Breakfast provisions were great, the cheese and wine on arrival was a bonus and all the facilities were comfortable.  We'll definitely be staying here again the next time were in the neighbourhood!! Thanks Henri!!

A beautifully secluded cottage nested between some lovely vineyards. Great location and not too far from many wineries or restaurants in the area. Henri made the check in super smooth and was very knowledgeable about the region. He had a lovely cheese platter with some local wine as well as breakfast options and snacks which accommodated for dietary requirements. The cottage itself is stunning with two toilets, a spa bath and an large open kitchen, a lounge room with television and Netflix, a sun room with games and bedroom with a king sized bed.A lovely stay highly recommend for a couple wanting to get away for a night or two!

Henri's cottage was an enjoyable and romantic stay for my partner and me, Henri was a great host providing plenty of food and amenities that meant we could just enjoy ourselves at the cottage when not out seeing the Barossa. He also was very willing to give us plenty of information be it the history of the cottage or great places to see.

my partner was quick to say she wanted to return for another stay and I agree.
Thank you Henri for everything, we hope to see you again soon!

Lovely cottage in a tranquil location near Rosedale and Lyndoch in the southern Barossa. A great place to chill and explore this beautiful region. We found some good bushwalking experiences nearby at Sandy Creek and Altona. Henri adds some special touches with food and wine to enhance the stay.
Great stay at a beautiful cottage. Absolutely spoilt with all of the provisions and the place was lovely. Highly recommend!

Our whole experience with Henri was amazing. His attention to detail from the moment we booked, until the end of our stay was second to none. Henri gave me so many suggestions to help me plan our trip to the Barossa and we followed each recommendation for sightseeing, wine tasting and food experiences.
When we arrived at the cottage after dark, the lights were on and the heater was pumping, giving us a warm welcome in more ways than one. The cottage is very well appointed and comfortable, and the luxurious extra touches of food and drink meant we could have easily stayed put for our entire stay without needing to venture out. We had wet, cold weather but the cottage and grounds would be even better in the summer months.
Would definitely recommend.

Our stay at the cottage was beautiful, relaxing and highly recommended. From the lovey cottage with it’s cleanliness and lots of treat to the incredible location and wildlife. Would 100% stay here again

Thank you Henri

Don't go past this place. From the time you step into the front door, till the time you leave, nothing has been forgotten. Every room shows thought and the extras (mostly the food) adds to a wonderful stay. 2nd visit and will be going back.
Great property in a terrific location. The host is excellent. Highly recommended.

Henri's cottage is a great place to stay whilst visiting the Barossa.  Henri had great communication, the place was very clean on arrival, had plenty of provisions and extra little touches.  Would definitely use Henri's cottage again in the future.

Wonderful setting allowing us complete privacy and time just to be together. Cottage is clean and fully equipped with everything you need. Henri was a wonderful host and we enjoyed all the special foods and extra touches he provided which made everything so special. Highly recommended.

Henri’s Cottage was so lovely and peaceful, will all of the finishing touches and so well stocked with every food item we could have wanted. The location was also fantastic for exploring the Barossa and we had an amazing weekend. Just wish we had longer!

The loveliest host we could ask for with our first Air BnB. The services were amazing and the opportunity to learn about the history was so insightful. We enjoyed everything Henri did for us and we can not recommend this place enough to anyone who is considering booking. You will have the most amazing time! Thanks again Henri and you will see us booking again soon!

Barossa Glen (aka Henri's Cottage) is an enchanted and magical cottage ideally located in the beautiful Barossa Valley. Henri is a very caring and thoughtful host who offers a very generous amount of very high quality provisions. These include breakfast (bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms. cereals etc.), wine, port, chocolates, fruit, snacks, juices.... the list is literally too large to cover here. If you truly want to feel very well looked after and you are seeking a thoroughly enjoyable experience, then book yourself a stay at Barossa Glen, you will not regret it!  Steve and Jacquie - Adelaide.

A amazingly peaceful weekend away. Fabulous location with a host who goes beyond to ensure hospitality and comfort. I can not fault the experience at all. I highly recommend to future guests. Without a doubt an excellent experience x

This was a wonderful place to relax and unwind in the heart of the Barossa.
