Henri made the experience a memorable one with all his attention to detail, helpful advice on things to see and yummy treats. Henri was a fantastic host I would would definitely recommend staying in his cottage if it is available.
Nice weekend in the Barossa ... Stay was comfortable. Friendly helpful hosts. Historic house accommodation. Clean and  quiet.
Delightful accommodation, lots of space and very friendly hosts!

We walked into a true Barossa lifestyle at Wroxton Grange, surrounded by vinyards. The heritage farm-style accommodation was spacious and comfortable, in character with the family's working winery. jo was a gracious hostess who thoughtfully provided more than basic b&b essentials and all kinds of local knowledge that added to our Barossa experience. Highly recmmended

Wroxton Grange is a heritage Barossa homestead surrounded by sprawling hills with wonderful pockets of vineyards which we thoroughly enjoyed exploring. The accommodation was spacious and comfortable for the four of us.

Jo was very accommodating who thoughtfully provided lots of local knowledge in the pamphlets/maps in the common areas. It was only a bit of a challenge for us when we wanted to cook up a feast as the kitchen was basically equipped. Nevertheless, we managed it with a big team effort and served up one of the meals of our trip!

What a beautiful spot. Jo made us feel right at home. The accomodation has the authentic cosy country feel. We could walk amongst the vineyards on the property and say hello to the animals.
we had a wonderful time and would recommend this place to anyone wanting an authentic Barossa experience.
Original old house overlooking vines. Pool table and generous breakfast provisions. Short drive to cellar doors.

We had a lovely afternoon and a very relaxing stay in Ian & Jo's place. We arrived earlier than check in time, Ian let us in regardless, thank you Ian.
Really beautiful farm, cottage and great host, kind, generous and flexible. It was the most relaxing stay we have had during our trip. Highly recommended.
There are two bedrooms, two bathrooms and two living rooms, so it was like huge for 3 of us. Plenty of places for eating out and look around in the town. Will definitely stay again if ever going that way again.
Very quiet location in a picturesque setting

Great little b&b attached to a working winery just out of Angaston. The spacious, private, self contained rooms are part of a beautiful old period country house. Especially liked the outdoor eating area where we could enjoy the lovely country breakfast with farm fresh ingredients provided by Jo and gaze out over the rolling hills.

Hosts were very friendly and welcoming.

Would definitely recommend.

We had an absolutely lovely stay at Wroxton Grange. The space is delightful and and beautifully clean. Jo provided delicious homemade biscuits on arrival and a hearty breakfast selection. Communication with Jo was easy. It was fabulous to stay in a space in keeing with the local area. Excellent location for  discovering the Barossa area. Thank you
Great location just down the road from major cellar doors in Eden Valley. Classic B&B plus alpha rustic style, friendly senior couple hosting with tradition giving your visit that extra warmth.

We had a wonderful stay at Jo s and Ian, jo welcomed us nicely and we enjoyed her wine.. She has beautiful property where you can enjoy walks and nice sunset colours in nature. Not to miss the oranges in your yard which are fabulous.. We had a great time as well cycling in the veynards around where you can purchase a a basket and butcher tour.. Where you pick up different things such as wine, honey while cycling ..you will for sure have a wonderful time in the region..
Great location, the owners are super helpful and lovely.

Jo and Ian’s place was absolutely wonderful. A very secluded location (we only spotted a few vehicles along the road during our stay) and a stunning sunset over the rolling hills. A great location to explore the Barossa and Eden Valleys, and plenty of cute towns to explore.

A clean and warm place to stay, with adorable homely touches throughout. A delicious breakfast and kitchen facilities as well - would definitely return!

We were very pleased with our stay at Jo and Ian's place. Truly wonderful relaxing weekend in a farmhouse/ vineyard within in short driving distance (5 mins) to Anderston town in Eden Valley. Less than 10 minutes the other way, you are in the Barossa Valley. Excellent hosts.
A great place to stay if you want to experience a real farm stay. Jo and Ian are fabulous hosts.
Cosy, warm and peaceful!

Fantastic country home in the beautiful Barossa with a friendly, generous and fun hostess. I've stayed at many Airbnbs and this is probably my favourite so far! The place is beautiful and Jo was so lovely and helpful - she gave us farm fresh breakfast provisions every evening for no extra cost! 100% recommend this place.
Bring own aero guard.  You may have many insects visiting you.

A beautiful location, and a cosy stay with lots of lovely touches. Fresh farm eggs for breakfast, homemade cookies, port, useful tips for eating in Angaston. We felt welcomed, and had a very comfortable weekend.
Lovely clean space. Good location close to angaston.

We loved staying there overnight, such a beautiful location. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfy. Breakfast was delicious  too. Hosts are lovely people and we were glad we stayed there.

A lovely spot for some old fashioned peace and quiet for our girls weekend. Jo showed us in and then left us with our privacy. There were thoughtful touches like honey biscuits and port, farm fresh eggs with fresh bread and homemade marmalade. The beds were comfortable and there were two toilets and showers which came in handy. We had dinner in Tanunda, the cab ride was $38 one way. The next day walked back to get the car, a spectacular walk!

Beautiful location! Welcoming host with lots of effort. Place and furnishings on the older side but majority still functional. Bedroom situation was confusing. Was a surprise that there was an extra fee for use of extra bedroom. Fine for couples who share one room but for friends who wanted separate rooms, I would have preferred this fee to be included from the beginning.
A perfect example of old world country hospitality. Amazing touches, huge space and the best sleep I’ve  had in ages.
Jo was a lovely host.  You step back in time staying here and the beds could use an upgrade.  It was lovely and cool on a hot day.
Very cozy, clean and comfortable, in a beautiful location. Jo made us feel welcome and we enjoyed the true bed and breakfast experience 😊
Beautiful and peaceful location, place was very clean and very hospitable hosts. Very comfortable bed and the pool table available made for extra entertainment during the stay
A lovely retreat right in the heart of the Barossa. Great self catered breakfast and a full kitchen for eat in dinner, which was a pleasant surprise.
A wonderful place on a lovely rural setting.   Close to some of the Barossa's most famous wineries.   Well worth a visit.
Beautiful, relaxing and friendly feel. Jo made us feel very welcome and gave us great advice for sightseeing and dinner. Very comfortable and clean.  Definitely recommend for a relaxing getaway.
A quiet rural retreat close to a premier wine region with all it has to offer in wine, food and natural tourist attractions. Jo is a very friendly and helpful hostess.

Beautiful spot in the country amongst the farms, whilst still being very close to Angaston and all the Barossa wineries! The view out the bedroom window was lovely and we even spotted an owl in the evening. The breakfast supplies the next morning were great, especially the homemade marmalade!

Jo and Ian’s place was great. The living area is just like the photos, everything was clean and had everything you needed to cook up the farm fresh eggs we were provided with. Their property is the real bonus though. We loved our walk around the huge acreage seeing all of the sheep, vines and bird life. It’s was close enough to visit all the wineries by car. Overall great stay.

Lovely property with wonderful atmosphere and amenities.  The homestead is very clean, tidy and comfortable. We loved being able to walk around and see the vines and animals. Our hosts were helpful and kind.
Excellent place to stay whilst visiting the Barossa or a getaway from the city.
Jo was very welcoming. It’s a beautiful relaxed place, we will be back!
excellent cottage in the heart of the Barossa.
Jo and Ian thought of everything we could possibly need. Provided a generous breakfast with fresh eggs and homemade preserves and made us very welcome

Jo and Ian were very welcoming and are excellent hosts. They have a beautiful old style home. Our stay was for one night, we had breakfast left for us in the morning with home made honey biscuits which were delicious with my morning coffee!

We had a lovely stay at Jo & Ian’s place. Sparkling clean, v comfy bed and huge space to ourselves. Appreciated the thoughtful breakfast supplies and communication was fantastic. Angaston is a beautiful area and we definitely recommend this property to stay.
Wroxton Grange is set in a lovely heritage home . Peaceful scenic spot, clean and spacious accommodation.  The hosts were very welcoming.  Love to come back
Lovely B & B stay. Very classic and beautiful family home.

Really good location about 15 mins drive from everything you want to see/visit in the Barossa .
Car essential .
Old traditional style of accommodation with which we were very happy but don’t expect modern appliances .
Beautiful place, super cosy, so homely and relaxing
We had a lovely relaxing overnight stay. Loved the fire in the formal sitting room and Jo's honey biscuits.
Look forward to exactly what you'd expect from a farm house suit stay. We thought it was perfect.
Lovely stay at Wroxton Grange. Warm, cosy, comfortable. The little touches were also sweet. Location is quiet and you can truly unwind. Highly recommended!
Fantastic spot. Beautiful old home set amongst the most spectacular grounds.
Great location for our event at Yalumba. The breakfast provisions and home made ginger biscuits were lovely. Very comfortable stay.

For those seeking a txaste of Barossa/Eden Valley history, an insight into premium viticulture and local produce with completly amicable hosts could not recomend this more highly.
Old world charm and country hospitality as good as it gets.
The lovely Jo hosted us in her warm, inviting home. Jo was available and provided delicious breakfast provisions. Highly recommended.

Great spot, very secluded in Eden valley but only a short drive to all of Barossa Valley's tourist spots. Great hosts with fresh eggs, breakfast and orange juice served every morning. An actual B and B on a working farm and vineyard. Highly recommend

A stunningly beautiful and quintessential farmhouse that is over 100 years old. It is quiet in a rural setting. Close to Angaston town and many top quality vineyards. The bed and bedding was very comfortable and we slept incredibly well. Jo was a fabulous host and made sure we knew where everything was and made us feel very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again when we return to the Barossa.
The home was perfect for our situation, heating was fantastic.  Great size home for a large family or those wanting a bit of space.

A fantastic place with lots of space, just perfect for a group of friends, especially because all 3 rooms can be changed from 2 Singles to one king size bed... Very flexible. Our host was very accommodating about key Pickup outside business hours and we very much enjoyed the gas log fires. Excellent location just a couple of minutes from Angaston town centre, and very easy to find. Thanks!
Great clean, quiet, spacious place at a great location. Perfect for staying over and exploring Barossa.
The host canceled this reservation 197 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great location - very comfortable. thank you!
Nice house, good location
All lovely
Lovely location, close to great wineries and restaurants and it's a beautiful house.
Comfortable home in a secluded location

Summer’s house is a beautiful home, and an excellent location. We were able to find it with ease, and it is close to a range of dining options and shops. It is also in the heart of wine county and easy to get around. We had a lovely stay, and were greeted with a delicious drink on arrival!

A spotlessly clean house that is on a busy road just on the outskirts of Angaston. We were only given access to two bedrooms but I think there are three. Two very large and modern bathrooms, one with a bath, the other with a spa bath. An outside sitting area that feels a bit like sitting in a car park.
We had some check in difficulties, it wasn’t clear that we had to go to a nearby winery to get the key. The host kindly let us check in early but then we ran late getting to our function because of time trying to contact the host and getting the key.
No breakfast provisions, but a large kitchen.
Nice big house - two bathtubs! Lovely hosts at the winery around the corner.
A great accommodation with thoughtful touches and beautiful surroundings.
Great place to stay in close proximity to the lambert estate winery where we had a wedding. They gave us everything we need to have a comfortable stay. Thanks

Beautiful spot, the retreat was more than expected and catered for all our needs needs. Perfect place on a winter night. The Cellar Door and wines are amazing. We did not expect to find such a jem and a must to visit.

Nice quiet spot. Short drive everywhere
Heaps of space
Very comfortable place to stay, lots of room.
Just a stop over but turned out to be fantastic night.
Great location and value, very spacious with lovely light

Plenty of space and amenities in a great area of the Barossa.
Highly recommend.
Super convenient location to explore the Barossa.  The house is light filled and spatious, ideal for a large family or group.
Super cosy. The heating and bathrooms were amazing. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in the area
Lovely people and lovely stay, thanks so much :)

Great house, great location in the heart of the Barossa.

Perfect for a traveling group for events or a couple looking for a home base on their winery adventures.
Spacious, clean and convenient. Great amenities and beautiful views.

A lovely homestead with lots of space for relaxing. There are 2 full sized bathrooms, both with double sinks, as well as a full sized kitchen and 2 living areas. The back outdoor area looks onto a very young winery.

It is such a lovely location, convenient to the wineries and my only regret is not having more time to stay and experience.
Great location to the wineries and for anyone looking for a photography holiday day and astro night.  So nice to stoke the fire.
Nice cottage, in a good area with good amenity nearby.
Lovely cottage in the Barossa, perfect for a night getaway.
Nice place, fast internet but sad mobile coverage if that matters. Angaston farmers market just don road ( Sat mornings)
Beautifully maintained 1860’s stone cottage with all the modern comforts and a fantastic collection of antiques. Quiet and private too.
What a wonderful cottage , with great touches and very comfortable, highly recommended.
The place was great ... just as described. Highly recommend a stay at this charming little cottage.
Beautiful cottage with the perfect mix of rustic charm and creature comforts
Lovely cottage. Lots of charm.
A good place to relax and unwind.
Beautiful decor, felt like I took a step back in time. Wonderful piece of history
Charming property, well thought out and stocked with everything you would need for a perfect visit.
A wonderful experience in the Barossa, you will enjoy the area and seclusion at the same time. Such a great a place to stay.
It was nice and beautiful and relaxing and quiet

Charming and delightful cottage in a quiet and natural surrounds. Amazed at the number of antiquities furnishing the home and well maintained too, including an old wall-mounted fully functional rotary telephone! (My parents were especially marvelling with nostalgia at the antique Singer's sewing machine). Equipped with all the modern comforts you need, including very ample warm lighting. Very thoughtful and comprehensive information guides by the owner to guide you around the house + local attractions

Comfy and warm bed on a very cold night. Started the fire and the house was lovely and warm. Interesting memorabilia which really suited the house.  Lots of extras left by the host - bottle of wine, milk and bread and all the extras needed if you wanted to cook for yourself.  a lovely place to spend a few nights.

We were extremely happy with our first Airbnb and Barrosa Valley experience. The cottage is nestled in a little town in a tranquil setting, a quick drive into neighbouring towns to the farmers market (Saturday morning), restaurants and wineries. The cottage was cosy, with a woodfire and cute furnishings making it feel like an authentic cottage experience. Some lovely pieces of furniture and items to appreciate. Bedroom upstairs had a comfy bed. Modern conveniences were available (full kitchen, wifi, tv, coffee pod machine, heater, etc). Included light breakfast provisions. Had everything we needed. Plenty of suggestions provided for places to visit in the area. Owners communicated quickly to all messages. Easy check in/out. Happy to refer this property and
John’s cottage was so cute, quirky and cosy! Very easy to find and check in and a beautiful place to stay when visiting the Barossa!

A step back in time with many thoughtful touches. We loved exploring the house and all its bits and bobs from the past!! Gorgeous cottage!
Higher end of the price range.
We absolutely loved our stay! The cottage is styled completely with local antiques. It was a great little touch to our Barossa trip!

We enjoyed our stay in Moculta, chasing family history. The cottage was very warm and comfortable, and well equipped. John was a very responsive host and added significant value to our stay. Thank you!

Beautiful little cottage with lots of thoughtful touches and historical pieces, it’s like walking back in time.
Loved our stay!
Cosy cottage only 10 mins from Angaston. Clean and comfortable with quirky deco.
Beautiful cottage in striking distance to all the major Barossa attractions.
The cottage is like a little time capsule with interesting vintage pieces and gadgets. We really enjoyed our stay here and it was easy to drive to different wineries from here.
Lemke Cottage is lovely. It has a wonderful homely vibe and is a visual treat with all the beautiful timber furniture and wire work. The upstairs bedroom is my favourite room.
Thoughtful touches everywhere. Every need anticipated. Great stay in a quirky cosy home. Would love to stay again in winter.

John’s cottage is so cute and a super authentic old country house. It is filled with beautiful heritage ornaments and artefacts, is super clean and has great facilities! We had a lovely time relaxing in the house in between visiting wineries and restaurants :)
Fantastic period property, very clean, comfortable and lovely touches from John. Would recommend and will be back.
It is very quiet

Beautiful rustic historic cottage in idyllic, private, peaceful area. Perfect for a couple or two couples wanting to enjoy an adventure in the Barossa. Great home base. Nearest shops are located in Angaston.

It was a chilly day, but the heater was already on for us, so the house and the upstairs bedroom were toasty when we arrived. The chilly weather turned into a pretty serious storm, but Lemke Cottage is so well built and maintained that there were no cold draughts; the house didn't even creak in the wind! We built a fire in the combustion heater from the well-stocked kindling and woodpile, and weathered the storm with some port. So comfortable and well-appointed.

The kitchen had everything needed for breakfast. There's a gas stove and double oven if you want to cook more, though we took advantage of the local restaurants: Fermentasian (fantastic!) and Fino at Seppeltsfield (quite good). The sunken bathtub and shower had plenty of hot hot water, and the bathroom has a laundry and tumble dryer, so we could even dry and fluff our towels.

Moculta is a beautiful little hamlet, with kookaburras at dawn, rosellas and fairy wrens, so we enjoyed a lazy morning with the birdsong. Wish we could have stayed much longer.
Can HIGHLY recommend, do it!!!

A unique and truly perfect cottage experience in the Barossa. The loft is as warm and comfortable as it is gorgeous! Little treats left were such a kind touch and we are so glad we spent our first family night in the Barossa here. Thank you!

John's place is a quiet retreat filled with wonderful items from the past. The location is great to visit anything in the Barossa Valley. Checkin was very easy. There is ducted heating, as well as a combustion heater which is in the formal dining area. The open fire place in the lounge area is not operational. There are plenty of other heaters if needed. The loft stays warmer than downstairs at night time. The bed was very comfy - ensured a great nights sleep. continental breakfast provided was generous, with  tea/hot chocolate and a coffee machine. Kitchen fit out excellent. The bath was great, the shower we could not get to give us a consistent good flow of warm water.  Very clean and tidy. Great communicaton.
Lovely historic characterful cottage. Warm and cosy in the wild weather we had while staying there. Good communication with John too. Recommend.
Absolutely lovely stay, quaint and clean in beautiful and peaceful surroundings, a really unique experience!
Lovely cottage in a great location.  Thoughtful and considerate hosts.
lovely old world home, authentic decorations & furniture. Very comfortable & close to vineyards & towns
We had a great stay at Johns cosy cottage. It was perfect to come back to after work to unwind and relax.
The place was like a museum - gorgeous and so much to discover! Great location also to go and do wine tasting and visit markets. Thank you for letting us stay!

This is a charming house with many decorative items from the historic era of the house. John and Jan were excellent hosts, providing thoughtful touches including biscuits to go with our tea and a charging station with apple and android leads.

Wonderful cottage with a lot of thoughtful touches like breakfast, coffee + many other surprises. Very cosy with many heating options too & every appliance you could possibly need to use. Would definitely come back!

Lemke Cottage is a very cosy and comfortable place to stay in the winter. Perfect for two couples. The house was very clean and well equiped and our host was very responsive and communicative to my queries. It’s located in a small Barossa village but close to many of the main wineries and attractions. There is a small but interesting arts trail in the village of Moculta itself, not far from the cottage. We’ll worth a visit.
If you are looking for a weekend away in a beautiful Cottage make sure you check out the Lemke Cottage.
Great little spot.  John was very accommodating.

Was a fantastic stay at Kym’s place! Awesome location, rooms were very spacious & had very large beds. Definitely recommend for anyone looking to explore the Barossa Valley Winery’s. Also love the in-house coffee maker!

The apartment was in a fabulous location, very clean and everything that we (4adults) needed. It was very well set up and suited 2 couples. A lovely short walk to the cafes and perfect for getting about the Barossa.
Communication with Kym was very quick, professional and efficient.

Seriously brilliant stay. Anthony (filling in for Alicia whilst she was away) did a top job with recommendations and the 'room' was actually an apartment. Extremely comfy bed, fantastic shower and a zero degrees plunge pool to get rid of the hangover :)

Couldn't recommend highly enough.

Vintner's is a 4 minute drive away for the farmer's market and a fantastic dinner, if you're over Barossa wines there's a great little authentic Italian place across the bridge from the White House and you can walk to the bike rental place which is directly opposite the bike trail. You can cycle to a number of wineries from there.

Top trip. Thanks again.

Matt and Bryony
Great spot for a weekend away! Accommodation was modern and very comfortable. Very friendly hosts. Highly recommended!

Comfiest bed! Great location!
We loved our stay at Alicia's place, the house is beautiful and clean. Definitely would recommend anyone to stay here! We will be coming back on our next visit!
Tony was fantastic in making us feel welcome, recommending local eatery's and points of interest. Excellent service.

Anthony & Alicia are great hosts and made us feel welcome and right at home from the start.  Being our first time in the Barossa we appreciated the information they provided on places to visit and where to eat. The rooms were just as described with plenty of space to move around.   Loved the king bed which was so comfortable.  Everything we needed for our stay was provided.  Angaston is such a lovely town and the White House has a commanding view over the park.  Would highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone visiting the Barossa.

We had a fantastic stay in the Barossa White House. Alicia and Anthony made us feel welcome from the first minute, and provided us with great info about the local area.
The accommodation was beautiful, and our hosts provided us with some additional extras which made the stay even nicer!
We will definitely stay here again. 5 stars!

Had an amazing time staying at the Barossa White House. Excellent central location for jump of point to see the cellar doors and valley. Great friendly hosts who recommenced some amazing local restaurants and cafes. Highly recommend for a weekend in SA's best wine region.

Alicia and Anthony were the perfect hosts. They made us feel very welcome and were very thoughtful offering us suggestions of where to go and what to do. I would 100% recommend their place to stay which is also in a great location close to all the wineries.

Very spacious accommodation located within short walk to Angaston town. Alicia was out of town but Anthony was a very welcoming and accommodating host, providing us with an esky and picnic basket for our drives around the Barossa as soon as we asked. A great base to travel around the Barossa.
a very enjoyable & relaxing stay. Anthony was a wonderful host, very helpful with suggestions of local eateries. Our rooms were very cosy & clean. Hope to stay again on our next visit to the Barossa!
The White House is a lovely BnB place in centre of Angaston with easy access to everything Barossa has to offer. The hosts are lovely and the pool is a great bonus.

We had an absolutely amazing time here! Alicia and Anthony were great hosts, super lovely and extremely helpful. They essentially helped us plan our stay, and even went out of their way to make dinner reservations for us.
Their place is absolutely stunning, very comfortable, spacious and very clean. It is quite central to all of the top rated restaurants and winery's, and the neighbourhood overall is also gorgeous.
Their backyard area was also stunning, sitting just behind a winery, and the pool was a great bonus!
Highly recommend this place!!

We loved our stay in the White House West Wing. Alicia and Anthony were very gracious hosts - the perfect mix of helpful advice and respecting our privacy. The accommodation is modern, clean and perfectly set out for an Airbnb rental. We especially enjoyed the walk-in shower with large shower rose and the comfortable lounge complete with Netflix. A true Barossa gem!
We had a great stay in the Barossa, and the unit with pool was great respite from the heat. Super comfy bed too!

We loved everything about our stay at the white house. From the warm welcome, to the great tips for restaurants, wineries and places to visit, it was a truly memorable stay. It made our trip to the Barossa all the more special.
The pool was amazing to cool down and relax on the hot days.
The place was big and comfortable, lovely clean bathroom and facilities, great tv and wifi.
The bottle of wine to welcome us was a lovely touch.
There's also a wealth of information and recommendations for what to see and do in the area.
We can't recommend the White house more highly! Alicia and Anthony are great hosts. Unbeatable value.

It was such a great get away destination with wonderful hosts. If you’re stuck on what to do, they have plenty of ideas and suggestions to share. Location was great also, just a short walk to the main street and entrance to a bike/walking trail. We would highly recommend if you’re looking for an easy, relaxing and beautiful stay in the Barossa!
Very close to local shops and wineries. Alicias recommendations were all fantastic and the accommodation was spotless. Lovely hosts in a beautiful setting.

Alicia was a wonderful host and made sure we had everything we needed, from restaurant recommendations to breakfast and clean cutlery. Our accommodation was very comfortable and had plenty of entertainment options. Outstanding hospitality!

Expect a very classy place. It's just a couple of minutes' walk to the middle of Angaston. Alicia (your host) is just fantastic - you'll fell like you've known her for a long time after just a few minutes. Can't recommend this place highly enough./
Great hosts at a great location. We really enjoyed our time here and loved the fresh baked bread!
Fantastic place to stay - very warm and wonderful hosts and a great location.  What more can we say but we'll be back
Lots of things to love about apartment 2. Great location, great pool and outdoor areas and a very clean, tidy and comfortable indoor area.

This is a lovely place, with all the mod-coms you'd ant. Induction stove, in-built coffee machine (a little challenging to work out how to use but once we did - yum), an entertainment area although we didn't use the TV, etc. Check-in was easy - ring and get given a code for a lock box with the key.
Beautiful little apartment. Perfect for our stay. Central to the wineries and nice and warm in a cold, rainy night.

Happy with the accommodation. Not happy with the beds. I asked for a King, and got 2 Very Slim single mattresses pushed together. The linen reminded me of a Hospital linen in the 1930's. I just thought that if the bedding was up to scratch, it is worth the price. But i didn't get any sleep at all, my wife and i slept in separate beds because of the beds being way under what you would expect.!! Budget sleeping accommodation.!
Great location. Great setup. Definite for those who want to see the Barossa
Great location, fantastic host, cosy little place to enjoy!!

We loved our stay in our townhouse. It was so close and within stumbling distance to restaurants and eateries.

Check in process was easy and we enjoyed eating at Musque on Kyms recommendation.

The only comment: the mattresses are in need of an update.
Great place and location. Would definitely recommend.

Thank you for the stay. Great location amazing property. Welcoming host.

See you again in the future.
Alicia was as welcoming as possible. The place was very clean and the beds very comfortable.
Great place for a couple the town at night is delightful. Lovely hosts and location.

We had a great time staying at the White House in Angaston.

The accommodation was excellent and both Alicia and Anthony were attentive hosts.

It was also just a few minutes walk to the restaurants and eateries in Angaston.

We will definitely stay again and it is a great B&B to spend a couple of days when visiting the wineries of the Barossa.

A wonderful house. We had a group of 12 and there was so much room for all of us. The kitchen was perfect for cooking for the large group and we had a wonderful stay. Planning a trip back for the wintertime and would absolutely recommend

Great place, no issues, basic supplies good. Big house, rather sound proof.
Thanks for that

The house is in a good location with easy walking access into Tanunda.

We picked it because it had plenty of rooms. We did not realise it also splits into separate rents if required.
For our stay all doors were unlocked so the units flowed.

Old / antique décor - an interesting place to stay.

Would recommend booking the wine tour through the house too.

Thank you Kym for a wonderful stay in the most beautiful house in Tanunda.  All the communication from the day I booked the house (and then accidently cancelled it) and then to the purchase of the food processor so we could make our pumpkin soup on the first night, was fantastic.  Response was always quick.  The house was beautiful, everything that we required was there and and in plentiful supply.  If we ever stay in the Barossa again we would have no hesitation in staying there again!.  Thank you so much again.

Would highly, highly recommend this accommodation if staying in the Barossa. we stayed with a large group (13) for a 60th birthday and the setting could not have been more perfect!The house was beautiful and spacious and we were more than comfortable in the beautiful setting.. it was truely an amazing experience!

Walking distance to shops for a little bit of retail therapy or relaxing in a cute little cafe for a coffee.. but far enough out of the Main Street to have a lots of privacy!

We also made use of their bus transfer services to get to and from Hentley Farm restaurant and the bus drive Bob was an absolute delight!

10/10 for the accommodation
and
10/10 for the bus driver and service!!
Good location and great for big groups

What a fantastic house!  Lovely original features, huge rooms with high ceilings and a great layout that allows everyone their own space.  The pool looked lovely although we were too busy to test it out.  Great location on the high street as well.
It was an incredible experience to stay in such a great house that fited large group of people
Great!

A great property for large groups with plenty of space, bathrooms and privacy.  The open fire was welcome of a winter evening with a glass of red and local cheese platter. Walking distance to everything in Tanunda and only 10minutes from anything else you might want to do in the region.
Wonderful house
Smooth communication, great house and great location. We absolutely loved staying with Kym.
Awesome house for such a large group of people and amenities were perfect. Air cons in every room which were welcomes due to heat. Walking distance to great cafes/shops/chemist etc- we loved our stay
A fabulous house in a fabulous spot. the prepared open fire was unexpected and a great touch. The access, beds, linen, kitchen, facilities all top notch. We had a large group of 12 with no hassles.

A great place to book. Myself and my work colleagues booked the Barossa Valley Dreams home for a 2 day leadership retreat and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The accommodation was spacious and each room was very comfortable. The building itself was super grand! Communication and check in was a breeze. Highly recommended
Great place to stay.  We’ll be back.

Maria's house is stunning.  A true holiday house - spacious, beautiful and homely.  The bottle of wine and breakfast supplies were a generous supply.  Outdoor dining looking over some vines was stunning in the warm evenings.  We were there to cycle the Barossa trail and the house was well positioned for us to achieve that.  Many thoughtful touches to the house including magazines and kids toys.  Highly recommended.
Great location, beautifully fitted out house with easy access to the whole Barossa area
A beautiful place to stay and enjoy what the Barossa has to offer. Wonderful hospitality with breakfast supplied.

Amazing house, lots of character. Comfy, quiet and peaceful. Vinyl collection is a bonus!
I recommend it!

Casa Rossa is a great space. Definitely feels like a stylish, contemporary home rather than a cold holiday place top sleep. Great beds, movies and cd's, good provisions and all of the utensils to cook. Highly recommended.

Definitely a 5 star host! Communicative, clean, responsive while being incredibly friendly. Couldn't ask for a better host! I would be happy to recommend Maria's place to all my friends and family we can't wait to return. We had an awesome time.

A really wonderful country location with great bird life. Quiet but so close to so many great wineries and restaurants. The house has been modernised to a high standard and was spotlessly clean. The welcome pack was very comprehensive and saved us doing any food shopping. An unexpected bonus was a visit from a family of kangaroos on our second evening.

Great place, well located, fantastic outdoor eating area and vineyard gave a truly Tuscan feel to the place. Many interesting and novel touches and more food provided than we could eat. Well done, nothing could be faulted and highly recommended.

We stayed at Casa Rosa for three nights. It was wonderful. The location is close to the town, but private, with a lovely outdoor dining area, over looking a vineyard. The bird life was magnificent and kangaroos visited the garden. We found the house exceptionally well equipped with beautiful high quality crockery and cooking equipment. There was a very generous welcome pack. The bedrooms were very comfortable with good quality linen, the bathrooms had great walk in showers and nice toiletries. We watched films together in the evening on the comfy sofa.  We would love to return for a longer stay. Highly recommended, you could not fail to enjoy this lovely house.
Casa Rossa was a perfect weekend get away! Lots of thoughtful touches, great communication and perfect location!

Fabulous home in the Barossa.

We loved everything about this Airbnb stay. Thoughtful provisions were left for our arrival, including bread and spreads, milk, OJ, snacks, and sparkling wine ready to chill. The house is tastefully renovated and well maintained, and appointed to a high standard throughout. We loved the many “extras” available including toys for the kids, board games, the vinyl record collection and turntable and the open log fire. We slept well in the comfy beds.

The house is located in a secluded location with its own small vineyard. Our only disappointment was that we couldn’t stay for longer!
Beautiful place to base yourself while you explore the Barossa

I highly recommend Maria’s place if you are looking for a quiet get away or somewhere to stay near the Barossa area. The house was stunning and extremely clean. Maria additionally provided a very generous amount of breakfast supplies and wine and chocolate on arrive. Cannot fault our experience or this house.

An Absolute 10/10
A very large well appointed home, beautifully furnished and great personal touches. We greatly appreciated the trouble the hosts had gone to with a lovely bottle of wine waiting for us on the kithcen bench, if that wasnt enough there was also an ample carafe of port to enjoy whilst relaxing next to the fire place after a long day exploring the Barossa. Fully ducted air con kept the place warm and cozy. Wonderful rural position,secluded and peaceful yet close to shops at Lyndoch and easy access to wineries. The outdoor area is amazing youd swear you're in Italy, surrounded by vineyards and great views over the Barossa Plenty of stocks for brekkie and a little treat for those with a sweet tooth was much appreciated. Maria is a wonderful host and has local managers to assist with anything you need, they were great to deal with and prompt with their replies. Will definitely be back, thank you Maria we had an amazing stay.
Staying at Maria's was an absolute pleasure, and if I ever return to the Barossa, I know where I'll stay.
Great place.

A delightful stay in a spotlessly clean home with everything you would need to cook, BBQ, sit outside,  and look over the hills and vines on the property. The fireplace at night created a perfect ambience. A  great location for exploring the Barossa.

Wow surrounded by cellar doors.
Must pick one...or two...well three
Then home to the fire place to finish off the day
An amazing house for our weeks’ stay in the Barossa, can’t wait to return❤️

A very memorable first trip to the Barossa Valley!!
We visited the Barossa Valley with another couple. We were all first time travelers to the Barossa and did we ever luck out when we chose Maria's place. It was the first time I've booked an Airbnb where the pictures and description did not do justice to what we experienced. To create that perfect first impression, Maria had left us a beautiful "welcome basket". The location was perfect. We could drive to anywhere in the Barossa and Eden Valleys in 20-25 minutes or less. We hiked in the mornings at nearby conservation areas, toured several top notch wineries in the afternoons, and BBQ'd and ate 'al fresco' on the terrace while watching the sunsets in the evenings. Our wives had a very relaxing and enjoyable experience at a Spa in nearby Gawler as well. One evening we even had some kangaroos visit us right in the backyard! An enthusiastic two thumbs up from all four of us!

Casa Rossa was the perfect Barossa base for our party of 2 couples.

Stylish, comfortable and really well equipped with more bacon, eggs, juice etc in the breakfast pack than we could possibly eat in 4 days!

Lovely, quiet, cosy, elegant home that we would love to return to and 100% recommend to anyone looking for a perfect, central but private base for a wonderful Barossa experience.

Great house, very clean, lovely towels and linen, nice little touches like wine and breakfast provisions. You do need a car but shops and wineries all within a short drive. We loved the peace and quiet!

We had a great week at this house, it’s in the perfect position for exploring the Barossa. It was quiet and private, plenty of space for six, very clean and comfortable and had everything we needed to self cater. Views across the vineyard towards to hills. The breakfast provisions were a lovely touch!

We had a fantastic time staying at Casa Rossa, loved the location and the house. So close to a lot of the wineries and beautiful scenery. Especially loved the morning and evening visits of the wallabies.

Lovely house with great facilities.  So much food provided as part of the welcome hamper that we could not possibly eat it all.  Wine was a lovely touch and we enjoyed the visits from the local Kangaroos.  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the Barossa

Such a great little gem in Lyndoch! Had everything we needed for our stay. Lovely bottle of wine on arrival was a nice surprise. A glass of red by the open fire made our stay. Plus the kangaroos were a great treat for the kids
This a fabulous place to stay. Extremely comfortable, well appointed, accessible to allthe Barossa has to offer. Excellent communication. Highly recommended - we had a fantastic time.

Casa Rossa is an absolutely beautiful house in the perfect location to explore the Barossa Valley. The house was sparkling clean and the hosts were lovely enough to leave us with complementary breakfast and a bottle of port! My friends and I were thoroughly impressed and we look forward to returning in the near future. Thanks again!
I highly recommend Maria’s place it is very very comfortable,generously appointed includes full breakfast more than enough for our needs,great views with serenity

Casa Rossa is a fantastic place.  It is situated in the heart of the Barossa so you can base yourself there and plan wonderful day trips to many of the wonderful little towns & vineyards throughout the Barossa Valley.  The house was spotlessly clean, the breakfast supplies plentiful, the beds extremely comfortable.  As it was still cool at night, we made a beautiful open fire which was the perfect way to relax with the wonderful wines we purchased.  Equally as nice on a warmer evening would be to sit outside taking in the vines & view, peace & quiet of the Casa Rossa surrounds.  I would totally recommend staying at Casa Rossa, it was a wonderful way to start off a few days R&R.

This is the perfect house for families or groups looking for a comfortable home away from home in easy reach to many wineries. Lots of space for the kids to play outside as well as some toys and books inside, which were a big hit with our toddler. The breakfast provisions and bottle of wine were absolutely lovely and very handy to have after a long drive. The fire place kept us warm of an afternoon as we sat and enjoyed the view over the yard. Would stay again.
A beautiful place to stay. A lovely home, great hospitality, and incredibly thoughtful touches throughout the visit. Could not recommend more highly.
Gorgeous place, perfect for 2 couples or more as there is plenty of space
Great location and house with some nice touches with breakfast and a bottle of wine provided. House was very clean and well appointed with a nice outlook.

Maria’s house was a pleasure to stay in, it is tastefully decorated, clean and located well. We really appreciated the food items on arrival. We would recommend Maria’s house to anybody who would like to stay in the Barossa region.

A gorgeous, stylish home in a beautiful quiet location, close to many of the wonderful wineries that the Barossa has to offer. We really appreciated the breakfast provisions and complimentary wine, chocolates and port. Looking forward to coming back again in the near future.
Very clean and lovely outlook. We even had afternoon visits from a couple of local wallabies. Highly recommend!
Such a beautiful home with a lot of thoughtful touches

Very comfortable house, spacious and well laid out. We enjoyed the complimentary Casa Rossa wine (a Grenache and a very nice drop). The kids enjoyed the toys and teddy cupboard. Good location, close enough to the centre of Lyndoch but with a feel of being in a rural setting.
Great place to stay. Highly recommended
Beautifully decorated house in a lovely area.  The house was lovely and warm for a winter stay and had all the items we needed for our family stay.  Perfectly situated to enjoy the Barossa

Nice comfortable place to stay, Communication was easy and quick. Walk distance to some great wineries. Bedrooms are comfortable and kitchen is well-equipped. Nice vineyard a step from front door. Beautiful view of the valley. It’s a little bit noisy in the main bedroom while the air con was on. And The hot water tank is a bit small, had to wait for hot water overnight. Overall, it’s a great place to stay with couple of friends. Would go again.

Casa Rossa is a perfect base for a Barossa short or long stay. It would make a great retreat for a couple, family or even group with it’s three bedrooms, two lounge areas, large dining table and delightful kitchen space. The records were an absolute treat. The entire space was modern and stylish but with beautiful character driven and historical touches that added a lovely sense of charm. We woke up to a kangaroo with a Joey in it’s pouch outside our bedroom window the first morning there and had lovely kangaroo visitors through the vines in the afternoons as well. The fire was a perfect space for a cosy evening after a brilliant day of vineyard touring and tasting. The breakfast provisions were substantial and the extra gift of wine and chocolate added such a thoughtful touch. It was a comforting enough to feel like a home away from home, but well thought out enough to feel like a wonderful holiday. We highly recommend this property and the swift and friendly communication of Maria. My daughter was thrilled to find the toys in her room and I was thrilled to find the coffee pods! Enjoy your stay in a lovely Lyndoch gem

Lovely house and thoughtfully provided breakfast options and complimentary wine.
Would stay again!

Absolutely perfect house for anyone wanting to get away to the barossa. Everything you need and more. Would highly recommend to anyone.
Thanks again.

Fantastic stay for my wife’s birthday. Group of 6 stayed for 3 nights and loved every minute of it. The Roos visiting at dusk whilst we enjoyed some Shiraz was a highlight. House is full of personality well equipped and well cleaned throughout.
Perfect stay with plenty of space for 6 guests.
We stayed at Maria’s house due to working in the area and would gladly recommend it nice part of the country perfect place to stay and explore
Nice place,relaxing environment,nice touches such as complimentary wine & provisions for breakfast.

Maria's place is clean, tidy and located in a quiet location. Waking up in the money to kangaroos between the vines is always a great way to start your day.

Its a great location to spend your week in the Barossa at as it is conveniently located near some of the best wineries. The space is large with plenty of break out areas and would work best for groups of 4-6.

I would highly recommend Maria's place for people that are looking to stay in the Barossa.

Beautiful house, has everything you need and very stylish!

Good location

Host is excellent

Great accommodation, beautiful setting, everything we’d hoped for!
Highly recommend !
Beautiful home for our country stay! Loved the interior, it was extremely comfortable and the house had all the things we needed!
Fantastic property with some very clever touches and quality beds. Our hosts went over and above to ensure we were comfortable and had an enjoyable stay. Couldn't recommend this property enough.
Maria’s place was exceptional - such a great couple of days exploring the Barossa valley!

Fantastic place to stay in the Barossa valley, ideal central location, beautiful setting and surroundings. The house was clean and well stocked with supplies, especially in the kitchen and the place felt much larger than the photos suggested. Easy and quick communication with the host, Maria - thank you. We would definitely return to stay if/when we are in SA again.

Says something about the place when the best part of each day - and of our visit to the Barossa Valley - was coming home to nestle in the coziness and comfort of Casa Rossa and the warmth of a toasty fireplace.
The place was fantastic and exceeded expectations. Nice location, spacious and a few great homely touches that made our stay great. Thanks again to Maria
Great place to stay in the Barossa - well presented and clean, roomy house. Very comfortable stay.

The house was lovely, and we would definitely stay here again. We booked this home for a family stay for my father's 70th. We were welcomed with a personalised card and a bottle of wine and some chocolates. It was a really nice touch and we enjoyed the delicious wine on our first night under the stars out in the alfresco dining area. The photos don't do it justice, the house is lovely, warm and homely, yet beautifully styled. The communication was excellent and Maria recommended some great restaurants, wineries and cafes for us to try. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, thank you again Maria.
Great quiet and private location and a fantastic house, would definitely recommend for a family group looking to visit the Barossa Valley and stay close to the local wineries.
Great spot for a few days in the Barossa region. Incredibly spacious. Really well-stocked and excellent communication throughout our stay. Thanks for making it such a memorable trip!
Amazing place! Very spacious and comfortable. We had a great time. Thanks Maria
Such a pleasure to stay. Thanks for making the trip so special with such a fantastic base to stay at.
A great place for a quiet, relaxing getaway. Close enough to the great restaurants and cellar doors in Lyndoch. Lovely outlook onto the vineyard.

The post on Airbnb says it all. Actually Casa Rossa is even better! It is quite a luxurious home away from home with everything provided. If you don‘t like comfort, tranquility, lavish vineyard views then you should stay home.  Casa Rossa is handy to everything the Barossa Valley has to offer. I would return in a heartbeat.

This place was a great stay for our family trip to the Barossa. Although it was only four of us, there was still lots of room to have another family and not feel crowded. The bathrooms are renovated and feel modern while the rest of the house has a classic feel to it. The kitchen had everything that we needed including utensils, paper towel, wraps etc.
We will definitely stay here again on our next trip and bring another family.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The layout is great and the location is in a beautiful quiet area.
Kitchen is well stocked with all the necessary utensils. Very comfortable.

What a beautiful Airbnb to stay at for a girls weekend away! It was very neat & tidy making for a relaxing weekend. Maria has gone above & beyond providing guests with complimentary breakfast & local wine. Couldn’t recommend it enough! Thank you for making our stay in the Barossa so memorable.
Great accomodation in an easy location for exploring the region. Appreciated all the extra touches like the complimentary breakfast and wine.

We had a great stay at Casa Rossa with our 5yo daughter. This modern farmhouse is spacious, clean, quiet, and beautifully furnished and decorated. We really loved the modern bathrooms (the shower products were lovely too) and the super comfy bed. The location was also great being close to cellar doors in the BV region.

Amazing outdoor setting that we didn’t get the chance to use due to the wet weather. But we thoroughly enjoyed the views of the private vineyard from the kitchen and even spotted a kangaroo hopping past. The fully equipped kitchen also comes with plenty of cooking pots and pans to whip a lovely family meal.

Special touches such as a complimentary bottle of wine + chocolates awaiting us, a cupboard full of fun board games to play, and the night lights along the long hallway and in the bathroom (very thoughtful especially for family with young children) were all appreciated.

Overall a wonderful experience. This place had everything you need for a comfortable stay.
Great experience staying at this beautiful house. Location was great but the the main highlight was the warmth the house provided.

Perfect for 2 or a group. Great location being close to everything but a private spot. Why stay in a cramped little place when you can have this full house. Excellent clean kitchen and bathrooms. If you enjoy a bath then you will love the one here. It’s huge. Comfortable beds and everything you need is here.

Magnificent! A beautiful home, a convenient location and a truly fabulous host! Accommodation exceeded our expectations and the place was sparkling clean! Every little detail was thought of! Would absolutely recommend and will visit again when next in the Barossa! You won’t be disappointed!
Beautiful house on a beautiful estate. I was also staying there for work but would definitely return for some RR

Casa Rossa is a great accommodation for one or two families. Loved the location as it is very close to all the local wineries. We even spotted a kangaroo and a rabbit during our stay. The kitchen is well stocked and the bedding linen are top quality. The showers are renovated. There is a big stock of  board games to enjoy time indoors too. Overall we loved  this accommodation and recommend it as a great place  to stay for anyone visiting Lyndoch.

We had such a wonderful stay in April. A beautiful home in a fantastic location. The attention to detail was shown throughout the house, from the decor and little luxuries scattered around the house to the Netflix and apple tv access.

The kitchen is fully stocked, making the breakfast cook up a breeze. Oh, and the breakfast provisions, what a bounty!

With fantastic restaurants and cafes at our doorstep it was everything we could have asked for and more from a weekend in the Barossa.

We look forward to staying again, thanks from the Carraghers and the Nunans
Beautiful new maxing large house right in thecenzerif tanun

Bilyara house was fantastic. The house was homely, comfortable, clean & technologically well appointed with internet & entertainment options.
We had the most beautiful breakfast ingredients of locally sourced product; who knew mushrooms could taste that good.
The house is right in the centre of town and a 2 minute walk from the 2 best restaurants in town (1918 & Ferment Asian - best to book in advance.
We visited the Langmeil & Peter Lehmann wineries & The Barossa Valley Brewery, in a 20-30 minutes walking distance from the house.
This is the perfect House if you are staying in Tanunda. Enjoy!!
A fabulous house in a great location. Spotlessly clean. Loved the beautiful breakfast provisions from local suppliers.

This house is fabulous, it is in the best location possible, close to everything you could need and across the road from the best Asian fusion restaurant I have been to in a long time!! The house was exceptionally clean and the beds had beautiful linen and were super comfy! If you enjoy cooking the kitchen  has every utensil you need and a large oven to prepare a feast! I would not hesitate to book this place again especially knowing how well stocked everything is!
Such a gorgeous place. Lovely kind hosts and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommend it!!!!!

Bilyara House is an absolutely wonderful place to stay. It's a block from Tanunda, my favorite of the towns in the Barossa Valley, and close to many restaurants, wineries, and vineyards. The house is decorated in an adorable retro style and has everything one could need. The breakfast fixings were amazing addition to an already lovely stay (thanks, Andy!). My family and I hope to visit again one day!

What an absolute gem! Andy and Natalie were wonderful hosts and their home is absolutely gorgeous! All of the special touches, the amazing smorgasbord of a breakfast they left for us...I could keep going but you really should experience it for yourself! Highly recommend this place!

What a wonderful property in the heart of Tanunda!
Wonderfully appointed with with everything you could ever need for your stay.
We spent fantastic nights enjoying the wonderful open fireplace and beautifully appointed rooms.
Fantastic hosts to liaise with and we absolutely loved the delicious supplies left for breakfast.
Can't wait to return again! What a wonderful home away from home.

Such a gorgeous home, within walking distance of restaurants and stores. Had it been summer the backyard area would have been absolutely fantastic! Andy and Natalie were wonderful, and the finishing touches really made it a special getaway. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a special stay in the Barossa.

My 2 friends and I had a wonderful stay at Bilyara house. The location couldn't have been any better. Close to wineries and restaurant's and everything else the Barossa has to offer. The house itself was awesome so well decked out with everything we needed. Beds were great and it was a wonderful home away from home. Thank you so much
Bilyara House was beautifully restored and had everything we needed and more. I would highly recommend this property for any family or group enjoying exploring the Barossa.
Bilyara House was great!  Close to everything, clean and very comfortable. And the owners were incredibly helpful. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa.

What a perfect weekend!
I visited Tanunda with a group of girlfriends to celebrate my 30th birthday and Andy and Natalie went above and beyond to make our trip unforgettable.
We arrived to welcome champagne, a birthday cake, balloons and a card. There was the most amazing breakfast spread on offer - some of Barossa's finest produce - as well as toiletries and other amenities.
The house itself was big and beautiful The decor was trendy and we felt so at home, immediately. It was a great space to spend a girls weekend away!
There were two big bathrooms which made getting ready quite easy. (Even for 8 females!)
I also should mention the beautiful outdoor area where we enjoyed our breakfast in the sunshine.
Location wise it is 10/10. We walked to the supermarket and some wine bars. We hired bikes and cycled from the house to many wineries around Tanunda as well.
I would definitely stay at Bilyara house again and I would 100% recommend it to other guests.
Thank you so much for being outstanding hosts Andy and Natalie!!!

What an amazing house  Bilyara is ! Not only are Andy & Natalie the perfect hosts it's the little touches that make it perfection . The house is so centrally located that you can walk to wineries /cellar doors and restaurants . Couldn't have asked for anything better . Will definitely go back and highly recommend .

Andy's place is a great house well located in the middle of town. It is spacious and well equiped with a gorgeous art deco feel.
Thanks for a great stay.
This place was great!  Food was well catered and beds were very comfortable.  Very close to the main street, will everything nearby!  Would stay here again!

This place was perfection on many levels. It’s location can’t be beat and the house has so many great qualities. The breakfast that Andy left for us was a lovely touch also for the lazy mornings after touring the Barossa. We hope to be back again!

Well equipped and as advertised. Spoke to Andy upon arrival and he was very helpful amd informative. Set in the centre of town and walking distance to all attractions in town. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone looking to have a base whilst exploring the Barossa
Thank you for an amazing stay, so much space and amazing outdoor entertaining area. So close to everything in Tanunda!
Perfect location, stunning house, highly recommend. Will be back.
Great location, lots of nice touches, great amenities, lovely house and great outdoor space. A wonderful place to stay
Thanks for a wonderful stay and especially for the family friendly touches ref: cots and well stocked fridge. We had a wonderful stay in the Barossa. Thanks again. Derek
Wow what a great stay! Perfect location and the house was lovely! The hosts went out of their way to provide value and great service! Excellent breaky provisions and condiments. Highly recommend

Bilyara house was lovely. The amazing baskets of food and condiments were scrumptious.
our hosts were always on hand when we needed anything . Beds were super comfy. We were right in the centre of Tanunda so walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. We loved our stay and will be back.
Beautiful house renovated to maintain the original charm and beautifully styled. Fantastic location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will defiantly be back.
A perfectly located and appointed home for exploring the Barossa.
Thanks so much! Loved your place and all the special touches! Felt like home.
Fantastic
Absolutely amazing  - we were so happy with our stay! Your small touches did not go unnoticed. Location is outstanding!

Bilyara house is in the heart of Tanunda. The home was clean and very comfortable with loads of xtra little touches in the way of provisions for breakfast, a lovely decanter of Port for after dinner.
Superbly fitted out and in an excellent quiet location.
Would recommend this stay definitely.

Brilliant home with everything you will need for a wonderful stay. We enjoyed the location, a hop skip and a jump from the main street where all the restaurants are. Also close to the wineries, right in the heart of it and my favorite restaurant 1918 is over the fence. The house is really well thought out and Andy and Natalie have made sure to make their guests very welcome. Beds are comfy, linen is excellent quality. Really appreciated the extras like breakfast including eggs, bacon, mushrooms, OJ, fresh bread, milk, cheese all fresh right from the Borossa... the list goes on. Over all this home is highly recommended!!!
Great location. Super clean and excellent communication.

I highly recommend this lovely house. It is in a great position close to the main street but still very quiet. Having 2 bathrooms it would be ideal to share with friends. The kitchen has the most utensils and equipment I have seen i (Website hidden by Airbnb) so would be ideal if staying for any length of time.
Excellent location in the heart of Tanunda. Clean and comfortable space, with thoughtful add on, the tawny in the evening was a real treat. Thanks Andy and Natalie !
Large comfortable home close to restaurants, pubs, shopping and central to explore the Greater Barossa Valley.
Great accommodation. Really loved the old record player!
An amazing home to spend Christmas in. Andy add the smallest of touches that made our stay that little be extra special. Will defiantly be back.
Great location and fabulous place to stay would love to stay here again

Fantastic house with plenty of space, made to host six people very comfortably but never felt empty with just the two of us for my stay.  Facilities were great, breakfast supplies were overly generous, and location was best by far.  Could not recommend enough.

This is an absolute gem. The house is very comfortable and stylish, equipped for a short or long stay. We felt so at home there and didn't want to leave! The bath is very large and deep which is a big plus. And the kitchen is huge, with everything you need to prepare meals. I would strongly recommend staying here!

Fantastic location, really nice place with everything you need, and a very responsive and helpful host.
Will definitely stay again!

We have had an excellent time, the location is brilliant, walk to so many lovely restaurants, the house so stylish, incredibly clean, very comfortable, could not recommend more highly, we will definitely return. Thanks so much!
Highly recommend this beautiful home! Everything was amazing and location was perfect! Very kid friendly and thoughtful touches throughout, thanks’
Fabulous location and absolutely everything you need to feel right at home in the heart of the Barossa!
Highly recommended for an exceptional Airbnb. Andy certainly goes the extra mile to ensure comfort. The accommodation is centrally located and leaves nothing undone. Everything you could wish for.
This is the perfect place. A short stroll to wine bars and restaurants. A beautiful art deco house with everything you will need. Highly recommended.
Amazing place. Clean and spacious Convenient location.

We loved everything about our stay, house was very comfortable and warm, many extra touches (bread, breakfast supplies, biscuits) detail exceeded our expectations. Excellent spot for exploring the Barossa and accessing Clare Valley for a day trip. Hopefullywe can return again one day. Thank you for being a wonderful host.

A quaint cottage in the heart of Tanunda, is the perfect location to explore and enjoy all that the Barossa has to offer. If the day takes too much out of you, relaxing in the comfortable house is a breeze with a feast of food and wine options available all with walking distance. Our stay wasn’t long enough and when it’s time to come back, I know where I’ll be staying.
Great house in a perfect location, the little touches around the house make it so great, Thank you.

This house is wonderful in every way, the heating is excellent on a cold winters day, it is also immaculate and has everything we need, truly appreciate the fine details that made us so comfortable.  Our hosts were very helpful, they answered me immediately on the questions I asked before leaving home, thank you so very much.

Lovely centrally located house, everything within walking distance. the house was lovely and cosy and very clean, and Andy had left everything ready for us to light the fire, which was really lovely to sit by on the cold evenings.
Andy the host was excellent to deal with and answered all of our questions promptly and was extremely helpful, would absolutely stay again.

Lovely well appointed character home, warm, comfortable and great location . Ducted air conditioning throughout. Firewood ready for the open fire. Nice welcome with the heater and lights on before our arrival. Plenty of breakfast supplies and fresh bread and milk on arrival.
Location quiet but very central, easy walk to all the shops, cafes , bars and restaurants on the main street of Tanunda. Plenty of great wineries a short drive away or a cycle! We loved Tanunda, definitely our favourite Barossa town.

Absolutely wonderful stay, well equipped kitchen to cook in and walking distance to everything you might require.
Great communication with Andy and very easy check in.

Andy's house was really lovely.  Spacious, well equipped, sunny backyard, and lots of little thoughtful extras.  Best thing though, it's seriously right in town.  Across the road from Ferment Asian which I highly recommend eating at.

Anthea and Stefan were fantastic hosts. We felt like we were staying with old friends due to the warm correspondence beforehand and how we were greeted upon arrival. The space was clean, well lit, and quite private, with the ability to interact with the hosts in the shared space if you wish or keep to yourselves. We chose to enjoy a wine and a chat in the evening when we arrived back from our winery visit. This location is great value for a person or couple enjoying the Barossa and surrounds.

I would highly recommend staying at this property it has a unique decor and I love the fact you can also take an art class with Anthea. Anthea and Stefan were very welcoming on arrival and their fur family were just gorgeous. Anthea also shared some great walks to do around Angaston of which I went on one after I checked out and loved every minute. It is a quiet, clean and cozy place to stay.

Anthea and Stefan are a couple of natural hosts who make you feel welcome and at ease very quickly. Our bed was very comfy and even had electric blankets for those chilly autumn nights. Even without that, the fire was going 24/7 to keep the whole house warm. We enjoyed the company of Merry (small dog). The 2 cats kept their distance, sadly for us. The house has Anthea's art work everywhere, which is just lovely and certainly adds a special touch to the house. Both of our hosts were accommodating, helpful and natural. We would highly recommend. The house is close enough for a stroll down town for a meal out, although the driveway is quite steep. Not for the faint hearted, but great exercise. Special little touches included a packet of local dried fruit blend and a bottle of red wine, should you choose to indulge.

Good location, nice warm house.  Loved having our own bedroom, tv room and bathroom.  Privacy if you want it, or join Anthea and Stephan in the evening.  Great artwork on display throughout the house.  Thankyou
Anthea and Stefan have a gorgeous home. Very comfortable and welcoming along with gorgeous surrounds in Angaston/Barossa! I highly recommend others stay here!
Great place to stay & great hosts. Loved it!
Super friendly hosts.

Anthea and Stephane are a great host very kind and welcoming.
The house is beautiful, clean and comfy. You can find everything you need. It’s really close to the center of the City, you can go by foot. I recommend this place.
Wonderfully helpful hosts. Tranquil setting. Lots of private space.
Anthea’s place was beautifully clean and a pleasure to stay at. She was very welcoming. Anguston is a delightful village and Anthea’s place is just a short walk from the main street.
Was a great stay. Very welcoming
Good location , very helpful and friendly hosts.
Nice place with plenty of privacy ! Accommodating host
A delightful, quiet space with easy access and a relaxed atmosphere. Very convenient if you're travelling or working in the area. Highly recommended.

A lovely place to stay when visiting the Barossa Valley - the home is full of character (and art!), Anthea is a friendly, thoughtful and welcoming host, and there is still sufficient privacy for guests.

Excellent accommodation within easy walk of Angaston town centre. Great to have our own lounge room we could relax in and everything was very clean & well presented. Anthea & Stefan were excellent hosts and a mine of information about local landmarks & restaurants. Thank you for your hospitality and we would be happy to stay here again anytime.

I was happy to have stayed at Anthea and Stefan's place. Anthea is an outgoing and super friendly character that was welcoming and loved a chat. The guest area gives you plenty of room to relax and chill at the back of their house.

Anthea's place, "The Art Box" is in Angaston, within the wine region of South Australia and in picturesque surroundings. Pets and a few steps are within the home. The driveway is steep, but manageable. We found Anthea to be very warm, friendly and helpful. Check in was no problem. The bed was comfortable. There was a separate sitting room, bedroom, toilet and bathroom for guest use only. Didn't have to share anything, which we were very pleased about. Everything was very clean and neat. Anthea is an artist and has many pieces of her work on show. Very interesting.
Thank you for a very pleasant stay Anthea.

Anthea  & Stefan are very welcoming and friendly. The bedroom spotless and bed is comfy!!! So important for a good nights sleep! It was so quite I slept really well & glad I did not opt for a motel room.  Was surprised at the extra cozy room with TV, fridge & sofa which I had not expected. 🌿👣🌿

Anthea and Stefan were excellent hosts who were friendly and helpful with local tips. The accommodation was clean, comfortable and a short walk to the heart of town.

Couldn’t ask for a better place to stay on this occasion - would definitely stay again!

It was a wonderful place. We had our bedroom and an extra living room which was really perfect. Anthea and Steffen were really friendly and really heart warming people. We also had dinner with them and it was a nice evening with really good talks. Also their dog and the two cats were cute. We can definitely recommend this place. Anthea also gave us good tipps and spots what to do in Barossa Valley. She organised for us our wine tasting tour.

All in all we had two wonderful nights in the Art Gallery Box with two wonderful people. Thanks Anthea and Steffen. :-)
See you later !
Anthea's place is beautiful, great amenities and just a short walk from town. Anthea is a wonderful host- very friendly and thoughtful. Loved the animals too!

Many thanks to Anthea for the expert tips and advice which allowed us to make the most of our day in the Barossa Valley. Our stay was fantastic, made all the better by the added special touches.
Thanks again for your hospitality.
Anthea was a welcoming host, without being too attentive (well balanced).  Great suggestions for local eating
Anthea and Stefan made us feel right at home, very warm and welcoming hosts. There were lots of thoughtful touches to the room, thank you for a wonderful stay!

Anthea and Stefan are great hosts, making us feel at home in their wonderful, art-filled, quirky and cosy abode.

Heaters and an electric blanket disguised the fact that it was soooo cold outside and a couple of welcome gifts greeted us.

Be prepared for a very steep driveway, but you don't have to walk up, as there is a parking space at the top. Inside there are also a few steps, but very safe.

It's plain to see why Anthea and Stefan are Superhosts!
Clean room with beautiful view. Will go back again!
Beautiful space, private and cosy.
A lovely spot overlooking Angaston. Very comfortable and hospitable, and a perfect way to prepare for the Barossa marathon festival. Ember pizzas for carb loading are highly recommended!

Staying at The Art Box was a delight. Anthea and Stephan were great hosts offering great advice and tips about the region. There were lovely unexpected personal touches that were lovely. Location were great.
Can highly recommend. We will stay again any time.
Wonderful hosts, plenty of private space, beautifully decorated home, close to main street area.
A comfortable, clean and  good value bnb only minutes away from Angaston and other parts of the Barossa Valley
Great spot to stay! Great location, very friendly hosts with great personal touches! Highly recommend!

Lovely space to call your own, bedroom, lounge area and bathroom.
Beautiful art about the house to brighten the stay.
Great host clean and spacious

Anthea was very welcoming and accommodating, a lovely person with a cool house!
It’s a great location, perfect to get bikes and visit many wineries.
An art filled home that's vibrant, clean, and made better by the hosts kindness and hospitality.
Quiet and peaceful location. A cute, cozy home with a touch of the owner’s artworks. We enjoyed our stay.
Quick easy but pleasurable stay. Thanks for your hospitality!
Nice place, close to town, comfortable, nice little patio outside that gets the morning sun.
It was awesome to have our own  lounge room! Perfect country escape!
I had a great time at Anthea’s place. The bed is so comfortable and the lounge area is perfect for a cozy, relaxing evening in. Everything was really lovely. Thank you :)
Great little spot. Comfortable bed. Anthea and Stefan are lovely hosts. I had a great stay.
Anthea is a great host! I highly recommend you stay here. Very cosy room, with a comfortable bed and lovely hospitality. Thanks again Anthea.
We loved our (Email hidden by Airbnb) fortable & private area, with the unique touches of Antheas art work. The indoor pets were very well behaved. Definitely recommend.

As soon as you are greeted by Anthea and Stefan - you will automatically know you made a great decision to stay in their place and enjoy their warmth, hospitality and incredible house. Located a stone's throw away from Angaston centre and with sweeping mountain views, the house is littered with character and you'll be spoilt by special welcome touches, a cosy vibe and so much space! Very easy to reach the hundreds of wineries in the Barossa by car, bicycle or even foot (Yalumba). Anthea's artwork brings a unique character to the place and the pets are ever so fun. But the best part is Anthea and Stefan's company - they gave us so many great local tips, lifts to and from town and constantly made us laugh. A brilliant experience.

Fantastic BnB with lovely, warm, friendly and welcoming hosts. We love meeting your fur family and especially spending time with Simon . This was our 1st stay in an air BnB and we can't wait to do more . Thank you Anthea and Stefan!
Great accommodation, very friendly with everything you need

We had a lovely stay at Anthea’s house! It was very cosy and warm. There is lots of space with your own living room and bathroom (with a large bath)! Beautiful spot in nature and surrounded by wineries.

Firstly, Anthea and Stephan were the loveliest hosts. Such warm, fun loving people. I felt welcomed like family in their home. The space was spotlessly clean, very comfy bed with a lovely view of the hillside. Nice bathroom and private sitting room. At first I  was worried about not being able to cook for the 3 nights but there was everything needed to make coffee etc. or prepare some pickies to have with a glass of wine at the little table in the back garden. Also many good cafes and restaurants in town which was a 10 minute walk away. Great value for money.Thoroughly recommended!
Great interesting house. Anthea is a great host. Friendly and accommodating. Lovely homely feel.
