Old Mill Cottage in Kapunda is a beautiful place to stay. We were surprised how historic the cottage was, being built in 1864! It has since been beautifully renovated. It provided us with a great base for both Clare Valley and Barossa.
The host canceled this reservation 30 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Cute rustic place with everything you need. Location is in a town centre, so not rural, but there is a beautiful backyard to hang out and drink wine in.

We really enjoyed our stay at Old Mill Cottage, the place itself is private and quiet and has a cosy feel. The cottage was well presented and clean, and the heating facilities are good as there is both a wall heater and a cast iron fire to light up for extra heat and ambience. Yvonne was helpful and quick to respond to all our needs. She was also able to provide us with a portacot which was a bonus. The kitchen doesn't have an oven, but has everything else required to cook family meals. The master bed is very comfy, with lovely soft bedding! All in all this is a very nice little hideaway, only 20 mins drive from tons of big name wineries.

The cottage was beautifully renovated with quirky themes. My partner needed more than 10 (Hidden by Airbnb) s to cover all the things she liked about the design.
It was very comfortable and made for a lovely weekend away from Adelaide.
The cottage was lovely, clean and everything we expected. Thanks for a great weekend in the Barossa Valley!

The most gorgeous cottage you will find, great, cosy space, all very well designed, stylish with many personal touches, many wow moments for sure! The garden smells dreamy - with all the blossoming flowers we were just enjoying wonderful wine whilst sitting outside! I would recommend this place to anyone, we also booked a wine tour and they picked us up and dropped back at the cottage which was lovely. Thank you
The host canceled this reservation 19 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Yvonne's cottage was absolutely perfect for a weekend getaway with friends to the beautiful Barossa Valley!! Kapunda is so close to everything, the garden is a gorgeous spot to sit in the sun and relax with a wine and enjoy a BBQ. It was still cool at nights so we sat by the wood fire inside and chatted. We had dinner one night at the Kapunda North Hotel which was also amazing.
A coffee machine would be a great addition to the kitchen and some extra pillows would also be good.
Fantastic & cosy cottage, close to local shops etc - Yvonne was a great host

Had a wonderful weekend stay. Walking and bike riding distance to the main street is a plus, very quite and peaceful. Styled and equipped to a high standard. Beautiful garden setting. Views of the garden from every window.

We had a lovely stay at the Old Mill Cottage. With the way the Cottage was decorated, we felt like we stepped back in time, but the bathroom and kitchen renovation provided the comfort of the modern day. It was clean, comfortable and welcoming. It was such a pretty place to stay in, and the welcome of eggs, butter, bread, milk and juice was just so special after weeks of being on the road. The Old Mill Cottage was in a convenient location to check out Kapunda and the other towns in the Barossa Valley. We would highly recommend a stay here :)

Great place, tucked away on a quiet street, next to what looks like a reserve. We came on a very hot day and the air-con was super efficient. Loved the old stone walls & polished floorboards combined with a modern kitchen and bathroom. If you're after a large claw-footed bath to soak in and dream away the day, this is the place!
We had a great stay! Beautiful little cottage and gardens! Thanks Yvonne!

Yvonne's place is the perfect spot for a getaway to SA's beautiful wine regions. A 15 min drive to the Barossa and a scenic 50 min drive to the Clare - it's in a great location. The place itself was easy to find, clean and well designed. We were very happy with out stay here - the beautiful outdoor area was perfect to sit back and relax with a glass of wine after exploring all day. Would definitely recommend! Thanks, Yvonne :)
Lovely cute cottage. Walkable to town. Beautiful area. Breakfast was provided

This little cottage provided a perfect spot for a winter getaway. The log fire gave off lovely warmth and a cosy feel, adding ambience to each evening by the fire.
The breakfast provisions were plenty for a hearty start to our day.
The decor is quirky and interesting

Yvonne’s place is perfect for a cosy getaway! We loved being so close to the barossa valley wine region and enjoyed the charm and coziness of the cottage. Perfect for couples or small groups of people. Thanks again Yvonne!

Clean & full of character cottage in a great position.
Sleeps 3 easily in 2 bedrooms, crowded with 5 - fold out sofa bed for 2 in small living area
Great fire. Nice setting. Comfy bed. Greenock tavern good pie. Nth Kapunda hotel good food
The host canceled this reservation 34 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Snuck into the Barossa for a friday wedding and booked this cottage without any hassle. The place was easy to find, easily accessible and very very clean inside. It had all that was needed (and more) including linen, towels, some breakfast supplies, toilet paper, wood for burning (if thats your thing), books, DVDs, a TV and a portacot. My wife was a huge fan of the supplied marmalade. The shower and bath is a cracker, and the hot water system is quick and excellent.

The location was outstanding with a reserve next door (including a large pond with plenty of ducks to see) and a nearby park 3 min walk away with a full size steam locomotive to play on - these were appreciated by my 2 year old daughter. Overall the place was great and I'd highly recommend booking it if you wanted to base yourself in Kapunda for a barossa trip. We ended eating at the North Kapunda Pub and FermentAsian which I highly recommend.

The place itself is great - and I have given it 5 stars. However if there was anything negative to note about the place, then its the following:
- there is a tiny tiny amount of termite damage on one doorway - but this doesnt effect your stay
- there are not many fly screens on the windows - so if you're keen to open up the windows and doors and let the breeze through you may need to be aware that bugs may join you inside.

Overall a lovely cottage
would highly recommend the Old Mill cottage. Such a cosy and clean place with great amenities and space. GREAT VALUE!

Lovely old cottage with great charm in a good location with a beautiful lake literally at the backdoor where the ducks and geese can be fed. Good amenities. Aircon in kitchen couldn't really cool the bedroom sufficiently for us.

The cottage is a stylish cosy space on the fringe of Barossa valley with nice touches to it.

Pros: quite location, 20min drive to the pretty part of the valley and all the wineries. Nice living area with a vintage fireplace.

Cons: uncomfortable beds and mattresses. Second bedroom is very small with very little space when Occupied by an adult couple. Not very clean especially on the outdoor areas.

If the host addresses the above the cottage is worthwhile staying.
We enjoyed our stay in kapunda in Yvonne’s warm welcoming home. It had a great feel was sparkling clean and in a great location

Beautiful, clean & cosy cottage, had everything we needed to have a nice relaxing weekend getaway. Easy drive to Barossa wineries, and 5-min walk to Kapunda main street for groceries, pubs and bakery.

Full kitchen with microwave and BBQ outside was great for doing own meals.

We'd love to visit again sometime in the future!
The host canceled this reservation 31 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The Old Mill Cottage was the perfect stay for my wife and I looking for a quiet, beautiful cottage with all the comforts. It was a pleasure to meet our hosts Yvonne and Glenn. They have taken a great deal of pride in the presentation of this beautiful warm and cosy cottage. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a beautiful quiet get away, close to all of the wonderful offerings from the Barossa Region.
A fantastic venue owned by lovely people.  Highly recommended!
Stunning property, lovely location, cosy fireplace, generous breakfast provisions, everything you need for a great stay.
Beautifully renovated, clean and comfortable. Great mix of new and classic design. Ammenities great as were breakfast provisions provided. Couldn’t fault it in any way. Would stay again.

The hosts go to so much extra effort to provide absolutely everything you could ask for in an AirBnB. They provide all kinds of food, drinks, kitchen items, tea, coffee etc... that goes way above and beyond expectations.

A beautifully decorated and comfortable stay in a lovely and well situated historical town.
The garden is lovely and a wonderful spot to enjoy a glass or the local product

Old Mill Cottage is such a treat to stay in! From the beautiful decor, super comfy beds, luxurious outdoor bath and yummy breakfast provisions, it's a cut above other accommodation! The cottage is spotlessly clean and so many special little touches made us feel extra pampered and relaxed.  The kids loved exploring the little cottage garden and we very much enjoyed the Kapunda market on Sunday morning and learning about the local history at the old mines too. Thanks for a wonderful break away from everyday life!

Words cannot express the brilliant settting, facilities and personal touches this accommodation offers its guests - so good I did not want to leave and return to reality - a hidden gem with so many personal touches we immediately felt at home. Yvonne and Glenn were most obliging and could not do enough to ensure our stay was not only memorable but relaxing and plan to return as soon as possible.

A sweet, peaceful and cosy cottage & garden. The outside bath is a real treat! Kapunda is wonderfully quiet yet a close drive to plenty of attractions and activities.
We were very comfortable for our stay, and Yvonne and Glenn were wonderful hosts. Thank you!
Absolute great place to stay! Yvonne and Glenn such great hosts, definitely stay again!

A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!! Best AirBnB we’ve ever stayed at! Will be booking again real soon!

Beautiful cottage, amazing amenities & really lovely couple that take fabulous care of you!

Thank you!
A perfect getaway accommodation! Beautifully decorated, which is great for photo. Very clean and comfortable. We wish we have had stayed longer than one night
Beautiful home and fabulous hosts made our excursion to Kapunda really enjoyable.

Amazing place for a getaway with everything you need.
Yvonne and Glenn were very accommodating and easy to communicate with.
Will definitely stay again! :)

Lovely charming place to stay.
Very comfortable.

Go-go's was perfect for our stay in Eden Valley. It was much more spacious than we expected, and lovely evenings were spent in the cool breezes on the front verandah after long days exploring and wine tasting. It had everything we needed and the general store and pub were just down the road. It was super quiet, perfect for star gazing at night, and was wonderful to wake up to the sunrise and birds in the morning. Karine and Michael were great hosts and we'll definitely be back again. Thank you!

Fantastic, comfortable and homely place to stay in Eden Valley, close to Barossa region. Clean, tidy and spacious. Lovely to sit on front verandah and listen to the birds. Especially loved how well equipped it was, even with supplies in the fridge and pantry, which was great as interstate travellers. Recommended

My husband and our two friends just spent 4 nights in this fantastic accomodation. Everything was perfect from the spacious clean house to the host "Karines' most knowledgable and local tips. Thank you. We can't wait to come back again as soon as possible.

The property is set on a reasonably quiet road, located near some nice wineries a short (5 - 30 minute) drive away. The rooms are clean and spacious and looked better than they did in the photos. The kitchen was well equipped, including a stocked pantry with all the basics. The single bathroom and separate toilet worked out alright for four adults. The host was very friendly and helpful (and also environmentally conscious, which was a bonus).  Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and would consider staying there again. A few things that did not really bother us but may be worth noting for some guests are (i) there is no internet access and we had Optus network on our mobiles. The mobile connection dropped in and out a fair bit during our stay. Not sure if other networks would be better in the area. We had a GPS and did most of our research before the trip so it did not bother us; (ii) the house was very clean but perhaps given the season (autumn) we found a number of caterpillar-looking worms inside the house. We were not bothered but just had to watch where we put our steps when walking around the house; (iii) the TV signal was very weak on two of the three nights, with only one channel working. Again we were not bothered as we did not go to Eden Valley to watch TV but if you would like to stay in one night and put a show on for the kids then it would be tricky as there is no internet or DVD player. Overall it was a lovely stay at Go Go. Thank you Karine.
A great retreat.  We loved the space for kids to play and a sense of being away from the business of life.

Go Go's was great, we had absolutely everything we needed and more. Excellent location - we were so happy we picked Eden Valley to stay and even happier with Go Go's. It was right in the middle of so many great wineries and other places to visit and really comfortable and well set up for relaxing after a busy day of sight seeing.
Thanks for having us!
A great place to stay. clean and tidy with room to move inside and out. The fresh baked bread waiting for us on arrival was a nice touch.

Great Place, Great Stay, Great Hosts. Brilliant place for Plenty of R & R.
Enjoyed by all of us. Very Clean abode. The 2 dogs loved every minute of the wonderful gardens. Hosts supplied fire wood so we could enjoy an open fire under the stars brillant

Set in the picturesque Eden Valley, Go's Go's is a great base to explore the Barossa Valley. The house is extremely spacious and has all the amenities, including a fully stocked pantry, for a no hassle stay. Host Karine is extremely helpful and prompt with responses to questions/requests. Overall, very good value.
The house was excellent and very clean. Karine was very friendly and hospitable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thanks Karine!
Great stay thanks. Nice and clean and well appointed house. Everything required for a great stay in the area. Will be back...

Although we only spent two night's at Go Go's we were very impressed with the location and amenities, The rooms were spacious and tidy. The surrounds were well kept and it was pleasing to wake up to the sounds of country wildlife. The atmosphere was typical of Peace and Tranquility and very relaxing. The location  is within close reach of many wineries and the larger towns of the Barossa Valley. The hosts are a young couple who were very keen to please and ensure and ensure our stay was an enjoyable one. Thanks to Michael and Karine.

A fantastic place to stay. The house is clean and spacious with plenty of natural light through large windows. The rooms are large which is an added bonus when 2 toddlers are in tow and is well stocked from a pantry/amenities perspective. Set on a sizeable piece of land, there is plenty of space for outside play. The birdlife in the early morning and late of an evening was just wonderful to hear. While Eden Valley doesn't have a general store, this is easily countered by some forward planning. All in all, thoroughly recommended - a wonderful few days were spent here.
Karine was an amazing host. The house was beautifully presented with a lovely backyard and all amenities also extremely clean. Could not ask for more.

The place was great, very well equipped, we had everything we needed and more ( we were traveling with two young boys and grandma). It was clean, communication was great, we were welcomed with all basic groceries like bread, eggs and great wine :-) as we arrived late. Great location - lot to see around or in Adelaide and Glenelg village. Stay at least 3 nights to experience it all and visit some vineyards too :-).

It was exactly what we were looking for. The friendly touch like a fresh loaf of bread, flowers and a well stocked pantry were certainly very much appreciated. The location was just perfect for us, a place surrounded by nature and beautiful birds.
Located in a very peaceful place with heaps of space inside and out, a very comfortable and spacious  house in which you feel at home. A very clean and tidy place with everything needed at hand.

We had a lovely couple of nights at Karine's place with my parents and our two kids. It was easy to check in and the communications prior with Karine were quick and accurate.

The place itself is located well, short drive to Fernfield Winery and easy reach to Henschke and the heart of the Barossa only a scenic drive of 15/20min away.

The house was clean and surprisingly well stocked pantry. We cooked at home for a night and whilst the place is of a certain age, everything works well including the heating and hot water in the shower.

Karine has done a great job putting some nice personal touches throughout the house and the real party piece is the garden, which is fantastic to just look out over and have the kids run around to chase the morning rabbits.

Thank you for letting us stay.

This home is a very stylish and well-organised. Karine did a wonderful job as the host and made sure our stay was as comfortable as possible.
Thanks again Karine
We found this to be a perfect base for enjoying the Barossa region offering comfort, space and privacy. Karine is an outstanding host. Highly recommended.

Great place to stay, especially with young kids. Good location close to the wineries, and a very specious garden where the kids can enjoy themselves for ages. We liked it that everything we needed in the house was there. Super convenient. Karine was very quick and helpful in her communication.

We had a lovely stay at Karine’s house with our two young children. They played so much in the huge yard, and we even saw a rabbit crossing the garden on Easter morning! There was a swing outside and so many toys and books inside, so they were happily occupied all the time. The house is in a great location, close to beautiful Angaston and to so many lovely wineries. It had everything we needed and much more; Karine had kindly left some home made bread, Easter chocolate eggs for the kids, as well as a very well stocked pantry. We are so grateful for her hospitality and would love to be back to Eden valley for longer one day!

Go go is a gorgeous spacious house with each room quite large, it was great for both our children with toys and games their age, the garden is delightfull, and we loved waking to the winery 1 km walking distance and did an awesome walk in the little conservation park 10 km away. Thank you for the delicious loaf of bread too!!

Go Go's was such an amazing place to stay!! Karine made sure we were alert, safe and looked after during the horrible fires in the Adelaide Hills even welcoming our family members who's properties had been affected by the fires to stay with us as they could not go home. Karine is an incredibly thoughtful person and we feel so lucky to have been able to stay in her property, everything you could imagine needing was already in the house from toys, extra bedding (which definitely came in handy), to a stocked pantry and even and emergency kit. If you ever get the chance to stay here I recommend you do it as soon as possible. You will not regret it!

We stayed there for 3 nights with our 2 young children and we had the best time. There were fresh bread and eggs when we arrived and the house was spotless. Plenty of toys the kids would play with. The house had everything we needed and the garden had everything to entertain the kids. The region is so beautiful, lots of things to do and visit for the kids and adults! Great and relaxing stay. Thanks Karine for the hospitality, we will be back!
Beautiful area.
We had a wonderful stay.

It was a 'home away from home'. All the things you expect to find at home are there. Plenty of space inside and out. Also thrilled to find a loaf of freshly baked break from Karine on arrival. That was delicious and so thoughtful.
We had such a lovely stay- the house was very clean and Karine left us a loaf of homemade bread 😊

Go Go's is such a nice place and Karine is really welcoming with great local tips
The Eden Valley Hotel down the road is definitely worth a visit as well
The house is perfect for a family, with lots of space and everything you need to self cater your holiday. The location is great for going anywhere in the Barossa.

Our family of 5 had a wonderful stay at Karine's place. It was perfect for our visit to the Barossa Valley, and had everything we needed. Karine's communication was excellent, and she was responsive to our messages and requests. Our kids had a blast exploring the yard, and enjoyed the toys, books and games available. We can't wait to go back!

We loved the large property and tidy, spacious house. It is well equiped with everything you could need. You can sit on the porch and enjoy the serenity, while being greeting by the neighbouring sheep. Twas a lovely stay.
fantastic place! all we needed!
GoGos is a perfect place to stay. The house is very welcoming and comfortable. Its proximity to the Barossa Valley and the Lavender Trail is a real asset. Our grandson loved staying at the house.

Beautiful property with plenty of space to roam and soak up some peaceful country ambience.
The house is amazingly well equipped with everything you could ever need in the kitchen, pantry, and the kids toy room is so well stocked. Plenty of toys to keep our little ones entertained- from 1 year old up to 8 years old. Loads of different board games too.
There is no shop in the town of Eden Valley, we got all our supplies from Foodland in Angaston, which is about a 15 min drive away.
Beds have electric blankets which was so great for our winter stay. And the rooms are really big so plenty of space to play and spread your suitcases out too!

It was a perfect home away from home and Karine was super friendly in all our communications. Self check in but she called by in the evening to see if we had any questions and to ensure we had everything we needed.

Definitely recommend for an all in one family getaway!

What a wonderful place to stay! A stunning property, with everything to make our stay comfortable. The local sour dough, fresh eggs and milk a lovely thoughtful bonus! The friendly sheep next door a highlight for the kids and the electric blankets magical for the cool nights! We can’t wait to return! Eden Valley is enchanting with a pub meal a short stroll away! Thank you so much!
Great house, everything you could need. Breaky supplies were a real bonus

Lovely place to stay
Lots of space for the kids to run around
We felt very comfortable during our stay
We had great long weekend away with friends.  Made super use of the fire pit.  The fresh loaf, eggs, and stocked pantry were much appreciated. Perfect base for barossa and hills exploring.
We had a relaxing stay at Karine's place, short walk to the pub & the kids loved the garden, just what was needed.

10/10 spot!
Was on a weekend getaway with friends and our little ones.
Absolutely fabulous for the kids!
Idyllic location.
Fabulous host. Fresh bread on arrival, roasting marshmallows over the firepit at night!
Was such a cool spot we spent most of our time on the property but there's so much to do on their doorstep.
Amazing!!!

A beautiful stay! And the place is very relaxing for a getaway! Karine has left the place fully equipped for her guests that we will require nothing extra! Thank you so much for your hospitality! We will see you soon 😀

Karine’s place was wonderful! It was definitely a very relaxing and much needed getaway for our family of three, after having to cancel two interstate holidays! Our 2.5yr old son loved the toys and books, the garden outside, the sheep, basically everything... and if he’s happy, so are we! Karine came to even say hello and checked if we got any questions at all, there was a fresh loaf of bread upon our arrival and both Karine and Michael were easily reachable at all times during our stay. Overall, everything was great :) We hope to be back.
Another enjoyable stay. It’s like a home away from home.

Lovely, well equipped home in a stunning location. Karine was incredibly helpful and the thoughtful personal touches on arrival, excellent communication and kind hospitality made for a great stay. We look forward to returning.

The cottage at Buckbury End farm is situated on a picturesque property. Beautiful country breezes, an outlook of peppercorn trees and gums and a gorgeously appointed cottage await. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, romantic escape then Buckbury end is your destination. Every detail has been attended from fresh cut flowers to the gourmet farm breakfast products and natural Australian bath products. We can't recommend this place enough!
John is a kind, caring host who has created a beautiful escape.
John is a kind, considerate and hard working host. He has created a beautiful place to escape.

Great secluded location which offers all the amenities of Tanunda (10 min drive away). The cottage has everything you need and the inclusion of a surprise breakfast in the fridge was unexpected but totally appreciated. Would stay here again and again!

John is a lovely host! We really enjoyed the mini tour around his property and wandering down the path to the creek. The cottage is lovely - has everything you need and really sets the scene for some excellent R&R! A perfect getaway for those wanting to be surrounded by nature and not too far from wineries and attractions!

John's place had absolutely everything you could want. We even saw a kangaroo close by while we had our breakfast - a must for overseas visitors. The attention to detail in the cottage was well appreciated, as was the peace and quiet. A special place. Highly recommended.

Located on a farm, but still very handy to all the scenic and tourist attractions of the Barossa. A lot of love and care has gone into restoring an authentic slice of Barossa architecture. Gives you the opportunity to experience a stone cottage but with all the mod-cons. Fabulous!

Wow if you want country - you have it here! Location just a little out of town but very easy to find when you follow the instructions given by John. Ample food for breakfast, bacon, sausages, eggs, milk, bread, yogurt, fruit, juice and all the condiments necessary. The very new and modern kitchen is equipped with all the mod cons. Top quality cookware, crockery etc... This farm cottage has been decked out with exceptional detail...lovely linen too.

We arrived and I was reading when husband went out to explore, next thing I recive a phone call from my husband to come and join him. I find him with John (our Host) and there they were beers in hand having a right old talk, I was then handed a drink myself. Now that is what I call a host and country hospitality. John is in the process of renovating the main farmhouse - an enormous job - we look forward to coming back in 5 years ? 10 perhaps? :) Great stay...thank you
John was the perfect host, very prompt in responding and giving directions. The cottage is comfy and lots of mod cons. A great setting for close access to the Barossa Valley.
Truly a gem. A great place to come back to after trekking the Barossa. A home away from home ... Thank you for an unforgettable experience
Great old cottage beautifully restored, very quiet location. Lots of goodies provided, bacon eggs yoghurt fruit etc. Loved our stay.
We had a wonderful overnight stay in the farm cottage and really appreciated the generous breakfast provisions and inclusions.  A very peaceful setting amongst the pepper trees.

Definitely book this place! John has equipped it with everything you need, right down to stocking the fridge with plenty of delicious breakfast ingredients. The cottage feels very private, and is a wonderful escape from city life. Thanks!

We had a wonderful stay at Buckbury end farm - quiet, lovely views and walks. John provided lots of information ahead of time, the fridge was well stocked with eggs, bacon, sausages, etc for breakfast, and John's dad dropped by after a couple of days to see if there was anything we needed.  Wonderful place to get away from it all.
Book this place now. It has everything you could want for an escape to the Barossa. Quiet, clean, beautiful property, and extra little touches that make it just magic. Thanks John.

Thanks so much for a wonderful one night stay, John! Wish it could have been longer.. We especially enjoyed our sunset walk around the property, with a glass of local rose, so beautiful. Best wishes, Jesper & Bree

This gorgeous little cottage is the epitome of the beautiful scenery and heritage of Barossa. Newly renovated and attention to detail with comforts like a fridge of essentials as well as breakfast essentials, bathroom essentials and the lovely crisp and clean bedding. So close to town and all the wineries you can imagine and in a quiet, country location this is the perfect getaway accommodation! We will absolutely stay here again. John was organised and communicated quickly. He was very generous and gracious and we felt totally at ease. I would highly recommend this stay to anyone visiting the Barossa. We loved our stay thank you John!
Great, cosy cottage with everything we needed for a comfortable, relaxing stay in a quiet secluded location.

John's cottage is a cosy, authentic place to stay in Barossa Valley. My husband and I stayed there for 3 days for our anniversary and we would definitely stay there again. The bed is very comfortable, the shower is nice, the kitchen has everything you could need. There is a TV, however there is no Wi-Fi. John has left little treats everywhere - breakfast, chocolates, magazines, toiletries, BBQ, etc. The location is great - close to all the wineries but far enough for peace and quiet. There's even a stream you can walk to on the property.

John is a great host and the cottage provides every comfort needed while on a trip.  Attention to detail in providing a well equipped kitchen and bathroom was really appreciated - and the quality of bath/bed linen was a wonderful bonus.  Thanks for providing such a gorgeous cottage getaway.  A close drive to Tanunda (15-20 mins) with plenty of wineries and a scenic countryside drive - and so quiet at night.  Thanks John.  It was wonderful!

This place is a recommendation for everyone who enjoys staying in a romantic and cozy cottage in a secluded area with a lovely country side. Take a walk to the nearby river, enjoy the peacefulness of the area or drive to Tanunda in 15-20min. It has all the nice touches and essentials for a wonderful stay. Everything is spotlessly clean. Thanks again John. You have done a great job.

This place is fantastic. Take it from an Adelaide local... If you're travelling in the Barossa Valley, this is the spot where you want to be staying. Only a short drive away from wherever your Barossa adventures happen to take you. Gorgeous setting, great host. Next time we'll look to stay longer and have a beer with you!

What a gem!
This cottage was so peaceful, tranquil and beautifully located. Set in the rolling Barossa Hills in a tucked away part of the world, we felt miles from civilisation.
The cottage was tastefully renovated and decorated with quality linen and kitchen supplies. We had everything we needed.
Thanks John, what a fantastic job you've done! See you again!

This place is extremely close to everything in the Barossa, but very secluded. Charming home, very private, and more views and birds than we ever expected. We chose to get back before sunset each evening so we could just hang out around the property. Highly recommended, and we will return when we get back to this great wine area.
Absolutely beautiful little cottage, was exactly what we were after for a relaxing little getaway by the fire

A fantastic place to get away from it all whilst still being within close driving proximity to all the Barossa has to offer. The cottage is beautifully restored, very cosy and with top quality soft furnishings and so many little extras that were greatly appreciated. Highly, highly recommended.
John is an incredible host. The cottage was impeccable. Everything was amazing!!

John has done a stellar job of renovating this cottage and it was all easy and functional from the outset. From great heating to a comfy bed, it was the perfect little barossa escape. A stroll by the river in the evening light capped off the ambience of a great find.

This is incredible!! We loved staying here and can't wait to stay longer if back in the area! Excellent host and all the little extras make it a 5 star touch! So peaceful, beautiful views and gorgeous renovated quaint country cottage!

The photos of this place don't do it justice. It is a stunning cottage with beautiful surrounding views. It's located in close proximity to many wonderful wineries. John recommended Pindarie for lunch and the views and was one of
The best places we visited and would
Highly recommend it. Do call for
Reservations if it's a long weekend or you want to eat at a certain time. Thanks again soo much John!

Amazing cottage! John was very helpful. It was fullly equiped with everthing we needed. The small personal touches like flowers and chocolate made it even better. Very cozy and close to everything you need it the barossa.
Awesome house in an awesome location. Amazing getaway. Great host!

This is a special getaway.  You feel like you've stepped back in time yet have all the mod cons and very generous provisions and extras.  We loved our three night stay and get away from the hustle and bustle of if all.  Our highlight was driving 'home' to the cottage each afternoon to settle in to the peace and quiet of the surrounds.  A lovely, peaceful getaway.

A beautifully restored cottage with lots of thoughtful touches. The kitchen is well stocked with extras such as breakfast and chocolates and I loved the fireplace. John is a great host who was only too happy to answer my questions and I wish that we could have spent more time here.
Staying at the Farm Cottage is a unique experience. The Cottage is beautifully presently, spacious and fitted out with everything you need.
Wonderful. Just excellent.
John was a fantastic host who went above and beyond to make our stay great. And the place was peaceful and beautiful.
Fantastic stay, can't praise it highly enough. Quiet, well maintained and well hosted by John.

really enjoyed our stay in John's little cottage.
Loved being a bit out of town,
Sitting around the fire in the evening and for the generous provisions when we arrived

The cottage is perfect for 2 people and has all the modcons.  The river is absolutely fantastic and the quiet rural setting is a great place to unwind.  Warm and cozy on the coldest day, comfortable armchairs and the bed is hard to leave being one of the best away from home mattresses I have ever slept on.  Highly recommend this cottage and we will be back ourselves!

A lovely, cosy & refreshing place. Old stone cottage, juxtaposed with very new fit outs that make it comfortable, interesting and relaxing. Attention to detail and old fashioned artifacts gives the place character. Generous light comes in from the large windows and modern lighting. And the location is magnificent.

We absolutely fell in love with this gorgeous little cottage. The owners have excellent taste, it was all so beautifully furnished. The bed was really comfortable, the Sheridan towels felt so luxurious, breakfast provisions were delicious and the open fire just set it off.  The property as a whole is really beautiful, especially down where the creek runs.  We love that we have found such a beautiful little gem of a place.  Definitely recommend this for your next Barossa stay..

A beautiful quaint cottage, set on a tranquil farm. All modern amenities available so you do not need to leave the cottage. The heater works well, but I would have loved to have firewood available to use in the fireplace. So so quiet. It was lovely. Thankyou John.

Great little private cottage with everything you need inside.
Excellent country getaway

A lovely and neat, quaint farm cottage for two, which has the necessary modern comforts, including an electric blanket, bright fully-equipped kitchen, and even a sound system, whilst offering a relaxing country escape. Breakfast ingredients provided were fresh and adequate, and the bathroom was kept clean. The host was also readily contactable.

A highly recommended experience for anyone wanting to visit the Barossa Valley region.
Absolutely loved our 2 night stay here. The cottage is gorgeous and the attention to detail was amazing. Utter serenity down by the river. Only a 15min drive from Tanunda, perfect for a Barossa trip.

We returned to Buckbury End Farm for a second visit because we enjoyed it so much the first time.
John has done a fantastic job creating a peaceful and rejuvenating space. He pays attention to all the details leaving you able to relax and enjoy the beautiful environment.
Thanks again John! We'll be back!

We had a fantastic time in this lovely cottage. It's in a gorgeous location and is thoughtfully maintained by John, who was helpful and hospitable during our weekend stay. It's perfectly located between Gawler and the heart of the Barossa for easy access & exploration. We enjoyed a picnic by the river and I met a good deal of wildlife on a morning run. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks much John.
A very quiet cottage with all the mod cons and Moore.
Beautiful cottage and very thoughtful little touches that made our stay thoroughly enjoyable. Will be back for sure!

Wow!  John has created a little slice of heaven with his restored cottage.  Very tastfully done utilising the old stone cottage highlights with modern very clean facilities.  Everything for a relaxing quiet getaway.  Access to the creek and picnic spot is exceptional in the afternoon for a glass of wine and a beer in glorious country solitude.  The cottage is close to all the Barossa Valley attractions and takes no time at all to get to the wineries and local shops.  We cant recommend John's cottage highly enough!!  Well done.
A great place to stay

A well appointed cute little cottage, on a super quiet and peaceful block of land. John's done a wonderful job of setting up this little getaway to feel like a home away from home. It's gorgeous on a nice day, and super cosy and comfy in bad weather. We were totally left to enjoy the space in peace, and appreciated the generous fridge contents and personal touches of the property. John was a great communicator and kept us apprised of a road closure that was to occur during our stay meaning we could plan around it and make the most of our time. We will be recommending it to others. Thanks again!
Perfect accommodation for attending a function in south Barossa. Rustic and quaint but also everything we needed. Little details taken care of... and we love the breakfast supplies!

John's farmer's cottage is a pleasant and comfortable place to stay. We stayed after attending a wedding in the Barossa. It was located in an convenient location (although accessed via dirt roads) and was a good choice for us for an overnight stay.

My husband and I had a wonderfully peaceful stay at John's wee cottage. Everything was as we pictured and the amenities all of superior standard. We were so close to the Barossa Wineries and were able to pick up a local tour that far exceeded expectations. All in all, a thoroughly enjoyable couple of days. Thank you John.
Genuine rustic farmstay, but with all the comforts of home. The cottage is fitted out very well, directions and checkin very easy. Friendly cows! Highly recommended 😊

My husband and I spent 3 nights at the farm cottage. We had an amazing time here - we loved the peacefulness of the property and the cottage had all the amenities we needed plus more. John was a great host and if we are ever back in Barossa Valley would definitely stay here again

John’s place is just beautiful! A gorgeous little cottage with all of the modern amenities you could want. Breakfast supplies were delicious and plentiful. The place was absolutely spotless, and there were even fresh flowers on the table!
The property itself was so lovely and peaceful. My husband and I enjoyed a walk down to the creek and wildlife spotting. We would have loved to go down there for a picnic with the provided bag, but it was 42 degrees so we stayed in! John’s communication was super efficient too. He was always so fast to respond to my questions, and was able to facilitate us arriving early, with the air conditioning on waiting for us!
The property feels very remote, but is actually only 15-20 minutes from major Barossa towns. We were able to have a winery tour pick us up from there and also a taxi driver drop us off with no problems at all.
An amazing stay overall! Thanks so much John!
This tastefully renovated farm building, in scenic countryside, is a little haven to escape to.
Such a lovely, comfortable and we'll-equipped little cottage, perfect for our wine weekend. Air con was a blessing in the summer heat. Easy to find with John's directions. Would definitely recommend.

We had a wonderful time at Buckbury End Farm. The cottage is simple but has everything you need for a comfy stay. We really appreciated the thoughtful touches - the air conditioning switched on ahead of our arrival, the brekkie provisions and the picnic basket. It was such a peaceful spot but still close to everything. Highly recommended!

We really enjoyed our time here. The cottage had all the amenities you could want. Beautiful area, close to vineyards, but far away enough to enjoy some peace and quiet. Beautiful river walk on property and fridge stocked with all the fixin’s for breakfast!
If you are looking for a real escape to the country but want something cosy with all the modern facilities, this is the place for you! Easy to get to and great sleeps!
Would highly recommend for a beautiful quiet getaway for some down time! John is a fast responder, the cottage is clean and he even gives you a little picnic pack! We will be back :)
Lovely tranquil place, great to get away from the busy lives us townies suffer!

Fabulous location and accommodation - everything supplied that you would need. The quiet and private nature of the farm/cottage - especially the riverside walk - makes for a peaceful and relaxing stay amid the bustle of the Barossa winery adventures.

A very well renovated and beautiful little cottage. All amenities you could want, with many small details that made it a lovely place to stay. John also gave us maps to get to the wedding venue nearby which were very helpful. Would definitely recommend
If you want a comfortable, clean place with old world atmosphere this is the place. John has super host status for good reason. Highly recommended!

My partner and I absolutely loved our stay at John’s place and would highly recommend this farm stay to anyone looking for a quiet place to stay in the barossa. The place has everything you need and more — great amenities, a very comfy bed, fully stocked kitchen and a nice front porch with a BBQ. There’s even a river nearby to enjoy a picnic. Great place!

Amazing place! We loved our stay, it’s such a relaxing and peaceful location, yet very convenient to the town and wineries. The house is so modern inside and has a great kitchen and bathroom. There were many thoughtful touches inside and out and I can tell that John really cares about his guest’s experience. Would love to stay again, exceeded expectations!

John’s cottage was the perfect spot for our Easter break. The cottage was clean and had little touches like the picnic bag and shower products for handy use. The nearby creek was the perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine from one of the nearby wineries. We most certainly will visit again :) perfection!

Wonderful little farm cottage situated in an extremely quiet area on the edge of the Barossa. Privacy and tranquility in spades!
John left the room ready for us with many nice little touches to help us on our way.
Would definitely stay here again!!
Thank you for an outstanding stay! The cottage is so charming - the photos don't do it justice. You thought of every detail, would love to visit again .

This place is just gorgeous and perfect if you want a feel of Aussie country life in luxury
Very clean can highly recommend for a peaceful getaway near to the barrossa

Thankyou, we loved our farm stay, it was so quiet and peaceful! It was only a short drive to Barossa Valley and all the amazing wineries. Just to note, the cottage is on a dirt road (in case you use a hire car) :)

Interesting location for the cottage surrounded by relics of a bygone era yet indoors a delightful contrast between the old world in the part slate floor and old fireplace with high quality modern appliances and fittings which include an induction hot plate for cooking and a Bose speaker unit for streaming on mobile phones. Everything provided for a great break in a secluded setting. Overall a great credit to Joh
Thank you John - such a spot and such a host. We felt incredibly welcome and couldn’t think of a better place to unwind for a few days.
John's cottage is warm and welcoming. Craig and I felt safe and relaxed there. We enjoyed walking down to the river and having a chat with the sheep.

We had a lovely stay at John’s cottage. Lots of thoughtful touches, modern bathroom. Appreciate the breakfast provisions eggs, bread, milk, cereals provided. Location is secluded & quiet.
Don’t miss boutique wineries Charles Melton & Pindarie as well as Barossa weekend market! As others mentioned a bit of dirt road leading to the cottage but it’s not an issue for us & the drive was easy.

Johns property did not disappoint! The cottage was very clean with high quality amenities. Check in was super easy, especially as we arrived late at night. John was very helpful in suggesting the best ways to access the property - local insight is best! Small touches like the included picnic basket, breakfast items and coffee were a nice touch. It was lovely waking up to cows and sheep on the surrounding farm. This property was great value for money and I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the Barossa region!

My partner and I stayed at the cottage to celebrate our anniversary. We loved the place, it was so clean, had loads of original features but also felt luxury. John is a top host and went out of his way to accommodate us! We loved the location as it felt remote, but was only an hour to Adelaide and a couple of minutes from some great Barossa winery’s. I’d recommend booking a winery tour through Getaway tours as you can be collected from the gate. We’ll be back and I’d highly recommend the cottage to others looking for an awesome weekend away.
It’s a quaint and comfortable cottage.
The cottage was the perfect place to retreat from the rat race for a while. John was an excellent host and provided everything we needed and more! Definitely recommend
This place was amazing. So many thoughtful touches made the stay extremely comfortable. Perfect for a cosy couple getaway - I highly recommend.

Such a unique piece of history in the Barossa. It was a pleasure staying in this traditional cottage, enjoying the old world charm, whilst having all the modern comforts of electric blankets, heaters and dishwashers! You can decide if you want to have a toasty wood fire or stick to more modern heating options. John really provides a welcoming experience, fresh flowers, ethical products, treats and best of all, a very peaceful and private experience, thank you!
Cannot recommend this wonderful cottage enough. John was so accommodating with our stay and the thoughtful details made our stay very comfortable and memorable.
Amazing country retreat.
Thanks to John (and his parents) for the stay on the farm. We had a ball, sans children, and all the amenities we could wish for. Cheers. Scott and Kathy

John's cottage is a spectacular spot for a getaway, stylishly kitted out with everything you could possibly need. Ideal for an escape, you'd never guess the nearest town is just 15 minutes away. Thanks John!

Really enjoyed our stay. Was a little disappointed to have to provide our own firewood for the fireplace (and only found this out on the morning of check in) but aside from that we had a fantastic time and would highly recommend.

I really do not want to do this because I believe it is a wonderful secret of the Barossa and I do not want to share...but to be fare this is one of the best Airbnb experiences I have had...and I have used Airbnb quite a lot in the past few years.
The cottage is set back from Johns property and is very private with a lovely out look onto a garden and the farm its self. The attention to special details is amazing and the cottage has absolutely every thing you could possibly need to make your stay completely self sufficient. It is close to many wineries and Tanunda.
I have no hesitation in recommending this property for couples who need a getaway from their busy lives.
Thanks so much John for making us feel very welcome

Our stay at Johns was a very enjoyable one. Cosy little cottage about 15 minutes out from Tanunda on a beautiful farm. One of the best airbnbs I have stayed in. Will be recommending to friends and family!
Such a great little cottage with everything you need for a comfortable weekend away. We loved it!
A great studio cottage for a couple looking for a quiet time off the beaten track and away from the hustle and bustle. Most enjoyable. Johns little extras are certain to please.
Perfect little getaway cottage on a beautiful farm! Johns hospitality was excellent too! We really enjoyed our stay and will defiantly be back.
Amazing

The farm cottage at Buckberry End Farm is delightful, very comfortable and well set up.
It's situated in beautiful and peaceful countryside. We enjoyed walking down to the river each afternoon.
This is a great venue to stay and explore all that the Barossa Valley has to offer.
We'll be recommending this venue to our friends.

We stayed at this beautiful little cottage for our anniversary weekend and it was perfect. John was an excellent host, easy to communicate with and even let us have a late check out as there was no one staying immediately after us. It was a great location, very quiet and secluded but still easy to get where we needed to go around the Barossa. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a couple of nights away!

This dear little cottage stole our hearts.  The pictures don't do it justice.  Rustic with all the mod cons, very comfy,  very clean  and the  most generous provisions  EVER!!  The flowers  were lovely and the  attention to detail was amazing,  everything was  thought of. The views outside are spectacular especially in the mornings and when the sun is setting. We enjoyed sitting on the porch and wandering down to the creek for  drinks and picnics. We loved seeing the animals and sharing our apples with the horse and pony. The roads around the property and in the area have gorgeous vineyards and olive groves to feast your eyes on as well.   John is very friendly and  available if you need anything but also very discreet, leaving you to  your privacy. Tips: Chateau Barossa's garden was really nice and their leek and chicken pie with mash was delish! Seven hills winery and tour in Clare Valley is really worth a visit on a sunny day as is the Lavender farm. The drive there from Lydoch is gorgeous and going to Parson's lookout on Trial rd as you turn right from the Lavender farm, not to be missed. Mintaro is very cute and charming  (and small) if you like old English type villages.  The "Co Op: shop is amazing. We were drooling over all the cheese! We loved our time in the Barossa and the accommodation was an absolute delight and hightlight. We will come again! Thank you John :))
Nice clean cottage on the door step of the Barossa. It was lovely and quite with lots of birds. Loved our time there.
Amazing little cottage! We wish we’d taken advantage of the beautiful river BBQ spot on the property. Very happy with our stay.

If you’re considering staying here then do not hesitate. We have no improvements to suggest! We stayed here with our five month old daughter for three nights and loved every minute. The cottage is lovely and warm, quiet and peaceful. It is kitted out really well with everything you need. It was spotlessly clean. We appreciated greatly that the fridge had been stocked with breakfast and loved that there was a dishwasher, who wants to wash the dishes on holiday!? The farm is lovely will lots of opportunities for walks and wildlife spotting. Thanks John for an excellent stay.

Beautiful cottage set next to a river with easy walking access.  Very quiet and relaxing space with generous provisions.  Close to the Barossa wineries, wine tour recommended to make the most of the Barossa.

The best of everything, if you want a quiet relaxing break.But lots if things to do in the area if this is what you are looking for. Don't miss an occasion to stay in this quaint cottage,a perfect hideaway for two.
John's place was just perfect for our weekend away. There were lots of thoughtful touches that really made our stay special. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to explore the Barossa Valley.
A really lovely stay! A beautiful cottage with everything you need for a lovely few days in the Barossa.
Gorgeous, homely cottage surrounded by lovely farmland. Just what we wanted- lots of character and attention to detail. Still has a modern feel. We will be back!!
We had an amazing time at John's place. It is in a beautiful location, and decked out with many thoughtful touches which made our stay very comfortable and enjoyable. Will be back!
Beautiful cottage and area.  And awonderful hospitality.  Highly recommend.
Great place for a quiet getaway and enjoyed the extra touches.
The cottage was cosy, comfortable and the perfect base for exploring the Barossa valley. My partner and I were thrilled with the additional touches provided and will recommend to others!
The reviews say it all! This was an excellent stay with lovely provisions. Would highly recommend choosing this farm cottage when staying in Barossa.
John’s cottage was perfect! So peaceful and homely, and had so many thoughful touches throughout! Would definitely go back again! Thanks John!

Best value for money! A wonderful quiet getaway, secluded and peaceful.  John made a great effort to create a cosy and welcoming space, and was very quick to reply and help if/when needed.  We will be back again.

Perfectly based in the Barossa, John's cottage is one of those dream Airbnbs where everything is considered and well-thought out - with even a pre-packed picnic bag to take down the river and breakfast provided. It was also spotless. I would absolutely recommend this beautiful spot and John's excellent hospitality.

Wonderful cosy cottage to get away and explore the Barossa. All the small things have been thought about.  There ous absolutley nothing to improve on.  John's place was outstandingly clean,  comfy and well presented.  Loved every second we stayed here.  Thank you.

Fantastic place to stay.
Very clean and spacious
Highly recommend it.

Everything was thoughtfully and generously appointed, with beautiful fixtures and fittings throughout. Very tastefully and thoughtfully appointed, small touches like kitchen and bathroom amenities reflect John’s organisation as a host and contribute to a very positive guest experience. The property is stunning, and the location offers a beautiful slice of farm life. It’s location in the Barossa is handy, as long as you have access to a car.
I recommend John’s place to anyone I know coming through the area and hope to visit myself again too!
beautiful cottage and John has thought of everything to make our stay great. such a peaceful and quiet place.

If you are looking for a peaceful get-away in the Barossa Valley, this is the place for you! The cottage is beautifully kitted out and you are lacking for nothing. A lovely breakfast awaits you in the fridge. We arrived on a 40 degree day and John had kindly turned on the air conditioning which was very effective. The property leads down to the river an there is even a picnic set for you to use. Highly recommended.

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful stay in Buckberry Farm. The beautiful stone cottage is perfect for some peace and quiet after a long day exploring the Barossa Valley. We just wish we had more time to stay and relax around the property itself. Unfortunately we didn't find time to head down to the river and have a picnic. Overall the place was very homely, clean, comfortable and in close proximity to all the best cellar doors. The breakfast ingredients supplied in the fridge were especially a really nice touch! Would definitely look to stay here again if we return to the Barossa.

This is the perfect private retreat , away from traffic, noise....and people. John has thought of everything, from the lovely big towels and amenities to breakfast / nibbles in the fridge. This was a wonderful escape, it was peaceful taking a picnic down to the river and seeing the cows come in to the shed in the evening while having a barbeque, this is the place to be for a lot of serenity!! + Super fast communication and close to vineyards if that's what you are after, thank you John!

We really enjoyed our stay at Buckbury End Farm. The cottage has the perfect combination of rustic charm and modern amenities. Beautiful location and, though on a working farm, felt quite secluded and private. Perfect to use as a base for wine-tasting in the region, or just enjoying a few days away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Would highly recommend.
Great place to stay thank you John for the lovely clean accomodation and the extra special touches of breakfast, flowers and in our case accomodating us with an early check in.  Woudl reccomend

John's place is the perfect spot for those looking for a getaway. It's out of town so make sure you have a car but that the beauty of it. Quite and beautifully appointed we could have spent much more than two nights there relaxing and exploring the Barossa.

This delightful cottage is truly a hidden gem, ideal for a couple to stay one or several nights. There were so many thoughtful touches, including the making of a yummy cooked breakfast or supper. Also, very convenient for all the attractions of the Barossa Valley.

We have just had the best time staying at this Beautiful cottage. Nice touches like fresh flowers, plush towels, and happy anniversary sign made our holiday feel extra special🌷. We loved the cows and sheep, and spotted some deers on the field across the river. Thank you John.
Highly recommended.
Beautiful cottage in the Barossa for a  secluded getaway. John has thought of all the little things you need for your stay. The cottage has so much character! Would definitely stay again. Loved it.

John and Jess were awesome hosts, super quick on replies and really homely touches in the house. Coffee, tea, milk, breaky supplies. The farm was fantastic; felt remote but was only a 25 min to the town centre and wonderful wineries. We had a great time!

What a way to complete your Barossa experience. It was so beautiful waking up surrounded by farm life and finishing the day with a picnic on the banks of the river. John went out of his way to make our sister holiday getaway extra special by including a happy birthday sign. We couldn’t recommend this little cottage more. Thank you

Beautifully restored cottage with all the modern appliances for comfortable stay in a hidden section of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Loved all the extra touches like fresh flowering orchids on the dining table, sumptuous Sheridan towels and all the makings for a delicious breakfast including smoked bacon and farm fresh eggs.  John and Jess have done a great job of combining a mix of the historic building with all the items to make you feel like you never left your home.  Would definitely stay there again.
Fantastic stay!!! All we could need in such a beautiful country setting. Will book again when we need a quiet getaway! Absolutely perfect!
Fantastic accommodation! The perfect relaxed location with everything you need :)

Buckbury End Farm Cottage is a rare gem! Nestling in a working farm, with your own path down to a peaceful picturesque river, you have your very own haven and refuge from which to explore this iconic wine and food Mecca. The cottage is recently renovated to a very high standard, charming classic luxury! All the facilities are perfect and spotless, the hospitality perfect and the breakfast to die for! We will be back and would not consider staying any where else. Private luxury 7 minutes from the first Cellar door - perfection.
John and Jess’ place was perfect for a weekend away, with everything you would need.
Relaxing country cottage, close to winery’s etc. Nice change from the city life.
Excellent little cottage. Great location. Great hosts and very clean.
Great location and launching point for the Barossa. Well thought out accommodation and beautiful views. Breakfast a bonus and it makes for a great couples stay
Great little hideaway for two in the Barossa Valley. Well located to explore the Valley, tastefully decorated and comfortable. Highly recommend.

As described - a cosy little cottage in the country.  The cottage was warm even though it was very cold outside with the temperature dropping to 1c.  The Air Con was enough to keep us warm, but the open fire added ambience, although you have to bring your own wood.  It was a nice base for a short break from the city and a day out on the bicycles.  The Barossa cycle trail isn’t far away and the Rosedale Scenic Road is worth a detour.  We didn’t need to contact the hosts during our weekend stay, even though they were just next door, because everything we needed was provided and there is a combination key box to let yourself in.
An amazing space in a great area. Great ambiance with a fireplace and a well equipped kitchen. Great communication from hosts. A wonderful stay! :)
We loved our stay at John and Jess’s cute and cosy cottage. Highlights were having wine and cheese by the creek and getting to know the farm’s  friendly pony! Highly recommend.
A perfect romantic country escape. Would definitely recommend using the fireplace, gave that special touch. Very tranquil and still convenient to drive to wineries etc. Definitely recommend!!

We absolutely loved our stay at John & Jess's adorable cottage. Our daughter LOVED the animals (esp the cow), and we slept better then we have since she was born. Amazing location (minutes away from wineries), and we really appreciated the thoughtful touches (fresh eggs, bread, milk and breakfast food). Thanks again! We will definitely stay again when in the area.
Great location,  perfect winter gateway

A great spot to stay off the beaten track in amongst the farms - loved sitting in front of the indoor fireplace while sipping Shiraz from a local winery.
A good location from which to explore the Barossa region.
Great location not far from Lyndoch and Tanuda. Very peaceful in a rustic farm cottage, with enough mod cons to make it a pleasurable experience.
Quaint little cottage, with lovely touches, that make staying here idyllic. We absolutely loved the cottage!

John & Jess's hideaway is amazing! The property is beautiful,  and the homestead is so cosy and welcoming. John and Jess are lovely to deal with and very thoughtful. We could not ask for anything more, and will be back!

We had a wonderful time staying at John and Jess’s Airbnb. Gorgeous property with lots of land and animals around to say hello to.
It is an easy 15 min drive to the Main Street in the Barossa Valley.

John and Jess's cottage is absolutely lovely with a charming country feel, yet is fully equipped with all of your necessities. Its location is absolutely superb to many surrounding wineries and little towns for restaurants, shopping, etc. The cottage is situated in the back of the main house, but allows for full privacy and zen. We enjoyed the gorgeous scenery, the farm atmosphere experience, and ending our nights by the cozy fireplace. It was an absolute great getaway, allowing for full Barossa exploration and ultimate relaxation. We would absolutely be delighted to stay there again.

Wow wow wow!! We stayed here for two weeks and had the most AMAZING time! The cottage is clean and cosy, very romantic for a week/weekend away. The property is also stunning. We went for a walk down to the creek and loved it so much we had a picnic down there for a whole afternoon! I would HIGHLY recommend staying in this beautiful little cottage. Thank you John and Jess!!
My parents stay with John and Jess was lovely. John was very helpful with directions to finding the house, and the location and house were very relaxing and comfortable.
Loved our stay here!

This cottage is absolutely fantastic and John and Jess were brilliant hosts! I took my girlfriend for her birthday and they were kind enough to add a sweet birthday message on the bed for our arrival, and in the entertainment area on the property. The entertainment area was especially beautiful, a perfect place for a BBQ dinner under the stars, sunset, or by the fire. We absolutely loved the property and would recommend it in a heartbeat, John and Jess's hosting skills to add thoughtful touches, provide breakfast, and make sure we felt at home were great extras to make the stay extremely enjoyable.

This AirBnB is truly amazing! We absolutely loved our stay.  If you like the country and peace and quiet, this is the place for you.  The place is cute, comfortable and warm, you feel like you are at home.  I would highly recommend this Air BnB.  it is also very close to the great vineyards of the Barossa, with Tanunda at your doorstep and Adelaide not too far away.

I so highly recommend staying here! There were so many excellent little touches that made the experience so special. It's remote enough to feel private and secluded, but close enough to drive everywhere you want to go! There is a lovely walk down the back of the property with a beautiful tree swing by the water. The kitchen is equipped to cook delicious meals, or to have a picnic by the river. All the amenities are brilliant and big enough for two people comfortably. Brilliant!

This little cottage was perfect for a quiet weekend getaway and we particularly loved exploring the property and picnicking at the river.
The bed was super comfy and we slept soundly with rustling branches about the only thing to be heard.
John and Jess were super easy to contact if needed but we also felt as if we basically had a section of the property to ourselves.
Would definitely recommend.
Great place to stay to see the Barossa

A wonderfully private and safe space on the property
Close to the Barossa with everything that you need
Tranquil and relaxing... ideal place to escape the city life!

What an amazing place to stay! We visited the Barossa to explore over the weekend. John and Jess’s place was the perfect location to explore the Barossa and also relax and enjoy the beautiful views from the patio. The cottage itself is very well appointed and the perfect size for a weekend getaway for 2. There were so many thoughtful touches and great information about the area which made it easy for us being first time Barossa visitors. Communication with John and Jess was easy and quick as well. Very highly recommended!
Everything was as expected. Very comfortable bed, and the accommodation was very cosy and clean. It's also an ideal location for exploring wineries. Would happily stay again and recommend to others.

We spent two nights at the cottage and were delighted with our stay. John was swift at replying and sent detailed info as to how to reach the farm. We loved the country feel of being on a working farm with accommodation reflecting its rural location but with modern amenities. A great spot to use as a base for visiting the many local wineries. If we lived closer we would be regular visitors!

The Farm cottage was conveniently located close to several wineries in the Barossa region.

The hosts have thought of everything. The small details made for such a cosy and comfortable stay. The eggs, bacon, bread and milk provided was perfect for breakfast.

Being located in a farm it is natural that we had several spiders visiting us. Additionally, we may have had more than the usual amount of visitors, due to the heat wave. It made it a bit scary for my partner who is petrified of spiders, even though she grow up in the country. We survived though and the hosts provided bug spray.

Overall, it is great value for money compared to other offering in the region.
We had a lovely, relaxing and peaceful time. We really appreciate all the special treats and touch’s done to make our stay amazing. Hope to maybe return again one day.
The place was absolutely beautiful! Loved the small thoughtful touches and great location
Nice comfy little cottage on a quiet country farm. Roughly 20mins from Tanunda and all the major wineries.
Great stay!
Loved it.
Delightful little cottage, perfect place for a little getaway! Great communication from John and Jess too!
great air bnb in the Barossa, cute farm stay, nice and isolated but close to all the action, highly recommend it!

Waking up on a farm is one of the most magical, wonderful holiday experiences I've had traveling in Australia. John and Jess made the stay absolutely effortless, providing unexpected surprise amenities for us to enjoy on this beautiful property in the Barossa
The cottage was a very comfortable, peaceful place to stay. It was well located  and had everything we needed, plus lots of extra thoughtful touches.
A cute little cottage perfect for a weekend get away! We really enjoyed our stay x
John and Jess are amazing people that love hosting people. They will help in anyway they can and know all about the area. Furthermore, the Barossa Valley is amazing. Lovely cottage with cute details!

What a romantic little hide-away this cottage is, with heaps of thoughtful touches that made our stay even more enjoyable. If you're heading for the Barossa Valley, we definitely recommend this place!
A really cute, quiet guesthouse tucked away. It made for a really relaxing trip and a short drive away from some of the best wineries. We will be back in the future!
great place to stay for a cosy lovely cottage stay. great hosts. andre and pauline
Peaceful and modern on the inside one can fully provide for themselves in the cabin or go out to eat at the many places around the area property is quite central but you will need to drive.
John and Jess’ cottage was fantastic. There are so many thoughtful touches, they really have thought of everything to make for a great stay.  Perfect place for a weekend away in the Barossa.
After a period of isolation, it was the perfect escape to get out in to nature and still be so close to a number of wineries. A perfect weekend away
Lovely place to stay, close to all essentials, amazing views, very clean and cosy.
A lovely, private farm cottage with beautiful scenery. A very well thought out space and great location. Would definitely recommend this accomodation for those visiting the Barossa!

This cosy cottage is fantastic for a tranquil break, yet all the Barossa highlights are also close by.
The hosts had equipped the place with all we needed and everything from the fireplace and kitchen facilities to the bedding and towels were stylish and the quality greatly appreciated.
We loved strolling near the river and spotting the llamas among the sheep!
A great little cottage for a quick getaway.

John and Jess’s cottage is beautiful! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there! The cottage has a homely, traditional feel yet is newly renovated and beautifully decorated. The atmosphere on the farm is calming and highly recommend their place to stay.

We loved our stay at the cottage, amazing space and well worth a look. Location was great allowing for travel to a number of different tourist locations, but also provided a tranquil place away from the busyness if it all. John and Jess helped to make our visit extra special. Would definitely recommend staying here.
A beautiful place to stay with so many lovely touches to make you feel at home. John and Jess were lovely hosts. I will definitely be back!
The Farmers Cottage is cute, peaceful, homely and affordable! John & Jess are lovely hosts, prompt to answer questions and all round lovely!! This is our second stay and we will definitely be back!!

Beautiful little cottage, very cosy with the fire place going and a glass of wine in hand. Located on an amazing piece of property where you can un-wind and go for a walk down to the river and check out the 4 legged locals.
Awesome spot, cute spacious cottage with an awesome backyard. Only 10-15min drive from tanunda.
Great little cottage that is very spacious. Amazing location and great for a long weekend. Will definitely be back!

We absolutely loved our stay on John and Jess’ property. Our weekend ending up being a lot busier than we originally expected but being able to unwind the day on their beautiful property made up for it. The cottage is stunning, their land is beautiful and the homey touches made it very comfortable to stay with our 4 1/2 month old. We hope to go back soon
Had a great weekend here, the cottage was very charming and we were were given all the amenities we could have needed including breakfast. The location is beautiful too :)
The farm cottage has a wonderful with great facilities and a lovely location
What a great location and cozy cottage. We loved sitting on the verandah and using the kitchen for some relaxed cooking.
Our fifth visit to Buckbury End farm across forty years. We’ll be back again. Fabulous.
A lovely cottage for a getaway

This was a very enjoyable stay in the Barossa. It is a little bit further out, however was easy enough for us to find, and our Barossa guide was still more than happy to pick us up from here. As for the space, it was cosy and stylish, and the reverse cycle airconditioning was wonderful on the cool nights we had. It was a great bonus to be able to wander down to the river and experience the bleeting sheep and have a tiny taste of farm living. The breakfast provisions were also most appreciated (and delicious!) Would recommend.
Beautiful area, with amazing and thoughtful hosts. We loved our first nights in the Barossa! Definitely recommend for location, cleanliness and finessed touches.

Enjoyed our stay here, a unique and relaxing property close to all Barossa activities.

Sadly the power was off for most of 2 nights of our stay due to freak storms but that was not the owners fault.

Would love to stay again.
Nice place to stay very comfortable and relaxing.

john and Jess were easy to communicate. we were able to have complete privacy and walk around the farm and see all the animals. the nature was really beautiful and the little cottage was very comfortable.
thanks John and Jess
Super cosy little stone farmhouse. Really cute, air con was amazing on the 44° days we had. Kitchen was perfect for cooking and wasn’t too far away from Tanunda and other towns and wineries.
Lovely farm stay cottage in the Barossa. Very well appointed and essential amenities made for a very comfortable stay.
A lovely space and cute cottage. Not too far from everything!

We had such a fantastic time staying on this property. It was exactly as described, extremely clean and we spent plenty of time walking to the river for sunset and having a picnic. The spot is utterly beautiful, highly recommended!!
Great stay
Beautiful place!
Amazing place to stay! Exceeds all expectations and John and Jess have gone above and beyond to make sure its a special place. Would definitely stay again!
Would recommend to anyone! Great location, beautiful setting, lovely restored cottage and lots of thoughtful touches.
Awesome little cottage, lots of privacy with plenty space to roam at your leisure on the property. Can recommend for. Couples retreat.
A great spot for a relaxing break and to explore the beautiful Barossa Valley. The cottage is nicely renovated, well equipped and very clean.
Beautiful space, cute little kitchen, really sweet stay

I have stayed at The Farm Cottage three times now... the cottage is super cute, peaceful and a home away from home!  John and Jess are amazing hosts and are very responsive messages.  Do yourselves a favour and stay at the cottage, you won’t regret it!
This is a lovely little country cottage, the hosts have created a very inviting, comfortable & clean space to stay. John was very a kind & welcoming host. Thank you John & Jess.
So peaceful. Great place to wind back
A great cosy place! Would go back and definitely recommend to anyone visiting Barossa.
John & Jess’s farm cottage is a wonderful spot to spend a weekend in the Barossa.

Such a great little place, bit off the beaten track but basically between 2 lovely towns. Great kitchen amenities and delicious breakfast provisions. Nice and comfy bed, great lounge chairs and overall it was a lovely stay for our anniversary. Thanks again!
just as described, nice and central to get around in the barossa.

Such a beautiful little cottage just perfect for a romantic getaway! Lots of little thoughtful touches and just a relaxing and charming space. It's located reasonably close to the main attractions of the Barossa, but still seperate enough that you feel like you've gotten away from it all. The hosts are very respectful and allowed us total privacy and peace. I would absolutely stay there again!
A cute and cosy little cottage with everything you need. A short trip to all the amazing places the Barossa has to offer and a perfect piece of serenity after a day of wine tasting .

Awesome Awesome Awesome, tranquil little farm stay with the animals right at your door step. Great location to wineries.

Highly recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Serenity. And well appointed with both appliances and provisions.

We absolutely loved our stay! The cottage is so cosy, clean and plenty of space. We loved the little touches like breakfast that we cooked up on the Sunday morning, and took on John and Jess's recommendation and checked out Pindarie. It was nice to stay a little bit out of the hustle and bustle of Tanunda/Angaston. Cant wait to stay again and would highly recommend to anyone that is looking for a country get away :)
We enjoyed our stay thank you.
We had a great stay. Perfect for a quiet weekend and to explore the Barossa. Would definitely stay again.

The cottage was super cosy and the perfect escape! It was beautifully set out with all the creature comforts and some you didn’t even know you needed.
Thank you John and Jess
