A nice relaxing, comfortable stay. Very well appointed and kitted out. Appreciated the breakfast provisions.
We loved our stay at John & Jess’ cottage! It was very clean and tidy and in a great location.

Location was great - isolated and peaceful - great to get away from city life. Fire and cottage was cosy but some things could be better such as the batteries in the candles could work, or the fact there was only one robe to share. Communication was absolutely awful, reached out to owners and asked them to call me multiple times due to an incident on the farm with an injured farm animal and no one could help. We had to find a neighbour to help. Even now I haven’t had a reply from them. I understand they were away for the long weekend and had no wifi, but hosts should be contactable.
Lastly, there were mouse droppings when we arrived everywhere. We saw the mouse every night running around on the floor, even under our bed, he was even in the toaster at one point. We understand it’s a working farm and that’s hard to manage, but the droppings were everywhere inside and we couldn’t sleep both nights due to the mouse scurrying in the cottage. We went out to buy mouse traps too.
It’s a shame as the reviews were so great and the location and cottage was beautiful- but we personally didn’t have a brilliant time and won’t be back.

We had such a lovely time! Definitely a super host. Cooked breakfast provisions. Kitchen basics well stocked (oil, sauce, s&p, etc.) Very comfy bed and bedding. The only thing to note is the distance away from majority of wineries - can get taxi service but quite expensive. All in all, 5 star stay!
Sweetest cottage filled with character and surrounded by beautiful country. John and Jess were so hospitable and helpful, a truly great experience!

John & Jess’ place is beautiful and I’m already looking forward to the next time I get to stay and relax in front of the cosy fireplace. Its the perfect place to retreat to, on a lovely property which is not too far from all of the Barossa goodies. Highly recommend!

Lovely, cozy cottage. Enjoyed how clean it was and all the little luxuries. The fire place was so cozy and very effective! The scenery was spectacular. Loved watching the sheep, guinea fowl and the horses and your cute dog. We’ll be back. Thank you 😊

Great spot! The farm is absolutely stunning! The cottage is cozy and has the amenities you could ever need. It’s nestled in the Barossa so there’s tons to do in the surrounding area. John and Jess are great at communicating and making sure your stay is great.
Everything was phenomenal! Thank you

Want to escape? This is it !!
Such a treat.
Completely away from everything
Total comfort
All little details considered, right down to the luxe hair care and bone china plates ! Will be looking to return soon. Thank you
Really beautiful place if you’re looking to be away from the city to enjoy nature! Loved it, it was so refreshing
An excellent little spot which offers a cosy country retreat. Lovely a clean with everything you could need. Would definitely return!

Gorgeous place in a gorgeous location! I definitely recommend. Way better than the photos. The cabin is lovely and all the little touches were the icing on the cake. It was such a lovely time out to have. Leaving was difficult. Thanks Jess and John.
John and Jess were very easy to deal with. Their communication was great. The key is left in a key safe by the door so we didn’t even need to see them.

This gorgeous little cottage is the perfect place to have a cheeky, relaxing get away. It’s close to heaps of wineries and located in a beautiful property . I would highly recommend this farm stay to any one visiting the Barossa.
Lovely little cottage on a farm. Some clutter in yard but they don’t interfere with views.
A truly peaceful place to stay in an idyllic setting. Amenities were excellent and host communication very good.
Magnificent location with thoughtful touches throughout. So lovely that we actually got  engaged whilst staying here! A perfect base to explore the Barossa
Would give 6 stars if I could. Great location, incredibly comfortable bed, lots of little extras, and beautiful scenery. Provided cot and linen for our baby. Could not recommended enough.

A very cosy cabin with everything you need & a beautiful river close by the explore. We were very comfortable.
Jess & her family were great hosts.
My toddler loved staying here & playing by the river & seeng all the animals.
Had a nice time away at John and Jess’ cottage. Beautiful decor and peaceful location. Would suggest bringing extra breakfast supplies if you’re vegetarian, but very generous if you eat meat.

A lovely stay in the Barossa Valley. This cottage is a great place to enjoy the views and scenery of the region, but also affords privacy despite being conveniently close to the major attractions the Barossa has to offer. Would highly recommend!

Comfy little rustic-style cottage, fitted with modern conveniences. Outfitted with good quality appliances, towels/linens and ample cooking facilities.

Perfect spot for a weekend away.
A beautifully equipped farm stay in a gorgeous stone cottage. Location is close to major wineries and has everything you need for a lovely stay. Beautiful sunsets as well!
Clean and tidy cottage in a good location with good supplies, great for a couple's weekend away.

Quite simply, this is the best Airbnb we have ever stayed in. John and Jess have done the most beautiful job fitting out the cottage, which enjoys a lovely aspect across the paddocks. Located just a hop, skip, & jump from the best of the Barossa, Buckbury Farm is a must-stay!

This was our first time in the Barossa Valley and we loved our stay. The cottage was the perfect place to relax and wind down after a day at the wineries and has everything you need in the kitchen to cook a meal to pair with any wine you have picked up!
Fantastic cottage close enough to some excellent vineyards and restaurants to be convenient but far enough away for some true peace and quiet.
Gorgeous well stocked cottage near the Barossa. We loved our stay here
Excellent place. Very well presented and extremely clean.

I was blown away. From the moment we walked in till the moment we left, it was clear that an incredible amount of care had been taken to provide everything we could possibly need - from milk, coffee and herbal tea to a complementary bottle of wine, fresh figs and strawberries. Not to mention fresh homemade biscuits on departure!

It's very well positioned as well - a tranquil setting and right in the midst of the best wine region.

I'm already looking forward to my next stag and would highly recommend to anyone exploring the beautiful Barossa.
Such a lovely space! Very cottage yet funky decor and the owners are lovely!
Fantastic stay! Wonderful place to call home for the weekend while we explored Barossa valley. Highly recommend.
WiFi is not available no top bed sheet only 1 chair no table

Our stay at Tracy's place was outstanding and gave us the private little getaway that we needed, only a 10-15 minute drive to Seppeltsfield (where we had a spectacular dinner). We were so well looked after, with some lovely little surprise extras. The breakfast was spot on with homemade granola, yummy bread, fresh strawberries and coffee. The place itself was simple and beautifully presented and it was so lovely to lie in bed with the papers listening to the church bells on Sunday morning. Would highly recommend the hike up the hill to the quarry to take in the views back over Light Pass and the vines... followed by a dip in the pool! We will be back.
Such a beautiful spot nestled amongst the vineyards. Tracy was a lovely host and her homemade granola was delicious.
Tracy was a lovely host who ensured we were comfortable. The homemade granola and biscuits were a lovely bonus. We loved the peaceful surrounding and the country feel

We loved our stay! Tracy was very helpful in the run up and made us feel very welcome and comfortable during it. We were very impressed with the home made granola and fresh bread that was left out for us so we could have breakfast both mornings. The shed is perfectly spacious for 2, clean and has a modern yet quaint feel. Central location and access to all the main wineries.

This is a beautiful place to stay if you are visiting the Barossa. A quiet retreat with 2 very friendly dogs. Complimentary wine and strawberries, and delicious homemade muesli were a lovely touch. Highly recommended!
Quaint accommodation with beautiful decor and attention to detail.  The breakfast provisions were nutritious and tasty.  The shower was fabulous too.  Highly recommend.
Nice clean room. A close drive to all the Barossa has to offer

We loved the very scenic, quiet location with lots of history in a quiet village.  Great accommodation and lovely hosts.  Ideal place to return to after touring the area during the day.  Tracy was very helpful and a pleasure to meet.

Lovely home away from home in the beautiful Barossa. Comfortable, spotless, pretty & centrally located for exploring this stunning region. The owners Tracy & Matt were really welcoming & gave us lots of great tips & recommendations of where to visit, eat, drink etc. Would not hesitate to recommend.
The host canceled this reservation 68 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We absolutely loved our stay at Tracy & Matthew's airbnb, our little cottage was perfect, they are such helpful and generous hosts. Light Pass is perfectly placed to visit wineries and the farmers market. Highly recommend.
Lovely clean little room and friendly helpful hosts.

Tracy's place was outstanding. Impeccably clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. We stayed 3 nights while exploring the Barossa wine region. Tracy left us delicious homemade cookies and granola and left milk, juice, fruit and wine. There was a coffee maker with coffee pods and tea with fresh lemon from their lemon tree. The property is surrounded by vineyards in the small town of Light  Pass in the northern part of the Barossa Valley. Perfect for exploring. Highly recommended.

From start to finish, Tracy and Matt showed amazing hospitality and offered a truly unforgettable Airbnb experience. She allowed us to check in earlier. When walking into the cottage, we found baked cookies and sour dough bread, freshly prepared granola, fresh strawberries and a bottle of complimentary Yalumba wine. It was a very generous offering, not to mention delicious. The cottage was clean and cosy. Tracy and Matt were friendly and always available for any questions. Tracey even provided us crackers on the last night when we missed our chance to buy them as the local Foodland was closed. Thank you once again for the amazing hospitality. It made our Barossa trip unforgettable!

Enjoyed a peaceful and relaxing short stay at this lovely cottage at Light Pass.  Quiet area but close to vineyards and villages and an interesting original settlers cottage just next door.  Would recommend a stay at Light Pass.  Thanks Tracy

We had a great two night stay here. Very comfortable room. Room was immaculate on our arrival. Perfectly located for exploring the Barossa. Tracy and Matthew were excellent hosts. Would highly recommend staying here. Thanks!

Tracy and her husband were very considerate hosts. The accommodation is well appointed and very clean. It is situated within a few minutes drive to most winery within the Barossa region. Definitely well recommended.
Tracy was a lovely host, and we really enjoyed staying at her place. She really went out of her way to ensure we had a perfect stay!

The Old Manse Shed was a cute granny flat that is made to be very homely. Great little kitchenette with bread, granola and coffee included which we had each morning in the yard which was lovely. The two dogs and other family that we met were friendly and we were made to feel welcome. The shed is secluded in a quiet town but is close to Barossa vineyards (cab ride away, which was easy enough). The bed was comfy but very squeaky. The pool was great.
Tracy has set up an awesome spot next to her family home. Very relaxed and a nice little spot
Perfect little spot for a weekend in the Barossa; thoughtful touches throughout & all the amenities you need!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tracy's. She accepted our last minute booking quickly, and we arrived to a cute and cosy place to stay. We both appreciated the wine, granola, fresh bread and the surprise delicious choc-chip biscuits left on the doorstop one morning! Not to mention the recommendations and local knowledge Tracy and Matthew passed on. Friendly pets too!

Great space to stay if you are visiting the Barossa.

Homemade biscuits and granola a real highlight.
Recommended for all travellers
A really lovely little place!

Beautiful little place, friendly animals.
Nice touch with the bottle of red and the brownies and sourdough.
Highly recommended! Beautiful space in a great location. Warm and cozy with thoughtful touches to make you feel at home. Very easy to communicate with.

Tracy & Matthew are such generous and friendly hosts. We really enjoyed staying in their lovely, cozy space and were delighted to find delicious goodies and a great bottle of organic wine waiting for us on arrival. We were able to check in early, which we really appreciated and it allowed us to really enjoy our first day in the Barossa. Also, Tracy gave us fabulous tips on places to visit which we took full advantage of. It was such a great location to explore the Barossa from - close to everything and lovely to come home to.
Many thanks for having us.

Everything as described. Nice quiet spot. We enjoyed the fresh and good quality breakfast items provided as part of the booking.

PS... Willow Wines and Tomfoolery wines worth visiting!
Great value and location. Close proximity to everything. Good local tips upon arrival. Thx!

Cozy room, very conveniently located for access to the general area.
A nice sun trap in the mornings for simple breakfast outside.
Hosts provide excellent local knowledge of where to eat and taste.

Great place at Light Pass, ideally located between Nooriootpa and Angaston and just north of Tanunda. The courtesy wine, tea and coffee, cookies and breakfast were a great treat and Tracy was great to deal with. Two super friendly dogs a bonus! Squeaky bed the only drawback and keep in mind the accommodation is on the same block as the family house.

We had a very comfortable stay in Tracey's place which was in a great location for exploring the Barossa Valley. Tracey's personal touches and care made all the difference to our stay.  Looking forward to coming back!

Great spacious room which was very clean and comfortable. Tracey and Matt are great hosts who provided excellent knowledge about wineries to visit and where to eat. Nice bottle of wine on arrival together with delicious strawberries waiting in the fridge. Central and quiet location, close to a host of wineries and places of interest.
The host canceled this reservation 36 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

It's rare to find a host that represents so perfectly what travel can be about. Tracy's space is perfectly presented and immaculately clean as well as full of thoughtful touches. Tracey and her partner are filled with helpful advice about nearby restaurants and vineyards. A perfect place to base any trip to the Barossa.

Really friendly hosts and nice little place by their house with welcoming access to their pool. Friendly cat and Labradors. Suits well if you're only in for breakfasts and we've suggested darker curtains for sleeping in. Location was close to two lovely towns and everything in Barossa. Great experience overall.
We had a wonderful stay at Tracy's AirBnB. It is a beautifully fitted-out room and we really appreciated the thoughtful touches like fresh bread and biscuits.

We loved our stay at Tracey’s place. It’s very cozy and clean, and Tracey went over and above to accommodate my partners dietary constraints in supplying alternate breakfast options which was very much appreciated. The communication with Tracey was effortless. The property is in Lightpass so it’s perfectly positioned to access key points in the Barossa - such as Tanunda, Angaston and the wineries. Would highly recommend it - great value. Thanks, Tracy!

If you are into your wine and you like animals, this is the place to stay.  Tracy was very knowledgeable, not only about wine, but also activities in the general Barossa area, and you couldn't help but fall in love with Bentley, Paddington and Devon.
Exactly as listed, good value, perfect for your weekend get away in the Barossa on a self drive trip!! We will be back!

Very much worth every 5 stars given!
Tracy was an incredible host and her hospitality made our trip extra special! Her place was beautiful and in a great location would recommend to anyone!

A wonderful little place to stay for a few nights when exploring the Barossa. The place is in a wonderful location, just a short drive to most places.
We highly recommend staying at Tracy’s and loved the thoughtful touches like fresh sourdough and wine. Thanks agin
We really enjoyed our stay at Tracy‘s place. It’s a great base to explore the Barossa and Clare Valleys.

Beautiful property that was quiet and charming. Tons of wineries within a short drive and Barossa market close by too. Loved the heated blanket that kept us toasty during chilly June nights with the cool concrete floor. Simple but tasty homemade continental breakfast waiting for us in the room upon arrival. Tracy topped us up with yoghurt and cookies for the next morning upon asking. Bottle of wine was nice touch too although we didnt get a chance to enjoy as we were out at so many wineries!

Loved our stay! The room is very cozy and comfy with everything we could have needed and the dogs are beautiful and so friendly! It’s only a short drive to different restaurants and activities
Would love to stay again soon.
A great private space, with generous hosts. Very friendly and eager to please. Comfortable and stylish furnishings, the place left us very pleased with our stay. 10/10 for us.
Fabulous airbnb to explore the Barossa. Tracey's place is super cosy and the homemade biscuits and granola were amazing.

Tracy’s place is amazing, it was a beautiful comfortable space in a great location. It was close to all the best vineyards and they were great hosts. We had lots of privacy, and the accomodation came with some beautiful personal touches like fresh bread, homemade muesli, yoghurt etc it was excellent. Could not recommend staying here more! We will be back next time we need to visit the Barossa!

Tracy's place is wonderful. Clean, exactly as described, and the breakfast provided is amazing. It is in a great spot for touring the Barossa, an easy drive to everything. We'd highly recommend Tracy's accommodation.
Tracy’s place is perfectly located to explore the Barossa.
Tracey has wonderful accommodation with lovely goodies to enjoy
Tracy was hospitable and shared great local knowledge of places to visit. The pets were super friendly and bonus to have breakfast provided. It was in a convenient location to wineries and shops.

We loved our stay at Tracy's! It is in the perfect location to explore the Barossa Valley wine region. The breakfast provided was high quality and delicious! And the wine was a thoughtful treat! We would recommend Tracy's place to friends and would stay here again!

Very comfortable and spotlessly clean!
If you enjoy peace and quiet, then I would strongly recommend this.

Fabulous hosts, great communication, and a  perfect location to explore the Barossa. The room was very well set out and comfortable in a quiet location. Tracy gave great tips on places to visit. We would highly recommend staying here.
A quiet location, clean and very close to Nuriootpa and Angaston
Amazing experience - far more offered by way of extra touches than we would have expected. Linking in with a lunch at Hentley Farm next door will take some forward planning but an absolute must-do
Total privacy and an entirely authentic vineyard experience.

Cathy was an extremely helpful host.  The accommodation was well equipped and comfortable.  We had 2 children 10 and 12 and there were games for them to play.  It was easy to walk to the centre of town however we had terrible weather.  We would stay there again, understanding that it is an old house that has tastefully been renovated.
Well located home with good amenities for a family to stay in the Barossa. Close to wineries and cafes and supermarket.
Perfect location for great food and transportation

Cathy's house was conveniently located and nicely appointed. Communication was hassle free and all the information we needed was provided well ahead of time. Although we did not get a chance to ride the mountain bikes it's a good option to have and would be a great way to explore the area. We had a comfortable stay and would recommend to others.
Great location - close to shops/restaurants in Tanunda. House was very clean and Cathy was a great host!
My stay here was great and very relaxing. The house is well furnished and supplied with a beautiful back yard area. Cathy was very hospitable.

Cathy was on the ball from the start! Emailing with very easy and clear instructions to get set up with the keyless entry (very cool!). The house is well located, walking distance to shops, eateries and visitors centre. The two mountain bikes saved us lots of money as we did not have to hire from the visitor centre who charge $44 per day per bike. Short drive, or scenic bike ride to Nuriootpa and Angosta with great wineries along the way. Would recommend! Thanks again!
Lovely home, very comfortable and central to town. The garden was a hidden gem. A morning coffee in the garden, planning vineyard visits while soaking up the sun was divine.

We had a lovely stay at Cathy’s place in Tanunda. The location was fantastic—walking distance to shops and restaurants and situated in the heart of Barossa Valley wine country. The house  is very spacious with modern kitchen and generous amenities including bikes if you’d rather ride than walk. There were only two of us but the space could easily accommodate a second couple or family. It also has a lovely backyard space for outdoor meals. Cathy was very responsive to our questions and check in was really east’s We would definitely recommend this space to others.
Highly recommended for all the right reasons!

Nicely renovated old house just a short walk from the middle of Tanunda. Lots of extras (WiFi, Netflix, bath products, Sheridan towels, games and kids’ toys) to make the stay more convenient and comfortable!

It was a great base to explore the Barossa and the hosts tips for wineries and food were spot on.
Cute little house with everything you need to enjoy your stay

Lovely house which has been recently renovated. Its relaxing and comfortable. Great location for a Barossa getaway as a couple, small group of friends or family. The local area has great shops and wider area has many excellent wineries, restaurants and attractions which are all within close proximity to the house. Cathy was a fabulous host and we would recommend her as a host!
A good base for exploring the Barossa

We booked this accommodation for my 40th birthday for 5 adults and 2 kids (1 sleeping in a portacot). It was perfect for us all and we were all really impressed with the place. The garden is gorgeous, the house is modern and with amenities that are current, the beds were comfortable, great shower head, open plan living/kitchen area where we could all gather, it's a quiet location and within close walking distance to the main street of Tanunda. It's a central place in the Barossa and close to all the great wineries. Cathy also has planty of recommendations of where to get good coffee, best restaurant etc. She was quick to reply to any requests and issues we had. It was a great weekend and you must put it on your shortlist of places to stay in the Barossa!
Very lovely house with a beautiful garden. Right near all the wineries would definitely stay again!
Great space. Everything you need for a cosy and comfy stay and an easy walk to the Main Street and all the amenities you need. Would stay again.
Great location for our fine dining experiences. Loved that we could walk or ride the bikes to the shops. Thanks for a very comfortable stay.
Extremely helpful and quick with responses. Many tips for the local area and made the stay incredibly enjoyable. Enjoyed our time at the place immensely!

Our stay at Cathy's place was fantastic. It's only a short walk to the Tanunda shopping strip, including the Barossa information centre. The house is perfectly decked out for a holiday, with a ping pong table, darts, pool table, board games and Netflix. We enjoyed watching TV after dinner and eating lunch on the patio.  Cathy provided a guidebook with info on things to do, and how to use the appliances. Thanks for hosting us Cathy!

Great home, perfect location to walk into Tanunda.
Cathy was very friendly!

Cathy’s place is perfect for a Barossa getaway! The house has two large bedrooms and then a seperate space with bunks as well. All the appliances and glassware and cookware are of the highest quality and the house was sparkling clean. The backyard is a great place to relax after a long day of wine tasting.

Cathy is a great host, she communicate well with us and even prepare the place to be comfortable and cool upon our arrival on a very hot day. Cathy’s place is beautiful and we enjoyed playing the darts and pool in there too. The location is perfect, close enough to places that we planned to visit and quiet for a good night sleep. I’m definitely recommending this place to everyone who’s going to Tanunda 🌟
Great location for visiting the Barossa region, 5mis walking distance into Tanunda. Lovely quiet location
Beautiful house with excellent amenities.  Location is fabulous.
Great spot, great value, lovely little place to stay will stay again

Cathy is an outstanding host - great communication and looking after all the little things you need for a stay in the Barossa. Plenty of space for a family or two, or perfect for a couple like us. Close to everything this wonderful area has to offer - the use of the bikes was fantastic! A great place to stay - highly recommended!
We loved staying at your place and will use it as a base again when we are in the Barossa.
Comfortable well equipped house with great backyard and outdoor activities in a quiet street close to the main street

This house is set amongst some beautiful rose gardens. There was ample room for us and the big open kitchen suited our family dining perfectly. Games and a pool room for the children and a short stroll to town! Had a great stay.
A stylish,  and exceptionally presented place, with all mod cons. Definitely recommend if in the Barossa.

Great location and home is beautifully presented. Only 1 toilet but it’s separate to bathroom so we managed. Had 3 nights in Tanunda and could habe easily done more. Comfy home. Great laundry which is essential when traveling.
A great place to stay and a short stroll to nice restaurants.

A beautiful home in a great location. It was easy enough to walk down the main street when we chose to and close enough to drive to surrounding towns. The house had everything we needed to be comfortable like it was our own home. The provision of tea, coffee and toiletries was a lovely touch, as were the books, puzzles and kids toys. The backyard was a nice area for the kids to play too. I would definitely be happy to stay here again, or recommend this place to family and friends. Cathy was the perfect host, ensuring everything was just right for our stay.
Lovely, comfortable house in a great location. Very clean with a nice garden. Good value for money.
Beautiful home in a great location. The highlight was Cathy’s great communication and recommendations thank you
Superb, affordable, comfy coaches and a great outdoors space to utilise.
Great little spot
Centrally located right in the heart of the beautiful Barossa. Lovely warm & comfortable space... home away from home

Groomsmen used this house for the duration of our wedding. The house was perfect with a great backyard and good soacea for entertaining. Was so close to the wedding venue with easy access to Tanunda and the rest of the Barossa.
Cathy’s place is great everything as described and pictured. She was very accommodating and communication was excellent.

Cathy is a helpful host and place is nice. Two great double rooms and bunk beds good for kids. Place was warm when we entered which is always nice when you get a chilly winters days in the Barossa. Plenty of towels, pillows and extra blankets if needed and I loved the electric blanket.  Lots of lovely wine glasses so you can enjoy a glass of vino in, also all the local recommendations were great.
Beautiful property close to town and great place for the family. We really enjoy the home and hope to come back again for more wine touring

Cathy's place was lovely and perfect for our long weekend in the Barossa. We could easily walk to the main street for coffee and dinner. The house was perfectly set up with everything we needed - a lovely backyard, comfy beds, wifi, Netflix.
We had a great stay at Cathy’s place.  Excellent communication and a great location to both town and the wineries.  Highly recommend.
It was a lovely space to have the children. Great location with all of Barossa at your doorstep.
What an incredible experience. Cathy's home is equipped with everything we could have needed and more. We will certainly be back.
Great little but spacious house in the Barossa area, quiet and peaceful, very modern facilities, great games room with pool table and darts and lovely sunny well kept gardens. A pleasure to stay at!
Nice and large place with a responsive host.

The house was everything we needed and more. Well appointed, clean, spacious and walking distance to town!

A special thanks to Kathy, for looking after our every question, you made our trip that much easier.

Thank you for a wonderful stay.
We’ll be back when visiting the Barossa... hopefully in the not too distant future.
Great place with excellent amenities and excellent location.
Excellent spot, short drive to town and presented as advertised.

Such a wonderful place to stay in Tanunda - walking distance to the main street (including grocery shop and cafes), and easy drive to wineries. The house and garden were lovely, and Cathy had great communication with us.
A lovely home with all amenities in a quiet location close to the main st.
Our stay was fantastic. Perfect location the explore everything that the Barossa offers. Nice and quite street close to town.
Great place, great location, very comfortable

Great location to use as a central base for exploring the Barossa and an easy stroll into the main street for many cafes, eating places, shops.  Well appointed and renovated cottage with a luxury kitchen and lovely gardens.  I particularly liked finding a place with a pool table!
nice little house on a quiet street near the shops in Tanunda. Cathy was a real help to us in organising our stay in the barossa.

The accommodation was conveniently located, walking distance from centre of Tanunda. The check in was so easy and all communication from Cathy was prompt and accurate. One night we cooked a BBQ and had a very relaxing time sitting in the garden. Highly recommended.

This place is great! Cathy is great with communication, very organised with all the tips and instructions for the house. It's very clean, well stocked amenities in the house and thoughtful touches added to the house. Pillows and doona (although we didn't need it with the 40 degrees temperature) were good quality. We also had fun with the table tennis and pool table. A bit disappointed we didn't get the chance to use the bike due to the high temperature. Hope to come back again..
fantastic location, clean and well appointed. Cathy is an awesome host!

Nice place which is a short walk to the centre of Tanunda. Good value compared to other places we look at and ideal for our week stay in the Barossa with our young family. Good activities on offer to keep older children entertained as well. Cathy was great host making sure everything was setup for our stay in advance and gave clear instructions on how to check-in and use appliances etc.

We had a fantastic stay! The house is located perfectly, walking distance to the center of Tanunda and great for exploring the Barossa. House has great amenities, including lovely glassware and the air-conditioning worked a treat and kept the whole house cool during the heat. Beds a little uncomfortable, but aside from this would definitely recommend.
Lovely place with all the essentials. Hosts were more than a pleasure to deal with. Thank you for letting us stay.

Cathy was quick to respond to messages. It was perfect for our group. We would definitely stay there again if it was available.
Great location to visit the wineries.
Thanks Cathy.
Lovely house, great space and garden with pool table and darts and in an ideal location but still nice and quiet
Very clean quiet large  house close to Tununda. Great value. Would stay there again.😊

Cathy’s place was the perfect base for our small group for a girls weekend in the Barossa. It was wonderfully clean, well laid out cottage with nice local bathroom supplies and coffee pods. Would suit up to 2 couples or a small family in the main part of the house. Loved the local tips and responsiveness of the host.  Keen to visit again!

We had a great stay at Cathy’s place! The home is very well equipped, there’s lots of information for in the home and out, it was clean, spacious and extremely comfortable and there was lovely outdoor space too. Cathy was also extremely friendly and quick to respond with all communication. I would definitely recommend this home.
Great location, clean place, exactly as described.

Had a great stay here at Cathy’s place. Very clean and comfortable . Seemless communication and check in / out.

Tanundas Main Street restuarants Are only 12 mins walk the correct way and about half that up the disused railway track.

Asian Ferment restaurant is an absolute bucket list experience for wine , food and service , wow !!!
Beautiful home, close to all amenities. Communication from Cathy was exceptional, I couldn't recommend any higher.

This house was perfect for a Barossa getaway. It is close to all the big Barossa wineries, and an excellent coffee spot is just around the corner. The communication from Cathy was also excellent and she was very accommodating to us when we requested an early check in. Super comfortable stay. Thanks Cathy!
Cathy’s place was incredibly clean and is in a great location for exploring the Barossa region. The garden is beautiful. Was perfect for our little ones too!

This place is a must if staying in Tanunda. Was just the best place to stay if you’re wanting to walk up the street for eating out. And was just wonderful for just hanging out with a few wines and the pool table or table tennis.
Perfect for the family or a girls trip. And wonderful help from the host.
Thanks again Cathy it was just perfect.
Amazing place, if you wanna unwind play some pool, kick back and just unwind
We had a lovely stay at Cathy’s place! Everything was in close proximity and the house was filled with everything we needed! Highly recommend!
This is a fabulous place with a renovated kitchen and bathroom and is only a couple of minutes from the centre of town.

Access is easy and plenty of helpful communication from Cathy before and during our stay. Location is walkable to bars and restaurants. We were there in winter and found the back half of the house (toilet, laundry & bunk room) very cold and difficult to heat. Didn’t even check out the games room or bikes as found ourselves snuggled in front of TV on nights we stayed in. Appreciated the free access to Netflix. Bedrooms and living areas cosy and comfortable. House is not as contemporary as appears in photos but done up nicely.
A great place to stay! We will return!

Great place in central location. Lots of info provided on wineries/restaurants to visit. It was really cold when we were there and the heating did struggle to heat the house. Lots of room and things for the kids.
Wouldn’t stay anywhere else if coming back to the Barossa Valley!
Excellent place to stay, close to wineries and with all the cooking necessities with the added bonus of a pool table, darts and table tennis table. Warm and cosy with excellent internet and TV.
Clean, neat and little extras that make the difference.
It was absolutely fantastic - very clean and the location was fantastic. Very good communication as well including tips on where to go

Absolutely wonderful place to stay! Cathy was so prompt in answering my questions and so so accommodating. She provided some wonderful local recommendations. The house was so central to the Barossa wineries around and a really convenient place to be. The place was clean, home-y, and the backyard was beautiful. Thank you for having us!

Cathy was a wonderful and communicative host. All communication were quickly responded to.
The property was well above expectations, with the idealic location, fantastic house with exceptional back entertainment area and ping pong and pool that the kids took advantage of.

Would highly recommend and we will look to book again!! A++++ rating 👍😀
Great location, excellent communication and recommendation on places to visit nearby.
We found Cathy to be extremely polite and very obliging and the location very quiet and close to Main Street. Thanks Cathy 😃

We cannot rate our stay at Cathy and Carol’s place highly enough!!! The house and garden are immaculate and beautiful.  The location is great, easy walking distance to shops and in a quiet street. The little touches (especially the the kids toys, books, cutlery etc.) went above and beyond and enabled us to relax and enjoy our stay even more. The local tips and  recommendations were much appreciated. Thanks so much!
Cathy's place was stylish, clean and had lots of special touches. We loved our stay at Cathy's cottage and our weekend in the Barossa.
Wonderful place for a family to stay. Kids bunks and lots of lovely books. Beautiful garden and perfectly positioned within 2 mins of everything! Highly recommend this lovely place.
Excellent location and communication. Check in was incredibly easy and the house was as described 😁
Cathys place was wonderful. Its clean, spacious and fully equipped for everything you might need during your stay. Loved the big backyard and the games room

Great cottage for a family or two couples with kids. Beautiful yard and gardens for kids to play in, close to everything in Tanunda, and beautifully furnished and appointed. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to the Barossa.

Helpful friendly service.
Regards
Ben
Clean, neat and tidy place in a great location. Cathy is a great host who is organised and very helpful.

We enjoyed our stay in this very comfortable home.  The additional activities for the children including games, jigsaws, pool table, dart board and bikes were an added bonus.  My family can recommend this lovely home for your stay in the Barossa Valley.

Great location, clean and comfy, nice garden spaces, lots of extras for entertainment in case winery  touring isn't your thing. Pack your own cheese board, or better still, grab a new one at Wohlers in the main street!

This was a lovely place to stay while my family and I visited the Barossa Valley. This house is perfectly located close to everything making exploring the region very easy. Cathy was able to provide some tips for local places to visit which proved a hit. The house was very clean and tidy and the board games provided kept us entertained for the night. I highly recommend Cathy’s place for anyone looking to stay in the Barossa Valley.
Nice and easy access to the main street of Tanunda. Good space for two couples.
Fabulous location with great local information provided. Perfect for a summer/spring break.

What a house! We loved every aspect. Check in was easy with the code on the door. The house is well stocked with anything you would want for basic cooking, and we were able to make our own breakfast and coffee daily an eat on the patio outside. The beds have different firmness levels so you can pick the one that suits you best. We enjoyed playing pool and ping pong in the early evening.  And did I mention the bathtub?!? The neighborhood is very quiet and we slept well. There are a/c units if needed; the first night was chilly and there were extra blankets in the closet, and the next day was 94 Fahrenheit and we were able to use the a/c to keep us comfortable. We got amazing suggestions of things to do and places to go when we arrived, and all the good stuff in the Barossa is within a 15-20 minute drive.  We would absolutely stay here again.

We loved staying here. It's so close to everything, and has a beautiful garden/outdoor space for down time between trips to wineries. It also cost us the same to stay here in a spacious and comfortable house as it did for our friends to stay in a cabin at the caravan park. We'll stay here again.

This place was perfect for our overnight getaway to the Barossa.
Comfy beds, coffee pod machine, lovely wine glasses to enjoy the day’s booty!
Beautiful backyard complete with table tennis table - lots of games and cards at the house, too.
Cathy was fantastic and clear in her communication - she even offered us potential early check in and late check out! Highly recommend!
Great location, neat and tidy. Included everything we needed. Soft bed in main room. Firmer bed in the other double room. Very nice!
Central location, easy access and stylish, clean house, beautiful garden!!
Extremely happy with this accomodation. So accomodating and thoughtful. House is very clean and comfortable. Walking distance to the Main Street. It was a pleasure to stay here.
Excellent location, plenty of nice touches to make your stay more enjoyable.
A great location with a short walk to the Main Street. House had all the amenities required and felt very comfortable.

Perfect for our stay in the Barossa for the weekend! Cathy was super helpful and her place was lovely. The house is perfectly located in Tununda and had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again!
Great host, location and amenities
Great place in a really good location, so handy for everything.

Cathy’s space is a great place to have a central hub to the Barossa. The bikes make it easy and fun to ride around to local cellar doors and Cathy suggested some excellent winery options. The space is perfect for a couple or few couples or even a family.
Lovely little cottage in a great location
A great place to stay. Excellent location. House is really well presented,  very comfortable.
Great place and location. Walking distance to centre of town. Bikes were great to get around in too.
Great, convenient place to stay in the Barossa Valley. The house is close to amenities and is sparkling clean and very comfortable.
The property had a good location in Tanunda

Great little place with all you could need! Really close to town (short walk). Cathy was a great and very helpful host, offered some great tips about where to visit. Appreciated all the labels around the place.
We made the most of the 3 bikes from the place and cycled to several wineries near town.
Great house and location! Photos don’tdo it justice, really lovely place

Cathy was a fantastic host, very accomodating and the location of the property was convenient and easy to find and access. We had all the amenities we needed, although the place was a little dated compared with the photos. The back bedroom with bunk beds is an extension to the rest of the house and quite chilly. Perfect stay for two couples in the two main rooms but probably not kids. The rest of the property was great to relax and enjoy yourself, outdoor patio to gardens to quiet neighbourhood street, bikes were a definite plus, thanks Cathy!
This is a great place to stay if you intend on exploring the Barossa. Easy walk into Tanunda where the restaurants are, and a great hub for wineries. Kathy is great to deal with.
I would thoroughly recommend Cathy and her fantastic house. Well located in Tanunda, brilliantly setup & one of the most organised hosts I’ve experienced. You’ll love your stay.
Great location!! easy walk to main street.. comfortable accommodation. Value for money
Great place right in the middle of the action in the Barossa Valley! Enough space for the whole family!

A good central stay in Tanunda.
Cathy was a very responsive host and great to communicate with. The house is very well located, within easy walking distance to all that Tanunda has to offer. Games, books, bikes, etc, were great. It was cold when we stayed; the back area (bunk beds and toilet) was therefore a little frosty. In our view it wasn’t quite as clean and nice as the listing implied, however overall a good base to explore from.
Our stay in this house was perfect .the kitchen has all that one needs on a holiday.Cathy is a perfect host and is always available I recommend this house for both families or couples.
A very quiet and peaceful place to stay, everything was as we expected.
it is a central location, has everything you need. the table tennis is a great touch!
Fantastic! Everything you need for a getaway…even a scrabble board 🤩
Great location, house was extremely comfortable, good size, great kitchen and the rooms were nice. The family enjoyed the pool table and had a great stay.

Tania7:54 PM
I had a wonderful, relaxing getaway experience at this charming B and B residence. The beds were very comfortable , I appreciated having an electric blanket on mine! The kitchen is well appointed, and it was great to have such a range of things to do, games room, huge range of board games, books, a lovely garden to explore, and multiple channels and choices on the TV system. It was quiet, peaceful I would be happy to stay here again in future! Thanks for making it such a positive experience Cathy!
Cheers, Tania
This is a great location walking distance to the main Street. The garden is lovely and the house was super clean.
Great central location walking distance to restaurants and cafes. The house was clean and had all necessary amenities.
Lovely comfortable clean house in a great location.
Brilliant spot for easy access to the main drag of Tanunda. Lovely roses in bloom & great clean and functional place to stay 💯

Cathy's place is a comfortable, refurbished home on the fringe of Tanunda.  It was well furnished and fully equipped with good appliances.  We spent a week and had a lovely time in the area.  Check in and out was a breeze and Cathy was quick to respond and a very good host.  We would recommend Cathy's listing to anyone visiting the Barossa valley.
Lovely peaceful stay, walking distance from the town. Will definitely stay again.

Perfect location, plenty to see and do will stag again.

Thank to the host Cathy

Great location and well equipped house. This air bnb had everything we needed - we were impressed with the bikes which we used to ride into town.

Very clean and cozy. Would stay again.
Very easy check in process and good location (easy walk to main part of town). Had everything we needed for an easy weekend away. Comfy beds and great communication from hosts.
Great location. Comfortable stay
Great place, nice and tidy. For a good price, and a little extra help from Cathy to point out some great places to visit.
Lovely house in a fantastic location. Thank you.

This place is perfected located, close to the main road, but in a quiet secluded cul de sac where you can’t here traffic. It has charming gardens, a games shed where you can have hours of fun playing pool, darts and table tennis. Lots of different spaces to entertain, and good appliances to cook or prepare food. Old world charm and the comfort of modern updates, I had everything I needed to enjoy 5 nights here, and entertain family and friends. I highly recommend a stay here!
Great place, great location. Pool table and table tennis were great fun 👍
Great location and  quiet street. Cathy was super helpful with suggestions on what to see and do when in the Barossa.  Would recommend

Awesome!!!

Thanks you so much. We had the best weekend. We travelled as 8 adults sisters and cousins with their partners.Would recommend this house for either families or a group of couples wanting a Barossa experience , the home had everything you need. Great sound system, tv's all u want!!
Thank you Jason, for giving us the best of weekends!
Cheers
Mark

The house is beautiful, very clean. The only challenge we had was we ran out of hot water on the second night. No Wi-Fi, only at an extra cost which we weren't aware of, no Telstra Air connection on the tv and the dvd was a little bit temperamental. The hotwater system we found out later, has a timer so would recommend not taking a shower early evening. Just first thing or late at night as the hotwater system doesn't fill up again.
Jason and his wife seemed nice enough.
However couldn't recommend this place for the price.

We stayed here over the Barossa Gourmet weekend and it was everything we expected and more. Lovely, clean rooms and great spaces to sit and chat with a large group. Will most certainly stay here again if we head back to the Barossa.

Jason's home is lovely! It is well appointed and very well stocked so we had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay. The home is well located within Tanunda with everything in close proximity so ideal as a base for exploring the wonderful Barossa Valley. Jason was very prompt with communication which made booking effortless. It was a great Airbnb experience and definitely somewhere I'd recommend others enjoy when in the Barossa.

Thank you so much to Jason for allowing us the opportunity to stay at LiebenGott. Everything was thought of......even down to having lovely chilled water in the fridge waiting for us after a long walk! Every amenity was catered for and the communication was fantastic. Would certainly recommend it a will certainly be back again.

Michelle
Great place - really handy for a wine tour.
Beautiful house. Very Comfortable. Great place to stay.

Great property very central to the wineries. Lot’s of room for a family or larger group. Check-in and out was smooth. Taxi pick ups were also quick when we ate at the recommended restaurant from Jason. Would definitely recommend a stay here!
The host canceled this reservation 149 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
LiebenGott is excellently equipped and impeccably presented, the pool table got a real workout!
Very accurate description and photos.  Wonderfully clean and presents very well.  We're only sorry we didn't get to spend much time there - next time!
Excellent communication from the hosts. The place had everything we needed (and more!) for a weekend away. Great accommodation for large groups.

Our experience at Jason and Kathryn's place was a 10 out of 10.

Jason was super quick to reply to any of our questions prior to the trip and when we got there everything went smooth and the house was amazing and had everything we needed. The location was fantastic and we would come back any time.

Thank you Jason and Kathryn for having us! We highly enjoyed our stay and had everything that we needed for our short stay. Highly recommened for anyone who is planning to stay in he Barossa for long or short stay. A +++

Great house for big groups in an excellent location to explore the Barossa. We had a group of 8 and had plenty of room in the living areas. Quite a big kitchen (although we didn't use it!). Jason was a fast communicator and we were able to check in early which was great so we could make the most of our time in the Barossa.

we were really happy with the property. neat, clean and very well appointed. All of the beds and supplies were quality and we had everything we needed.

if we return to Tanunda, we will be looking at this place again!

The accommodation is centrally located to the nearby wineries and just a short drive to the centre of Tanunda.  The house itself is very well maintained, clean and there is plenty of space.  Jason was a very responsive and thoughtful host - we had a minor problem with the A/C which was quickly fixed after speaking with Jason.  I would definitely come back to this location and would happily recommend this accommodation.  My family equally enjoyed the space.
Great house. Lovely place and good communication. Highly recommended

Place was great.
Everything was clean and tidy.
We really enjoyed our stay and the pool table got plenty of use in the evenings after a long day of wine tastings.
The photos make the place look a bit dark, but this was not the case in real life.
Great place to stay with plenty of room for everyone.

Jason home was a fantastic place the stay, very homely, very clean and great location. Jason was also exceptionally quick to respond to a couple of questions and requests. The adults and kids really enjoyed the family space and pool table, along with some movies on netflix and stan!

Would stay again and highly recommend.
Fantastic house with all you could need for a relaxing and pleasant stay.

Great location in a quiet street and in driving distance of all Barossa attractions. Clean, spacious and comfortable, easily accommodated 8 adults. All communication from Jason & Kathryn was prompt and clear. We and our friends had a  fabulous weekend.
A lovely clean and spacious house, accomodating us, our children and grandchildren very nicely. Would definitely look at booking again.
As a group of 8 we had an amazing time staying at Liebengott. Could not have asked for a better house with all of the amenities and luxuries. Would recommend to anyone.
Loved the place!
Great location!
Really nice and very spacious.
Jason’s place is spacious, very comfortable, well equipped and met all our expectations. Location was perfect to explore many local attractions.

This property is ideal for a group, with a well equipped kitchen, very complex beds, situated in a quiet neighbourhood

Pefect place to stay AA++

Jason's house is centrally located in Tanunda with just a few minutes drive to the winery region. The house has everything we need for a weekend trip and has all the kitchen amenities, board games selection and nice touches like pool table and grand piano. Will definitely recommend staying at the house!

Was a fantastic place. Was a perfect home away from home for a weekend getaway. Had all amenities we requires plus more! Beds were very comfortable with beautiful linen. Would highly recommend and look forward to visiting again!
Great house in a nice quiet spot. Everybody got a queen bed too which was so nice on our girls weekend!

An amazing house with lots of space. Out  the back there was a park it was great not to be hemmed in. Even had a gate out the back to go to the park. There was a pool table and piano lots to do. Thoroughly enjoyed being there. Thanks
Very  comfortable. Well situated in Tanunda. Really enjoyed  our stay Would stay again

This property was very comfortable and the perfect location for our staff for a quick work trip. Would highly recommend as clean, spacious & very quiet neighbourhood. Jason was great to deal with & accommodated our needs.
Amazing place to stay. You can’t go wrong ❤️

This place is amazing! Comfortable, with all the amenities that one could ask for. The kitchen is very well equipped. We loved the fact that all the knives worked and the pots and pans perfect. Highly recommend this home. Excellent and worth every cent. The hours of fun around the piano was also fantastic. Thank you

This spacious and comfortable home is located in the lovely town of Tanunda. It is a 20 min walk into the heart of the town to grab a lovely coffee and is a 5 min walk to Lindsay Estate Winery Cellar Door (which is great). The house was very clean when we arrived and the air conditioning was on and the house cool which was great as it was a 40 degree day. The house was well stocked with all the general supplies you would need and was very comfortable. We were two couples plus two small children under 2 and it was just perfect for our needs. The host Jasón was very easy to communicate with and was a fantastic host. Check in was super easy as well. I would highly recommend this property and if visiting Tanunda again would stay here again with a group. You really couldn’t want for anything else.

Thanks for a great stay!
A great place with everything you could need. Easy check in and clear communication. Would definitely stay here again!
Excellent house, location and host. Everything you could ask for for a great weekend away.
Nice house great for families. Very quiet location and centrally located in the Barossa.
We found LiebenGott to be a large comfortable house with all necessary amenities and more.

Great location, view and house! Can not fault this place!

Our host was extremely easy to communicate with and replied promptly to any queries, the house is located in close proximity to Tanunda town centre
Jason’s place is very well situated. The kitchen is well stocked and there are plenty of games etc in hand. The billard table was a highlight for us! A great place to stay!

We had a wonderful time at this property. We were 2 couples but it would also be perfect for families. There are 4 bedrooms upstairs and 2.5 bathrooms. 2 of the bedrooms have tv's. Downstairs a family room overlooks the park, there is a fully equipped kitchen and a pool table which provided so much fun over our weekend. The layout of the house is fantastic and has spaces for everyone to relax whether you want time alone to read a book,  spend time with your group for a game of pool, etc, or have a quiet drink in the sitting room where a baby grand piano sits for anyone who can play. Jason, (host), was fantastic, replying to my messages within minutes. Thank you so much, our weekend was so relaxing, which was just what we all needed. We will definitely be back. A rare find.
Great house. Great location. We’ll definitely stay again.

This was my second stay at LiebenGott and I’m already looking forward to staying again! It’s always sparkling clean, the couch and bed are both super comfy and there is lots of space for a range of activities. Would definitely recommend!
Lovely home! Terrific space and excellent location. Very good value.

This house is beautiful, very clean and luxurious. The grand piano is an amazing touch!
The place is very clean and tidy, the beds are comfortable and the location is great.
The kitchen did not seem as well stocked as we would have hoped, but other than that it is a gorgeous house- spacious and comfortable.

Spacious home with areas to suit separation between guests for those wishing to do their own thing. Close proximity to Tanunda activities and located on a quiet street. Entertainment amenities are very good.
Wonderful big place with everything you need. The board games, pool table, and piano are all really luxurious. Great location, and great communication from host. Would stay here again!
Great place, exactly as described, or better. Rare to get 4 proper bedrooms, and heaps of indoor and outdoor living space. Great base for our barossa visit, will be back for sure!
Great location for Tanunda township and local wineries. Very clean and spacious for a large group.
Was a fantastic place to stay and great location!
Great space & host was a pleasure to deal with. Thanks!
Prompt responses from host.  Spacious and clean, would definitely suit a bigger group as they have all the space and quite close to some great wineries and eat-outs
Jason's place was fantastic. Great location and fabulous space. Would highly recommend.

We thought it would be too good to be true but we loved staying here.  The location was great for the Barossa Valley, as we were close to everything.  The weather was less than desirable during our stay but we had a great space to relax and entertain ourselves inside. Amazingly comfortable bed,  great pool table and amenities and a wonderfully set up house.
A great place. Close to everything the area has to offer. Well equipped kitchen, comfortable beds and lounge areas, and nice bathrooms.

The place is exactly as it is shown in the photos. No trickery. Immaculate, lots to keep the kids amused - games and movies. Rooms were very comfortable. Great location so close to shops and restaurants and a quiet street. Highly recommend

Was really clean.
Easy to check in and great location.
Perfect for family stays with lots of entertainment and games.
A lovely stay. Great location. Very comfortable house!

Such a beautiful modern home, very spacious for our group of 6. Great location & most importantly very comfortable beds. Definitely a really nice home away from home. Highly recommend this property if you’re looking for a nice weekend away in the Barossa with family & friends.

Jason is an exceptional host.  Always ready to listen, adjust where possible.  The house is very clean and has everything you would expect with an extra beautiful touch from your home to their home.  Lots to entertain all ages if you don't feel like going out. Easy to find too with close by amenities.
overall excellent experience, and all members of our group are very happy, especially the welcome wine offered was Fantasic gesture for the host.  Will visit again in future
Perfect place for a relaxing getaway... Jason is a super host and has provided thoughtful touches to compliment the experience
Home away from home.

This is a lovely home with wonderful hosts. Spacious. Well equipped. Very large spa in ensuite of main bedroom. Quiet location yet easy to travel to other locations in Tanunda and the Barossa. Excellent communication from hosts.

Hi
I highly recommend this place to stay in Tanunda. This house got lots of activities to do. The pool table and piano makes the stay memorable. The house was very cleaned and well maintained. The welcome wine was awesome as well. It gives you the feeling of staying at your own house. Looking forward to stay again in it.

Highly recommended.

Liebengott in Tanunda is a great place to stay ... it’s location is in a nice quiet residential location and there are plenty of amenities a stroll or short drive away. The house is huge, has a piano, pool table and large open plan living space and host was super quick responding to a query I had. The property would suit all sorts of guests and my mates and I enjoyed staying there for a weekend of golf and wine in the Barossa Valley. I highly recommend the property.
Thanks so much for a great stay at such short notice. It was perfect for our needs and we loved exploring the Main Street dining experience ☺️
Jason's place is well furnished and in a great location
Jason was great to deal with. Great communicator.
We had a fantastic stay. The house is spacious and well appointed. The kitchen was great for home cooking to go with the amazing wine from the area!

This is a beautiful house. Very spacious and fully equipped. They thought of everything. It is clean and the beds are very comfortable. The bedrooms are huge and luxurious. The location is perfect for a base to go to many wineries or enjoy all the little towns. Jason is very accommodating and responsive. You won’t be sorry in choosing Liebengott.
check in was easy and the place was spectacular
This is a wonderful, very clean house and we had the best stay! From a piano to pool table to a huge spa, we had it all. We will definitely be back. Thank you Jason, we had a great time!
Great spot for a wine group for three nights
beautiful place, nice and clean, we will be back for sure
An awesome place to stay in the Barossa valley. Big house that is great for families and couples. Pool table is a great addition to this place.

Jason’s house is a great place for a large group. We were comfortable and Jason communicated well.

The welcome wine was nice (would prefer it was in an unopened bottle not a decanter from a hygiene perspective). The pod coffee machine was a good touch with Vitoria pods.

Overall the house was very clean and great for entertaining with the pool table. The down side for me was the soft furnishings are a little dated and beds a little on the firm side.
Lovely property conveniently close to everything in the Barossa. The pool table was a hit with the kids.

Thank you Jason, we had an amazing weekend away in your beautiful Barossa Valley home. Clean and spacious, close to amenities and local Tanunda shops. Wineries are close for you to enjoy the divine wines of the Barossa region. Jason is a fantastic host and a great communicator. Thank you 🙂

The house is spacious and in ideal location. It has a billiard table and a piano - but that doesn't make it luxury. It's a little tired. Was freezing when we arrived, not been used for a while so wasn't very welcoming. The owner was very nice and helpful when the heating didn't work on day one and the hot water ran out on day two. We were directed to reset the fusebox and boost the hot water which is frustrating. Overall good but certainly not luxury
Highly recommend this great B&B. We loved every minute. The pool table was areal hit. Beautiful location overlooking a park.
Beautiful accommodation. Would highly recommend it.
Jason’s place in the barossa was fantastic. With everything we needed for a short stay. Highly recommend. Would stay again.

The house was spacious and clean and looked exactly like the photos. It was perfect for our group (two families of 3). The pool table was a big hit with everyone. The kids loved the spa bath, and my son loved the bunk bed. I loved the huge dining table: there was plenty of room for all of us to sit down together. We had a great weekend, wish we could have stayed longer. Would absolutely stay there again. Thank you Jason!
We had a wonderful stay in Tanunda. The house was in a good location and had excellent facilities.

Couldn’t have been better. The house was spacious and equipped with everything we needed, with plenty of personality. Jason and Kathryn were very clear and efficient in all of their communications and the location was great. Excellent value as well.
Great place to stay, plenty of room. Nice view of the park. Very large dining table/ games table. Pool table was lots of fun. Spacious bedrooms.

Had an absolutely amazing stay at Lesley Ann's cottage. It's centrally located, spotleslly clean and Lesley Ann was an incredible host. She made us feel like we were at home and made our expierence extra special. We will definitely be coming back! I feel like 5 stars doesn't do this place justice.

Lesley Ann's place was a welcome oasis after a long day touring the Barossa. She was a most hospitable and welcoming host, willing to guide us on our food and wine journey through the Barossa. Everything we needed was provided for and our stay was most enjoyable.
Warm and knowledgeable hostess, fantastic location and a very luxurious and private studio, with all you could want for an indulgent stay in the Barossa - Thankyou Lesley Ann!

Lesley Ann è persona molto di classe, disponibilissima e simpaticissima. La casa che mette a disposizione degli ospiti è meravigliosa, e solo la mancanza del bidet è un disagio che mi impedisce di dare il massimo punteggio. Il wifi funziona benone e non c'era traccia di insetti. La colazione fornita era gustosa e completa. Il giardino circostante è bello tranquillo e silenzioso e la zona è strategica per la Barossa Valley.
Lesley Ann is a fantastic host, her studio is beautiful and well appointed, very close to the centre of town. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and will definitely be back!

The writers cottage at Tununda offers the perfect getaway for soulful self time, a romantic escape or just to enjoy the many and varied offerings of the colourful Barossa region. Perfectly located right in the heart of Tununda, character and charm ooze from from this little slice of heaven in the Adelaide Hills. Adorned with original artworks and quirky charm, the warmth of this little love nest is matched only only by the hospitality of its host Lesley-Anne and the beauty of its surroundings. Highly recommended, we’ll be back, both for Lesley Anne, the writers cottage itself and the fabulous varietals on offer in this unsurpassed wine making region

You will not be disappointed. This studio is perfect for a couple - plenty of space and privacy and lots of little comforts. It's also clean and cosy. The photos do not do it justice. We were absolutely thrilled when we arrived. The location is also perfect, being centrally positioned to explore wineries and you can easily walk to Fermentasian or Zwines, etc. for dinner. Lesley Ann was a lovely host, and she has obviously put a lot of TLC into the accommodation.
The studio is outstanding. Located 5mins walk from the Main Street but you feel like you're in your own little world. Lesley Ann was the perfect host with lots of good advice for places to visit.

Leslie Ann's place is the best place we've stayed on our journey (and that's saying something for a 7 month trip).  Her place is well situated (all of the services you'll need are very close - and yet, the area is very quiet), plenty of room, the cottage is wonderfully decorated - and - very close to all Barossa wineries.  You will need a car for any serious exploration of the vast number of outstanding wineries. This place is extremely well located to get to all cellar doors.  Leslie Ann is a perfect host; extremely interesting to talk with (knows gobs about Barossa and about wine) and just an all around great person.  If you are going to Barossa - you've got to book Leslie Ann's place.  Trust me folks, you won't be disappointed.

Close to shops and restaurants, but felt like our own little hideaway.  Lesley Ann shared local knowledge of the area and great places to eat and visit.  Awesome host.  Thank you for sharing your home with us.

The photos are accurate but can't capture the wonderfully calm and positive ambience of the space.   The moment I walked in I knew that this was a special place.  Loads of space, lots of light from the large windows on three sides with completely private views onto the garden. Clean, cosy and comfortable.   A quiet, tranquil space and yet less to than 10 minutes walk to Murray Street  and the shops and restaurants.  (However, car necessary to go further afield.) Lesley Ann is the perfect, thoughtful host.  I definitely plan to stay here again.  Highly recommended for either a business trip or a holiday escape.

We loved our stay in the writers studio. It was very clean, quiet, bright and very comfortable!
Lesley Ann was a lovely host. Very warm and friendly and was very helpful with information and recommendations. She goes out of her way to make you feel welcomed. I would highly recommend staying here.

Couldn't recommend Lesley Ann's place enough! She is a truly wonderful host and the studio was an amazing space. The bed was incredibly comfortable, I slept like a baby! Great cooking facilities, lots of books to read in the comfy mezzanine nook area and a beautiful garden. A lovely area that's very close to the shops, cafes and wineries. I hired a bike and cycled round the Barossa and this was the perfect base. Thank you Lesley Ann for being so lovely and welcoming, I'll be telling all my friends and family :)

Lovely place and an absolutely amazing host! Lesley Ann was extremely friendly and accommodating during our stay. She supplied us with inside information about the region and things to do. The accomodation was even better than described as Lesley Ann had left some local food for us to make breakfast with. Location was also on point. 😊
Had a lovely weekend: Leslie Ann was a generous & welcoming host and the home was warm & comfortable.  Would definitely come again another day!  Thank you so much!

What a great little getaway in the Barossa. A cozy studio, close to town, but nicely tucked away it’ll be like your own little retreat. If it’s raining, you definitely won’t feel guilty about staying in and keeping cosy in the studio for an afternoon.
Lesley Ann is full of great recommendations and knows everything about the region. We really appreciated Lesley Ann’s kind spirit and knowledgeable.
We wouldn’t think twice about staying in the Writer’s Studio next time we visited the Barossa. Thanks Lesley Ann!

We had a truly wonderful weekend at the Writer's Shed. Lesley provided a very warm welcome, and had decked out the fridge with all the necessities for a cup of a tea and a cooked breakfast. This was particularly appreciated after we left our bag of food back home in Adelaide! The place was so much more beautiful in real life than the photos could capture, we didn't want to leave. Lesley is a fantastic host, and was very willing to provide us with tips to maximise our weekend stay. Will spread the word and hopefully be back!
Perfect place, in a great location. Very responsive and generous host. The place was cosy and filled with great jigsaw puzzles and books to keep us occupied. Would stay again!

If you want to chill out with your partner in a alternative gorgeous retreat. This is for you. Perfect secluded location close to restaurants, shops and wineries. Lesley Anne is the perfect host. And we wanted for nothing. . Pamela Adelaide. July 2017.

The Barossa Valley is fantastic: great wines, tasty food and beautiful landscape. The writer's studio is a beautifully/tastefully decorated self-contained shed, with good facilities, very quiet, and centrally located, providing access (by car) to all villages nearby. Lesley Ann was a great host, offering her local knowledge of the region, but also providing us with privacy. The only problem we found was the inflatable bed, which was not very comfortable.

The Writer's Studio was a really fantastic place to get away for a few days. It was walkable to some wineries and restaurants and the studio itself was well decorated clean, and well stocked with kitchen gear and entertainment for rainy days (which we definitely used). We would absolutely stay again.

We stayed at the Writer's studio as the last stop on a two week holiday - it was the highlight of our trip! Lesley Ann welcomed us warmly with a hand written note, fresh bread and milk, and supplies for bacon and eggs for breakfast.

The studio is comfortable, warm and clean and is decorated with so many interesting pieces of art. The blow up bed has a base and a pump to top it up and we found that it was as comfortable as a normal bed. Lesley Ann was also extremely attentive and immediately followed up an unavoidable maintenance issue.

We really loved the selection of puzzles, books and games, the little mezzanine floor was the perfect spot to relax in the afternoon with a cup of tea and a book.

Our advice is for everyone to ask Lesley Ann where they should visit in the Barossa. Her recommendations made our holiday, we wish we could give an extra star. We would come back here in a heart beat - next time for a longer stay!

Beautiful and very cosy. Close to the shops and walkable distance to the main cafes and street of Tanunda. It is tucked away so no traffic noise. Such a beautiful stay with a gracious host. Extremely clean and we appreciated the breakfast ingredients and fresh bread! Lesley Ann is an amazing hostess and the Writer's Studio is a must for a couple looking for a quick getaway from city life!

Thank you so much Lesley Ann!! This was such a beautiful location, house and all round experience. The studio was so warm, homely and inviting. There were beautiful flowers outside and views from the attic. There is no doubt I'll be back to get some quiet study done or be in close vicinity to Barossas best wineries again. Thanks :)

This place is an absolute gem! It was my first time in the Barossa and the location couldn't have been better, nor could I have asked for anything more from Lesley Ann as a host and the studio - was so well stocked, and a little bit magical! Lesley Ann made it feel as though we were staying at the back of an old friend's place, with lots of local tips and hot spots of where to go for great food and wine. She was so lovely, I'll definitely be back!

Very true to pictures, nice location to the main Street. Lesley leaves bacon and eggs and bread which is very generous of her. The shed is beautifully decorated and private being at the back of the garden. All the facilities are reliable and enjoyable to use

Had a great stay in the writers studio. Perfect space for an inspired journey. Lesley Ann was a great host with abundant knowledge of the areas attactions and fabulous places to eat. Highly recommend.
Lovely place, beautiful decor and full of light. Highly recommend staying here.
The Writers Studio is a sensory delight, beautifully equipped, very clean, comfortable and perfectly located for all the Barossa can offer.

Lesley was a great host and very responsive - always looking to guide and give us recommendations around town! Thank you so much for being very thoughtful - the place was in an amazing location, close to town, wineries and the place was very clean and homely! It definitely looks better than photos!

The breakfast was so good and lots of books, towels and general supplies to make it feel like home!
The studio was absolutely beautiful! Lesley Ann was extremely helpful in providing us with many recommendations for the area and making sure that our stay was as pleasant as it could be.

Lesley Ann is by far, hands down, my favourite host! The space was absolutely beautiful and she has thought of every possible convenience. The knowledge she shared of Tanunda and the Barossa was fantastic and much appreciated. Would thoroughly recommend to all and very much looking forward to staying again.

I booked this accommodation for my daughter and husband and they had a lovely stay and raved about how cute the cottage was.

Lesley Ann was so helpful and a fabulous host.

The house was super close to the main strip in Tanunda and Lesley Ann was a fantastic host. She was very welcoming and had a lot of information about where to go and what to do in the Barossa. Would definitely recommend staying here!

The Writer's Studio was perfect for our break to the Barossa. It is within walking distance to some of the best restaurants in the area, but if you fancy an evening in, the apartment is so cosy; we especially loved the reading nook. Lesley Ann is the perfect host, giving great personalised recommendations for vineyards and restaurants that really added to our experience. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend a stay here, and would love to return - next time for longer!

Lesley's place was incredibly lovely, in a perfect location, and just what anyone would need. Set on a wonderful property, the shed is spacious, stylish and clean. As a host, Lesley was extremely attentive, friendly, helpful and thoughtful. If you want to explore the barossa and surrounding areas, look no further than Lesley's place - I certainly won't!

Fantastic location and such a cozy and relaxing space. Leslie Ann was a lovely host and she had lots of great suggestions about places to eat/drink but at the same time she gave us lots of privacy during our stay.
