It didn’t feel like we were on someone else’s property. The tv had chrome cast which was awesome and Leslie Ann provided us with bacon and eggs for us to cook breakfast which was a lovely touch. We would definitely stay here again!

Wow! What an amazing getaway! Lesley Anne was a fabulous host! A very warm welcome with great tips on dining places and winery visits. The Writers Studio is simply gorgeous. Quirky and funky. Decorated with such interesting touches! Very clean. Excellent location. 5 minute walk to bars and restaurants. Fresh breakfast supplies were yummy! You’ll love this place!

Highly recommend the Writers Studio for anyone visiting the Barossa! Perfect location within walking distance to some fantastic restaurants and wine bars. So central, but also plenty of privacy tucked away in the beautiful garden. Lesley Ann’s local tips helped make our stay even more enjoyable. Will definitely be returning!
Loved our stay at Leslie's. Very walkable to downtown Tanunda. She gave some great suggestions on smaller and boutique wineries which we prefer more. Beautiful space!

Awesome place, very stylish and cosy furniture! Lovely host and fresh local produce in fridge. Great location to explore the Barossa and great insider tips by Lesley Ann! We will definitely come back :)
A quirky, delightful little place perfect for a weekend away. Lesley was the perfect host! Well done. Will be back.

This place is a great base to explore the Barossa, easy walking to the restaurants on Murray street. Lesley Ann is a super host, everything is covered. The "shed" is at the back of her house, it is brightly and funkily decorated but the total effect is charming, the bed is comfortable, bathroom is clean, kitchen works, nice bread, bacon and eggs in the fridge to​ cook yourself. We had two comfortable nights here. Highly recommended.

We absolutely loved our stay at The Writers studio. Lesley gave us a warm welcome and the studio was clean, quaint and had everything we needed. The local bread, eggs and coffee beans was an extra treat. Couldn't recommend The Writers Studio highly enough!!
Character, charm, eclectic, great location and very friendly hostess..... overall perfection!
Absolutely amazing! Beautiful place. Presentation and local Knowledge was outstanding! Looks exactly like photos! Very very happy with our first Airbnb experience!

The personality and character that this room exuberate's upon entrance is enough for me to recommend this studio to anyone wanting the true Barossa experience. This accompanied by genuine hospitality and friendly local knowledge/tips, made our short stay extremely enjoyable! Lesely, your airbnb is a true work of art and a credit to you! We hope to be back again in the near future :)

Amazing! We travel all over the world more than 15 years,but Lesleys studio was one of the nicest accommodation we ever have had!Very nice,clean,perfectly located next door to Tanunda castle, very good and practically equipped -great comfy bed,kitchen with more than you need equipment :),perfect bathroom,very well working wifi and TV,nice (Website hidden by Airbnb) we really felt like at home! The greatest bonus was Lesley Ann -charming and very helpful amazing lady.We can only warmly recommend this wonderful accommodation and five star is not enough!

Given the picture we knew this Airbnb was going to be a great place to stay, but we appreciated our place at Lesley Ann even more than expected. The little attentions, the [crazy cool] design of the place, the advice on where to go, the location; everything was perfect. Potential guests: Book this airbnb now! Lesley Ann: Thanks for having us over. :)

Lesley Ann’s studio was a great base for our explorations around the Barossa. She gave us plenty of tips for places to visit which we really enjoyed.
We were greeted with local fresh coffee, bread, eggs, bacon and milk which was a lovely surprise.
Thanks for having us and we hope to be back!

Lesley Ann is a fantastic host and the studio is the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Lesley Ann provided everything we needed and more. She also gave us fantastic local advice. The studio is surrounded by a beautiful garden and is a great place to relax. We hope we can come back soon!
Great little trendy place close to the main part of town. Lesley Ann was a lovely host.

The cottage is an open, airy space. Lesley Ann is a pleasure to communicate with and very helpful. The cottage is an easy few minute walk to bars, restuarants and the information center. The cottage has everything we needed. Bed is comfy. Highly recommend.

Staying at Lesley place with the best part of our trip to the Barossa . We were so impressed with how comfortable the bed was we decided to buy one ourselves. Loved the ability to do some basic cooking and the shed has all the mod-cons. Our only regret was not booking another few nights here!
The perfect place to chill out Lesley Ann is the perfect host she provided plenty of info about the area if we return to Australia would definitely stay in the writers studio
Das Studio war erstklassig und die Lage im Barossa Valley perfekt! Kann es nur jedem empfehlen 5***** Unterkunft! Lesley war als Gastgeberin großartig und hat mir manchen wertvollen Tipp gegeben.

The most unique place the Barossa has to offer.
I cannot express how hospitable Lesley was during our stay at the studio!! She ensured the studio was well equipped, gave us detailed information about the local area, the bed was sooo comfy and soft & the room very clean. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in the Barossa! Especially as it’s right on the doorstep of Chateau Tanunda (a lovely winery we also recommend!) Thanks again, Lesley!!!!

The studio is such a charming space with lots of books, board games, magazines, cushions and fabrics which make the space feel very cozy and home-like. I especially loved sitting in the loft area with the lights off with a cup of mint tea and star gazing.
Lesley-Ann was a great host and gave me lots of tips for food and wineries in the local area and we had a nice chat about our travels (and cats).
The house itself is about 5 minutes walk from the visitor centre and opposite a winery so the location is perfect. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Lesley Ann's place in highly recommended. The facilities are great and personal, and our host made this our "home from home". The location is fabulous with locally (especially at the wineries) and Tanunda is within walking distance with lots to offer. The welcome was great with fresh bread, home made jam and breakfast ingredients in the fridge. This Airbnb is highly recommended and I would not hesitate to book again when we are in the vicinity in future.

Paul & Val (Sheffield, England)

This was my first Air BnB experience and it was so lovely. Thanks so much for a relaxing weekend! There was delicious bread and jams/chutney in the kitchen when we arrived, and the shelves are full of boardgames and puzzles! I haven't done a puzzle since I was a kid! Lesley Ann was so kind and welcoming. We would definitely stay again and have recommended the place to others.

This is such a fun and comfortable spot for a great time in the Barossa Valley. If you enjoy wine Lesley Ann if a well of knowledge. Her place is inspired, comfortable and so well equipped that we had great lunches out but eat in each evening. All our needs were met including a good Wi-Fi. Would stay again if ever back in the area.

Lesley Ann is an amazing and generous host.  Her place is a gorgeous oasis that is exceptionally comfortable and convenient.  It feels like a home away from home.  I would have no hesitation in recommending the Writer's Studio as the perfect place to stay while in Barossa.

A gorgeous little spot with a winery across the road and a short walking distance from the Main Street in Tanunda. Lesley Ann is a great host with lots of knowledge on local activities and great wineries.

Our stay at Lesley Ann's place was amazing. The studio is large and light with beautiful details and thoughtful decoration. The kitchen is well appointed with a great communal dining table - the bathroom is sparkling with a good shower. There's a plethora of interesting reads, games and jigsaw puzzles in the cosy lounge which is perfect for sharing a glass of wine in the evening. Situated just off the main street in Tanunda, the studio is perfectly located to access some of the best scenery and vineyards in the Barossa. Lesley Ann gave us some fantastic local tips and really went out of her way to make us feel welcome and part of the local community. We would wholeheartedly recommend staying at the studio on your next trip to the Barossa!

We had a beautiful stay at the Writers Studio while we were in the Barossa for a wedding. Communication was very easy with Lesley-Ann, and we were very grateful for the breakfast supplies she’d left us, as well as her wealth of local recommendations. We’d definitely stay there again :)

Nice place, thoughtfully stocked, but park on street and walk down gravel driveway. Convenient walking distance of shopping and Main Street for bus connections, tours, etc.
Cleaning fee lifts daily rate into B and B price range

Thanks for taking the time to help us organise a little wine tour! Much appreciated.
loved your artist studio!! was perfect for my partner and I.
Very close to cafe/restaurants and wineries , will definitely recommend
Lesley Ann was a fantastic host, quick and easy communication and very flexible. Her studio is stunning, stylish, well located. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting the barossa!

Lesley Ann’s place was so bright and beautiful!  We celebrated my Birthday in the Barossa and Lesley Ann was very helpful with local tips and recommended great places to visit. Perfect location and walking distance from the Main Street in Tanunda. I would definitely visit again! Thanks for having us.

Lesley Ann is an amazing host and her studio is beautiful and very private. I’d recommend her place to anyone visiting the Barossa. She gave us lots of local recommendations, which were all fabulous.

P.s. her freshly baked bread is delicious.

Lesley Ann's place is the perfect spot for a weekend exploring the Barossa. The studio space itself is quirky, comfortable and beautiful and had everything my partner and I needed. It is a short walk to the main street in Tanunda including the Foodland if you need to stock up. There is also an amazing Cellar Door on the corner of Lesley Ann's street and the main rd, Z Wines.
Although the studio is at the back of Lesley Ann's place it is private and quiet. Lesley Ann was a fabulous host and was able to recommend a number of great spots for wine tasting and eating and we will most certainly be back to check out those we couldn't make it to all in the weekend. Cannot thank Lesley Ann enough!

This is by far the best place to stay in Barossa. Really loved our time here. It’s a really large space, feels private and tucked away at the back of the house. It’s a cute converted shed with amazing decor and a nice outlook on the garden. The kitchen is completely stocked with everything you could need. We were treated to fresh bread/eggs and bacon on arrival which was such a nice touch. The bed was so comfortable, doesn’t feel like a blow up at all. Had the best sleeps in it! Did not want to leave. The location is perfect for exploring Barossa, right out the front of a winery. Thanks Lesley for the tips and hospitality. We will be back.

Stayed with Lesley Ann for two nights as part of our honeymoon (kid free!). Had such a lovely stay, the writer’s studio is beautiful and cosy and private also. So many nice touches too, such as the breakfast goodies and welcome note! Great location, close to eateries and wineries, can’t recommend Lesley Ann’s place and Tanunda itself for a break away from it all.
Great location near so much in Tanunda and a lovely host.
The host canceled this reservation 138 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The Writer's Studio is a quirky and unique self contained unit privately located in a back corner of the property. Lesley Ann is to be congratulated on her initiative to create such comfortable and interesting accommodation. The studio is ideal for two people and has all the comforts and provisions of home plus extra. We stayed here for one week in total comfort and was a highlight of our time in the Barossa. The personalized service and attention was an added bonus to our stay.
Beautiful place in a great location, 400m stubble  to chateau Tanunda. Great styling

The Writers Studio is the perfect place to base yourself for wine tasting in Barossa. We loved the fresh bread, eggs and tomatoes left for us to create a tasty breakfast. The bed is super comfy and the gorgeous lighting  in the studio adds to the cozy feel. It’s walking distance to 1918 for dinner, which was lovely. And Lesley Ann’s recommendation for The Eatery at Maggie Beers for lunch and Artisans of Barossa for wine tasting were spot on. We can’t wait to return to the area again!
Lesley Ann’s place is a super comfortable, stylish and warm space. It has everything that you may need for a great Barossa stay. Highly recommended.

Lesley's place is absolutely amazing,  I completely understand why the reviews are so wonderful. The space is so private yet warm and welcoming, and the small touches completely made our stay in the Barossa. I would stay here 50x over, and will recommend this place to anyone staying in this part of the world

What a great place, the location was fantastic- you could walk to the Main Street in Tanunda. Fantastic set up and the place felt warm and cosy. Lesley-Ann has thought of everything including a delicious breakfast. Thanks for a great little getaway!

The place is beautiful and spacious, with very nice decoration all over. Warm thanks to the AC unit. And with tons of light! It is in the back of a lovely property, surrounded by a large, green backyard, and tones of quirky artsy details!
Lesley Ann kindly left some yummy goodies for us to enjoy during breakfast. She was very easy to communicate with. She lives in the main house within the property - however, the deck has lots of privacy.
Close to shops etc, and short drive to nice wineries and restaurants :)
Amazing space very central to town. Lesley is very welcoming and has great local tips

The writer's Studio was a perfect 'home' whilst we spent a few days exploring the Barossa Valley. Lesley Ann was a generous and thoughful host who looked after us very well. We appreciated her advice on the best places to visit and particularly enjoyed the quirky decor of her little studio. We hihgly recommend this place for anyone wanting to spend a little time in this region.
Amazing place to stay at the Barossa Valley, we loved it!

We really enjoyed our stay at The Writer's Studio. Lesley Ann was a fantastic host who provided us with a great private and peaceful stay whilst always being on hand for tips and information about the surrounding area. We will be back!
Lovely and clean space, with thoughtful touches. Lesley Ann was a wonderful host and gave us great tips for local sights and experiences, many of which we did! Would definitely recommend her place.

Lesley Ann’s place is an absolute delight. It is unique in its decoration and a smorgasboard for the senses. We spent two days there during winter....the weather was pretty wet on one day and we had no hestiation staying indoors, cooking lunch and sharing a bottle or two of local wine.  Take your time to look at all the books that surround one of the walls. The location is just down the road from the local Foodland, near the Workers Club...(great for a meal) and also down the road from Z a winebar...what more do you need?
Great host and a beautiful home
Lovely space a real pleasure to spend time there.  Well located and very comfortable
Beautiful, comfortable and stylish. We would love to stay again.
Great location, comfortable space, friendly host, and all the extra little bits to make you feel at home.
We had a wonderful stay at Lesley’s place. It’s located in an incredible convenient location and she provided great tips for wineries and restaurants to visit. We’d highly recommend!
A wonderful stay at Lesley Ann's place, such a lovely host and I'm sure I'll be back!!
We had the most amazing & comfortable stay @ Lesley Ann’s.  It was all we expected & more.  We highly recommend staying here and Lesley Ann’s hospitality was fantastic.
Great studio, well appointed, great central but quiet location, lots of lovely little touches, a great host. Highly recommend 👍
A wonderful place to stay in the Barossa.

Lesley Ann’s place was an arty and relaxing place for us to stay in the Barossa.

Lesley Ann was a great host and gave us lots of tips on where to go around the area.

There was fresh bread, eggs and tomatoes upon arrival which was a lovely surprise.

We would definitely recommend to stay here on your trip to the Barossa!
Fantasit place, clean and central, well appointed and with extra unexpected touches. Communication was quick and clear. Highly recommended.
Expect an amazing quaint  studio in an excellent location. Very clean and the host is extremely warm, welcoming, helpful and responsive. We highly recommend!
An outstanding time at Lesley Ann's - place was great, travel tips were outstanding, hospitality very welcome.  Right in the heart of the Barossa.

We had a lovely stay at Lesley Ann’s studio. It’s a beautiful space with everything you need. Also benefits from being in a fantastic, central location in Tanunda, with bars, restaurants and cellar doors all a few minutes from the front door.
Perfect location, lovely well designed studio!

We had good expectations about Lesley Anne's delightful studio after reading the reviews and in no way were we disappointed. Everything was perfect for our needs and we loved the quirky little designer touches that make the studio so unique . Lesley Anne was most helpful and friendly and we highly recommend a few days stay at her place
Great stay! Absolutely beautiful, thanks Lesley!

We had a fanstastic stay at the Writer's Studio. The space is full of character and fits in with the beautiful garden surrounds. Comfortable bed and all the necessities for a relaxing stay have been well thought out by Lesley Ann who also provided some fantastic personal recommendations for our weekend. Great location just a few minutes walk from Tanunda shops, and the communication with Lesley Ann before and during our stay was quick and helpful. We will definitely refer our friends to stay here for their trips up to the Barossa.

Cannot recommend enough! Perfect location, beautiful sunny cottage, well-equipped kitchen and a lovely garden for evening wines at home.  Leslie Ann was so friendly and provided great local tips (as well as beautiful fresh food for breakfast). Highly recommend!

this is a beautiful little place,
with a fantastic host. Lesley Ann puts little tastes of local produce in Studio on your arrival.
I would recommend the Writer's Studio to anyone.
Lesley Ann is the best hostess and makes sure you have a wonderful stay, just make sure you bring an eye mask is you would like to sleep in 😊
Cute secluded spot. Nice open and pretty studio space.
A beautiful place and lovely host! I recommend staying here for anyone visiting the Barossa.

Lesley Ann’s bolig er fantastisk. Det er et charmerende lille havehus i bunden af haven. Smukt indrettet og meget rent.
Lesley Ann var hurtig til at svare på vores henvendelse og kommunikationen fungerede upåklageligt.
Vi blev taget imod med lækker mad i køleskabet og gode instruktioner i forhold til de ting, vi gerne ville se i Barossa Valley.
Kan absolut anbefales

A wonderful retreat to escape for some time out. Super comfy, and the amenities you need, plenty of books to read, puzzles to solve, or just chill.

Very clean and tidy, lots of nice touches. Super close to Tanunda, the wineries and and all the Barossa has to offer.

Highly recommended.

Lesley’s place was wonderful. Great location, lovely space, lovely garden. Lesley was very thoughtful in terms of making sure we had everything we needed. Her local knowledge was also very useful and she has some great tips. I would highly recommend staying at Lesley’s.
Lovely eclectic vibe, perfect location we loved our stay thank you...👍
Peace & Quiet. Great location. Walk to town. Spacious studio space with quirky touches and everything you could possibly need for a comfortable stay. Highly recommended.
Ein super schönes und ruhige Quartier, kann ich nur weiter empfehlen.
Cannot recommend enough. Beautiful sunny cottage with a fantastic host.

We had a fabulous stay in the writers cottage it has everything you need and more! The location is perfect with a winery across the road and a very short stroll into Tananuda where you will find some truly exceptional restaurants.  Lesley Ann was the perfect host and we can’t recommend staying here enough - you won’t find anywhere better!
A great little studio, well located only a short walk to local cafes, bars and restaurants.  Very helpful host with lots of local tips.
We were there for 5 days and found lots to do, the Hill & Sun organ is worth checking out. Lesley Anne was a fabulous host.

We had a great 4 nights in the Tanunda for my birthday. The Studio is artsy, spacious, clean and well supplied. It was in a great location. It was quiet and private also close to town and right in the Barossa. (We booked a tour for one of the days so we could both have drinks and they picked us up and dropped us off at the front which was great). Lesley Ann was a great host, she provided us with delicious breakfast supplies. We had fresh (locally made) bread, bacon, eggs and coffee everyday which meant we could set off exploring easily without searching for breakfast first in town (fantastic!) Lesley Ann had some great recommendations, we went to a number of wineries and restaurants she suggested and loved them all! We highly recommend staying here. Thank you again for a great stay Lesley Ann.

An absolutely lovely stay. Lesley Ann is such a wonderful host & the studio is just gorgeous- even better than the listing pictures. I didn’t want for a thing during my stay.

The location is perfect, a stones throw from everything in town. Only wish my stay was longer - will definitely return !

Lesley Ann is an amazing host with a breath of local knowledge and great recommendations. The place is unique and peaceful, beautifully decorated and located right in the middle of the action, a few hundred meters away from the centre of Tanunda. We only stayed for a weekend but I wish we could have stayed longer, we had a wonderful time.
Wonderfully unique ... fabulous location ... very comfortable ... Lesley Ann rocks!

Staying here was lovely - a charming room, full of personality, felt very private and had a lovely outlook onto the garden areas. The location was fantastic for hitting the wine bars and local eating in Tanunda, plus access to surrounding wineries and Barossa offerings. Lesley shared fantastic tips for eating, drinking and local experiences. We followed as many tips as we found the time for and they were spot on, plus we have some amazing ideas for our next trip. Thank you Lesley!
Amazing

Fabtastic stay. The place is like the pics. Alle elements in there: calm, rest, books, even set of dvd and chromecast, kitchen well equipped though only one heatpit, bathroom immaculate and a treat.
Location is also great: from here you just walk within 10 mins to the best winebar and restaurant in town, how great is that.
Lesley Ann is a perfect host. I work in wine and she provided me with the exact right directions. She more than knows her way around the wineries so her advice is gold. And she gives you all the space you need but is always available to help out. And she is just a very kind, good and smart & savvy person.
This place was just what I needed, travelling alone and with my roadbike, as a base for cycletraining through the Barossa and visiting the best wineries in the area, all in a short timeperiod.
Delightful accommodation, central location but very quiet and private, fully self-contained. Lovely personal touches throughout makes for the perfect getaway in the Barossa.
Fantastic location, amazing space.  Felt so welcomed and lots of little touches.  Highly recommend Lesley Ann and the Writer's Studio.
Lesley Ann’s place was amazing. So close to town and very comfortable. Lesley Anne was also so great at giving us advice for dinner and wineries.

Such a great space to relax in while planning our time in the Barossa. The extra touch of bacon, eggs and fresh bread waiting for us on arrival was a delightful addition and Lesley Ann's recommendations of where to eat and explore made our time there all the more perfect.
Accomodation, host and location were all great. Could not fault it, looking forward to coming back.
Very warm and friendly host. Value for money to get a wonderful place in Barossa Valley. A place worth visiting!
I could live here merrily for several years.

We loved this place and Lesley was a superb host. Extra touches included artisan bread, locally roasted coffee and homemade jam. Lesley shared numerous tips on visiting the Barossa Valley. Wish we had stayed longer!
Very clean and comfortable, walking distance to the town center and winery’s
A terrific place to stay! Highly recommend for anyone heading to the Barossa valley.

What a lovely place to stay. Lesley Ann is a wonderful host and her knowledge of the area and beyond is amazing. The studio itself is perfect and quaint and has a very laid back, happy and relaxing energy about it. Highly recommend and look forward to coming back in the not too distant future. Thanks again for your hospitality, Lesley Ann. You’re a wonderful host.

If you enjoy a colourful, quirky and relaxing setting, housed within a rustic garden you will find the Writer's Studio the perfect place to stay. It is central within the Barossa, lending itself to a 5 minute walk into town, local wineries and a short drive to many of the major drawcards of the area. Leslie Ann is a fabulous host with a wealth of local knowledge and knowhow.
Nice quiet place to stay, with all amenities and a few extra touches. Great value, great place. Lovely host!
Great host and fantastic position. Can walk to the Tanunda shops and cafes.
Lesley Ann is a wonderful host and the location is within walking distance of restaurants in Tanunda.  Lovely accommodation with breakfast provisions and local tips made for a really enjoyable stay.
Lesley Ann’s studio was so lovely! It was a great location (so close to the main street) and very charming. Lesley Ann was a terrific host - very communicative and her recommendations were excellent.

The fresh baked bread was a highlight and Lesley Ann's knowledge of things to do and see helped us to experience the best the Barossa has to offer. I would not hesitate to reccomend the Writer's Studio for anyone traveling to Tununda.

Lesley Ann’s Tununda Airbnb space is fabulous. Much care has been taken in both design and provisioning. The studio has everything you will need to enjoy your time in the Barossa Valley. It was like a perfect home away from home. A wonderful location and marvellous host.
We highly recommend and will definitely return. Brilliant!!!

Loved this place! The space is amazing. Nice open plan barn like feel with heaps of bohemian style decorations. Feels really homely. Light filled and warm. The location is a short walk from the main street.

My sister and I really enjoyed Lesley Ann's airbnb. So my style, with the high ceilings and beautiful handicrafts sourced from India. The fresh bread, eggs, jam, coffee etc were such a welcoming treat. Lesley Ann is lovely and has excellent knowledge of the area. Highly recommended!

I frequently travel to Tanunda for work and Lesley Ann's place is by far my favourite.  Clean, comfortable, lot of little touches that make it feel like home.  So glad to have found this wonderful Airbnb.

Lesley Ann's place is so lovely! It's private enough that you feel like you're on your own, but Lesley Ann is there if you need something. It's a beautiful space, clean with lots of art and books, and it's easy to walk into town for dinner. We also really appreciated the eggs, bacon, butter and tomato Lesley Ann kindly left in the fridge for breakfast the morning after a long day (and night) of wine tasting... a perfect AirBnB experience!

The most perfect place for your Barossa weekend. A beautiful space and everything has been thought of. Lesley Anne even had a lovely sample of local produce for our breakfast. Walking distance to wine bars cafes and restaurants  but extremely private and peaceful. Thank you so much for our amazing stay.
Great location and an excellent host.
Lesley Ann has put a lot of thought into making the places feel like a proper escape. She offered lots of helpful tips of local places to visit and we throughly enjoyed our time there.

A great little studio that is quiet, comfortable and spacious.
Close walking distance from eats, drinks, entertainment. Would be comfortable staying again if returning to the Barossa.

Lesley Ann presents a wonderful place to base a Barossa adventure. She thoughtfully left local coffee, freshly made bread, butter, bacon and tomatoes as well as other staples for us. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and hope to return.

Absolutely wonderful place to stay, I would definitely come back! Lesley Ann is a very welcoming host and had great recommendations for local vineyards and restaurants. The studio was just beautiful, with lovely decor and great facilities. Excellent selection of puzzles etc for a rainy day too.
Great spot for s great weekend

Lesley Ann's writer's studio is perfectly located and beautifully set up for any stay in the Barossa.  It is a v relaxing space full of great colour and texture from her world travels.  Some unexpected delights on arrival made it very inviting.  Her food and wine tasting tips were spot-on, making our stay even better than expected.  The Barossa and Eden Valleys are a delight for exploring wine and food - punching well above their weight.  Lesley Ann's studio is well worth a visit when you are stopping by in the Barossa.

Private room out the back, felt really alone which was good. Very clean place with lots of entertaining things such as board games, and a tv, and wifi which was handy. Lesley was very friendly and helpful as she showed us local activities and supplied us with lovely local produce to make our breakfasts with. Highly recommend staying here if visiting Tanunda, evident that Lesley takes pride in offering people a beautiful place to stay.

Seriously brilliant experience. This sort of space is EXACTLY to our taste and met ALL of our needs. We feel we could retire to a space like this. Of this size, of this disposition, we would need very little more than this.
Great little place in a fantastic location. Would definitely stay here again.
Such a beautiful place, so close and handy to everything.
Lesley Ann was a great host and gave us tips on where to go for dinner and wine tasting. The house was decorated in an interesting manner and she left breakfast supplies for us.
A wonderful Barossa experience! Lesley Ann’s knowledge was so helpful and the space she has created is gorgeous!

Lesley Ann's "shed" is a perfect spot to enjoy the Barossa. It is within walking distance of great restaurants, coffee shops & the main section of Tanunda. The "shed" is extremely comfortable with extensive amenities & very clean. Lesley Ann is so knowledgeable on the area that you will discover more of the areas delights. Thank you so much for a perfect visit. Cheers Ross & Rosie.

Can't recommend Lesley Ann's place enough. The location is just minutes walk to the main street of Tanunda, less than 15 mins drive to tons of cellar doors. The studio is very comfortable and well appointed, but more than that, Lesley Ann made me feel very comfortable and took time to tell me some of her favourite spots around the area! Wonderful!

Lesley Ann's studio was perfect. Really nice attentions and perfect location. The place is in a charming environment.
Thank you very much

Staying at Lesley Ann's was a wonderfully relaxing experience. Nestled in her beautiful garden, the studio is equipped with everything you'd need and is only a few minutes walk from the main street. Lesley Ann was easy to contact and provided some very handy tips on the area.  She also, very kindly, left us some delicious breakfast items that we thoroughly enjoyed. Comfortable, stylish and surrounded by wineries - this was an absolutely perfect place to spend a few days in wine country. P.S - If you're really lucky you'll get a surprise visit from Chilli, the beautiful lab next door.
A great place for a weekend getaway. The garden is lovely and just a short walk to some amazing restaurants
Lesley Ann's studio was such a lovely place to stay. The artwork, book collection and her beautiful garden along with extra touches like fresh bread and local coffee made our stay extra special.
A brilliant location for your Barossa wine trip including top restaurants in walking distance. Supermarket, bakery & bottle shop just around the corner.
Lesley is a great host. Lots of tips and every suggestion was fantastic. Location is perfect and very central to the best wineries.
Lesley Ann is a fantastic host who is extremely well informed in the local area. The studio is more than you can imagine for being comfortable and clean
An amazing host with the most beautiful property.  Great amenities, local tips, location and privacy.  You would struggle for a better experience!

Lesley Ann's place is set in a perfect spot - close to shops, the main street, across the road from Chateu Tanunda and close to many wonderful wineries. A beautiful little abode in a wonderful yard, fully operational with rain water. We were also provided with the provisions to make breakfast which was a lovely surprise. Lesley Ann had superb communication and was incredibly helpful. We will definitely be back!
Perfect location, private, quiet.

Absolutely beautiful little place. It was so clean, spacious and very conveniently located in the Barossa.
We were greeted at the place and provided with some great recommendations.
Further, we were given the nicest fresh bread and some things for breakfast.
Lesley definitely goes above and beyond. Loved it!

A lovely place for a couple to stay and so centrally located it was easy to get around to all the local Barossa attractions.

We’d love to come back in autumn.

A very lovely little space which was homely and had plenty of thoughtful touches. A great host as well, greeting us as we arrived/departed and available for plenty of great tips for the region. The location was perfect for our experience in the Barossa, would definitely stay here again!
The best place to stay in Barossa Valley!!
I'm staying here twice this summer; enough said.
It’s in a convenient spot and close to everything. Lesley is a great host. Jenny also provided helpful information to me. I was really enjoyed the time I spent there :)
Wonderful host and a gorgeous private studio in a fantastic location.

This place was gorgeous . We loved the decor ...simple but sensuous  and sumptuous in its use of colour and texture . The host was very generous in her local knowledge  . Generous supplies provided for breakfast and access to beautiful fresh fruit from the host’s garden . Very good location with great local restaurants and wine bars within walking distance. Do not be concerned by the inflatable bed. It was incredibly comfortable and we slept well . Despite the modest size of the kitchen , we were easily able to cook ourselves a full meal . Delightful

My partner and I absolutely loved our stay at  Lesley’s place - if only we had stayed a little longer! The studio was clean, had all the amenities required and breakfast items provided. The location was great for us. It was only a short drive to the wineries we wanted to visit and a short walk into town. We’ll definitely stay here when we return to the Barossa Valley.

If the Barossa is an oasis then this is the oasis within. Charming, self contained modern cottage set in a beautiful garden with artwork inside and out. Breakfast for a couple of days including fresh local bread and Lesley Ann's knowledge and tips for the local area was much appreciated.
Everything about this place was amazing - hospitality from the host, extras provided, location, room and bed
Such a beautiful stay! Lesley Ann was amazing! Will recommend to friends and family staying in the Barossa Valley in the future! :)
Lesley Ann is an exceptional host lots of tips and wonderful local knowledge. Accommodation sparkling clean with full amenities and great location walking distance to Main Street highly recommend.

The perfect place to stay, relax in the studio, read a book overlooking the quirky gardens, or marvel at the endless amount of artwork in & around the studio.  It’s close to the  town centre, only a 10 minute walk! Our host Lesley Ann was lovely, we’ll definitely be back - Thanku

The Writer's Studio is a lovely space to stay, and a perfect jumping-off point for exploring the Barossa.
Located close enough to the center of Tanunda to stroll into town, but far enough out for a sense of peace and quiet, the Studio has been comfortably furnished and beautifully decorated.
Lesley Ann, our gracious host, also provided accoutrements like fresh milk and bread, and locally produced coffee, which made staying in during rainy weather as enjoyable as our adventures out and about.
Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this space to any couple looking for a getaway.
A lovely space thoughtfully fitted out and filled with interesting objects. A short walk to main street. Highly recommended
Spectacular place. So hearty and warm. It’s just what you need to relax your mind and soul.
Amazing hospitality, great location in Tanunda

Cannot recommend this place enough!! Wonderful location close to the Main Street and surrounded by wineries... beautifully styled.... everything you need in one! Will definitely be back to Tanunda and hopefully get to experience Lesley Ann’s beautiful place once again!
Lesley Ann’s place is beautiful! In a great location, close walk to town centre and drive to nearby wineries. Perfect spot for a getaway

Lesley Ann is a wonderfully warm and gracious host. The space is incredibly beautiful and stylish. So close to everything; just a short walk to the Main Street. Lesley Ann was very quick to respond and a great host!
Highly recommend!

The writer’s retreat is a beautifully designed, private, art filled studio set in Lesley Ann’s lovely gardens. She is a wonderful host.
The town of Tanunda is beautiful. A perfect place for a refreshing getaway from the city.
Such a beautiful place, so close to the Main Street.
The place is as nice as it looks online.  Very spacious, great host, perfect location and excellent value for money.  Would recommend this place to anyone wanting a relaxing stay in the Barossa.
Good value, lovely host, not the first time I have stayed

This studio is such a gorgeous, bright space to be in (even on a cold, wet, winter's day). It has everything you need for a long or short stay. Great kitchen facilities, hot shower, comfortable bed, and the upstairs reading/relaxation nook is a particularly beautiful space.
Lesley Ann was a terrific host and had plenty of local knowledge and tips to share, which we hope to take advantage of next visit.
We really enjoyed the Farmer's Market in Angaston on Saturday morning and Vino Lokal in Tanunda (walking distance from the studio).
We stayed for two nights, but would love to return for longer so we have a better balance of exploring, but also staying in to enjoy this gorgeous space.

This place was absolutely beautiful and in the perfect location! The studio was so cosy and nicely arranged, it made it hard to leave. Being right in the middle of Tanunda meant almost everything was less than a 15 minute drive. Lesley was very friendly, super helpful and gave great local insights. Would definitely recommend staying here!

An absolutely wonderful stay! We loved the decor and the feel of the place, and the upstairs nook which was a warm place to relax in the afternoon. A comfortable bed, plenty of tea and coffee, and a fresh loaf of bread. Not to mention a beautiful sunny garden to relax in. We were grateful for Lesley’s quick replies and her great hospitality, whilst still feeling like we had our space and privacy. The studio is also a short walk to Foodland and the Main Street which was convenient. I hope to stay again in the future!
Interesting eclectic decor.  Very peaceful.  Lovely garden with little nooks to sit in & enjoy the surroundings.
We adored the natural light in the space and Lesley Ann was a fantastic host. Great with local tips, thoughtful touches all around the space and we'd love to come back again!

Lesley Ann is a great host, who provides good local knowledge. Her place is cosy, vibrant and stylish. It is the perfect escape get away.  We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend it. We will return.

Extremely well located. Easy checkin and excellent communication by Lesley-Ann. The ‘shed’ is delightful- full of arty and thoughtful touches and also very comfortable. Lesley- Ann provides many suggestions on things to see that are tailored to your needs.
Wonderful and quirky place to stay in. Good local knowledge and personal touch to the accommodation. Would recommend

The shed is a wonderful studio with everything you need - including a super comfy bed! Its a true gem. Lesley makes you feel welcome and gives you all the tips you need for the area. Location is excellent, short walk to main street. I highly  recommand this place.
Great location and lovely host! Definitely recommend.

This is a delightful, exceptionally well equipped  and private studio. Lesley Ann is extremely hospitable and helpful without being intrusive. The garden is fabulous - it is indeed a special place and a great base for exploring the wonderful Barossa region.

Really enjoyed my stay in Writers studio. Very eclectic
close and convenient to hotels and shopping
Situated opposite Chateau Tanunda
The cottage garden in beautiful

Amazing location and great retreat to stay in. It’s at the back of Lesleys house and she does a great job accomodating and giving advice of places to go.

Great facilities and Lesley went the extra mile making our stay a great one.
Beautiful place in a great location, for a good price. Plenty of tips for things to do
Great location, beautiful space, perfect for a weekend away.

Wonderful wonderful wonderful!!!
The studio was extremely spacious and quirky with an extremely comfortable bed and a well equipped kitchen which Lesley Ann kindly provided enough goodies such as eggs, bacon, bread etc for at least a couple of brekkies. It was so wonderful waking up to the birds singing and looking out to a beautiful garden full of gorgeous pink roses. Lesley provided valuable advice on restaurants etc.
Most of the fantastic wineries were within 10 min drive while the local supermarket was only 5 min walk.
I have no hesitation on recommending Lesley's place.

The writer's studio was a perfect place to stay in the Barossa. So close to the main shops and very convenient for surrounding wineries. Lesley Ann was friendly and very helpful. I can definitely recommend this place to stay!

Lesley Ann provides such a wonderful and welcoming place for you to stay, she provided information when necessary but allowed us to feel as though we had our own space. The Writers Studio is an amazing place and offers great value for money with the bonus extra of Lesley providing supplies such as bacon, eggs, bread and tomatoes for breakfast. I look forward to staying here again.
Lovely place, lovely experience, lovely fresh baked bread and lovely host. Could not recommend more. :)

Absolutely amazing accommodation.  Has everything you could possibly need for a very relaxing and comfortable stay in the Barossa. Walking distance to all the wonderful places Tanunda has to offer. Extremely quiet location. Very comfortable bed. Gorgeous garden to dine or just contemplate! Our stay was extended due to an immediate "Covid lockdown". Lesley Ann afforded us the most generous and kind support through this unexpected time of turmoil. We can't thank her enough. We know you will enjoy your stay in 'The Writer's Studio'  and we have no hesitation in highly recommending this wonderful space.

The Writers Studio was such a lovely place to stay, and very centrally located for Tanunda with the high street just down the road.
Lesley was an incredibly welcoming host offering up tips, tricks and local knowledge. A lovely surprise for some yummy breakfast bits too. Would definitely recommend.
Exceptional reviews of this place did not disappoint! Space and host were equally fantastic - highly recommend!

Lesley’s home was beautiful and exceeded our expectations. She had so much local knowledge to share with us that helped us shape our time in the Barossa. Her gardens are stunning and we’ve gone home with inspo for our own backyard. We will definitely be back!

The writer’s studio is truly an amazing space that was unlike anything we had experienced before. The property was absolutely beautiful, and we loved learning about how Lesley Ann had made or designed many of the items on-site. The living space was extremely well-equipped (we did a fair bit of cooking) and Lesley Ann was very helpful with all our requests. The studio is perfectly located for checking out all the local wineries and sights, we really could not have picked a better place. We are so thankful to Lesley Ann for all her help and kindness.
Great place, excellent location. Hospitality was excellent and even supplied breakfast which was lovely.

A delightful, interesting and character filled space which was perfect for a weekend Barossa escape. We loved the open plan design and great location as only a short walk to the Main Street and lovely wine bars. Being able to pick delicious peaches off the tree out the back door was a real treat. Lesley Ann was there for any help if needed but we had privacy as we were in the back corner of the garden away from the beautiful main house.

The Writer's Studio is in a fantastic location enclosed in a beautiful garden and Lesley Ann has great knowledge of the valley. She was also very warm and inviting. I highly recommend for anyone wanting to be in a good central location to access the wineries in the Barossa Valley.

The Writer’s studio is an absolute treat!
Very well equipped, clean, comfortable and charming accommodation with fantastic service.
Lesley Ann was a perfect host.
We’ll be back!
A beautiful and intimate place to stay. Everything is provided for, well presented and comfortable. Within walking distance to many restaurants. Lesley is a great host and will look after you.
A lovely place for a couple to stay and so centrally located it was easy to get around to all the local Barossa attractions. We enjoyed our stay and would love to come back in spring.
We enjoyed a vibrant and creative space in a central location and wonderful hospitality with thoughtful extras.  Thank you Lesley Ann!

What a lovely stay!
The Writer's Studio is exactly what it says on the tin, quirky and relaxing!
As always the stays are made by the host and although we didn't get to spend much time chatting to Lesley-Ann she made us feel very welcome and we even got a tour of the vegetable and fruit patch!!
Very fresh I highly recommend borrowing some to cook with your food, delicious!
Tanunda is such a lovely little town and it helps when you have somewhere to go that feels like home.
Would highly recommend and we will be back!

Had the most wonderful 3 night getaway at Lesley Ann's home. The writer's studio is a big, beautiful lofted studio behind her house, among the lovely garden and orchard. The studio had plenty of books and puzzles to occupy your time, though we were fairly busy visiting wineries throughout the day! The location is perfect for walking to dinner in Tanunda and is only about a 10 minute drive to the furthest wineries in the area. There is a little kitchen with everything you need to make breakfast and coffee, and Lesley Ann even went as far as to supply us with some fresh bread, eggs, bacon, and tomatoes. She is a lovely host and was available for any questions or recommendations. We hope to come back again and make use of the puzzles next time! Thank you Lesley Ann.

Wow! What a place, what a location! Our expectations were well and truly exceeded with our stay, the photos don’t do the Studio justice - we honestly loved everything about our stay. Walking distance to the heart of Tanunda (stumbling distance back) - we didn’t use the car from arrival to departure.
Brekky goodies generous in nature, not just your basic cereal but a fresh loaf, eggs, bacon - and fresh plunger coffee.
Clean, comfy and a little quaint & quirky - we immediately felt at home which we were so grateful for.
We will be recommending to friend and family and only hope that the Studio is not booked out when we try to book again. We won’t look anywhere else for our next trip to the Barossa. Thank you Lesley Ann for everything, we’re so grateful :)

Lesley Ann's studio is a beautiful place to stay. It is a quiet space just away from the main street in Tanunda. The studio has everything we needed for a long weekend and Lesley Ann is a wonderful host who greeted us upon arrival. We really appreciated the local knowledge that Lesley Ann provides as we were given some great tips of local eateries and wineries.

The Writer’s studio is so inviting and comfortable.
With glorious decor, a beautiful garden setting and every special detail, it’s makes a weekend getaway feel like a luxury retreat.
This was our second stay here and we will definitely be back.
Amazing place and host. Lesley was so helpful and accommodating. Would highly recommend this place if you want to stay in the Barossa

We stayed for a couple of nights at the writers studio. Lesley Ann was a wonderful host with lots of tips on food, wineries and activities. She kindly provided delicious bread, bacon and eggs for is to cook in the (well equipped) kitchen. The studio itself is a bright open space and is beautifully decorated. It’s a short walk to Foodland and the main street of Tanunda. We would recommend a stay with Lesley Ann if you are visiting the Barossa.

Fantastic stay in the writers studio, incredible location, beautiful space to stay in and wonderful host
10/10 can’t wait to come back

Lesley Ann's place is a great place for exploring the Barossa.
It's in a very central location in Tanunda, within walking distance of the main street, restaurants and a number of wineries.
The space itself is very private and set in a beautiful garden.
Lesley Ann was a wonderful host, with excellent recommendations for local places to go, and the stocking of the fridge and pantry was a wonderful touch.

My partner and I had a wonderful stay in the Writer’s Studio. The facilities are excellent, the location to the main street is excellent and the cleanliness was of a high standard. Lesley Ann was an excellent host who was very attentive to during our stay and provided some excellent recommendations for local wineries/eateries.
Overall, I would absolutely recommend the Writer’s Studio for fantastic and affordable accommodation.
Lovely place, great location and well equipped. We had a great stay Thanks Lesley Ann
Perfect location. Excellent host. Gorgeous space with everything you might need for a stay in the Barossa. Can't recommend it highly enough. A real treasure.

Wonderful place, easy walk into town and Lesley is a terrific host, really thoughtful touches and local tips … she even had homemade bread warming on the bench when we arrived. It has been one of our favour it Airbnb’s - We will be back!
A beautiful spot for a relaxing weekend away in the Barossa.

Lesley Ann’s place is beautiful. It is a very well decorated bungalow that is centrally located in the Barossa Valley. Lesley Ann herself was very kind, easy to communicate with, and always willing to help. Thank you for a very pleasant stay!

The writers studio is hands down, the perfect place to stay for your Barossa getaway.
We have just stayed there for 4 nights and the studio is exactly as pictured and described. It is perfectly situated close to the cafes and restaurants of Tanunda, everything is within walking distance.
Lesley Ann is an amazing host, she made sure that we had everything we needed for our stay, gave us some wonderful recommendations on places to visit, and the bacon and eggs she left in the fridge was a very lovely gesture. We’ll definitely be back!

We would highly recommend Lesley Ann and the writer’s studio to anyone visiting the Barossa region.
Very comfortable and convenient to the centre of Tanunda. Lesley Ann is friendly and very helpful.
great location, such a cute cabin with beautiful interior and own little balcony. would recommend!
A great space and an extremely considerate host. A wonderful experience in the Barossa.

We had an awesome stay at Lesley’s place! Her studio is so nice and has everything you would possibly need. The backyard and the reading area are a plus with the morning sun!
The location is perfect to explore the Barossa area and also walking distance to Tanunda’s main Street.

Gorgeous little place, very homely, excellent location within the town and it felt very private. Lesley Ann was very helpful with her recommendations. The house was clean, filled with beautiful artwork and the food for us to cook for breakfast was a delicious welcome treat!

A charming and comfortable backyard studio a short walk from Tanunda shops but quiet and private. We were there in winter, very cosy with everything provided that we needed and Lesley Ann was a superb host, lots of thoughtful touches, great communication, highly recommended.

This lovely accommodation is full of character - bright, clean, spacious, and a great place to hide from the world (and get around the Barossa if you so wish). Lesley Ann was helpful and check-in was smooth. The crusty bread and breakfast provisions was a lovely touch.
A fabulous stay with a lovely host.  We were very comfortable and warm considering the wintery weather outside.  Would 100% stay again.

This is a beautiful Barossa retreat! The location was stunning, central, and everything provided at the studio made our stay very relaxing and easy to enjoy the surrounds! Lesley Ann was an excellent communicator with great local knowledge too.

The Writing Studio is a really cute colourful space. Lesley Ann's garden is pretty and would be amazing to see  in spring. Lesley Ann met us at the studio and showed us around and also recommended some local places to visit and eat. We highly recommend visiting the David Franz winery for a few drinks and you can also create your own platter. The view is spectacular. The Studio had everything we needed for our stay.

The writers studio is a beautiful home! Extremely clean, comfortable bed and gorgeous space to stay in.  Lesley Ann was a lovely host, very accomodating and helped us map out places to visit on our stay with lots of local knowledge! Highly recommend staying here!

Lesley Ann's cottage was a perfect place for exploring the Barossa. Unfortunately, we were caught up in the July lockdown, but Lesley Ann was a great host and made our stay so comfortable with coffee catch ups and allowing us to use her washing machine. The cottage is perfectly set up for a comfortable stay, including plenty of books, DVDs and jigsaws. I would absolutely recommend staying at the writers cottage.
This is my second stay in this lovely, eclectic, beautifully presented little hideaway. I'll be back... guaranteed. Love it. Even the resident chooks are used to me now :)
Perfect place to relax after exploring the best of the Barossa. Leslie was so accomodating and made sure we had all that we needed. Highly recomend!

My partner and I went to the Barossa for short weekend away and Lesley Anne’s place was perfect for that - it has all the provisions to stay at home or go out, is close and central, and Lesley Anne took time to make suggestions and assist us with bookings where required. Thanks once again for a fabulous experience!

The Writer's Studio is everything you can see from the photos - and so much more! A beautifully secluded studio based in the heart of Tanunda means that you can experience all that the Barossa has to offer, and at the same time shut the world away; whichever you want!

Lesley Ann is an amazing host who is more than happy to share her personal favourites of the surrounding area and offer suggestions based on what you're looking for.

Thank you for the perfect getaway!

Do yourself a favour and book a stay at this lovely little studio nestled behind the host's house just off the main street of Tanunda.  Even though you are in the back  yard, you have every privacy, and the host doesn't interfere with your comings and goings.  You will love the comfy, snuggly bed, well appointed kitchen area (with full sized fridge, stocked with lovely breakfast staples, and pantry staples in the cupboard).  Cook to your heart's desire with the full complement of cook and tableware, or dine out at one or more of the many great restaurants, clubs, pubs and cafes that abound in the area.  Or if you feel like a few hours whiling away time and relaxing, feel free to pick something from the well appointed bookshelves, be it a book, a jigsaw puzzle, or a board game.  Go on, book a weekend away here; you know you want to....

We very much enjoyed staying at Lesley Ann’s.
Gorgeous place, beautiful gardens and fantastic location close to everything and walking distance to Tanunda township with great restaurants.
Lesley Ann is a lovely host and communication was easy. Would definitely stay again.
Writer’s studio is a great cozy place. We loved our stay and enjoyed some downtime amidst Lesley Ann’s studio surrounded by her lush garden
A lovely place for a getaway. Cute little studio with everything you need. Beautiful garden surrounds. Walking distance to the shops. Lesley was a great host.

This is exactly what we were looking for — a cosy place with a cute loft, surrounded by a lovely garden and in a super convenient location! We loved our trip from beginning to end. Lesley Ann was a great host — we appreciated her local knowledge about places to eat when we checked in and were grateful for the delicious, ground coffee and fresh crusty bread she left us! We didn't do any cooking because the location is sooooo close to great food. We were not at all sad when the rain kept us inside though because the place is just so nice. We were particularly happy to find scrabble on the shelf! Loved it.

Lesley Ann was an exceptional host, ensuring that our stay in her delightful ‘Writer’s Studio’ was enjoyable and trouble-free. The studio was set in a gorgeous garden and was light, tastefully decorated, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. We appreciated the delicious breakfast provisions and the coffee and tea. The quiet location was great, a short walk to the restaurants and shops in Tanunda. We wish we could have stayed longer. Highly recommended.
our second, wonderful stay in Tanunda with Lesley Ann. Will definitely stay again.

A beautiful BnB in a very lovely garden setting. Lesley Ann is a great host with a wealth of knowledge about local restaurants and events. We could easily walk to the restaurants in Tanunda. The breakfast supplies and freshly baked bread were unexpected but very welcome.

The writers studio is the perfect place to base yourself for exploring the Barossa! Lesley Ann is also very welcoming, is well informed on what to do and where to go in the area and the studio is surrounded by an absolutely stunning garden. We would love to go back!
Pictures are accurate, the location is right in the heart of town with bars, restaurants and supermarket within a short walk

Fantastic place that’s so close to amazing food and wine (a 5-10 minute stagger, depending on how much taste testing you’ve done!). Really comfortable space (and bed). Top quality linen/towels, breakfast supplies (sadly I was too full to eat the  fresh eggs & bacon), local coffee beans, as a tea drinker I was impress with the selection (not everyone likes English Breakfast) and the homemade bread with lashings of butter (my highlight!). I enjoyed sitting out the back and chilling (thank you Lesley Ann for the sun umbrella!). Appreciated the ceiling fan during the night. Super effective AC too. Just lovely, clean and inviting. I’ve never seen so many jigsaw puzzles! Thank you for your warm hospitality…see you again!

This is a gem to be discovered in the Barossa Valley. Romantic,chic,stylish, the Studio is well equipped, comfortable and well positioned.
Lesley Ann was a great hostess, friendly, respectful of privacy with some great local knowledge if needed.
Try the degustation down the road at Musque. Amazing value.
Great stay, can't recommend it enough.

The studio was everything we expected and more. The space is wonderfully designed and decorated, well-lit and appointed for a retreat - we wish we could have stayed longer and enjoyed more of the reading nook, tv area, dining space, as well as the various garden areas to sit in. Short walk to the centre of town - restaurants, cafes, pubs/bars, Barossa regional gallery, and historical sites virtually at your doorstep. Lesley Ann was a very friendly and welcoming, helpful and accommodating host. We hope to stay again!

A hidden gem! We had the pleasure of staying here for 2 nights. Lesley Ann is friendly and polite and showed us to our accommodation and explained how a few things worked. The space is exactly as the photos show. The surprise of fresh eggs, bread and bacon was a lovely treat and we enjoyed breakfast each morning in the garden. The kitchen is well equipped, shower is nice and not and a great choice of puzzles in the lounge area. We could easily walk into the Main Street of Tanunda for a browse which was nice. We will definitely be back!

What a wonderful, bright, cheery and relaxing little spot to stay. We really enjoyed spending time in the beautiful garden and reading inside the light filled and cosy studio. Very convenient location and much appreciated the local knowledge. Thank you Lesley Ann!

Wonderful little retreat - for not just writers but anyone who wants to get away.
The space is very open and homely and the visiting chickens were a pleasant quirk.

The hostess Lesley was super welcoming and gave some great insider tips of where to visit.
Super location close to lots of shops and eaters/bars and a few wineries.
Highly recommend

This is the most beautiful little cottage, with a beautifully set-up interior, and a lovely host in Lesley Ann! Breakfast was fresh eggs, bacon and butter, and it was a 5 minute walk to the main street of cellar doors and shops in Barossa. A perfect retreat or base from which to explore the region, I'll definitely be coming back!

Such a lovely spot! Really bright and quirky with everything you could possibly need. Lesley has some great recommendations about what to do around town. We had a great time here. Thanks again Lesley!

This place is well worth the visit. Excellent location to Main Street with restaurants, shops and cellar doors. The cottage is beautiful and very private. We loved our stay here and will be coming back! Lesley is a great host, she is knowledgeable of things to do in the area and was very welcoming.
Great stay, close to everything you need and Lesley Ann was very accommodating. Thanks for having us and recommend to anyone coming to stay in Tanunda
Lovely place and location. We had a wonderful stay.

Beautifully decorated place with everything you need. Lesley Ann is very knowledgeable of the area and provided great recommendations. The space was very comfortable and clean in a fabulous location. Would recommend staying here!

We loved our stay at Tanunda with Lesley Ann. The studio was out the back in the beautiful garden and was well equipped with everything we needed. It had so much character and is perfectly located near plenty of good restaurants and wine tours. Lesley Ann was very helpful with suggestions of local attractions.
Fantastic place, great location and an amazing host! Loved everything about our stay, from the decor, to the proximity to everything and the amazing suggestions and hospitality by Lesley Ann.

Lesley Ann was an incredible host - very thoughtful and generous and did everything she could to make me feel welcome. The studio has everything you need and is very nicely located near the main street of Tanunda. Highly recommend!

The property is amazing and makes for a great getaway; its peaceful and plenty of space to go for a wonder around. Peter and Marijan were the best hosts we could ask for; they made sure we had everything we needed, were easy to get hold of, and offered us a late check out. Marijan even left us amazing pikelets and comquat marmalade!!! She's a gem!! The cottage is quaint and cosy. A woodfire in the living room hearkens to the cooler months ensconsed in the inviting warmth of the fire with a fabulous red and a book. The gardens are remarkable; we had the chance to observe the changeling colours of autumn in the trees. We imagine spring would be amazing too. There is a vineyard to meander through, and lamas and sheep share this wonderful retreat with you. We cannot wait to return and spend a few days retreating in these beautiful surrounds.

We stayed here for work, it had a great location and large spaces for parking even enough room for the truck. more then that it offered the space need in the house for our crew. the gardens and surrounding land offer piece and quite after a hard days work. The host went the extra mile to make us welcome and feel like we were at home. The history was lost on the boys but it wasn't hard to see.

Marijan and Peter were very welcoming and very knowledgeable of the land they have taken on and let us explore their property, with a private tour while we stayed for a lovely two nights on their glorious estate.
Will highly recommend and definitely return in the future to see their hard work and progress on the estate to relax in the peace and quiet of the mountains.

The house is really nice and comfortable, there is everything you need. We had a very good time walking around in the hills, petting the alpacas on the property and everybody was really nice and caring and Marijan was happy explaining things and giving us tips about where to go in the Barossa, walking trails etc.

Marijan and Peter's cottage is a special place. You can pick your poison there: relax by the open fire, breathe deep as you wander the beautiful property, or jump in your car for a delicious visit to a local cellar door. The accommodation is just as it is described - very functional and comfortable. The open fire kept the cottage perfectly warm and added wonderful atmosphere. Marijan was a fantastic host. She had the cottage prepped for every eventuality, made us pikelets, and stayed up late to greet us as we arrived in the pouring rain. Make sure you take her up on her offer to have a tour around the property - it is wonderful. We will definitely be coming back to Martinsell. We loved it.
Awesome hosts - went out of their ways to accommodate us. Will definitely recommend and stay here again.
Lovely county property. Right at Mt Crawford for walking, bike/horse riding. Great view out across the paddock. Well equipped for family weekend away. Great hosts.

Marijan greeted us at the gate and had the fire roaring for us on arrival. It's a quiet old property with sheep and alpacas roaming freely. The cottage is decorated in a simple style and is impeccably clean and comfortable. We brought our own cheese platter and a meal to pop in the oven so we were playing cards in front of the fire in no time. We opted to spend the next day on a short hike up Mt Crawford and then a drive through Angaston, Tanunda and Birdwood. Marijan's place was the ideal accommodation to feel like we'd really gotten away from it all and we'd love to return some day to see more of the area.
Gorgeous property in the barossa with plenty of wildlife!  The sheep and alpacas were lovely to watch and the indoor fire was cozy.   I would definitely recommend this roomy cottage!

Peter and Marijan's property is in easy reach of Barossa Valley wineries and sites, numerous walking trails like the Heysen Trail and mountain bike routes. It is also perfect for relaxing. It is an interesting and historic property important for the history of the Barossa. Our accommodation was above the original barn, simple, functional, exceptionally clean and a little old fashioned. We loved Marijan's pikelets, the tour of the main house and the efficient combustion heater in the cold winter's weather. Thank you Marijan and Peter for minding our bags and the enjoyable stay.

Peter and Marijan's place was lovely. It was on a road less traveled but the property was charming and old worldly. Because it has a history - the property is getting restored bit by bit and it's wonderful to step back in time and take in the atmosphere. We wanted a break and a breather from the city and the place was exceptional. Billy and Sterling (the Alpacas) were adorable and we loved the tour of the property. Our son got to experience what it is like to be a farmer. Overall it was a wonderful stay and because it's a short drive to Williamstown, Tanunda and Angoston, we enjoyed the local eateries and delicacies as well. Wonderful place to stay while on holiday.

Oh my goodness if you want to experience a beautiful rustic retreat then this is the place to go. We were greeted with a warm cottage and some friendly alpacas. Our beds were so warm and cosy had the best sleep and that fresh country air just added to it all. Do your self a favour if you're going to the Barossa stay here.
Thank you for the very peaceful  and warm stay at your beautiful place. the whole place was perfect and the hosts are super friendly, i couldn't have hoped for anything more

Quiet, secluded, fresh air, very special farmhouse type ambience.
Marijan is a very welcoming host.
The home itself is simple yet comfortable, like walking back 40 years in time and some of the furnishings and implements match that era.
Lovely to wake up and see "Dorper" sheep grazing outside your window. The legendary Roos did not make an appearance but we didn't miss it!
The surroundings are lovely for walking and exploring
and offer ruins, pine forests, streams and vistas of rolling hills.
For a family used to life in inner Adelaide, this was quite magical.
Lovely farm style stay in beautiful rural surroundings. Thank you for hosting 😊
A fantastic location amongst the hills. Beautiful backdrops and very helpful hosts. Recommended to all

Very friendly and welcoming. Nothing was a problem. House was large enough to sleep all 6 males in our group comfortably.
Very well set up place to stay

We had a lovely time at the cottage. It was very picturesque. Marijian was very accommodating and was genuinely interested in making our stay enjoyable. We even got to feed her adorable hand-reared lamb!
Lovely property, with awesome views on the way there.  Great facilities and just like the description - highly recommend

Don't miss the opportunity to stay at Martinsell and Pewsey Vale! Marijan and Peter have created the most beautiful place here -- the cottage is in such a glorious setting, and the sheep, alpacas and old gums make it really special.  Marijan has thought of everything, and their tips for outings and places to eat were spot on. Our son will never forget helping hand-feed the baby lamb and the alpaca gents. Thank you so much for a gorgeous couple of days -- we hope to be back!

We would highly recommend this as a stay for groups both big and small. The property is incredibly picturesque and is ideal for relaxing outside or taking walks.

The cottage was spacious and comfortable with everything we needed. The host Marijan was very hospitable in offering us a tour of the property; the stories behind the manor and the gardens added a tremendous amount of enjoyment for us as a group.

The area is easily accessible with a car and the local wineries and town markets are a short drive away. Without a doubt we would love to go back.

We had a great time at Martinsell Cottage and would return there anytime. We loved the pleasant and unique rural location. Marijan met us at the gate (it was drizzling) and welcomed us in. We learned the history of the property, which we partly knew, enjoyed the convivial atmosphere and the guided tour of their property.  Mt Crawford and Martinsell is a great place to visit.

Wonderful greeting with freshly cut roses and plenty of helpful advice regarding the Barossa from Marijan. The location was excellent with everything a nice driving distance, yet very quiet and tranquil. Thoroughly recommend for anyone visiting the area.
Peter and Marijan were great  hosts who warmly welcomed us....a lovely touch of paradise and a wonderful place to stay in the Barossa ...highly recommend...

Marijan and Peter are amazing hosts and we will book their beautiful house again.
Thank you very much, kind regards,
Hélène and Michael (from Hobart)

Beautiful cottage in a stunning part of the world. Marijan and Peter were fantastic hosts- so welcoming and helpful in every way. The alpacas and sheep were a huge hit with our young girls and the location is fabulous. Very close to all the attractions of the Barossa.

Marijian helps a lot and very friendly.
Very relaxing place with the nature.

Peter and Marijan made us feel so very at home in their beautiful cottage. Marijan even gave us a private tour of their stunning sprawling property! There are sheep and alpaca running around, all very friendly, and the cottage has everything you need. A quiet and cozy place, 20 minutes drive from the centre of the Barossa. I recommend staying here as the drive to town is beautiful, with a limit over the region as you drive in to town. I can't wait for them to finish the work on their château, as it is already looking amazing and luxurious, and a great alternative to the cottage.
Very friendly, comfortable house, spotless clean and Marijan and Peter will be the best hosts of your trip!!

Marijan has been an absolutely wonderful host! She has given us local tips on where to eat and visit, showed us the manor (including recounting its heritage), and also allowed us to visit her wonderful sheep and alpacas. The place itself is very peaceful and the air is simply so fresh and crisp. We would love to visit again!
Beautiful cottage in secluded stunning country with flora and fauna only a stones throw away from Barossa valley and Adelaide
Fantastic spot to get away from hustle and bustle,  quiet and secluded,  comfortable beds and very attentive hosts!  Definitely recommend!

Thank you for a lovely stay - really appreciated the tour of the estate and feeding the animals, as well as your recommendations for activities and restaurants. Beautiful spot and very comfortable. We wished we could have stayed longer. See you next time!
Great spacious place in a bountiful rural setting. Only 20 min from the central Barossa. Perfect for walks and for people on horseback.
Great location, beautiful property and nice hosts.

Absolutely wonderful place to stay with exceptionally attentive hosts. Well maintained and clean accomodation with fresh linen and everything you need for secluded country interlude, including wood fire. Close to a wide range of high quality restaurants and wineries in the Barossa with plenty to see and do. Highly recomended and we will definitely be going back..

Great hosts with local knowledge, interesting, helpful hints and information.  Great spot for a couple of a family.  A little distance from town though an enjoyable and beautiful drive towards the heart of the Barossa.  Highly recommended!!
Great location neat and tidy accomodation. Nice to have a tour of the property and see the manor house
Stunning property, exceptional hospitality and super cosy - couldn't have asked for more from our wonderful hosts. I'll be back!
Beautiful location. The llamas were cute :)

The Cottage was so spacious,  well furnished with everything you could want, a lovely wood fire as well as the reverse cycle meant the main living area was toasty and warm.  The hosts are really lovely people who could not have been more friendly and approachable.  The property itself is magnificent, with  the most beautiful gum trees and grounds with wonderful old buildings full of character.

This gorgeous cottage is in an absolutely picturesque location. Waking to see the magnificent sunrise over the vineyards and walking amongst the grounds is a magical experience. The cottage is warm and has everything you need to enjoy it’s peaceful location. We simply LOVED our stay.
Lovely county property. The hosts are super friendly We had a great time at Martinsell Cottage ..

I highly recommend Marijan and Pete's Martinsell Cottage. The place was big, clean and had everything we you could possible need.
Marijan gave us great recommendations on places to eat, to visit, best scenic roads, and was very helpful every step of the way.
My favorite part of the holidays spent in the Barossa was the tour around this property, we fed the sheep and the alpacas, had a walk around the vineyard and heard the amazing history behind this beautiful property. There is no money that could pay to make up and go for a walk around Martinsell Place, I completely love the property and would love to go back.
An amazing weekend away in the most perfect place. I feel so rejuvenated and will definitely be returning.
We had a lovely stay on this beautiful property, and also enjoyed great hospitality
Wonderful place.  Peaceful and beautiful.
Fantastic fireplace, air conditioning, good kitchen and the hosts are super friendly (in a good way).

The Martinsell Cottage sits alongside Martinsell Manor. Both are listed on Airbnb although the cottage is where we stayed, due to our more modest budget! We found it to be of great value and the hosts were wonderful - Marijan even took us on a tour of the grounds and manor, which was very interesting. Marijan and her husband Peter are meticulously recovering and renovating the manor and other parts of the property.
The cottage is clean and pleasant. The kitchen is fully functional and comes with tea, coffee and basic breakfast supplies. The bathroom is clean and large, and the water is hot with reasonable water pressure. So lovely to have a fireplace in the lounge room also! While there are no facilities for babies, Marijan was more than happy for us to bring our 3 month old, and we just brought our own portacot.
The Martinsell Cottage is a convenient and comfortable base for exploring Barossa wineries by car, and we would definitely stay there again!

Amazing place.  Quiet, slightly out of the way but close to every thing you need in the Barossa.  Lie in bed in the morning and only here the animals, birds and bees.  Huge place from two people to six, would be great place for large family with kids also.  Tour of the property is a total added bonus.  What has been achieved in two years is mind boggling.
