Conserving all that history!  I will be back.
We had a lovely stay at the cottage. Great communication and hosting from Marijan and Peter. Would love to be back.

A perfect getaway that allows you to switch off and relax. The property is amazing, so nice and relaxing. The cottage is also really good ...perfect for a young family. Highly recommend, the owners where so friendly also which made the experience so much better!

Fantastic rural location deep in the Barossa vineyards. Peter & Marijan were lovely hosts & gave some great advice about wineries, etc. Very interesting main house, stunning grounds and nice to meet & feed the Alpacas. Would love to have stayed longer.

we loved our stay in this beautiful old cottage. lovely rural propery with sheep bleating. good base to explore barossa and adelaide hills. Marian was a warm and generous host and gave aus a tour and history of the property.
Awesome views and great place to be to relax and unwind among the sheep.
The Cottage was just perfect ! Set on a picturesque farm with beautiful views and an outstanding property rich with history & a great feel. We loved it !

We stayed for two nights in Marijan and Peter's cottage on their very scenic property.  The cottage itself was extremely comfortable, clean, and well equipped.  Marijan was a perfect host, meeting us on arrival (and very flexible when we changed our arrival time late in the day) and giving us a very interesting tour of the property, including the manor house, fitting in with our schedule to do so.  We had some marvellous meals in the cottage, prepared in the well-equipped kitchen.  When a (rare and brief) power cut, caused by an intense electrical storm, threatened one of our dinners Marijan came over straight away and helped us with setting up a BBQ.  It was an excellent and restful stay in a beautiful part of the country.
Quiet, relaxing hub for visiting the Barossa.
Very peaceful, great hosts, tranquil, relaxing and a good base to explore the Barossa from.

This was the place we just couldn't get enough of, even after 5 days there. Peter and Marian are such good folks, very accommodating hosts, and full of helpful tips for what to do and see.  You basically will have your own country estate, complete with a spacious house, a small flock of sheep amongst the enormous red gum trees, the occasional kangaroo, and two friendly alpacas. The furnishings in the house are simple but quite adequate. The house itself and the other buildings on the property are lovingly restored from their early days, and are wonderful. It's out of town and up in the hills, but still an easy drive to shops, wineries, etc. The more rural setting added a lot to its appeal for us. We loved it!

The cottage is an amazing space that is just perfect as a base to explore the Barossa valley. The cottage has everything you need, and is consistently styled in the 1970’s theme. The kitchen is fully equipped, and there are plenty of blankets for cold nights. It was just the two of us staying, but the space can comfortably fit three generations with the three great bedrooms and multiple bathrooms. The views on the property are stunning. We were able to walk around the property, even to their vineyard which was so great. There’s lots of amazing animals on the property too, and you can spy sheep, alpaca, and kangaroos from the cottage. The location is totally private, and yet conveniently located to cellar door locations for making the most of the region. We also got a tour of the manor, which is suited for a very luxurious stay. I would highly recommend it, and would come back here again

If you want to escape to a peaceful oasis at the end of busy winery and township touring, this is just the place to stay. This comfortable, spacious cottage, nestled among ancient gums and towering pines is a perfect, economical  refuge with wildlife, vineyards and livestock within metres of the door! A place of very interesting Australian history and a chance to witness great work-in-progress on the nearby stone buildings by the hosts. Don't miss this!

Martinsell Cottage is in a lovely setting which is peaceful and quiet. Marijan and Peter are friendly and helpful and the cottage has everything you need. It was a perfect base for our Heysen Trail walks not too far from Williamstown or Tanunda. It was lovely to look over Martinsell Manor and see all the work they have done there. We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay.
Great place to stay in the Barossa if you love country and farm animals. Great host too and we really enjoyed our stay.

A great place to get away from it all. Our kids loved feeding the sheep and thinking they were farmers for a few days. Peter and Marijan were lovely, helped us out with local tips and showed us around their property. The house decor is unashamedly straight from 1982, but everything works and it is part of the charm. Very scenic property and outlooks, it really does make you shift gears while you’re there. Enjoy!

Martinsell cottage is a hidden treasure in every way. Magnificent property quiet and private very relaxing.  Comfortable bed lovely warm wood fire. The tour of the farm premises is very worth the time. We can recommend this accommodation.
Wonderful experience. Peaceful surroundings and friendly hosts. Would recommend the cottage to everyone.  Gorgeous scenery and lovely walking trails. Fabulous  all round.
Amazing views so beautiful

Quiet and tranquil. A beautiful place to rest and enjoy nature. Superb hospitality. Can’t wait till we go again. Highly recommended.
Thanks again. 👌👍

Very lovely place and host. Warm greeting was great, tour of the property. The cottage has a really awesome ambiance and feel to it, really thoughtful decoration but also practical.

Fire place was really cozy and the beds were very nice looking and comfortable.

Classic cottage that I know will be enjoyed by many! And peter and Marijan were more than lovely and very helpful in helping us experience as much of the area as we could!
If you are looking to spend time in a truly rural environment, where stress is at a minimum, or actually non existent, this place is for you
We really enjoyed our stay here in the Valley. So beautiful and very relaxing space. Looking forward to staying here again.
Relaxing location for a retreat. Friendly and accommodating hosts, thank you for having us.
Nice place in the heart of  Barossa valley,absolutely loved the farm animals

Martinsell cottage is in a fantastic location to Explore the Barossa.  The hosts are amazing and go out of their way to make you feel welcome and  ensure your stay is comfortable and enjoyable.  I was there for an extended duration of several months with work couldn't ask for a better place or people to stay with.  Many thanks Peter and Marijan.
Fantastic place and people

Beautiful historic cottage, warm and cozy during these wintery days. Loved our stay and hope to be back, our toddler son hopes to see baby sheeps soon❤Dear Marijan and Peter, thanks for your warmest hospitality.

Very welcoming hosts who have taken on the restoration of a historic property.
The cottage was very comfortable and warm during some very chilly winter nights. The property is set in the quiet country side of the Barossa Valley and close to walking trials but still within close proximity to all tourist attractions and wineries. The best of both worlds.

A lovely place situated on a huge farm.   Perfect for autumn - surrounded by oaks and eucalypts with a large combustion heater in the lounge room.   A serene get-away that is ideal for couples and families.

Such a great time away, was a cold July weekend but the cottage was warm and cozy. Beds were so comfortable. Our kids really enjoyed the farm and didn’t want to leave. Peter and Marijan were so nice and thoughtful. Marijan even brought a tub of LEGO down for my kids to play with one night and supplied some froot loops for them - they were wrapped. We also enjoyed exploring their property and were totally in ore of their magnificent homestead and tranquil gardens. It was like nothing I have seen before. They have put so much work and heart Into their property and it really shows... Hope to return for another visit in the future. I can definitely recommend.
Such wonderful hospitality in a glorious location. Highly recommend.

Martinsell Cottage is a wonderful place to stay. Warm log fire, games and videos, well-equipped kitchen and plenty of comfortable beds made it a perfect place for a family of 6 adults to stay. The location is divine - set among gorgeous trees and surrounded by sheep, lambs and alpacas. Marijan was a lovely host who made us feel very welcome and  showed us around the manor garden and property, imparting the local history to us. The Heysen trail is close by. The rest of the Barossa easily accessible. We wish we could have stayed longer. A really lovely place to stay. Thank you!
Highly recommend for a family holiday.  Baby lambs just gorgeous!  Billy and Stirling the Alpaca's also need to get a mention!  Cozy cottage and breath-taking scenery!
The setting is peaceful and private, the beds are exquisitely comfortable & we highly recommend Peter & Marijan’s Airbnb.
Fabulous 1901 cottage in a beautiful area of SA. Hosts were welcoming and promptly responded to all questions prior to our arrival. We would definitely stay there again.

Amazing grounds and hosts. Marijan had great information about the Barossa and surrounds. The cottage was very spacious and homey, which made our weekend very pleasant. Highly recommend staying at Martinsell cottage if you want a weekend to remember.

Absolutely wonderful stay! The photos don't do justice to how quiant and beautiful the cottage property is. Loved seeing the sheep and little lambs roaming around and the fire was great. Great communication with Marijan. Would love to stay again, perfect little getaway.
Beautiful grounds, lovely cottage with friendly greetings from the hosts throughout our stay.
A great place to have a quiet peaceful break from the stresses of liife

It’s a beautiful historic place on a beautiful piece of land. Marijan has a lot of knowledge of both the area and the property itself. The cottage is a repurposed old shearing shed which is great. The amenities are simple and the overall aesthetic of the inside is a bit rustic, however, you can see this clearly in the photos and at this price point you can’t be beaten. The oven takes quite some time to preheat but it is fully functional. The animals are very cute too. You will love this place.
Outstanding property and location! Nothing to fault at all! Come and enjoy...you will not be disappointed...Jenn
Highly recommend! Waking up amongst the alpacas and sheep in that setting was amazing!

Very special thanks Marijan and Peter for your friendly hospitality, with your welcome, presentation of the spacious cottage, and thoughtfulness of a bonfire & BBQ - a great evening!  And providing us with a beautiful 'farm-stay' and gateway into the magnificent Barossa region for 5 superb days / nights of activities.  We will be back!  Warm regards, Rob & guests

The cottage is the old shearers quarters from the early 1900s. I love old architecture! The quarters were wonderfully cosy like staying at Nanna's. Everything was clean, tidy, comfortable... warm! We loved having the fire going as it was the last traces of Winter. The sounds of the sheep during the night was magical. We hope to come back and explore some more another time.

This place is marvellous but if you have been reading the reviews you already know this.  Please note there is no Wifi and the signal comes and goes.  But we managed very well.  Please note that at the gate that you have to open and drive through, there is a cattle grid.  For those a little unsteady on their feet you have to be very cautious.  When we were there (October 2020) many of the wineries were closed, some only opened on weekends and some that were open charge a fee for tasting, supposedly because of extra precautions that have to be taken due to Covid (at least that was what one winery told us).  Not certain this is the real reason.  I get the feeling that, unlike McLaren Vale that doesn't usually charge for tastings, this is the go in the Barossa.  So plan well.  Overall it was a wonderful stay enhanced by unexpected little treats.  It is certainly great value for money.
Amazing location, tranquil, peaceful and loved having the sheep and Billy and Sterling nearby!

This cottage is in a lovely countryside setting.  The owners were happy for us to walk anywhere on the property, including through their beautiful garden area.  The cottage itself is comfortable and spacious and there are sheep and alpacas on the property.  Peter and Marian are friendly hosts who are great custodians of the history of this special place.
Very friendly hosts who are full of local knowledge. The cottage is fantastic and definitely in the 1970’s theme which is awesome.

We had an absolutely lovely time at Peter and Marijan's place. The flat is spacious, comfortable and with a superb view from each window. It rained a bit while we were there, but that didn't matter as we were perfectly happy to spend the time inside.
Peter and Marijan met us on arrival, filled us in on the local area and Marijan later took us on a tour of the garden. The property has an abundance of land on which to walk and just hang out amongst the trees, and the towns of Williamstown, Lyndoch and Tanunda are just a short and beautiful drive away.
If they'll have us, we'll be back at Peter and Marijan's in the not too distant future.
Highly recommended.
Martinsell Cottage is lovely and the hospitality is great. Perfect location to explore Barossa Valley.

We absolutely loved our weekend away. We explored the garden took multiple photos of the beautiful buildings. Explored nearby the old school house on the edge of the forest and the heysen trail. If you love places steeped in history you’ll love this place. Thank you to Marijan and Peter for your ease in booking, the clean space and the sharing of the proud history. You’ve done a marvellous job with it all.

The Martinsell property was beautiful - the big old gums, free ranging animals, beautiful manor and gardens.
The cottage itself was comfortable, clean and had lots of extra touches that make it very homey. We enjoyed reading about the history of the place, and the kids loved the bridge to the entrance!
Thanks for having us 🙂

Breathtaking spot. The cottage is so charming and felt so comfy. The gardens were beautiful and it was incredibly peaceful being here. Our hosts were so kind and lovely and extremely knowledgeable about the history of this beautiful site. 5 Stars!!

Peter and Marijan’s cottage is located in a beautiful property where you can choose to be based to visit close by wineries, or just stay for as long as you want and unwind by reading a book, observing their sheep and alpacas or walking around. Totally recommended, and both of them will be up for a chat and give both local tips and extensive background on the region if you ask them :)

A lovely place to stay, with all the comforts of home. Beautifully quiet setting with friendly sheep and alpacas. Very convenient to Barossa wineries and cafes, but a world away from them. Highly recommended.

The cottage was absolutely lovely and perfect for our family of 8 (including 2 young kids). We spent a fantastic few days touring the Barossa Valley wine region and the cottage was in a great location. Marijan met us upon arrival on the first day and gave us a great overview of the area and some very helpful tips. Throughout the stay, she was very accessible for any questions we had and the check out process was similarly seamless. We had a great experience and we would highly recommend staying in the place and look forward to revisiting in the future!

We recently enjoyed a two night stay at Martinsell Cottage. Peter's welcome was warm and genuine and Marijan responded promptly to the few inquiries we had during our stay. Martinsell Cottage is a charming stone building that sits beautifully in its rustic environment.  And as you look further into the distance, the scenery really is lovely.  The sheep and alpacas add to the idyllic rural picture. The cottage is comfortable and the air-conditioner in the living area assured we were toasty warm in the unseasonably chilly summer weather.  We set up nibbles on the front porch (it's small space but a bit of a sun trap and quite sheltered from the wind - worth the effort) and spent a couple of restful hours enjoying wonderful local produce and wines, chatting and watching the animals quietly move about.  We principally used the cottage as a base to explore the local area.  Tanunda is a pretty half hour drive away.  So many place to see.  I can thoroughly recommend Gomersal Wines on Lyndoch Road (a lucky stop despite the premises normally being closed on Tuesdays - the host, Gaby is a delight) and Fino Seppeltsfield.  All in all a lovely stay.
Comfortable self contained cottage away from the big house with a lovely vista.  Peter and Marijan are very welcoming and friendly and happy for guests to wander in their lovely gardens.
Inviting and private. Homey and a great escape. Worked well for us as a young family. Accommodating owners.
Such a lovely old, historic place to relax and unwind. Marijane and Peter helped with local knowledge and showed us around the beautiful property.

Peter and Marijan's place was definitely our pick of the bunch when staying in the Barossa region - with good reason! They had a beautiful historic cottage in a very convenient location to wineries and restaurants. There were lots of little touches that made it feel extra homely. The property itself was also lovely, a massive amount of land with alpaca and sheep that we loved. Our group of 4 agreed that we could've easily spent more time there. Marijan was very hospitable, lovely to talk to, and had so much excellent local knowledge. We would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a quieter area to stay in whilst visiting the Barossa, without compromising on location.
Clean and basic. Perfect if you’re looking for isolation.
entirely as described. lovely place
Quiet, clean and comfortable place to stay.
All thumbs up, a really nice place to stay, pubs and cafes are just 10-20min away and we had a great time all in all. 🙂
Charming place!
Worth a stop if you want some nice peace and quiet! Loved having the animals around. Not far out of the Barossa valley.

Fully recommend this cottage to base yourselves to explore Mount Crawford and the surrounding wine regions.

Great hosts and a tranquil environment.
My friend and I had a wonderful experience starting at the cottage. The property is beautiful and Marijan and Peter were exceptional hosts.
A wonderful stay, secluded but close to great wine regions.
Lovely cottage and lovely welcoming hosts in a beautiful part of the country and working farm.  Recommend staying here for a peaceful and picturesque weekend away.
A lovely cosy cottage, located in a beautiful countryside. We enjoyed the gardens and the log burning fire.
Amazing location and incredible hosts. I can't wait to stay here again!

We were lucky enough to stay when there were lots of lambs around so that was wonderful. It's a quiet place where you can easily head out into the bush for a walk. The fireplace was heavenly and the electric blanket kept us warm at night. A perfect place to recharge for a couple of days.
We really enjoyed our stay in this beautiful place, so close to everything yet it feels like a million miles from anywhere. A highlight was the old schoolhouse.

A great stay. Very peaceful. Great to watch the animals from the cottage windows. Loved the log fire in lounge. Marijan greeted us warmly and told some information about the property.
Will be back :)
Amazing place to stay! We loved it for a weekend away.
Comfy beds, nice fire and close to walking tracks. We had a great stay!
Lovely rustic cottage

Lovely house, hidden in the Barossa which is exactly what we wanted. The fire in the lounge was just lovely and perfect for roasting marshmallows on a cold night. The two queen sized beds were comfortable with a range of pillow choices. The back room with the two bunk beds was comfy and a good size. It was nice that there were two bathrooms too.

Beautiful, private, quiet, cosy, clean and centrally located in the middle of the Barossa. Everything is close by and it was absolutely amazing and relaxing.

Peter and Marijan are knowledgeable, kind and humble hosts and extremely helpful.

I highly recommend the cottage to anyone looking for a getaway.
Fantastic place to stay. Peter and Marijan have a little slice of paradise with a lovely little cottage to match!
Highly recommend for a peaceful retreat with amazing views and landscape.
Beautiful grounds and location
a beautiful cottage with everything we needed. friendly welcome by marijan - showing us their little friendly sheep. overall a lovely warming stay. ☺
Nothing short of spectacular. Will be back again.
Beautiful restored cottage on stunning grounds. A great choice for a family staying in the area. Peter and Marijan were very active communicators and were flexible and accommodating.

This was our second stay and has got to be one of the most reasonably priced BnBs that we have ever stayed at.  It's got everything you need and more.   If you get a chance, visit Luhrs Cottage at Light Pass (Ph: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) for a self-guided tour. Gold coin donation.  It was one of the highlights of our stay.
Beautiful property with nice scenery

Lovely cottage with all the amenities you need.
Peter and Marian were very friendly and helpful.
In a great part of the country for exploring wineries and restaurants.
Also peaceful with the animals around.

Beautiful property
Well maintained house
Worth staying again
Check your phone coverage as no Wifi
perfect location for all the barrossa attractions
Such a relaxing and peaceful stay! Wood fire was perfect for the cooler weather. Lots of nice walks aswell.

Peter and Marijan's place is a wonderfully situated cottage high above Williamstown in the Barossa valley hills.  We spent a glorious week going for long walks in the local area and exploring the Barossa region.  The whole property is around 77 acres and you will be surrounded by peace and tranquility, just the sounds of nature!  The cottage itself is very spacious with everything you could possibly need for a short or long stay.  The slow combustion stove is fantastic on a cool evening and the bath is wonderful for a long soak after walking in the hills.  Peter and Marijan are terrific  hosts and communication with them was smooth and efficient.  We would thoroughly recommend Peter and Marijan's listing to anyone seeking a unique experience on a large property with easy access to the Barossa area.
Fantastic property and great hosts!

A fantastic cottage located in pure nature!
We enjoyed the stay a lot and it fit our needs and expectations perfectly.
Thanks for the great time!

Lovely cottage for our family catch up. Had everything we needed.  We enjoyed the R & R and the kids loved the sheep wandering around. Note for an extended stay that grocery shopping is 20 minutes away. We had a lovely meal at the Williamstown Hotel for a change from the BBQ.  The cottage is not luxe but we didn’t need that & enjoyed our stay very much.
Great hosts.  Marijan took time to explain the history behind the property.  It is great for families looking for some peaceful time.  Williamstown is just 7 km away with a great bakery.
What a beautiful little cottage, close to town and local wineries, though their own wines were the best we had! Owners were very thoughtful and accommodating. Highly recommend to stay!

From the get go Cynthia was a fantastic communicator. Fire place was lit prior to our arrival and a lovely breakfast hamper and some chocolates to settle us in. The location is absolutely spot on. Smack bang in the middle of some of the best wineries in Australia.
We will definitely be back.
Thanks again Rolf and Cynthia.

Where to start? The place was beautiful, cosy and had everything we need for a perfect long weekend. The fireplace was roaring by the time we got in, and the beds were super comfortable and warm. The kitchen was well stoked with some local produce and we loved our complimentary bottle of red.

The house itself is within walking distance of at least three fantastic wineries (Peter Lehman, Langmeil & Dave Franz) with Cynthia and Rolf's winery (Rolf Binder) only being a short drive up the road (be sure to also check them out!).

Rolf and Cynthia went above and beyond to show us a great time in the Borossa, with winery and dinner recommendations only ever being a text away.

Thanks again for an amazing long weekend, we are already planning our return.

A lovely weekend in the Barossa! Cynthia was so helpful and welcoming, providing lots of information & recommendations for the surrounding area. The house was quaint, we loved the fire and the location was excellent. We'd definitely recommend and stay here again!

An exemplary place to stay whilst in the Barossa, everything needed is in the house. Loved time on the verandah and in front of the fire. Cynthia kept in touch with us once booked and ensured a perfect stay from start to finish. Thoroughly enjoyed a wine tasting with her at the cellar door and we look forward to a return visit to Hanisch House and Rolf Binder wines. Thank you Cynthia and Rolf.

Rolf Binder accomodation was amazing. We stayed at Hanisch Haus & it was basically perfect. Very cute cottage with everything we needed, very close to wineries & quite close to town. The cottage was very clean, the breakfast provided were more than enough & thoughtful. Thoroughly recommend !!

The Cottage is beautiful and very cozy. Its centrally located at the same time secluded as its towards the end of road. The wine by the host was excellent , the food was well stocked and the kitchen has all amenities. The communication was great. You actually go back in time when you live there , would recommend for someone looking for that experience.

Lovely house in the Barossa valley on the estate of wine makers (Rolf Binder) whose complimentary bottle and great breakfast material awaited us. A wonderful place with lots of charm and a working fire place. Well existed and likely cozy and warm in cold weather.

Our stay at Rolf and Cynthia's house was superb!  We were welcomed by the fire already going and a great bottle of Rolf Binder wine which was enjoyed over our stay.  The breakfast supplies were plentiful and more than enough for our two night stay.   The house was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable.  The location was excellent and walking distance to some great wineries (including Rolf Binder of course)!   We had a great time and would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the Barossa.  Thanks Rolf and Cynthia!

wow just book it!!!!!
perfect location family friendly as well as heaps of room for two couples.
clean warm and quiet all the things i look for in a property.
beds and linen where of the best quality and the wood fire kept the house nice and warm.
Cynthia was extremely quick with her reply to my early check in request.
Breakfast supplies where fabulous!!
Go see Rolf at the cellar door and pick up a bottle the reds are magnificent.
thanks we will be back!!!
Comfortable period home. A great place to explore from, and a convenient check in/out experience. Would book again.

We had a lovely weekend thanks to Cynthia and Rolf. The house was well situated to explore the Barossa, and in beautiful surrounds. The four of us enjoyed the delicious breakfast provisions each morning and appreciated the nice little touches to the home. Thanks for a great weekend!

What a wonderful home, oozing country charm, right in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Cynthia was AMAZING to deal with. We only ever needed to travel a maximum of 12 minutes to visit the many wineries, produce markets, farms etc. in the area! The breakfast provisions provided were both generous and delicious. And the Rolf Binder winery is a must visit - great pizza, Shiraz, Reisling...! We will certainly be back. Thank you Cynthia and Rolf.
Beautiful house in a lovely part of the barossa super close to some of the world’s best wineries.
A brilliantly comfortable step back in time. A 1950s house with modern facilities retaining all the style of its time. Worth a major detour to enjoy this opportunity.
Thank you so much for sharing your wonderful home.
A perfect spot for easy access to many exceptional wineries and places to eat. We made good use of the delightful patio and generous provisions supplied by our host.

The stay exceeded our exceptions with such great hospitality, care, advice about the region and the lovely details in the house (and stellar breakfast). Very clean and well located. Two couples stayed and we had an amazing time. I would definitely stay again and will be planning our winter trip soon! Thanks so much Cynthia and Rolf.

Cynthia and Rolf went absolutely over and above to ensure our stay was enjoyable. Cynthia is warm and so welcoming, it really felt as if we were visiting old friends. The tasting experience at the winery was fantastic and the house is very well stocked. The breakfast provided was also extremely generous, all local produce which we loved. Would stay again!

lovely cottage, very peaceful setting, comfortable beds, easy access to everything the Barossa offers.  Access and communication were very easy and we wanted for nothing during a very relaxing weekend away with friends.
Beautiful cosy cottage in great location. Friendly and helpful host.
Had an amazing time!

Excellent accommodation nestled in a quiet rural setting amongst the vineyards yet close to town centre, restaurants and cafes. A beautiful house- well furnished, spacious and sparkling clean.  Comfortable bedding, fire and heat pump,  AC, Nespresso machine to mention just a few of the creature comforts. Lovely views. So many thoughtful touches from Cynthia- from the ample local produce to a lovely bottle of wine. Highly recommended.

Beautiful red brick cottage with lots of room and fire place for the colder nights. We were very happy with our stay at Veritas retreat. Very welcoming hosts, Great location, breakfast included and very clean and comfy home. Our little one was able to enjoy running around in the garden.  It's in a great location made it easy for us to travel to family friendly winery's like whistler and to the local park. Definitely be back to stay in the future at Veritas Retreat.

Hanisch Haus is a beautiful cottage set in lovely gardens, providing a peaceful slice of paradise, yet close to all the Barossa has to offer. There’s so much to love; thoughtful touches, farm free eggs for breakfast, local jam and bread, vases with fresh cut roses, and much more.

The kitchen has all amenities, including modern items such as a coffee maker, but steeped with nostalgia, including an aga stove. The laundry boasts an old horse trough along side a modern washing machine. This all works well to blend the rich history of the area with modern conveniences.

There’s plenty of space and the bedrooms are comfortable with beautiful quality bedding. The cottage is clean and welcoming. Communication with Cynthia was excellent, and she is a wonderful host. There’s no shortage of things to do with several wineries in walking distance, and excellent restaurants and cafes in the main street. We are definitely looking forward to our next visit to Hanisch Haus.

The experience of staying at Veritas Retreat is like no other.
The history, combined with little pleasures and very comfortable beds takes you to a level of pleasure you may not have experienced before.
Cynthia is an excellent host and very thoughtful.
The location is perfect for exploring the local area.
Several of the best wineries in the Barossa are within walking distance.
This was a repeat visit and we will be back again

A lovely location,  beautiful accommodation with everything you need and more. Cynthia was very helpful, her communication was great. we had a lovely relaxing time away and would highly recommend to everyone
a
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This historic apartment is beautifully furnished and in an absolutely perfect location - a quiet street a few minutes walk from the main street of Angaston.
The apartment was well equipped with everything we needed, including a Nespresso machine and thoughtful touches like Lindt chocolates. Mark replied to all messages quickly, check in was a breeze, and we loved the warm welcome from Mark's 3 small and friendly dogs each morning. We loved staying here and would definitely stay again next time we are in the Barossa.
We were here for a wedding so didn't have a lot of time for exploring but would highly recommend the Barossa Farmers Market for breakfast on a Saturday.

1851 @ Hill House was such a wonderful experience. From the minute we confirmed our booking, Mark was welcoming, attentive and so helpful. From restaurant suggestions to offering to confirm bookings, nothing was too hard. Check in was a breeze and we loved the attention we received from not only Mark, but his three gorgeous and friendly dogs. 1851 is a gorgeous and very cosy cottage, with so much history and character. Mark has fitted out the cottage beautifully. Tucked away in Angaston, we loved that it was only a short drive from the wine trail.
When Mark discovered that Riesling is my go-to wine, he immediately offered to organise a wine-tasting with RieslingFreak (a MUST DO if you're in Tanunda) and even organised transport to the cellar door.
Mark also recommended a meal at FermentAsian - another "must do". As it was the long weekend, the degustation menu was on offer and wow - what an experience. An extremely impressive wine list so Mark's advice to leave the car in Angaston was a good call!
It's worth noting that Angaston is much quieter than other towns in the Barossa so a car is essential and take note of opening hours. We were there during a long weekend and a lot of places were closed entirely or early.
A wonderful weekend... and we'll definitely be back!
Lovely historical accommodation in fabulous location. Great comfy bed.

Lovely private room and great location.
I would recommend it.

Cosy cottage just off the Main Street of Angaston. Mark, the host, was really great with communication and recommendations. Space is a good size for two people and was very clean. Jack, Russel and Honey, their three dogs were a highlight. They were there to greet at every opportunity.
Cute place to stay with a comfy bed!
Beautiful room, great location. Spotlessly clean. Feels very homely and comfortable. Would recommend.
A lovely place to stay, very historical, great location to the barosda
Beautiful accommodation
Lovely place. Great quick responses from host and loads of privacy. The dogs are a welcoming treat.

Very stylish property.
Gorgeous location.
Very comfortable bed, exquisite bed linen.
Will definitely be re booking.

Stayed for the weekend for my girlfriends birthday and really enjoyed it, room was immaculate and mark had included everything we could need for our weekend with great little touches like coffee, fresh milk, water etc location in Angaston was great and made getting around very easy. For the price we were really happy with the room and would 100% recommend it.
Great place,location and nice wick check in. New bathrooms and Mark was there to greet us.
An amazing place to recharge between wineries and eating. Highly recommended!!

Perfection. We couldn't believe how lovely and how lucky we got staying in Mark's place.
Close by to the town, beautiful gardens, happy dogs, soft bed linen and comfortable bed! We hope to be back soon!!
Mark is a wonderful host, went above and beyond for us! Highly recommend a stay at  beautiful Hill House, thank you Mark.

What a beautiful place! Located in the charming town of Angaston, a short walk from the centre. It’s a super cute bedroom and lounge.
Everything you need with lovely sheets, great lighting, airflow and welcoming little dogs.
Lovely little place in the heart of the town - small but has all you need. Beautiful grounds & so close to everything in the town & the resident dogs made our stay even better than expected!
Very clean and location is (Website hidden by Airbnb) need to get the car out. Loved the dogs 😊

We had an amazing stay, Mark was a very gracious host with lots of tips for food and wine. It’s a beautiful place and they’ve recently renovated, so all the amenities and shower are fantastic. Built in 1851, it’s an historic and memorable stay. We’ll be back!
Nice spot, nice house, perfect for the Barossa
Great place to stay, lovely hosts, great location walking distance to cafe, restaurants and bars

1851 provided us with a very comfortable and enjoyable base in the Barossa. Thanks to Mark for being a very responsive and helpful host. He provided good recommendations on local attractions and eating options. we appreciated the little extras including mineral water and coffee machine. It was also lovely to have the company if the 3 dogs. We highly recommend 1851.

Had a last minute cancellation elsewhere and Mark was prompt to reply and got us in without a hiccup.
An amazing home with a brilliant fit out.
Highly recommended!

Great little bnb. Lovely host, good location, beautiful old converted apartment.

Would definitely stay again.

For your Barossa visit or just to get away this delightful original stone cottage has new bathroom and toilet is immaculately clean, with thoughtful touches like sparkling water, Nespresso machine and mixture of coffee pods along with fresh local milk in the fridge. The space is elegantly decorated with a comfortable bed with linen sheets and quilt cover. Mark and hi (Website hidden by Airbnb) are wonderful hosts.
We will be back.
Great accommodation, close to everything we needed
Lovely place clean and stylish with a historic feel and beautiful grounds. Best of all there was a teapot for us tea drinkers, a nice thoughtful touch.

We had a beautiful stay over the Easter long weekend. Mark was extremely helpful with providing recommendations about local eateries/wineries and was extremely prompt with communication. This place is a gem.
Cheers
Mark's place is centrally located in Angaston. It's a great spot for exploring the wider Barossa, and we had a comfortable couple of nights there.
Marks place  is gorgeous.  Sparkling clean and close to everything. Would stay again!

1815 was in a superb location as the village of Angaston is just a short walk. It was right on the Barossa Scenic Trail.
The ambience of the cottage is delightful and the terriers a bonus
Great location. great host...perfect...

Stayed in the 1851 for 3 very comfortable nights. Very well appointed for 2 people in a very nice setting. Bed is very comfortable with quality linen. Bathroom had a shower with good hot water and overall very clean. Would definitely stay again.
Lovely and cosy stay with friendly Jack Russell’s that would drop by for a pat. Very easy communication with Mark and perfect location for Barossa activities. Would definitely return.

Cute little cottage underneath a large property where Mark and his furbabies live.
Appreciated the little details like locally supplied handwash/shampoo & body wash, milk and pods for the nespresso machine and tea bags. Quality linen both bed and bathroom. Comfortable bed, although queen size for those who may need a king.
5 min walk to town. Angaston is a pretty town of course, not the bustling restaurant and shops choices like in Tanunda. That was perfectly fine for us.
We got to meet Mark who is a friendly guy and easy to talk with.
thanks for a lovely stay.

This is a truly great stay. A wonderful old dwelling with modern, warm and comfortable facilities. The accomodation is located in a great area close to all that is desired in the Barossa and Eden Valleys.

Lovely little 2 room underneath the main house. Angaston is central to everything in the Barossa and Hill House is a short stroll down to the main St of Angaston. A touch of home also with visits from Jack, Honey and Russell.
Lovely little space, with some very sweet dogs. This place is in walking distance of the main street, foodland, and parks. Great spot for great value.
What a beautiful old Barossa property. Loved it all. Mark was a wonderful host and our stay was the best we had in South Australia. Thanks
Marks place was better then the photos! Great location and neat, tidy space. Perfect spot to enjoy the beautiful barossa
Maureen house is brand new to the AirBnb community and it is truly lovely.  Set in a lovely picturesque area of the Adelaide Hills close to the Barossa wine district.
This home was even better than expected! Large dining and entertaining space, perfect for a family or small group. Maureen was so easy to communicate with. We had a great stay in Mt Pleasant.

Great location to visit the Adelaide Hills, Eden Valley and Barossa Valley. The house is in a quiet location and easy walk into Mt Pleasant main street. The house was immaculately clean and tidy with plenty of room for a family or two couples with all the conveniences of a well set up house. The host provided timely updates before and after our stay. Thankyou Maureen for sharing your lovely house and garden.
Beautiful home, so welcoming, elegant and spotlessly clean.   Spacious bedrooms and living areas.  Highly recommend a stay with Maureen.

Maureen's home is lovely, light-filled, spacious, and inviting. The kitchen is huge and the view from the family room is calming and beautiful. We loved our two-night stay and wished we'd planned a longer trip!
This house is honestly beautiful, immaculate and serene. We had a fabulous weekend and wish we could’ve stayed longer! Definitely would stay again.

Very calming, stylish and relaxing. A very very quiet town with a supermarket 10mins drive away, you will love the simple layout of the house allowing couples of families to relax.

Perfect for a glass of wine on the patio watching the birds nestle in the trees.

Bring your own food and drinks to cook up a storm in a kitchen that has everything you need.


The house is in the main street but some trucks are the only noise you’ll hear. 25mins to Barossa - such an easy drive. We loved it - I’m sure you will too!

Maureen was an excellent host, quick and clear with communications. The house is very stylish  and spacious. Maureen was very thoughtful to leave out a cot and paddling pool for our toddler. We would definitely recommend staying here and would love to visit again ourselves in the future.

Maureen's home was lovely, homey and stylish. It's a beautiful space in a lovely location that just comes to life on the weekend. I highly recommend staying here in this GORGEOUS home. It is picture perfect. All the best x

My family and I had a wonderful stay at Maureen's place. The house was beautiful and well appointed with very comfortable bedding.  We particularly loved the extra special touches such as beautiful linen, great toiletries  and small pantry items to use such as oils and spices etc. My daughters loved the fact that there was a cupboard filled with puzzles, games and paper for drawing.  Mount Pleasant is nicely situated in the Barossa to explore many towns and enjoy the sanctuary of a quiet country town.  We would love to stay again sometime and make it to the farmers market held on a Saturday morning.  Thanks once again.
The house and gardens are beautiful! Such a lovely spot! The house was clean and comfortable, plenty of space for everyone to relax, great for families, I highly recommend.
This is a lovely house, thoughtfully equipped in a splendid location. Not far to the Barossa, to the McLaren Vales, to the Murray, to the hills or to the city. Would love to come back one day

Maureen’s home was absolutely stunning. We were blown away by how picturesque both the home and surrounding property were. Having family over from Sydney and being able to show off what South Australia has to offer was incredible and to be able to do that from this gorgeous house was just the icing on top! Hospitality was outstanding, with milk, eggs and bacon awaiting us in the fridge on arrival too!  Couldn’t have asked for better and would 10000% recommend Maureen’s home to anyone else looking for a lovely getaway.

Maureen's place is a stunning open living cottage house. The property has some stunning surroundings and the house it's self has been decked out in the best of brands for appliances, towels etc. the pictures certainly don't do the house justice. It has been the best property we have ever stayed at.

What a beautiful property in the quiet town of Mt Pleasant. Great for exploring the SA countryside: 20 mins to the Adelaide Hills and 30 mins to the Barossa Valley. Maureen is a great host, including spices, olive oil and any other essentials you need to cook up a storm in her gorgeous kitchen. Our kids loved the toys, dollhouse, sheep and alpacas. It kept them entertained for hours! The SA countryside in general is very family friendly. We will definitely be back!
Beautiful location, really enjoyed looking out into the paddocks and watching the sheep roam around. Big house with lots of space, good amenities. Very well stocked kitchen.

Thank you Maureen for your prompt responses. We loved the open family area of kitchen/dine/lounge but also appreciated the separate front loung for those who wanted quiet time for reading a book. Personally we prefer slightly firmer beds, but loved the quality linen. Thanks also for our breakfast provisions. Highly recommended.
very neat and cozy for farm stay
Thank you Maureen for making your lovely place available. It is all we hoped for and more.

Maureen's place is absolutely fantastic. It is fully equipped with everything you could need and in a quiet area. Mt. Pleasant shops etc are a short stroll away. We loved everything about the week we stayed here.

A beautifully appointed cottage with fantastic inclusions and a great place to unwind after some challenging roads, some unbelievable food destinations, and very enticing historic and new vineyards. And we loved the little country touch with Alpaca and friends in the backyard!

We had the most wonderful time staying in Maureen’s beautiful home.
We were so sad to leave!

We loved waking up every morning to the fabulous view of the hills. It was so spacious and relaxing. I hope we are able to come back and stay again. It was exactly what we needed after a busy few months.

We went on many long drives around the Barossa which was fabulous. It was also nice coming back to the charming cottage at the end of each day.

There is a brilliant local farmers market about a 5 minutes walk from the property every Saturday. We got there around 9am for an amazing cooked breakfast! We definitely recommend that.

Down the road there is a butchers, pharmacy, post office and a fabulous little Cafe with a general store attached. This is all walking distance from the cottage.

We came from abroad and didn’t have any data on our phones so we bought a pocket WiFi from the post office which worked really well.

Maureen’s place is completely charming and definitely a hidden gem.

Absolutely beautiful home & garden. The presentation and cleanliness were outstanding As was Maureen’ s hospitality.
Located a short walk to the impressive farmers markets with beautiful views of the surrounding farm land.
We couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay.
Lovely house particularly for a family visit
Excellent house with all the necessary amenities and a super stocked kitchen. Great base for exploring the Barossa. a wonderful place to stay.

We loved staying at this beautiful, large home. It really did feel like a home away from home as everything we could need was all there.
Would highly recommend!

Maureen, staying at your place was an absolute dream!
It was a gorgeous country dollhouse which made for the most memorable weekend away! Thank you for letting us stay there :)
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here
We had a wonderful few days in Mount Pleasant, and felt we stayed in the best house in town 😊
What a wonderful place to stay! We would highly recommend this amazing home to anyone staying in the area.

Had such a great time here. The perfect base - 1 hour from the city, one hour or so from McLaren Vale region (we did a self drive) and the same for Barossa Valley. Plenty of nearby shops and we tried out the local pub. The house was so beautiful - the garden was the perfect backdrop for a sunset, the kitchen was large and had everything we needed to cook, the rooms were so comfy and beautiful. Maureen also had our first breakfast covered and all the basics in the kitchen.

This home is so beautifully decorated with fabulous amenities and stunning garden and lovely outlook from the back verandah for a home in town. It was within a 30 min drive to Angaston and little country towns as well as numerous wineries. My family and I had a wonderful time. The beds were very comfortable and the house furnishings very luxurious. I highly recommend this house and host.
Beautiful house, thoughtfully equipped, in a charming Adelaide Hills / Barossa Valley location
Beautiful house to relax in after exploring the barossa and beyond!
We enjoyed a great weekend away with friends in this beautiful home, it had good amenities and comfy beds, we will definitely be recommending to others.
A great place to stay on the edge of the Barossa, you can sit and look at the beautiful countryside from the back door!
Beautifully decored house that you will fall in love with upon opening the front door.  The house reminds me of my trip to France.
We would highly recommend this place to anyone it really is a home away from home.
Such a stunning place to stay. Incredible home. Sweetest area. Comfiest beds!!
Gorgeous house, not too far from Adelaide city. Driving distance to some lovely Adelaide hills wineries. Thanks Maureen!
The place was perfect. The house had everything we needed for a weekend away!
What a beautiful place to stay. It is so clean, comfortable and inviting and easily accommodated two families including a baby and a toddler.
What a lovely home. Everything that you could possibly need, a beautiful setting, clear communication, large comfortable beds. Would stay again with hesitation and recommend to anyone.

A lovely place to stay for families with young children; Maureen has all the great extras like kids toys, books, plastic cutlery etc that make life a lot easier! Very comfy and homely. Loved the sheep and alpaca too. Easy location for visiting both the Barossa and Adelaide Hills so a great place all round. We had a fantastic time!

Our three day family stay just wasn’t long enough.  Beautifully presented, homely accommodation with everything you need and some truely thoughtful touches.  Maureen and her family are exceptional hosts and I highly recommend this location.  We will be back.
What a stunning home! Our group were so comfortable and at ease our entire stay and would definitely stay again. Maureen was very accomodating & quick to respond. A perfect airbnb stay.
Spectacular home and a great base for exploring the wonderful Barossa valley, note the team at the Tanundra iSite are simply awesome in making customised suggestions!
Fantastic home, beautiful gardens and outlook, great kitchen and every room is lovely. Excellent selection of games, puzzles and toys for the children.

Outstanding place to stay for families with top notch facilities and modern design.
Very nice place to relax and with easy access to wineries in the region by car.
Great place to stay, my children loved the size of the back yard
Beautiful house and garden. Immaculate condition, very big, stylish decorations. Plenty of supplies in the pantry too.

Photo's just don't do this place justice, as soon as you walk in you feel like you're at home instantly. All the amenities are 5 stars and the little extras like breakfast provisions were such a nice touch. The house was super clean, beds were comfortable and heating was so good for the chilly winter! It's the perfect place for a cozy weekend away in winter, I would love to come back in Spring when the garden is in full bloom and you can utilise the alfresco area for meals. Using the bonfire and wood oven was also a treat, definitely a must for pizza lovers and making s'mores with the kids! Thank you Maureen for this amazing getaway!
Lovely place to stay and get a away for the weekend.

We had a lovely time at Maureen's stylish place in Mt Pleasant. Everything was clean, comfortable and plentiful, really felt like we have been well looked after by the host. With the lush pastoral landscape in the region and its beautiful produce, it really made a perfect winter getaway!

Peaceful, very comfortable country escape, all conveniences included, fantastic for families with children. A great location for farmer's markets and exploring the Hills and Barossa. Easy choice for Mount Pleasant!

I visited Maureens place with two friends for a quick weekend away. Needed much longer! Beautiful views, very clean and lots of helpful amenities throughout. Very comfortable beds also! Great location and will come back one day for a longer stay!
A beautiful house in a beautiful location. Maureen was an excellent and quick communicator who made the booking and staging process very easy. Very clean and spacious house. Thanks again, Maureen.

The house was full of high end amenities. Yummy bacon, eggs, bread, jams for breakfast. About half hour from Tanunda and gorgeous surroundings.
Definitely recommend staying!
Absolutely beautiful.
Beautiful space, very well designed, very clean, well equipped!!!! We had a great time there! Pizza oven was great! All the books and toys for kids! The view in the morning was spectacular!

Second time staying at this beautiful property. Well appointed, sparkling clean and comfy bedrooms for the whole family. The kids loved all the things to do in the house, and we all enjoyed the pizza oven. Short walk to the local park and nice seeing the sheep and alpaca out the back and all the beautiful birds drinking out of the bird bath. The garden is gorgeous to look out on as well. Thoroughly enjoyed our weekend away.
House is amazing, very clean has everything you need and more. Lovely gardens and outdoor area. Would love to stay again.

very beautiful house, thoughtfully decorated and has everything you need to make the stay extra comfortable. location is perfect to visit the wineries.
we had an absolutely fabulous time here...
the local pub and bakery, just add to the excitement....

Lovely weekend away with the girls, everything you needed.
very stylish and cosy.

We recently stayed for 3 nights and loved it. This place is beautifully presented, comfortable and welcoming. The country location offers beautiful views with plenty to do on your doorstep. The small touches like a variety of children's toys, the breakfast provisions and firewood provided meant our stay was even more enjoyable. We would love to come back again as it suited the needs of our 2 small families perfectly. The huge kitchen with everything you could possibly need was a highlight too!
Lovely character home with beautiful countryside views. House very well equipped with lots of extra touches for a comfortable stay!

Great spot for a quiet getaway - firepit and pizza oven were amazing entertainment for kids and adults in winter. Well setup kitchen for home cooking, noting limited takeaway options in close proximity.
Amazing house, impeccably presented and resourced.  We had an amazing time.  Maureen’s communication was amazing - a perfect stay.

The most beautiful home in a great location! Photos do not do this house justice - when you walk in you are blown away by how gorgeous this home is! Everything you could possibly need is provided and the stunning kitchen is fully stocked for cooking up a storm. Immaculately clean - and I mean perfectly clean!! And Maureen is only a phone call or text away if you have any questions. The outdoor area is just fantastic and cars are parked safely behind the house. We absolutely loved our time here and cannot recommend this house or the host enough.
Had a great time exploring the Barossa from our little cottage

We were privileged to be the first guests to stay here and it is clear the owners have put alot of time and effort into this place. Its bloody fantastic, when they say luxury tent experience they certainly deliver, next level glamping. Kate our host was approachable, accomodating and puts on the best cheese platter and breakfast spread we've ever had in an airbnb. The tent in situated at the bottom of their property next to a little creek with views from your bed across the paddock. Cannot fault the experience. It was a memorable stay. Will be back!
Fantastic and unique getaway. Amazing attention to detail with all the little touches throughout the tent. Highly recommend!

If you could classify a tent as being the “four seasons” of tents, then you have it right there! It is beautifully stunning, even down to the small details. Perfect in every way. Sandy the family dog came and visited us which was nice there is also sheep and two horses. (So make sure you take some carrots & apples as they love them). Star gazing on an evening is a must so quiet and totally dark.

We had the best 3 nights staying at Kate’s place! Words can’t express how beautiful the tent is, tranquil and serene! The inside is outstanding and the bath is sublime! The views and the fire and wine, what more do you need for a relaxing get away! It’s right on the door step of the Barossa Valley! We had absolutely everything we could need! Kate is an awesome host, so kind and attentive! We had a great last night with the hosts! Honestly couldn’t ask for anything more! Toasting marshmallows in the campfire, watching the stars! The Tent is 10 stars! Highly recommend to anyone who wants a truest memorable experience! We had a fantastic time!!!
Lovely place if you want something a bit different. Peaceful, relaxing, and a little quirky. Kate has thought of everything, well catered and very hospitable. Highly recommend.

What a fabulous hidden gem. From the moment we arrived to the late check out we truly didn't want to leave this private oasis. The tent is stylish in decor and amenities with breath taking views. Which only got better at night when we turned on the fairy lights and little lanterns lit the way to the fire pit area. A wonderfully romantic, very private unique place to stay.
Highly recommend it for a special occassion. Hard to beat!!
Fantastic place. We loved seeing the stars at night and it is a really unique place to stay. Kate is a great host. Thanks!

The tent is very cosy and has all the amenities you would want. The bath faces out to a beautiful view, as does the bed. The outdoor kitchen is well stocked with all the tools you need for cooking anything you like. It was such a relaxing stay we hope we can go again when we visit the Barossa.

We had the most wonderful stay at Kate's gorgeous tent. Every tiny detail was covered, even things we would have never expected! The location is the perfect home base to explore all the Barossa has to offer, but you could just as happily spend all of your time at the property too. Kate couldn't have been more helpful or accomodating. We had the most magic time and would 100% love to come back and stay again!

One of the best Air Bnbs I have ever stayed in, complete with the cutest BnB doggo!

Clean, luxurious, private, unique and quiet - what more could you want?
Easily the BEST place I’ve ever stayed !! Absolute bliss - every detail spot on - gorgeous bed, bath, view.

We absolutely loved our stay at Kate’s and Garry’s place! Very peaceful and you have the whole place for yourself. Clean and everything had been provided for. Glamping at it’s best! The food left for us in the fridge was delicious and more than enough for breakfast. We even snacked on it in the evening. Location is great; you’re basically in the centre of Barossa. Overall, perfect for us. Can highly recommend the luxury tent.

This is an exceptional property! An outstanding location right in the middle of the bush but not very far away from Angaston. Kate had contacted me quite a number of days before arriving with local tips and recommendations to help us plan our trip, which was super helpful! Upon arrival, we were blown away how picturesque the location was and how beautiful the tent was! It was extremely clean, very spacious and well equipped with everything that we needed. Kate and Gary were also on hand if we needed anything extra. I would highly recommend this property-I definitely want to come back!!

The luxury clamping site that Kate has created was a perfect holiday away from home. There were so many little touches that made our stay so enjoyable and relaxing. I highly recommend this place - I didn't want to leave!
Great Luxury tent accomodation with full bath and ensuite with handy outdoor kitchen. Relaxing spot.

We absolutely loved staying at such a unique place in the heart of the Eden Valley! The tent and the outdoor area were laid out with the most homely of touches, we loved the decor and the brekky in the morning. Whilst the tent is nicely heated inside, it would be good to bring warm clothes if you want to have dinner outside as it can get a bit chilly!

Thanks again Kate for such a delightful stay!

We loved everything about our stay in the luxury tent! The tent itself was amazing - so comfortable, pretty, clean and warm. Opening the canvas sides to be able to look out on the farm and animals was just breathtaking. The bathroom was superb with a lovely shower and the most decadent of baths - i recommend relaxing in a warm bath on a rainy day with a glass of local red. The kitchen amenities were also excellent, all you need for a gorgeous stay. Communication with Kate was easy, helpful and friendly. We cant wait to return.
Perfect remote retreat with all the luxury you could wish for.
A wonderful place and brilliant bush experience. Thanks Kate
Had a beautiful couple of nights away, loved the tent. Highly recommend staying here.

Absolutely loved the glamping tent.. So comfortable and everything that you require is there!! Wonderful to wake up to all the animals and a nice red around the fire!! My first glamping experience will certainly not be my last!!
Perfect spot
Wonderful little spot to stay for a day or two or longer. Spectacular all round view of the nature. Definitely recommend to others to stay
A really beautiful, unique space and location, with lots of extra touches.

Our stay at Boongarrie Luxury Tent was an absolute delight! Perfect for a relaxing and romantic getaway.
Kate and Garry have put such thought into the set up & the space has everything you could possibly want. Their local knowledge and advice prior to our visit was so helpful.
Truly there is nothing better than waking up to the view over the paddocks each day.
The fire supplies were a pleasant surprise & playing with beautiful pup Sandy was an added bonus to a perfect trip.
Can't recommend highly enough & would love to come back one day!

A place to recharge and take stock of life.  A lovely peaceful, well kitted out refuge from the busy-ness of todays lifestyle.  Fifteen mins drive to nearby towns to stock up and spend as much time as possible at Boongarrie, enjoying the hospitality and the fabulous countryside and night sky of the surrounds.
What a beautiful outlook, we had such a relaxing weekend! The tent was clean, and had everything we needed.

Kate’s Boongarrie Luxury Tent was amazing! With a grate location just a short drive to everywhere we wanted to go to in the Barossa Valley, the Luxury Tent, was exactly that, a luxury!

Kate and Garry have done an amazing job styling the Tent and providing many creature comforts that made our stay a pure pleasure.

Great place, so peaceful and close to nature. Sandy was very special, beautiful dog.
Kate was very nice and lovely to talk too. Will be telling everyone about this gem.
Thanks

Luxury  tent is an understatement! Kate has thought of everything ..its all there and more ! Extreamly comfortable, clean , warm, and just so beautiful.  The property is great  with friendly animals to pat and lovely little nooks to explore. The highlight for me was the glorious big bathtub with views across the property,  bath salts and bombs provided , very spoilt.  You will not be dissapointed, travel around to local wineries or just relax and soak up the ambience.  We will definitely be back thanks Kate for all the special touches that you dont normally recieve at a BnB. In love with Boongarie

Oh my golly ! How lucky we were to enjoy this amazing space! Filled with luxurious touches and yummy delights including homemade bread. It has the best bath in the Barossa, incredible views, a twitchers paradise ... so much love for this place! Thank you Kate and Garry you’re on a winner! ❤️
The most beautiful place I have ever been, the amazing views from the bed and bath were incredible... such a relaxing getaway, we will definitely be back very soon!!

The whole experience was pure magic. The tent is even more beautiful in person and Kate & Garry went above and beyond with extra touches. The horses were so friendly! Definitely buy apples of carrots from the market and spend some time feeding them. Pootawanga Wineries just across the way is some of the best wine I've had in South Australia - highly recommend booking a private tasting.

However, if you're stuck on what to do, just flick Kate a message. She has spot-on suggestions. Overall, one of the best weekends away we've ever had. Highly recommend staying here.

Unfortunately we were unable to stay at this beautiful property due to the real threat of bushfires. Kate went above and beyond to communicate with us and make sure we were safe and happy. We look forward to eventually meeting the lovely Kate soon and staying at her beautiful property.

We loved staying here over New Years! Even though it was hot, we found things to do and the aircon was very handy! Kate gave us great restaurant recommendations which we made the most of. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a quiet escape.

We couldn’t fault our stay at Boongarie luxury tent. You tell that Kate and Garry go above and beyond for their guests and have thought of everything. Finding the fully stocked fridge with breakfast supplies was a special touch. Communication with Kate was friendly and helpful. Providing us with tips for local wineries and restaurants before our stay. 10/10 could not recommend enough!!

Cannot speak highly enough of Boongarrie Luxury Tent - was amazing and perfectly equipped with generous and thoughtful personal touches.
We loved it!

Glamping comes with the friendliest horses, sheep & dog. I love this! Perfectly baked fresh bread & delicious local wine greated us on arrival & the property boasted the most adorable little seating areas hidden amongst the surrounds.

Amazing accommodation! Definitely a luxury stay and in a beautiful location. The wildlife was a great bonus - we saw a kangaroo plus joey about 50 metres from the tent. Will be recommending to all our friends!

This is such a beautiful place to stay... definitely the fanciest tent we've ever stayed in. We felt like we did it all... feed the horses, bath overlooking the land, breakfast alfresco with the sheep, and wine under the stars.

It feels like your own little remote paradise, but beautifully furnished and with touches of hospitality that go above and beyond. (We did end up having some 40+ weather during our stay, so it got a bit hot of the second night with no breeze, but the fan and AC really helped.) We've already recommended to friends.
A wonderful luxury tent - definitely glamping (not camping). Beautiful little touches with breakfast supplies & wine on arrival. Would thoroughly recommend

Loved waking up in the morning to the sounds of the kookaburra’s and birds. Brekky supplied, with a great bottle of wine provided on arrival. The homemade bread and jam was delicious. Enjoyed walking around and appreciating the natural landscape. The luxury tent had everything you needed plus a beautiful tub to soak in, with bubbles and bath salt’s supplied. Kate provided great recommendations for activities to see and do. Highly recommend other’s to try Boongarrie luxury tent.
Most stunning views in an amazing place to spend away. So many little touches that made the whole experience so special. Thank you for making it such an incredible place to stay!
Gorgeous place and wonderful scenery
Amazing!!! exactly what we needed!

We loved staying in Kate and Gaz’s beautiful tent and waking up to the Magpies and Kookaburras in the morning. Such a lovely property to explore and it even had a fire pit to enjoy while having a wine and watching the sunset. Just what we needed.
We hope to be back!

I absolutely loved staying here with my partner. It was our one year anniversary, so this location was perfect for the occasion. The thoughtfulness of setting everything  up, leaving breakfast food and a bottle of wine out and also giving us tips and info about the area was better then we could’ve asked for. 100% recommend staying here. Kate and Gary were amazing hosts, and I’ll definitely be back.

We absolutely loved staying at the luxury tent! There were so many beautiful touches and all the amenities we needed.   The tent was lovely and warm at night and we were greatful for the wine, fresh bread and choccies :) Kate was very helpful with recommendations and any questions we had. Although not many places were open at this time due we Covid, there was still plenty to do at the farm to keep us entertained. Thank you for wonderful stay!

We absolutely loved our stay. This place is so special and great for a romantic getaway. We loved the thoughtful touches and enjoyed visiting both Poonawatta and Flaxman winery near by. Hopefully be back again to visit soon!
What a beautiful place! More than we expected. 🙂⛺✨🍷

My wife and I stayed for Two nights at the Boongarrie glamping tents. It was a fantastic two night, their wasn’t anything extra we needed or could have asked for, was very very comfortable and great way to spend a few days. It was also a fantastic point to explore the Barossa especially Tanunda which offered great food and so many wines options. Poonawatta wines was especially great with a dedicated path built through the paddock to make it walking distance and an enjoyable afternoon.
Perfect location for lots of activities, the site is well set up with everything you need, peacefully walk around the property or head to a winery.

amazing experience, very cosy and comfortable. The scenery is great, the hospitality is exceptional. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family.
It’s not far from restaurants/cafes and there’s lots of activities etc close by.

Such a tranquil setting: the sounds of the sheep, the laughs of the kookaburras, a creek to explore, outdoor area with a campfire plus there’s the tent... separate kitchen area, bath overlooking the fields with the warm afternoon sun coming in... this is a special place that gives you a taste of the outdoors with all the luxuries of modern living.

Kate and Garry. Are very accomodating and made our stay so comfortable. Everything at Boongarrie is set out beautifully, it is such a cosy place to stay. They have thought of all the extra little comforts, like the homemade bread, breakfast items and treats which made it extra special. Having the options to spend time in the tent or by the fire was fantastic, with everything ready to go from Kate and Garry made our stay so effortless. Prior to booking Kate offered so many suggestions of local eats and places to visit which meant we could plan our whole getaway and even invite family up for a day trip and lunch in the Barossa. Time well spent in a great part of South Australia!

A few days away to reset is exactly what we needed and what a perfect way to spend it at @glampingatboongarrie ❤️
Kate and Gary created this stunning little oasis on their property and share their beautiful slice of paradise for us to enjoy.
Relaxing, serene views and the perfect spot to unwind.
Beautiful large tent with all the creature comforts and a stunning ensuite, so many spots to sit down and relax and enjoy the surrounds, fully equipped outdoor kitchen and bbq. Breakfast food is provided AND they bake you a fresh loaf of bread 🤤 say whaaaaat 🍞

Highly recommend for a couples weekend away and that reset that we all need at times 🌷
The facilities were perfect,   and the location is delightful. The bird bath was frozen when we woke, but we slept warm and cozy!
The best place I’ve ever stayed at!

Kate and Garry have create a space that forces people to slow down and take a deep breathe. Boongarrie exceeded our expectations. Everything has been carefully considered in this luxury tent, including thoughtful breakfast provisions (Garry's homemade bread is to die for), showering supplies, right down to prepared fire pit area. The highlight to our stay would have to be sharing breakfast with our neighbouring horses, your gorgeous and behaved dog Sandy and the copious bird and wildlife. Thank you for establishing this beauty in the bush, we will be back!!!
Good
Thoroughly enjoyed our cozy winter stay, and can see how this would be great in warmer weather too!

Better than expected! We went in winter with temps down to 1 degree overnight and We were incredibly warm inside the tent!!  The fairy lights at night are a beautiful touch. So nice to wake up to the sound of nature and baby lambies bleating away 🥰

Thank you so much Kate and Garry for this beautiful little stay!! We could only stay for one night but we've already decided we want to come back so we can fully sit back, relax and enjoy the cosy space you have provided. We loved the little touches like the home made bread, fairy lights, hot bath, dressing gowns and Netflix!! Waking up to the birds singing and drinking my coffee watching the horses play and sheep graze was very peaceful. It well exceeded our expectations and I cannot recommend Boongarrie tent enough!

Boongarrie is everything you could want in a luxury clamping experience and SO MUCH MORE. Our expectations were far exceeded by the beautiful surrounds, the fully equipped “outdoor” kitchen, the luxury en-suite/bath, the four poster bed, the indoor kitchenette as well as the incredibly thoughtful welcoming touches. We won’t hesitate to tell everyone we know about this place and can’t wait to get back one day. Thank you Kate and Garry!!
A stunning experience and a beautiful way to take some respite.
Beautiful little spot to get away for a few nights. Speaking of night, the sounds of all the native birds is just magic whilst your laying in bed!

Staying at Boongarrie is an absolutely amazing experience. Kate and Garry have thought of everything when it comes to this glamping experience. We had the most relaxing and peaceful weekend and we got to enjoy all of the beautiful food and wine in the surrounding areas. We will be coming back again!

We spent only a night but for sure not the last time. The amenities on the site are clean and tidy, we’ve got almost everything we need. It’s the most idilicc and beautiful place to spend to unwind. We really had a great time, a place for us to cherish.

Greg & Clezel
Amazing place to stay for a relaxing getaway! The tent is clean and tidy and has everything you could possibly need. Definitely one of the best glamping experiences around!

Boongarrie was the perfect mini honeymoon for myself and my new husband! We had time time to relax and recharge for in amongst nature then a short drive would take you into some of the beautiful towns that make up the Barossa Valley. Lots of little personal touches like freshly baked bread and a bottle of local red wine just made it so much more special. Thankyou so much, we will definitely be back again ☺️
Excellent place to stay. Highly recommend.
Everything about this place is so perfect.
Wonderful luxury tent is peaceful surroundings. We will be back.
We had an amazing stay everything was perfect! From wildlife running right in front of us to the little touches with fresh eggs and bread.

My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary and it was definitely one to remember.
The location was absolutely stunning and the tent felt so comfortable and homely.
The little details such as breakfast in the morning added to the whole experience.
Sitting on the deck with some wine and cheese and watching the animals was a truly memorable experience.
I would definitely recommend Glamping at Boongarrie!
Was fantastic! Couldn’t have asked for a better stay
Beautiful glamping experience, with everything you could possibly need and more. Loved the gorgeous nature and animals around the property too 😍

Kate has an amazing place to sit back and relax. They have everything and more to enjoy a comfortable stay for many days! Not short of little extras (eggs, bacon, wine, chocolate). We were very lucky with the weather which made the stay even more enjoyable. Would highly recommend and we will be back again!
Wonderful accomodation and a beautiful location!

Beautiful Glamping experience with this-  good location around Barossa , hosts were friendly and communication was easy. Bathroom was clean and place was comfortable to stay, definitely recommend if you're looking for a cosy glamping site in SA:)

We really enjoyed our stay at Boongarrie, it was a great place to relax together for a few days. Perfect for an unique experience in the country whilst still being close enough to enjoy the numerous features of the Barossa and Angaston. Thanks Kate and Garry for your hospitality.
Excellent
It is really a wonderful place to stay and rewind. We had a great time.

Kate’s luxury tent is such a great space to spend time away from the city and relax in a calming farm/rural environment. The tent is very well equipped and perfect for a couples weekend getaway. It is very tastefully adorned with great views of the farm and livestock. Best of all the farm friends who wonder over to say hello, two beautiful horses to greet you each morning and love pats and scratches!

Thank you for allowing us to stay on your beautiful property. We loved waking up each morning to the sheep and birds, wonderfully done! Hats off to you both. Would recommend your place to anyone needing an escape somewhere beautiful. Definitely a romantic getaway and unwind!
Watching the sunset over the paddocks on the deck of the tent was beautiful and the area itself was a delight

Amazing place to stay for couples. Definitely would recommend anyone who is looking for something in Barossa. It gets cold at night however there’s heating and blankets available. There’s even a loaf of bread, eggs and a bottle of wine!
Fantastic place for couples wanting to escape back to nature.

We absolutely loved our stay at Kate's place. The tent is gorgeous and there are so many thoughtful touches.
We would definitely come back again!
Was fantastic
absolutely loved our stay, wonderful peaceful location right in the heart of the region and plenty of unexpected touches that made our stay a delight. would recommend!
