we had an awesome time the peace and tranquility were awesome the amenities were great as well. Definately recomend staying there.
was a great weekend getaway destination
We had a lovely time - truly a great spot with all you could ask for. Don’t hesitate!

Such a beautiful and romantic getaway to celebrate my husbands 40th Birthday. The location is beautiful, it was lovely to be surrounded by nature. The facilities were clean and the view from the bath was beautiful. The breakfast provisions was much appreciated and we loved the home made bread. Wish we could have stayed longer as it was hard to leave the accommodation but we also wanted to explore the Barossa.
Can’t wait to visit again!

Stunning tent , thoughtfully decorated , lovely outlook . Gorgeous to sit on the deck fir a sundowner for lovely sunsets and  then watch the stars emerge . Some lovely spots around the property to sit and contemplate . We loved our stay .
Private and very well set up.

Kate’s place is an incredible escape from the city. Perfectly formed, the tent is cosy but also feels spacious enough for two people to comfortably inhabit. The amenities are superb, and bathrobes are provided for you which was a lovely touch. The complimentary wine and chocolates were also very much appreciated. As it is a tent it gets extremely cold overnight depending on the weather so make sure to pack some warm clothing, although there is a heater and the bedding is very nice and warm. Overall an incredible stay and we can’t wait to get back as soon as possible.

definitely worth it, relaxing accomodating beautiful little eco tent! would definitely go back for another soak in the tub! had absolutely everything we needed including nice home made bread for breakfast, kate was easy to communicate with. i thoroughly enjoyed my stay 😍
great little get away. their horses were so gorgeous and friendly.
The attention to detail is felt throughout, definitely worth staying for an out-of-the-box, but still totally luxurious, getaway!
nice place to stay

Such an amazing place! So clean and went above and beyond with all my extras such as adding balloons, providing a platter with all the foods we love and bringing down wood when we needed it! Will definitely be back! It was such a great experience! Thanks x

Great location and really relaxing.
We stayed one night but we wish that we could have stayed another
Boongarie luxury tent was an incredible experience. We would definitely stay again. A great set up in a beautiful setting. We loved sitting by the fire at night.
Perfect weekend away! Well catered for with everything you could need! An enjoyable experience that we would recommend to others.

Boongarrie is absolutely wonderful. It’s secluded amongst paddocks in the middle of wine-growing country. There’s a closer connection to nature staying in the perma-tent, but with the perks of a hot bath, warm comfy bed, decking and fire pit that give you the taste of luxury too. Absolutely loved the place.

A tranquil quiet location, a beautiful outlook and lots of privacy. The tent is luxurious and has all you need with some personal touches. Two nights wasn’t long enough, we would have loved to stay longer. Close to many amazing locations in the Barossa. Thanks

A beautiful place to stay! Would absolutely recommend!! Kate and Gaz have done a fantastic job! A lovely couple too. The tent itself is stunning with so many beautiful features. The bath with a veiw was amazing and my partner was all about the home made bread! It was a cold weekend but we were able to enjoy an outdoor fire and the heating in the tent was certainly enough. Would love to come and stay again :)
An amazing getaway with so many lovely additional touches - would highly recommend
Heavenly location and absolute luxury and comfort!
The morning view is just AMAZING, had a small fire at night, animals about, just lovely

Freshly baked bread, farm eggs and wine provided was a nice touch!  All ammenities were provided, Kate took the upmost care in making our stay very comfortable. Also there are cute horses and sheeps nearby!

This was our second stay here and still just as good as we remember. Next time it’ll be an even longer stay. There was one night when a proper frost came in but it was so snuggly warm in the tent. Absolutely perfect!
Ansolutely stunning accommodation with wvehthing to do! Kate the host is very kind and gracious and will make sure you have eveutjing you need. 10/10
Amazing cosy feel, would recommend time and time again

Exceeded expectations! An amazing spring location surrounded by wildlife and greenery. If you want to sip red wine by an open fire and look at the stars this is the place to stay. The hosts put many small touches on our stay including fresh home made bread and breakfast provided.
Great romantic get-away. Lovely and secluded. Kates place has great amenities and is definitely worth the visit.
10/10 would recommend, beautiful little farm stay and a nice play for a weekend getaway. Will definitely return in the future

Kate and Garry have gone to exceptional lengths to provide their visitors with a special and unique experience. We love our time spent at Boongarrie, so much so that it has become an annual tradition. Thank you so much Kate and Garry, we will see you next year!
Loved this place! Highly recommend for a little getaway

Had a great time in the luxury tent.
Everything you could need for a short stay was there.
The tent was cosy warm despite the wind and rain that we had.
Shower was good and the bath fantastic.
Great place to stay

Amazing property! Has everything you need for a weekend away. From the homemade bread, the bottle of wine and the trail of lights through the garden, the many little finishing touches really make this place very special.
Absolutely amazing accommodation. The photos do not do it justice! Stunning views, beautifully designed and great communication! Cant wait to come back!
Amazing stay with everything you could want and need out of a few nights away! Incredibly relaxing!
Kate and Garry have done an amazing job with the place. The new addition of the outdoor bath tub was the icing on top. The complementary wine was a nice touch. Look forward to coming back again.
My partner and I had the absolute pleasure staying at this stunning place! The wow factor when first arriving and checking the place out was big! Highly recommend it for a romantic getaway.

Perfect getaway
From busy lives
Incredible! A must stay if heading to the Barossa. Kate and Gary were fabulous hosts and we enjoyed every minute of our time at Boongarrie

Kate’s  place exceeded our expectations, the location is perfect and the accomodation has everything you could need and more. Kate left some beautiful touches such as freshly baked bread and a bottle of red wine which were so welcoming. The outdoor bath is divine and the view and scenery is breathtaking. We would book again in a heartbeat. Thank you so much for having us 💕
We had a wonderful stay!! Everything was there that we needed. Taking a bath under the stars was really great!! Recommended

AMAZING!!!

So so beautiful!

Very special location
Beautiful spot and very relaxing !

Amazing location with lots to do. All the facilities you need to stay in and have a romantic and relaxing weekend. Only a short drive from some of the Barossa’s best wineries. The only downside is you will want to stay longer!
This stay was absolutely wonderful. Very clean, kitchen was well equipped and it was just lovely. I would definitely come back and stay again.
Absolutely loved staying here! Worth every penny!
Amazing location and a unique stay. Quiet and cozy. Will definitely come back here again.

Such a lovely accomodation! Kate has really thought of absolutely everything to make this a special space. There is everything you will need and is the perfect spot for a nice getaway. Only a short drive to all the spots you’ll need.
Amazing, this place is the dream! Loved tge home made bread, fresh eggs, and wonderful views of the farm from bed! We were thrilled.

Kate’s luxury tent stay was incredible!! She has thought of everything in terms of small touches that make your stay comfortable. The outdoor bath was a highlight. Comfortable and warm in the tent. So peaceful on the property and loved having the animals close by and so many birds. Would 100% come and stay again :-)

You won’t find a nicer place in the whole area, my wife and I have stayed at Boongarrie twice now with two years between stays and it was even better the second time.

It’s an easy drive over into the Barossa proper, but if you’re anything like us you’ll just want to spend the time in this idyllic setting, enjoying the peace.

Simply perfect. Even in searing temperatures with plenty of bugs it still felt like a luxury tent. Loved our bird, horse and sheep neighbours. A special place to stay in Barossa and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Thanks Kate!

Boongarrie tent is certainly luxurious! The homemade bread and fresh eggs are a really nice touch that made for a yummy breakfast. The horse and sheep were super friendly and a great experience being able to have a pat and feed. Inside the tent the bed was very comfortable and the kitchenette very handy. The outdoor shower and bath that has recently been added was a beautiful touch to an already spectacular retreat. Would highly recommend booking a stay at the Boongarrie Luxury tent!

We loved our stay at Boongarrie.
A lucky little find after we cancelled our interstate travel plans!
So quiet and relaxing, all we heard were the kookaburras, parrots, pet sheep and horse who was up for a pat as soon as we ventured in his direction.
The outdoor bath and shower was amazing , we didn't even use the one indoors at all. Kate was a great host,who was more than happy to help with our query. Highly recommend for a peaceful time away.
This is a wonderful, private place for a romantic getaway. Absolutely loved it and would definitely stay again. Glamping at its best!

Boongarrie Luxury Tent is simply amazing in every way.  Everything has been thought about right down to simple touches.  A very relaxing stay with the wild life and farm animsls making it that extra special. The outdoor kitchen has been thought about and is so well equipped with everything you need. The baths (esp the outdoor one) make this tent very luxurious and special. To wake to the sound of the native birds  in a bed that feels like a floating cloud is the best way to start the day. Will definitely be returning.

So gorgeous!
Absolutely loved it and had the best time
It’s amazing
❤️

This luxury tent is absolutely divine! We wanted for nothing and have rarely, if ever, been so relaxed in our lives. We bathed (lots) inside and out, we cooked in the fantastic outdoor kitchen twice -  dinner was locally purchased steak, salad and wine, and a bacon, egg and homemade bread breakfast which was provided by the host. The view from inside and outside the tent could have been hand painted by Arthur Streeton but it was better because it was a moving landscape, with many birds to spot, trees swaying in the breeze, clouds and the moving moon, the sheep and horse. Magical night lights and a swing seat in a towering gum all added to the perfection of this Airbnb! We will be back!
Such an amazing little place for a romantic getaway.

Our time at Miriam's certainly more than lived up to expectations. The style, charm and cleanliness of the place were only exceeded by the little touches which made us feel more than welcome. We particularly enjoyed relaxing over a glass of wine and enjoying the beautiful garden. We would certainly return to Miriam's, given the opportunity. Philip and Chris Eldridge

Alicia is a great host. Great to talk to, very fast respond and very helpful. Highly recomend Mirijams Cottage as it offers everything you need, incl BBQ Station. Many tks Alicia for everything, incl the Wine. It was wonderful. Pascale&Andy

Miriam’s Cottage was clean, well stocked and cosy.

Alicia was fantastic to communicate with.

Miriam's cottage is a wonderful little house in a quiet street in Tanunda. It was clean and comfortable and there were nice touches such as a bottle of beautiful wine and generous breakfast supplies.
Our pleasant experience was somewhat reduced by the lack of contact re entry details before our arrival and an old electric stove which only had two small rear plates working. That somewhat spoiled our breakfast experiences until we found an electric frypan hidden back under the sink. A drawer full of a jumble of kitchen implements, many duplicated or useless, is more reminiscent of a family beach shack.
A manual re where things are located, garbage arrangements, etc would be really helpful. Wifi is really an essential these days.
It seems that no one has had a really critical look at the house contents, customer relations etc for a long time

We had a lovely family long weekend at Miriam’s Cottage! The home was clean, warm, comfortable & inviting with a lovely breakfast spread offered! Alicia was very accommodating with an easy check-in/out process. We would definitely stay again!
Great place, well worth the visit.
Perfect place to stay with wonderful extras like cheese platters and a bottle of wine provided.
Highly recommended - a wonderful cottage with a gorgeous garden and lots of extra touches that made our stay extra special.

Miriam's is a charming cottage with beautiful gardens to wander through and enjoy. The cottage was spotless, beds comfy and lovely linens. Large lounge room and an enclosed room at the rear to relax & read. The kitchen has everything you need and plentiful and varied breakfast provisions were provided, fruit on the table and a lovely touch which was much appreciated was a bottle of wine with a cheese platter to welcome us which we enjoyed outside on the rear deck. We would love to stay again and will recommend to our friends as a great Barossa base, walking distance to Tanunda shopping & dining and central to the valley's lovely wineries.
A lovely stay with all the little touches and amenities that make an Airbnb feel like a home away from home. Spotlessly clean and wonderful hospitality, thank you very much.
Alicia is the perfect host wine and cheese platter on arrival . The Gardens were lovely and provided a peaceful place to rest and listen to the birds.
This house was exactly what we hoped for. Great location (4 min. walk to Tanunda town), very quiet street, wonderful ambience, delightful courtyard and back yard. Lots of thoughtful inclusions.

Miriam's Place is in a perfect location just off the main street of Tanunda. An easy walk to restaurants, pubs and cafes. The stone cottage is adorable with a lovely cottage garden at the rear. The area is extremely quiet so you'll get a great night's sleep. Breakfast provisions were in the fridge, as was a greatly appreciated bottle of wine. Alicia is a great host and quick to respond to communications. We'll stay again next time we're in the Barossa.
Beautiful little house, we enjoyed our time there. Would highly recommend.

This is a great place. It is sparkling clean, close to everything in Tanunda and a beautiful place to stay. Alicia is a great host - great communication, super helpful, and the gift of breakfast items and a bottle of delicious wine was fabulous.
An ideal place to rest and enjoy. The house and garden are lovely and include anything you could think of, breakfast is great, and the host truely is a super- host! Great memories!

We were very happy with our choice of staying at Miriam’s Cottage.
Alicia had gong the “extra mile” with a lovely cheese platter and great breakfast supplies.
Everything very clean and spotless and the cottage was whisper quiet.

We would be very happy to recommend Miriam’s Cottage when visiting the Barossa.
We stayed 4 nights and very glad we did so.

Miriam’s Cottage is in a fabulous spot, walking distance to main Street of Tanunda and the great restaurants and cafes. House was clean and exactly as advertised.  Check in easy and Alicia very contactable and she even popped in to make sure all was good. Loved the goodies she left for us. Would stay again if we’re back in the Barossa.

A wonderful place to stay especially if dining at Ferment Asian. Only 10 minutes walk.
With 40 degree days the Airconditioner was tested but the cottage remained beautifully cool.
Lovely decor, lovely bed linen, lovely treats. Thank you.
Wonderful home with special touches to make our stay complete. Provisions for breakfast were great and cheese board and wine much appreciated. We will recommend to our friends.

Miriam’s is a charming cottage. Great location, just a short stroll to the Main Street of Tanunda.
Spotlessly clean. Loved the welcoming cheese platter and wine on arrival, and enjoyed the delicious, and plentiful, breakfast provisions. Alicia is a great host.

We enjoyed a few restful days at the cottage while we were exploring the local region and could not recommend it more!  It was perfectly situated, both for exploring the local wineries and also within Tanunda itself, which is a gorgeous town with lots of beautiful eateries and shops.  The cottage had absolutely everything you could want for a short or long stay, with plenty of character and charm to boot.  The breakfast and cheese plates (featuring local products) was particularly special.  Thanks Alicia!  Hope to be back some time very soon.

Situated in a quiet street, but within easy walking distance of town.
A beautiful old house with lots of character and special touches that cater to your every need. The air-conditioning surprisingly is ducted and worked exceptionally well in the hot weather. The lovely character garden has lots of wildlife , with birds splashing in the birdbath in the early morning. The kitchen has all the implements and appliances you need for cooking. Would definitely stay there again when in the Barossa.

Great cottage , furnished in the style of the cottage , very comfortable beds with great bed linen .
Lovely touches of food and drink which Alicia provided
Highly recommend. Beautiful spot and wonderfully clean

A beautiful cottage in a very convenient location.
Spotless and well equipped, thanks Alicia for the easy checkin.
We all had a great time wine tasting
Anita and family

All the little touches - a bottle of dessert wine, fresh bread, eggs, bacon, juice, coffee were much appreciated. We had everything and more for a wonderful stay in the Barossa. Comfortable bed, amazing shower, perfect location!!

Alicia was very hospitable, and the house is great, combining the best of the old and then new. The ducted heating was a winner in very cold weather, the beds are luxuriously comfortable and the location is terrific - just around the corner from the main street.
Our stay at the cottage was delightful, the breakfast treats were delicious.
Great location, beautiful property, perfectly clean and equipped for a great night away

Miriam’s Cottage was absolutely terrific. Great location, great dwelling, great host, great little touches.

I could not recommend it more highly.

We had a wonderful stay. The cottage was centrally situated to the town centre of Tanunda. The food & beverage supplies were perfect. The central heating was essential. Will definitely recommend the cottage to friends.
Great place. Alicia was extremely helpful and easy to deal with.

Alicia is a fabulous and very responsive host. The house is very charming and sparkling clean. The heating kept us warm as toast on a very chilly winter night. The fire pit was fantastic and a glass of wine while toasting marshmallows was a great way to spend a wintry evening. When the Weather warmed up the rear patio was a lovely spot to enjoy a BBQ overlooking the lush garden. The bedrooms are spacious and the kitchen is small but cosy and adequate for 4 guests   We loved our stay here and left regretfully
Lovely comfortable and clean cottage. The food provisions were delicious including the bottle of wine.  Will certainly recommend Miriam's Cottage to anyone.

We stayed for an enjoyable weekend with our children. Miriam’s Cottage was located within walking distance to Tanunda township with some great places to eat and drink.
There was lovely local produce for breakfast and a delicious cheese platter and local wine provided by Alicia, the host.
We really appreciated the extra effort made to help make our stay even better and would thoroughly recommend staying at Miriam‘s Cottage.

This cottage is gorgeous. Alicia was a fantastic host, calling me a few days before and briefing me on everything I needed to know. She also accommodated an earlier check in which was much appreciated. The cottage has everything you need and more! Would definitely stay again.

Charming old cottage well located in Tanunda within walking distance of the Main Street. Generous breakfast provisions and comfortable beds / linen. Alicia goes above and beyond for guest experience and made a special effort to accommodate our 6 month old baby.

You can expect everything you would need for a weekend stay. Just need your clothes and personal items.  Short walk to the main street for all your food and culinary needs and short trips to local wineries and locations to make your stay extra wonderful. Miriam's is so lovely you could even stay in the home and be occupied.

Awesome hospitality, character house which remained lovely and cool despite hot weather. Plenty of supplies too - eggs, bacon, tomatoes etc plus muesli, yoghurt and even a bottle of wine. Easy walk to lovely Barossa township.
We had a lovely stay at Miriam’s Cottage. Clean and with everything we needed. We loved the provisions for brekky and the children loved exploring the back garden. Thank you!
Great location, lovely space and beautiful garden. Very peaceful and within walking distance to the best restaurants in Tanunda. Very clean with thoughtful touches.
Great location and host is very attentive to your every need

This was just perfect for us, we travelled in one of the hottest weeks in Adelaide and the entire house was beautifully cool, absolutely sparkling clean - crisp linen and very comfortable bed, Alicia had provided enough breakfast provisions to last the whole week! Centrally located in a very quiet street but still within walking distance to first class restaurants, breakfast cafe's and supermarket. We highly recommend this property and would stay here again without hesitation.  Thankyou Alicia for the attention to detail, we had a delightful stay.

The cottage was beautiful. Lovely comfortable beds, very clean and a generous breakfast. The host was extremely generous with our booking. Easy walking distance to the shops. Five stars. Loved our stay.

Mirriam’s Cottage is quintessential Tanunda. Great place to spend some time eating and drinking and the location means it’s an easy five minute walk to the fine food in Tanunda.
The cottage had everything we needed plus a bit more. It was clean and more than comfortable and Alicia made sure every thing was good.
Loved the bed, loved the towels and loved the old worldly style.
We will be back!

Miriam’s Cottage is a delightful place to stay. It is full of character & has a lovely garden. Also it is well located only 5 minutes walk from some of the Barossa’s b3st restaurants. Alicia is a terrific host & we would highly recommend her cottage for visitors to the Barossa Valley.
What a beautiful old stone house with all the mod cons, very comfortable and the location is perfect.

Miriam’s Cottage is in a wonderful location,  an easy walk to restaurants, breweries and at least one winery. The home is very comfortable and the garden beckons you out. Alicia’s breakfast and grazing provisions are wonderful and very generous. We are already plotting a return and highly recommend staying at the cottage.
A fabulous cosy cottage stay. We wanted for nothing. Easy walking distance to the Main Street. Close to restaurants, bars, cafes and supermarket.

We absolutely adored staying here. We are from SA and wanted to get away from the busy city life. Alicia is great at responding quickly. She provided HEAPS of delicious food for brekky and marshmallows for the outdoor fire. The cottage feels very homely and warm. Great location in a stunning area of the Barossa. We will be back for sure!
We had a fantastic 2 night stay at Miriams cottage. The home was in a great location and very cosy. Would highly recommend
Great location, beautiful cottage, good amenities.
Fantastic setting, location and hospitality. Definitely going to stay here again when in the Barossa
Our stay was delightful. The amenities were great with many thoughtful touches including fire pit with marshmallows. I would recommend to stay here.
Absolute gem!! So close to the Main Street of Tanunda with some fabulous places to eat and nice and close to some amazing wineries. A beautiful place with country charm.

We enjoyed a peaceful 2 nights away with beautiful serenity & gardens.  The cottage had so much charm & was very close to everything.  The local produce provided allowed us to enjoy a lovely breakfast in the garden. Highly recommended
Idyllic cottage, well appointed for exploration in Tanunda and surrounding Barossa Valley.
A beautiful cottage that felt like home. Loved the cheese plate, wine and breakfast. Made our stay so easy.
Spacious cottage in a great location. Beautiful garden. Alicia was wonderful to deal with. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Miriam’s is such a beautiful cottage and was perfect for our Barossa stay. A stylish and comfortable space with thoughtful touches to make it extra special. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast provisions and the cheese platter with wine! The house is in a quiet location and in walking distance to the main street of Tanunda. Thanks for a great stay!

Alicia’s place was gorgeous & perfectly located - just a short walk to the main streets & all the great cafes & shops. The gardens are amazing and the house is fit out to perfection. Bring an appetite as the breakfast fixings are substantial!  Would certainly stay again & couldn’t recommend more.

Miriam’s cottage is wonderful place to stay.. it is the best Airbnb experience we have had anywhere that we have stayed to date. The house is beautifully presented
very well thought out and a credit to Alicia. Thank you so much

A fantastic character cottage which offers a high level of finish and fantastic attention to detail.  The gardens are beautiful too! The cottage is perfectly placed to the Main Street of Tanunda and is only a short walk away. Highly recommend!
100% perfect as a home from home! Loads of personal touches throughout and an absolute pleasure to stay for our 2 nights whilst touring.
Well suited cottage with thoughtful touches from the host. Wine, cheese and outstanding Barossa breakfast provisions provided. Clean and very comfortable with lovely garden. Highly recommend
Such a beautiful house with everything you would ever need, including a bountiful breakfast!  We have fallen in love with Tanunda all over again.  Thanks Alicia for a wonderful stay.

Alicia went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. From the delicious wine and cheese platter on arrival to the fruit and breakfast goodies. I really appreciated Alicia’s excellent communication, particularly throughout the lead up to our stay. I would highly recommend Miriam’s Cottage if you are exploring the (Website hidden by Airbnb) location, comfort and style are fantastic. Thanks Alicia.
Alicia’s Place was perfect. Excellent quiet location within walking distance to the main street , amazing provisions and attention to detail. Highly recommend!!

I highly recommend staying with Alicia. The Home is lovely, tastefully decorated with quality linens and all that you need for a good stay. The kitchen is well appointed and the breakfast and other thoughtful touches were perfect.

great location, spacious house, beautiful hospitality and air-conditioning during a 38 deg heat wave. what more can you want? the cheese board and wine on arrival (amongst other items) was a pleasant surprise and a great way to kick off our stay. highly recommended.
Beautiful cottage, everything you could possibly need when traveling to the Barossa. Alicia’s little touches throughout the house made the stay even more unique.

This little cottage was super clean and tidy and had everything we could have needed for our weekend away. Of particular note were the gorgeous breakfast provisions left for us, beautiful fresh produce and lots of it. This stay was fantastic and we’d recommend it to anyone.
I booked for my parents for their Christmas present and they loved it. They had only great things to say about their weekend stay!

The cottage was perfect for what we wanted - great location for the Barossa valley and Tanunda town centre. The cottage perfectly appointed and everything required for our stay was provided. Alicia was a fantastic host, quick to reply to any questions. We would recommend to anyone who wanted a central base for visiting the Barossa!

A truly gorgeous cottage in the heart of Tanunda. We really enjoyed the close proximity to town and short drive to amazing vineyards. The cottage has everything you can think of for a comfortable stay and we were there for 5 nights! Breakfast supplies and a little cheese board were so special and a lovely welcoming touch. Also really loved the sun room, perfect to enjoy a coffee in the morning and slowly wake up. We will definitely be staying again!

what a fabulous stay! you won't get a better location, very central and a stones throw from shopping and dining. a very authentic country cottage experience and lots of thoughtful touches. worked perfectly for our family, including our toddler, who had a wonderful time running around in the beautiful garden. highly recommend!
We were so impressed with the thoughtful communication and special touches Alicia made. such a gorgeous home and perfect place to relax.
Great location, clean, comfortable cottage with a fabulous host. Would highly recommend
A fantastic location for exploring the Barossa, and a very comfortable cottage with so many good points, plus a fabulous breakfast.

Gorgeous cottage with lovely thoughtful touches to make our stay cosy and comfortable. Great location close to restaurants, shops and wineries. Recommended for a place to stay to enjoy the beautiful Barossa Valley.
Miriams cottage is picture perfect . Cozy and comfortable , lovely complimentary cheese platter & bottle of wine .Highly recommend a stay .
Cute little cottage in a quiet area of Tanunda with great amenities and thoughtful touches.
Beautiful house in a beautiful and convenient location. The breakfast options were very thoughtful
This cottage is so cute, sparkly clean very comfortable and perfectly located.

Neat little cottage with a gorgeous garden. We enjoyed our stay at Miriam's cottage, a perfect base for our Barossa wanderings. Thanks Alicia for the goodies provided...the best mushroom I had in a long time...

This lovely cottage was in a great location, close to the main street and had an amazing garden! Alicia was very friendly and gave us great instructions for checking in. We would recommend staying here if you are visiting Tanunda!

Thanks Alicia. What a beautiful home and location. Very clean and so close to the main street restaurants. Excellent breakfast and snack provisions. We will be back in 6 months for another stay. Thanks Paul

Alicia is a great host and her breakfast catering exceeded our expectations.
A great place in the heart of Tanunda with a backyard that feels like you are in the bushLoved it
Mark - Unley SA

We walked in and were happy. Simple as that. There were thoughtful notes about the house on how to operate things and a bottle of rose to take the edge off our day. The garden is rambling and beautiful. The house is clean and the beds are comfortable. My husband, young child and I will be back. Absoutely loved it - perfect place to wind down after celebrating with family.
Lovely little quintessential South Australia cottage - perfect for a cute wine weekend! Place was quiet, clean and had all the right amenities. Would stay again!

This place felt like home.  From the moment you enter you instantly feel relaxed and ready to unwind.  So much detail, comfy beds, good linens and pillows and lovely breakfast provisions all make this a great stay.  Thank you Alica.  Highly recommended

We had a great stay at cottage. Alicia was so lovely, left us fresh eggs, bacon and bread and few other things .. all local produce 🙌.
House is spotless. Character is welcoming and retro feel, which we loved!

Bbq in the garden in evening. Kids had strong wifi signal. So everyone was happy, both kids and grownups.

Short walk to grocery shops, pub, cafe and Chatau Tanunda winery as well.

Z wines bar had lie music and funky atmosphere.


We truly enjoyed our stay.

Better than we could have expected. Alicia was such a wonderful host. The accomodation is beautiful and so clear, tidy and warm. The gardens are gorgeous. Check in was quick and easy. The accomodation is a short stroll to town (or taxi if it's 40 degrees). Alicia provided us with great recommendations as well.
Thank you so much!!!!
lovely heritage cottage in the heart of the Barossa. Alicia provides a well equipped, clean and comfortable house. she was quick to respond and very friendly.

This house/cottage was absolutely perfect for our weekend away! We were three couples, but could have easily had a fourth couple and no-one would have been on top of each other. It is beautiful inside with every detail considered through to bathrobes in all rooms. It is cozy, elegant and homely all in one. Suzie was an absolute pleasure during the lead up to our visit, and her response times were excellent. We were a 10-minute walk away from the closest winery and a maximum of 25 minutes' drive away from the furthest (that we wanted to visit). Loved it!

Though we have traveled extensively for over 30 years this was our first Airbnb. Since my wife and I are traveling with our 21 year old son and his friend we felt that a house would be our best option. Overall it was an excellent stay.
The location is a short walk into Lyndoch the first of several "wine towns" as one enters the Barossa Valley from Adelaide. There one finds a bakery and several restaurants (we had good coffee and breakfast at The Table Cafe), a small grocery store (for serious grocery shopping much better off in Tanunda) and a gourmet meat market (great house smoked salmon). The first several of the valley wineries are within a kilometer or so.
The four bedrooms are each quite unique and except for the one off the eating area have individual climate controls off the main system and are each decorated quite differently. The house is quite old but that is much of it's charm. There are many nice touches and features throughout such as two robes with each bedroom, a working fireplace (with plenty of wood) in the living room, dozens of movies, plenty of nice dishes and glasses, a propane barbeque (we did steaks one night). The master bath shower and jacuzzi style tub have a great view of the backyard and surrounding vineyards (though can draw the shades if needed). The backyard is pretty with the smell of citrus trees.
There was a supply of Nespresso pods with milk and a frother so good coffee was at hand!
Really nothing to complain about; overall cozy, plenty of room and a large bright kitchen when we needed to cook.
Suzie supplied us with useful tips before we arranged. We had a minor issue and were able to reach Steve the manager and had it resolved in minutes!
Highly recommended!
Beautiful cottage with gorgeous views....such a warm & relaxing space...🤗

Fantastic spacious house, ample parking. Suzie was so quick to respond to all enquiries and was flexible with check in/out times. Well set up house with lots of amenities like coffee pods, condiments, milk etc. highly recommend.
Beautiful character house, the nicest we've ever stayed in. Was walking distance to the towns cafes and pub. Is a short drive to other parts of the Barossa. Really didn't want to come home!

I cannot recommend this place highly enough. It is absolutely gorgeous. The attention to detail and all the little extras are fantastic, but it is the house itself that is just amazing. Suzie clearly has a passion and flair for interior decorating. We were 5 women on a 'girls' weekend and we when we entered the house we just were blown away by how beautifully it was decorated. And spotlessly clean. The rooms are huge, the 5 of us each had a large comfortable space and the living areas are also big and really welcoming. Great vibe to the house. Having 2 bathrooms was also good! Fresh crisp sheets, thick fluffy towels and bathrobes. Sitting on the back deck gazing at the lovely garden with the vineyards stretching behind was just what you want from a Barossa escape. Yet you have the convenience of a bakery and IGA in walking distance up the road. I will be telling everyone I know this is THE place to stay in the Barossa.  Was really convenient for everything we wanted to do there. Made our weekend away really special staying here,
Such a beautiful home, loved it
Amazing stay for 2 days. Thank you

This lovely cottage was exactly as described and as appeared in pictures. Lovely garden out the back. Suzie was very responsive and sent through a list of things to do and places to visit as soon as the booking was confirmed. Suzie was also very accommodating with check-in and check-out time. We were there during a very hot weekend. The air-conditioning was very powerful and cooled down the house very fast. The kitchen was also stocked with all the necessary amenities.

I must say there isn't all that much in the town of Lyndoch, although it served its purpose as a base to discover the wineries in the Barossa Valley.

We travelled from Brisbane to the Barossa for a 60th Birthday weekend.  Suzie's place was perfect for the four couples with lots of space.  The house was full of the most amazing knick knacks. The outside area and surrounding gardens were beautiful overlooking the vineyards.  Everything we needed for our celebratory weekend.
Great location,comfortable well presented cottage with fire place that made our evening vine and cheese plate unforgettable experience .We loved our stay in  the cottage and Barossa Valley.

Great place to stay to just unwind and relax or explore the Barossa. Great view of vineyard and rolling hills from rear pergola, kitchen and spa bath.

Would definitely recommend spending some time at this accommodation and looking forward to coming back.
Fantastic stay

Suzie, what a lovely place to stay! Love how homely the place felt, you have thought of everything. So many blankets, cushions and a nice log fire for that much needed winter warmth. The provisions were spot on and so thoughtful! Love love loved it! Will be back!! Thank you!!

We had such a lovely time celebrating Mums 60th! The gorgeous house is perfect for a family get away, it's inviting, warm and cozy. It's our second time visiting but was Mums first, she was blown away by the decor and really wanted to move in! Absolutely loved staying and we will definitely be back!

Such an amazing property. Would be great for kids, young families or couples wanting to get away. Its perfectly situated and so close to the local pub, butcher, grocer and restaurants. There is nothing left for you to do apart from relax in front of the fireplace with your recent wine purchases.

We had a fabulous stay at Azalea Cedar Rose. We stayed for two nights to celebrate my 30th birthday and the house accommodated 8 of us very comfortably. Hospitality was impeccable and made our vacation all the more special. Thank you so much and would highly recommend!
We stepped into a dreamy and relaxing place. I cannot recommend highly.

Suzie is a great host with good communication and was very helpful and knowledgeable on the Barossa Region.  Her house is peaceful, elegant and clean and a great space for larger groups.  I would definitely recommend this house and would stay here again if the opportunity arose.
The house and property are beautiful with enough amenities to make your stay comfortable and easy. The location excellent with a relaxing outdoor area with wonderful views.

Azalea Cedar-Rose is a charming little cottage and a wonderful base for anyone visiting the Barossa Valley. The cottage is beautifully decorated and has a wonderful homely feel about it. Sparkling clean. Our trip was a girls weekend away - we all live in various parts of the country and rarely get the chance to spend time together without partners and children around! We spent our evenings lounging on beanbags in the gorgeous gardens and enjoying the spectacular scenery each cheese and drinking wine in the lovely quiet of Lyndoch. Suzie was a wonderful host - very accommodating to our needs and so prompt in replying to any questions I had before and during the weekend. The cottage includes lots of hot tips for travellers and Suzie was also kind enough to offer lots of additional suggestions throughout the weekend. We are all already planning another trip for next year!
The cracksin the wall just add more character to this gorgeous place.
An amazing house in a central location. Beautiful finishing touches throughout the house made you feel at home.
As described, a cute place. Fire place was great. Beds were a bit squeaky.

Azalea Cedar Rose is a beautifully appointed four bedroom cottage in Lyndoch, with a sun filled dining room at the back, looking out over a kitchen garden and rolling vineyards in the distance. The house is sparkling clean and each bedroom has its own unique style, from exotic and bold to pretty in pink. We stayed in July and the underfloor heating in the bathrooms were much appreciated along with the wood fire stove and central heating! The meticulous attention to detail was evident throughout the house, from amenities through to decorative finishes. We particularly loved the chalk board on the back of the toilet door with the itinerary of places to visit in the Barossa Valley! We enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this gorgeous cottage as a rest stop.

We stayed two nights at Suzie’s beautiful home. We arrived at night and were able to easily access the house and loved waking up to find the view from back of house over the vineyards. Quite amazing. The house has been finished beautifully with lots of lovely touches which fit in well with the Barossa. It was well located for easy access and the chalkboard list of where to go helped guide our visit. We enjoyed the breakfast, chocolates and port supplied. I would recommend Suzie’s house for a weekend away or a longer stay if you have the time.
Lovely house, warm fire and great touches like electric blankets on all the beds. A great mid-winter getaway!

Everything at Susie’s place was perfect for our weekend getaway. There was plenty of room inside the house with a beautiful garden area in the back. It is driving distance to the bigger town but walking distance to a few local shops. Ideal for a big group. Would highly recommend.

Azalea Cedar Rose is such a delightful place to stay.  Myself and the other guests were enchanted from the minute we walked in and we thoroughly enjoyed everything about it.  We were 10 people in total and there was ample space for all of us.  The décor is lovely and so well thought out.  It is obvious that a lot of effort has been put into making this place special.  Suzie shared lots of her local knowledge with us which was very useful when deciding what to do while we were in the Barossa Valley.  She was also quick to answer all of our questions.  The breakfast provisions were generous and delicious.  It is fair to say that we weren't left wanting for anything.  I  highly recommend staying at Azalea Cedar Rose and hope to visit again one day in the future.

The whole experience of working with Suzie from start to finish went beyond expectations. She always responded to any questions within a very short time frame and went out of her way to make our experience in the Barossa a most enjoyable time. I could not recommend staying at Suzie's accommodation more highly.

It was an absolute pleasure working with Suzie and her recommendations for activities were also spot-on.

Our girls weekend away will be remembered as very special for many years to come.
A lovely house, nicely decorated with lots of nice little touches (coffee and choccies etc). The bath is next level, just a great place
Well located in Lyndoch. Very quiet, lovely big garden overlooking vineyards and trees. Gorgeous place! Great fire, heating and spa.
We had an amazing stay. Thankyou!

We had the most amazing weekend away in the Barossa Valley. The cottage is luxurious and homely with so many extra special touches. The home has everything you could need and more. The views in the backyard are serene.
Spotless house, well equipped and great location in Lyndoch. Beautiful view onto the vineyards. Suzie is great to communicate with and is so helpful!

The Azalea Cedar-Rose Villa is a beautiful house in the little town of Lyndoch. The house itself is spacious and great for relaxing in the gorgeous garden or snuggling on the comfy couches. Surrounded my pillows and blankets you'll feel like you're floating on clouds. I feel like Suzie has thought of everything to make your stay perfect.
The house is situated in Lyndoch with an easy stroll to the supermarket, cafes, the bakery and the pub and just a short drive to hiking and mountain bike trails.

If you are looking for a very welcoming, comfortable and gorgeous garden setting for a getaway, this house is truly just so gorgeous. You just need to pack your clothes - even special bathrobes are left for every guest. As soon as we walked in the door we were blown away about how tranquil the property is. Beds and linen are of high quality for a great sleep. Suzie is such a lovely host and really just wants people to enjoy this beautifully character filled home. Highly recommend it. We will be back for sure.

Where to start - this home was truely amazing. It is a beautiful home which offers so much and we all really enjoyed our stay. It is clean, comfortable and the design of the home is beautiful. There is a spacious backyard that is so lovely and we sat out and relaxed at night around the fire pit.

Suzie was excellent with communicating with us if needed. The welcome booklet is so informative which she sends you when you book. I can’t recommend enough - it exceeded all our expectations. Thank you!

Azalea Cedar-Rose Villa is well positioned to provide a great location from which to explore the Barossa. The rooms are comfortable and well furnished and there is plenty of heating in the colder months. It offers well considered inclusions, like tea and coffee and other staples, as well as information about local sights and highlights. It is definitely somewhere I would love to return to!

Azalea Rose is an absolute beautiful place to stay. Suzie was extremely hospitable and everything was very comfortable, clean and in perfect condition. Highly recommended if you are looking for A+ accomodation in the Barossa region.
Excellent. Suzie is an amazing host.
Great location, well equipped
Beautiful gardens full of flowers and birds it is a lovely place to chill out and re charge your batteries.
Fantastic accomodation. A beautiful home in a convenient location.
Beautiful comfortable home. Beautiful bathrooms, comfiest beds ever. Everything thought of. So lovely. Perfect for a girls weekend away!

Charming little cottage with fabulous shabby chic decor.  Lovely views from the backyard and a cosy feel inside, complete with fire place in the living room and large spa bath in the bathroom.  The kitchen has everything you need and the bedrooms were super comfy.  Only a short walk down the main street to the shops/cafes/restaurants and easy drive to all the main wineries.

Jasmine's Cottage is in a tiny sleepy part of the Barossa, however it is very close to Tanunda and Nurioopta and Gawler is not far either. Sensational restaurants to try are Bistro 1918 in Tanunda and St Hugos Vineyard for a degustation lunch. Appellation at The  Louise is another fantastic restaurant but possibly more for a special occasion. Would also recommend Fino at Seppeltsfield for a more casual share plate experience. The Barossa for us is all about the joy of eating great food and the beautiful wines of course and this time was no different. Jasmine's cottage enhanced the experience as it is a charming little oasis to return to each day. Would definately recommend.

We loved staying in this cosy shabby chic cottage. It was perfect for our weekend away to the explore Barossa Valley. Great info available in the cottage and some nice little extra touches. Lovely back garden to enjoy a pre-dinner glass of wine in the sunshine and a nice wood fire to keep things warm in the evening. Would definitely come and stay again. Thanks Suzie
What an amazing experience, the cottage is beautifully decorated and Suzie’s attention to detail is fantastic. It was a relaxing 2 night stay after a busy Christmas.
Beautiful decor and relaxing back yard.

Great location - very close to excellent cellar doors and restaurants. Suzie is very thoughtful and caters for every need. The fireplace, heaters and electric blankets made our stay very warm and cozy and the Nespresso pods were a great touch. The view of the vineyards from the kitchen window is beautiful!
The cottage is spotlessly clean and very comfortable.
Charming cottage with nothing left to do but arrive and enjoy.

Wonderful, cosy place to stay. Beautifully maintained property and it had all we needed for our stay in the Barossa. Air con, wood fire, fully equipped kitchen, separate bathroom and toilet, extra blankets, undercover parking. Suzie has thought of all the little details her guests would appreciate. The view of the vineyards adjoining the back of the property provided a relaxing view from the kitchen window.

it is a very lovely two bedroom apartment. Suize is a very thoughtful host and response very fast if you have any questions. She gave us all the good activities to do even before we reached there. And the location of her place is very good, close to good vineyards and restaurants.
What a wonderful place to explore the Barossa. Was so central to the region. Nice and cosy little retreat. Thanks Suzie
Cosy and inviting in the Barossa with local insights, tips and hospitality.  Thank you!
cosy comfortable and everything you need for a romantic getaway
We loved everything about our stay. Such perfect accommodation for a winter getaway. Everything was thought of and the spa was just amazing
Beautiful place and Suzie’s communication is fantastic. Highly recommend staying here.
Everything was completely thought out and immaculate, one of the nicest  B&B's I've stayed at!

A great little cottage which was perfect for our Barossa getaway. All the amenities  we needed even with a 9 month old.  Everything was great although we just wished we'd stayed linger to enjoynit more. Communication and info on the area was one of the best ive experienced.

What a gem Jasmine's Cottage is! Perfect for a relaxing weekend away. The cottage has been styled beautifully with lots of thoughtful additions. Spa bath is amazing! The view is beautiful! Location is perfect. Highly recommend this place.
It is a lovely cottage and the location was great for our weekend in the Barossa Valley.

You will not find a better host that Suzie. She was caring, kind, interested and responsive. She shared her local knowledge and gave great tips. But moreover, she so genuinely wanted us to have a good time!
Her cottage is like a little piece of paradise and she has thought of everything! Clean, cosy, traditional, yet has the modern touches. It was so easy to relax, unwind and forget about the rest of the world!
This is the place to stay and we will be back.
Thank you Suzie - you are a true gem!
X
Beautiful cottage in an area very central to the Barossa Valley. A fantastic place to stay and will be doing this again, only longer next time.

Such a sweet cottage with so many thoughtful touches. A great escape both in decor and practicality! Enjoyed the private back yard and bbq looking out to rolling vineyards. Suzie was wonderful to deal with and I would definitely stay again.
Well decorated beautiful cottage, will be sure to make a return visit.
What a delightful & cosy little cottage. The kids loved the fireplace & toasting marshmallows over the outdoor fire pit.
Great location, every amenity you could need, cottage is so well decorated and very cosy. We didn't want to leave!

There is SO much love in this place, every personal touch you’ve thought of and those you haven’t.

Just a lovely stay and we hope to be back.

My partner and I had a fantastic stay here for two nights - the cottage is gorgeous with plenty of amenities and the kitchen has absolutely anything you could want during your stay. The hosts were also lovely and very responsive. The location is great if you’re basing yourself in the Barossa, plus looking out over the vines from the bathtub is a real treat!

Thank you again Suzie for a lovely stay! It was the peaceful surroundings that we enjoyed & I also particularly loved the Spa bath. We thoroughly enjoyed our time relaxing in the cottage, Netflix was a great touch and the location was lovely. Thank you, Shelley & Nenad 😊❤️
Cute little cottage. Very comfy and tidy
Jasmine's cottage is a cozy homely stay with gorgeous backyard views looking into the vineyard

WOW! What can I say? I could have lived in this place and I could have even eaten off the floor :) Only kidding on that last point. We decided to travel from Melbourne the weekend of 42 degree heat. The house stayed really cool with its aircon. We had port and chocolates, coffee and biscuits, am amazing spa and the views onto the vineyards behind. The wineries were so close, the restaurants at the end of the street and a garden to die for. We'll be back!!
Gorgeous cottage with so many beautiful touches. A real treat to stay here!

Thank you so much for the beautiful place to get some rest! We had such a lovely girls trip. Was cosy and made complete with the fire, Netflix and giant spa bath! We loved watching the sun go down over the vineyard with cups of tea, and then a glass of rosè by the fire (which seemed fitting with the decor!). Thanks again. 💞😌
Well maintained property with a great spacious back yard. Vintage feel with modern comfort, good selection of pantry items and a experienced host to make your stay seamless.

We enjoyed our stay at the cottage very much. The location is great. Walking distance to Lyndoch shops, cafe's, bakery and hotel for dinner. The backyard is such a winner. We enjoyed our morning coffee and after find of local wine while watching the sun highlight the vines and hills that surround. The warmth of the fire place was greatly enjoyed too. Quiet location. Great communication.

Lovely Cottage, beautifully decorated and with all that you need for a wonderful stay in the Barossa. Comfy bed, great heating for those chilly evenings and a stunning view of the vines out the back.
Thoroughly recommended.
Lovely cottage with vineyard views. The fireplace was lovely at night time. Great host who was responsive to messages. Spa bath was a real treat. Would recommend to others!
We had a lovely stay. The garden setting,  cosy fire and spa bath were highlights.
This cottage is the perfect mix of comfort and quaint homeliness. The cottage is full of warmth and comfort, with the most amazing views from the backyard. Well worth a visit.

Beautifully presented cottage with useful information folders inside, and whatever you need to make your stay enjoyable. Gorgeous gardens and cozy interiors, and a fire and a spa… what more could you wish for?
Lovely little girly cottage in a great location!
Fantastic unique stay +++++

Jasmine’s cottage is cute and has all of the things you need for a short stay.  They’ve thought of everything.  The hosts are lovely, and very responsive.  We had a lovely time here and look forward to coming back.

Beautifully presented cottage within easy walking distance of the local shops and with plenty of wineries to drive to. Very clean and comfortable bed. Lovely to sit outside in your choice of sitting areas and watch the kookaburras.
Organisation was great, spaces were fine and clean. Air conditioning wasn’t great in one of the rooms. Decor is ok.. out of date but it is as per the pictures.
Fantastic!
Outstanding venue, great communication, cannot recommend highly enough!

Wow! The Reserve is even better in real life than in the pictures. Superb location to visit the Barossa. Simone had great communication from day 1 and went over and above with the information provided as well as local hints of where to go and what to see. We didn’t want to leave

The Reserve is the perfect accomodation for any group looking for a self-catered home with all the mod cons! Warm, inviting & gorgeous views out the back of the home, our group of 7 had a fantastic time staying here. Thanks to Jodie for her fantastic communication during our stay :)
Fabulous home and location!
A beautiful property with lovely furnishings and fittings, and in an ideal location to experience the Barossa. Highly recommend.

We stayed with our family for two nights for our small wedding, which we held in the beautiful gardens. The Reserve was a warm and welcoming place and was so close to great wineries (literally on the same road as many of them) that we even had a chance to visit a few. The fire was going and keeping the place cozy for our arrival which was a really nice touch. The grounds were beautiful - nicer than the pictures and able to be fully enjoyed even in bad weather, through the glass windows at the back. We also really enjoyed making our own pizza and using the pizza oven the night before the wedding :) All necessary equipment was provided. We had hoped to have our wedding dinner outside and although the weather wasn’t kind to us, the glass conservatory/dining area made a beautiful alternative and was more than comfortable and big enough for us all. The host was happy to allow caterers to come in to prepare our meal, and helped us with various recommendations ahead of time.
The host was extremely responsive to all queries leading up to our stay and promptly responded to an issue with the gas supply on the night of the wedding. Unfortunately the temporary fix for the gas meant that there wasn’t enough for hot water for all 11 guests to shower before leaving the next day, but my impression was that this was unusual and ultimately out of the hands of the hosts, who had arranged for the gas to be replaced early the next day, but the suppliers didn’t arrive. Other than this hiccup - which I’m guessing is very unusual - we had an amazing time at the Reserve and will actually be returning in December with friends which we are looking forward to. I would definitely recommend staying at the Reserve.

Beautifully situated in the heart of the Barossa. Amazing house/property with an equally friendly host - this is an ideal spot to visit wineries and/or just sit-back and gauze out overlooking the vineyards in our private retreat.
The place is stylishly modern and accommodates up to 12 people comfortably (2 x on stowe-away beds) for a perfect escape. Facilities are ample and there’s even an option to hire a personal chef to utilise the outdoor wood fire oven.

Would highly recommend staying for a week.

Such a beautiful property with incredible views, gardens, access to the best wineries around and gloriously renovated. Booking was easy and Jodi, the property manager, provided exceptional service throughout. The owners even allowed us a late check-out with no extra charge. The beds were incredibly comfy and the kitchen easily catered for 9 of us self-catering on the first night. The only slight criticism was that the spa did not work. I'd planned the late checkout to give my guests (8 of them) time to enjoy the property and its amenities, which we were paying luxury prices for. However, despite one of the main reasons for booking the property being that there was a spa, it did not work. That being said, Jodi responded quickly, came out to the property (with a bottle of sparkles to apologise for the inconvenience) and attempted to fix it. Whilst she thought she had, unfortunately the spa continued not to work and we all vacated early.

It was a beautiful and cozy place. Jodie got the fire going for us before we arrived as I texted that we were cold on Kangaroo Island. Very thoughtful of her. The grounds around the house was lovely and my girlfriends took plenty of pictures there. The location was fantastic as it was a short drive to all the places that we wanted to go.

Amazing place. The setting is perfect. I especially loved the lights in the trees. The info we received beforehand really helped us to make the most of our time. The house itself is gorgeous. Beautiful features, garden, bedrooms everything. It’s worth the spoil!!

Great place.
Would stay here again.
Price of property could be a little more affordable. But we were over all happy.

This space is more magical than the photos even suggest. The reserve is just gorgeous and an amazing winery just a stone throw away named Rolf Binder Wines - Highly recommend! We used the pizza oven and made the most of the gorgeous gardens. We will be back!

Unfortunately missed the mark. Property/ grounds were great but wasn’t luxury accommodation. We paid a lot and the house was missing a number of essential items (toilet paper, body wash etc). Spa wasn’t working.
Nice accommodation. Easy access to wineries. Grounds are beautiful. All the amenities needed are provided.
Pinecone Ridge is a fabulous place to stay.  Cosy, comfortable and stylish.  Only a short drive from town, beautiful surroundings and we wished we could have stayed longer !

We can not recommend Anne’s place enough. The house has absolutely everything you need and more and the view of the paddock was stunning. We were a group of 8 adults and had a wonderful weekend in Angaston for a friend’s 30th.

We were a group of 6 friends that stayed at Anne's over the weekend and had the most amazing time in this home. The photos do not do the place justice, not only does it feel extremely homely, but a lot of thought and details have gone into the furnishings. All of your needed amenities were provided, plus additional little touches that were an added nicety such as board games, basic cooking amenities, soaps etc.

We will 100% come back to stay here again!

Of all my stays with Airbnb, this was the best. Anne's attentiveness was evident right from the moment I booked. The home and location are superb. Just a glorious place to stay and enjoy and Anne was on top of everything and her attention to detail was fantastic. A highly recommended option for the Barossa Valley.

Pinecone Ridge really has it all, wineries at your doorstep, a friendly and accommodating host and little touches that made the stay so much more enjoyable, the bread kit was a hit as was the wine, thank you!  5 stars from me and my guests!

Pinecone Ridge is simply amazing. It’s tucked away from the Main Street is Angaston which is perfect and provides a home away from home. Waking up to a sunrise, birds chirping and a stunning view was the perfect way to get the day started. Anne’s property has everything you need, you literally don’t need to leave, except maybe to grab some of the amazing wines from the local vineyards. Comfy beds, couches, well equipped kitchen, toasty fireplace, stacks of LEGO to keep your creative mind going and very thoughtful attention to detail across the entire place! This is the type of place that you’ll want to come back to time and time again, and we definitely will be back!
Thanks for everything Anne. We loved your suggestions and your place! See you again soon!!!

We stayed here , with two families and had an amazing time (4 adults, 3 kids) The place is perfect for that . We were there in the absolute depths of winter but stayed incredibly warm with cozy fires and a few reds of course. There’s also plenty for the kids to do with games, LEGO and amazing outdoor spaces . Anne as our host was amazingly attentive. Highly recommend staying here.

This is a gorgeous place, situated in a quiet location but close to everything.

A place to come back and relax after wine tasting or stay the while day while drinking, eating and enjoying the view.

Highly recommended.
Absolutely gorgeous - views, ambience, amenities. Hosts have tbought if absolutely everything. Thank you so much, hope to return we just loved our stay.
This place is stunning. If you are considering it as potential stay place then don't waste time. If it is free then book it. No point writing anything else. It's wonderful
A relaxing and well equipped getaway. Not a far drive from all the Barossa has to offer!

The house is very well presented and is in a great location. You can walk into town, but have country views.
The kitchen facilities are excellent and the wood burning stove warms things up quickly.

Great place for anyone looking to escape the city, with loads of space on the property and gorgeous views.

On a practical note, the rooms are filled with large, comfortable beds, but lack hanging space for clothes - so travel light and ditch the formal wear.

A lovely property for our family to stay at. Great local tips from owners and great communication, beautiful outdoor and indoor spaces. Plenty of toys for our four and five year old to play with. We also had fun riding the billy cart down the hills.  Beautiful having breakfast watching the kangaroos hopping over the property. I would stay here again.

We had a wonderful weekend stay at Anne's. She has thought of everything we needed and more! The space is beautifully decorated. We enjoyed waking up to freshly baked bread, the property, and all the local tips on things to do and see. Can not recommend Anne's place highly enough.

This is the perfect house, it has everything you could need and more. It’s on a beautiful 16 acre property, overlooking vineyards and countryside. It has an outdoor fire pit to enjoy the sunset and view. The beds are super comfy and everything feels new. We all had great sleeps! The main bedroom is quite large with its own en-suite. Both showers have rain shower heads with great pressure and heat. We got stuck into a puzzle there is a wide selection ruin of them to choose from along with so many games, dvds and books. Full cooking facilities with things like oil and salt n pepper and some other goodies. It is such a great location for wine tasting and exploring. We have stayed in tununda before but this was much much better. We booked a maxi taxi for the day and they had no troubles picking us up it’s a great way to wine taste without the hassle of a proper tour. We got to choose where and when we went.

We had a fantastic time in Anne’s place. The place was in the most beautiful position with stunning views over the valley. The house was very stylishly done with lots of thoughtful touches and extremely well equipped. We would love to stay there again. Anne was an incredibly responsive and helpful host.
This house was amazing. Great location. Clean. Modern. Secluded. Highly recommended.

What an amazing place, decorated in a really cool fashion. Great touches with the provisions and the tips on local events / to do’s.
Everyone had an awesome time, thanks so much!!

Magnificent!
An absolutely beautiful place, spotlessly clean, and everything you need right there. Comfy lounge, comfy beds...comfort everywhere. Beautifully and tastefully decorated. Very useful info left by Anne. Great space for two independent travellers. Could not fault one thing. Even had a lovely visit by a local kangaroo in the morning! Will be back again. Thanks Anne.
Amazing place, book it now!!!

This house was a dream. Sunlit rooms and well decorated spaces made our stay here unforgettable. The beds were so comfortable! The kitchen well stocked and had everything a cook would ever want. Best toys and books for our kids. we found ourselves bringing wine and food back to the house rather than going to the restaurants. Anne was a great host - superb communication and recommendations tailored to our family. I cannot recommend this house enough. Thank you!

The home was perfect! Great location, beautiful space with absolutely everything we needed. The Kitchen is wonderfully equiped, loved making the bread overnight as suggested. The bedrooms are beautifully decorated and the beds very comfortable. So many games - our family loved them. We enjoyed the reading material too. Great personal touches and thoughtful message.
Thank you Anne, being able to check in early and out a little later was a bonus we weren’t expecting. A wonderful weekend being able to enjoy the Barossa region and come home to a comfortable home. Highly recommend this accommodation.

Anne’s place had a warm, welcoming relaxing feel for our ladies get away. Pinecone exceeds every expectation. We specifically loved having the fire place, a puzzle and glass of wine to relax too. Her local tips were invaluable!

A wonderful space for couples or families. Everything about the house speaks of quality and class. It feels like living in family home and not a holiday house.

On top of this the views and surroundings are spectacular and provide ultimate privacy and peace.

Will definitely be back.
My sister's an I had an awesome weekend at Pinecone Ridge! It was so clean, warm and cosy. It is such a beautiful spot! Would recommend!

Faultless! Anne has thought of absolutely everything and the only problem we had was not being able to stay longer!

Pinecone Ridge is such a beautiful, relaxing place to stay. It's decked out with everything you need and there's lots of thoughtful homely touches. There's stacks of good quality books, games, puzzles and dvds. We have 2 young kids and Anne left out boxes of toys, Lego and books for them.

The house is spotlessly clean. The bed linens and towels are beautiful quality. The combustion fire was warm and toasty. The sunsets from up the top of the property are stunning. Netflix and Nespresso were appreciated!

We will absolutely return!

Stunning location in the hinterland of Angaston surrounded by trees and beautiful garden. Every window in the house has a gorgeous view and immediately relaxes you. Tasteful decor and creative touches throughout the house, beds so comfortable, all the extras and no need unmet. Really lovely place to stay and generous host, definitely recommend.

We had the most amazing time at pinecone ridge. We were fortunate to experience misty rain and clear skies and both were magical.

Incredible views and sunsets along with several kangaroo sightings.

The house has everything, games books and magazines along with Netflix to keep you entertained but little things like electric blankets and firewood were a nice touch.

We really appreciated the effort of the host to make our stay special and we’d love to stay at pinecone ridge again in the future.

We loved our stay here. Anne had a little welcome sign on the counter with a bottle of wine for us on arrival which was a cute touch. The house has a homely feel, plenty of space for the kids to run around on the property, and a view to die for. I would recommend this stay to anyone with kids.

Lovely house, highly
Recommend. We enjoyed our weekend. Thanks Anne

Pinecone Ridge is very comfortable and exceptionally well equipped. Just far enough out of town to enjoy the peace and quiet, but only a short drive to many wonderful restaurants and cellar doors. We had a great stay and being only just over an hours drive from Adelaide, would love to visit again. Highly recommend!
An absolutely fantastic Barossa experience at Pinecone Ridge. From the moment you enter the drive expectations are exceeded by this beautiful accomodation.

Stayed here in October, lovely thoughtful touches. We loved the pre set fire, great communication, the wine and of course the very awesome set of instructions on setting the bread maker so that we woke up to warm fresh bread. The electric blankets were great and we loved all the quirky light fittings. Very well appointed bnb, picnic basket, champagne cooler in freezer etc. Loved our stay.

One of the best Airbnbs we have every stayed at around the world. The place has absolutely everything you would want or need to have. Immaculately clean and very comfortable. Anne was very accommodating as we made a couple of requests to make it easier for our 3 year old son. Will definitely come back!

Just came home from a long weekend relaxing at Pinecone Ridge. The house is delightful and to make things even better it is amazingly well set up. I have a “travel box” that I bring along to every AirBnB because most have blunt knives, and a veggie peeler, scissors and can openers etc are not always there. My box stayed tightly sealed for the whole weekend because Anne has thought of and provided everything and it all works. The property is magnificent and we loved watching the storm roll in on Saturday night. I’d love to come back in winter to enjoy nights by the fire.
Fantastic house. Amazing communication from Anne and it all added to the perfect weekend away. Thanks Anne.

A beautifully appointed house, exactly as the pictures show PLUS a lot more! A great place for a quiet, homely yet luxurious holiday for a romantic getaway or a family with children. Kitchen, bedrooms, laundry, bathrooms, pristine clean and  fully equipped with everything we needed and things that we hadn't even anticipated needing. We will definitely be back to stay again! Thank you Anne.
Amazing stylish place with a phenomenal view. Incredible array of books and board games. Well stocked kitchen and generous additions like a bottle of wine.
Beautiful, quiet and thoughtful touches throughout. Great spot !

We loved our stay at Pinecone Ridge. The house has so many extra touches if you forget anything Anne has everything covered.

The house is lovely, in a convenient location with lovely gardens. We really did enjoy our stay.

We needed to contact Anne as the water went off and this was seen to immediately. We would definitely like to stay again in the future.

Thanks Anne and Josh!
Great stay, very clean, exactly how it is advertised. Would recommend
Stunning house with great views and a lot of extra touches that we really appreciated. Will be going back!
Can’t recommend this house more! Amazing views, beautiful decor and a properly equipped kitchen. This place will not disappoint!

This property was flawless in every way. The attention to detail was one of the very best we have seen in an Airbnb and anyone would be lucky to stay there.
The views are incredible and we even got to enjoy watching some kangaroos just outside the window as well. The local tips were great, and overall we cannot recommend this Airbnb enough. Thank you Anne and Josh for the beautiful space you have created.

Awesome location to explore the Barossa!
Great amenities, tidy, comfortable, quiet and Anne is great!
Recommend eve highly!

Annes property was just beautiful and had everything you needed & more to enjoy our stay - it really feels like a home away from home!!  Not to mention the amazing views across the valley, this hidden gem was also only a short walk into the Main Street of Angaston. Anne also kindly offered an early check in/late check out (without request). I highly recommend this property and will certainly rebook again when visiting the Barossa Valley!!

Pinecone Ridge is a true haven! We couldn’t have wished for a more perfect getaway - the house is spotless and fully kitted out (including a fire that was ready to be lit!) and Anne went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and provided great suggestions for our stay also. You will LOVE your time at Pinecone Ridge - can’t recommend highly enough!
An idyllic stay away from it all but near all that you want to see in the Barossa

Absolutely loved our stay at Pinecone

A fantastic base to explore the Barossa. Everything you can think of needing has been catered for and the property is fantastic

Can’t recommend this property enough!

Absolutely amazing.
So much personal touch like providing us with boxes of toys for our son, having a bread maker with the mixer for us to use, amazing range of kitchen appliances, welcoming sign & great range of quality tea - just to name few things, which made our stay extra special.

Great property too - so much to explore. The host was very accommodating and resourceful too.
Anne's place was great! We had such a good time. The value for money and location in Barossa is perfect for a couple or family. Will come back and stay here again for sure.

Such a special homely place with so many unexpected extras that made the whole experience so much more than we expected. Anne was a most helpful and lovely host and I would recommend Pinecone ridge to anyone and everyone. Thank you so much Anne.

Well organised and thoughtfully prepared property with everything you could possible need for your stay. Great position overlooking the valley with privacy. Easy access to all the Barossa has to offer. Kangaroos were an added bonus. We enjoyed the unique decorative touches in the home. Comfortable, cosy and spacious. A top choice in this beautiful location.

Immaculately clean, cosy home. Very well organised, well set up kitchen, fire, toys/games for kids. Anne provided very thorough instructions, suggestions and was very easy to communicate with. Beautiful views and property.

Fabulous house. Everything you need is available. Loved the views, sunset over the hills. Both outside fire and inside were lovely to sit by.
Also loved spotting the kangaroos who call Pinecone Ridge home. One even had a Joey it was carrying around.
Amazing house, great location, very well stocked. Lots of fun having fires outside and indoors

We had a lovely time in this comfortable and well appointed home. We particularly enjoyed having the fireplace on cold evenings. A great home base to explore the Barossa. Communication was great and the home had everything we needed with lots of lovely personal touches. Would recommend.

What a stunning place to stay! The house is set up so well with fantastic land to explore and have an adventure in. It was perfect for our family of 7 to stay in with great facilities, a range of games to play and wonderful views for each side of the house. Anne was a pleasure to deal with and couldn’t recommend this place more!

Pinecone Ridge was a lovely property with very considerate hosts who let us have an early check in and a late check out. We arrived to a welcome message, complimentary wine and a bread kit for making fresh bread, as well as one of the most well-appointed kitchens we have seen in an AirBnB. There were thoughtful touches everywhere, from wood for the fireplace to electric blankets for the chilly nights. We would happily stay here again.

What a wonderful place was beyond clean and amazing, such a peaceful place. would def go back and cant wait till we travel again. Anne was beyond professional and amazing and responded so quick, she made us feel very welcome and comfy. Well done to Anne and her wonderful place!
Our stay at Pinecone ridge was just beautiful! Such a great house with incredible views and in a brilliant location. Highly recommend!!
