The kitchen was amazingly equipped and we cooked breakfast every day and had it in the back yard listening to the birds singing. Evening time was spent with the family again outdoors. It was truly  an honor being entrusted with Heather's gem! I would definitely stay again and again...
This is a great place to stay. Lots  of thoughtful extras greatly located to the Barossa and a short stroll to the local bakery and eateries.
Great location, very easy to access bike track and local wineries. Close to restaurants and a quaint place to stay.

This is truly unique Airbnb accomodation with everything you would expect to see in a 5 star hotel. Great location, excellently finished with amazing furniture and fittings. We’ll be back, I’m sure when revisit the Barossa. Thanks again Heather and Gordon
old world charm

Heather and Gordon went above and beyond in every way - communication, arrival, even generous breakfast provisions. A gorgeous and historic place, filled with magnificent antique furniture and wonderfully generous touches. I loved my stay here, look forward to returning, and cannot recommend it too highly!

Having travelled all around the world this is definitely one of the best places we have stayed. Everything was exceptional from the furnishings to the breakfast provisions. I will have no hesitation recommending this accommodation.

Heather was fantastic and responded to me very quickly. Properly was lovely.
Thanks again for everything

Highly recommend! Gordon met us for check in and shared the property’s history and showed us around which was a lovely personal touch. Huge space with attention to detail - Heather has provided clear instructions and local tips. Thoughtful touches such as fresh coffee beans and grinder, coffee pod machine, breakfast provisions, toiletries, fluffy towels and a very comfy bed! A great location to explore the Barossa.
Good location and plenty of charming period features!
Many lovely touches, very comfy bed and pillows. Nice hot shower and lovely farm fresh eggs and toast for breakfast.

Close to all the wineries and located in a very beautiful, cosy home.
Communication was fantastic, comfy bed and yummy breakfast.
Thank you for having us Heather! we loved our stay! :)

This is a fantastic B&B complete with its own history. The place was super clean and very comfortable for our small family of 4. Thoroughly enjoyed our time in the Barossa and won't hesitate to re-book here again in the future!

Beautifully presented period home, everything you would want or need is provided. Comfortable beds and the fluffiest towels I have ever used. Heather is a wonderful host and communicates extremely well.
I highly recommend Heathers place. So clean and everything thought of. Charming place.

Lovely hosts and home. A comfortable home away from home for anyone wanting to visit the area. It's obviously not as modern as what is popular now, but the elegant and historic characteristics are what makes this place memorable.
Such an amazing place to stay and our hosts were outstanding! We will be back for sure!!!

Heather and Gordon’s place is a lovely period house. It’s conveniently located to explore the area, short distance to many wineries and the neighbourhood is quiet and quaint.

We loved meeting Gordon upon check-in and learning about the building’s history. He also gave us some useful local tips.

Heather’s thoughtful touches around the house made our stay even more special. The house has everything you could possibly need, and more. So comfortable, super clean and even smelt incredible.

We wish we could have stayed longer, one night just wasn’t enough!

Thanks again :)

Great little 2 bedroom place with everything you will need as a B&B, just be aware that there is two beds. Therefore, not recommended for a family of 4, with two kids.

Had a great night there and the hostess will pass on some interesting history about the building.

Thank you so much to the lovely hosts Heather and Gordon we absolutely loved our stay.
All the added touches were very unexpected.
Such a beautiful place to stay and easy start to the Barossa vineyards.
Wish we could have stayed for longer.... Next time..

We had a great stay. The house is well equiped. Lots of heaters for the winter :-) Heather was easy to reach and her suggestions for the area were great. I would stay there again if in the area. Thanks!!
Great location and helpful hosts , a very well maintained country town home to stay.
I loved staying at heathers place. She was a lovely host and told us about the history of the house etc before leaving us to our own devices.. the house had everything you could need

Truly beautiful accommodation with lots of fascinating treasures to look at in the house, as well as the historical side which Gordon showed us on arrival. It has everything you could need, especially in the very well equipped kitchen. Loads of books and DVD's if you want to stay indoors. Immaculately clean. The back patio was delightful in the sun, and the high fences gave privacy as well as protection from any breeze. So many things around Lyndoch to see and visit - no need to go too far afield. The Lord Lyndoch is within walking distance, and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal there.
A special thanks to Heather for coming to our rescue when "someone" managed to lock the house and leave the keys inside!!!
I absolutely loved this place. It is unique, historical, comfortable and the service provided is excellent. Easy check in, terrific communication. Will be back I am sure.
Heather provides everything and more at her historic BnB. All our needs were covered. A lovely spot to stay!
A wonderful, clean accomodation which I cannot recomend highly enough. Very comfortably beds, delightfuly decorated.
Lovely stay, host very accommodating and friendly, warm cosy place & very relaxing

This property in the beautiful town of Lyndoch is well appointed with everything you need for a great stay. The house is extremely clean, the beds are comfortable and there are plenty of breakfast provisions. The furnishings in the house are stunning. Thank you Heather.
Outstanding place! Beautiful and cosy and wonderfully historical. Well stocked with everything you need!
House can be a bit cold, but there is extra heating and blankets.
Highly recommend. Heather is a wonderful host
A lovely place for a weekend getaway. Accommodation was exactly as described, beautiful quite and perfect for a couple. Heather was very easy to contact and met us on arrival. Very welcoming

Such a lovely place to stay. The owners have lovingly restored this gorgeous building, turning it into a very comfortable and pleasant retreat. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and will be back again in the future.

Perfect place to explore the Barossa. Everything you need is there. Spacious accommodation for 4 adults. Heather is a great host, responds quickly to questions with great local knowledge, will meet you on arrival with a quick tour of the property and is readily available if there are any concerns. Absolutely seamless stay

Heather was amazing to deal with and her communication was excellent.
We booked this as a 50th birthday surprise for our friends and they loved their stay.

A wonderful location for a weekend getaway in the Barossa. Accommodation was exactly as described, perfect for a group of four adults. Heather was lovely, met us on arrival and gave us brief history of the building. Absolutely would stay again!
Fabulous accommodation.  The house has everything that you need.  Beautifully clean.  The hosts were very pleasant to deal with.  Would highly recommend this house.

We loved our stay and enjoyed all the authentic touches, comfy beds and thoughtful little touches around the place as well.  We had everything we needed.  It was ultra clean and tidy and could not fault it at all.  Great spot in town.  Highly recommended.  Very gracious hosts.
Thank you Heather for a great stay! The house was super cosy and homey, yet very spacious. The backyard area with barbecue was great for the warmer weather too.
A fantastic cottage in a great location. Loved our stay and all of the special little touches.
a lovely apartment exceptionally clean and well appointed.   Close to bike tracks, bakery and two pubs in Lyndoch.  A fabulousplace to stay while exploring the Barossa

Wow ! Martinsell manor was incredible! Peter & Marijan were fantastic hosts and so helpful to all our needs. We had the most amazing week and look forward to coming back to stay again hopefully in the next few years. The property and grounds were just beautiful! Definitely recommend Martinsell Manor to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa region.

AMAZING! Peter and Marijan were great hosts, so welcoming and helpful! the manor was so beautiful and we were honored to be able to stay here, it has been lovingly restored to a high quality. It really takes you back in time through a wonderful building with so much heritage. walking up the stairs from the pool made you feel like a princess.
Thank you again and we will be back

We stayed at the Martinsell Manor for our 10year Anniversary.

Marijan and Peter have worked hard to restore the lower level to its former glory.
They've done a wonderful job keeping true to history - from the beautiful rugs to the beds to the decor.
Amazing effort - it really shows.

Its a wonderful place to stay - quiet, relaxing and private.
A pool all to yourself for the hot days, a garden and near by pathways to go for a stroll and lovely soft grass to have some fun on.

We stayed in the Gold/White room. Restored and decorated beautifully - very large, with a large TV AND King size bed to match.
The bed and sheets were extremely comfortable.

Marijan and Peter were the perfect hosts - ensuring we had everything we needed.
They supplied the little things that normal places don't such as toothbrushes and toothpaste - and as well as adequate toiletries.

One highlight to our stay was they provided us with fresh fruits from their garden and Marijan's delicious plum jam! (As well as other items to eat/drink)
Its these little things that make going somewhere enjoyable and it really did help aid in our relaxation.

Thanks again Marijan and Peter for making our 10 Year Anniversary memorable!

There is no denying that this is a stunning property. The gold room was gorgeous, well appointed and everything you would expect from a manor house. The second room unfortunately paled in comparison, with a literally a tv the size of a laptop screen and electric blanket that was a single size and only warmed one side of the bed (I was freezing and Mum was like a hot water bottle ha ha).

The main living space lacked ANY form of heating and we found ourselves utterly freezing in literally sub zero temperatures. We were forced to eat and huddling around a heater in the main bedroom...not what you would expect from a property that charged over $1,200 for a weekend (I mean who wants to eat dinner in a semi circle around a heater in a bedroom????)

Breakfast was scarce and there was a distinct sense of a lack of generosity about the place. As a long time Airbnb user, I’m used to small thoughtful touches rather than 3 tiny packets of cereal for breakfast for a group. I’ve stayed in properties for $120 a night and they were so consumer focused, as well as places $2k a night which were sensational (thorngrove manor for example)

The property is grand and stunning, but it’s not decked out for winter unless you intend to wear snow gear.... to BED...I’m not even kidding! ( the pool is covered so you won’t get the photos you see on the air bnb page etc). In spring/summer months I’m sure it would be magical. We informed our hosts we decided to find alternative accomodation for the second night we paid for due to the sheer freezing temperatures in the home-it was utterly inhabitable. We weren’t offered a refund, rather we were told if we wanted to visit again they would heat the home. I think they need a lesson in customer service. As a business owner I would never treat my consumers that way-that’s not how you treat someone spending that amount of money.

There is no wifi codes provided so expect to not able to contact the outside world during your stay. I couldn’t receive texts, check my work emails and there was nothing in the info books around how to access it.

I think this place could be magical, it just needs a passionate manager who understands customer service, who is generous and genuinely wants their customers to enjoy the experience.

It’s hard to determine whether or not to recommend. The building is lovely, it’s just not particularly comfortable. I think there are other manor houses who really understand the customer, are passionate, generous and decent, I don’t think this place is it. It’s not about the asthmatics alone. To be fair, it’s about how you utilise the property and how it makes you feel. My rating? 2/5 they need to lift their game and not focus entirely on profit. I’d rather pay an extra $200 a stay for those little touches to include those who care about the customer experience. I hope this is a realistic wake up call to these guys. It’s a competitive (Website hidden by Airbnb) better!!! People will return because of the experience you created, not because your MO is income generation. We should have been provided a refund for a second night after raising our issues you directly. . That would have been the right thing...but these people don’t do the right thing, they put them and thier bottom line first....and do we really want to support businesses like that? I think not, choose elsewhere until they learn the art of decency and hospitality.

We spent a very special weekend at this property and enjoyed the luxurious gold room in the manor, which is very private with a separate entrance. The furnishings in the room are in Georgian style with quality throughout. Also the bed is very comfortable with a high quality mattress. The old blends with the new as there is a flat screen TV, wi-fi access and heating. We also enjoyed the electric blanket which was working perfectly. The property has a beautiful large swimming pool set amongst majestic trees and pretty gardens with pathways. We enjoyed a tour of the property with a vineyard, sheep, llamas and chickens. Breakfast is provided in a modern kitchenette off the lounge area and is self service. There are tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge for personal use.

We enjoyed touring the wineries and eating in the Barossa as there is so much to see in the nearby vicinity. Our experience was very positive with such warm and friendly hosts. We would certainly recommend this accommodation.
Absolutely stunning views and a great location for our trip!!

My husband and I had the most amazing stay with our little daughter. It was definately a trip to remember !

We enjoyed walking around the property, playing in the pool, cooking dinner on the bbq and relaxing in the amazing house.

We used the lawn games and had so much fun family time together.

The best parts were the privacy on the property and views !

We also were gifted with a bottle of wine from the owners vineyard on new years eve.

Highly recommend !

We had an amazing time at Martinsell Manor, the house and surrounding gardens are stunning. The rooms are so grand and luxurious, Peter and Marijan have done a wonderful job renovating. They were excellent hosts, offering so much knowledge on the property and area. We had such a relaxing trip, highly recommend!!

We had a lovely few days here over New Year's Eve (spending quite a lot of the time in the swimming pool)! The area is beautiful, with nice walks nearby and further afield; the building is very lovely; there's clearly a lot of good wineries and restaurants within a 20 minute drive or so, though we mostly didn't venture far away as there were so many spaces outdoors in particular to sit around and read or look at the wonderful views over fields.

Lovely accomodation surrounded by beautifully kept gardens. Highlights were the pool, great amount of amenities (breakfast, snacks, cooking essentials and toiletries) and antique style interiors. Thank you for all your help and effort you put into making the space beautiful!

Peter & Marijan’s place was absolute perfection.

They have thought of everything from beautiful decor to a generously stocked kitchen complete with eggs fresh from their chickens! It is clear from the moment you arrive that they have taken a huge amount of care and pride in creating a truly spectacular stay for their guests.

The location was ideal, close to everything but still entirely secluded once you are on the property and the ammenities on property would certainly be enough to entertain you for a whole weekend. You can lounge by the salt water pool, play lawn games, feed the alpacas and enjoy a glass of wine from their vineyard.

Highly recommend.

Peter and Marijan,

Thank you so much for the amazing stay at Martinsell Manor, we had such a lovely experience in the Barossa made even more special and exciting at the manor.

The Gold room was large and spacious, with the cosiest bed and electric blanket for the colder nights. The small touches made us feel so welcomed as well, such as bathroom amenities, snacks, water, even eggs from Marijan’s chickens!

We thoroughly enjoyed our walks around the property but didn’t get a chance to swim in the pool. We’ll have to come back next time!

Thanks again

Dan and Gwen

Lovely manor in a beautiful location. Manor had history and old world charm. Fantastic examples of older trees on extensive property. Very attentive hosts who were eager to make stay enjoyable ... which it was!

This property is, in one word, magnificent. Marijan and Peter are the most marvellous hosts: caring, generous, thoughtful, but unobtrusive. Their property is a mix of historic charm and luxurious amenity. We walked a great deal during our stay and we were so impressed by their care of the land as much as their flawless renovation of this historic manor.

The home was ultra comfortable, warm and homely, despite being located in a historic manor. The beds were like sleeping in clouds and the linen was super high quality. The property felt like some luxe inner city home but set in the middle of a vineyard and country farm; the ultimate country getaway.

I have read another’s review of this property. It is utter rubbish. Our stay was absolutely the opposite of what was asserted. We have travelled very extensively domestically and internationally, and could not have been happier. We stayed here a week and very happily would have stayed another week.

If you want a ‘real’ experience of the Barossa, this is it. We cannot wait to return!
Beautiful property, I’ll never forget the gorgeous little lambs. Lovely rooms. Marijan was very welcoming and kind.

Had a wonderful stay at this beautiful property. Marijan was more than helpful, and very welcoming. We had everything we needed and more! It was fun to walk around, to explore the grounds, and to see the sheep and alpacas!

The Martinsell Manor is gem, one of the best kept secrets of the Barossa. My wife and I have been fortunate enough to travel the World and we can honestly say this place ranks very highly in our books of exquisite locations to holiday and lucky for us it’s in our backyard being Adelaide locals. We absolutely loved our stay at the Manor. Peter and Marijan have done a fantastic job in renovating this magnificent historical home. The rooms are splendid, architecturally marvelous, very clean and as someone said in another review the bed is indeed like sleeping in clouds, super comfy and warm. Marijan and Peter are such wonderful hosts; the kitchen and fridge was well stocked we hardly even got through half of the goodies, very quiet and non-intrusive. The peace and tranquility of the surroundings is to die for and refreshing. There is so much to do in close proximity of the Manor; wineries, amazing restaurants, tourist attractions etc couldn’t recommend it more, you just have to try it out.
A truly grand mansion,set in stunning grounds in one of the most beautiful parts of the Adelaide hills. A wonderful place to stay.

Martinsell Manor is in a beautiful location surrounded by wonderfull gardens and lovely views of the vineyards. The Manor is beautifully furnished, very private and extremely comfortable. Peter and Marjian were very discreet allowing us to enjoy the Manor as though we were the only people there. They also provided lots of little extras such as fresh eggs, juice and bread. We loved our stay.

Myself and two friends stayed at Peter and Marijan's home in between Christmas and New Years' whilst travelling around South Australia and it was a highlight of our two-week trip. The home is beautiful and exactly as per the listing, as are the grounds and the swimming pool. Both Peter and Marijan are incredibly welcoming hosts and couldn't be more pleasant, even driving us back to our car on New Year's Day. However, at the same time, you wouldn't even know they were there, the downstairs accommodation is totally private. I highly recommend booking this home when in the Barossa Valley!

Loved staying at this cottage! Everything was so comfortable and clean. It is obvious that Deb has put a lot of time and thought into making sure that the place is “just right”. From the supplies in the kitchen to the way each room was set up - you really felt like a valued house guest. We started each morning with a walk through the videyards and enjoyed spotting kangaroos and other local wildlife - stunning! Steve was great too and nothing was too much trouble. Definitely make sure you visit their cellar door if you are there on a weekend - the wine and cheese platter were fantastic.
Such a beautiful home within an amazing setting. Every little detail exceptional x
Would highly recommend Linfield Cottage. Everything a much needed getaway required and much more.
Lovely well appointed place, Helpful and friendly host would certainly recommend the place and host to anyone.
Everything was wonderful.  Would recommend highly, just check when the tastings are available before you stay. Extra lovely touches throughout the accommodation and very personable hosts.

This place was absolutely fantastic! Cosy, warm and a perfect base for a lovely wine weekend! The property had everything you could want and need including a bbq and a fire pit for late night marshmallows! I couldn’t recommend this place highly enough and the hosts were so accommodating. If you come across this place I’d go right ahead and book it!

This property surpasses the listing, it is better than expected.
We were given a supply of food and drink, the home is beautifully decorated, Steve and Deb have thought of everything. Location is perfect for exploring the Barossa

Our family of four stayed at Sally’s place for 6 nights and had a really fantastic time there. Staying at a working vineyard, especially during harvest time, was a fascinating experience. Sally and Martin were wonderful hosts, they made us feel very welcome. We were able to walk around the vineyard, watch the harvest, feed the rescued kangaroos (and the geese and peacock), we borrowed bikes from them, enjoyed a complimentary bottle of wine from the vineyard, were given lots of tips on what to do in the area and very much enjoyed Sally’s homemade cookies and crisps and the chickens freshly laid eggs.

The house overlooks rolling hills of the vineyard and has a lovely view framed by the garden and lots of native trees; we loved just sitting out on the deck and taking in the scenery and listening to the birds. The house has lots of character with artwork and thoughtful touches including fresh flowers. It was spotlessly clean; we had lots of space; the kitchen was suitably equipped for the several meals that we cooked there, the condiments were appreciated, plus the fridge was stocked with milk, butter and some local goodies on our arrival. Overall we really enjoyed our time there and would love to come back for another stay if we make it back to Australia some day. Thanks Sally and Martin for a wonderful time.

Whistler Vineyard Retreat is an absolutely fantastic accommodation in the heart of the Barossa Valley. We spent two days with Sally and Martin and cannot recommend their accommodation highly enough!
From the minute Sally and Martin welcomed us to their retreat, the kind gesture of a complimentary bottle of whistler wine and platter waiting for us on arrival and the perfect location to enjoy a glass of wine on the back verandah and watch the sun set over the vineyards we knew this was special and felt right at home. We loved every moment we spent at Whistler's Retreat, and hope to return again soon. Thank you Sally and Martin, just perfect.

We really enjoyed our stay with Sally and Martin.  The setting is beautiful facing out to vineyards, in a quiet winegrowing area that makes for a serene stay with quiet, dark evenings that highlight all the stars you haven’t seen since you were a child.  Their friendly menagerie wandered about the property; their gorgeous peacock would periodically check in on us, and their friendly dogs and cat would occasionally come by to greet us as well.  Of course there are geese, the orphaned kangaroos they care for near their cellar door, and the chickens that provide your breakfast eggs as well.   We appreciated the fresh flowers, snacks, breakfast goodies, local recommendations, and their sincere and friendly hospitality.  And when we reported a minor problem one evening, Sally and Martin immediately fixed it.    Internet worked perfectly well even while accessing some data-heavy spreadsheets for work.  Over a decade ago we stayed at another nearby property where we had sole use of a guesthouse, and we really preferred our stay here, as we had all the privacy we wanted while having access to the recommendations and company of 30+ year locals when desired.  Don’t wait,....book this guestwing now!

The experience was nothing short of extraordinary. A perfect getaway in the middle of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Starting with an amazing, very warm host [Sally] to the most scenic/beautiful property with deeply thought out amenities and, what deserves the most mention, a collection of adorable pets [incl baby kangaroos and peacocks!]. A true gem!
Very nice place, stylish, sparkling clean and quite .. highly recommended ! Thank you very much for your very much welcomed hosting!
Beautiful place to stay in the heart of the Barossa. Warm, comfortable and inviting and Sally is an amazing host with a wealth of local information to share. Loved our four days here!

One word: Superb. From the welcome platter and bottle of Whistler wine, recommendations on local spots to visit, to just sitting and gazing at the wind playing in the trees; this was  heaven!  Gorgeous accommodation with thoughtful and interesting touches.  We had three days and could easily have enjoyed more.  A fabulous property.

The Whistler is one of the best airbnb's I have ever stayed in! We spent the evening by a roaring fire and Sally's incredibly well stocked kitchen, complementary bottle of wine produced on site and heated floors kept us extremely warm and happy. The location couldn't have been better for wine tasting and in summer, taking a bike ride around the vineyards (bikes offered on site), would be lovely. Sally's hospitality could not be topped and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to explore the Barossa.

Very clean and cared for rooms and property in a private vineyard setting.
Sally was an excellent host that provided us with everything we could possibly need including a bottle of their own lable of premium Shiraz on arrival together with a local cheese board.
We particularly enjoyed sitting around the fire in their garden at night sharing stories and a glass or two of wine.

Fantastic place to stay. Bottle of wine and platter on arrival. Cosy guest house in a stunning location.  Sally was an amazing host providing lots of lovely touches including the best homemade anzac cookies I’ve ever had.

From the very first message to Sally I knew I had picked a great place to stay! On our arrival she was so welcoming and offered us so much great advice about where to go and what to see, not to mention the lovely welcome platter and bottle of Whistler wine. It was also all the other touches, home made cookies, crackers and fresh eggs from the chooks in the back garden. We enjoyed a glass of wine on the back balcony overlooking the vineyard as the sun set, magical!! The accommodation is spotlessly clean and the beds are super comfy! Location is perfect and we were central to so many amazing vineyards and restaurants as well as the new Gin Distillery just up the road. We also enjoyed a wine tasting at the Whistler cellar door, beautiful setting on the lawns. All in all this place is the only place anyone should stay at when visiting the Barossa. Sally makes you feel so welcome as soon as you meet her and is happy to share her knowledge and love for the Barossa. We will definitely come back and have already recommended it to our friends.

Sally was a wonderful host. The personal touches (like home baked cookies, farm fresh eggs,  fruit) make you feel at home from the first moment. The home is located in the vineyard and is very serene, with the resident farm animals wandering about creating a very relaxed and familiar atmosphere. I highly recommend Sally’s place!

Amazing location to venture across the Barossa Valley. The host knows the area well and recommendations been great! This range from where to eat, drink, grocery etc . And she always response fast.

The stay been great with a nice kitchen to wipe up meals after Barossa Farmers Market, and having it on the patio, facing the sunset over the vineyard. Mornings are a delight to have the resident peacock going by, chickens giving freshly laid eggs and geese going by.

The wines from Whistler packs surprises. Do spend time at their cellar doors, while children could while their time at the playground.

Lovely host and place.

It was absolutly amazing. I can't say enough about how beautiful the place was. Sally was such a lovely host and had everything we could have needed ready for us. If you love piece and quiet, animals, pizza and wine then this is the place for you.
An awesome place to stay and Sally is an awesome host, she left home made baking for us to enjoy and fresh flowers, awesome

An awesome place to stay . Sally was a welcoming host , from the plate of local produce on arrival , home baked snacks and fresh eggs to providing great information about the area . Sally provides the right balance between attentiveness and being unobtrusive.  We had a fabulous weekend hanging out at the vineyard as well as getting out and about . Highly recommended!

This was a beautiful little place to stay. Really loved watching the geese walking about the lawns and spying Roger the resident peacock.  Not only were the hosts very accommodating but we were welcomed with a lovely bottle of white wine and a cheese platter. Just a beautiful way to start a mini holiday in the Barossa. I would definitely recommend this lovely piece of paradise to anyone.

This was a peaceful relaxing place to stay. The setting was really beautiful. The apartment was stylish and well appointed. The wine, the platter and the eggs on arrival were really nice and very tasty. There were so many little extras such as condiments, home baked biscuits and books on the book shelf. We highly recommend this as a really lovely place to escape the city hustle and bustle. It was a good central location for sampling what the delights of the Barossa. Thank you for having us. :-)

Whistler is a beautiful winery in a fabulous location and it is a delight to stay there, Sally is a wonderful host who looks after your stay with great information and hospitality. Very enjoyable stay and will certainly be back soon.

Absolutely loved this, it’s what airbnb is all about! Sally is a wonderful host, lots of lovely touches and generous with her local knowledge. Willing to go above and beyond!
It’s even better than the photos ... we’ll be back!
Great location in the heart of Barossa. Good to stay on a working winery with Australian animals. Great knowledge of Barossa attractions.
Great place to stay if you are looking for peace and tranquillity.  Clean and tidy accommodation, loved the bottle of Red wine.

The perfect winery getaway in Barossa. Sally was very helpful and responsive during our stay, great hospitality. She’s also very knowledgeable about the region. We particularly enjoyed walking around the property and relaxing on the hammock! We will definitely be back if we are around this area in the future.
We had a great weekend at Sally’s place, great hospitality and an amazing spot to stay. Would love to go back and would highly recommend.

This place is in a beautiful location at a fantastic winery. Great walks around the vineyard, dams and animal enclosure were a great start and end to our day. The hosts are super helpful and very responsive to any requests.
The cottage is very well equipped with everything you could need and the hammock was an especially nice touch.
Thanks for the use of the push bikes and the local tips and advice. Can’t wait to come back.

Amazing! I could stay here for a full week!
There is so many things to do at Whistler from a walk around the vineyard to play equipment (for kids), roo enclosure and of course the great wine!
Wonderful hospitality, local suggestions and relaxing surrounds.

Sally's place is impeccable.  It is beautifully presented, charming with many personal touches.  Surrounded by a gorgeous garden and sited in a vineyard it is the perfect place to stay in the Barossa.  Sally herself is friendly and hospitable and has thought of everything to make your stay comfortable and to provide expert information about the area.

Amazing hospitality, delicious fresh eggs for breakfast, home made biscuits, platter & wine on arrival and a gorgous, sparkling clean place with all you could need. There was even a luxurious deep bath. Sally gave us loads of local tips and was always available when needed. The winery has delicious wines and a green open space for relaxing while tasting and plenty for the kids to do too. Everyone we met there was friendly and helpful, we were also lucky enough to be there for one of their friday night food truck and wine nights.
The view from the place is of the vines and it is very easy to get to many wineries inc Seppeltsfield and Maggie Beers restaurant. I highly recommend staying here, it is a treat! Thank you Sally for ensuring our weekend was so memorable.

The perfect quiet getaway in the country. If you are after a private bonfire, with short walks, in a beautiful  location this is the place. Sally was generous in her supply of little extras. The underground floor heating during cold winter nights was fantastic.
We had a lovely stay during a rainy weekend. Cozy, warm and everything you need! Sally was lovely, we will be back for longer next time!

Absolutely loved staying here. Sally and Martin are excellent hosts and their property is stunning. This is a stylish and private space with all you need for a relaxing stay in the Barossa. Beautiful location overlooking the vines, awesome bath, great walking and cycling track and close to Tanunda.

We absolutely loved our stay at Whistler Wines, and are sure you will too, whether you are traveling with kids or without. Sally was extremely proactive with communications, and we couldn't have received a warmer welcome at checkin from Ellen. The location, just off Seppeltsfield Road, is arguably one of the best positions in the Barossa - you're just a stone's throw from Torbreck, Two Hands wines and Seppeltsfield, and a short drive from Nuriootpa and Angaston. The retreat was a warm, welcoming space, comfortably furnished and with amazing amenities (+1 for underfloor heating and a deep soaking bath overlooking the vineyards!). Our children especially loved meeting the friendly dog, Winnie, the geese and the rescue kangaroos down by the cellar door. Fresh eggs are provided from the well-fed hens on site and there are other amenities like freshly baked biscuits, great coffee and even Sal's home made tomato sauce. As our stay was mid-winter, we didn't have much of an opportunity to enjoy the outdoor area (including hammock!), but this would be divine once spring rolls around. Highly recommended!

Fabulous welcome, accommodation and location. We loved walking with the dogs. A perfect break with the cellar door to walk to with fantastic wines to try. Sally is very generous leaving us a lovely bottle of wine to welcome us, a cheese platter, homemade crackers, I’d love the recipe please, and biscuits. Could not have asked for more and we’ll be back.

A perfect place for a long weekend, even in winter! A warm welcome from Ellen on one of coldest days. Lovely food provision - cheese platter, eggs, biscuits, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, butter and a bottle of Whistler wine.

It’s a great location for many other wineries, and just two minute drive to Appellation for dinner.

The kitchen is well equipped, we cooked a dinner with local produce from the farmers market.

The bedding is comfortable, soft and fluffy towels, and nice bath tub overlooking the wineyard.

The underfloor heating is just perfect for winter, a mild and effective heating. It was a little wet to have an outdoor fire that weekend but it would be perfect setting on other cold days.

Absolutely love the geese! They are just gorgeous little things. (Not that little actually)

Highly recommended and we’d love to return on other occasions.
A truly fabulous place to stay!! Great location, atmosphere, full of comforts and personality. We’ll definitely be back again soon. Thank you!

This is a beautiful piece of paradise in the heart of the Barossa. Sally was a kind and thoughtful host and made sure we were comfortable during our stay. Her extra sweet touches, like fresh flower bouquets, rice packs to warm the bed, fresh eggs from the chickens and a delicious welcome platter and a bottle of delicious Whistler Wines are just a few of the fine touches. The beautiful scenery amongst the vines and all the animals made this a truly unique experience that I would recommend for anyone. I know we will be back.
A beautiful little spot with lovely hosts, great wine and close to all the best spots in the Barossa! Highly recommended. Thanks  Sally and Martin
A beautiful peaceful stay. Sally was very hospitable, the wine and platter were very thoughtful. A perfect place to relax.

We had a great stay here with our adult son and his partner. The house was very comfortable (the underfloor heating was a bonus as the weather became very cold) and the beds were also comfy. Sally provided little welcoming extras such as heatbags for the beds, homemade soaps, homemade biscuits, fresh eggs, a cheese platter and bottle of wine. There were also some basic but very useful provisions left in the cupboards (salt, pepper, oil, gladwrap, etc) which were great to have as we cooked a couple of meals. The view over the vines was very peaceful and the chooks, geese and roos provided some entertainment! The central location made accessing wineries and restaurants in the Barossa easy. Would definitely stay here again!

Such a great space and location. Guests are only metres from the vineyard with ample places outside to socialise and soak it all in. The attention to detail was outstanding with a welcome platter, homemade Anzac bikkies (yum), fresh eggs and cut flowers. Sally and Martin were fantastic hosts, and we’re looking forward to returning sometime in the future.

All round 5 Star stay we had. The BnB was stunning and super easy to get around to all of Tanunda’s best offerings.

Lovely personal touches like homemade biscuits and a welcome bottle of wine were wonderful, and topped off with a late check out. An all round lovely stay !

Overlooking the vineyard and beautiful gardens this is a great stay in the best area in the Barossa! Quiet and peaceful with great hosts, just the spot to rest and relax for2 to 4 guests. Highly recommended.

Our family of four stayed here over Easter and couldn’t recommend it highly enough! Perched on top of a hill, with a short walk through the vines to the cellar door, the location was perfect. Our kids loved the wandering geese and dogs. Sally is quick to respond to any requests and a great local guide. We would happily return again soon!

This place is all that’s great about AirBNB … a delightful,comfortable space that has a connection with the owners … and a friendly, thoughtful and generous host! This was our second stay and we WILL be back. The guesthouse has everything you’d expect and then Sally’s delightful extras - fresh eggs from the chooks, Anzac biscuits and even a bottle of wine. It’s private, but with the benefit of being connected to the vineyard. A great base from which to explore the Barossa!

I booked Whistler for my Wife and sister and after a couple of cancellations due to Covid a year or so ago they finally got a chance to go, they both can not speak more highly of the accommodation and the hospitality by Sally, from the wine and cheese platter on arrival to the beautiful scenery of the vineyards where the house they stayed in is situated the views were amazing.
You can enjoy wine tasting of quality wine 100 mts away in Whistler cellar door which had kangaroos and was a big hit for the kids that were around, there are numbers other wineries within walking distance.
All in all an amazing experience with lovely hosts 5 stars.

Thanks Sally and Martin. We really enjoyed our stay in the Barossa, and that Whistler is so central to wineries, restaurants and towns in the area. Your suggested day plans are great and make it easy to have a great day without having to think about it too much! We loved that one of your gorgeous dogs took us on our walk around the vineyard on Sunday morning, and the sounds and sights of all your other farm animals and rescue kangaroos. Thanks again! Paddy and Angela.
We had a perfect long weekend staying here, after a boring conference in Adelaide.  Beautiful location, amazing hosts, thoughtful details - we couldn’t recommend this place more.

Sally really has thought of everything! From the homemade sauces to the heat packs on the beds, all the homily touches are there. We were blown away with all the small details, great hospitality and the warm welcome we received. Not to mention the great location, access to Whistler Wines, friendly animals and bonfire. We cannot wait to come back again and recommend this stay to all our friends! You will not be disappointed.

Such a great place for a getaway. The home has everything you would need - Sally has thought of everything. There are stunning views from the large windows and there is a cosy verandah to just sit and chill. The underfloor heating was amazing for the cold weather and it was great having access to a bathtub. We also enjoyed a walk around the property to see the wildlife and vines and a visit to the cellar door is a must!

10/10 stay...this place is the best!!!! So so homely and Sally is a wonderful host who goes above and beyond! The winery itself is fantastic too, the wines produced here are top shelf! But that is just the start, the setting is amazing and animals just complete the place. We travelled with our two young daughters who both had a fabulous time and therefore it does suit families however a romantic relaxing getaway would even be better...maybe we can make it back for that one day 😉. The master bedroom looks onto the vineyard, you could not expect to wake up to a better view....anywhere!!! Highly recommend...we will be back 😍
Beautiful location, with loads of lovely little thoughtful additions throughout the accomodation. The underfloor heating is absolutely wonderful in the cold weather, too!

Thank you again for the wonderful stay. The warmth and homeliness of the place is hard to beat and we were very grateful to be able to experience the tranquillity (even with our 2 young girls) for a very relaxing and comfortable weekend away.
The location is the best we have experienced in the Barossa and for someone who is a bit of a linen and towel "snob" - it was pure heaven to have such high quality and beautiful items to use over the weekend. The extras were so generous and we all thoroughly enjoyed every minute of the trip!
Wonderful country property, and sensational hospitality.

Lovely place to stay when visiting the Barossa. Nice central location to restaurants, and gin and wine tasting.
The animals just add to the beautiful location. Worth the visit.
You won't find better people hosting anywhere. The location was amazing, home was beautifully looked after. Family friendly and attached to a winery!  It was just what we needed.

We had a wonderful stay at the Whistler Vineyard Retreat. The property is beautiful and tranquil - a perfect place to switch off and unwind. Sally was a wonderful host - welcoming, helpful and a great communicator.

Whistler Vineyard Retreat was a wonderful find. I stayed with 2 other girlfriends , but it is flexible to accommodate 2 couples or a family of 4. Inclusions were very generous with a  Barrossa cheese platter, fresh Barrossa coffee,  a bottle of their Whistler Wine and many more home made goodies making this the best valued in the region.  Underfloor heating made the place super welcoming after coming home from a day of lunching and gin tasting . Unfortunately we were too full to drag ourselves to the firepit , looking forward to enjoying that on our next stay. Location is perfect  for exploring the valley , you could walk to the Seppeltsfield Gin Distillery up the road or meander down the driveway  and enjoy the on site cellar door! Sally was warm and welcoming making communication a breeze. Would highly recommend this place on your next stay to the Barrossa.

Very clean and comfortable cottage in a quiet village. The provisions were excellent and the linens and bedrooms very comfortable. The owner is very helpful and accommodating. There is no garden so if you have kids this is something to bear in mind. The restaurants and cellar doors are around 15 minutes drive (some may be closer).
Every fine detail is catered for and all add up to 5 star quality accommodation. Such a beautiful and romantic little get away spot!
Delightful cottage with luxury fittings and extras.  Gourmet local foods for breakfast and snacks. Handy to the prettiest part of the Barossa
The host canceled this reservation 67 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Lovely French style cottage . Cozy stay with full hospitality. Yummy breakie and lots of sauces for cooking. Mel is a Very thoughtful host !

This place raises the Air BnB standard. Staying here is a must for a Barossa Valley visit. Mel has thought of everything, including freshly picked roses, bath salts for the bath, amazing food and drink supply, candles, stocked firewood. I had no trouble communicating with Mel and she is extremely accommodating.
Beautifully appointed cottage in the middle of town. The breakfast and food and wine supplied was from local producers and excellent quality. Everything you could need a great place to stay

This place is beyond expectations. Every single touch had been carefully thought about and many surprises. We loved our stay and couldn’t recommend it more. Thankyou Mel for allowing us to stay. We will remember it forever

This is such a charming cottage in the Barossa Valley area.  Every vineyard is a short drive away.  Mel the owner has Queen's Cottage decorated in such a lovely way from sheets, towels and even the bed covers are 5 star.  The cottage is filled with supplies from chocolates, wine, breakast provisions, and many more.  The fire is warm and cozy with heaps of candles and wood is supplied for your stay.  Mel even supplies bath salt for the lovely claw tub.  Thank you Mel for the lovely birthday celebration I was able to give to my husband on our weekend trip to the lovely Barossa.
Could not recommend Queen’s cottage more highly. Mel goes above and beyond to make the stay as memorable as possible. 10/10.
Beautiful house, so well renovated and beautifully appointed with everything you need for a special trip. Lots of great little touches and extras. Have already been recommending to everyone!
The host canceled this reservation 47 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Mel's place is a real warm and cosy gem.

Like the other 5-star reviews, we were absolutely delighted with ALL that we found at Mel's Queens Cottage. The space is thoughtfully decorated and is warm and welcoming. There were gourmet delights for us from local businesses. Breakfast provisions were very welcomed and generous. The beds are firm and comfortable, with electric blankets (which was very appreciated during our stay as the nights were cold!). Having said that, the wood fire certainly warmed the living area beautifully and added a lovely ambience. The under floor heating in the laundry and bathroom was a welcome treat for bare feet and kept that end of the house gently warm. If you can't be bothered lighting the fire, there were 2 reverse cycle air conditioners that quickly warmed the living area, bedrooms and kitchen.
Despite being on the main road, we barely heard any traffic and being a country town, there really wasn't any traffic to be seen anyway.
We really enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and will be back to enjoy this fabulous find again.

My stay at Mel’s was amazing. The home itself was lovely, but it was the little touches that really made my time there really nice.

There were fresh muffins waiting for us, as well as some lovely chocolates and port by the fireplace (which was already made up and ready for us to light!)

Mel provided a gorgeous spread for breakfast - fresh eggs, bacon, tomato, mushrooms, yogurt, fresh fruit, croissants, as well as some cereals. There was milk and orange juice as well and lots of tea and coffee options.

The house was in the perfect spot to walk to the local pubs for dinner, not even a two minute walk.

My weekend at Mel’s was amazing, so relaxing, I didn’t need to worry about anything. Highly recommend!!
Excellent with a lovely warm fireplace and lovely large hot shower for a winter retreat

We loved our stay at Mel’s bnb! The place was beautiful, and there were so many lovely little touches that just made it perfect (like the freshly baked cookies and breakfast). The underfloor heating in the bathroom was incredible and the fire was so cosy. Mel have really helpful tips on getting there and into the accommodation, and had super quick communication. I hope to be able to go again soon!

Your expectations will be exceeded above and beyond. My friends and I had an amazing 2 night stay at Queens Cottage and we were blown away.

The place was clean and tidy and Mel thought of literally everything. From the provision on cheese and wine, right down to the paper bags that were available when we were looking for extra bags upon leaving.

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the Barossa.

Loved every second here! Such an inviting, clean and warm home. Hospitality is one of the best I’ve seen and received so far.
So close to some beautiful hikes, we were spoilt for choice.
I can’t fault this place or Mel’s attention to detail at all. Thanks!
Absolutely beautiful. All the little added touches made our stay extra special. Perfect for a little getaway and so close to everything.
Beautiful cottage, lovely cheese & wine provisions. Loved the fresh loaf of bread and breakfast aswell. Central location in Williamstown

If you could have someone think of your every holiday need or better still the things you did not know you knew, how amazing would that be?
Thanks Mel, that was how we felt staying at your cottage in the Barossa.
The cottage is so quaint and immaculately kept.
Arriving to a fridge of beautiful local produce, wine and chocolate is such a treat. Great size bedrooms with starched linen, like all 5 star hotels. Living room with a real fireplace and comfy sofa and chairs and cottage decor. Great big bathroom and extra loo works well if you are a group of 4.
The detail is where Mel’s cottage sets itself apart from other properties.
I didn’t even think of a picnic until we stumbled upon a picnic blanket and picnic hamper. A picnic at Angaston Lookout was awesome! Plush Robes, history of the area, games, centrally located in Williamstown.
So many positives, the only negative is that we had to leave!
Thank you so much Mel for such a wonderful stay! Highly recommend Queens Cottage!
Beautiful home! Lots of special touches (like candles, room sprays, beautiful outside furniture) and the bath is amazing!

Stylish, immaculately clean cottage with plenty of room for 3 people. Great amenities and so many personal touches. Lovely platter and wine on arrival with plenty of food for yummy breakfasts. Close to attractions and easily accessible. Lovely host who was easy to communicate with and very generous.
Beautiful property in a great location to access the Barossa. Generous food provisions provided. Would love to stay here again.

Queens Cottage is what hospitality is all about - we loved all the personal touches Mel put into making sure our stay was memorable. Mel was also quick to respond to any questions we had about the place. Definitely felt like a home away from home.
A lovely Cottage, cosy fire, beautiful bath and yummy Breakfast Provisions
We absolutely loved our stay here. All the little personal touches were great. The house is in a great position & is decorated beautifully.
A luxurious retreat at the edge of the Barossa away from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful ammenities and comfort combine to make this the perfect stay.

Amazing and well above expectations! The house was huge, clean and beautiful. We had a great time and loved the pool table and outdoor setup. There were 5 of us (adults) and we had ample space, with two bathrooms and two lounges. Just off the main street and a short walk from Peter Lehman and Langmeil. Would definitely recommend for big groups or families and hope to visit again!
Lovely place, the pictures dont do it justice! Host is very accomodating and helpful.

Tastefully renovated house, excellent for large groups, family or otherwise. Comfortable beds with nice linens. Polished wood and tiled floors. Very well set up kitchen with masses of cutlery, plates etc. Washing machine, easy access to line. Added extras include wine fridge and pool table. Two wineries within walking distance and easy access to town  and the rest of the Borossa. Fills a much needed gap in the market as a lot of Barossa accommodation caters only to couples.
nice and spacious

Heath’s property is a great place to stay while in the barossa especially if you have a larger group. Heath and Monica have awesome communication and the property is fully stocked with everything you need to enjoy your self and be comfortable during the stay. The house is huge and we loved using the back yard for a bbq with friends. Would definitely stay again!
Nice and roomy in a convenient location. Good communication from the hosts.
Beautiful home in a great spot. The place was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed. We'll definitely book again. Thanks! :)

This is the perfect place to stay for touring the Barossa Valley, particularly for a group. The location is perfect, the house is very spacious with plenty of bedrooms, separate spaces for relaxing, watching tv, dining and even a pool table area which was great fun. There is also an outdoor area with large table and chairs and bbq. The kitchen is also large with everything you could need and more. Our hosts also offered us early check-in and late check-out which was really helpful and a bottle of wine was waiting for us which was a lovely touch. I really can’t fault this place and highly recommend. We loved our stay and will definitely be back!

We stayed at The Entertainer for one night while attending a wedding in Bethany. We really wish we could have stayed longer.
This house is huge! With 2 living rooms, 2 bathrooms and an abundance of bedrooms, this is the perfect home away from home for a big family holiday!
Check-in was super easy and the beds were comfy. Can't wait to stay again!
Great larger space for a large number of people to enjoy the surrounding areas. Would definitely stay here again, and the hosts were amazing with flexible check in and check out.
The host canceled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Spacious comfy house with everything you need for an overnight stay! Appreciated the en-suite, dishwasher and fire being set before we arrived.

Eight of us stayed here for a wine tour. Great location, walking distance to some wineries.

Massive house and huge backyard with plenty of space, beds and great facilities.

Monica was really helpful and was really understanding when we changed the booking earlier in the week.

Couldn’t have had a better stay. Highly recommend if travelling with a large group.
Great place, really spacious and clean.  Great location.
A great location and a generous home for a large group.

Beautifully clean house in a great location. We were a group of 8 and the house at heaps of room. Good location and a few wineries on your door step. The fireplace was a highlight. Monica answered any of my queries swiftly. Would stay there again. Perfect stay.
Five of us stayed for a girls weekend. It was a really stylish, luxurious and beautiful space. Extremely comfy beds and had everything needed!
Lovely home for the weekend.  Arrived to an already lit and cozy fire. We all got lord of enjoyment out of the pool table.
Great location & fabulous house!
A really lovely roomy and stylish place to stay with a group. Also in a great location!

Great spot for touring and exploring the Barossa valley. We stayed here with friends and family for my 30th birthday and we had a ball. The pool table and fire place are great touches, highly recommended!
The host canceled this reservation 68 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We loved staying here!  The house is so big, and all the spaces are really comfy - we loved the pool table.  It was really easy to get to, and our host was easy to deal with the whole time.  Thanks again for our stay!
Spacious and clean and comfortable and close to wineries and faclilties. An enjoyable stay.
Very clean and comfortable.
Great property! Spacious and modern with lovely facilities. Loved the pool table.
Great place with lots of space
Great place to stay, and a great location. Communication great. Done very well.

Thank you Monica; your house was the perfect get away for a girls weekend. The location was central and very easy to find. The home was very comfortable and suited our needs perfectly. Large entertaining areas to sit and relax with ample bedrooms and bathrooms.
It was just what we were after!
Unfortunately I had issues with the host after there was a miss-communication on their side. Nice house and good location, however the abusive messages from the hosts ruined our stay.

Spent our wedding night at this beautiful house. It is in a perfect location to access Tanunda town and the rest of the Barossa. This house is massive and is styled really well. Would recommend and would definitely stay again.
Loved it! Great location and lovely touches throughout the house.
Beautiful house located near the town center. Immaculately presented.
We had a girls weekend away in the Barossa and loved staying in this beautiful house. Fantastic location walking distance to the Main Street. Would definitely recommend and we’ll stay again!
Great location, large immaculately presented house with modern appliances
A fab house in a perfect location.
Stunning home with fantastic amenities! Perfect base to discover the Barossa!

The place was fantastic! The perfect location and so much space! Only minutes from some great wineries, restaurants and breweries.

Fantastic amenities and a really well stocked kitchen. I’d recommend staying here to anyone!
Perfectly located, pool was wonderful, spacious kitchen. Perfect for 2 families!!

This place is amazing! So central and comfortable. Our group of 5 girls were extremely happy with the house. And the communication and assistance with booking wine tours whilst in Tanunda was exceptional. Highly recommend the Highlights tour, we had a fantastic time.
The house was beautiful and clean, with just about everything we needed to create a home away from home. Shops, cafes and restaurants only minutes walk but the kitchen was also very well equipped to enable us to enjoy meals at home also.
The outdoor area near the pool was perfect for us to gather and enjoy a few bubbles, board games and laughs.
We would absolutely stay again.

Beautifully redecorated and very well appointed large house just a 100m walk from the centre of town in Tanunda. Fabulous modern facilities including a new Sony 4K TV with Netflix which was great. New appliances in the kitchen and a lovely pool. Had a terrific stay it’s so central we will be back
a traditional home in great location- walk to your morning coffee.
Great house in an amazing location. So close to all the wineries that we wanted to visit. Everything we needed was in the house. Thanks for a great weekend!
Great house. Spacious king bedrooms.
Lovely kitchen, five extremely comfortable bedrooms all sparkling clean and a great location in Tanunda.
Beautiful house in the heart of Tanunda. Kitchen had everything we required to cook and was a very short walk into town.
Great location. Comfy rooms.

Wonderful location and spotless. So close to all places in Tanunda and a really perfect location for a girls getaway, wine and food Barossa trip.
Note that both showers are in step in baths, if that is difficult and one is just hand held. Not a problem for us, but worth knowing. Great water pressure and lots of wonderful clean white towels.
Very comfortable beds.
Pretty garden, easy communication. Thumbs up!

This charming house is in the perfect location to immerse yourself in Tanunda. Very clean,  large,  great feel. Comfy beds, clean fluffy towels and the best shower ever! Enough spaces for a larger group to spread out and also areas to do things together. Excellent choice for time in Tanunda and Barossa
Beautiful home equipped with everything you can think of, perfect location for wineries.
Wonderful location and beautiful home
A perfectly clean beautiful home for our group of eight. Easy access to the Main Street yet quiet and private. 15 minutes drive to plenty of wineries and restaurants to enjoy the region.

We recently had a wonderful five days staying at Ambrosia for a girls getaway. We all throughly enjoyed the house, the pretty garden and the fabulous location to the main street. We really appreciated the five generous bedrooms and the comfortable beds. The kitchen was well set up for our cooking needs,  with plenty of cooking pans and serving dishes. We used the big metal trays for our charcuterie plates , which were perfect. Thank you for a great stay!
Lovely home in a fantastic location - so close to the main street of Tanunda
Perfect location for Tanunda. Clean and tidy, a lovely place to stay.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and both Tuoi and her beautiful property were exceptionally welcoming.  Villa Maria was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  An extra highlight to our weekend was an evening meal at FermentAsian that was superb.

Toui's house is beautifully renovated with all the modern features. The rooms are lovely and each has it's own ensuite. The kitchen is great and gets the morning sun. It is a short walk to shops and restaurants and location is great to visit lots of the wineries. We loved our stay there and would definitely come back.

Thank you SO much Tuoi.  We absolutely LOVED your home and the stay was 10 out of 10 (or more!).  We highly recommend your place to anyone.  You have thought of everything and it is the height of luxury in the perfect Barossa location... so close to all fabulous restaurants and amenities.  Your home is truely beautiful.
Beautiful stylish space, great location and amazing hospitality
Thanks Tuoi for the short getaway from the farm!  A very relaxing beautiful house and garden in one of Tanunda best areas! Perfect location for those touring the Barossa and Dining around Tanunda!

Tuoi’s home is really, really comfortable
Lovely spaces and very clean
The old shade trees in the back garden are wonderful
Thanks

Extremely happy with the villa and service. Everything has been thought of, from amenities to breakfast in the fridge... Loved the central speakers and Spotify/iPad set up in the kitchen. Walking distance from main st of Tanunda. Will definitely be coming back!
The Villa Maria is an absolute delight. Thank you Tuoi! The decor, appliances, garden, bathrooms and beautiful linen all make for a stunning stay in the beautiful Barossa.

In the middle of a cold winter, the underfloor heating in the bathroom was just divine! The place is so clean and perfect, either for a couple like us, a family or a group of friends to share. It was quiet, toasty and comfortable. Perfect!
Thanks Tuoi. You are a wonderful host.
Beautiful property. Couldn’t fault it. We had a lovely stay with our family. Thanks Tuoi.
A beautiful property! We had a brilliant stay. Thank you.
Great accommodation,  location , every detail thought of

This is a really beautiful property in every aspect. Huge rooms and an ensuite for everyone! Great kitchen to cook and mingle and walking distance to everything. Would highly reccommend this stunning property.

Tuoi’s house is exceptional in every way,  full of character, thoughtfully renovated and refurbished with beautiful quality furniture and decor.  This is a home away from home that you won’t want to leave!
Its a great place one must go to. Very spacious and the structure/house it self is a wonderful place. The kids loved it.

Nine mates and I stayed in the house in the house which is a grand old place and had a nice weekend but thought we had the house to ourselves. We were disappointed we weren’t made aware the house is sold off in sections like hotel rooms with tiny kitchens and fridges in bedrooms and that we were sharing the house with other guests with only a locked door between us so at night had to be quiet and respectful to the other people staying there which wasn’t easy with 10 of us. There are units at the back of the house also and all had access to the pool which at times made it difficult for all of us to go for a swim as there was a limit of 10 people in the pool area at one time.
As we were taking away a friend who is terminal and we wanted to give him a great weekend with a lot of drinking and laughs but we were restricted in what we could do.
Kym as a host was polite and responded to all correspondence in a speedy manner.
David

Correspondence with this host that became an extremely horrible experience with her and Airbnb. I will not be booking again through Airbnb so I’m not concerned with a potential nasty review from this host. I do not typically leave reviews unless I have something positive to say, but here it is....

There have been a few issues since we arrived and it is rather disappointing given the price we are paying and how this property has been advertised.

- Booking suggests that we have booked the entire house, not that there are multiple shared facilities with the apartments that are located on the same property directly behind the house.

- rowdy guests from apartments making inappropriate comments when we arrived. Then hogging the pool area being really loud, rowdy and putting us off going to the pool as their behaviour is quite disruptive and a bit intimidating.

- Random people from the apartments coming over onto the verandah and putting their empty bottles into the bins while we are sitting / chatting - no privacy or peace and quiet.

- Naked / screaming children were running through the back of the house / verandah area - no privacy or peace and quiet.

- apartment guests having a family reunion/ party for someone’s 30th - no privacy or peace and quiet and as there is a “no party policy” this is not in keeping with that policy.

- Secure the dishwasher - it tips over when you are loading the dishes and the drawers tip out onto the floor injuring someone’s foot. This complaint was also on a 2018 TripAdvisor review but still continues.

- our booking says ‘entire house’ and we will have the entire home to ourselves. Yet another person showed up after the first 24 hours to stay in “the Ruby Suite”. This is not accurately represented in our booking.

- host said she would get back to us, but didn’t- this meant we were outside the Airbnb 24 hour window for resolution/ refund.

- host refused a refund and despite multiple other reviews on TripAdvisor and Airbnb voicing similar issues (only found these after our issues as they are hidden amongst glowing reviews for the apartments) there remains a complete lack of transparency in there advertising.

- This host is exploiting every possible Airbnb loophole and getting away with it in a recurring manner.
A nice place to stay!

Crystal’s home was absolutely lovely! The house was clean, tidy, cosy and inviting. It was close to everything we needed and wanted to see in the Barossa.

Crystal went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The fridge was stocked with ingredients to make breakfast, and Crystal even dropped off a coffee machine to us the day we arrived, after it was replaced. The fire was set up ready to light as soon as we arrived.

My correspondence with Crystal before and during our stay was always friendly, polite & prompt.
Lovely house, great location, great host. Thanks Crystal.

A lovely clean house, close to everything for a Barossa get away. Great for a group of family and friends to relax and spend time together as well. Some lovely touches by the host were very much appreciated. I would stay again

Very neat property only moments into the Main Street. The host had the wood burning fire place lit well before we arrived so the home was already warm upon arrival. The breakfast and coffee provisions were also a pleasant suprise with ingredients for coffee and ham and cheese croissants. We also appreciated that the home had Netflix.
Great stay!
Crystal’s home was lovely and very spacious. Thank you for having us
A lovely quiet and cosy place to stay. A short distance to some superb Cafés and restaurants. 10/10 for cleanliness!

Loved staying at Crystal’s house. The location, bedrooms, cleanliness, atmosphere & my favourite the open log fire. The place was that warm and inviting that I almost didn’t want to explore The Barossa Valley as I was so completely content with where I was. Will definitely be staying there again.

Crystal’s place was very clean, well set out and equipped. Very comfortable for two couples. It was a thoughtful touch having the log fire set for us when we got home in the late afternoon, and it was very effective in warming the place up and keeping it warm. Crystal was a great communicator right through the process including excellent tip for dinner venue and quick and clear response to all questions.

I stayed at Crystals place with some girlfriends during the Gourmet Weekend.  Crystal was absolutely fantastic, she communicated with me from booking right up until the day of arrival, she had the fire going for us when we arrived, a bottle of wine and nibbles in the fridge - it was a great welcome.  The house was clean, neat and modern, it had everything we needed - including a great coffee machine! we were very comfortable.  Great location too, close to everything we needed.  I highly recommend staying at Crystals place when visiting the Barossa.
This is a very nice, well equipped home in a safe, quiet neighborhood. Great location for exploring the Barossa Valley. Crystal is a terrific host, quick with responses, warm and welcoming. 5-star!

A lovely house for a group of friends looking to get away in the Barossa.

Crystal was great to deal with, and included a number of little extra touches which really made the stay for us!
Great stay. Had everything you could need. Loved the fireplace.

The whole house was lovely. The bedrooms were so beautifully made and were very clean, almost like we were in a hotel! Big spacious backyard space. It was our home away from home. Will definitely be back.
Excellent host
Crystal's place was perfect for a large group.  She was a thoughtful host,  and the place was very clean and cozy! Awesome backyard too!
Very spacious home kept in very good shape. Be sure to ask Crystal for local tips as she knows her stuff.
Sitting by the fire listening to the sound of the frogs nearby with a glass of wine or cup of tea at the end of the day was a delight. Superb hospitality and local tips were welcome.

We stayed at Crystal's place overnight and it had everything we needed and more. The house is well appointed, sparkling clean, and the king size bed ensured a fabulous nights sleep. We loved how quiet it was there and it would be a perfect place to stay if you are planning on exploring the Barrossa Valley. Crystal was extremely helpful and accommodating and we appreciated her booking us in at short notice.

Crystals place was great, very cozy and nice and peaceful.
Crystal was an amazing host with fast communication if I ever needed.
Will definitely stay again sometime soon 😊

Excellent stay was exactly what we needed after camping for a few days. Lots of space to store car and camping gear undercover. Great for the kids and had everything we needed. Outdoor area and deck was great and location is close driving distance to all the Barossa attractions.

Almost wish it was colder during our stay so we could have used the outdoor pot belly.

Crystal was very accommodating and responded quickly, would definitely stay again, thanks!
Great, clean home

Nice and clean and in a great location.

Will be back
Great place to stay, super clean with nice little touches, great location

If you’re planning a trip to the Barossa, this bnb can be the perfect spot to relax after a day driving around the beautiful area. The fireplace is great and will warm up the whole house.

For those unfamiliar with the area, be prepared to drive to other towns to visit wineries (this is typical of anywhere you stay).

Check in was a breeze and Crystal was highly responsive to messages. Highly recommend staying here, and it would be suitable for large groups too.
Crystal is a professional and a worthy super Host
A great back yard and deck, super warm fire and very comfortable bed.  Great food options.  Very lovely place.

Crystals' house is a modern, well-equipped property in a quiet cul-de-sac in Lyndoch.  The kitchen is functional with adequate supplies.  The location provides great access to the Heysen Trail in the Barossa region, and is also close to some great wineries.  The 'Table Cafe' in lyndoch is well worth a visit for brunch, and 'Kellermeister' is great for an indulgent platter for lunch.  Highly recommended.
Place was lovely and clean and the fireplace was amazing!

Crystal was an amazing host!
I threw my best friends bridal shower at her property and crystal was more than accommodating allowing me to come set up decorations early before lunch which made the whole day go so much smoother.
Everyone was so happy with the entire house.
It was the perfect night away.
A cosy  comfortable home . Convenient access to all towns in Barossa.

Thank you Crystal,
The house is a lovely quiet area of Lyndoch, with a lovely back yard area to bbq and relax.
Comfortable beds and appreciated the little extras like breakfast provisions and the bottle of wine.
Would definately be happy to stay again
We had a wonderful stay at Crystals. The place was just as pictured. Communication was great and will eagerly recommend if you’re visiting the Barossa
Beautiful place, wonderful hosts. An epic place. You must stay here
The house is the perfect space for 2 couples to enjoy without falling over each other. Very relaxing and enjoyable!
Great spacious house. A very relaxing stay.

Gorgeous house, great location and beautiful touches from the host. Spacious and clean, this house was perfect for a short getaway to the Barossa and had everything you could need. Internet, Netflix and cereal / milk were extra thoughtful touches we were not expecting but appreciated. Comfortable beds and tidy rooms, you wouldn’t be disappointed staying here!
Lovely space. Easy access and everything was just as advertised. Clean with everything we needed to make it a very comfortable stay.

Highly recommend this property, it’s spacous, has a great backyard and all the amenities you could need.
The personal touches were especially welcoming. Crystal also gave us local tips and shared her driver’s details with us, which was very much appreciated.
A well equipped clean and comfortable house to stay close to town. Thanks Crystal.

Crystal's place in Lyndoch is a perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The house is kept very updated, impeccably clean, with an appealing big backyard  to spend some time in with a glass of wine in hand. Really appreciated the  little touches like extra conditioner, milk and cereal. We only spent a night and definitely will come back for a longer stay if there is an opportunity!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Crystal’s  & esp the aircon in the 44 degree heatwave. Spacious & clean with thoughtful extras like Netflix, toiletries, cooking condiments. Even a bottle of wine, orange juice & cake. Thank you! The Pictionary & Jenga came in handy too! Crystal is a very kind host. Communication was super quick & clear. Highly recommend.
A very spacious, clean and well equipped house. The location is perfect for a stay in the Barossa.

Nicely located in a quiet area, close to all the wineries in the Barossa.
Lots of welcoming touch from the host.. super clean, Nice BBQ area.
Really happy with our stay
Clean and tidy house with a nice back yard for our dog to run about. Very close to nice winery's.
Nice yard for our dog!
Loved staying, was beautiful and homey. Super comfy beds to was out light a light.

Great place to stay for a family or just a couple. Nice back yard with decking and outdoor setting. Fireplace was great and unexpectedly used it on a summer night.
Crystal left some breakfast food and drink as well as coffee pods and soy milk which was great to have. Thanks again crystal was a lovely place

We had an awesome stay! The house was beautiful - clean, spacious, had everything we needed, we were even spoiled by breakfast items and a bottle of wine! Couldn’t recommend highly enough and will definitely be back!

Crystal's place is a great base to explore the Barossa. Whilst we were only there overnight for a wedding, Crystal was able to help with our transport and arrange a smooth check in for us. Very much appreciated! The place is great for a group or family and has everything you need to feel at home. If only we were to have stayed longer! Thanks again Crystal!
Clean, comfortable, great accommodation. Has everything you need and more!!
Great house in a wonderful location

Amazing house. So spacious. And was great to relax just geting married and spending a week there for our mini moon.
Used the bbq nearly ever night. Was great.
Our pugs loved it too. Highly recommed.
