The hosts were wonderful, check in was simple, facilities were beyond our expectations and we were spoilt with treats from the hosts. Highly recommend. Don't think twice about booking this one.
Happy to recommend this beautifully restored cottage, only a short walk to Tanunda's shops and cafes. We hope to be back to enjoy it again.  Mark and Tanya were wonderful and considerate hosts.
We enjoyed our stay and loved the extra items that were stocked for us  but as we stayed during a very cold wet time we found the air conditioner a bit inadequate to warm the entire cottage .
Great location and hospitality! Great selection of games to play while hanging out. Would recommend for anyone looking to be close to the Main Street!
Excellent location for exploring the Barossa. very spacious. Attention to detail with the style and error was amazing. Very lovely place to stay

lovely cottage
walked to dinner every night
great eateries and close to lots of wineries
Absolutely beautiful stay, easy style and fantastic location- will be back
Cottage is beautiful! Clean and perfect location. You will be spoilt by Mark and Tanya with on arrival goodies.
Great central location, good communication and the complimentary gift hamper on arrival was a very thoughtful touch! Loved our stay, would highly recommend!
Absolutely loved our stay here! The location was so central and the cottage was very spacious for 3. The welcome hamper was a lovely touch! We will definitely be staying here again

Let's start with the pro's: incredible location, you can walk to restaurants, wine bars, even a cellar is within walking distance. The beds are wonderful, SO comfortable. The owners are abundantly generous in what they leave you in terms on snacks and drinks-you would never find this elsewhere! Brilliant value for money.

Cons- the caretaker lives next door, my mum and I were returning home and she opened the door at the adjacent apartment and watched us every time we arrived and left the property. It made us feel SO uncomfortable, like we were being stalked (it was truly horrid) and made us feel a bit unsafe. At one point she asked us if we were okay.....code for be quiet at 9pm on a Friday evening. Realistically how loud could a 37 year old and 55 year old professional women be? utterly ridiculous!

The layout of the property is highly unusual. You can't access the front door without going through somebody's bedroom. It is rather awkward. There is only heating in the front lounge area. The back bedroom and kitchen area is heated by a small transportable heater. It would be particularly hard to keep warm in winter.

Please note, no Wi-Fi, Netflix, and the host has only a very small outdated TV, that said, who spends time at home in the barossa?

This property would suit a mature couple, ready to explore the wine region, spending minimal time in the property.
Conveniently located and well provisioned historical cottage

A wonderful little cottage with some lovely decor and touches, giving it an old world feel. We also appreciated the generous snacks and bottle of champagne on arrival, and in vicinity of all the wonderful vineyards in the Barossa. The cottage is also a short walking distance from all the pubs and beautiful shops that Tanunda has to offer. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again!

Tanya and Mark have a lovely cottage and i'd highly recommend to stay at the cottage if you are visiting Tanunda. The house has been thoughtfully decorated and each item on display is a time piece sharing a story. The house was well stocked up with supplies and made our stay a delightful experience.
The cottage is on the main street and is walking distance to restaurants, bars and cafe's. Ample parking and nothing to worry.
One call out, the house has only one Aircon and is in the first living; rest of the house gets really hot if the temperatures are soaring beyond 30 degrees.

As I walked in on a hot day, the air con was already on and music was playing on the retro radio. Loved everything about this place - could not have asked for more, from the yummy breakfast provisions, wine,cookies.... to the super comfortable bed and amazing shower. Even the outhouse toilet was luxurious. Everything was truly perfect - and I’m very fussy! I loved it so much I extended an extra 2 nights and lucky for me it was available - hope to be back one day

Angaston is a beautiful town in the Barossa Valley. We thought the accommodation was amazing and the little touches made
it feel like a home away from home. All credit goes to Sue and Mike for making us feel very welcome...we cant recommend
The Rusty Olive enough!

The Rusty Olive has been lovingly restored and is beautifully presented. It is spotlessly clean and has everything you need for a very comfortable stay.
We wish we had booked for longer and we would definitely stay again.
We had an excllent stay at The Rusty Olive! Everything was very comfortable and the breakfast (and wine) was great! Would definitely stay here again if visiting the Barossa.

We cannot fault anything about Sue & Mike’s place. Everything was perfect! The little touches were amazing. It was in a fantastic location and was the most amazing cute little romantic airbnb. Seriously recommend!!!
It was very cute and enjoyed the stay. Thoughtful additions and Sue and Mike's communicated well. Girlfriend loved the claw foot bathtub. Would happily stay there again.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rusty Olive - such a gorgeous venue! Sue and Mike added so many personal touches that made our stay extra special! Thank you
The house is absolutely gorgeous. Perfect for a romantic getaway.
Best Airbnb we’ve ever stayed in with so many personal touches
Wonderful stay, beautiful town and close to everything in the Barossa Valley as well walking distance to the local shops .
A thoroughly updated old cottage in a quiet little town; great access to the Barossa and Eden Valley without the hustle and bustle that frequently afflicts popular wine regions. Highly recommended!

This cottage is everything you could was from a Barossa BnB. Rustic and charming, yet incredibly clean and with all of the mod cons you would expect.

Every detail has been considered and this attention to detail and comfort did not go unnoticed.

Highly recommend.

As soon as you drive into the drive of this unique cottage you will be in awe. Not only will you be stepping into a past era with the style of the home but it has been brought back lovingly into today with the practical ammenities we’ve become used to. A huge comfy king size bed, beautiful linen to match the era of the home, stylish kitchen and the bathroom is amazing.  This property is immaculately presented and the homeliness is immediately felt. Well done Sue and Mike in the lovingly restoration of “the rusty olive”.
A very cosy cottage with all the amenities and more. Would definitely stay again!

The Rusty Olive is a charmingly restored stone cottage, beautifully decorated. The attention to detail and added special touches would put some 5 star hotels to shame. The cottage is exactly like it is in the pictures and absolutely spotlessly clean. Communication with Sue & Mike was prompt and straightforward.  Check in was easy. The Rusty Olive’s location  (on a quiet street – no road noise) is ideal as a base from which to explore the Barossa Valley. It is excellent value for money and I would recommend it to anyone travelling to the Barossa for a weekend away.

The Rusty Olive was absolutely beyond perfection. The attention to detail made it a divine, luxurious stay from the bathbombs and bedside chocolates to the Nespresso coffee machine and local condiments..... everything was of the highest quality and made our week long stay all the more comfortable and enjoyable.
The convenient location made it perfect for exploring the Barossa’s many, MANY Cellar Doors, as well as the Farmers Market, burning vines and other wonderful offerings this region has.
Sue and Mike are wonderful hosts who made our stay so memorable and the whole airbnb process so easy. Their hints, tips and information guide were heartily used and guided our activities and adventures.
We would definitely stay at The Rusty Olive again and again and again. Book this accomodation, you really will not be disappointed.

The Rusty Olive is the perfect base for a quintessential Barossa experience. It’s such an intimate and cosy space, lovingly restored by Sue and Mike. The thoughtful touches make it feel like a home away from home and we will definitely be back!
Incredibly cosy, warm, stylish and welcoming, this place is great value for money. Really a step above, with lots of little touches throughout the house that made for beautiful surprises.
Wonderful stay. The house is great and beautifully styled. My partner and I didn’t want to leave. Comfy bed and everything you needed for an easy stay. Would love to stay here again
Excellent little cottage, everything was neat and clean. Looking forward to staying again.
Clean, cosy and stylish cottage! It was all we expected and more. Big thanks to Sue and Mike for their hospitality and attention to detail!
Excellent, well renovated cottage. Close to shops, but away from traffic. Amenities were fabulous. Comfortable bed, excellent bathroom! Enjoyed our stay, along with the person touches.
Amazing place to stay and drink some wine!
We really loved this little cottage. So many thoughtful little touches, we couldn’t have asked for more. We hope to be able to get back again
This place is much better than what it looks like in the pictures. We loved it so much, that this  has now occupied a joint No 1 position among our airbnb stays.

The Rusty Olive is a very thoughtfully restored cottage, with many great touches and wonderful workmanship. It is very comfortable, with everything you need and is in a great location - only 5 minutes walk to the shops in Angaston.
A very stylish cottage, great location near the shops. Plenty of information about the Barossa provided for guests.
Thanks so much, what a great stay, lovely place and oh so relaxing!

The Rusty Olive has been beautifully restored and was a great base from which to explore the Barossa, with Angaston winning our vote for nicest village in the district!
The king size bed was luxurious and the waterfall shower brilliant!! Heaps of other thoughtful touches made our stay - we very much hope to return!
Amazing home to discover the Barossa from. Stylish and welcoming.

This bnb is absolutely stunning. You can really see how much thought and care that has been put into this home. It has such a homely feel but with all the modern, and glamorous touches. We will definitely be recommending to others.
Just beautiful!!

If we could give this Airbnb 6 stars we would! The most comfortable bed we have ever slept on and an amazing shower. So much thought and care had gone into this perfect little cottage from the breakfast spread to the bath tub.. loved it!
Simply the best. Everything you could think of has been thought of. 5 stars and beyond. Book this space.
Everything was outstanding about the Rusty Olive, would definitely recommend it to others!

Sue and Mikes place is a stylish cottage in the middle of wine country.  They provided breakfast supplies, chocolates and wine to make our stay more comfortable.  The place is near restaurants and a grocery store (assuming that you will have a vehicle to tour wineries)
Great location. Lovely accommodation and extra touches.
Had a best time . Perfect spot to experience and have an perfect time in Angaston.

This gem is a perfect base from which to explore the Barossa Valley. The Rusty Olive is well located in Angaston - just a short stroll from the main street - with all the delights of the Barossa just a short drive away.

We could tell the Rusty Olive had been lovingly restored with excellent attention to detail; the whole house felt coherently decorated while at the same time very functional. We found it spacious and immaculately clean with thoughtful extras adding a touch of luxury.

All communication with Sue and Mike was clear and prompt. We would not hesitate to recommend the Rusty Olive as a perfect Barossa home away from home.
Really great heritage house in a brilliant location. Really nice amenities through the house.

We loved our stay at the Rusty Olive. A recently renovated cottage that still retains its old charm also incorporating all the mod cons you’ll need to unsure you have the perfect stay. Very close to the town centre of Angaston and it’s a great base if you decide on exploring the surrounding Barossa Valley!

Very quaint and lovely place.  Town itself was a bit sleepy for us. The Rusty Olive was so nice and comfortable with a lot of thought put into all the details.  Close to other towns and of course wineries. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
This old building  and its garden area have been lovingly refurbished. The location and amenity of this B&B will suit many visitors. It's located close to the Angaston  shops and in a quiet street.
Cheers guys, we really enjoyed our stay ☺️

After a few weeks in Tassie hiking we just wanted to chill for a few days... That’s exactly what we did at the Rusty Olive. This cottage is amazing, with everything you need for a really comfortable stay. Sue and Mike included lots of thoughtful touches like breakfast goodies, leaving the lights on as we arrived late, they even had face wipes and dry shampoo in the bathroom! Was exceptionally equipped. Really close to the Main Street meant we could walk to breakfast or the supermarket and within 15 minutes of all the wineries. Would definitely recommend staying here.
What a great place. So perfect for a couple looking to explore the region and enjoy some luxury. All of the little things were taken care of. One of our favourite ever AirBnB

A beautiful home, full of historical and Barossa charm, but with all the modern convenience of a well appointed luxury hotel. The Rusty Olive is full of treats and trinkets which have been put together with love and make for a warm and inviting space. A short stroll from Angaston and it’s delights, a veranda to enjoy a sundowner glass of Shiraz or morning coffee. Sue and Mike have thought of everything you could need and more, a truly delightful space - very highly recommended and spotless!
Very cozy place, highly recommend
Can’t fault the place, beautiful place in a lovely location
Great location, the place had lots of thoughtful touches. We would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Barossa valley.
Fantastic stay, beautiful property and perfect location for exploring the Barossa
This is an amazing home, with beautiful personal touches that went above and beyond.  I recommend a stay here anytime, and will definitely be going back (soon if I could)!
We really enjoyed our stay..we will be back

Absolutely beautiful place!!
Thank you so much for the effort you have put into this cottage. So much to look at and explore within the place itself Made our weekend cosy and comfortable but with a luxurious touch!
Immaculate cleanliness and generous set up of food and amenities.
Would have loved to have stay longer and make use of the funky kitchen and more of that bath!!!
Would love to come back in warmer weather to enjoy some local walks.
Delicious local pizza from 40s cafe, please continue to encourage guest!
Again thank you thank you!!
Quaint little cottage close to the main street.  Lovely breakfast and personal touches, chocolates and wine and biscuits provided .Lovely big ,soft bed as well.
Sue and Mikes BNB was one of the loveliest I’ve ever stayed in. So many thoughtful touches and fantastic local tips. Would 100% recommend.

This is the most perfectly formed couples Airbnb we have ever stayed in - anywhere!  The little touches like coffee capsules, bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms and eggs in the fridge, easy to follow instructions, a bottle of wine and chocolates, to the classic music playing on arrival.  This is a delightful, well appointed couples retreat.  Easy walk to middle of Angaston, inexpensive taxi's to BV restaurants.

We have just come from back from a fantastic weekend in the Barossa where we used Sue and Mike’s place as our base. The reviews you will read below are true - this is the perfect spot for a getaway and Sue and Mike truly have thought of everything... from breakfast provisions to a bath bomb for the amazing bath. Thanks for having us - we will recommend to our friends and family without hesitation. 😊

We loved the rustic touches outside, and the stylish touches inside. Perfect getaway for a couple. Big comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, and workable kitchen for egg & bacon breakfast. We couldn't ask for any more!
The Rusty Olive might be one of my favourite Airbnb stays ever - every detail was so thoughtfully considered. Highly recommend!

Breathtaking - Sue and Mike had truly thought of everything. From supplying a Netflix account for when you're relaxing with a glass of wine to the herb garden when cooking up dinner. This little cottage is truly a home away from home, you have transformed a little four room cottage into a mini paradise - 10/10 would recommend.
The best air bnb we’ve stayed at to date! Everything was thought through, the place is amazing and the location is perfect for exploring the Barossa.
If youre looking to find a place to stay in the Barossa the Rusty Olive is it! From a couple who book a lot of stays all around

Sue and Mike have transformed an old style four room house into an amazing modern cottage with all the facilities you could ever need for a wonderful stay in Angaston.A very sympathetic makeover with emphasis on the past has made ‘Rusty Olive’ one of our best ever Airbnb experiences.
The position is perfect,one block from the main street with a wonderful garden and outdoor BBQ area.The Clawfoot bath,washing machine,incredible kitchen and the most comfortable king size bed eve (Website hidden by Airbnb) give the place the ‘Wow’ factor.We hope to return one day and have no hesitation in recommending ‘Rusty Olive’ to you.
A really nice place, with lovely touches and great amenities.

We enjoyed bath time, grill time and bed time. The Rusty Olive really is a beautiful place and we appreciated all the extra thoughtful touches ☺️ Tom particularly enjoys rusty farm equipment so he had a whale of a time. A delight in the Barossa, would recommend 🍷
This place is beautiful, from the stylish amenities to the little touches! We had the best stay and would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa!

A beautifully renovated cottage with some of the most thoughtful touches i have seen in an air bnb - a very peaceful and memorable stay! About a 5 minutes walk to all the cafes and restaurants in Angaston - perfect!

This is the place you really need to stay in, if you are in Angaston. 6 stars are probably not enough. You can leave home with your clothes and everything else is provided for you, even things you didn't think you might need. Provisions for breakfast, toiletries, a delightful bath and a lovely bottle of wine were all part of the Sue and Mike standard. We would definitely stay again, hopefully if there is a vacancy. We have stayed in Airbnb's both in Australia and Europe and this one is the best,

A brilliantly rustic cottage, with everything you need to be totally comfy for the weekend.
Comfortable bed, spacious en-suite, great kitchen to cook in sand a cosy lounge.
Great location in Angaston, out of busy area of the Barossa with a great main street to get local produce or a yummy breakfast.
Totally enjoyed our stay.

The rusty olive is one of the most beautiful Airbnbs we’ve stayed in, so tastefully renovated and luxurious. All of the fabulous little touches made it feel like a home away from home. Perfect base for an exploration around the Barossa, would definitely stay again. Thanks Sue and Mike

A perfect little house for couples, it was a cold weekend and the house was so cozy and warm! Lovely breakfast provisions and even chocolates on the bedside tables and cookies from the local bakery. A great quiet location, Angaston is pretty sleepy but that’s why we loved it, and very easy to get around to sample everything the Barossa has to offer. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again!

Spotlessly clean! Even smelt beautiful 😊
Perfect accommodation for a couple wanting to explore the Barossa Valley. Angaston village is a delight and The Rusty Olive meets all expectations!
Such a lovely stay at this gorgeous cottage. Very thoughtful hosts with even the smallest detail taken care of. We will 100% stay again given the opportunity.

The Rusty Olive was a perfect spot for our quick getaway - the cottage is absolutely beautiful and well-appointed. Super warm and cosy even in the middle of winter, and the bathroom is amazing! There were plenty of breakfast supplies provided and the kitchen had enough equipment for us to cook dinner as well. We loved all the extra surprises too, like chocolates and bath bombs! We’ll definitely be back for a stay in future :)
So cosy, warm and comfortable - close to everything and delicious breakfast provisions. We just loved it 😊
Beautifully restored cottage with such thoughtful touches. Bathroom facilities were to die for!
The cottage was a wonderful place to stay in Angaston, very cosy and warm, wish we had a place like this for ourselves to stay in!
Great accommodation, definitely would stay again

A beautiful cottage in a beautiful area. A great spot to explore the region. We loved our stay at the Rusty Olive, with a perfect balance of luxury amenities, whilst maintaining the cozy feel. Sue and Mike are great hosts, and have clearly thought about everything their guests might need during their stay. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Delightful house. Beautifully restored. Bathroom amazing. Great king-sized bed. Access and communication great. And all the little touches - yummy breakfast treats, bottle of wine, lavender sprigs around the house. You won't regret staying in this accommodation.
beautiful cotrage in an awesome spot to get the best of the barossa.

It’s obvious that Sue and Mike’s place has been fitted out with thought, care, love and QUALITY!!
This place has everything you need, and everything in this house is quality - not just random shit from ikea.
The bed is so comfortable, and the bath was amazing. Bath bomb was a nice touch, as was the wine and breakfast provisions. Would love to stay here again - thank you Sue & Mike
I’ve been around 70 years and well travelled. Absolutely best Air bnb I’ve ever stayed at. A mix of the rustic with the modern. They have thought of everything for your stay.

The house was just perfect, so well renovated and the hosts had provided so many little extras that were very much appreciated.  The bed was extremely comfortable, location great, and everything was as advertised.  Congratulations to the hosts on providing a wonderful experience for us.  Couldn't recommend this stay more highly.

The best B&B ever!  We absolutely loved this charming early settlers cottage fitted out with all the mod cons. This cottage has loads of character and has been lovingly restored with attention to detail that way exceeded our expectations. Plus all the thoughtful extras added up to a truly authentic Barossa experience that made for a most memorable stay.

Mike & Sue’s ‘Rusty Olive’ cottage is beautifully restored and presented and a great place to stay. All the little extras provided are thoughtful additions and much appreciated, and will simply enhance your stay - the welcome bottle of wine, breakfast (first day) and all the ‘home’ supplies you could possibly need.
This little Angaston gem is centrally located in the Barossa and only mini away from anywhere you might want to visit.

A gorgeously quaint cottage right in the middle of the vineyards. Sybelle was an excellent host, with quick communication and the home was spotlessly clean. Excellent value for money and a terrific location to use as a base for exploring the Barossa Valley.
Lovely quaint cottage. Very good communications and flexibly with check in times. Total enjoyed the country atmosphere
Great host, everything was super clean and organized! Great time!
Very nice historical house. Quiet location with beautiful scenery. No air conditioner and really hot weather but the fans provided did help.
Little old cottage which is nice and set in between a vineyard
Nice little cottage to stay at, very private location outside of town. Beds were comfy. Host left breakfast supplies in fridge. Everything you need in terms in terms of basics. Good value for money
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The cutest cottage in a picture perfect location

Very suitable location that is close to wineries. house gets cold at night however there are small heaters. Good value for money. Lots of brochures and information available for the Barossa valley. Continental breakfast items supplied.

Sibylle's house is amazing.
Very clean, great amenities and to wake up in the middle of a vineyard is breathtaking.
Highly recommend this place.
Luca and Rosanna

The farmhouse was just as gorgeous as the pictures. It was great to stay outside of town in the peaceful Light Pass. Very close to major towns, and lots to do in the area. Sibylle left great instructions for making the best use of the house. Vineyards in the backyard are very picturesque! We stayed for two nights, but could easily see ourselves living in the area.

As my first AirBnB experience, Petra's House was a fantastic surprise. Surrounded by vineyards and staying in an original 1910 house was a great way to immerse ourselves in the Barossa state of mind. The house was spotless and we got some belated easter eggs as a welcome. If you like wine, and peace & quiet, this is a great option.

This little cottage is very quaint and brought back lots of memories for my husband of his grandma’s house in regional Victoria. It was cold but there were plenty of heaters around the house. The bed was good and the feather doona was adequate overnight. The other facilities - kitchen and bathroom were basic but in keeping with the style of the cottage. It was a good location for our needs and a great stay overall.
We had a great overnight stay in Sibylle's quirky cottage. It was the perfect base for our family of four to explore the Barossa.
Lovely historic cottage in a central location away from the main road, old world charm with comfy beds.  Sybille is a thoughtful host, we didn't meet but would choose to stay again.
Petras house is a beautifully maintained old style house. The beds are wonderfully comfortable and it is set in a peaceful location.

🔷️ cosy, eclectic little home
HOWEVER ..

￭ the inadequate Heating ( fan heater FAILED dismally to heat the rooms with 11'6" ceiling height)
￭ the faulty electrical WIRING.. fuses tripping all the time when using fan Heaters & fuses over-Heating. I got a zap when checking one of the fuses on one occasion.
- fuses are 16Amp so is dangerous to use more than one heater per circuit. This meant that for safety one needed to turn off the 12Amp fan heater if using toaster or jug. It was also dangerous to try to use a fan heater in kitchen & Lounge at the same time (24A LOAD against 16A fuse). The expectation to manipulate appliances to avoid tripping the fuses was LESS than satisfactory.
🔴This house in its current state is unsatisfactory for RENTAL purposes. Additionally there is INADEQUATE / LACK OF heating or cooling ( not even a ceiling fan).
￭ No thermal bedding even though the booking was was in mid-winter.
￭ Crockery & Cutlery appeared to have been OpShop leftovers & was NOT up to standard .. some items are chipped (hygiene issue). Only 3 plates so had to eat in shifts.
￭ Cooking utensils are old & need replacing .. hygiene issue
￭ HWS was inadequate for 4 adults
￭ Washing machine was NOT working.
￭ No axe provided to cut firewood to length ... had to resort to brute strength to break it up
￭ No broom/ mop provided in case we needed to clean up ?
￭ Only ONE key provided even though it was clear that 2 couples would be using the house.

A lovely house with period correct finishings, bringing back memories of the golden ages of yesteryears.

Sibylle was easy to communicate with, check in was easy, and some breakfast food and drinks were provided, which is a very nice touch!

If you do visit in winter however, bring extra thick indoor clothing along as the place is cold; there are only two small heaters.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this gorgeous, quaint country house. It was in a fantastic location to explore and enjoy the Barossa Valley, and we especially loved the peace and quiet it offered. We sincerely appreciated the little touches, such as the provided breakfast. Thank you for a cosy, clean, and comfortable retreat!

A quaint house set in the vineyards - a true South Australian representation of yesteryear, with interesting little treasures and nick knacks.
Nice personal hand written notes about where items are located in the house, how the taps work etc.
We stayed mid-winter and the place was FREEZING. There are 2 small electric heaters which, together, heat a single room. We wore coats and wrapped in blankets to keep warm.
Great little spot, very cosy and super quiet. Check in couldn't have been easier. Would recommend

Great location !!!
Loved our stay here - located within a short distance from some of the local wineries. Really appreciated the breakfast options provided.
We came in winter so be sure to rug up! Would recommend to others 😊

What amazing quirky place in a fantastic location. The house was really cool, plenty of room, perfect for 4 people. Lotsog thoughtful touches and in a beautiful setting. Beds were crazy crazy comfortable.
The house was in a beautiful area, very convenient, and I love the history of the house that was around. It was very clean and all communication was quick and clear
Great place to stay, terrific house and host.
Cosy, clean and a stones throw from all the Barossa has to offer
This is a lovely character cottage best visited in the warmer months but it did have the most comfortable and cosy bed I have slept in ever!
Quaint cottage feel in quiet area near vineyards - definitely a "Barossa" feel about it. Thoroughly enjoyed it and thoughtful touches by the hostess. Good air-conditioning system as well.
Clean, spacious and great heating in an old cottage which was perfect for a relaxing night away.
A quaint & clean place to stay.  Comfortable beds.  Airconditioning was great to have (previous reviews said heating was an issue but we had no troubles at all) & breakfast was well catered for.

Petra’s house was cosy and well placed to visit all areas in the Barossa. Very generous with breakfast foods. Having Willows Wines next door was an added bonus . We would highly recommend staying there.
Debi and Darren.

The house has character & love and is comfortable throughout. Loved that it was spotlessly clean. Ample light switches and beautiful, peaceful surrounding grounds that the house stands on. A pure pleasure of serenity to enjoy. Sibylle's extra touches with the food provided for breakfast was much appreciated and enjoyed. We could have easily stayed for a week not just overnight!

You can expect a lovely home with many comfort creatures.  It is an original older property which is one of the many highlights of the property.  It is set in a relaxed rural community right in the Barossa. Access to explore the many vineyards is right at the door step. A most enjoyable place to stay.
This place has a warmth and charm only experienced once arrived. Great cottage and stay with excellent extra special touches.
Had a great time and so peaceful in a lovely location.

Lovely little place. Beautifully maintained and pleasantly furnished with lots of thoughtful touches. We loved our night here - it was the perfect homey environment to return to after a wine-soaked afternoon in the Barossa. Would highly recommend!!
We had a lovely stay at Petra’s. The beds were super comfy, shower nice and hot and the place was very clean. Sibylle made it all very easy.
Great place to stay close to the wineries.
The house is very roomy, old-fashioned, Australian Colonial style and situated  in a very peaceful area next door to some amazing wineries (Willows & Gibsons).

Fantastic authentic home. The days we were fortunate enough to stay were in excess of 45 degrees but due to a modern ducted air conditioning we were very comfortable. Beautiful setting and very close to so many wineries. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay😍😍
Lovely historic house surrounded by vines, very pretty.  Air-con works a treat on super hot days (we were there when over 40).
Such an amazing old house! It is beautiful, and the surrounding area is really quiet and relaxing while still being close to all the Barossa has to offer. Sibylle was a great host.

We were satisfied with Petras place. The location great for local wineries & to sit on the front porch. The beds were average & boiling your own rainwater was recommended but otherwise it was a lovely stay and great value.
Beautiful surrounds and amazing hospitality from Sibylle! Complimentary bottle of Riesling from neighbouring winery went down a treat on the cottage verandah.
Very accurate and effective communication, we enjoyed the environment and also the beautiful bottle of wine that was left for us. We will definitely come back and enjoy the space.
Great place.  Clean.  Very central.  Can stay 1 night.  Lovely character home in the vineyards.  Enjoyed sitting on the verandah having a glass of wine.

This place is special.Set amongst the vines with a great view from the front porch. It is like stepping back in time while still being very clean and comfortable. The breakfast provisions were generous and much appreciated.Highly recommended.
Lovely character home and brilliant location if your after a secluded rural spot that’s close to everything in the Barossa.

This is such a great place to stay in the Barossa. There is so much character to the house, and we found it comfortable and warm even in the middle of winter. Excellent location, very peaceful but still close to wineries, a wonderful place to relax.
Cute and cosy cottage in a quiet location. Great spot for exploring wineries
A lovely warm, cosy and charming place to stay surrounded by vineyards
An authentic cottage.  In all honesty though would not choose to stay there again
Sparkling clean, historic cottage in beautiful vineyard surroundings. Has everything you need and more. We had a wonderful stay and would love to come back

(+) Spacious, well furnished, complimentary bottle of wine.
(-) Sound of traffic on the main road outside - front rooms only.
It is a beautiful heritage cottage, which many original features. It is more spacious that we expected and the complimentary breakfast is a wonderful touch.
Great host, thoughtful and welcoming. A lovely bed and place to stay.

Very lovely house with two bedrooms, lounge and kitchen.
Surrounded by vineyards and close to town as well as Wolf Blass Winery.

No wifi but good 4G reception when creating a mobile hotspot.

Highly recommended!

A beautiful, charming old house. Very clean and comfortable with thoughtful touches such as breakfast goods. Not for those who like “modern amenities “ but fabulous for those that love periodic charm.
Beautiful, cosy and rustic house which takes you 100 years back in time - in a pleasant way! We celebrated Christmas evening at this location and it was absolutely perfect.
A great retro house but with all the facilities - a good place to stay for some peace and quiet after a big day at the wineries

Beautiful old house and a great location. So close to most of the cellar doors in Barossa! By far the best cellar door is literally around the corner at Gibson wines- best reds and a must do if you love wine.
Sibylle was easy to communicate with and house was spotless clean and perfect. Thanks again and we will be back🍷
Had a wonderful stay at Petras Place. The location and cottage was lovely

Great house with amazing antiques and old fashioned charm. The beds were extra comfy and the breakfast goods left were great. An extra special touch was the fabulous German bread. What a treat.
The bathroom had scads of really hot water, which was welcome.
A great place for the four of us to stay.
A lovely house and location, with top notch hospitality.
A little cottage about 15-20 min out of Tanunda. Clean and tidy, has old school character. Easy to find and owner was responsive to messages

Beautiful cottage, away from the hustle and bustle of town and nestled right amongst the vineyard. The cottage had everything we needed, and the little notes around it answered every question we might have had. The breakfast provided was tasty and had so much variety. If you’re after somewhere relaxing and quiet then this is the space for you.
staying at this house was my first experience on Airbnb. the house was lovely and there was even free breakfast. Thank you.
Sibylle's place is in an excellent location and is surrounded by beautiful vineyards. It is well equipped and excellent value.
Clean and tidy, nice period cottage in good location.
Fantastic spot in the heart of the Barossa valley. Easy going host and lots of character to the place.
Lovely little cottage!

A gorgeous little cottage, easy to get to and nice and close to Nuriootpa and Angaston. Check in with easy and hassle-free with Sibylle being prompt with her communication and explaining everything clearly. She was so thoughtful with all the goodies left out for breakfast for us, and provided more than enough linen, towels and blankets. Although it was a very cold night, the heater did the trick very nicely! Definitely would stay again!

Very attentive hostess and looked after us well.
Quaint 1900’s cottage with a very modern efficient heating system. Lovely large rooms and a tranquil rural environment. Very peaceful.

A lovely place to stay! Clean, tidy, warm, quiet and welcoming.
Great sense of space, looking out over the vines!

Great original cottage, close to everything and very welcoming and comfortable after a day in the Barossa. Excellent beds, excellent shower.  Northern verandah a beautiful afternoon spot for a cuppa. Will stay again.

Thank you so much for sharing this beautiful place with us. Plenty of breakfast supplies. Awesome peaceful location in the Barossa Valley, close to everything you need but not in the hustle and bustle. We got a local massage therapist to come to use, house was nice and warm and beds were cosy. Highly recommend.

Petras House was an amazing, authentic base to explore the Barossa. The house has so much character and charm with its period features, nestled next to some beautiful vineyards. The house itself was clean, and the central heating worked perfectly for the cold winter nights. Host was helpful and communicative. A picturesque experience - like stepping back in time.

A beautiful piece of history among the vineyards of the Barossa but with the comfort of central heating. We found a well equipped kitchen and a lovely welcome pack of walnuts from the garden’s orchid, fresh local bred, milk, jus and jams. The trip to the nearest local town is a 5 minute car drive and the awesome family run Willows winery is right next door.  I highly recommend a stay at Petra’s house.
Beautiful quaint cottage house. Excellent hospitality from Sybil with personal touches for our stay. Loved it
Great place, clean and easy to check in/out

Overpriced and underwhelmed
We were expecting a quaint cottage experience but this wasn’t it.
We chose Petras Place due to its location. The cottage was the exact replica of my grandparent's house that they left over 40 years ago. Unfortunately, it looked like my grandparents had just walked out the door and left it as is.
Firstly we booked the entire house, as it was advertised on Airbnb. There were only two of us but we require separate beds as one of us snores. The second bed was not made up and there was no linen for us to make it up.
The fit-out of the cottage was such that it looked like the linen, bath towels, crockery and cutlery was the collection your Mum put together for you when you first left home, old and poor quality. It was also very interestingly decorated with torn-off pictures from calendars stuck around the place.
The house was freezing cold and while there was a heater/cooler system (not central heating as noted by the host) it only serviced the four main rooms. It was also set to a 4-hour cycle so it turned off in the middle of the night in a very cold Barossa winter.
The laundry and bathroom areas were frigidly cold, not helped by the cement floors and the heating didn’t extend to these areas.
The lounge, in the only reception area, was old and lumpy and was not comfortable to sit on.
The bathroom was very poor standard and you were unable to use the mirror to shave or apply makeup due to its poor placement.
We were glad to leave and won’t be going back.
Very cosy historic house in a great location, easy access to all the attractions of Barossa and with beautiful vineyards to wake up to. Enjoyed our stay very much!

Cute old cottage in a beautiful quiet location. 5 minute drive to Nuriootpa and next door to a lovely winery.
House was neat and tidy and the heating made it warm and cosy. It felt like a stay at Grandmas house.
Thank you! House is beautiful
A period piece settled in a vineyard. A unique experience staying in a house from an earlier age. A comfortable welcoming house in a lovely location.

The house was quaint & old. Some decor could be better. The quilt in bedroom two was too small for the bed and a top sheet would have been good. Otherwise it was a nice stay. Lovely garden & surrounding vineyards.
Lovely place to stay, close to all the wineries we wanted to go to and Sibylle was lovely to communicate with!

This is a lovely home with a beautifully kept cottage garden set amongst grapevines.
Sybille has some unique special touches including fresh flowers from the garden, and a moreish German treat, stollen bites, to welcome you. Luhr's cottage, 1km south, is a heritage gem well worth a visit.
A beautifully maintained 1910 house with original features and tranquil setting no too far from Nuriootpa.
Sybille s cottage is a sweet little house in beautiful surroundings. Presentation is good and the whole cottage extremely clean.
Nice relaxing location
Absolutely loved our short stay at Petra’s cottage. Great location, easy check-in and fantastic host. 10/10!
Gorgeous house in the middle of a vineyard. What else you can ask for? Well stocked kitchen with lots of lovely touchs. Thanks Sibylle :)
Great cottage. Good location. Cute place to stay.
Beautiful old country home with period features and quiet location. We had a lovely stay here.
Amazing old school cottage in a beautiful setting with views of vineyards.

Great place to stay. A little piece of yesteryear in the Barossa. Charming.
Piece and quiet. Third time here and will be back.
Comfortable and spacious with all you need plus a lovely welcome package on arrival. The only distraction from the great location is the somewhat old furnishings and the daggy decor.
The ambiance of this place is amazing. I slept like a log.
So many thoughtful touches in this place and wonderfully quiet. A place to really get away from things.
Had a lovely stay for our anniversary, very clean and and spacious for two, great breakfast and warm hospitality from Evelyn

We had a brilliant one night getaway at Evelyns place. The unit is exceptionally clean, well furnished and comfortable. We stayed on a mid-30s day and the aircon was nice and cool. Views and surroundings are fantastic.
Nice quiet and relaxing get away with great amenities
Such a lovely spot, with special luxury touches. A perfect spot to stay to explore the Barossa. Would 100% stay again. Thank you, Evelyn.

Evelyn’s guest suite ticks all of th boxes! She has created a beautiful guest quarters in her new home that is stylish and spacious, comfortable,  and convenient to the many wineries and nearby small towns. Located in the countryside, there is peace and birdsong. She provided a wide selection of breakfast items, including eggs and bacon, honey from her hives, and other homemade items to round out a lovely breakfast. After two months traveling, her place ranked in the top three of our many Airbnbs. We highly recommend if you are thinking of visiting the Eden and Barossa Valleys!

Homely, clean and comfortable and Evelyn is very friendly and welcoming.
Thoroughly recommended!

The thought and care put into little touches around the place, like fresh flowers and produce, for example, make this space feel loving and cosy while being super clean, fresh and modern at the same time.

Evelyn asked ahead of time of any dietary requirements so I could happily get stuck in to all the treats provided, knowing my allergy had been considered.

I highly recommend this spot to any couples or singles in need of an escape to take a breath, Meander is perfect.

The place was beautiful! Nice and cosy winter nights with a hot tea was bliss 🥰. Beautiful scenery with lots of animals around. Evelyn had out done herself with the homemade products. Nothing better! Loved how she used the space with wooden furniture with touches or green and blue around.

This is the perfect place to relax and enjoy a warm welcome. We used Meander Retreat as a base for walking the Lavender Federation Trail. Perfect retreat after a day's hiking! Evelyn is a fabulous host.

We could not have imagined a better Winter stay - stunning accommodation, great breakfast, and the most lovely host. Evelyn made sure we had what we needed to fully relax and culminated with a bonfire and a bowl of yummy chocolate pudding. We were spoilt and will come back very soon! Thank you - best experience we’ve had in a long time.
This is a beautiful property and a very stylish studio. It’s the perfect location to explore the Barossa/Hills and get some country air. We highly recommend this stay.

Lovely spot on the edge of the Barossa. Evelyn is a great host, unobtrusive but attentive. Super clean, nice Asian decor touches, really warm in the winter, high ceilings and roomy. Chooks, veges, fruit in season and modern kitchen for own cooking. Lost an hour in the big bath after canoeing and walking around Warren Reservoir.
We have really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely recommend this place and will be back one day ourselves.

We had a great time staying at Meander. We love the house and the location. Evelyn is a very thoughtful and generous host. This was our second stay at Meander. We really enjoyed the extra trouble Evelyn went to - bonfire, after dinner drinks, the wood oven pizza. The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa wineries and walking the Lavender Trail. We look forward to another visit in the future.
Thanks Evelyn for a wonderful stay at your sparking cleaning retreat.  We enjoyed our stay in the quite Springton fields with the rolling hills and with the Barossa just down the road.   Peter & Prue

Evelyn's place is just perfect. Lofty ceilings, beautiful views, quality finishes, lovely host. We felt relaxed and pampered there. It was the perfect country getaway. Evelyn has thought of everything to make guests feel welcome and at home. We only wish we could have stayed longer! Thank you Evelyn.
This was our 3rd visit to Meander; we love staying here. Evelyn is a fabulous host!

We have really enjoyed our stay at Evelyn's place.  We love her place;  it's beautiful, well-equipped, comfortable and serene with a country feel.  It is great for a retreat!  She pays attention to details and we felt really well taken care of.  We highly recommend Evelyn's place and plan on returning.

Evelyn was such a lovely and accommodating host! We loved our farm stay and couldn’t recommend highly enough.

We loved the wine and chat, homemade jam, musli and farm eggs!
Thanks again Evelyn for a wonderful stay x

What a peaceful and relaxing spot! We loved every part of our stay from adventuring around the property, being greeted by doggo and chickens, relaxing with a wine under the gums and the amazing facilities. Evelyn is a lovely host who will make sure you’re well looked after but have your own space. She puts so many lovely touches into the property and we really enjoyed making our breakfast with local produce! Easy adventuring into the Barossa by car. Thank you again!

We loved our stay here over Easter. Evelyn is a lovely host and made us feel very welcome. the homemade bread and breakfast supplies were very much appreciated. I loved spending some time in the hammock with a local wine, under the gums, watching the orange butterflies against the blue sky in the breeze.  I can wholeheartedly recommend staying here!
Definitely you won’t regret to stay in this lovely place! The place is amazing! The host thinks about the smallest details that make the stay even more special! We loved so much everything!

Evelyn's property is absolutely heavenly! The location is superb and the love and care she puts into running her business is revealed in every detail of her spotless place. It was amazing to be able to enjoy a glimpse of the country life, especially the delights she offers such as the honey, the jam and the fresh eggs all produced locally in her property. I highly recommend her place and I would easily go back for another restorative stay.

Our stay at Evelyn’s was fantastic. She was so welcoming and her place feels so homely and secluded, we didn’t want to leave! From the little touches around the supplied baked bread and eggs from her chickens to her warm welcoming and hospitality I couldn’t recommend this getaway highly enough.

It was exactly what we wanted. Peace and quiet, away from our busy lives. Clean and spacious. My personal favourite part was he bath, I spent hours soaking in it. Meander cottage was super easy to find and check in was a breeze!

A fantastic and stylish stay in Springton! Evelyn is such a lovely host and her property is lovely. Her garden is beautiful and if you are keen on fully using the kitchen the vegetables and herbs that Evelyn offers add a wonderful touch to any meal.

Lovely clean, new space in a gorgeous part of SA. We really enjoyed the king bed, soft sheets, deep bath, modern shower, fresh produce & 11am checkout!
Just a heads up for the nudists out there & those going away for a 'romantic' occasion - the suite is attached to the main residence & there is an internal door between the two rooms, which is locked but we found a little unsettling 😉
Thanks for a lovely stay Evelyn.

A cute and comfortable little place to stay in the Barossa. Super quiet if you wanted to chill for the day like we did. Lovely orchard full of different fruit trees and veggies growing, sweet little doggy that liked to be in your company and a great big bath if you fancy a treat! We loved our stay, it was just what we needed
Thank you Evelyn.
A beautiful cosy stylish retreat for 2. Enjoyed spa and outdoor  area. Great hosts.

57 studio was very clean and new, nicely designed and had a great space.
The location was central to Barossa Valley but not walking distance to Tanunda town centre.
We were abit disappointed that we didn’t meet Annemarie during our stay.

Lindsay and Anne Marie were very friendly hosts. A great little
Place to stay for a weekend in the Barossa. Clean, comfortable and the spa was an added bonus. Look forward to a beer with Lindsay when we are next in the region.
Beautiful little studio.
Great stay, hosts were very welcoming, would recommend to other guests.

We loved staying at Lindsay's apartment. It was beautifully decorated with lots of thoughtful touches. The shower, outdoor spa and kitchen were highlights, as well as the lovely bottle of wine on arrival. The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa too.

Highly recommended!
You'll enjoy a nice stay in the Barossa Valley. Nice and comfortable place, good location, friendly owners.
Nice little studio apartment in good location. Lots of pretty decorations and furnishings. Plenty of room for two people with a nice outdoor sitting area too.
lovely, stylish and cosy with nice extra touches, would stay again!
Most enjoyable place to stay, very clean & comfortable. Very friendly & accomodating hosts.  Would gladly stay again.
This place is as it is listed. Loved the place. Loved the Barossa

Studio 57 is a beautiful spot to stay and explore the Barossa. The location was perfect and the hosts were very helpful. The studio contains absolutely everything you need and is very comfortable. We didn’t want to leave!
clean, everything a couple would need, great hosts, very friendly.
Sparkling clean and beautiful. Better described as an up-market granny flat though, they've made every effort to make it private and have done very well. Just something for people to be aware of :)
Beautiful hosts and accommodation with everything you need. Spa was a special treat. Easy walk to main street of Tanunda. Also several wineries withing walking distance. Highly recommended!
Fantastic! So much more stylish than the photos could portray!

What a beautiful stay! The host is such a warm gentleman and very helpful!
We got a beautiful bottle of wine too!!!
We will definitely recommend this place and will definitely be back! X

Murnane's Studio 57 is very well equipped for a weekend away in the Barossa, either using it as a bedtime base or having some quiet time at the Studio. It is warm and cozy, very well set up, and aesthetically very lovely too.

The studio was spotlessly clean, well provisioned, modern and with everything working. It was perfect for our needs as a base from which to ride the Barossa Cycling trail. It's tastefully furnished,  comfortable and relaxing, in a quiet location. The wine and chocolate were most appreciated. Thank you, we recommend it very highly and would stay again!

For us this was just a stunning studio in a perfect spot for visiting some local wineries. From the moment we checked in we were greeted and given some tips on local places to eat and drink, the amenities and extra touches exceeded any expectations I could have had, and the studio itself was clean and modern and just perfect for a few nights away. I can't think of anything that could be done better at this spot and I would definitely stay again on another trip to the barossa.
This is a great place to stay if you want to explore the wineries of the area. The place was clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our short break here.

Had the a fantastic 2 days away in this perfect little apartment. Had full ambition to go out and enjoy culinary delights of local restaurants and bars for days but felt much more comfortable staying in and in joying the unique atmosphere this little place had to offer !
Sparkling clean studio bedroom with all the amenities of a hotel and lots of little thoughtful touches such as local wine, chocolate, milk. Would definitely stay again.
Very comfortable and clean with amazing hospitality. Excellent value for money in ideal location

This air bnb was amazing! So much better than expected, the room is so  big - it’s like a self contained unit! So warm and comfortable. The host was lovely and took us to some wineries for a far cheaper price than a taxi! Perfect place for a little weekend escape from the city and the location is fantastic to get to all the local wineries. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we will be back :)

Lindsay and Annemaree were lovely hosts ! 'Studio 57' offered a cosy and luxurious little hide away to unwind and relax in for a couple of days with all the amenities one could ask for. The wine, chocolate, newspaper and bath robes were just some of the special little touches.

We stayed here as part of a weekend in the Barossa, and it didn’t disappoint! You are sooo close to everywhere you could possibly want to visit. The space is lovely and very very clean! We were just shocked by how close the Airbnb was to the owners house, as it is not part of the description! Overall we had a lovely stay.
Very Clean and spacious, everything you need and perfectly decorated, areas inside and out to sit and relax, close to the main road if you like walking or a $10 taxi ride to most places

Unfortunately we couldn’t wait to leave. Lindsay entered the unit on three separate occasions during our stay and only had the courtesy to let us know the once. This made us feel uneasy from the very start of our stay.
I also cancelled a wine tour with Lindsay and the way he spoke was beyond belief. I’m certainly glad I cancelled in the end.
On a good note having spent most of our time out of the unit we had a fantastic time in the Barossa.

Stylish, got everything you need. Great place for 2. Lindsay was a great host and made sure we had everything when we settled in.  Got an outdoor BBQ and spa, too bad we didn't get a chance to enjoy either because the weather was just too cold.

Studio 57 is extremely clean and quaint. It is very well dressed. The photographs don't do it justice. Very private from the hosts residence and the outdoor area is amazing. The studio had everything we needed. The bed is firmer than I am used to but still extremely comfortable. We were there for my partner's birthday and they even left us a birthday card! A highly recommended bnb! We will be back!
Staying at this place was great. It is clean and tidy and well equipped and in a good location. We had a great time and would visit again.
Murnanes place is a lovely little retreat, spotlessly clean and with some nice touches. We would definitely stay again

Loved our stay at Studio 57.  The photos really don’t do this place justice.  It was much larger than we were expecting and we loved all of the little extras (robes, wine, chocolate, milk etc).  We would without a doubt stay here again, and have already recommended it to some friends.

Fantastic hosts! Would stay again anytime given the chance. Great space topped off with the host being our chauffeur for our winery tour. Would recommend to anyone looking for accommodation in the Barossa!
As well as accommodation, Lindsey does personalised tours of the Barossa which we can recommend. You get to go where you want to go at your own pace!
Great location - close proximity to wineries & town. Clean, comfortable and nice amenities.

What a great experience! This is such a nice place to stay in Barossa valley. The pictures really don't do justice to this very nice appartement. The location is quiet, the town center and some wineries (including Peter Lehmann if you are looking for big one) are in walking distance and the hosts are super nice. Nothing to worry about in this appartement! Super clean, super comfy and it has everything you need incl. a BBQ place, a whirlpool, nice terasse to have breakfast or BBQ outside and general items like a huge fridge, dishes, glases, etc. . We have also booked a wine tour with Lindsay (the host) and it was a blast. My wife and me highly recommend it if you stay here! It is a private tour and you can discuss upfront with Lindsay where to go. We left out the big wineries and went to some small wineries and a brewery, which we would never have found without Lindsay. It is definitely a special wine tour as Lindsay is well-known in the area and has a huge knowledge about it. It gave us a really special feeling as we never felt like normal "tourists" going from winery to winery, but more like locals meeting friends and drink some wine...well, we were still tourists :-) , but it was a great experience. Definitely the best stay during our holiday!
A1

Studio 57 is a self-sufficient aesthetically-pleasing spot. Had everything we needed. Pictures don’t do justice. Great location, so central for us to get around. Even walking distance if you’d like that too. We were celebrating a birthday and were pleasantly surprised with a bottle of wine and a birthday card upon arrival. Very sweet of Lindsay and Annemaree to go that extra mile. We booked a wine tour with Lindsay as well, he knows the best spots. Pillows are plenty and bed is very comfy, but if you can only sleep on a firm pillow - bring your own. Don’t leave without saying hi to Denzel (the cutest Cavoodle in Tannunda). Forgot our passports behind and Annemaree was kind enough to send them back to us by post. Can’t recommend this place enough!

Clean and stylish studio.
Great tips about where to visit and enjoy a great meal.
Great hospitality

Great place to stay!
Very helpful hosts who were there when needing guidance but respectful of your privacy. Place was exactly as described. Clean, well located with lots of thoughtful extras. Would definitely stay again
the place was lovely and the hosts were extremely friendly. made us feel right at home! highly recommend!
Was a lovely place to stay, really clean and comfortable! Lots of little tips of where to go and what to see
Lovely place. Loved the spa bath and the small touches. Very relaxing stay. Will highly recommend
Great place to stay, close to everything and the unit has everything you could want.
Very clean space, everything you need and more. Close to everything. Very friendly host. Bed very comfortable and great shower. Will be back again.
A great place with awesome amenities. The spa, bathroom and outdoor area were amazing. Nice cozy spot for a romantic getaway. The hosts were prompt and helpful also. Highly recommended.

Great location for the Barossa.
Spotlessly clean - could eat off the floor! If you are a clean freak this place won't disappoint.
Lindsay met us on arrival and showed us around his lovely little place.
Our only criticism was that the property is on the same grounds as the hosts - not sure this was mentioned on the site posting. Though the hosts didn't interfere or disturb us at all.
The spa in the back overlooks what is possibly a "shared" garden. Lindsay assured us that the blinds on his house which possibly overlooked the rear yard were constantly pulled down during our stay (which they were) but we just didn't feel comfortable having a spa.
That aside a great place to stay

We absolutely loved our stay at Studio 57! The perfect spot for a romantic getaway. Lindsay was a wonderful host, responding quickly to all communication and meeting us on arrival to show us around. The space is beautifully styled and absolutely spotless. The bed super comfortable, the spa and fireplace a treat. We can't recommend this place highly enough.

Studio 57 was absolutely perfect for our 2 person getaway. The apartment was sparkling clean, homey and had all the amenities you would need. The hosts also run wine tours which is super convenient, and we had the absolute pleasure of having a private tour with Lindsay organizing it for us. Although we went in middle of winter, when we were at the apartment at night we spent most of our time in the gorgeous outdoor area in the spa, with the heater on and a glass of wine. I would definitely recommend, perfect stay and very helpful and kind hosts. Thankyou!
Small, but clean and new.  Limited indoor and outdoor space   - note this a studio in the owners backyard.
We had a wonderful weekend at Studio 57! It is immaculately clean and every need is catered for in a beautiful space! We look forward to coming again!

Although this property is in the same yard as the owners you would not be able to tell from inside the studio apartment. It was sparkling clean and they have thought of everything!!! There was a screen in the outdoor patio area which made it feel very secluded and private. The hot tub is to die for. I would definitely stay here again!!
Awesome Apartment clean, modern and comfortable close to town centre and recommend the wine tour with Lindsay in his luxurious Holden HSV Grange.

This place is super cozy! Lots of little touches to make you feel welcome and at home. Location is perfect, just a few minutes to the main road in Tanunda with plenty of drinking/eating options and a short drive to several wineries.
Great little spot with friendly and knowledgeable hosts!
Lovely place, in mint condition! Would happily come back!

Very comfortable and clean studio with all the amenities in a very convenient location.
Great way to spend a long weekend
Sparkling clean with modern decor.  Quiet location and reasonably close to the main street shops.

What a place ! Might be the best Airbnb we had so far. Very well equipped and designed. We've even been welcomed with a red wine bottle and chocolate. Located in Tanunda, the perfect departure spot for a wineries tour.
Great spot!
Amazing stay. Easy checkin. Hosts were so helpful. A+++

Great accommodation for
relaxing after a busy wine tour. Walkable distance to local restaurants, cafes and shops! Hosts were accommodating with change of travel details due to COVID which was great! Highly recommend staying here while enjoying the Barossa!
Wonderful place
Great little space to chill out in and relax after a big day in the Barossa. Fantastic location and close to amenities. Hosts were very easy going and approachable. Would highly recommend
Very beautiful place to stay, they have made the place comfortable and welcoming. Definitely recommend to stay

Spotless, 10 minute walk to restaurants and shops and lovely private garden. Charming homely touches everywhere, everything you could possibly need is provided. Had to cut our stay short due to COVID lockdown but would love to come back one day.
Very lovely accomodation, great facilities, great location. Highly recommend this place! Lovely hosts :)
Lovely decor and outdoor area where the hot tub is, close to the main street!

Such a great apartment for a stay, it has all the amenities you could expect and more.
A great kitchenette, BBQ area with outdoor settings and Spa after a day at the wineries.

A great bed, with pillows to match, waterfall shower. Nice surprises with complimentary snacks provided.

I will certainly be back, there was no annoying "ahhh I wish they had this here", it was all there. Great value for money.

Me and my wife stayed at studio 57 and had a absolute blast. The studio is a well designed and caters to every need. It also offers a large covered / non covered outdoor area with a jacuzzi and BBQ facilities. This is an ideal place to visit the barossa valley with walkimg distance from wineries, shops and restaurants. A must visit.

Extremely pleasant stay. A hidden gem in Barossa. Everything is well thought for you to feel in a 5-star location. The bed is comfortable, the decoration makes you feel at home. The outside jacuzzi is an extra that makes it even more delightful. A well-equipped bbq and a nice backyard may convince you to spend more time at home than visiting the vineyards. Every detail has a lot of care from the hosts. Not to mention the location. Right at the Tanunda’s centre, which makes your life very convenient.
Totally recommendable!!

We had such a great time during our stay. The accommodation was perfect for our kids free getaway,  with all the extra touches that made it feel really special and relaxing. the day tour with Lindsay was also a fantastic way to spend the day - we loved meeting some of the smaller winemakers and hearing their stories and history. Very much recommend!
My partner and I loved our stay. The location was perfect - close to wineries, restaurants and a bakery with good coffee. It was super clean and had everything we needed for the 3 days we were there
Very clean and comfortable space. Great location. Would highly recommend!

Had a lovely relaxing stay in a unique location,  just a few minutes walk to the local town. The garden was meticulously maintained, a wonderful sight whilst relaxing in the outdoor area and spa bath. Lindsay was great with communication, very welcoming and friendly throughout our stay.
Lindsay is a quick responder who goes the extra mile to make the stay comfortable and memorable, will be recommending to friends and family

The studio apartment is on the same block as the main house and although we did see Lindsay around, it is very private. It shares a driveway with the main house. The studio was very clean and tidy and they gifted us a bottle of wine for our stay which was a nice touch. The outdoor/spa area is shared with the main house although there is a privacy blind that can be pulled down. The house is also very close to the Main Street of Barossa and some wineries. Would recommend staying here!

Beautiful accomodation in the perfect location . Short walk to town centre and a few key wineries. We really enjoyed the little touches that made our stay extra comfortable - tea, coffee, even milk and fresh bread. Highly recommend !

What a terrific little gem to explore the Barossa from. Studio 57 was decked out with all the amenities that you would need for a memorable stay.
I loved the private garden space, setup with a TV and tub, which was perfect to while the hours away with a bottle of red wine.
Don't forget to try the restaurant '1918' whilst you are in town, serving up the best food & wine in their gorgeous garden area.
The hosts were great, check-in was easy and hassle free. However note the studio is close the to the owners adjoining property, in case anyone was seeking pure privacy.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. It was a wonderful spot! 5 stars.
Lovely space. Great location. Friendly host!

Studio 57 was spotless...
Many great touches milk in fridge wine chocolate port !!!
everything needed and more !!!
a great stay...
Winery tour was a very well spent day to remember ...
Great location in Tanunda, nearby many of Barossa’s best wineries! Presentation & cleanliness above standard.

Great little studio apartment!
Lindsay was a great host and helped us out will tips and advice
Would stay again
Very comfy for a couple
Fantastic place to stay, extremely clean, fantastic amenities. If you looking for perfection and are in the area this is a must to stay!
It was a gift to my sister and her husband! They absolutely loved it! Thank you 😊
A gorgeous little place which is modern, clean & most importantly has a great spa bath outside with a telly, to enjoy a relaxing wine in the evenings. Thanks for having us!
Lovely studio, owners onsite so less privacy than other Airbnbs or hotels
Perfect location to Tanunda Main Street. Great little studio just off the owners main house. Breakfast condiments and toiletries a welcoming touch.
Beautiful accommodation. Highly recommend.

We had an amazing stay whilst in Tanunda! Lindsay and Annmaree have created a relaxing retreat with all the finer touches from the robes down to the lovely bottle of wine! The outdoor kitchen and spa were well utilised and stocked with everything you could possibly need! We wouldn’t hesitate to book another stay!
Has all you need for your Barossa getaway, and more! Would love to stay here again on our next visit!

Beautiful, clean and perfectly fitted out studio in a great location just a short walk from the action of Tanunda main street. Comfy bed and the outdoor spa in a private garden setting was a great added bonus.

Beautifully appointed accommodation with every detail well thought out. Studio 57 was spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. Our 2 night stay was thoroughly enjoyable and hosts Lindsay and Annemaree were very hospitable hosts.
Excellent location for fun times in Tanunda at night and explore the Barossa during the day.

This AirBNB was amazing. Wicked location right in the centre on Tanunda and so close to all the wineries all over the Barossa it was perfect, super cute layout very homely feel. The back yard takes the win for me Bbq, Fire, hotub, tv. What more do you need? Maybe a bottle of red? They provided that for us too. Thanks again will be back!
Great place for a weekend away. Our hosts were very responsive and helpful. The extras (milk, bread, wine!) were unexpected but appreciated.
Very clean, comfortable & stylish accommodation. Great all seasons outdoor area.

Studio 57 is one of the best places we have stayed using Airbnb. Beautiful decor, clean, thoughtful touches like bathrobes, coffee, port, wine. Private space in a great neighbourhood and we walked into town each day/night for meals. Perfect spot to use as a base in exploring the Barossa. Easy checkin and communication with our hosts. Highly recommend this one!
Studio 57 is a perfect place for a staycation. Great facilities, well located,  and friendly and knowledgeable hosts! we will definitely be back
Great accommodation, clean tidy comfortable. All small details have been thought of.
Excellent stay. Apartment was well supplied with everything you need and more. Fantastic outdoor area
Accomodation exactly as described. Cleanliness exemplary. Check-in process extremely easy, located near Tanunda Main Street eateries and prime location to great wineries within 15km radius.
The Murnane studio was everything we expected and so much more. A luxurious escape where our comfort and relaxation was a priority.
A beautiful little space, where  everything has been considered. The bed and linen was so soft and comfortable.  The studio had everything we needed and more. Location is also good.
A lot of thought was put into the room which made the stay very enjoyable.
This place is everything it promises to be and more. It’s actually better than photos depict. So comfortable, many surprises. Can’t fault it.

such a beautiful cozy studio with all the necessary items included.
The host definitely made us feel welcomed and assisted where needed. Would strongly recommend this for a cute couple vacay

Good location, place was clean and tidy. The outdoor spa was perfect.
Note the owners are onsite. otherwise a lovely stay, with all amenities required

The studio is lovely, very private, spa is great as is the bbq area. Location is close to the town centre so you can walk in if need be. The stuido is sticked with everthinf you couldneed! Would happily say again!!

Wonderful little studio and perfectly located. Love the spa and the personal touches  - there was a card wishing us a happy anniversary when we arrived. The studio is next to the main house but is completely private. We felt right at home. Will stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

This is the perfect slice of heaven for anyone needing a getaway! Studio 57 had beautiful decor and every practical utensil under the sun. This accomodation was above and beyond our expectations and I couldn’t recommend more!
The place was amazing and delightful to stay at. Very convenient location. Hosts were very friendly and helpful. All round great experience. Would definitely stay again.

This was a very special place! The hosts have gone to great lengths to add those extras which make a stay unforgettable and we look forward to returning in 2022. The quiet spa baths in a leafy courtyard were very indulgent and we loved being so close to the wineries in Barossa. You can't go past the cheese platter at Chateau Yaldara. After 2021 we really needed a break and this went way above what we were expecting. I can't recommend it enough.

Every finish is luxurious and thoughtfully designed.
Alfresco outdoor area is fantastic and really enjoyable to spend time in.
Short walk into Town - and so many wineries and restaurants easily accessible.
Hosts respect your privacy which is always much appreciated.

This is a lovely place to be based from in the Barossa. Walking distance to Tanunda. It was beautifully set up, with lots of attention to detail, and little touches including breakfast cereals, bread, milk, wine etc.
It was very comfortable and the outside double bath was amazing overlooking a gorgeous garden.
Had a beautiful few days in the Barossa and coming home to this lovely AirBNB was perfect fully equipped, comfortable and perfect.  Will be back to stay again  one day!
A perfect place for a night or two!

Has everything you need for a short Barossa stay. Whilst being attached to a house, the studio feels private and was a great base for exploring the great wineries nearby. Highly recommend Torbreck just up the road.

Also very handy being able to walk into Tanunda (approx 1km).

Hosts were friendly and a lot of thought has been put into making sure it is a great stay.

Five stars across the board - perfect for a weekend getaway. Barossa Villas is in a peaceful location just a few minutes from the best wineries, restaurants and other attractions including a gin distillery practically on your doorstep! The property is very quiet and extremely well equipped with stylish furnishings and a generous array of carefully selected local products. The breakfast supplies were outstanding! The choices made by the hosts are very well considered and eco friendly. Cathy and Grant made the whole experience very easy and memorable. Check in / check out were a breeze and they communicated clearly throughout the process. We look forward to staying again and will highly recommend to friends.
What a great place to stay, very comfortable and stylish, and close to everything. To have places within walking distance was a great novelty.

Beautifully appointed and low impact villa, stylishly designed. Had everything we were looking for in a weekend getaway. Really well positioned on Seppeltsfield Road with good wineries and eateries nearby. Fantastic provisions left for breakfast and nibbles - much appreciated. Would definitely stay here again for a special weekend away as a couple.
Fantastic little villas with gorgeous little details bto make your stay extra special

Treat yourself and book one of Cathy and Grant’s cabins! Our stay was incredible, the cabins are stylish and equipped with everything you could need and more. There were soo many thoughtful little touches too, they went above and beyond! We will definitely be back.
Highly recommended location to make the most of any visit to the region. Wonderful accommodation with absolutely everything you could possibly need. A must stay

Perfect for couples to enjoy a romantic and peaceful get-away to appreciate each other and the beauty of nature.
Surrounded with endless activities and highly rated restaurants.
Thanks again!!
Stunning location! Great hospitality! So much to see and do. Will definitely be back again.
This stylish little getaway has all the amenities you need in a luxurious way. Being able to walk to neighboring wineries along seppeltsfield road is so handy!
A wonderful place to stay with beautiful scenery, local goodies and special touches!

Such an awesome little getaway that feels luxurious with the Aussie outback at your doorstep. Minutes away from the gin distillery and wineries - it’s the perfect spot for a weekend getaway! Very private, and all the yummy nibbles provided save you having to do any food shopping which is a bonus!
Great accommodation in a fantastic location. Felt so welcome and really appreciated the local produce provided

Cathy and Grant were fabulous hosts. The accommodation was clean, modern and had everything we could possible need for a stay in the Barossa. The little extra touches also made for a memorable stay with some local tips and recommendations along the way. Would definitely stay here again.

Marananga more like cowabunga! We had a radical time in your amazing accomodation! It was central to all the amazing Barossa hotspots and your recommendations left us: full, smiley and sometimes tipsy! We loved it! Thank you for being so hospitable, we would love to come back!!
Such an amazing place for a little weekend escape. It’s in the perfect spot, beautifully furnished and so well equipped!
