Tamu is a lovely, sweet place which refreshed my soul. It is beautifully decorated, clean and serene.

Tamu is easily accessible to surrounding towns, and provided wonderful information regarding eateries, wineries and further tourist information.

I hope to visit at Tamu again to enjoy the beautiful Barossa.
Lovely hosts and a great space which catered for all our needs.
Lovely self contained unit on a peaceful property. Check in and out was well explained. We had a great stay, thank you.
Really nice - newly renovated, tidy, and spacious
Very clean, modern place with a beautiful view of greenery. It's a 10-15min drive out of the main town so be prepared to drive or take taxis.

Stylish and recently renovated guesthouse. So comfortable , spacious and modern
Heating working very well. Would love to book again - great place.
Very friendly hosts

The place was spotless, had everything you need and was quiet and tucked away! Bed was very comfy and heaters worked very well. We did feel there were quite a lot of rules and while we of course were happy to abide by them (and probably would have behaved the same way without the rules) it was somewhat off putting. I’m not sure if there have been issues with previous guests. Other than that I can’t fault our stay and while we didn’t meet Bianca her communication was great.

Lovely private and clean place, in close proximity to all Barossa has to offer. Including the Altona Landcare Reserve, literally around the corner, which beautiful short walks and beautiful views, can highly recommend. Although there's quite a few house rules communicated, the hosts are very warm, friendly, approachable lovely people.
Fantastic place for a Barossa trip. Close to shops and also a walking trail.

Bianca was friendly and her communication was clear and helpful.
The place had a lovely view and had everything we needed to cook. We felt very at home.

Wonderful place to stay. Really tidy and fresh, and somewhat secluded which gives you privacy and allows you to enjoy the place without any interference. Really close to the major wineries in the area and the host has provided a really useful guide as to where you might access wineries/bars/restaurants!
Worth every dollar spent!
Lovely spot in a more secluded area of the Barossa, but still close to Tanunda and Nuri to bike ride. Clean and homely cottage. Would stay again.
Great place to stay

Bianca’s place is exceptionally clean, and well designed for a quiet and restful stay. The location is a quick drive to great wineries and restaurants. You could also easily walk to a tasting at a nearby winery with stunning views. Great value for money and we will try to stay again the next time we’re in the Barossa.

Very beautiful and private place to stay.
Immaculately clean and a bright cottage to relax after your wine tours.
Highly recommended and we will be back!

Tamu is quiet, clean and is everything you need. Bianca provided everything we could have needed, even stocking some milk and porridge for us. The guest house has aircon too which is great because it was hot! The shower is great, and we really enjoyed our stay. Biancas quick communication made our stay easy, and we will be back! Really couldn’t fault our stay. The location is great too.
We absolutely loved our stay at Tamu! The location was ideal, the house is the perfect size for 2 and the beds are comfy! We will definitely be back and recommend to friends!
Great accomodation that had all that is needed for a comfortable stay. Very well presented and clean. Thanks Bianca for the prompt communication.
We absolutely loved our stay - great amenities and location. 100% would come again
Alexandra was amazing. She even left a present for my my partner because she knew it was his birthday. The house was immaculate and beautiful. So close to Anguston centre and delight
We had a wonderful time in the cottage - beautifully decorated, with thoughtful touches throughout. Great cooking facilities and outdoor area. Highly recommend.
Love love love this house! So clean, homely and comfortable.
Beautiful little cottage feels! So many cute touches left by the host! Photos don’t do this property justice! Absolutely loved our stay!
Fantastic

We really enjoyed our stay at Alexandra's place. The bathroom and kitchen come with all the things you will need for your stay.  The bed was very comfortable too.Alexandra was very responsive on messages.
The pictures don’t give justice to the home. Wonderful touches and great location in a historical town.
Alexandra is an amazing host, thoughtful with all the extras you don’t expect. The home is simply beautiful and is perfectly located in the heart of the Barossa. We will definitely be back.
While we only stayed 1 night, the cottage was just right. We wouldve  loved to have stayed longer. If you like a good bath, this place is for you!

We really enjoyed our stay.  Alexandra’s Place was clean, comfortable and stylish.  Alexandra left a delicious breakfast for us to enjoy in the fridge and some really enjoyable wine.  We’d happily recommend to friends.

Had our 10 year anniversary and it was absolutely perfect. The host and the house are amazing and I feel very lucky to have booked this place. What a great bathtub!  If you are thinking of renting this place, do not look any further.
Amazing bath, delicious bread and jams and coffee!
Lovly house,  the host goes above and beyond. Looking forward to a return trip.
Beautiful cottage, short walk to the main street of Angaston. Thoughtful touches in the house with a real homely feel. Highly recommend.
A wonderful cottage, warm and welcoming. Beautifully renovated (the bathroom is amazing!) Great location as well.

Definitely recommend staying here. Alexandra was quick to respond and provide information throughout booking and arrival. Nice extra touches are provided and the amenities  and all good quality. We really enjoyed our stay and could easily walk to the Main Street and access to wineries and other businesses is all very easy and close. Take a break here.
We had a great stay in Alexandra’s cottage. It is beautifully renovated with an amazing bathroom and tub. We would highly recommend this place.
Great cozy place for a weekend getaway. Highly recommend
Wow, what an amazing home. Just stunning and kept beautifully. Thank you for allowing us to stay in this little treasure in Angaston.

Such a lovely weekend getaway! A beautiful cottage located in a lovely town - was nice to wake up and walk down to brunch.
It’s obvious that so much thought has gone into the place- we literally wanted for nothing for our entire stay.
Cannot write a review without acknowledging the bath- it is the largest most luxurious bath I think I’ve ever used! Definitely a getaway to revisit.
Great place to stay and fantastic location just behind main street of Angaston.
Beautiful little home with beautiful views and front garden. Such a calm, peaceful place to spend a few days
Great bath. Nice bacon and eggs for breakfast! Comfy beds and decent heaters.

Devitt on French is a lovingly restored property with many period touches, conveniently located in the centre of Angaston. Perfect for a romantic weekend. Alexandra is a thoughtful, welcoming host. We had a wonderful stay.

Nice place, great shower. Lots of original features and touches.
Pleasant stay.
Thanks Alexandra
Highly recommended
Lovely place in a convenient location!

Alexandra’s place truly lets you take a deep breathe and take in the true beauty the Barossa has to offer. Disconnecting from the digital world and enjoying the moment was what we needed. The outdoor area is so lovely to sit under and enjoy a platter. That shower/bath is spot on as well.
The pictures don't do this beautiful place justice 😍 well worth the money and Alexandra has literally thought of everything you might need 😍
beautiful home! appointed with everything we needed for our stay and in a great location for exploring the Barossa valley

We have just had four nights in Angaston at Alexandra’s place, it was the right decision, only two of us, so bigger than we needed, but good location, all the extras you could think of, I quite often have to buy glad wrap or paper towel, but no, Alexandra has it all, very comfortable, needed the aircon as it was cool at night. The only negative which I had overlooked when booking was ‘no internet’.
Angaston is a lovely village, with several restaurants to choose from, and if you are a cyclist you can rent bikes at the Hardware shop and cycle down the rail trail to Tanunda and then back up a gradual incline
Christine
A wonderful cottage and stay. Everything we could have wished for provided by Alexandra. I would highly recommend.
Great little cottage.Beautifully appointed and decorated.Very comfortable and good base forBarossa and Adelaide Hills. Attention to detail was fabulous.

Great cosy clean cottage close to town with everything you need. The lovely sunny back patio was great for chilling on a winter day and I can imagine that that would be great in summer too.
We popped the antique plates away (made us nervous ! ) but used all the other dishes that you could pop in the dishwasher.
A delightful cottage in a great location to explore the Barossa. Picture perfect. The bath is a real treat! Very clean. Nice and warm on very cold days.
Alexandra’s place is everything we wanted and more! A cosy little cottage steps away from Angastons Main Street. Charming features with a modern twist. Can’t wait to visit again!
We had the most amazing stay! The home was so beautiful and also so thoughtfully set up for us, a true home away from home. Truly dreamy home.
Beautiful place to stay, very cosy and warm. Bathroom was amazing !! Lovely provision provided and Alexandra was lovely to communicate with. Would definitely recommend

A beautiful, clean, character-filled cottage right near the Main Street of Angaston but tucked away on a quiet street. The bath is amazing and the kitchen is well set-up for cooking. An amazing spot to spend a few nights while exploring the Barossa. The pictures don’t do it justice!
Perfectly located, cozy and warm, you couldn't ask for anything more.
Excellent communication, lovely home. we had a wonderful time & would stay again!
Devitt on French was magnificent! Amazing bed, amazing bath and within easy walking distance of restaurants and cafes in Angaston. Such a nice cottage to relax and unwind. Will be back for sure!
Wonderful luxurious stay in the gem of the Barossa.  Happy accommodates two couples.  Lovely sitting spaces front and back to enjoy the quiet surrounds.
Very relaxing weekend - beautiful country getaway in a quiet little town!
We had a great stay at Alexandra’s, it is 10 minutes drive to many of Barossa’s great wineries! Super sized bath!
Quiet and lovely- I would recommend if you’re looking for a relaxing stay.
A stunning cottage, extremely neat, well appointed and very cosy. Walking distance to food places too! We can’t wait to be back.

Alexandra’s place is perfect for enjoying Angaston and surrounding wine country. We loved the short walk to town and the lovely house with all you need to relax and enjoy. Alexandra is a fantastic host and very accommodating. Great place!
Lovely, stylish bnb....we highly recommend this
Excellent stay, beautiful set up and hosts were hospitable. Room was perfect and super comfortable and close  to many Barossa wineries.

We loved the location, Natalie was excellent in her communication and we enjoyed the independence but still with some lovely interaction with the family. Would definitely recommend for anyone spending time in the Barossa

Natalie’s place was simply perfect! We stayed two nights and used it as a base to explore Barossa valley. Natalie provided some great local tips and the room itself exceeded expectations. Clean, comfortable and great value for money. We’ll definitely be back!

I stayed for three nights for essential work travel. The place is spotless, great location, great hospitality, excellent facility. It's located next to a beautiful vineyard. Definitely will stay again.

Absolutely wonderful stay with Natalie and her family. The room was spotless, cozy, and felt like our own space. Everything was spotless and Natalie’s daughter was even kind enough to give us a ride on her way into town when we wanted to go wine tasting. A++ hospitality!
Great value for money. Very friendly hosts.
I loved staying here, very comfortable and relaxing. Everything was clean and perfect. Highly recommend!

Natalies place is lovely, it is a self contained section of the house with no entry to/from the main house and has a bathroom and bedroom which are both really nicely done and very clean.

Natalie welcomed us and let us know some of the best vineyards to visit which were great tips! We met Natalie, her daughter and her husband who were all incredibly friendly. Definitely recommend!

Natalie was warm and welcoming and quick to respond to our messages. Her place was beautiful and relaxing. In the morning we woke to the most amazing skies filled with hues of yellow, pink and orange. Her surroundings were quite magical with the wineries on either side, as well as a pool and tennis court which we were welcomed to use. The area is close to the wineries and main towns. I’d highly recommend this place.
Lovely room with views over a lawn and vineyard next door. Very clean and stylish.
Lovely room. Very comfortable, clean and lovely hosts
Great place if you want to explore Barossa! It has quite a lot of storage space and nice, big bathroom. We really enjoyed our stay.
A nice new spacious, clean and comfortable room and bathroom with a very friendly host in Natalie. Thanks for hosting!
Comfy, clean and attractive room for stay.

Gorgeous room and bathroom.
Comfortable and super clean. Great host very friendly and welcoming.
Highly recommend this stay.
Beautiful place in the heart of the Barossa
Nice, comfortable self contained flat.  Great location amongst the vines, close to all the best Barossa wineries. Really nice hosts - what more could you ask for ?
Lovely and comfortable private room with ensuite. It was absolutely spotless and very comfy
Nice place, great location. Would book again

A perfect little spot in a great location (there are wineries within walking distance!). Nathalie and her family were very welcoming and shared some great tips on the area. The bedroom is spacious and there is a large bathroom and closet area (although note there’s no kitchen/kitchenette, just a mini fridge and kettle). You can see vines from your window, as well as the tennis court, which was great to have access to as well. We stayed with our 4-month old daughter and there was plenty of space for her travel cot.

100% recommended. Flexible checkout which we really appreciated. Beautiful bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Nice outlook from the bedroom. Lovely hosts, happy to chat and provide recommendations for the area and offer anything we needed during our stay.
Nice accommodating stay
Great room close to Nuri and the Barossa wineries. Perfect for a weekend stay!

Natalie is a super host very clean room.
Theo the Mutt was a welcome addition .
Thanks

I've spent a weekend at Natalie's place.
Amazing room, great communication and an overall fantastic experience.

Natalie' guest suite is a very comfortable, cleaning relaxing space. The shower was spacious & warm and the room had everything we needed for our short stay in Barossa. Thanks Nat & family for welcoming us, we highly recommend it :)
A beautiful suite with a very comfortable bed in a beautiful location, flanked by vineyards. Natalie and family were welcoming and friendly whist respecting privacy. I'd be happy to stay there again.
A really special cottage, tucked into the edge of a beautiful little town.
Perfect little cottage getaway. Close to all you need
awesome home and host. would love to stay again. thank you

What a great place to spend a weekend away. The cottage is full of charm and lots of thought has gone into every detail. We had delicious breakfast supplies (bacon, eggs, bread, milk, coffee etc) and the owner even thought to include treats and a toy for our puppy! Lovely fireplace (with plenty of firewood), heating, electric blankets... and walking distance to about 6 wineries, the brewery and the pub! Also a gorgeous gift shop across the road. This place is almost too good to let others know about.
Well located for a visit to the Barossa Valley. Neat, very tidy and with good amenities, coffee maker, bbq, wood fire, we really enjoyed it.

Wow.
What an amazing little cottage.
Perfectly located, immaculately clean and maintained and wonderfully appointed.
The inclusion of quality breakfast provisions and bottle of wine are the icing on a particularly delicious cake.
A brewery, wineries and the pub are all on your doorstep.
Light a fire and settle in on a cold winter's night and you won't want to be anywhere else.
Virginia is super responsive to messages and provides timely information.
The Old Telegraph Station at Greenock is highly recommended.
Almost everything Greenock has to offer (a lot) within 200m. Really quaint, comfy and cosy cottage with beautiful sunny backyard and garden.

This was an amazing place to stay for the weekend, beautiful little house , had everything we needed , great location, spotlessly clean , warm and cozy , we will certainly be returning in the future , can’t recommend this enough

THE place to stay when visiting the Barossa, in the hidden gem of Greenock. The cottage comes with all the amenities you need for an escape plus so much more - doggy treats for your fur friends and wine and local food for you, cosy comforts for sitting outside in the cottage garden and a spa for a late-night soak.

We loved staying at the Old Telegraph Station at Greenock. Virginia has thought of everything. So many nice little touches to make the bnb homely. It’s location in the main street  means you can walk to a restaurant,  wineries, the pub and the brewery next door making it incredibly convenient, yet it is still quiet. It is now our favourite accommodation in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) we definitely hope to return.

The old telegraph building is a lovely, comfortable place to stay. We travelled to visit the Barossa wine region and Greenock is centrally located to most wineries. The location is quiet and the main bed is comfortable.  Several extra little touches like bacon and eggs on arrival made the stay a memorable one.

Wonderful quaint little place with all the extra finishing touches one could want.  Great breakfast provisions and beautiful private yard. Fantastic that this place is dog friendly too. Would highly recommend a stay here.

We had a fantastic stay at Virginia's place. It had everything we needed and more and it's location was incredible. You honestly could stay there a week and only visit places on its street. We would love to stay again. Virginia was also very accommodating with anything we needed including a late check out.

A very comfortable small cottage to stay in. Was just the right thing for two single women.
Had our own rooms. All kitchen facilities excellent. Lovely back garden. Thoroughly great stay and our host Virginia so thoughtful and accommodating. Greenock a gorgeous village. Just all round bouquets .

My partner and I have stayed at the Telegraph Station previously and got to enjoy another stay after our wedding in the Barossa. Such beautiful and cozy accommodation walking distance to everything in Greenock!
It was perfect. Everything you could need and more.
Absolutely love this place , great location for seeing everything in the area , Virginia is the perfect host and provides everything needed , would recommend to anyone and will continue to return

Five stars all around! A beautiful Barossa getaway. The old Telegraph Station is a cute little cottage, a great base for exploring the wine region. Clean, well kept, can't complain at all. Virginia is a wonderfully responsive and helpful host. Can't recommend highly enough, will definitely be staying here again in the future.
This gorgeous little cottage is perfect and perfectly located.
Beautiful spot. Only 40 mins from North Adelaide. Had a fantastic time and will 100% be going back. Beautiful touches like food bits and complimentary wine made all the difference.

What a gem, a beautiful place to stay, great location, walking distance to brewery and cellar doors, friendly pub.
The cottage is amazing, cute, full of charm and beautifully presented. Lovely linen, fluffy towels and little homely touch all over the place. Virginia has thought of everything you may need. Even treats for your four legged friend. Just perfect

The old telegraph house is a wonderful little cottage, it is spotlessly clean and beautifully presented.
Virginia provides the most wonderful produce for your breakfast and bottle to help you relax on an evening while you sit in the garden chairs and unwind.
We had a perfect few days relaxing in the cottage. The pub is a 2-minute walk and the Tanunda & Nurioopta are 10-minute drives away. You are in the heart of the Barossa!

One of the best bnbs I have stayed in, everyone was so pleased with the quality of the experience too. Everything is very clean, the breakfast food quality was lovely and beds were also quite comfortable. Perfect location as it was close to our wine tour destinations. Easy to get to and also nice to have parking on the premise.
Overall a great bnb experience, would highly recommend when visiting Barossa valley.
fantastic place to stay. Very central & clean. amazing yard for the fur baby.

You can’t go wrong booking the beautiful Milk and Honey house for a stay in the Barossa! It was spotlessly clean, luxuriously appointed and so many thoughtful touches that we felt very much at home !
Communication with Alex was prompt and easy - would wholeheartedly recommend this property to anyone looking to enjoy the most of what Barossa has to offer !

What a beautiful cottage, the pics don't do it justice. It's so well appointed and equipped, everything we needed for a very relaxing stay.

Great location within the Barrosa valley, we used Barrosa taxis to get around the vineyards and cellar doors.

Alex was super accommodating and helpful with lovely suggestions to make it a fabulous weekend.

5* recommendations all round!!

Photos of the place do not do it justice, even better being there.

Excellent touches and everything was thought of.
An amazing experience, it made our time in the Barossa Valley all the more special. Thanks for providing such a well presented and maintained property.

I could not recommend Milk and Honey enough. The cottage is exquisite and Alex has truly thought of everything, from the welcome gifts to bathroom toiletries, this place has it all. The interior has been beautiful chosen and selected making it a warming and stylish cottage. The grounds are equally as impressive with well maintained garden and quaint sitting area. Do yourself a favour a book your stay at Milk and Honey. I guarantee you will not be disappointed. We can wait to visit again and will be recommending to all our friends.
What else can I say other than the house looked even better than the photographs. The hosts were fantastic and their communication was superb. I highly recommend staying at the house.

Such a great stay! This accomodation had everything we needed and more! Perfect location for exploring the Barossa and coming back to a cozy place to share a wine. Great for two couples. Can’t wait to visit again soon!
Great stay, very cute house!
Beautiful home with lovely touches throughout. So close to everything and would love to return in the warm weather to really enjoy the outdoor spaces.

A warm comfy space, even in the dead of winter. Lots of thoughtful touches, including a bottle of wine and loaf of bread on arrival. A great place to relax and unwind for the weekend. It was spotless, neat and tidy.

Milk and Honey is a fantastic place to stay. Everything was available that we needed. Super clean and comfortable. Delightful cottage central to the Barossa sites and places to visit. Had a great time.
Cheers Brian and Deb
We had a wonderful stay at Milk and Honey cottage. The place was warm and very well equipped. Alex was a great host and very helpful. Hope to visit again soon.

A wonderful weekend away in a fantastic location! Alex was an amazing host and the house was exactly what we were after for a luxurious weekend away. Thanks again for your amazing hospitality! We will be back!

The space and style of the home is a lovely place to unwind and relax. Well located to explore the great local boutique wineries and farmers market if you’re there on the right day. Really comfortable for 2 couples with a atmospheric outdoor area.

Milk + Honey is such a comfortable and relaxing cottage to stay in. The place was sparkling clean with great amenities. It’s styled so perfectly and is in a great location. Alex was easy to communicate with and always very prompt. We would definitely stay here again!

Wonderful stay with great amenities. Clean, accurate and lovely location.
Thanks Alex!

This property is perfection!!! Stunning and so stylish. SMEG appliances, comfy beds with the best pillows, sparking clean. Central to everything. A fantastic couple of days. Thanks Alexandra! A wonderful host!!
A peasant surprise, ideal for two couples

Would totally recommend a stay at Milk and Honey !!
10 /10 !!!!

Milk and Honey is a fantastic place in a quiet spot in Penrice. We throughly enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and having a nice comfortable place to sleep was exactly what we needed after a day of touring. The house provided exactly that. All amenities were of high quality and all very clean. Thanks very much Alex!

A really lovely comfortable and cosy place centrallylocated.
it suited us wonderfully and the wine bread jams and water were thoughtful v and appreciated.

A wonderful stay at Milk & Honey House for the Easter weekend with very thoughtful touches by Alexandra to help us celebrate the season! A lovely, clean place to stay and absolutely recommended to any wanting to explore the Barossa from this little gem!

We had a lovely stay at milk and honey, Alex has fitted the house out in style, everything ( sheets, towels, food, wine etc) that is there for you shows thought and quality.  Alex recommended Vintners for dinner which is 10 mins away and it was really terrific.  Thanks again Alex for a great stay.

We loved our stay at Milk & Honey, a charming cottage situated just outside of Angaston.
Spotlessly clean, we were warmly welcomed with a bottle of local wine, bread & condiments.
Situated in a great position, we enjoyed exploring the local area with lunch at The Eatery (@Maggie Beer) a real highlight (do book!!!) as well as a visit to Seppeltsfield. The Paul Bangay garden at Barossa Valley Estate was simply breathtaking & we highly recommend a visit. Thanks Alex.

Beautifully presented home with tasteful furnishings, comfortable bedding and useful crockery & appliances. Great heating as we were coming into winter providing a cosy environment. Can hear some road noise but not a busy street. We enjoyed the 20 min walk into Angaston for meals and a little bit longer walk to Saltram's for a lovely afternoon. Very short drive to Tanunda so easy access to many areas of the Barossa Valley. Alexandra is very responsive to communications and requests which was very much appreciated.
This place was perfect for our family getaway to the Barossa. We have no issues recommending this place to anyone!

Milk and Honey house is beautiful with lots of extra comforts kindly added such as a selection of jams, fresh bread, milk, beer, and wine. It is in a very convenient location and we enjoyed our stay immensely! Alex was brilliant with communication and ensured our stay was as comfortable as possible. Thanks again Alex!

We absolutely loved everything about our stay at Milk&Honey House, we could not fault it at all. The attention to every detail was outstanding. The cottage was spotless and location amazing.
It is by far one of the best Airbnb’s we have stayed in. We will be back .
Thanks Alex
Great cosy place to stay, a place of refuge away from the wine tasting…

What a beautiful, peaceful and cosey cottage. So clean and the decor is well thought out.  Plenty of supplies and appliances with split systems in most rooms. Beautiful care taken to maintain Milk and Honey.

Beautiful stay. Lovely little home, very cosy and an easy space! Perfect for entertaining or just hanging out! Easy location and only a short drive to the winery! Communication was easy and Alex was very welcoming. Thanks Alex!
Milk and Honey is a stunning cottage, with beautiful decor, comforts and extra touches. A great location for Barossa.
I would recommend this as first class accommodations close to everything you need to see and more. Very responsive and helpful hosts.

We were two couples, staying three nights while we explored the Barossa.  Milk+Honey was a brilliant base.  Such a cleverly renovated house, simple but elegant and supremely comfortable.  Good as it was nothing prepared us for the way Alex provided for us on arrival.  You know you're in time for a lovely stay when you find the kitchen and bathroom stocked with provisions of the highest order.  Freshly baked bread, quality muesli, bottle of red (and not just something bland but a bottle of 96 point Barossa shiraz) etc etc.  First class hospitality!

We had a very comfortable stay here. The cottage was exceptionally clean and quite new. It is very close to a supermarket, various restaurants that offer both dine in and take away (including the amazing Fermentasia) as well as a childrens playground. Well equipped kitchen and laundry with everything that we needed. The owner has paid great attention to detail in decorating the cottage and it has a lovely relaxing feel to it.

Lizha & Geoff’s place was wonderful! Such friendly and caring hosts! The thoughtful touches such as all the yummy goodies and l’occitaine bathroom soaps were beautiful. The house was super clean and in such a great location. Will definitely be back!

We had a fabulous weekend getaway at Lavender Cottage. The house was amazing with everything you could need. Super comfy beds and location is outstanding. We lived the thoughtful touches like cheese and fresh fruit. Would definitely stay again.

A really well presented and clean cottage
In a perfect location ! Loved all the little extras and provisions to enjoy.
The little touches on top of an amazing property made for a wonderful experience
B

A lovely house with many nice touches including local produce, toiletries and ammenities. The house itself is very welcoming, secure and warm. The house is very close to the Main Street with many eateries. Perfect for visiting the wineries!
A beautiful home with extra little additions thrown in. Great to communicate with & the perfect location. Exactly what we were hoping for!

The cottage was lovely, met all our expectations and was in a great location. The cottage was very clean and the jacuzzi was fabulous. We also booked massages and a private wine tour. Joe from Getaways SA was an amazing tour guide. Would come back in a heartbeat!
This was a well-sized room with everything we needed. It was lovely and clean and in a great location. We are very happy with our stay!
Nice stay and at a cute cottage in a good location.
Lovely place to stay in the heart of Tanunda. Beautiful house and garden and pool was excellent. Thanks for the stay.

An oasis in the heart of Tanunda.We stayed for 4 nights over Easter. The home has been beautifully furnished Each bedroom is very large with beautiful touches.We received a large bowl of fruit and a bottle of wine on our arrival.Absolutely sensational. Don’t miss it. The Christie/Baillie families.

Steve & Amanda's place was an absolute joy to stay in ! The house was absolutely stunning and matches the photos exactly. In terms of amenities it had EVERYTHING all the utensil imaginable in the kitchen, to every type of wine glass necessary. It really was resort style living.

Add on top Steve's local knowledge of the Barossa and the direct connections to winemakers he was able to provide us with, just capped off a truly fantastic stay

I wont be staying anywhere else in the Barossa when I'm back, that's for sure !

Steve and his lovely wife were a pleasure to deal with. We had a wonderful stay with lots of local recommendations from Steve and Amanda. They accepted our request at late notice and were so accomodating. The house was immaculate and in the perfect position for wineries, activities and restaurants. We couldn’t have asked for more.

Steve’s home was so wonderfully appointed to the local village of Tanunda and a great base to explore the Barossa. Steve was so accommodating and his home and garden made our stay so relaxing and enjoyable. Thanks Steve!
We loved our stay - a gorgeous house in the perfect spot. Thank you so much for sharing with us and easy communication.
No
Beautiful cottage with a great view out over the vineyard from the living area. Perfect for a weekend getaway
Beaut place! Would stay again. Thanks Sandra.

This wonderful cabin was such a treat to stay in! It was styled beautifully and felt like home as soon as we arrived!
Sandra was lovely, responded quickly and was very flexible with our late arrival time. A great quiet place to stay in the Barossa!

Loved our stay at Biscay. A lovely host, a friendly doggo, an awesome spot to explore the Barossa. The cottage is beautifully furnished, super comfortable and the photos don't do it justice. Great view over the farmlands with a wine on the deck. We loved it

Lovely comfortable and sparkling clean cottage in the Barossa, just a stone's throw from all the attractions and eateries. Sandra was efficient in her communications and very welcoming. The bed was super comfortable and linen great quality. Very peaceful and quiet too!!!
Great place to stay to explore the Barossa. Very peaceful and quite. The cottage is modern,  very comfortable and well equipped. Sandra was a response host and made check in super easy.

Sandra's cottage was really lovely to stay at. It was very clean and comfortable. It was also very peaceful with wonderful views from the veranda but very close to all the top wineries and restaurants in the Barossa.

Sandra was a lovely host and the cottage was so beautiful, relaxing & comfortable.
Loved staying there.

Sandra's little cottage well and truly exceeded our expectations! The view from the front balcony was nothing short of the serenity that you would expect from a place such as the Barossa Valley, or "the valley" as the locals call it. Sandra was a most hospitable host, with impeccable manners. The property was clean, modern and had everything one might need inside.  placed just outside of Tanunda,  all the gorgeous sites of the Barroasa Valley were close by.
Fantastic host and location. Very comfortable and all the amenities you require. Quiet, great shower and comfy bed. Highly recommend.

We had such a great time at Sandra’s cottage - it was beautifully clean and relaxing inside, and the front deck overlooking the fields was such a calm and peaceful place to sit with an incredible view. Sandra was very easy to communicate with and offered helpful tips for our stay. Would definitely recommend!
Great place to stay. Very clean and awesome view. Very close to everything.

This has to be best airbnb we've ever stayed at! Home away from home. It was clean, modern and had everything we needed. The kitchen had all the essentials, the bed was clean and comfortable. We appreciated Sandra's attention to detail and hospitality while we were there. Cherry on top were the amazing views of the hills. Would highly recommend this place and hopefully we get to stay here again!

Sandra’s house is beautiful with a stunning view. Excellent location to explore Barossa; central to so many wineries. The house was decorated beautifully and had everything we needed. We can’t wait to visit again!
Great location and yet nicely hidden away from all the traffics of Valley. Great views and you can hear the birds in the evenings and mornings...
Such an amazing little place to stay. A perfect little getaway, highly recommend! Will definitely be returning
A lovely house, in a great location, with everything you need.
Thanks for a great stay, the property was nicer then the pictures and very clean. Good value!
Great location, tranquil and quiet while being close to all facilities. Gorgeous views of the ranges.

Sandra's place was very clean and tidy, tastefully decorated. with comfortable beds and pillows. An excellent location within easy travel times to wineries and local townships. A great view of the hills from the from verandah. Would happily stay there again.

Sandra place was awesome. Super central to the Main Street with all the bars and restaurants. It was very clean, had everything we needed and the check in was smooth. Sandra was great with communication. Couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay during our time in the Barossa.

Look no further if you appreciate a beautiful Barossa view of hills and vines. We loved our stay in this beautifully furnished, new, clean and comfortable country cottage. We cherished the luxurious beds, great shower, lovely decor, peaceful countryside surrounds and perfect location.
Gorgeous property! Perfect for our family, clean and beautifully fitted out. Great place to explore the Barossa

Look no further — this place has everything you need, it’s in the perfect spot, and Sandra is an amazing host. You’re conveniently located close to all of the best cellar doors, and it’s a cosy place to rest up after a day of tours and tastings. The place is wonderfully detailed and has a really chilled vibe. Can’t recommend enough.
A quiet gem.  Close enough to services to enjoy the Barossa,  combined with the solitude of a country outlook.  Very comfortable, clean and well equipped.  Lovely birdsong.

This is the perfect cottage to base yourself for a stay in Barossa. Close to Tanunda for convenience, but you get to look out on the vineyards from the balcony. and feel you are  miles away. The cottage has everything you need for a comfortable stay, including a full kitchen, laundry, etc - after camping in Kangaroo Island - we appreciated the comforts. Very clean and Sandra is just next door for any help, questions. Would love to go back again.

On arrival, I walked into a stunning space with wine and nibbles thoughtfully presented and music playing.
We were treated to a comfortable stay, amazing amenities including a spa bath and double shower and delicious breakfast provisions.
We enjoyed a beautiful view over the Barossa from the bedroom and woke up to wonderful natural light.
Highly recommended. Exceptional!
The Barn is absolutely lovely with very thoughtful touches. The bath with the view was a real highlight. My husband & I would certainly stay again when visiting the Barossa

We had the most wonderful time here. The place is honestly amazing - stylish, clean and spacious. The views are out of this world, what a stunning location. I cannot recommend this place highly enough, you must go!

The Barn is absolutely gorgeous. Such a cosy yet sophisticated place to stay. Everything was perfect, even down to the finest touches (including light music being played upon arrival). The views of the vineyards were Devine. Definitely highly recommend to anyone wanting a romantic getaway in the Barossa

There is simply nowhere better to stay- if you’re thinking about it stop and just book immediately! My partner and I were in the Barossa region for my birthday weekend and staying here was the cherry on top! We were in “the barn” which is absolutely stunning, with amazing views and the most incredible bath! We were blown about by all the complementary treats, breakfast and wine - such a nice touch. Our only regret is that we didn’t stay longer!

This accommodation was absolutely delightful and filled with incredible views!! My friends and I were treated to a delicious breakfast and snack hamper filled with amazing produce! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would gladly come back!

We had such an incredible stay. The property is even more incredible in person! There wasn't a detail that was missed, the fresh local produce we absolutely adored. I can't speak highly enough about our stay, we will definitely be back!!

We loved our time at the barn. View was amazing, very clean, lovely welcoming touches (nibbles and wine).
Great space for 4 guests.
Would highly recommend.
Easy drive to wineries.
Great base for a weekend in the Barossa.
Beautiful spot for a romantic getaway, the view over the vines from the bath was a particular highlight. The little fire downstairs made it very cosy on a cold night. My partner and I loved it.
Great room with stunning views. The hosts were also very accommodating when asked to help set up a few things for a surprise birthday!
Beautiful residence in a beautiful location. Hosts communicated well throughout and made the stay enjoyable and easy. Thoroughly recommended this place for a romantic getaway in the region
Amazing stay, great spot and think it is definitely worth doing for a few days

We cannot recommend this property enough, our stay was lovely and the extra touches were above and beyond our expectations. A perfect spot to base yourself in the Barossa.
Suggest you take a little longer than one night to truly enjoy this amazing experience.
Beautiful views and location, thoroughly recommended.
We absolutely loved our stay. The Barn has specular views, everything you need, very clean and well looked after property. Would definitely stay again for a splurge holiday!
Great location and has everything you need while exploring the Barossa!
Was fantastic, will come back. Beautiful view and a lovely space

Just a stunning place to stay - the barn itself is fitted with the most thoughtful touches for the most comfortable stay. It has been beautifully  renovated and is set in a garden with incredible views over the vineyards. We enjoyed every part of it - from the fluffy robes to the BBQ!

Highly recommend staying at the Barn. It’s very nicely renovated and set up with two modern bathrooms each with a big bathtub, the lavender soaps from Lyndoch are a very nice touch. We especially enjoyed the sunset views on the balcony, and relaxing in the garden. A beautiful spot. Kym and Suzie are very thoughtful hosts and stocked the fridge up with lots of breakfast goodies. Thanks for a wonderful stay!
This place is a beautiful spot to share a weekend away in the barossa. With a fire, great service and amazing views, you won't get much better than this.
Beautiful spot
Motel room as well as pool and area around is very well taken care of, good location close to town and wineries. Nice and easy communication. Recommend!!

Facilities were very clean in a quiet and we didnt swim in the pool but it looked nice and clean.  Friendly staff and very conveniently located across the road from the Saturday morning Barossa Markets.
An amazing location , close to all the Barossa tourist attractions. Our room was clean, had all the amenities you could  think of and a real comfy bed. would highly recommend to anyone
Ease of booking, nice views and great location
The room was clean and accurate description of what is presented. Super close to all the great wineries. Recommend this place!
Will be staying here again. Excellent accommodation.

We always like staying at the Angaston Vineyards Motel. It’s in a great location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, undercover parking, and lovely grounds.

This getaway including swimming twice each day in their pool.

A perfect way end 2021.
Great location
Just as expected
The Motel was nice and the stuff really friendly, but the Bathroom could be cleaner
Nice place, beautiful scenery over vineyards
Clean, tidy, great amenities
Awsome accommodation very clean and tidy no worries at all with a family of 4
Just perfect! Everything was clean 👌.
Value for money. Good pool and suitable for kids.

Great clean and comfy space in a peaceful setting with amazing views. Wineries were only a short drive away and deck was the perfect spot to enjoy both a wine at the end of the day and a coffee the following morning.  Will be back to stay again!

Couldn't have been happier with the stay. It's a newly built, well finished space with brilliant views of the vineyard to wake up to each morning. Little touches like the freshly cut flowers from the garden, locally sourced ingredients for a breakfast (which were absolutely delicious!), made the stay! Comfortable queen bed, great aircon and close to all that Barossa has to offer. Will be back again in winter time!

Vineyard Views is the perfect spot for a weekend getaway. Karl went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed, providing us with local produce and beautiful views of his vineyards. Spacious, comfortable and luxurious amenities. Will definitely be coming back!
Great Accommodation that was very well presented. The honey for breakfast in the morning was a nice touch!

We had an amazing stay at Karl’s property in the Barossa. Very clean and the breakfast supplies were such an unexpected surprise and very delicious. I recommend everyone to check this place out if you’re ever looking to stay in the Barossa.

Vineyard Views is a great property with a lovely outlook in a central location, perfect for couples looking to spend a weekend exploring the Barossa. Karl is a responsive host, and the space is clean, modern and well equipped - we particularly enjoyed the kitchenette and local produce for brekkie! A small thing worth noting is that property is located in a shed in the backyard of the main house, with a small privacy screen seperating the two spaces. This wasn't a major deal, but did make the deck feel less selculded. Overall, we had a great time at Vineyard Views and would recommend Karl's place to anyone visiting the Barossa.
Had a lovely weekend stay at Vineyard views. Close to all the Barossa valley vineyards, had everything you needed and beautiful views. Thanks Karl!

Strategic location, just 10minutes to restaurants n famous winery. Less travelling time, means more time to explore. Place is fantastic, clean and fully equip kitchen. Luxury but not over doing it. Comfortable and spacious. Like the natural theme and sundeck to have drink or two or three, so close to vineyard.

Absolutely incredible. Having been to the Barossa a few times previously, staying at Karl’s place has made this time the most special.
The apartment is awesome, super clean and comfortable and incredible views of the surrounding vines - especially at sunset.
Karl was really friendly and welcoming (as were Jazzy and Ginger) - he even bailed us out when we arrived too late to get food anywhere.
We really, really didn’t want to check out. 100% recommend.
Lovely space and in a good location, with lots of local insight!
Had a great time! Thanks for having us :)

My partner and I were beyond impressed with our stay at Vineyard Views! Everything from the styling to the surprise breakfast goodies were a hit - and the incredible views go without saying. The location is also great - we stayed in for dinner to be able to enjoy it all but we easily would have been able to get outselves around to local eateries. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for accommodation in the Barossa and hope to go back ourselves.
Karl’s place was lovely, the place is beautiful set in amongst the grape vines. Karl was very helpful and attentive. Could not recommend more.

Karl is a very warm host. We really liked the accommodation. The accommodation is perfect for exploring the Barossa Valley. We had top wineries nearby. Hentley Farm Wines, Hayes Family Wines, Henschke, ... In the evening we enjoyed the most beautiful sunset on the terrace and we discovered many kangaroos next to our accommodation. We had a delicious breakfast from Karl in the fridge. Homemade honey, bread, bacon, eggs, tomatoes and butter. We love it and we will come back! Thank you so much Karl!

Karl is a fantastic host and the place is a perfect little getaway in the heart of wine country. Everything you need is there and it’s sparkling clean. Beautiful produce supplied for breakfast and hanging on the deck with Ginger the cat is extremely relaxing... highly recommended!
A beautiful view, a great location, the space is stylish and we were provided with some delicious breakfast treats! Highly recommend a stay here

We had a lovely stay among the vineyards! Such a beautiful view and peaceful spot! Communication was amazing leading up & throughout our stay & the house was extremely clean and well presented! Looking forward to staying again in the future, Thank you!!
This is a hidden gem! A great location topped off with great hospitality from Karl.
Great stay! We loved the area and loved the view of the vineyards! Very good heater in the cold weather it was toasty indoors! Thanks for the stay!

Exceeded all expectations! Karl was so hospitable and the amenities were amazing. The heater works an absolute treat. We especially appreciated the gorgeous local produce for breakfast and the special visits from Lucy the dog and Ginger the cat. Wonderful experience, highly recommend!
Nice location for an authentic Barossa experience with vineyards right out the window. Lovely hosts and friendly people. Absolutely recommend.

Vineyard Views is situated in a gorgeous location on Menglers Hill looking across the valley toward Nurioopta, surrounded by vines, sheep and great views. It's the perfect spot if you're looking for something a little secluded but still a close drive to the wineries and sights of the Barossa and Eden valleys. Karl was a welcoming host and the accommodation was first class - cosy, modern and very comfortable.

Vineyard Views has amazing views of the Barossa Valley and even better views of the vineyards. The place was really clean and lovely, the fresh breakfast was really nice as well, would go there again!

The accommodation was great! Nice and clean when we arrived, the view was amazing and we loved the added breakfast too. The location of the accommodation was perfect. 10 - 15mins away from everything!

We loved our stay at Vineyard Views. The place was clean, well equipped and Karl was extremely responsive, and very helpful. We enjoyed meeting the resident cat and dog and the views were lovely. We would not hesitate to come back, and will certainly recommend this place to anyone looking for a private getaway in the Barossa.
This place was absolutely stunning!! The views were incredible and you could easily get around to all the local attractions.

We had an amazing weekend staying at Karls place! The location is perfect, close to all the main attractions and wineries with a beautiful view over the vines. The added milk and breakfast was a great touch. Would stay again.
Very neat and stylish space with everything you could need. Stunning views and very friendly and accommodating hosts. Can’t recommend more!

Karl and Natalie's place is sparkling clean and neat, with an incredible view and a stunning sunset. The shower was great and the bed was so comfortable. There were nice little touches like flowers and  organic honey with breakfast. We would highly recommend staying at Vineyard Views. XY
A perfect place to stay for a Barossa trip- well located, and stunning deck to sit and enjoy the products of the region!
Highly recommend this to anyone that’s after a peaceful retreat in the Barossa Valley
Comfortable, relaxing getaway! Would highly recommend.
Vineyard Views is the perfect romantic stay. Highly recommend!
Amazing place, there is a attached shed that lets you know it's there when it's windy, but with that aside I can highly recommend the stay. The best value for money

We loved how clean the place was. Easy directions to find the place. Karl was also very friendly and the welcome goodies were a very nice touch. Overlooking the wines really set the relaxing mood for the weekend.
Karl’s place is perfect for a few nights away. A short 10 minute drive to shops and close to some amazing vineyards. The space is modern, clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay again!
Stylish and comfortable space. Amazing views. Sparkling clean. Recommended.
A perfect place to stay in the Barossa. The balcony over looking the vineyards is something special. The place is very clean and well presented.

Lovely clean space that is reasonably close to everything in the barossa. Karl and Nat were attentive and made sure we had a welcoming stay. We made best friends with their sooky ginger cats that just wanted lots of pats. Even the dog came up for a nice pat during our short stay. Will be using this at our next stay for sure

A fantastic place to stay, quiet and secluded with beautiful views. Close to all the wineries and towns. Beautiful living spaces and lovely little touches make it a warm and comfortable place to stay. Highly recommend.

Our stay at Vineyard Views was definitely one to remember!!
The location and views were absolutely stunning, and the house was clean and tidy.
We were greeted by the family cat who joined us for a cuddle or two.
We also later met Nat who was so lovely.
The little extras like breakfast supplies definitely added to the visit.
We will definitely be visiting the Barossa in the future and this would be the only place we would stay!
Super clean and modern! Lovely hospitality! Would 100% stay again!
Fantastic place and a wonderful setting! Couldn’t have asked for more, the finishing touches and the delicious local food to cook for breakfast was added beautiful touches!

Such a nice place to stay. The deck and the views over the vineyard was a great place to both start and end the day.
Karl and Natalie were so accommodating and were such nice hosts, going out of their way to look after us. The selection of local produce was also a lovely touch.
Unfortunately our stay was cut short and both Kyle and Nat were very helpful and understanding. We’ll definitely be back to spend some more time there.

Beautiful space with beautiful views.
Easy and quick to get everywhere through the taxi company up there.
Perfect for the few nights we were there to get to explore different areas of the Barossa.
Would definitely recommend

Wonderful setting and stylish layout. A beautiful view to make your home in the Barossa for a few days. Karl was very welcoming and the touches like homemade honey and local bacon were extra special. Have no hesitation in recommending.

Perfect location for a peaceful stay in nature, set right amongst the vineyard with beautiful views and amazing night skies.

Karl was super helpful with great recommendations and really quick communication

We had an absolutely excellent stay at Karl’s place. The local breakfast produce was very thoughtful and much appreciated. The location of the place was perfect to explore what the Barossa has to offer. We would definitely stay again.
A little hidden gem! Peaceful and very comfortable, with an amazing sunset to boot.
This place is an absolute gem. 5-10 minutes from Tanunda, you can soak in the best views of the Barossa valley. Comfortable, quiet accommodation while enjoying a glass of wine on the deck. Bliss!

Vineyard Views was a great place to stay! Amazing property overlooking the valley, the host was very easy to communicate with, and the breakfast board was with local and farm fresh goods was a really nice touch. Perfect for a little getaway for two to the Barossa.

Karl and Nat are incredible hosts - they want to ensure that you have the most enjoyable stay possible. I would describe them as the epitome of true South Australian warmth and hospitality.

“Vineyard Views” is the most spectacular Barossa Valley AirBNB. It felt like a dream come true to stay in a place where I could enjoy an al fresco dinning space and overlook the vineyards. Get your camera ready for those exquisite sunsets.

I adored the layout inside as well. It is incredibly spacious and comfortable. I loved the stylish colour schemes that added to a wonderful experience.

The location is perfect as you are only a short drive to several wineries, the Mengler’s Hill Sculpture and Barossa Adventure Parks.

Thank you so much for ensuring that I had a brilliant first time in the Barossa.

Karl and Nat’s place is amazing, great view with everything you need. Beautiful breakfast with local produce and coffee machine. Communication was super easy and quick.

Location is perfect, close many great wineries and restaurants.

Their hospitality was above and beyond, highly recommend and would definitely stay again :)

A great little spot to stay while we toured the Barossa. Just a short drive from the town and from many great wineries! The space was beautiful, and the little breakfast bits and pieces we discovered on our arrival that Karl had left for us was a really nice touch. We would happily stay again.

We absolutely loved our stay at vineyard views. The self contained accommodation was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay... Including delicious local goods for our breakfasts! The view from the deck was beautiful and we were really able to relax and feel like we were on holidays. Karl and Natalie were excellent hosts and we would recommend their place to anyone visiting the barossa.

Highly recommend this beautiful vineyard stay with amazing views sunrise to sunset and amazing hospitality as well not to mention being so closes to majority of vineyards only a 5-10 minutes drive , we would definitely stay again and recommend everyone to try the experience.
Accommodating hosts and an incredible space and view. I would highly recommend to anyone!

Newly renovated barn, stylish decor, immaculately clean with absolutely everything you’d need. Stunning views from the deck of the vineyard and rolling hills. Lovely hospitality with fresh eggs, bacon etc for breaky! Could not recommend more!
Thanks Karl, my parents loved their weekend away!
The perfect location for vine-side ambience, 10mins from the centre of Tanunda. Our evening spent on the deck overlooking the valley was a highlight of our trip. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Great views of vineyard, lovely quiet getaway. 10 minute drive to many wonderful restaurants and cafes.

Where do I even start on how amazing this spot is.

We came to the Barossa for our Honeymoon, as we arrived we were greeted by Karl for a quick gday. It was great to know who he was and where we were staying. Karl was great on the text and communication with us and happy for a call or text anytime.

The actual room itself was 10/10 with all the little comforts you want.
To start with the photos are spot on, walking out from your lounge area you are directly on the deck very close to Karl’s vineyard. Awesome to have a bottle of wine at the end of the day right on a real working vineyard.

The whole room is brand new, high ceilings. We however loved the little things like;
- free wifi
- Apple TV with the ability to sign into Netflix
- real, big towels and bath mat for the shower
- really good strong shower with hot water
- powerpoints right beside the bed for Charing phones etc.

Karls hospitality was sensational. He answered any questions we had and really went above in beyond with us which we can’t thank him enough for.

We were left in peace the whole time did not see any of Karl or his family unless we wanted to.

All the taxi’s we got to and from town knew the address from previous guests and we didn’t have to explain where to go or how to get there.

This is like a classic Air BnB experience but revamped to the 21st century.

You will not find another place like this for the price.
We will be back for sure. it was absolutely amazing
Charming accommodation set beautifully amongst the vineyards. My partner and I would definitely stay here again. Thank you Karl, you were most welcoming.

Vineyard views was just magical. Looking over the 180 degree views of the vineyard from the deck over a glass of wine was very special indeed. The place was sparkling clean, stylish and spacious and exceeded all expectations. Karl and his family were lovely and hospitable (we even received some treats from the Easter bunny) and the fresh local produce for breakfast was divine. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a picturesque, private stay just out of town.
Highly recommend!!! A very comfortable, cozy little place to stay close everything you need! Thanks Karl, we’ll be back!!
Our stay at the Barossa was exceptional, especially for my first time. The views at the property are gorgeous and peaceful. The space is new and very homey, will definitely go back.
Great spot! Amongst the vines, beautiful sunsets 🌅

A lovely place to stay in a fantastic location in amongst the vines, and in the heart of the Barossa. The accomodation was clean and spacious. Karl and Natalie are great hosts. We couldn’t have asked for any more for our first trip to the Barossa Valley.
Great place to relax in the Barossa. Highly recommended.

We really enjoyed our stay with Karl.  The accommodation was excellent and views of the valley were exceptional.  Karl was a great host and communication was excellent.  Would recommend this accommodation to anyone visiting the Barossa Valley

The accommodation was amazing, I would highly recommend the place! Karl and Natalie were great hosts!  Amazing views of the vineyards and great sitting areas outside. Location was great - very central most the of the wineries are 5 - 10 minutes on either side (drive) . I loved the little details - such as different colored towels/shower cap,    kitchen is well stocked in terms of equipment etc and breakfast was local and amazing.  I will surely stay here again when I come back to the Barossa! And will miss Ginger the cat who used to drop by here and there :-)

Karl’s place was perfect for a visit to the Barossa valley. Perfectly secluded and quiet, and only a 5-10min drive to wineries and surrounding towns. The place was sparkling clean and comfortable, we will be back :)

Though the flat is located at the back of the family house - because of the size of the property it feels  completely private. We loved the deck area, lovely viewing spot for the sunset, star gazing, or just to listen to the country quietness. A unique spot located in a vineyard and very central to Barossa attractions.
A quiet and serene place.

Nothing but great things to say about our stay at Karl’s property. The set up is exactly as pictured and offers travellers a beautifully authentic experience in the Barossa. We enjoyed wines on the deck watching the sunset over the vibes every day. Incredible! Also appreciated the thoughtful touches like fresh bread, eggs, bacon and local honey. Would love to stay again and will recommend highly!

A great place to stay in the Barossa and close to everything. It is very spacious, clean and has a beautiful view of vineyards. It was also very private even though it is located behind the family home. Karl, the host is lovely and his small touches (locally sourced breakfast ingredients, fully equipped kitchen and Apple TV) made the stay even more enjoyable.
We had an amazing stay! It was so beautiful, very clean and Karl was an incredible host! I would highly recommend!
Everything was great - bed comfortable, cosy, clean, warm, peaceful & great views, a really enjoyable stay Thank you!
Such a beautiful place to stay at whilst being at the perfect location and amazing view !

I have stayed in a lot of Airbnb’s but this one was superb…Great location…authentic experience..comfy bed and brand new renovation..Karl grows grapes for the wineries and you surrounded by his vines …Natalie works in one of the local vineyards and they are fabulous hosts..Everything is provided from the eggs grown on the farm & local produce…first class natural experience and thanks so much for making our trip so memorable

Awesome little space with an amazing view ! Hosts also super friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting top notch accommodation surrounded by quiet, country serenity, not to mention the vineyard views !
The guest suite was so comfortable with a beautiful view from the deck! Loved our stay :)
Wonderful and cozy spot perfect for a Barossa getaway! Great location and beautiful views from the balcony! Would highly recommend staying here at this warm and welcoming little spot!
Amazing views, clean and neat properly perfect for a couples getaway

Loved our 2 night stay at Karl's place. Such a quiet peaceful spot and the views are just gorgeous. Located just outside Angaston on the rise of Menglers Hill we were treated with amazing vistas on our drives to and from the property and from our verandah space. Vineyard views surrounded us with happy sheep being the only sounds heard.

Comfy well thought out accommodation space with everything we needed. We didnt cook for ourselves but treated ourselves to supporting local cafes and restaurants. Can highly recommend a meal at Casa Carboni and the cakes and breads at El Estanco in Greenock are stunning!
We had a wonderful stay. The location was very quiet and peaceful. Really clean and neat and had all the basics you need. Great proximity to wineries and food options. Highly recommended!
This place is a gem. Pictures do not do this place justice. Awesome location and some beautiful friendly animals.

Great location with beautiful views of the vineyards and lovely modern and comfortable furnishings. Impeccably clean and the fixings for a local breakfast were a great addition. Karl was a great host and Vineyard Views is a perfect weekend getaway.
Fantastic spot! Great location! Hosts are helpful and very easy going, and they aren’t lying about it being the best spot to see the sunset in the Barossa 😍
Fabulous accommodation in the heart of the Barossa with breath-taking views. Karl is a great host and the place is immaculate and cosy and perfect for a weekend getaway.

Fabulous little hideaway nested amounts a vineyard....stunning outlook.  Property very clean; well appointed furnishings, lovely soft bedding. Nice size bathroom with all necessary amenities supplied.   Very enjoyable 2 night stay.
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at vineyard views. Excellent hosts, a clean and modern space and breath-taking views😍
Booked a weekend and this place for my parents - they loved it! Had everything they needed for a weekend in the Barossa and beautiful views. Will be booking again!
We had a great stay here. Lovely location, neat and tidy accommodation. Would definitely recommend!

We had such a lovely stay at Vineyard Views. The accommodation had everything we could have needed and it’s easy to see why Karl is a super host! He was clear and very responsive with his communication and went out of his way to check on us when we arrived later than expected. The accommodation was very clean, well-appointed and opened out on to a deck with a stunning view! We’d love to come back for longer next time.

Great spot with lovely views across vineyards and down towards Angaston.  Afternoon sun cuts across the vineyards and onto the surrounding paddocks and is so beautiful. A very rural vista. Accm is lovely and new, plus was super clean. Bathroom is spacious and shower was lovely. Hosts provided beautiful local breakfast provisions and there is a Nespresso (no microwave). We had some variable weather (warm and cold) but the accm was really well insulated and the temp stayed perfect.  Wireless and AppleTv worked great. We enjoyed some cuddles out on the deck with Ginger the cat (she is not allowed in the accm). She seems to love coming to greet all the guests! Karl was a great host and good with communication. We also highly recommend Casa Carboni in Angaston. Fabulous food and super friendly hosts/chef.
A perfect retreat tucked away in the vines, yet close to many Barossa gems!  Vineyard Views is modern, comfy and clean, with everything you could need for a short or long stay. Thanks Karl!

Vineyard views was absolutely wonderful!! Amazing views, peaceful, exactly what we needed. Very comfortable, cosy and well equipped. The eggs and bacon for breakfast were a lovely touch!
Great communication with Karl, the host! He is very friendly and stopped by to say hello!
So much to explore in the area! And a great deck to relax and enjoy sunset at the end of the day. Highly recommend Karl’s place!!

Beautiful stay if you’re after a more secluded, peaceful and scenic accommodation. Location is still amongst everything good. Nothing is more than a 10-15 min drive & cabs come right up to the accommodation, they know it’s there. The brekky condiments included gave us meals both mornings which was a great personal touch. Very clean and has everything you need. You’re stay is set in the vineyards so it makes for a lovely view when you’re out on the deck enjoying the sun. Ginger the cat loves the attention!!   Overall super stay and would go back.

This is a must stay spot! 5 stars!
Beautiful setting overlooking the vineyards.
Perfect setting for a glass of wine at the end of a day in the Barossa.

This residence, only minutes from Angaston and luscious wineries is just wonderful. The creation of a private space with all amenities one requires for a stay in the Barossa has been executed very well. Not to mention, the location and view from the deck is beautiful! Well worth a look for your next, private and serene Barossa Valley stay.
Loved the stunning views! Place was very clean and had everything we needed. Central to the main towns and fresh eggs were a nice touch. Thanks for having us!
Amazing property with spectacular views. Feels very private and close to everything you could need
We had an AMAZING stay here! Great location, beautiful views and super friendly hosts.  Couldn’t recommend this place enough for an enjoyable stay in the Barossa!
Beautiful location! Close to many wineries and very friendly hosts that offered many recommendations on wineries, sight seeing and tours. Thankyou!
great place, scenic and private
Terrific place to stay for a relaxing Barossa weekend.

Karen was amazing & made everything easy.
She went above & beyond for breakfast provisions.
The presentation is famtastic, the cottage had everything & more, felt like home!
.
A great little place to stay if you're visiting the Barossa. The host was amazing with breakfast supplied, it was much appreciated and kept us going before and between our wine tours.
Beautiful new home with amazing facilities- very good location! Jay was lovely and so helpful with recommendations and where to eat and tour

Fantastic spot for larger groups.
House was very clean and had all the things we needed.
Water pressure was AmAzInG 🙂

Our stay in Jay's house was excellent. House was spotlessly clean, very stylish and spacious, and had great amenities.
Jay was very responsive and helpful, and was an excellent host.
I couldn't recommend a place more highly for groups wanting a place to stay in the heart of the Barossa Valley.

My family and I had a wonderful stay. The place was very clean and offered everything you would want with a home away from home.
Great place for children with walking tracks and playground close by.
A lovely and spacious home, perfect  for a small family or group of friends.
Fantastic house in a convenient location. Would definitely stay again!
Stayed overnight with a group and we all loved this house. Clean, affordable, modern, and the host was incredibly helpful! Will definitely be back.
Great spot, house is so spacious and the layout is great for a group of people. Nice back patio and lawn with a bbq as well. Loved it!

Jay was the perfect host,
So accomodating and easy to communicate with. The house was extremely beautiful, spacious and clean. I would recommend staying here if you are ever in the Barossa and we will definitely be back :)
A large house, sufficient rooms, a spacious backyard, fully equipped kitchen etc etc. all that you need for a good holiday.
Great place
Enjoyed our stay in the Barossa, Thank you Jay, your home is clean and quiet will plenty of room for a few people.Will recommend and hope to stay again one day!
Very nice and clean as advertised
Jay's place was very comfortable and spacious. Had everything we needed and is in central location for trips to wineries around the barossa.

Ben's place (Triple Creek) is literally in the middle of a vineyard - beautiful home, stylish with plenty of space!!! very private, but only a short drive to the local town.  We loved our time here and it was a perfect place for us to hold our Camino Reunion and relax after a day of exploring and wine tasting throughout the region.   We loved it!  Thank you!
Beautiful location & plenty of room for many guests. Lovely spacious rooms & comfortable beds. Very bright rooms so makes for an early rise.

We had a fantastic stay at Triple Creek house - the house was huge, very well equipped and with excellent views of the vineyards. Ben was also an excellent host and quick to reply to all our questions. Thank you Ben!

It was an absolutely stunning location with vineyards surrounding the property. The home fit us perfectly with ample space. I would highly recommend staying at Triple Creek! Thanks to Ben for your great communication.
Good location, nice view, very warm hospitality.
Beautiful stylish house in a quiet locale, in the heart of a premier wine growing region. Lots of space to relax & enjoy.
Wish we stayed longer. Amazing views. Perfect for a group or a large family. Will be back soon
Lovely hpuse, great location
I would highly recommend staying at Triple Creek Wines! The views were stunning and the house was spacious and comfortable! Perfect for a group trip of four couples! Ben is fantastic!
Great place. Beautiful home.
Very spacious, great views, modern amenities and well equipped

We were blown away by this place. It was even better than we had hoped. The house is very spacious. Wonderful for a family getaway. And the view of the surrounding hills is quite a sight to wake up to. I loved that it was peaceful as there are no close neighbours. However, you are only a short drive from the main strip in Tanunda. Very handy for dashing in and out of town. Would highly recommend and we hope to visit again.

The house is nice but a bit tired. The house was full of millipedes mostly outside but a significant amount inside as well. Both toilets were blocked by the time we left. The house location is nice but on a long dirt track so a bit bumpy. The blinds in the rooms are not block out and we could see the blue sky through them so expect to wake up whenever the sun comes up. Overall it's a nice place and very big but for the price we paid I don't think it was great value for money.
Beautiful location
Lovely location in amongst the vineyard.
Great location and prompt responses to any messages/questions.
Fantastic location, beautiful views. Highly recommend.
Lovely accommodation for couples. Spacious,clean and in great setting.

Triple Creek is well located for a time in the Barossa if you want to spend more time out of the house than in. It's spacious and the beds are comfortable and the linen fresh. There was however a very unpleasant smell of plastic / vinyl which needed to be expelled from the house every time we went in. This unfortunately brought many of the bugs in - and there were a lot! Provision  of little things, like insect repellent, coffee, sugar, normal tea bags (only green or earl grey was provided), more than one tea towel, cling wrap, a vegetable peeler, or sieve would have made it a little more comfortable. The outside area was not really pleasant or user friendly with the verandas being quite narrow. A little too expensive for what we thought it was / provided.
Great place, super spacious, lovely grounds!

Loved this place, such a unique experience staying on your own vineyard in the heart of the Barossa. The house is large, modern and well fitted out but the real star is the location among the vineyards
The place was in an ideal location. Within close proximity to all the other wine cellar locations. The house was supper comfy with all things included. Great place

Amazing getaway!
If you want to escape the city life, this is definitely the place to do it
Loved staying amongst the vineyards.  Great central location to explore the Barossa Valley.

We loved our time at Ben’s place! He was a great communicator from booking to check in.

The house was great, so much room for our group of 6 adults & 4 kids.

We would definitely book again & recommend to others
This place was so wonderful. Being in the middle of the vineyard and away from other buildings was sp refreshing. Wish we could have stayed longer.
Huge space - great for groups!
Sooo big! Amazing for my bridal party to get ready in the morning!!
Beautiful place and such a lovely location.
Huge place, beautiful views, very peaceful. Had a great stay

Fantastic place, really spacious!
Lovely and quiet ... great get away !
Excellent time experience with family and friends

Exceptionally large house set on a beautiful vineyard. We couldn't believe it was all for us when we arrived! Fairly modern, very comfortable beds and a great kitchen, bbq and living spaces! This was the perfect base for our group trip to the Barossa and close to most major vineyards and local towns. We would return!! Thank you.

We had a great couples weekend away whilst in the area for a wedding. Great location just outside of tanunda! Nice peaceful and private location with plenty of room.
Only thing we’d change would be adding some blockout curtain or blinds. The morning sun was a little unwelcome so early in the morning.

We had a great time at Triple Creek guest house. The house was huge and had everything we needed. Able to stay in the working vineyard in the heart of Barossa region was unique experience, which we enjoyed greatly.

Great secluded property in the middle of a vineyard. Waking up to the sound of birds every morning was a delight.

Ben and his team are very helpful and respond quickly to communication.

4 separate bedrooms plus large living spaces make it a good house for a large family or a house party.

This place is huge! We easily fit a group of 4 adults and 3 kids and had plenty of space for everyone. The fire pit and tree swing were huge hits with the kids! The beds were comfortable, but you may like to bring a spare blanket or two with you if you’re a cold sleeper as we couldn’t find one anywhere.
The kitchen has plenty of space for several people to be in there at once, but if you plan on using it to cook proper meals then make sure you bring any utensils or specific items you need with you (eg. Serving spoon, wooden spoon, grater, strainer, salad bowl, baking paper, glad wrap) as these aren’t provided.
The location is perfect - quiet and secluded, yet only 5 mins to Tanunda or Nuriootpa. Watching the changing light across the hills at sunrise and sunset was lovely.
Dorham was very quick replying to messages and we really enjoyed our stay at his place.
A big home in a stunning setting. Cooking facilities made our stay particularly easy, communication was swift and the facilities were great. Made for a perfect weekend for our group

Great place to stay for a big family or large group of friends. Highly recommended.
We look forward to staying there again!
