A spacious delightful open spaced 2 bedroom house. Very clean with comfortable beds and large en-suite. It is in walking distance to Angaston and very close to the start of the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle path. Highly recommend this Airbnb
A beautiful renovation of an interesting building in an excellent location. We had a great time!
Fantastic place with very unique features. The place was very clean and luxurious. Will definitely book again!
Loved our stay here, a unique and stylish space but very comfortable with everything you need. Location was great, peaceful and private and a plethora of birdlife to enjoy.
Loved this place!
Fantastic place, perfect for two couples. ensuites were incredible!
Such a great place to stay!

The Auction Shed is a beautiful property - you feel like you are in the country but still within an easy walk of the town.  It is worth noting that the bedrooms (which are lovely) do not have to the ceiling walls so noise does travel, however, sitting on the deck of a night looking out at the view more than makes up for this.  We would definitely stay again.

Lovely property in a great location right near Angaston town centre. Close to all the sights of the Barossa and a very thoughtfully designed property with great facilities for two couples. Highly recommended!

Jasmine's Auction Shed was amazingly authentic. If you ever wanted to stay at an unique and interesting accommodation, this is definitely the place for you. It is equipped with reciting you need and more! The place was very clean, but there were some bugs around which could not be helped in such an accommodation. The 2 bathrooms (and spas!) are very modern and are spotless!  Would recommend for a unique stay!

Amazing bespoke accommodation.
Fab place to stay when visiting the Barossa.
Beautiful place

What an amazing use of space. The auction shed is such a one of a kind place to stay. Peaceful and comfortable!

And Angaston is a gorgeous little town to use as your base for the Barossa.

Great location, next to Angaston village. Cool space & a view! Loved bathrooms & fireplace. Only concern is the noises (I believe it was mouse or possum) Hope this issue will be resolved. Otherwise, I would recommend

Jasmine place was absolutly amazing! Evry detail in the shed was well thoough and the vibe of the place was amazing. I'd highly recommend everyone who is looking for unusaul accomodation in Barossa region
For a unique experience I can highly recommend the Auction shed. The place is unique, rustic and extremely comfortable . The walk into the gorgeous town is easy with numerous choices for dining.
Excellent location to explore the Barossa. The shed is such a unique place to stay and it has been so well done. Comfortable bed and exceptional bathrooms. Could not recommend more.
Jasmine's place was absolutely beautiful and such a great location! An easy walk in to town but still feels nice and secluded. The goats across the fence were also a 10/10 for us!

The accommodation is very well appointed and spacious.
Great bathrooms, kitchen and beds. Highly recommended. We will be back.

Beautiful setting and amazing building with great history
Plenty of space to spread out for two couples to have their privacy
This place is incredible. Beautiful sunsets and views over the valley. Very close to great food options in Angaston. The house was wonderfully comfortable and warm. We loved it!
The auction shed is what the photos are! Every detail has been thought out and put into restoring this shed as it is now. Beautiful view and scenery!
Stunning place! very clean and has everything .. would highly recommend this to anyone

The four of us loved our stay at the Auction Shed. The location was close to the adorable town of Angaston and perfect for exploring the nearby wineries. The house itself is so unique and special and was very clean. We also loved our next door neighbours Al and Kerry the alpacas!
Loved staying here so much! Was such a unique place with a cool vibe.  It was spacious and could be made private if needed. I would definitely recommend it!
Such a cool, quirky experience! We loved staying at the Auction shed, made some amazing memories

We loved our stay at the Auction Shed. There was Loads of original character mixed with the stunning and huge bathrooms, modern kitchen appliances and beautiful views from the deck in a quiet and rural location. Would definitely go back.

A beautiful place to stay.

The location was fantastic. It felt like you were much further out of town than you actually were - in the middle of a paddock but just a 5 minute walk to excellent coffee.

Loved the outdoor shower - we were lucky enough to have singing magpies overhead.

Would definitively recommend it.
Lovely stay! Gorgeous area! Plenty to see and do. Or just stay and relax on the amazing deck out back. Highly recommend the Barossa sculpture park, and so many wonderful Cellar Doors to visit.
Great spot!
Nice unique and comfortable place to stay.  Great location.

Such a unique and beautiful couples retreat. Amazing views and the bedrooms / bathrooms are luxurious and comfortable. Perfect place to relax for the weekend and less than 10 minutes from the local shops: we will be back :) p.s love the alpacas!!
A lovely place to stay, we thoroughly enjoyed how they have renovated it keeping all the history.
Such a stunning location, and stunning home! Everything had been renovated to beautifully, and it had everything we needed to get away and relax! Would definitely stay again!
The house is amazing and the views are terrific. Well worth having a few days here.

Beautiful, unique property with high quality amenities. Perfect location within walking distance to Angaston town centre. Great for a family of four or two couples but near in mind there aren’t internal ceilings in the bedrooms so you might hear your snoring housemate lol. Would definitely stay again.

Incredible stay. Great location and very well done renno. Our two kids were very excited to be staying in an old shed and they loved the spa bath and the Alpaccas.

The Nuri-Angaston bikeway being so close was excellent as well.

Fantastic from start to finish. Jasmine was a great host with lovely touches in the property (breakfast ect). been renovated to a very high standard, outdoor shower (with lovely bird songs) and hot tub baths are lovely touches! Really enjoyed our stay, The alpacas we’re a highlight too!

Fabulous renovation of a lovely piece of local history conveniently located within walking distance of cafes, pubs, and shops. Bathrooms are gorgeous. Kitchen is complete with all appliances and the few things we needed extras of magically appeared after a quick text to Jasmine.
Stunning house in a great location! Sparkling clean and smelt amazing. Really thoughtful host with lots of good recommendations. Would definitely recommend 😊

Was an easy check in and an amazingly beautiful place to stay every little detail had been thought of and was located in such a beautiful area just out of Nuriootpa would definitely stay here again soon

We had a wonderful stay at Mel's house. She was easy to communicate with and she went out of her way to accommodate us. We appreciated all the special touches especially the banana cake she left us in the fridge. Thanks so much Mel I'm sure we will be back to stay with family or friends 🙂

Melissa's place was absolutely spotless, stylish and cosy. We stayed 2 nights with our two year old and felt right at home straight away but still got to experience those little touches of holiday luxury. The cottage is a ten-minute walk to the really pretty main street with heaps of cafes and amenities, including two beautiful playgrounds. Melissa was a dream to communicate with. I would highly recommend a stay at this perfect spot.

Melissa's cottage was the perfect backdrop for our girl's weekend away in the Barossa Valley. The cottage itself is gorgeously styled, fully stocked with everything we needed (and more!), and the extra touches were so thoughtful. Melissa's local recommendations were excellent and even though weren't able to experience them all, we can't wait to come back again to finish the list! We can't rave enough about how smooth and easy communicating with Melissa was, the location of the cottage and and how the host had thought of absolutely everything - we were so impressed and can't wait to come back!!

Mel is prompt in answering questions and has truly gone above and beyond to create a calm, relaxing and beautiful space. The backyard is picturesque and the amenities are second to none.
It’s perfect for a girls weekend away or if you’re a couple looking for a romantic get away in the Barossa.
Angaston and the Main Street has lots to offer and delicious food and coffee.
It was all the personal touches that Melissa had that truly made us feel special and made our stay extra amazing.
Couldn’t recommend highly enough and we will most definitely be back.
Fantastic stay! Wonderful hospitality, clean, welcoming home. Far exceeded my expectations.

An excellent modern house in a great location. The house had everything that we needed and Mel was a fantastic host who made our stay very special. We would definitely recommend staying here and we look forward to staying again. Thank you Mel!

Melissa is a super host. Beautiful accom. Walking distance to everything in Angaston. Mel's attention to detail is superb - so clean, folder of local tips, so many kitchen (fully equipped) and food items provided. Great washing machine (!) Well styled. Warm. Kids toys, games and books are a handy touch. Netflix was appreciated! Lovely new bathroom. Spacious outdoor area. Hubby, kids and I LOVED it.
Highly recommend. Great house with everything you need. Very clean. Great location.
Extremely thoughtful, spotless and comfortable. A lovely space! We will definitely stay again

Melissa thank you so much for your kind hospitality. Your place is in a perfect spot close to everything in Angaston. Your thoughtful touches were much appreciated. The property was spotless. We would definitely stay again and also highly recommend this property to others wanting somewhere lovely to stay. Cheers Leanne
Clean and gorgeous space! We had an amazing weekend away!

Book this charming home! We had a wonderful stay here and are already planning a return visit. It is beautifully furnished, with lots of thoughtful touches (including my favourite candle!), it is amazingly clean, has comfortable bedding and the most gorgeous outlook - we enjoyed a few cold glasses of wine admiring the view whilst our girls happily played the provided lawn games.  Everything is on your doorstep. Holiday bliss!  Mel is simply a wonderful host. 10/10 from us, thanks again!
We had a lovely stay at Melissa's place. Clean, lovely outlook in one of the nicest towns in the Barossa. Would thoroughly recommend staying there!

Melissa was an absolutely AMAZING host for my friends and I. She was super accommodating and was more than happy to go above and beyond for any request I had. The place was sparkling clean & she added some sweet touches upon arrival. For anyone looking for a beautiful little cottage to relax and enjoy a nice weekend, this is the location! I can’t recommend this place enough. Absolutely loved my time here & look forward to booking it again in the future :) thank you so much Melissa ! :)
Mel is a great host, place was clean and cozy. Some nice little touches that make you feel at home. We would recommend Mels place to anyone

Melissa’s place was fabulous. It is in a great location...you can walk into town and is only a short drive to many local wineries and other towns. Everything you need for an enjoyable comfortable stay is there. Melissa has local knowledge of the area and provides many little extras that made our stay wonderful.

Mel’s place is amazing!! Such a lovely house in a great location. Mel was very quick with communication, and left a great selection of information about Angaston and the Barossa. I highly recommend you stay here!

Thinking about staying here? DO IT!
We were so impressed with the communication - especially given I am a bit crappy with communication, missing emails and texts (I'm the person who never knows where my phone is!).
Mel even made sure the heating was on for our arrival and there were so many lovely touches like local bread, treats and wine which just made my day on arrival.
The facilities are top notch and Mel has though of all the little things.
We would so happily come back next time we are in the Barossa - great value and great location!

The Perfect location from
Which to enjoy a Barossa escape. Mel’s communication and quick communication was fantastic. Clean and stylish home with beautiful views and plenty of space to relax.

We had a wonderful stay Melissa's place. The home was beautiful, clean, and had many generous little touches.

Melissa was also very responsive and thoughtful about the public health environment. She was a fabulous host and we strongly recommend her place.

This cottage was immaculately presented and really comfortable. It was well-located with an easy walk up the main street  to the local cafes, shops, playgrounds and walking trails. Angaston is such a pretty town and close to other Barossa townships.

If you're looking for a 'home away from home' while in the Barossa, Mel's place is IT! From the quality of fittings and stylish layout to the wonderful welcome pack and information on local Angaston and Barossa attractions and activities, Mel's place had it all. It is a gorgeously renovated cottage with sparkling new bathroom and laundry, quality kitchen fittings and very comfortable beds. Mel ensured it was spotlessly clean - including extra foil in the Smeg oven to catch any drips. The house was as depicted in the photos but with much more outdoor space to which photos just don't do justice.  Sitting in either of the covered outdoor areas with views across to the sheep and alpacas grazing on the hill while listening to the cockatoos and parrots in the creek-side gum trees made us feel as if we were a million miles away - but in fact, it was only a short walk up into the main part of Angaston where there is something for everyone. Being central to many wineries, taking a taxi was easy too. There were no 'downsides' to staying at Mel's place! Easy to find, great location, excellent communication - highly recommended.
A lovely stay for a relaxing trip in the Barossa. The house is exceedingly comfortable and pretty, and Melissa was kind all the way through.

Absolutely awesome place to stay. The house is stunning and instantly put me in holiday mode. Felt like a home away from home and I really enjoyed being able to cook up a storm in the great kitchen. Would definitely recommend staying for a decent period of time to explore the area. Thanks Mel ☺️

A wonderful stay to disconnect from city daily grind. Loved the kitchen facilities, kitchenware and extra touches in pantry; we cooked a lots of meals (due to allergies) during our stay and almost used everything at least once. Lovely new appliances with Miele dishwasher and Smeg stovetop/oven and mattresses were comfortable with some feather pillows. Mel was able to accommodate a late check out request which made us and the kids so happy. A short walk to playgrounds and shops which was amazing. Loved the space of the backyard and views of the hill with animals. Recommendations and tips by Mel in the book was very helpful and yes Kiel’s have SPECTACULAR coffee! Many thanks for your great communication and being a great host Mel. Hope to stay again in the near future.
We really enjoyed our stay. The photos represented the place very well and the kitchen was particularly well outfitted. The property was very clean and well kept. Loved the outdoor area and view.

If you are looking for a property in Angaston - or the Barossa Valley in general - look no further. We have stayed in a number of Airbnb's around the Barossa and Mel's is the best we have found. Welcoming, clean, stylish, well stocked; it is pretty much everything you want in an Airbnb. Mel's communication was outstanding and she even left local wine and sourdough bread for our arrival. It is a 5 min walk to all the restaurants in Angaston and an easy drive everywhere else. Perfect for families or couples.
Mel is the definition of a superhost!

Mel's place was a wonderful place to stay at. The house was sparkling clean and extremely well appointed. We loved the outside area, which provided a fabulous playground for our 2 young children. The property is fully fenced so we didn't need to worry about our kids running out onto the street. Mel provided some little extras, that made us feel very special, including fresh bread, fruit, coffee, etc. The beds were super comfortable and we ended up sleeping better and for longer than we do at home ;). We would be back in  heartbeat!

Beautiful place to stay in the Barossa. Melissa has thought of everything, and it’s an incredibly homely place to stay. Loved the bottle of wine and treats to help us settle in on arrival. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend.

Situated at the edge of  Anguston, just a few minutes walk from the shopping, cafe precinct. Perfect stopover for the 5 of us for a couple of days. Mel was an outstanding host going beyond what is normally expected with her little homely touches. Would highly recommend!

We loved staying at Mel’s beautiful cottage on the edge of Angaston - the best Airbnb we have stayed in, hands down. Such a brilliant location, slap bang in the middle of the Barossa - right next to incredible cellar doors - and in a pretty town full of delightful cafes and equipped with the best playgrounds ever.
The cottage was homely, cosy and immaculate - Mel had supplied everything you could have asked for (including lots of tasty treats). The beds were more than comfortable, the shower was hot and powerful and the garden had lovely, rural views. It was quite hard to leave this gorgeous house. Thank you, Mel.

Thanks for welcoming us into such a beautiful home. The care and dedication that you have put into this space was evident the moment we arrived. From the welcome message in your guide book to the delicious local produce, it was the perfect touch to a great weekend. We won’t hesitate to tell all our friends and family about this place.

Wonderful, centrally located house perfect for a small group of friends or a family.

The host provided fantastic personal touches such as wine butter and cheese in the fridge.
The kitchen and bathrooms were well equipped and the bedrooms had comfortable beds.
Remote controlled outdoor blinds to block out light were another bonus.

There was also a binder of local suggestions and instructions.

We really enjoyed our stay at Melissa House in Angaston. Walking distance to the town and playgrounds.

The house was beautiful inside, great furnishings and very comfortable for our family stay. The back garden is setup perfectly for entertaining and lots of outdoor games for kids/adults.
It was very special to watch the neighbouring farmers sheep and lambs.

Lots of personal touches like fresh bread, milk, chocolates, coffee and the list goes on. Melissa communicated with us from start to finish, assisting with any questions. Thank you, Melissa. Highly recommend this stay!

We had a wonderful 3 night stay at Mel’s beautiful house. We felt so welcome with beautiful touches and goodies left for us. Such a gorgeous town, great walk in to coffee and short drives to amazing wineries. Couldn’t be more perfect. Big thanks Mel!
Lovely relaxing location with beautiful, clean amenities. Lots of information about local places to go which is much appreciated.
An amazing place to stay, with incredible attention to detail by Mel to ensure a worthwhile stay for all guests!!

Mel's house provided a cosy retreat against the cold, wet winter conditions raging outside. We certainly appreciated the central gas heating that reached through out the house and the comfortable bed to snuggle into.
Angaston itself is quite central and an easy commute to other towns and wineries. It's is a pity we didn't have time to take the Casa Carboni Italian cooking class in the main street, but we have to leave something for our next visit.

Mel was an excellent host ensuring the house was warm and welcoming upon arrival including local produce and a bottle of red wine. The location gave amazing views and quick and easy access to sights including Nuriootpa and Tanunda from the location on the edge of Angaston. An excellent family house with our young children happily exploring the backyard. Will definitely consider staying here again.

Melissa's house is absolutely adorable. We were a group of 5 adults, 4 of who travelled from the Sunshine Coast, and to have a few goodies and bottle of red wine waiting for us upon arrival was an absolute delight. The location is great, short walk to a park and the bustling town of Angaston. Every morning we sat outside in the garden admiring the peaceful view. Thank you Melissa for a lovely stay!
Beautiful house. Convenient location. Mel was easy to communicate with and clearly puts a lot of thought into the house with lots of special touches

Mel is a great host adding personal touches in her communication and our welcoming stay in the cottage. The cottage is cosy, very comfortable and has everything you could think of for a really pleasurable stay; lots of little extras. Great kitchen, wonderful shower, terrific outdoor facilities for warmer weather and plenty of space for kids to play if you're a family. And  every room very clean. Beds are very comfortable, linen excellent. 2nd toilet helpful. The cottage is in good location at the western end of the main street so easy walking distance to Angaston's shops and things of interest. Lovely outlook from the back up to the open gum studded hills with sheep to watch; lovely feel of country. Tree part way over the drive makes turning in interesting but space to turn your car in the back garden to come out facing front! We would certainly go back. Really enjoyed our stay there.
Comfy, warm beds, plenty blankets, everything you could possibly need in the kitchen, just the most comfy, Cody place to stay

Thank you Mel, our stay was just wonderful. Perfect location for little kids as we were able to walk to cafes, restaurants and most importantly the awesome Angaston playground!
Beautiful and thoughtful touches of local supplies on arrival meant we didn’t have to dash to the shops when we arrived.

Beautifully styled cosy cottage complete with a gorgeous back garden overlooking the serene countryside. Perfect location in walking distance to restaurants & cafes in Angaston as well as easy access to bike track. Our host made us feel very welcome with lots of special touches. Very comfy beds !! We will definitely return again. Thanks Mel.
Tracey

Well I think this would have to be the cleanest and well provisioned AirBnB I have ever stayed in. The house was spotless and everything you could possibly need and or expect was there, brilliant, Mel you are indeed the hostess with the most-est. We cleaned up as best we could but we were running late so didn't get a chance to clean the floors, sorry about that.  I will definitely recommend Mels cottage to anyone who needs a great place to stay in the Barossa Valley.
Beautiful home just as described. Beautiful views and thoughtful little touches throughout.

Melissa's house at Angaston is a unique treasure. With a wonderful eclectic taste in literature and music. The welcome basket including the bread, wine, biscuits, cheese, milk frutichocs. Not to mention the Vegemite and butter in the fridge were absolutely brilliant. Melissa had been there not long before we arrived and had turned the airconditioning on to ensure the house was toasty warm. It is hosts like Melissa and houses like hers that she allows others to use that will ensure the longevity of organisations like Airbnb. Melissa is organised and committed to ensuring that her guests will have the ultimate travel/ holiday experience. Thank you Melissa. Everything was perfect.
Kind Regards Neville.
Well appointed and warm cottage.
great BNB; location, fittings and presentation all excellent

My wife gave this place the ultimate compliment “the cleanest place she has ever stayed”. Lovely place very comfortable.
I was a little surprised with the amount of traffic that road carried.
Would highly recommend this to anyone.
The house was great, clean and well setup. Enjoyed the views. Would definitely recommend.
Lovely cottage, quality fixtures and fittings. Melissa was very helpful and responsive.

Lovely stay! House was very clean with awesome views. Great for kids with lots of easy access parks and playgrounds. Great hospitallity showen. Whenever i had a question Melissa was always there. Thanks again 😀

The thought and care taken by Melissa to provide guests with just the right amount of information on local areas and must sees, as well as surprise touches throughout the home made our stay perfect. Not to mention the outlook sitting outside and the sunset… wow!

The cottage is so beautiful, homely and clean - we really had the most relaxing stay. Also location was incredible in Angaston, walking distance to great cafes and the cheese shop.

Excellent accommodation. The house has everything you need, is very clean and nicely presented. It is on the main road, but the noise didn’t bother us at all. We all loved the shower- amazing water pressure. Would definitely come back and stay again.
Melissa place is very comfortable and clean, with great amenities and goodies. Would recommend perfect location close to Saltrams and close to the town, lovely outdoor area.We will be back :-)

highly recommend this little cottage, fell in love straight away
Great host and great place ❤️
We will be back 🙂

A great spot! A clean house with a great outside area with lovely views. Perfect location to get out and explore as everything is in walking distance along the main street. Mel was very good with communication and left us a wonderful note as we got married. Would highly recommend.

Mel’s cottage is ideal for a visit to the Barossa. Comfortable, beautifully presented, a great shower, and a range of places to sit and relax. We really enjoyed sitting outside and relaxing together. Was appropriate for our 18 month old too.
Mel was a kind, friendly and generous host. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
We stayed over Christmas and were amazed and delighted with the attention to every detail.  This was easily the best Airbnb, both in and outdoor.  Thank you Mel and family for the wonderful homestay.

Mel’s place is spotless and well stocked with all the essentials. It is in a perfect location to explore the Barossa. Mel’s communication was amazing and we really appreciated the little things she did to make our stay even more enjoyable. We highly recommend staying here!
Beautiful spot to get away and enjoy some fresh air. Drinks on the deck, watching the sunset was lovely 😊

Sharon’s cabin was exactly what we were after.
Cosy and clean with great amenities.
Would highly recommend
Would highly recommend staying here for a weekend break in the Barossa. Fantastic location, delicious goodies in the fridge for breakfast
Excellent proximity to local wineries. Cabin was nice and modern with a shared community feel. Check in and out was a breeze.
Beautiful space perfect size for a couple and the spa bath was a highlight!
A perfect getaway from the city life. My partner and I enjoyed our little holiday. Loads of experiences around the area. We will definitely be visiting again and recommending friends.

Great location. Just a short taxi to The Louise for a great dinner and close to some excellent wineries for tasting. Walking distance to Fino for lunch. Wonderful goodie basket on our arrival with terrific breakfast provisions. Dolce Gusto coffee machines with some pods provided. It was super hot outside and the aircon coped really well. A great little weekend away.
Wonderful cozy space. Would love to come back.
Sharon’s place was clean and tidy. Perfect location for the Barossa wine region!

A great studio cabin which is very well placed for the local wineries and very stylishly furnished. Very clean with a good range of amenities and kitchen accessories. We had a little trouble with wifi dropping out
Perfect spot right next to the wineries. Everything you need has been thoughtfully provided, great space! Will be returning when in the area
awesome location!
Very nice place in a very great location, would definitely recommend!
Amazing little cabins had an awesome weekend! Thanks guys!
Amazing place would highly recommend
Clean room, was unfortunate that we couldn't reschedule our booking due to a canceled balloon flight.
Nice location, close to wineries, comfortable accommodation.
Perfect location!
A great place to stay! Very close to everything and easy to find.  The place was spotless and stylish. Sharon was a great host! Would definitely stay here again!
Lovely space in a great location. The breakfast produce was an added bonus! So lovely. Would definitely recommend :)
A fabulous stay in the heart of the Barossa. Perfectly clean with all the amenities and items you need. The personal touches of recommendations and a food hamper was an added bonus!

Feels like a onsite cabin you could find at a caravan park on the outside but stylish, clean and modern on the inside.
Amazing hamper on arrival was very welcoming.
Comfortable stay with great access to the Barossa. Many wineries in walking distance. Complimentary breakfast was a nice touch.
Great place
Great location, very clean and the fire place was great! Would recommend!
A good one night stay cabin in a beautiful part of the Barossa.
Cozy and adequate place for stay over.
A comfortable cabin in Seppeltsfield. The property is a commercial property. Unfortunately the bath plug was missing and use of the spa bath wasn't possible this time.

A very clean and cosy cabin to stay in, in one of the prime spots of Barossa. Easy seamless booking and check in process. Place actually looked nicer in person than the photos do it justice. Definitely recommend if your looking for something cute but affordable
Lovely space for a getaway. Sharon was very good at communicating and very accommodating.
We had a lovely stay! Very clean and close to everything. Thanks Sharon 😊
Amazing stay thank you

A beautiful and special cabin. Loved the whirlpool spa! Very convenient that firewood is provided and that there's a community bbq. It's in a great location, only a short walk Seppeltsfield winery. Would definitely stay here again!!
Comfortable and affordable stay. With an amazing spa bath
Not bad, good location in the heart of the barossa valley.. But for the price, we were expecting a little more
Great location and cute little cabin! Was perfect for our stay
Just as described. Good location, clean and spa was a nice touch. Breakfast provided for one day too was a nice touch.
Lovely stay! Loved the animals nearby and the breakfast too! Sharon was easy to communicate with and we will definitely go back!

It was a lovely stay, a pretty location looking over the field of animals and vineyards. We felt it was a little overpriced compared with other homestays/cabins we’ve stayed at. It costs $30 each way for a cab into town if you both aren’t driving.  The lovely breakfast supplied was a sweet touch - very thoughtful.
Great place
We had a great time at Sharon’s place, the place was amazing with everything we needed and the cutest animals outside too. Would definitely recommend :)
Such a beautiful place with the most incredible view from the front porch. AND a delicious breakfast!
Clean, tidy, comfortable and communication was reliable

Great location for a cozy couple getaway!
The animals were a delight to interact with also.

We enjoyed our stay at Sharon’s place. Hosts were very responsive to an issue we had with power and rectified this quickly for us! A nice walk to seppeltsfield winery :). Nice and peaceful with great views of vineyard and paddocks. Amenities were better than expected - eg. Toaster, electric frypan, breakfast food provided.
Simple accomodation with what you need for an overnight stay. Great location.In walking distance to a few great wineries.

Poor communication -was unable to contact hosts / new operators had failed to update phone numbers on the Airbnb website. Therefore we could not  contact them or access  the accommodation. Don't be fooled by the 'Super host' label as it refers to previous operators.  From the outside the cabins look no better than a shabby caravan park. Host is unwilling to negotiate any sort of refund. Very disappointing!
Helpful hosts. Nice location
Lovely stay, would definitely come back and recommend.

Great spot and in a perfect location. We really enjoyed exploring Seppeltsfield.
Comfortable and cosy cabins highly recommend!
Clean and comfortable country accomodation within easy walking distance of Hentley Farm restaurant and winery (and others too of course). We will go again!
Cute small cabin conveniently located to spend the day out exploring the beautiful region. Nice views and relaxing.
Really nice place, clean and cosy. The fire place is amazing and the hot tub is really nice as well. The bed is so comfy. Private with a lovely view

A cute little cabin.
Love the spa bath !
Inclusion of fire wood is a nice touch

The cottage provided the perfect base for our Barossa trip. It’s close to wonderful restaurants, wineries and distilleries, and we loved going back there in the evening for a spa! The cabin was so cozy and the beautifully maintained grounds and nearby fields made the perfect view when we sat outside for a drink in the evening! Just lovely.

Extremely well-maintained, clean and beautifully located. All amenities mentioned were provided and superbly quiet! We walked to Hentley Farm and to Fino - that’s how close it is. Highly recommend this place, especially waking up to super views of the vineyards!
Comfy ,tidy and beautiful little cabin house,we had a really good night to stay there ,also the bath is so amazing to have a relax,nice view ,absolutely will stay there again when we visit next time
Great place to stay. We had everything we needed and good communication.
Excellent spot, lovely cabin!

What a great find! We spent two nights here in a Couples Cabin and were impressed by the fact that the cabin was so well equipped (not just a microwave but a cooktop and oven plus all utensils), the fridge offered not only breakfast but some welcome nibbles, the bed was comfortable, we had privacy and a pleasant outlook with a deck for eating outside and the location was ideal giving easy access to the Barossa Valley highlights.
We will definitely return and highly recommend the cottage
Excellent location and lovely accommodation

A wonderful stay in the heart of Seppeltfield! Everything was lovely and clean with plenty of thoughtful touches and modern amenities. Plus, you’re just a stones throw away from one of the biggest wineries in the region and it’s iconic palm trees!

Perfect cosy winter getaway, what with the wood fire in the bedroom and the spa bath! The bed is comfortable too and the location is fantastic for visiting nearby wine cellars. We will definitely be back and stay more than one night next time!
Fantastic little place to stay with a gorgeous view!
Perfect for a couples get away, even for a family as there was a bunk bed as well as the double bed! couldn’t recommend this beautiful little stay enough!
Great location. Sharon was quick to respond to any messages and very accomodating. Perfect spot for a quick getaway.
warm and comfortable while working away
Our favourite place to stay in the Barossa! We stayed for 2 nights this time and loved it. The cabin was welcoming and clean and we enjoyed the breakfast provisions. Will definitely be back!
scenic stay, lovely amenities and comfortable beds. very easy check-in
Thank you for having. Great location for a wedding near by. Was a good night stay.
Great place for a family adventure in the vines, or a work wind-down. Highly recommended.

Thank you Annika,
We appreciated all of your efforts to make our family holiday so enjoyable. The house was lovely and suited what we needed. I am was really grateful for all of your thoughtful touches including all the work you did to accomodate my baby daughter.

Annika’s home is beautiful and was stocked full of food, snacks, and board games! Annika was very hospitable, lovely, accommodating and responsive. The home was clean, quiet and bedding and towels were great quality. The location is also very close to the main strip. We would definitely stay there again and cannot recommend it enough!

We had a lovely weekend at Cirillo Guest House. Annika went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Our stay included a large selection of delicious breakfast foods, sweet treats, nibbles and a bottle of wine on arrival. Annika was extremely generous! All linen and toiletries were included as well as many suggestions for our stay in The Barossa Valley. The house was exceptionally clean and was in a great location. We definitely recommend to others. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Annika and Marco were incredibly generous and thoughtful hosts. Had a great stay in the Barossa!
Great location and a great house. Thoughtful ammenities and great hosts

Absolutely exceeded our expectations! Annika was so thoughtful and communicative in both the lead up to and duration of our stay. The house is incredible, amazing kitchen and dining, extremely comfy beds, and no shortage of additional touches around the house. Highly recommend.
Incredible property with lots of extra little touches. Fantastic hosts, beautiful space. Ideal setting for exploring the barossa. Thank you

We had an amazing stay. The b&b was sensational. Annika had so much food available and her general thought of our comfort requirements covered every aspect! The B&B was spacious and
clean. Annika was such an amazing host, best ever and the private session we had with her husband Marco regarding their fabulous wines was memorable. Their Grenache came from the oldest Grenache vines in the world, well what more can I say but..it was special! We will definitely be back.

We had a fantastic stay at Cirillo House - A beautiful house with everything you need, including amazing comfy beds! Enjoyed having a few Cirillo reds by the fire and having a wine tasting with Marco! Annika was a friendly and lovely host and was really accommodating - the delicious fresh food for breakfast was great! Thanks Annika and Marco, we hope to come back for another girls weekend sometime!

We had a family getaway with babies in tow, and this house had everything PLUS some! Annika was very easy to communicate with and Marco treated us to a wine tasting, which we definitely recommend. The house was sparkling clean, beds very comfortable and location was perfect for our needs (far away from noise, but close enough to all the Barossa attractions). Very happy we found Cirillo House!
This place is amazing! Very clean, comfortable and has everything you need! Be sure to pop over to Cirillo Wines just across the road 🍷

Annika has a well presented accomodation situated on the beautiful Cirillo estate. The place is well positioned being five minutes out of Nuriootpa and a stones throw from the sights and tastes of the wider Barossa region.

The house is spacious, clean and well stocked with all the amenities you could need.

We made the most of the warm afternoons and spent time relaxing on the outdoor deck, withdrawing into the house with the onset of cooler night and retiring by the fire.

This place effectively had everything we needed and more.

Honestly the best place we have stayed . Annika and Marco catered for literally every need you could think of!
The guest house was amazing, set within a great location of the vineyards on their property. They supplied breakfast and snacks which was fantastic and even a cake for my girlfriends birthday which was a nice touch. Marco hosted a wine tasting which was brilliant and made the day! (His wine is 👌)

Thanks again and hopefully one day we can come back!

Craig, Donna, Ryan and Jessie

Truly the perfect Barossa Airbnb; absolutely exemplary in every aspect. The house is modern and stylish, light-filled and airy by day, snug and cosy by night, and positively teeming with supplies, amenities, and a bespoke selection of goodies that raised the bar for thoughtful hospitality and attention to detail. Its location strikes an ideal balance, with easy proximity to many iconic Barossa treasures and yet just removed enough from the town centres and arterial roads to ensure a serene and secluded escape. We’re also so grateful for the superb private Cirillo tasting with Marco — an absolute must for lovers of wine without the wank(!), it perfectly encapsulated the Cirillo experience: welcoming, generous, understated, deliberate, and the quality speaks for itself. Wholeheartedly recommend, and will certainly return! Huge thanks to Annika and Marco.

if you are expecting luxury and to be spoilt this is the place. Very comfortable beds. Everything you would expect of 5 star. Copious amounts of food left for you. Quiet place on the vineyard. Perfection.

We had a very enjoyable stay at Annika's. Particularly impressed by the generous and delicious provisions (above and beyond). The house is beautifully presented - attention to detail in every room. Enjoyed catching-up with Marco and tasting Cirillo's Grenache wines. The property is nestled in the vineyards with the Barossa Valley Trail close by - perfect for cycling and walking. Annika is an excellent host. We'll look forward to staying again.
Paul & Bron

We had an amazing stay at Annika’s place. Annika went above and beyond with all the yummy provisions. The place is beautifully laid out with incredible attention to detail. Great location in Barossa. We can’t wait to stay again.
What a fantastic stay. Felt like every little detail was thought out. Best stay we have had and highly recommend Cirillo Guesthouse.

This property is absolutely perfect. The location, the furnishings, the kitchen equipment and linen are all top drawer and plentiful. The extra goodies Annika leaves out for guests is outstanding and very much appreciated.
We were extremely impressed and happy with our choice of accommodation in the Barossa and would certainly recommend this property to others.
The private wine tasting with Marco was also a highlight and again we appreciated his insight into the wines of the region.
Five stars is well deserved for this Airbnb.

We had the most incredible stay at Annika’s beautiful place. She was incredibly considerate and provided a large amount of food to our dietary requirements. The place was hugely comfortable and perfect for our group. Annika’s communication was excellent. We will definitely be back and highly recommend staying here! Thank you Annika.
This was honestly one of our best Airbnb stays! We will DEFINITELY be staying here again whenever we are in the Barossa! You will not go wrong booking this stay! Thank you so much!

Thank you for the wonderful accommodation and your hospitality.
The house was clean, in a quiet location, close to a lot of sites and had everything we needed. We are very grateful and really enjoyed our tasting with Marco, too.

We had a fantastic stay, the house is lovely and the provisions left for us were very generous and thoughtful. We had a tasting with Marco at the on site winery and it was so much fun, and the wine was delicious as well. Would definitely recommend a stay here, We loved it and will be back!

Annika and Marcos property is stylish, clean and beautifully presented. As we walked in we were greeted with a beautiful note addressed to us and a complimentary bottle of wine and cheese board. The linen and bath towels were all at a very high quality and the bathroom newly renovated. Will be recommending this property to family and friends. Thanks!

Wonderful stay! The house is beautiful, very clean, great location, and very well stocked with supplies. The hosts went above and beyond what is typically expected from airbnbs by providing a selection of food and drinks.

Such a perfect base for our stay in the Barossa. The welcome pack of food was absolutely outstanding, everything was such great quality, we really couldn’t fault a thing about this beautiful property and Annika and Marco were fantastic hosts. We are already looking forward to staying again on our next visit.

The Guest House is perfectly situated, at the most 9 minutes to everything. The house itself is so welcoming , the decor is as the pictures if not better. The beds are uber comfortable and invite you to afternoon nap. As for the little touches, from the toiletries for each guest to the condiments (which are actually fresh produce including local beverages, cheeses and some of the best bacon we have tasted)  arriving at the house is a treat. We absolutely didn't want to leave, and enjoyed our time there, especially over communal breakfast and evening drinks. A perfect place for a perfect weekend. Annika was super easy to chat with and clearly loves hosting.

Absolutely stunning place to stay! Very clean, and such a unique , beautiful house and views. Grateful for catering for dietary requirements, and a very generous amount of food left 🤗 I will definitely be back it was amazing!

Such a beautiful place, immaculately kept! Was very peaceful being surrounded by vineyards. Annika was a wonderful host and provided a huge amount of food and amenities for our stay. 5+ stars! Highly recommend!!!
Amazing place to stay! Great host and great location. Would recommend highly to anyone looking to stay in the Barossa!

What an amazing stay!! The place was incredible and Marco and Annika thought of EVERYTHING! They were also so kind when we accidentally ran over their tap pipe.. I’d recommend everyone to stay here.
Thanks SO MUCH. It was so nice.
All good
Great place! Nice amenities and in a great location.
everything was as advertised.
Great stay, clean and great location
Amazing apartment! Clean, well set out and the location made our stay great! The huge spa was definitely a highlight!
This is a lovely, modern, and super clean room. The spa is awesome. We loved that it is in the centre of town and walking distance to cafes and shops.
My partner and I enjoyed staying here, it was very clean, had nice amenities and in a great location.
Amazing locations thanks so much for a lovely experience
Very good location
Great place to stay. Tidy comfortable and well set out unit.

Perfect central location in the heart of Tanunda for exploring the Barossa. Comfy bed, sparkling clean apartment and loved the spa bath. We enjoyed sitting out and having a platter on the balcony and Jasmine was great at communicating with us.
The Apartment was sparkling clean and well located as a base to explore the Barossa region , tanunda is a great little town. Can’t wait to return soon x
Standard
Very clean and good location!
Thanks for a great stay! Super clean and comfortable, spa is an awesome addition!!
This apartment was perfect for our quick one night stay! The jacuzzi was perfect to soak in after a long day of wine tasting. Great location, close to shops.
Great location and clean apartment!
An excellent apartment within an easy walk of all the restaurants and cafés. Spacious area, big bathroom and extremely clean. Everything needed for a weekend getaway.

We stayed here for a base spot to explore the barossa. Penfolds is 5 minutes drive and so is Jacobs Creek. The main street is essentially 2 minutes walk and there' s a great gin/wine bar musque. Id recommend this place and the barossa  it is definitely a great town.

The apartment was smaller than the photos would suggest but still nice. The location is perfect, walking distance from restaurants and a short drive to wineries. The air conditioning was really good during our hot stay. There were bugs in the bathroom and main area which wasn't ideal. Overall, a nice stay
Pretty good place clean tidy close to everything
Lovely clean space, close to everything
beautiful place. clean and modern.
Nice little apartment in a great spot in Tanunda.
Great location, literally just behind the main street making everything walkable. Very comfortable accommodation with everything you need.
Had a great time. Fantastic location. Clean and modern room. No complaints!
Great location, walking distance to the main street and everything you need

The apartment building looks very nice and is very well maintained, inside and out. Plenty of parking and crawling distance from the main street with plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants to choose from. Perfect location for a lovely getaway!
Clean, spacious comfortable bed and great bathroom and spa. Also a great, well equipped kitchenet.

This apartment is in the perfect location and more than reasonable for the price. So clean and spacious. Small touches such as having copies of the local pubs menu’s in the room really added extra convenience and ease for our weekend away
The best location for the main street of Tanunda! Absolutely easy walking distance to all the shops, cafe's etc on the main street. Clean room with beautiful bathroom.
Very clean and easy
Was very clean and spacious. Great value.
Great location, lovely and clean studio perfect for exploring the Barossa valley
Great apartment in a great location, walking distance to everything on the main street
The spa bath was amazing ! Very close and central making it a great location  - walking distance to everything you need !  Free parking in sight made it easy to go out on day trips
Central location. Clean and modern furnishings.
The place is clean and tidy excellent location as it’s just off the Main Street behind the pub.
Lovely apartment and spa was a bonus.
Great central location for visiting the Barossa.  Perfect location if you planning on dining in Tanunda.

We had a great stay.
Very clean and great location and value
Enjoyable stay!
Fantastic accommodation - highly recommend!
Great little place. Central location, quiet and clean. Walk to the Main Street for shops and food.

Whilst being 1 of many apartment(9?) in a purpose built building, and not part of a private home, ( which wasn’t what I was expecting ) I did find this place very comfortable, with many amenities. The bathroom is huge, with a great spa, separate shower, separate toilet and basin area, and lovely fluffy towels.
Very convenient for walking to shops and eateries on the Main Street. It had great kitchen facilitie, a comfortable bed, and lots of space. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Immaculately clean.

We had a great stay. The room was nice and clean and the bathroom was spacious.
Very easy for us to walk to the main street and try out a few great restaurants.
We would definitely return should we head back to Tanunda.
Perfect. Just what we weee looking for in our Accom. Thanks
Great room, particularly the bathroom was luxurious. Enjoyed our stay in the Barossa
Massive space and an awesome hot tub bath!
Awesome room, great location, walking distance to Main Street. Lovely apartment, had everything you need for a great time away!
Clean and crisp room. Massive bathroom and the hot tub was great.
fantastic location just off the main street, easy check in and out. kitchenette with everything you'd need. beautifully clean.
Fantastic, spacious room with a large spa. The heater worked well for our stay on a very chilly weekend. Highly Recommend. Thank you
Nice and easy check in process, great place and very centralised.

Very clean
Great location
Easy check in
Room was perfect for an overnight stay in the Barossa. Great location to visit everything around Tanunda
The room was clean and spacious with a generous sized bathroom and balcony. A very enjoyable stay.
Was an awesome stay. Would happily stay there again
Comfortable bed, great location. Spa was a plus on a wintery weekend.
Very nice, self contained apartment.
Room was clean. Great location

Very clean,great location.A beautiful place to stay.
Highly recommend A+++++
Perfect little hidden gem.  Self contained accommodation with everything you’d want.  Super clean place and is a credit to Jasmine.  We will be back.  It’s a no brainer.

Great location
Very comfortable bed
Clean and tidy
clean and tidy place. Good location just off of the main street.
Great location, a little pricey, wish there was an oven & bigger Tv

Great location, walkable distance to many restaurants and shops. Only a few minutes (driving) to get to wineries. Easy access to check in. Very spacious compared to photos! It was a great experience would book again when I return to visit the Barossa.
Absolutely perfect location, close to the Main Street eateries and shops. Apartment is clean and has everything you’ll need for your stay! Highly recommend
Modern clean and quiet apartment near the Tanundra Hotel

Very spotlessly clean, lovely modern little unit. Fab bathroom and fit out and great central location. Loved the spa. It is on the upper floor of a block of units and is actually part of the local hotel accommodation, not a free standing unit as I thought when I booked.
Didn’t receive any reply to my communication with the host but all good.
Great central location in Tanunda.
Was a clean lovely place to stay! spa was amazing!
Fantastic location, lovely apartment within walking distance to shops, eateries and attractions. Highly recommend.
Great place to stay
Very nice apartment
Very clean and well appointed apartment. Great location within easy walking distance to the main street .
Very clean and very spacious. Central to restaurants and breakfast places. Will definitely stay there again.

Easy check in.
Great location.
Very Clean.
Had a great stay, wonderful location

Absolutely beautiful! So glad we chose this location.
Thank you 😊
Beautiful location and a lovely place to stay. We will be back!
Great location and spacious apartment.
A central location and extremely clean room.
We had a lovely time staying at Jasmine's Apartment. Location is great and a short walk from the main street in Tanunda. We'd definitely book again!
Perfect place to stay for a short trip, fantastic location close to shops and cafes.

Lovely clean modern space. I was impressed with how perfectly quiet it was, even in the downstairs apartment, I couldn’t hear the neighbours at all. The kitchen is wonderful for cooking my Barossa goodies that I discovered. The spa was lovely to relax in at the end of the day with a glass of wine. Remember to bring some beautiful bath salts (Go to Coco- Marie for lovely natural bath salts and soaps).

A generally enjoyable stay however a few things were not upto scratch which prevented the stay being much better.
On checking in to the room, we found an out of order please do not use sign on the spa bath. No prior notification was given which was a pity as we were looking forward to relaxing in the spa whilst on our break.
The TV also had issues as it kept switching itself off intermittently so in the end we just gave up on it.
And the listing states a washing machine available. However it is a pay for use machine in a common area laundry - would have expected better clarification of that in listing.
Apartment was clean and comfortable enough. Check in/out was easy too. Unfortunately the problems somewhat soured the overall experience. Some sort of discount really should have been offered in my opinion.
Lovely modern little cottage, comfy bed and couch, and stylish bathroom, good value :)

Greg and Mary were great hosts. We enjoyed our stay in the cottage. Amazing amenities and very close to lots of beautiful wineries. We also enjoyed walking around the area to see the horses and wildlife.

Thanks Greg and Mary for sharing your little cottage. It was modern, clean with really great amenities. Thanks also for providing breakfast foods! If we'd had more time, we would have enjoyed sitting on the verandah and chatting to the chooks :-) Easy access to Gawler and the Barossa Valley.
Clean, fresh, peaceful, comfortable. Just what we needed for a brief retreat and unwind from stress.

Greg and Mary's place is a true gem! It is even better than the photos, they have done an amazing job renovating.
The space is so large and open too!
The location is beautiful and serene, and only 20 minutes drive from Tanunda, and only 5 or 10 minutes from the start of the wineries. It is so conveniently close to Gawler too, so we were able to pop in and grab some bits and pieces and make the most of the kitchen.
It was so kind to have the bacon and eggs available too, clearly fresh from the chooks on the property.
Greg and Mary's hospitality was amazing, and Greg truly went out of his way to help us with some left behind items.
We would happily return again!

Perfect space in an amazing location. Greg and Mary’s hospitality was lovely with many thoughtful touches in their space. 110% recommend to anyone looking to stay for some time in the Barossa! You won’t be disappointed!
Very clean, neat and comfortable space with everything you need for a peaceful getaway!
Photos don’t do it justice - gorgeous place to stay!
Beautiful, secluded and clean cottage. Updated and stylish. Exceeded our expectation for size and comfort.
Great place, private from the main house and close gateway to Barossa and beyond!
Greg & Mary’s was delightful & charming, a perfect little getaway from the business of Adelaide

We enjoyed the peace and quiet of the property located a short drive from town. Everything you need at the property including the ever important coffee machine. Nice to be in the country away from the chaos before Christmas time!
Nice clean and upgraded interior. Quiet country setting. Would go there again if I had a  comfortable recliner for a person in their retirement age.
Beautiful place
Wonderful spot with all the touches

Very stylish space with all new furnishings and appliances. Fantastic location near all of the Barossa Valley wineries. Also near the town of Gawler for all necessities. Great surprise to also find a tennis court there, which we made great use of. Loved our stay and definitely recommend it to everyone!
Wonderful place to stay 😊
Greg and Mary’s place was an excellent introduction to the Barossa! The space was clean and had everything needed for both a coffee and making a full meal. Thanks Greg and Mary for a great stay!
A well styled, modern and clean accomodation that is perfectly located!

A beautiful little cottage that was everything we were hoping for!
Very clean and modern and a great little getaway from the hustle and bustle of Adelaide.
The coffee machine and breakfast items in the fridge were an added bonus.
Would definitely recommend!
Great place & amazing location to relax but also close enough to enjoy what the Barossa has to offer. Fantastic hosts.
Great little cottage and cute getaway for a couple. Super quiet and private. Great heating / cooling system. Very clean and well stocked with all the necessities. Definitely recommend!
Great little get away destination, near by the best of what Barossa has to offer.
A lovely cosy, refurbished cottage in quiet farm location. Everything we needed for our 2-week stay on our arrival to SA.

Wonderful location, so close to all the wineries. Beautiful modern amenities. Very comfortable and clean. Definitely would stay again. There are even chickens in a pen beside the house! Great little get away. Thank you

I highly recommend this beautiful place.
It was a real treat. Close to everything but centred so that you feel like you are in the peace and quiet. Absolutely delightful
An absolutely beautifully renovated home that is perfectly located to take in all the Barossa valley has to offer.
Lovey place at a great price.

The property has been tastefully renovated and is super comfortable. Well located to the Barossa wineries and restaurants ( by car). It was a charming property and our host was charming and quick to address our questions.

This house is a wonderful old home beautifully renovated with lots of space.  The linen , coffee machine, fire pit and BBQ, were quality touches and made our stay very relaxing, we didn’t want for anything apart from more time to spend there.  Any questions were answered promptly.  Highly recommend this accommodation in the wonderful Barossa Valley.
By far the best experience I’ve had! This home is beautiful with lots of space indoor and out. Perfect for a jam packed weekend or great for a low key relaxed weekend away. Can’t recommend enough :)
Amazing house, we thoroughly enjoyed the place. It was clean, beautiful and in a lovely spot. The heated flooring in the bathroom was an added bonus

This was the perfect place to call home while we explored the Barossa. This beautiful historic house had the best beds we have slept in so far on our epic SA Road Trip! The interior design is gorgeous, with a fun pool table and massive lounge room, separate dining and fully equipped kitchen. The location is perfect, being on the best road in the Barossa with so many iconic wineries and restaurants just down the road! And, the gardens are the perfect backdrop for any romantic occasion!
Beautifully presented house, great pool table and easily workable TV with Netflix!!
Thanks Katelin. Great house, it was a fantastic stay. Great facilities within and satisfied all our needs. We would be happy to stay again when next in The Barossa. Cheers.

Matchoss House was by far the most comfortable and relaxing air bnb we have ever stayed at. Everything from the rose garden and lawns to the inside entertainment areas, fire places  and decor was charming. Bed very comfortable. Will stay again!

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Sheda in the Barossa Valley. The little house is surprisingly really spacious and beautifully presented. The space is very thoughtfully designed and has everything you need, from a king size bed right up to a dishwasher and washing machine, to make it a fully self sufficient holiday. We even enjoyed the novelty of the composting toilet, which proved to have no smell unlike regular toilets. We loved sitting out on the verandah and watching the sunset and then the stars with a glass of wine. We also loved meeting Gina the dog, who we invited to come stay for a drink with us one night!
All the main attractions of the Barossa and the Adelaide Hills were an easy drive away and the Williamstown town was about a 15-20min walk.

Nelly goes above and beyond providing all needs are met for a lovely stay. Great communication. Very clean, great decor, light & fresh, comfy bed, yummy extra home made provisions and beautiful natural surrounds. Note the fridge is 'mini'.  Close to reservoirs for kayaking. Sheda is a little haven.
Beautiful spacious house in a quiet street that is the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The host has thought of everything and we really enjoyed our stay!

Was honestly the best Airbnb we have stayed in. Rebecca thought of everything, was so beautifully put together and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! Great location to visit all the wineries, great design and Rebecca was so great giving us many local recommendations. Would highly recommend!

The house is beautiful and was spotlessly clean. Rebecca has thought of everything when it comes to amenities. Communication was easy and very efficient. This Airbnb was perfect for exploring the Barossa valley- we would highly recommend!
Nicely styled house in the Barossa Valley.
A beautifully styled home with great attention to detail, such as fresh flowers and local produce for breakfast. A lovely place to rest and enjoy the region.
Lovely home in a quiet cul de sac. Beautifully furnished with all the creature comforts. Perfect for a Barossa getaway.

This is the perfect place to stay and explore the Barossa Valley from. It is close to wineries and adjacent towns and has everything you need to wind down. With everything to see, do and eat in the Valley we couldn’t help but take an opportunity to cook at home and take advantage of the beautiful kitchen. The property is styled beautifully, the basics are all provided and the beds are guaranteed for a sleep in. Wish we had a couple more days and some warm weather to enjoy the outdoor entertaining area and pool. Next time!

Relaxing getaway for the whole family! My husband, mum and 3 year old son had a wonderful time at Budburst House. Rebecca's house is beautifully styled in all its furnishings, and immaculately clean. Such thoughtful touches throughout with fresh lavender and plants (I loved the potted olive tree in the dining area - I bought one at the Barossa nursery myself for home!). Great goodies provided, Barossa locally made bread and milk & breakfast essentials for breakfast! The outdoor area was gorgeous with a nice sized yard and beautifully clean pool, would love to come again in summer one time to use the pool. We did have a quick dip on the warmer day we were there and my son loved the floaty llama! Great for kids, puzzles, books, toys/blocks and a piano for them (and adults!) to play on. It is great as it has a bath too as well as seperate shower for families. Inside, the kitchen has absolutely everything you need and is very well designed with brand new appliances. Linen and bath towels were all very lush. Budburst House was a stylish home away from home, has everything you need as a family and close to all Tanunda shops. Thank you for being such a wonderful host Rebecca, we were very happy in choosing your lovely b&b for our getaway!!

Budburst House had everything we wanted for our stay.
Lots of different spaces to relax and it was all spotlessly clean and comfortable. It's location in Tanunda made it posible to walk to dinner or wine tasting and it was central for getting out and exploring the region.
We will come again when next in e Barossa

WOW!!! This place is beautiful. Such a clean, modern and tidy house in Tanunda. First time being in the Barossa & we absolutely loved staying at this house. Everything was thought of....from fresh bread/jams/butter for breakfast, fresh flowers around the house, to make up wipes in the bathroom! Rebecca has gone above and beyond to be an Air bNb host and it shows. We will definitely be visiting again!

Absolute gem in the Barossa. Rebecca's house is not only modern, stylish and clean. The little touches she put in (e.g. a little welcome note with some snacks and breakfast prepared for us, though it might look small, we really appreciated it as it saves us time to head to supermarket). Everything used in the house is of quality too. We absolutely enjoyed our stay. Communication with Rebecca was easy and quick.  We cannot fault a thing from our stay. There are 5 star hotels, and the Budburst House is definitely a 5 star airbnb. Highly recommended!

Rebecca’s place was lovely and stylish. The kitchen was well stocked with cookware, utensils and especially sharp knives (which is rare). The breakfast supplies & Nibbles were plentiful and very much appreciated. The location was perfect as we walked into town often. Would definitely choose this place if visiting the area again.
Deborah, Roland, Matt & Paula
Beautiful house and pool, great location, very clean and lots of little extras provided.

This stay was amazing. It had everything, pamphlets of local establishments to visit, complimentary items from the town and an amazing pool. It was very clean and tidy, overall an amazing time. 100% recommend staying here when visiting or passing through Tanunda.

A fabulous place, great location,nice and quiet but a pleasant stroll to town and nearby wineries. The house itself is spacious, spotless and a great place to stay. Comfy beds and linen, and fantastically well equipped for a young family. Lots of great nibbles and thoughtful amenities too... would definitely be back!
Wonderful house and lovely hospitality

We had the most amazing time at Rebecca’s place. The place had absolutely everything we needed plus loads of surprising welcome snacks/breakfast items. Every bit in the house is well thought out and super clean. This was the perfect gateway for our little family. We’ll definitely be back :).

We absolutely loved our stay here! The place was stylish, clean and you can tell Rebecca has clearly thought of everything with all her lovely little extra amenities! As a family with 3 young children they were constantly entertained by the pool, building blocks , as well as children’s books and games that were provided - which was a great extra touch!

The place could not be faulted in terms or cleanliness and spaciousness would highly recommend to all.

Rebecca was lovely to deal with. She provided quick responses and went above and beyond to provide helpful recommendations on places to visit within Barossa.

Hope to come again in the near future :)

Budburst House is the the ultimate 'Home away from Home'. My partner and I had an amazing few days away and we really appreciated all the little extras Rebecca provided from the beautiful hand and body wash in the bathrooms, to the yummy local bread and creamy milk. We adored the quality bed linen, Sheridan towels and the most comfortable mattress ever! The kitchen had absolutely everything we needed to cook up a storm.. we loved the premium quality knives and cookware and the huge island bench!  The spacious, open plan living with gorgeous raked ceilings has such a great vibe. The undercover outdoor area complete with bbq is great, but the highlight is definitely the sparkling clean pool. It was just perfect and we spent a whole day relaxing and swimming. Budburst House is such a beautiful home.. we didn't want to leave and will definitely be back soon!

This house is exceptional. Beautifully decorated. Quiet street. Easy walk to town. Beautiful pool and outdoor area for alfresco dining. Spotlessly clean with some great treats and games left for us.
Rebecca was a fantastic host. Responsive and helpful and went above and beyond.
Barossa is fantastic we were blown away and tanunda is an excellent base.
If I could give more than 5 stars I would.
The home is beautifully appointed, well located, sparkling clean and managed by a lovely lady! Perfect holiday location and the pool was wonderful for the kids.
Highly recommended, the cleanest house I've been from airbnb, really well decorated,  with books and toys for the kids, nice swimming pool and garden. We loved everything, we had a great stay. Thanks

Rebecca’s place is in the heart of Tanunda. It’s clean, homey and close to shops and restaurants. We also LOVED the solar heater pool, we had hours of fun there. Rebecca is also very accomodating and thoughtful. We loved the welcome treats and fresh bread. We highly recommend Rebeccas place.

Beautiful house with all the extra thoughtful touches and amenities. Comfortable beds, Sheridan linen & towels, good kitchen supplies, helpful tips left for us for for our stay and a quick drive to the local town. Rebecca also left us a bottle of rose, snacks, bread & milk for our arrival!
Absolutely amazing place to stay! Would 100% recommend
Beautifully present house with lots of lovely touches.
A lovely clean, stylish space with everything you need for a comfortable stay.  Great outdoor area around the beautiful pool space.

We had a lovely 2 nights at Rebecca's house.
It is beautifully furnished with quality furniture and linen.
The location is very central for a great stay in the Barossa.
I would highly recommend to anyone

Thank you so much Rebecca! Your Airbnb is without a doubt the best I’ve stayed in.
It has amazing amenities, beautiful pool and in the be at location. Could not recommend higher!

Stylish space, airy and full of thoughtful touches. Rebecca has thought of everything to make your stay here memorable. We were supplied with everything we needed as well as a bunch of awesome local tips for touring around the Barossa. We had two great nights at the house and didn’t want to leave on our final day. We totally recommend this property! If it’s available book it!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful B&B.  Budburst is welcoming, clean and comfortable. It was lovely to come home to each day after exploring the gorgeous Barossa Valley. We wouldn't hesitate booking this again !!
A stylish and comfortable place to stay. Clean and fresh. Incredibly well equipped and very generous amenities. A cook’s kitchen. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Can’t speak highly enough about our stay at Rebecca’s house. Well appointed, amazing location, super clean, incredibly quick responses.. everything we could ask for. Hopefully we’ll be back!

Rebecca’s place is absolutely fantastic. Great location in Tanunda. Easy walk to town. It has everything you could possibly need. Lovely touches and welcome basket of local produce. The pool is great if in season. Very tastefully decorated, comfy beds and linen. Great for a family or multi generational family such as ours. We loved it. Thanks Rebecca.

just easier if I say book it!!
exactly as described

We had a wonderful time at Rebecca's place. It's convenient located to discover the Barossa and very well equipped for family. We have been greeted with a bottle of wine and snacks and we instantly felt like home. We will be back in summer to enjoy the pool.

We had a great time at Rebecca's place. The communication was super easy, quick and the place looks exactly like it does on the pictures. A number of very thoughtful touches including wine, a hamper & board games. Would absolutely recommend to stay there!

Rebecca was a wonderful host, checking in to ensure we arrived safety and ensuring her property was in incredible condition for our stay. We took our young daughter with us who found their was many activities within the home that she could do. Rebecca gave us a lot of great ideas on what do see and do on our trip. All of the finishing touches she put in ensured our stay was wonderful. We are looking forward to coming back

This place is absolutely amazing! As described, location is fantastic, home is very clean and hygienic, Rebecca was very responsive with her communication and accommodating. The moment you set foot into this place, you feel quite warm and homely, check in and check out was a breeze - cannot highly recommend enough!

Budburst house is a breath of fresh air. Such a beautiful place to rest & rejuvenate right in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Tucked away in a quiet little part of Tununda (Website hidden by Airbnb) it truly is the perfect accomodation located closely to some of the most incredible wineries & restaurants. We loved being so close to Fermentasian Restaurant, Hentley Farm Winery & Casa Carboni Restaurant & Cooking School.
Only my husband & I stayed but the house could easily accommodate a small group.
We are so happy we stayed at BudBurst with so much attention to detail, from Breakfast to 'Happy Hour' we felt very spoilt, lovely bedlinen & interior design from gorgeous artwork, cushions & furniture.
We will be sure to return.
Very nicely maintained and well stocked house. Great value and excellent service from Rebecca.

Budburst House is such a lovely place to stay in - super clean, comfortable, well equipt, good snacks (not to mention wine!). Handy location in regards to the town, and anyone staying with a group is going to enjoy this spot. Highly recommend staying here if any time of year if you're looking for a place in Tanunda!
As for Rebecca, she is a thoughtful, attentive host who communicates kindly and quickly. You can tell she takes pride in the home and in making your stay as easy as can be :)

Absolutely amazing house!! We love, love, loved staying here! Really great location, spacious house with multiple rooms to chill out in, great kitchen with everything you need to cook a yummy meal (go to the farmers markets, and cook at home!). Rebecca also added some really lovely little touches, which just made it so great! Would stay here again for sure. Thank you!
Beautiful property. As pictured. Spacious, quiet, homey, gorgeous bedrooms and pristinely clean! Very impressed, can’t wait to come back
Super friendly, accommodating and hospitable! Very clean and neat! Very enjoyable stay.
A great place in a great location, didn’t want to leave.

Rebecca was a fantastic host & responded quickly to all my messages. She allowed us to have an early check-in & a later check out which was really appreciated.
The house is lovely, spotlessly clean. She made us feel very welcome with a lovely basket of snacks & another of breakfast provisions.
The house was really set up well for families & the beds were very comfortable. The house was cosy warm & the electric blankets on all beds were much appreciated.
Really nice house and host! Would definitely recommend 👍🏼

Rebecca's place is a bright and airy makeover of a 1970's family home.  It is thoughtfully provisioned and equipped with just about everything you could need for a short stay. It would suit a young family on a summer holiday as there is a piano, a pool and a reserve right next door for frisbee or footy.  And, a very comfy king sized bed which is hard to find on AirBNB.

We met Rebecca and she was very welcoming and said if any issues to contact her.
A beautiful home, immaculately clean & tastefully decorated. Lovely entertaining area with well planned garden. We enjoyed the goodies left for our stay. Well stocked with cleaning products etc.
Great location only a short stroll to the Main Street, parks and playgrounds.
It was the perfect size and layout for my husband, kids and myself, and my parents too. It didn’t feel like we were on top of each other as there are 2 living areas and bathrooms.
We would like to return in warmer weather and utilise the pool!

Rebecca’s house is a quiet refuge.  It has everything you need for a getaway for a family.  Next to a reserve at the end of a quiet cup-de-sac there is a reserve for the children to play and runaround. In summer there is the pool.  The house has two television areas and also games etc for children to play indoors.  The kitchen is well equipped if you choose to cook.  It was a pleasure to come back to the house and relax  after a day out in the Barossa Valley.

Lovely accomodation, exceptional cleanliness and attention to detail - had everything we could need and made for a great stay. Rebecca was very helpful  and welcoming, contact was a breeze, and we were able to negotiate early check in/late check out which was much appreciated. Would definitely recommend :)

One of the best Airbnb’s I have stayed in. Beautifully styled, comfortable beds, great showers, plenty of space and well equipped. A short walk in to lovely Tanunda. It was like a little slice of heaven at the end of a long road trip. Thank you 😊

Rebecca was so wonderful and accommodating especially with proving for my 1 year old. The house is wonderful and was relaxing from the moment you walked in. We especially loved spending time in the back yard. It is well thought out and even the smallest details have been thought about like motion detecting night lights in the hallway to help unfamiliar people find their way at night. It is generously fitted out with supplies you need (Rebecca was even thoughtful enough to ask what sort of milk we would need. I can not recommend her any more. We may have to stay again in when it is warmer to enjoy the pool more as most of us where not brave enough to bear the pool in what seemed like winter weather.
