Thanks again.

We had a delightful stay at Budburst House.
Everything was considered and provided for.
Very handy location.
Every creature comfort was provided for.
Would highly recommend this property.
We loved our stay at Rebecca’s place. The house was stylish, comfortable, well-equipped and spotlessly clean. A perfect base from which to explore Tanunda!
Stunning house, so close to the centre of Tanunda! Will definitely be back!
Beautiful home prepared perfectly by the host.
Nice please.
Rebecca was a great host, very accomodating, stylish place, very clean, plenty of goodies left, lots of amenities, beautiful pool and backyard area, comfortable beds.We will be back :-)
Great place to stay 😃
Perfect place if you’re coming to the Barossa! So clean and has everything you’d want or need. Home is beautiful, as is the backyard. Couldn’t fault it!
What an amazing place and incredible hosts!! Great location and such a friendly and welcoming place. Can’t recommend it highly enough.
Outstanding place

From the moment we walked in the front door, with a welcoming light in the sitting room, everything was just spot on.
The freshly baked cake and bowl of fruit on the side was an unexpected treat.
Everything was sparkling clean, we were unable to fault it.
John Street is so quiet, yet only a five minute walk to the Main Street where there’s an array of cafes and eating place.
We’ll certainly return soon.
Perfect location and beautifully equipped house with a gorgeous garden.
Was a great, cute place to stay and would stay there agsin. Just a short walk to the main Street of Tanunda.
Thoroughly recommend !

We had the best stay at wyndaways. The house was spotless and sparkling clean when we arrived and was exactly as described. We loved the cottage retro vibe of the house while still having great cooking and modern facilities. The location is great with a less than 5 minute walk to the Main Street. Hannah went above and beyond to make us feel accommodated. We will definitely be staying again next time we visit!
Great place to stay highly recommended

Wyndaways is a fantastic place to stay. It is comfortable and very clean and Hannah has thought of everything you might need. We arrived on a hot day and it was lovely that Hannah had the airconditioning on for our arrival which made it very comfortable. The location is very convenient, walking distance to the main street of Tanunda which makes it easy. We can't fault this lovely house and hope to stay there again.

Hannah’s place will not disappoint.
This house is in an excellent location, a 5 minute walk to the main street of Tanunda and all it has to offer.
It is in a quiet street with little tracfic, amenities are top notch and the house is characterful.
Super comfy bed and pillows and nice breakfast provisions make this a place to return to.

Amazing house, great character and in a fantastic location to explore Tanunda and surrounding areas.

Hannah was amazing and let us check in early as we had a little one that needed a nap.
Breakfast supplies were thoughtful and delicious!

Will return for sure
The house is spotlessly clean, lots of natural light and lovely to stay. Great location and Hannah is so quick to respond. You won’t be dissapointed.

So many great things to write - Hannah’s place was immaculately clean and such a cute cottage with nice antique furniture. She was very kind to offer extra doona as I am not good with cold weather and put the heater on for us for our arrival. It was really nice of her to provide breakfast too! comfortable bed and walking distance to the main street. We enjoyed sitting one afternoon with some wine and cheese in her beautiful garden. We will definitely come back!
The photos don’t do it justice, this place is absolutely lovely and so comfortable. Best equipped kitchen of any place we’ve ever stayed.
The place was clean and cosy and only a short walk into the main part of town. Couldn’t ask for much more.

Very hospitable and nice place to stay in Barossa. Hannah was very caring, answered my question right very quick. The home have it's own character and style, a lot of beautiful details for comfort and beauty. Nice and green backyard. I'd recommend it to my friends )
Wyndways was a beautiful place to stay, quaint furniture and a lovely garden. Having coffee a quality breakfast provided was a lovely touch and really made our trip!

5/5 - walking into the home reminded me of my grandma’s house - so warm and inviting.
Hannah has equipped the home with everything you need for a great stay.
Coffee pods, biscuits and the very generous cooked breakfast provisions were greatly appreciated.
Towels are soft, the bed is comfortable and there are several spots around the house to catch the sunshine.
Great location only a short walk from shops and restaurants.
The property is sparkling clean and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend - you won’t be disappointed!

It is a bit like walking in to Grandma's house - but a very clean and well appointed one. Everything you could possibly need has been thought of plus things you hadn't even thought of.  Lovely garden and so nice to sit in the sun eating breakfast and watching the birds in the bird bath.

Hannah’s cottage is charming, immaculate and very conveniently located. The garden is beautiful

Hannah was extremely prompt and helpful with her communication and she had very thoughtfully provisioned and appointed the cottage
Great location. Walk to restaurants & bars. Everything you need in kitchen & bathroom. Comfy beds, lovely linen.
A delightful cottage close to everything, comfortable beds everything you could possibly need. I would recommend it to anybody. Beautiful garden.

Location 500m to the Main Street  and eateries, wine tasting and shops was great. Very quiet area and the house had lots of places inside and out to relax. Being winter we needed warm clothes inside although heaters provided worked well. Very generous  breakfast supplies and treats. Hannah was a great host even very promptly saving us when we locked the keys inside!

We had a fantastic stay at Hannah’s place in Tanunda. It was cold weather in the Barossa when we visited but Hannah had the heating on for our arrival and the house was lovely and cozy. Spotlessly clean with lots of nice touches, including breakfast items. Great communication too - would highly recommend. Love the vintage vibe of the interior. Would stay again. Thanks so much for having us.

Hannah’s place was a delight. Oldy worldly charm with every eye on detail to make this place workable and comfortable. Nothing was neglected and Hannah so thoughtfully left us so many provisions for breakfast. We were overwhelmed with her generosity.
I might add that the location was very central to Tanunda itself and indeed all the tourist attractions.

We absolutely loved our stay. All the wonderful special little touches made this a stand-out stay. The cottage was so well equipped with everything you could possibly want. The well equipped kitchen with breakfast, beautiful bread, fruit,  yoghurt, honey coffee - even local biscuits! We will definitely return!
lovely older house, set out beautifully. very generous with breakfast. thankyou for a wonderful time.

We had a great stay at Hannah’s place, great location and easy access to the town. We loved having the heaters on when we arrived and the yummy biscuits were great. The yard was amazing, especially for a 4 yo who loved exploring. The house was very clean and tidy and had great supplies in the kitchen.
This house was amazing. The little touches were fantastic and the blend of old and new was brilliantly done. It was warm and cosy and we would definitely stay here again when next in the Barossa.
lovely home, enjoyed our stay very much.
Comfy home. Great location. Lovely touches.
Lovely clean tidy home with loads of creature comforts.  Everything you need for a weekend in the Barossa.
The home was splendidly presented, loved the garden and birds and close to town.
Beautiful house in a great location

We couldn't fault this lovely place. The host was accommodating with early check in and provided lovely local baked goods which was a nice surprise. The house is a short walk to the main street and has a nice enclosed yard for our young children to run around in. Very comfortable. We will return for sure.

Highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa it is a lovely hose close to all amenities and a garden full of flowers and native wildlife. Love love this place and an amazing host

The house is exceptionally clean with a well appointed kitchen and a  great reading nook with lots of books. The garden is a delight with a great outdoor space for relaxing. The breakfast items left at the house by the host are exceptional.
A beautiful home with lovely homely touches. Was so nice to have breaky in the fridge waiting to be cooked!
If you like antique charm you will love this place.   Very spacious and thoughtfully styled.  A very nice place to stay
Good for a group of travellers/family.  Cool building, classic furniture, in a lovely town close to the action
Fantastic location and comfortable. Could easily have stayed much longer.
This is a great venue to tour the Barossa, a fun piece of local history filled with everything that you need to enjoy your stay.
Ideal place to stay at the barrossa valley. Clean and tidy had a great time

We absolutely loved our stay. The house was sparkling clean, the interior decoration could be out of a magazine, it's perfectly stunning!
The house doesn't just offer free Wifi, but also Netflix, Stan snd other on demand channels as well as a DVD player.
The kitchen is fully equipped.
We could not gave hoped for a better place.
We loved meeting Heather at the property to hear a bit if the history of the property.
I coukd go on and on about just how good this place is.

Heather is a wonderful host, the inn is a lovely space to relax, the beds are extremely comfy and the amenities were great, including very thoughtfully bread, juice and milk for our arrival. Would definitely recommend it for anyone wanting a couple of nights in the Barossa
Thanks again
Great hosts and a gorgeous building with interesting history. Just what a Barossa bnb should be!
Just a beautiful bnb - sparkling clean, snuggly blankets to wrap in on cold nights, so convenient and Heather is so lovely.
very Intresteing , Heather was very helpful, responsive.

This is a home away from home! We loved our stay here. The house had all the essentials you could ever need and the special welcome by Heather on check-in giving us the history of the house, was a lovely touch. We spent a few nights in and using the BBQ and cooking some lovely dinners was beyond easy in the very well equipped and spacious kitchen.

Overall super clean, very comfy beds with a selection of pillows, fast internet, a huge TV, comfy sofas with blankets and a cosy fire place. Easy to park right outside and only a walk down the road to the local super market and pub. Very good location and quiet at night time.

We will be back!! Thank you so much for a great stay!

We enjoyed a fantastic few days at Heather and Gordon’s place. Set within close proximity to the Barossa and Eden Valley wine districts their bnb had everything we needed and more. A beautiful old house tastefully decorated with quality furnishings and all the facilities we needed. This is a really comfortable home and a true country getaway. We also enjoyed the historic nature of the house and Heather’s tour of their original Scotch Oven at the rear of the house was a great treat. We’d definitely like to stay here again when we next visit the Barossa Valley,

What a lovely place! So full of history and very stylish and many thoughtful touches.
The beds are very warm and comfortable.
Ask to see the original old oven out the back, it’s awesome!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Lovely heritage building, well positioned and well equipped with thoughtful touches.
Great location and space. Heather and Gordon are very helpful hosts.
What a beautiful cottage. Well appointed, great history, well located. No downsides I can think of - thanks for a wonderful stay, will be back!

Heather & Gordon Thank you for welcoming us and for sharing your wonderful home. We enjoyed the home very much and appreciated the history of the home and it’s many fine furnishings.
There is so much to appreciate and so little to suggest.
Thanks again for allowing us stay in your comfortable and well appointed home. Many thanks Peter & Evy.
Fantastic place to stay. Accurate photos and description. Very clean. Helpful host.

Such a well appointed, charming cottage with everything a traveler would need while visiting  the area. Heather and Gordon were fabulous hosts and really went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and at home.

Heather’s place is absolutely lovely. 3 beautiful bedrooms, a kitchen with everything you could need and a great lounge room to relax and enjoy with family or friends. Heather met us on arrival and was really welcoming. She always communicated really quickly too. Pity we couldn’t stay longer.

This lovely property was perfect for a quiet weekend getaway in the Barossa. Heather was a fabulous host and very helpful in settling us in for our stay. Highly recommend to others who are looking for a quick getaway to the Barossa.

We had a wonderful stay at Heather's place.
It was so comfortable and clean.
The kitchen was fantastic and the apartment was very spacious with two large living areas.
The fire was lovely and the apartment had everything you need for a lovely stay.
We would definitely love to stay again.

Heather and Gordon's place is a little piece of heaven in Lyndoch. From the incredibly comfortable beds to the fully-stocked and Immaculate kitchen, they didn't miss a single detail. If a home-away-from-home bnb experience in an historic nineteenth century property in the heart of wine country sounds like your thing, we couldn't recommend this place more. We'll definitely be back!
Lovely home, that’s really well located. Sparkling clean and  Heather is great to communicate with. Comfy beds and love the fireplace to gather around. Thanks again Heather!

We had a very relaxing two nights in Lyndoch at Heather’s place. It was clean and well-appointed with many thoughtful extras (herbal teas, condiments, sofa-rugs, etc). It was easy to explore the Barossa from there but also comfy to spend some good family time around the table with some board games. Thanks Heather!

The Inn and Bakery are beautifully maintained, keeping a good feel of the history of the place along with well appointed mod cons. Highly recommended as a cosy place from which to explore the Barossa or simply to relax at and enjoy. Jeff & Petra

What a wonderful place to stay in. House is very clean with ample of space.
A complete kitchen which will make your feel like home. House is full of character.
Our host heather was lovely and we we enjoyed our stay. Definitely recommended to check this place out if you are visiting Barossa. Value for money , double thumbs up!

Wonderful house and location in the beautiful village of Lyndoch.  Beautiful beds and furniture in accord with the history of the building.  The kitchen is spacious and well equipped with a coffee pod machine, electric milk frother, Kenwood chef mixer, food processor - everything you could possibly need.  The wonderful selection of teas was very impressive.  A great selection of breakfast items are provided as well - bread, milk, eggs, cereals, jams, honey, vegemite.  The very organised instruction folder for all the equipment in the house was much appreciated as well as the information booklet with recommendations for places to go and things to do.   We had an amazing meal (tasting menu) at Ferment Asia in Tanunda.  We loved sitting around the large fire place, there was plenty of wood provided and the fireplace was ready for us to light when we arrived.    Lyndoch is a very pretty village with numerous wineries within a short distance.  The countryside is delightful especially in spring with all the leaves on the vines.  This is an amazing air bnb, highly recommended.
Expect a wonderful stay with all the creature comforts. Beautiful home!
Lovely home and lovely hosts. The kitchen was so well equipped, our group of two families staying there were very comfortable and wanted for nothing. Also the beds are super comfortable!

This is the most gorgeous bed and breakfast, we had such a wonderful stay! All the facilities you could possibly want with fantastic location to some of the Barossa’s best wineries. Heather & Gordon fantastic hosts!
A friendly reception, a lovely home and a great stay. This B&B has everthing you need to have a brilliant time in the Barossa.

We loved our stay here. The location was perfect, within walking distance to the local cafes, brewery and wineries.

The place itself was very comfortable and full of character (used to be the old inn in the town). Heather was great with her communication throughout as well, would really recommend this place.
There are so many positives - Cleanliness, everything we needed for a comfortable stay, Space, History & we can’t wait to book another stay.

Peter and Jane were wonderful and generous hosts. We opened the door to a beautiful and cosy home, fire running and bacon in the fridge. It was so perfect having the wood fire pizza restaurant next door, meeting the locals and enjoying delicious local wine. Thanks for having us, we'd love to come back!
Lovely location, fantastic food and wine, beautiful accommodation.

Peter, the owner and winemaker, is a great host and makes amazing pizzas. The facilities in the Loft were great with a well equipped kitchen and a large lounge with plenty of movies and games. If your lucky you'll get a tour of the estate.

Jane and Peter and their staff made us feel very welcome from the second we arrived.  This bnb is special in that the accommodation is just metres from a wood fired pizza restaurant where you can also taste locally produced fine wine.  The grounds are beautiful. A perfect place to relax or to engage with your hosts.
A spacious and very comfortable house with all that we needed.  Hosts were very welcoming and accommodating.  PIzzas are excellent if you are staying on a night the pizza oven is lit.
amazing spot, beautiful indoors and out, amazing hosts
Only stayed one night, awesome clean place, would definitely stay again.

Great characterful accommodation under the same roof as a cellar door and pizza restaurant.
Highly recommended
Wonderful loft with plenty of room, perfect for a family getaway or romantic weekend.
Amazing place and amazing host! Will definitely be back - thank you for your hospitality!
This is a wonderful location, it has great facilities and a fabulous host. Can’t recommend highly enough.
Thanks so much Jane and Peter! Excellent service provided throughout (including a complimentary and delicious loaf of bread) - my brother and I thoroughly enjoyed the weekend trip 😊
Amazing hosts, stunning location and cannot wait to go back for another visit

A great peaceful place to stay! Amazing views and up close encounters with wildlife. The wood oven pizza is fantastic along with a glass of wine. If you're looking for a rustic relaxing stay, this is the place for you!

We were stoked with the property on arrival. It’s a beautiful estate, with it’s charms and birds surrounding it. The house were nice with fireplace and clean. Jane and Peter were very helpful and friendly (and the two labradors)
Nice wood-fire pizza restaurant next door. We would highly recommend this place.

This is a great place to stay in a rural area of the Barossa. It is not in town but on a working farm. There is a weekly market in the next town with "the best breakfast in the area" which is fantastic.  It is within 30 minutes drive from the major wineries of the 100 or so in the Valley. Everything is exactly as shown on the website and Jane & Peter are wonderful hosts.
Gorgeous estate, and pizza was soooo good!!!, enjoyed every minute of the stay!! Can’t complain
A great place to stay and delicious pizzas!

Lovely, large, cozy place. Hospitable hosts, some lovely puppies running around and we enjoyed the Springton pub! Huge DVD selection, great after a big day of tasting wines. Would 100% recommend and will likely be back. Thanks!!!

Beautiful accommodation equipped with country views and a roaring wood fire heater, perfect for a winter getaway.
Jane & Peter are very accommodating and went out of their way to make our long weekend memorable. Peter served up some delicious wood fire pizza in the restaurant, right next door. The kids loved exploring this picturesque estate and eating toasted marshmallows from the pizza oven... The Shiraz is also great! Will definitely recommend
Great location. Loved the pizza and wine. Perfect place to unwind and recharge.

Great venue, the pictures don’t do the place justice. It’s bigger than it looks and very cosy. The hosts were fantastic, made everything super easy. The wood fired pizzas next door were quality and would highly recommend. Only regret was we couldn’t stay longer.

Beautiful, cosy space in peaceful, scenic surrounds. Yummy breakfast supplies, plenty of wood provided for the fire, and delicious wood-oven pizza and wine available from the adjoining restaurant. Lovely base for a weekend away in the Barossa.

Jane was such an amazing host, really communicative, considerate and thoughtful. The photos do not do this place justice, it completely exceeded my expectations. It’s extremely clean, The large gardens are gorgeous to walk through, the house is so warm and spacious and the bedrooms are very cosy. The house is full of little surprises as you walk around and watching the birds outside the window every morning was beautiful. Jane made the effort to have the fireplace on for us as we arrived and made us fresh pizza from their restaurant. I can not recommend Jane and this property enough! Thanks again Jane, you were a wonderful host!
Amazing hosts, Magical location 😃

We had a lovely relaxing stay.
From keeping the fire going to watching the chattering birds on the feeders; we felt really content on the farm. Receiving a visit from grandpa (the dog) was a treat and he was glad to take care of any leftovers. The pizza’s were excellent, as was the wine, port and everything else the farm offered. The weekend was very relaxed and just what we wanted.
This is a beautiful place to stay with amazing food and great scenery! This is the perfect getaway for anyone needing a change of scenery and wanting a place to relax. Highly recommend!
Beautiful peaceful setting.  Self contained, with all the comforts of home.  Friendly and helpful hosts.  A lovely place to unwind.
Jayne and Peter are wonderful hosts and that property is amazing. We really enjoyed our night there and the pizzas were just as good as the conversation. Absolutely would love to come again
An exquisitely beautiful location coupled with warm hospitality. Well provisioned and a yummy wood oven pizza.  Thank you Jane and Peter.

Great BnB, great wines, great pizzas, and great hosts. Oh, and great lab/retrievers too!
A great night all round.
Great, spacious and comfortable accommodation, in a superb location with great hosts.

Such an amazing loft/accommodation and experince.

The pizza is fantastic.
Such a beautiful place. You will have no regrets. Thank you both.

This is the perfect Airbnb! Jane is a truly wonderful host, and the house is impeccable! We stayed for the wine tasting and had some delicious woodfire oven pizza!! The location is scenic and picturesque and the stay was beautiful! highly recommend :)
Cute Location would be great for a weekend away

What an AMAZING place to stay in Barossa. With vines right outside the window, in a cosy hideaway right next to Tanunda - this place is perfect. So cosy, with touches of luxury, we loved the locally crafted breakfast hamper - honestly, the best supplies compared to the many, many airbnbs we stayed at. Loved the open plan and soaring wooden beams, such a nice feeling to come back to the cottage after a day of exploring. Double shower and a huge, comfy bed were a bonus. Charmaine was very responsive and so helpful with local recommendations - we had such a great time! If we’re back in Barossa, this is the only place we’ll be staying at - and will be recommending to everyone. It’s a gem.

Such an incredible stay. All the attention to detail and the local products and produce made our stay even better than expected. Not only was there everything we could possibly need for breakfast but local cheese, chocolate and jams for us to enjoy. Loved the cottage and also the book showing how it was built. It had absolutely everything we needed. The view of the local vineyards made it feel like we were really amongst the wine region with locals. We loved our stay and will be back.

Charmaine and Steve’s place was absolutely beautiful. It was better than we imagined. So many thoughtful touches made it an incredible place to stay at. We loved the place so much it made it hard to leave and actually explore the Barossa! We will definitely be back when we visit the Barossa again.

Charmaine & Steve created such an unforgettable and amazing weekend getaway in the Barossa Valley region. Absolutely loved the homely and thoughtful touches throughout the cottage. The local produce that was provided upon arrival was incredible! Cannot fault Halletts Valley Hideaway and hope to visit again!

The cottage was so beautiful. Nice and private,  the most lovely view out into the vineyards and hills. Amazingly generous local produce inclusions for a lovely cheese platter, breakfast and champagne. Central location, less than 5 minutes by car to Tanunda. We will be staying again!

Gorgeous Spot with amazing hosts. My Partner and I were blown away with how much care had gone into our stay. The location is stunning, and the house itself is nothing short of beautiful. The amenities were fabulous and we felt like we were spoiled with the local produce we were provided with. We will be coming back when its colder to make use of the wood fire heater and to sit out in the garden watching the sunset again

Beautiful place to stay!
5 minutes from Tanunda main street.
Clean, comfortable and modern with very thoughtful touches. Great breakfast provided. Very peaceful and relaxing.
Pictures don’t do it justice, amazing place, great hosts, would highly recommend this stay you won’t be disappointed.

Charmaine’s place exceeded our expectations tremendously! Such a beautiful stay with many thoughtful touches from Charmaine including locally grown treats. Charmaine’s communication was extremely quick and responsive. The cottage is also closely located to many wineries and local shops. Amazing stay, would highly recommend!
Had a wonderful time, great location and well catered for. Would recommend!

Amazing little cottage to set up base for a weekend in the Barossa. Great selection of local produce was a nice touch. Great communication and easy checkin. Would not hesitate to stay again or recommend to others.

We had a wonderful stay at Charmaine’s hidden hideaway. The cottage is absolutely gorgeous with beautiful renovations and a view to die for. Romantic and private, with so many little touches and local food and wine provided by Charmaine. Nice and close to Tanunda and easy to get a taxi to wineries and town. We would definitely like to stay again in future.
Perfect in every way! We spent two nights and loved every moment. We hired bicycles and tried some nearby wineries.
Thank you for a wonderful stay , it was above and beyond what we expected and the extra produce supplied was exceptional,defiantly a 5/5 and I am very fussy !!!

Hallett Valley Hideaway is outstanding accommodation. A stand alone newly built cottage is perfect in every way. It’s beautifully modern, with all amenities and plenty of food for our two breakfasts plus some treats. The bottle of bubbles was a nice surprise. Delightful setting and surrounds. Charmaine presents a really high class place to enjoy a break in the Barossa. She responds quickly to messages and provided clear directions. Thank for a lovely couple of days.

What a fantastic little place this is! Beautifully designed little cottage in a secluded and quiet location but still very close to Tanunda (5min drive) and so many little personal touches that made our little trip so memorable. We loved the generous selection of delicious local produce and we even had a delivery of Easter eggs on our doorstep on Easter Sunday.

Highly recommend, we will be back to see more of the Barossa and look forward to staying here again! Thank you Charmaine and Steve!
Great place just outside Tanunda. Fantastic breakfast and very spacious. We’ll be back.
Great location 3 mins from town, hugely spacious, all facilities and a perfect place to relax and escape the town bustle.

I’ve stayed in a lot of AirBnb’s in my time and this cottage was by far the best I’ve stayed in. I stayed here for my fiancee’s 30th and it ticked all the boxes. 5 Stars for everything. It will be hard to top this lovely cottage in the heart of the Barossa.
Thank you, we had a great stay 😊

Stunning! A lovely, private cottage surrounded by vines! The cottage had everything you need or want.   The provisions provided by Charmaine were a wonderful suprise - breakfast was fully taken care of.   Would certainly recommend it, and hopefully will make it back for another visit as right in the middle of wine country & on Tanunda's doorstep & golfcourse next door.

Hallett’s hideaway was everything and more than what we could have expected. Charmaine and Steve had the cottage warmed on our arrival with a fireplace pre built and a beautiful selection of breakfast things for the time - as well as a lovely bottle of chilled sparkling. The cottage is in a secluded location, but a quick drive to Tanunda and surrounding wineries. Taxis are available to take you to dinner as well from the cottage. We would come back and stay again in a heartbeat. Thanks Charmaine and Steve for a lovely stay.

Very comfortable cottage , exactly as described.
Great Barossa sourced provisions for breakfast as well as treats of cheese, chocolates, delicious biscuits and champagne.
Lovely wood fire that was perfect for the cool nights while we were there.
Short drive to Tanunda and taxis readily available .
Perfect for romantic getaway and Barossa touring

WOW! Such and amazing stay here. If you are looking for a cozy place to stay, look no further. Great location,  just a few minutes drive to town. We were looked after very well, including the great treats provided for us (all not only delicious but also local!). The fireplace was the winner for us - we sat in front of it for hours! Five stars isn’t enough for this cottage!

You will not be disappointed with this absolutely beautiful bnb! The attention to detail here is amazing. A very private location a little bit out of town with amazing views from all directions. You won't be left wanting for anything here.

An awesome spot, the cottage is incredible, the photos don’t do it justice. Charmaine has everything is setup
for the perfect weekend away.
Cant wait to come back
This is a delightful cottage, spotlessly clean, very well equiped, secluded and quiet location. It’s simply a must.
We had a great stay! The place is spacious, clean, and well-located. We also appreciated all the food provided with the place! Thanks very much.

Absolutely gorgeous location and such a lovely little cottage. Extremely clean and cozy. It was all the little touches that made this such a memorable stay. We will be reccomending to anyone visiting the area. Thank-you!
Charmaine’s space was beautiful and has been carefully maintained to make the most of its stunning location. A definite stay when in the Barossa region!

Thanks Charmaine and Steve for making our little getaway just perfect 😍 thanks for accommodating our dietary needs and supplying such a variety of yummy goodies 😋 your cottage and setting just so quaint- we loved the fire and king size bed!!! We will definitely recommend to all our friends and be back to stay another time. Thanks again Leann & Michael 😃
A fantastic stay.

Halletts Valley Hideaway is a beautiful couples' retreat for those looking to escape to the peace and tranquility of the wonderful rolling hillscapes of the Barossa Valley. Nestled amongst vines, and located not 2 minutes from Tanunda, the secluded getaway is a sanctuary where you can relax and unwind after a day touring local vintners and other attractions.

Setback off the road, the cottage is a stunning space with brilliant amenities. Recycled wooden beams adorn the open ceiling, with beautiful stone bench-tops running the length of the kitchen area, and an impressive combustion heater in the lounge heats the cottage well. The showcase of the open floor plan is the luxurious double shower, and the perquisite of a comfortable King-size bed is something to exploit on wintery mornings. A panoramic window in the lounge area opens up the cottage to the views of the western acclivity of Trial Hill, which is a stunning sight at sunset.

Your hosts, Steve and Charmaine, are very welcoming, responsive and helpful with things to do whilst visiting the area. They also generously supply a superb array of local food produce in your complimentary breakfast hamper.

The Halletts Valley Hideaway is a stay which we highly recommend for couples wishing to enjoy a romantic week-long getaway to the Barossa Valley.

What an amazing stay! From the start the communication from the hosts was above and beyond and the stay itself was amazing. It was extremely clean, well stocked with amazing local produce. It has everything you could possibly need with really comfy bed and pillows.
Couldn’t speak highly enough of the stay and would recommend it again and again :)
A warm and cosy cottage with everything you need on a beautiful rural property. So close to the main strip of Tanunda but far enough away to have your privacy!

Hallets Valley Hideaway is a beautiful cottage in an idyllic location. With only a few minutes drive to reach the town of Tanunda, HVH is well positioned to reach the top wineries of the region. Expect to wake up with views of the vineyards and valleys with birds dancing amongst the vines. Incredibly generous provisions and thoughtful hosts make this an unbeatable stay.
Amazing place to stay to unwind and relax. Very clean and very cozy absolutely loved the place. Will definitely recommend to my friends and family :)

Beautiful vineyard views surrounding the peaceful cottage with a modern fit-out with rustic charm. Everything was very clean and all needs considered. Delicious local food provided and great toiletries. We loved it!
Absolutely perfect in every way. This was our third stay here. We love it 😊

If you are looking for comfort, privacy, cleanliness and a sanctuary, this is the place to stay.
Steve and Charmaine are excellent hosts who are thoughtful and take time and care to make your stay special. The directions and communication are outstanding as are the generous provisions and toiletries, all locally sourced. The cottage is spacious with attention to detail with everything you need and more. It is well located and a good base to explore the Barossa. Loved sitting on the comfy sofa at night with the fire on looking out to the uninterrupted view of vines, watching the sunset and the birds!
Highly recommend this property and the hosts, Steve and Charmaine.

Beautiful hideaway right near the heart of Tanunda.
This was a beautifully clean and serviced self contained flat.
You do have privacy but one thing I would mention is that the house is about 80m away, this was something I didn't realise until we had reached the location.
Beautifully presented and had everything you could want!
Thank you so may to Tony and Charmaine, it was just lovely.

My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was absolutely beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed having a wine next to the fire and looking out into the beautiful garden. The location was fantastic - secluded and private, yet so close to the Barossa Valley. We highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in the Barossa
Such a beautiful place to stay! Thank you for having us Katrina and Natalie :)

Amazing , clean accommodation with generous quality fresh provisions in a quiet situation .
We enjoyed bird watching from the comfortable sofa , so relaxing .
Everything we needed was provided without asking . We would definitely stay again .

Lovely cottage set amongst the vineyards away from the hustle and bustle of Tanunda. Well appointed, clean with great facilities like good size kitchen, huge double shower, RC air conditioner, wood burning heater etc. The gazebo in the yard to sit under was a nice touch for somewhere to sit and relax perhaps with a glass of wine or two. Hosts were communicative but didn’t intrude on our privacy even though the main house is quite close to the cottage. Would visit again. Thanks Charmaine and Steve!
Fantastic location, great extras like the in room massage, hosts were nothing but accommodating! Would definitely recommend and we will be back next time we visit the Barossa!
A stunning little gem just outside of Tanunda.  Everything was taken care of, from start to finish.  Thank you to Charmaine and Steve for a very memorable weekend.
Great little cottage in the heart of the Barossa. Highly recommended for a weekend getaway.

This little hideaway is perfect for a slow and relaxing getaway. A quiet night in by the fire with a glass of wine and a cheese platter was the perfect way to recharge the batteries. The local produce supplied by the hosts was the cherry on top! Would 100% recommend.

This Airbnb is in a perfect location - 5 mins from the Main Street - and is the perfect getaway accommodation for couples. Charmaine and Steve were lovely and the local produce was an absolute treat that we enjoyed for breakfast every day. The fire was a lovely bonus on the colder nights. Would highly recommend!

Great spot with a very nice view of their yard
Location is nice and central for lots of great things to do
Will return again as they made it feel like a home and not a hotel
Wow what a place to stay!! Great views and perfect location for summer or the colder months! Few minutes drive from the Main Street in Tanunda - couldn’t ask for a better getaway!

Wow! What an incredible experience. So much thought went in to our stay - from the message to confirm our arrival time so that the room could be a suitable temperature, to the amazing and delicious produce that was provided. The photos don’t do this incredible property justice.
Thanks so much, Charmaine and Steve! Will be hard to top the amazing experience and beautiful accommodation.
This Airbnb is well thought out and has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.
The accommodation and the hosts are outstanding. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Highly recommended.

The pictures don’t do this place justice. We had some of our wedding photos taken here in the driveway and at the rotunda and couldn’t be happier with how they’ve turned out. Charmaine also provided a delicious selection of Barossa products which was amazing

The perfect stay in Barossa. Stop searching and book. Very central to the wineries and town while still feeling secluded and private. Cottage was beautifully designed and built with views of the vines. Pantry and fridge came filled with local produce and Steve and Charmaine provided great winery recommendations. Everything was perfect.

Loved our stay here, it was so well presented and tranquil, we could not of asked for anything else, we were even catered for with some fresh local produce that was a real treat! Will definitely recommend!

Thanks again for a great experience!

We used this location to prepare for our wedding, and the views did not disappoint, the cottage was amazing to have photos taken in while my partner and myself prepared to become husband and wife, and we also did our first reveal there also, so many happy memories made here, and the hospitality and service exceeded expectatio
A beautiful place, small touches that make the difference. Highly recommend.

Excellent accommodation with everything we could need to make our Barossa holiday comfortable and enjoyable. Jodie went above with little cozy touches around the home and was highly responsive to any queries we had. Would love to stay again
Was an amazing place to stay the personalised touches was amazing and we really enjoyed the stay. Would highly recommend this place to anyone.

We had such a fabulous time, a beautiful spot amongst the vineyards and short walk to Hentley Farm and Seppeltsfield experiences.  Also very handy to other Barossa towns and venues, and also only just over an hour to the Clare Valley. The house was immaculate, very comfortable and Jodie has thought of everything we could want.
The Retreat is aptly named. The house is spacious with tasteful decor, wonderful amenities and lovely personal touches. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Our stay in Seppeltsfield was perfect due to the beautiful house we stayed in. The view out of each window was amazing and all of the small touches Jodie added made our stay in the Barossa perfect! We highly recommend this stunning house.
Everything was perfect. Faultless. Great location. Beautifully appointed. Jodie was also fabulous to communicate with. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Our family of 6 had a perfect weekend away staying in the beautiful "Retreat" . We opened the door to find a welcoming "home away from home". Everything you could possibly need had been provided for or thought of. Delicious local produce had been left in the fridge for us to enjoy. It was a cold weekend, and we thoroughly enjoyed sitting by the wonderful fire. Jodie was excellent in her communication. She made you feel welcome from the minute we booked our stay. The Retreat is surrounded by stunning gardens. The location is perfect to explore The Barossa. We will definitely be back to enjoy this beautiful place.
Stunning location, only walking distance from wineries and a beautiful view out of every window!

There were six of us staying at the "Retreat". Since we open the door we loved the house. Everything was perfect. The house was spotlessly clean. The fridge was filled with local produce. The fire places were ready for us to use.
The house is surrounded by beautiful gardens and vineyards. It is only walking distance to the Hentley Farm and Seppeltsfield vineries. Jodie was great in her communications and responses. We had a great weekend, even it was raining almost all the time. We highly recommend this beautiful house and already planning to come back.

Just delightful. Jodie looked after us so well from the start. This was such a wonderful home to stay whilst we explored the Barossa. We went for a special family birthday and it exceeded our expectation. Everything was great - from the luxury of the home, cleanliness to the goodies supplied to make our stay special. We'll be back without doubt !

We were completely amazed by beauty of the setting and gardens.
Jodie went over and above with communication, thoughtfulness and attention to detail.
We will definitely be back 😊

Wonderful location and home to spend our first adventure in the Barossa. Walking distance to Angaston and a short drive to many great wineries and restaurants. Lovely cottage with contemporary amenities, which along with Adele's handwritten welcome note all made for a tranquil and enjoyable stay in the Barossa Valley.

We absolutely loved Adele’s place. It is perfectly located - walking distance to town. It was a beautiful space that is comfortable and clean. I would not hesitate staying here again! (I almost want to keep it a secret!) Highly recommend! Thanks Adele!
Plum Cottage is a great find! Location was ideal and lovely and comfortable place to stay for a few nights. Would love to return one day!

It was hard to find a fault with Adele's cottage. It is located barely 5 minutes walk from the town centre and within very close driving distance to so many wineries, breweries and distilleries. The photos do not do place justice. There is an amazing view from the backyard over Angaston which you can either enjoy in the backyard or from the comfort of the enclosed verandah. You will not find a shortage of places to eat at or things to do when you're here.
Great property within walking distance to the Main Street and a short drive to hundreds of wineries. Perfect spot to stay whilst exploring Barossa
We had a relaxing time in this beautiful country cottage. Thx Adele for your hospitality
Lovely, quiet and peaceful stay. Amazing place to spend a weekend!
Great little cottage right near all that Angaston has to offer. Was perfect for our weekend getaway and Adele was welcoming and helpful at every point of the process.
Adele’s peaceful cottage was located very conveniently central to what our travel purpose was. The space is tastefully fitted with a number a basics which are handy.
Adele’s place was superb. A lovely little home away from home. Will definitely stay again - thanks Adele!

A rustic retreat with all the mod cons....... no TV or wifi so great for unplugging which is what we wanted. Great location. Short walk to the main street, perfect for walking off the great food & drink on offer.

Cosy cottage in the middle of Angaston, with a fireplace and modern interior combined with charming ‘old-days’ details. Adele is very approachable, we received a welcoming bottle of wine and a hand-written note that was very lovely.
Thank you Adele!

My wife, puppy and I had a great time here. Lovely cozy house, great for cozy nights in front of the fire. So close to lovely cafes and shops and only a short drive/cycle to cellar doors. Adele was great at communicating and lots of nice little touches. Would definitely stay again.

What a wonderful cottage, sparkling clean, all the essentials in the pantry, beautiful wine glasses, comfy beds, a lovely fire. We couldn’t have asked for any more! We were thrilled with our accommodation thank you so much Adele
Lovely ambiance in great location, perfect Barossa getaway
Great little place. Walking distance to town. Thankyou very much

The house is beautiful, and set in a lovely part of the town with an amazing outlook from the back. The house is beautifully dressed, it is warm and inviting. Not to be missed for your Barossa get away!
Great spot in Angaston as you’re able to walk to the shops and cafes. The cottage is very cosy and a lovely place to have the fire on for a cold winters night.

Adele’s place was the perfect get-away for Barossa adventures. It was super cozy and loved the fireplace for the cooler winter nights. It’s fully setup with amenities including a fully featured kitchen and reliable hot water.

Our cavoodle Frankie also loved the backyard to roam and explore. Will definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in the area and certainly will look this place up again in the future when we’re in town! Thanks again Adele!

We had such a wonderful stay at Adele’s place! It is such a welcoming and cosy space where we could just relax while feeling like we were at home! Loved the fire, such a novelty for us!! And just really loved the rustic feel of the place.
Thanks for allowing us to stay Adele :)
Great place, lovely fire. Comfy bed and underfloor heating is delightful.
Great spot and great accommodation at a great price
Very cosy accomodation and excellent location! The bottle of wine on arrival was a great touch and very appreciated. Would definitely stay here again.
We had such a lovely stay here, so cute and the dogs loved exploring the big yard. Such a cute place to stay and would highly recommend :) thanks for having us!
Amazing!! We absolutely loved our stay at Adele’s place!

This accommodation is so very perfect for a large family, so much so that we would like to stay there again sometime when international travel recommences and we can have ALL of our family together.
There are 4 sitting areas and 2 dining areas inside, and spacious bedrooms, allowing for any amount of privacy for anybody who wanted it (children escaping from adults and vice-versa). When downstairs it's impossible to hear anybody upstairs, and even between rooms the sound-proofing is amazing. One sitting area & the main dining room were large enough for everybody to congregate, and the kitchen was very well-equipped and large enough for many cooks to work together.
The outside deck, sitting areas and barbecue spot overlooked the orchard and a vineyard, and we were encouraged to pick and eat as much fruit as we wanted, and also to help ourselves to any vegetables that were growing. The lawn areas were great for playing or relaxing on, and with no near neighbours, we could be as noisy as we wanted.
The house has many doors and windows, allowing for flow-through fresh air, so whether we were inside or outdoors, we could always hear the birds chatting in the massive gum trees.
I felt that the only possible improvement would be a swimming pool or tennis court. However it was all so perfect that we only went out for a few hours during the days, and at night nobody wanted to eat out; we all stayed home and cooked up our own banquets. We certainly appreciated the gift of some wines.
This is a very homely, comfortable accommodation displaying history and character, and very perfect for families or groups of couples.

Incredible experience and such a perfect home to host large family gathering. I would definitely stay here again.
Perfect!!

The hosts were very friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The house was very clean and facilities were all good quality.  They provided basic cooking supplies, hand wash, shower gels, shampoo and conditioner etc.  they also supplied plenty of firewood and the complimentary wine was delicious. Plenty of space for multiple families. Would definitely recommend this house for a luxury getaway
Such a beautiful house for a Winter weekend getaway. The log fires were amazing, and made for a cosy family getaway.

Our party of 8 arrived Friday and departed Sunday. What a weekend!  Located in a quiet part of the Barossa , this property is surrounded by vines, trees and the Jacobs creek. Wildlife in abundance in the local area with kangaroos and plentiful bird life observed on our frequent walks. Near the Mawson trail if you wish to walk/run/ride some great trails. (I ran to the Steingarten lookout). Taxi picked us up for dinners out. Comfortable beds, great deck to watch the birds.  Loved the house and the location. We will look to return next year.

Great spot amongst the vineyards. 5 bedrooms all with ensuites was excellent and plenty of space to relax, cook and eat. Appreciate the responsiveness of Amy. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and hope to be back.

Huge property in a fantastic location just outside Rowland Flats. Five bedrooms all (essentially) with ensuite. Great kitchen and outdoor dining areas overlooking vineyards and Jacobs Creek. Five minutes drive into the shops and restaurants in Tanunda.
Highly recommend this property. So beautiful and serene. Johnny the house manager was just awesome!
We had such an amazing time in the Kraft house! Hosts were so incredibly flexible and lovely and so easy to deal with. We will be back!
Great place to stay with family and friends. Excellent location and Amy was very clear in communicating . Happy to return in near future.

A great location, close to local wineries. Aloe gave really clear directions to find the property (off of dirt roads) to make it easy to find. We received fast responses to any questions we had. Would definitely stay here again.
Great location with an amazing view!

Thank you so much for hosting us. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Beautiful secluded surroundings. Kids loved it and we felt really safe there. Power went out on our last night but we managed to turn the generator on pretty easily. The free wines are definitely a nice touch. Definitely highly recommended.
Excellent place.. it's off the beaten track, so load up with food and supplies and enjoy every moment.. great fresh eggs from the chicken..

We had a lovely time at Kangaroo Farm. Such a comfortable house with everything you need, it really felt like a home not just a holiday house. My toddler was a big fan of saying hello to the Alpacas and the Chickens, and we all enjoyed having a sing around the piano.
Great off grid and relaxing Airbnb
Absolutely beautiful location, very quiet and relaxing. The house is full of character and you'll wake up to kangaroos in the landscape around you. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Extremely relaxing and beautiful views, property and house.
Very close to the Barossa but some lovely Eden Valley locations that you don’t want to miss out on!
A lovely homely eco friendly off grid property. The kids enjoyed the screen free time and checking on the chickens, fish and alpacas. The fire place made for a few comfy and warm nights in.

AMAZING! Such a beautiful & unique house we loved how quirky & cosy it was. We arrived late with the fire place going & some wine left out! Amazing views and cute chickens, everything was perfect & we definitely will be coming back, we wish we stayed longer!
Eclectic, property.   The house is full of character,  in a beautiful secluded location.  great views,  lovely wood fire.
beautiful house with an even better view.
Amazing location, kids loved running free across so much land while seeing all the animals including kangas, chickens, hares and deer. Nice simple living and warm house, we recommend 😊

This place is amazing!
Brilliant character and charm.
The land is beautiful, the house is incredible and has great energy. With high ceilings and beautiful hexagon windows, a combustion fire heater and a modern kitchen, this place is perfect all year round whilst being "off the grid".
We will be back.

this place is very secluded and has amazing views. kangaroos will share the sunset with you. this house is fully equipped and has a very personal vibe to it. great place to discover barossa from. we aware of arriving on dirt roads and a long uneven driveway
Great location, peaceful and serenic. The house was very comfortable and had everything we needed. We are looking forward to coming back!
Very spacious house and lovely location overlooking the vineyards. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning here again.
The property was set amongts vinyards with stunning veiws out of all the windows. And great location being halfway between Tanunda and Lydoch.
Yang was fabulous to deal with, going above and beyond to make our stay in the Barossa amazing. The house was great and would definitely visit again.

Stayed three nights on cold and wet weekend in July, family of four, plus dog.
Huge house with big and well equipped kitchen, only missing a toaster, but easy to use grill.
Bedrooms lovely with comfortable beds and fresh linens. Nice views from main bedroom.
Games room with pool table was a brilliant edition and many games were played over our stay.
Ducted heating doesn’t work well, but wood burning stove brilliant and four electric radiators kept us warm.
Check in and out super easy.
Had a plumbing issue during our stay which meant we couldn’t use the spa (had planned on using a lot) but these things happen and sincere apologies given and two bottles of wine quickly delivered.
Would be great place for a couple of families or large group of friends to stay, although if more than 4 people staying would need more sofas, as only a small L shaped lounge just seating 4. Dining table seats 8.
Ok location. 10 mins to Tanunda and Lyndoch. Quiet even though on main road. Outdoor area lovely with lots of different areas to sit, great gazebo with Lounges and table overlooking vines, never got to use unfortunately as cold and wet. Would be fab in spring/autumn.
Peaceful and spacious and only a ten minute drive from the cute little town of Tanunda. The kids slept so well!

Everything was absolutely perfect. The hosts had thought of everything with a delicious platter waiting for us to enjoy with our Barossa wine, the king beds were huge and very comfortable with luxurious linen, good heating throughout multiple living rooms so if you are in a large group you can spread out. Beautiful gardens with balconies to sit and enjoy the outdoors. We loved the whole experience, thanks for a memorable stay!

This historic building is a treasure, and such a good location for a big group. The rooms are comfy, the bathrooms spotless, kitchen is well equipped and the garden is a delight, oh and don't forget discovering the delightful period decorations. Darren is a great host. Highly recommended.

Hi Darren! Thank you so much for having us stay at your magnificent property. What a lovely piece of history the house is. The checking in process was easy and the platter upon arrival was a great (& tasty) touch. Thank you for your hospitality.
Good stay, nice isolated location.
Great location, great property and very comfortable
Beautiful house in an excellent location. Host was very attentive. Will definitely stay there next time we’re in the Barossa.
Great location, very comfortable for a group stay. Would stay here again visiting the Barossa.

The house is in a perfect location , set way back off the road.
The house is spacious and the rooms beautifully appointed.
The kitchen has plenty of utensils and condiments.
Milk and coffee was provided.
There is a bbq to use and the outer areas were great .
Went to Greenock pub one light that had great schnitzels.
Spent 4 nights and thoroughly loved the experience.
Will be back!
The accommodation is good overall.

Teresa Garden Holiday Home is set in amongst the vineyards and about half a km back from the road. It's a lovely location - very tranquil, private and beautiful views from the windows. It's also very close to the main centre of Tanunda, which is helpful.

The house itself is large, which is lovely. There is a dining room, 2 separate living areas and 4 good-sized bedrooms. The beds are very comfortable and warm with lots of blankets and pillows, which was important because it was cold when we were there. There are also a number of heaters throughout the house. The house was also very clean and well-appointed - it had everything you need, including board games which we had a great time playing around the dining table.

The hosts were very responsive and helpful. Shortly before we travelled to the accommodation the hosts advised me that there had been some recent electrical work and to let them know if we had any trouble. We noticed that there were some power outlets that didn't work and I've advised them since returning from our holiday.

Thanks so much to the lovely hosts - the home is beautiful and it was a lovely setting. I would recommend and would stay again.
Beautiful location, close to town, but still far enough away to enjoy the views of the vines and the hills!

Fantastic house, great views. Minutes away from the wineries. The house is well equipped. Large space. Great to a stay with multiple families. We left something behind and the owner arranged to have it shipped to us. Very good customer service.

We very much enjoyed our stay. Only one hour drive from Adelaide CBD.
Huis place was one of the best homes I've stayed on Airbnb. It was so cosy and well located for our Barossa trip, communication with Hui was easy and timely and I would definitely stay here again.

The Teresa Garden house was a beautiful place to stay. Gorgeous views of the vineyards, comfortable beds and a well-appointed kitchen made our stay enjoyable. Highly recommend - so close to wineries and the lovey town of Tanunda!
Amazing location, great host, beautiful home with all the amenities!

The setting is just gorgeous here, definitely worth the car ride needed to get in and out of a Tanunda. The tranquility and seclusion is actually something we really valued. The garden has many beautiful spots to enjoy but the interior was the real draw card for us. Beautifully furnished rooms and two well appointed bathrooms made this perfect for a girls weekend away.  With four living spaces, we didn’t even use the sitting room. Such great value for money - We will be back!
Nice place to stay, beautiful location.

My family & I stayed a few nights as we had a wedding in the Barossa. The check in process was very smooth & easy, there is Lovely views from all parts of the house but unfortunately it was very dirty, dirty dishes on the sink & in the dishwasher, the bathrooms weren’t clean, new towels had been chucked on the basins with the tags still on which didn’t give everyone a towel each, the outdoor furniture was everywhere & covered in dirt & leaves, the inside rubbish bin was full & the beds didn’t appear to have had the bedding changed. This is just a few things.
Unfortunately as we discovered these things we all became very disappointment & wish we hadn’t booked the accommodation.
When we contacted the owners about the towels they advised us the cleaner forgot so they arranged new towels & could we use the hand towels to make do.
We wouldn’t recommend this accommodation at all.

A great retreat in surrounded by vines, and spacious for a group.

Lovely to sit on the deck with a glass of vino,

thank you!
Charming place! Perfect for a couple. Comfortable bed and a lovely view from the loft. Located strategically between Barossa and Adelaide Hills!
Lovely spot. Emu and turkey aficionados rejoice.
Beautiful place real unique too. Also they had complimentary chocolate love that

Mark and Fiona were such thoughtful hosts - they went out of their way to do a little preparatory research on our behalf so that we didn’t have to sift through all the possible options - which was so appreciated! Their accomodation was absolutely charming and once international travel is available again I’ll be suggesting their place to my relatives. We loved it!
Had a great stay while hiking the Lavender Trail.  Great location right in town and such a cute and cosy little spot.  Great communication!  Thanks so much for having us.
Beautiful location and accommodation, so much to do and see. We will absolutely be back again! Thank you Mark & Fiona

Beautiful getaway loft and wonderful location. Would definitely come back.
Thanks again!
Hosts commicate very well, very secluded and quiet location and easy access to Adelaide Hills and the Barossa region.
Quiet ,quaint and relaxing place to stay
Perfect escape for a weekend. Easy to find and access was simple. Great advice on local hospitality. Will definitely be back!

An excellent getaway retreat in the heart of one of the best wine regions - we loved our stay at the Hayloft lodge and will definitely return next time we are in the area, thanks again Mark and Fiona!

All the best,
René & Prit
The Hayloft is a fantastic place to stay! Mark and Fiona are super nice and friendly! If you are heading to Barossa or Adelaide Hills, the Hayloft is definitely one of the top picks!

Welcoming and beautiful atmosphere, private and relaxing with gorgeous gardens and lots of bird-life. The advertising photos matched the real thing. Friendly communication from the owners. We loved our stay!
Great comfortable place for a couple to stay venturing through the Barossa region
We had such a relaxing and lovely time at the Hayloft. Mark and Fiona were very thoughtful and made us feel most welcome. Thank you again for hosting us!

The garden is very relaxing and a nice area to walk around and enjoy sounds of nature.
The hayloft is very cute and equiped with all the home touches.
Great location, easy access to local wineries,  and great pub meal at Mt Pleasant (they do takeaway). Very clean and comfy, lovely relaxing spot.
Beautiful and peaceful location, an enjoyable stay!

My friends and I had a great time. Louise was a lovely host who replied quickly to any of our messages and was very welcoming. We loved the little touches (and the delicious eggs from their farm). The cottage was gorgeous and it was amazing to wander around and see all the farm animals. We especially enjoyed our surprise visit from one of the farm dogs, Rocket. Would recommend for anyone wanting a peaceful and relaxing time in the country.

We loved our stay and the generous hospitality at Little Eden.
The cottage is beautiful, charming and relaxing.
Watching the sun rise in the garden was a beautiful start to the day and staying here was a lovely experience.
We really enjoyed our stay at Mike’s place. We travelled with our dog and it worked well for her. It was also in a great location to visit the Barossa Valley. We would stay again!
Cute cottage in a nice little town.
This is the most beautiful little cottage. It’s been done up extremely tastefully and is perfect for a cosy weekend. It’s right in the middle of Eden and about a 20 minute drive into Barossa

Lovely cottage in a very nice area.
Check-in was easy and Mike was super fast to respond to any messages.
Thanks!
Cute and beautiful cottage that made for a perfect base to adventure around the Barossa and Eden Valley
Lovely cottage in Eden Valley. Clean, comfy bed, perfect for a couple.

Mikes cottage is cute! My daughter and I felt we had stepped back in time but with all the luxury of now! Comfortable and relaxing. It’s a remote setting so ensure you take supplies for your own meals, or book ahead at the local pub.. a comfortable walk from the cottage.

A cosy cottage with modern amenities. We enjoyed our stay at 'Little Eden' a perfect home base to explore and unwind in the Barossa. Mike made us feel welcome with snacks and a bottle of wine. The house was beautifully decorated and cosy, keeping the classic features of the cottage, with the comfort of modern furnishings. Plenty of space to unwind and read a book or enjoy the sweet little garden. The bath with spa jets was an added bit of luxury! We really enjoyed our stay and appreciated how easy Mike made the booking and check in process. We will be recommending 'Little Eden' to our family and friends!
Amazing stay !

We loved our stay in this adorable cottage! It’s on the main road and a short walk to the local pub. Mike provided details for check in and check out in a timely manner. There was breakfast and some goodies left on the kitchen bench which is a big tick in my eyes! The bath was a big tick as well. 5 stars ✨

You will have a lovely, restful, quiet stay in this gorgeous cottage. Its circa 1860, but modernised beautifully. Comfortable bed, good heating,  and everything one might need for a restful few days. Make sure you eat at the local pub, awesome atmosphere.
amazing place to stay, gorgeous little cottage

This is an absolutely beautiful and very comfortable cottage to explore the Barossa and Eden Valley. It has be renovated to a high standard, spotlessly cleaned and really lovely styling. We really appreciated the extra touches of wine and chocolates and the well stocked kitchen. We just loved our stay here and so did our pooch! Would definitely stay again.
Beautiful getaway spot!

A delightful 1860's cottage that has been thoughtfully restored with a wonderful kitchen and modern bathroom. The fire place with its combustion wood fire added a delightful ambience and warmth to the living area. The breakfast supplies, bottle of bubbles and chocolates were a nice touch.
The front garden is a treat, with interesting touches of nostalgia in its rusty iron work gates, original stone walls and little nooks. I can highly recommend this cottage, it was a real treat to stay here.

Amazing, everything was perfect, Mike was helpful and great with communicating.
Cottage was perfect, ammenities very good.

Great dog friendly Accommodation with a pub right across the road. The place is beautiful and cosy! The fire place keeps the whole house so warm. The welcome champagne and breakfast  was a lovely thoughtful touch. We loved the bath tub and our dog loved the house so much I don’t think he wanted to leave 😂!
Super cute cottage, perfect for a romantic weekend away. The bottle of bubbles and chocolate on arrival was a really nice touch.
This is a cosy clean cottage in the quite town of Eden Valley, a short drive from the Barossa wine centre. We loved the fire, the welcome wine and the peaceful surrounds.
Little Eden is an amazing place to stay! It was very clean and tidy. Such a unique place in a great little town. I would definitely recommend!

Very pretty and well set up property. Warm and comfy!
Quite location. Good pub a few doors up the road but you need a car if you want other dining options. Not too far from towns for provisions etc so stock up! Or visit the weekend farmers market - which was great!
Appreciated the complementary breakfast provisions and welcome bottle of wine!
A few minor suggestions made directly to host - but no show stoppers!
Highly recommended for those looking for a quite and well appointed property
What a great cute cottage place to stay! Had everything I needed and more. With a warm and cosy charm, this place felt like home straight away. Perfect for a little getaway in the Barossa!

Mikes cottage is excellent. Super easy check in, Sparkling wine and chocolates, bread tea coffee and spreads all ready to enjoy. A super comfortable bed and bath towels. The wood fire was excellent and very effective. It’s a very quiet comfortable beautiful early settler cottage that wants for nothing. Highly recommended. Thank you Mike, we have had a wonderful stay.
Amazing place, loved the little extra touches from the host. Very well presented house with incredible cottage vibes. Will definitely be back next time I’m in the Barossa.
Great space for a cozy weekend getaway! Thanks for having us :)
Beautiful and comfortable cottage. Really enjoyable stay.

Exactly what we hoped for! This gorgeous place really was a little Eden, a perfect respite for us. Immaculate, homely and peaceful, this was a brilliant place to relax after the odd winery. I would thoroughly recommend and I will definitely be going back.

Cute small cottage in picturesque Eden Valley and a reasonable base for Barossa Valley wineries a 20 min drive away.  Four rooms provide all you need with good breakfast and bathroom provisions.  Fireplace a bit small for woodcuts but nice to counter cold of Eden Valley.  if you arrive at night and can't see cottage, go up driveway 26A.  Mike responds promptly to Q's and local Kaz fixes stuff in a way I hope owners value.
Lovely little cottage in an idyllic location.
Really Relaxing great place to stay!

Such a beautiful cosy cottage in a superb location. It was the perfect place to spend our first wedding anniversary in winter. We absolutely loved our time at Little Eden and look forward to returning soon – maybe for our second anniversary. Thanks Mike!

Beautiful little cottage surrounded by lavender bushes. Great backyard for a dog. Lovely touches in having bread and toiletries available.
We were disappointed with some cleanliness issues (we had to clean up broken glass) and also the fact that the wood supplied was not suited to the fireplace (which has been mentioned by other guests).
Loved staying at Mikes accomodation with my partner. Beautiful little place and Mike was a great host. Would highly recommend this place to anyone!
Little Eden is a little slice of paradise! Quiet, secluded, just the break needed!

A lovely cottage full of old world charm amidst the tranquility of a small farming village all about an hour from Adelaide. The 21st Century doesn’t seem quite so important in a 150 year old building and conversation, rather than clicking keyboards, flourishes.

A coffee in the morning admiring the beautiful feont garden and a glass of something more adult in the afternoon among the rear gardens Lavender.

A quick walk up to the pub for dinner and an award winning wine list to boot!

Mike’s place is the perfect spot to unwind and recharge.
Comfy bed, big shower, awesome couch, and all in easy driving distance of wineries galore.
Great little cottage with everything you need. Dogs loved it too
We wished we could stay longer in this cute pet friendly cottage. Well equipped kitchen in a perfect location for exploring the wine region

Lovely small cottage and great secured yard for the dogs. The Eden Valley is a beautiful, quiet location to explore the Barossa from. Nice assortment of amenities supplied, and we were comfortable throughout our stay. Mike is prompt and considerate in his communication.

We found broken glass, and evidence of previous guests not picking up after their pets, so worth a checking if you use the yard.
Wonderful stay, super cute, cosy and super clean! Thanks for the stay in this beautiful cottage.

We stayed at Mike’s place for 4 nights while we explored the Barossa region. The house is located in Eden Valley which is a small town about 20 mins away from the main Barossa towns and wineries. Eden Valley has a general store and an excellent pub, but not much else so you will need to arrange transport or drive to wineries further afield. The house is absolutely lovely, really well equipped and perfect for a couple. Although it was 40 degrees outside the air con kept us cool and we had a great time doing jigsaw puzzles and cooking up a storm in the kitchen! Would definitely stay here again when we are next in the area.
Quick to respond and excellent communication. Great host!

We loved staying in the Goat Square Cottages. It was the perfect place to spend our 20th wedding anniversary. It was comfortable, cosy and beautiful. The fire place and spa bath added something special. Having some breakfast things and wine provided was a great touch. Perfect location!

Charming, well-appointed, comfortable and clean accomodation. Everything required for a hassle-free and homely escape to the Barossa is provided. We were especially pleased by the spa bath and shower, the bottle of wine and house port available, the well stocked fireplace and impeccable bedroom furnishings and soft sheets. We loved it!
A wonderful little cottage with great facilities!
Great place to stay for a couple of nights, everything was 5 star - the little niceties like a bottle of wine, some bacon and eggs in the fridge made it feel really special!
Amazing spot. Great to walk to restaurants and bars on the Main Street!

Beautiful cottage that we absolutely loved. All things you need are catered for & it’s in a nice quiet location. Enough Bacon & eggs for brekky each of our 2 days there - easy to cook in the well equipped kitchen. Log fire, glass of port - Will definitely look to stay in the cottage next time in Tanunda.
Beautiful little place to stay and explore the Barossa

This cottage was beautiful and had a lot of extra touches that made the experience even better. There was bacon and eggs, bread, tomatoes, butter and a bottle of wine as well as simple condiments for cooking and seasoning. Tea and coffee provided and a wonderful spa bath. The extra bonus were the heated floors!!
Lovely accommodation to base yourself in the Barossa, all that you need for an enjoyable break away.
A beautiful cottage in the heart of Tanunda. It had everything we needed for a fantastic weekend of wine tasting and exploring the Barossa Valley. We would definitely stay again.
We loved our stay at Goat Square Cottages.  Perfect location, well equipped and generous breakfast supplies. Definitely recommend!
A really lovely, quaint cottage that's more spacious than you think! Quiet, homely and special.
Perfect location, close to the main road of Tanunda, but perfectly positioned to be quiet and quaint. We had a wonderful stay in this gorgeous cottage!
Great place, great location!

This was a wonderful place to stay. Very close to Tanunda town centre and a very well equipped cottage. The bread, eggs and bacon and wine was delicious and the wonderful cottage feel made us feel right at home. The beds are comfy and it was very clean. The perfect place to come back to after a big day touring the Barossa Valley. Thank you and we will be back!

The cottage is a great size for 2 people with a cozy feel. Modern amenities like a nice kitchen and heated floors mix really well with the rustic vibes. I'd recommend it for any couple staying in the area and we'll probably be staying again.

We had a lovely few days away celebrating our anniversary. Loved the fire and heated tiles, which kept the place cosy. Comfy bed and spa bath were a treat too.
Great little space, in a great location full of things to do.

We had a great stay at Goat Square Cottage. The accommodation was very cosy and comfortable, the breakfast supplies were locally sourced and delicious. The air conditioner worked well and the pot belly stove provided the cosy atmosphere.
lovely cottage with cute touches in a great location in Tanunda. The breakie supplies were a nice treat. Thanks Mary.

Very nice, cosy little spot. Location is brilliant as the Main Street is within easy walking distance but far enough away that it’s quiet. The amenities were great, firewood was provided and everything for breakfast was in the fridge! We would definitely stay again
Excellent location, easy check in, cosy cottage with all the requirements for a weekend getaway. The wine and breakfast supplies were a great start to our stay. Thanks Mary

Perfectly-located, well-equipped characterful cottage. Great for exploring Tanunda’s restaurants (fermentAsia a standout Vietnamese) and the whole Barossa region. Harvest Kitchen also a must-eat. Mary’s cottage was just ideal.
Perfect base to see the Barossa! Supplied bacon and egg breakfast was a great addition

Beautiful little cottage off the main strip in Tununda. Perfect location to explore the Barossa wine region and food. Very spacious size bedroom, kitchen and bathroom with a beautiful spa tub and heated floor. Cozy wood fire in the bedroom with firer wood provided. Fresh locally sourced produce is provided to cook yourself breakfast. Loved our stay and would highly recommend, you will not be disappointed. Thank you Mary!
Beautiful cottage and wonderful location. Will definitely recommend and stay again.
I would highly recommend booking this place. It was a great little cottage for two for our weekend get away. Heater was wonderful and location was great.
A wonderful old worldly cottage with lots of charm and very cosy. Loved the underfloor heating. Great location too.
A lovely quaint cottage in the heart of Tanunda, very clean and cosy, perfect for a romantic getaway. Highly recommend.

Wonderful cottage in a great location. All the little touches made it such a lovely stay. The local produce left in the fridge for breakfast and even the under floor heating, heaven. Wish we could have stayed for longer!

Fantastic little cottage with everything you could need. Breakfast provided too. There is plenty of room to sit outside in the garden and enjoy the day. Such an easy walk to the main strip. Highly recommend Darlings for coffee. Musque was absolutely delicious for a fine night out. We also had takeaway at Kungpung Kitchen, which was very nice too. There’s even great little wine bars in town for when you’re not able to drive. Brothers at War was a great spot and the owners were delightful. A great little spot for touring around the Barossa Valley. We’ll be back for sure!
