The place was gorgeous. Very quaint and comfortable and perfect for a romantic couple of days away. Nice and close to the main street for convenience but not so close it was noisy or there was a lot of traffic/foot traffic.

We did understand the description to mean that there would be an oven (that could just be us and we love to cook together when we are away), not in any way a big issue, we were still able to cook together on the gas stove, but just a heads up.

Would absolutely go back there. Check-in and out were also very easy and we knew exactly what to expect because Mary was great at communicating with us.
Loved staying here! Really appreciated the bottle of red and the bacon and eggs! Such a nice touch.  Thank you!
This was just lovely to stay in.  Very quiet,  comfy bed,  everything you could think of needing was provided here! A perfect stay!
Such a cute little cottage, so close to the Main Street with a really comfy bed! Check in was a lot earlier which was nice to plan the rest of our day with and the spa bath was super relaxing!
Perfect location to be based in Tanunda and a great little base to explore the Barossa 👍
Cosy place in a great location. The breakfast was a nice touch!
We had a beautiful stay at the goat square cottages - very cute, had everything we needed, and a lovely location in Tanunda - thank you Mary and Ngaire!

Lovingly and beautifully restored old Kapunda train station. The photos don’t do it justice! This property is huge with massive bedrooms all very stylishly decorated. Great communication with the host and lots of nice little touches including continental breakfast being provided. Would highly recommend.

All aboard! We LOVED our recent stay at The Station.

Our group of seven (5 adults & 2 children) enjoyed a 2 night stay in May, and we wish our stay was longer!

From the start, our communication with Bridget (host) was great, and her warm welcome was informative and helpful. Bridget had thought of everything for our stay. From marshmallows to toast on the fire-pit, to delicious local essentials for breakfast.

The old Kapunda railway station is huge and has been lovingly and stylishly restored. There were plenty of living spaces, both indoor and outdoor, and we almost lost count of the bedrooms. Although the property is large, it is very cosy and was perfect for our weekend away. The bedrooms were toasty warm and are decorated in a stylish, minimalist manner. There were thoughtful touches like complimentary eyemasks and an ‘Alexa’ in each room. The games room was fun and the kids also enjoyed the wooden train set that was supplied. Other little touches like plenty of throw rugs, spare toiletries and a big bowl of fresh fruit made us just want to stay in all weekend! At the host’s recommendation, we also ordered a brunch box and a DIY pizza pack which was delivered to the door by local providore, Coopers Fresh.

When we did get out and about, we enjoyed walks around the town, some retail therapy in the local shops and a visit to the nearby playground. Pubs and the supermarket are also within walking distance.

We’d highly recommend The Station for a few days away. It’s great for families and groups and we’re already thinking about another visit! Toot Toot!

The Station is great place to bring people together for a wonderful holiday
It is full of generous and luxurious inclusions that make you feel welcome and relaxed.
We loved staying here and Bridget is an excellent host
Highlights
The cosy and comfortable beds
The outside fire pit and marshmallows
The hilariously competitive table tennis competitions
Place was a great with lots of thoughtful touches. Recommend it for 10+ guests

Fantastic place that offers something else - the atmosphere of being in an old railway station is special. The place has a nice design and special touches that makes it warm and welcoming. We had tree lovely nights, among others enjoying a big bonfire in the courtyard while looking at the stars. The kids had a blast exploring both inside and outside - it is not everyday you say yes to them playing on railway tracks.
Wonderful history in this old station. Has been tastefully decorated and is very comfortable. A must stay if your in the area.

Everything about this place will exceed your expectations.
From the get go Bridget was so helpful & accommodating.
Check in was a breeze with a guided tour and lay of the land.

From the furniture & super comfortable bedding to the custom room sprays & candles. This place has it all. Everything has been thought of & executed amazingly.

Highly recommended for anyone wanting a perfectly styled & exclusive stay with all the trimmings.

Would stay there again in a heartbeat.
Such an amazing stay! Bridget really did perfect everything - from the complimentary breakfast to the gifts you could purchase! This place has so much character and is so great for a big group.
Thank you do much for the beautiful stay!

Absolutely 10/10! The station is a stay unlike anywhere else. To be in such a historic and beautiful building, coupled with Bridget’s incredible restoration and styling. This place is a must with a group of friends or families! 2 nights certainly didn’t feel long enough. Bridget’s attention to detail was impeccable, not a single thing wasn’t considered.

This is such a special place to stay. I can see the host put lots of effects on decoration and make the house feel comfortable and stylish. We are group of two families had a wonderful two days stay in The Station.  Definitely recommend to everyone.
Better than the pictures. Perfect stay.
Place was very spacious and clean
Very spacious home, quiet area and all the facilities you could need .. great place to stay, we will be back again for sure .
Perfect house for our group, has everything you need - great hosts too.

Nick’s house is homely, welcoming and the kitchen is well stocked with good quality appliances, equipment and generous provisions of tea, coffee and milk. It was spotlessly clean. The hosts also left a welcoming message with a bottle of wine and chocolates.
The beds were comfortable, the heating was efficient, overall a very comfortable home.
One of our party is an Airbnb superhost and she asked me to pass on her compliments to the hosts. Highly recommended.
Great location great spot!
Great house and great host
Great place to stay
comfortable accommodation
Great location, close to everything Barossa and surrounds have to offer. Excellent and welcoming host, felt like we were just at home. Would recommend and would come back!

Kirsten’s home has spectacular views, gorgeous gardens and is a beautifully clean and inviting place to stay. Kirsten was kind and helpful with lots of great suggestions for places to visit in the area. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommended her home as a peaceful get away in the Barossa.

Great house not being able to use the kitchen was a bit of a bummer. Finding out that the owner was going to be staying in the house was surprising and not what we were expecting. Great house but felt like we had to be in the bedroom for privacy while the owner was in the house. Incredible bath tub
Great house, modern, well decorated and Kirsten is very accomodating. Great place to stay for the weekend!

Amazing setting with magnificent views. Kristen so obviously enjoys sharing her space and is both a generous host and discreet in her ability to truly share her space. She provides a generous hamper of provisions and a whole shelf in the fridge.
The accommodation is sumptuous - as others have mentioned the bath is terrific, the wood burner was also effective in reaching our bedroom, an oil heater was also provided but we did not feel the need. Kirsten is passionate about this off grid experience and it shows in her thoughtful attention to detail.
We really enjoyed getting to know Angaston better, great food, shops and fab bike hire service and cycle track.
Would not hesitate to recommend.

Great spot, everything was fantastic and Kirsten was an excellent and welcoming host. Relaxing by the fire after a day out in the winter rain and cold was a treat and the view across the valley was awesome.
Beautiful views
Beautiful place to stay with amazing views. Overall everything was very clean and tidy and had everything we needed. Watching the sunset on the deck was amazing at night.

Beautiful home and the view is phenomenal - surely the best view of the Barossa! Kirsten was so lovely and communicated well ahead and during my stay. All the facilities were as described and the bed very comfortable. Can absolutely recommend and I will certainly be heading back again next time I stay in the Barossa.

Beautiful spot for anyone who needs to get away and relax, my partner and I loved our stay, the views were tranquil.
We will be back !!
Thank you again Kirsten. :)
The views from Kirsten's house are beautiful and she is a very accommodating host. Great location.
Kirsten has an amazing place. Good stay in a quiet town if you want to travel to different vineyards in the Barossa valley, as it is close by. The place was very clean.
A really lovely cottage with a great little garden.  I'l stay again.
Great spot
What a fantastic space! Exceptional ammenities and fantastic hosts. Will be back.
A quaint cottage with some really unique features. Great location

Possum's Cottage had beautiful and well maintained gardens and we were in awe when we walked in. The home was spacious, bed was comfy and location was great - right in the middle of everything we wanted to do.
Nick was a great host, the house presented exactly as advertised. Very comfortable and cosy cottage.

Possum Cottage is a cute, pretty and quirky place. We loved all the amenities & the attention to detail. Close to the shops & restaurants of Tanunda we only wish we had had more time & more favorable weather to enjoy the gorgeous garden.

Fantastic house, the hottub and whole backyard setup is incredible and well worth a stay. Two minute walk from the Barossa brewery which was a nice suprise! And a very short drive into the heart of Tanunda. Very happy with the possum cottage!

Nick was a great communicator during our stay.
The outdoor area is a great space for chilling out and a lot of thought has gone into the landscaping and layout which has a Balinese type vibe. The outdoor spa room is very relaxing - would highly recommend.
The bedrooms are roomy and beds were comfortable. If you are a light sleeper, pop some ear plugs in your overnight bag as the property is on a main road.
The cellar was a unique feature and great for family meal time!
Functional kitchen and lovely fresh eggs for you to cook up at breakky.
The location of the property is nice and close to town and a good spot if you are wanting a weekend get away to explore the wine region.
Beautiful garden and spa
Perfect location, great stay.
Beautiful garden, close to so so many wineries and main centre of town. Great spa.

This place is a hidden gem ! It’s quirky, cool, cozy, close to the town but a tranquil paradise. Outdoor hot tub in Japanese style garden makes you feel miles from anywhere. The building is historical and the owners have nurtured that but with every mod con that you need. There were no issues with checking in and would definitely give this place a 5 star rating
Fantastic accomodation. Will definitely be back.
The garden and hot spa are a highlight of this place! Very cute cottage get away!

A hot fire and a hot tub - perfect for the chilly hills! The uniqueness of the cottage is great, like stepping into an alternate reality. The wine cellar is a great place to chill out with a glass, or dinner. The hot tub is the perfect way to relax. And the lounge is a comfy space to watch a roaring fire and rest a weary body. The bed is one of the largestand and comfiest beds we've ever slept in - it was hard to start the day!! We spent a sudden lockdown in Little Possum Cottage, and it was the perfect place to be stuck! 10/10 would do a lockdown there again!
beautiful will enjoy

Nice and interesting place. Wish the fireplace had been on at arrival as it was a cold rainy day and the cottage is quite cold.
SPA is outside with no door so difficult to use/possibly not worth it on cold days.
Host was accommodating and efficient communicator.
Quaint, clean and comfy home with beautiful outdoor area.  Awesome hosts.

Great place to stay.Central to everything.
Beds are so comfortable.
We had an amazing time,
We will stay again.
Thankyou.

A lovely time in a lovely old house.
As advertised.
Awesome fireplace setup with plenty of firewood to keep us warm.
Brilliant outdoor jacuzzi that was perfectly sized.
Would definitely recommend for a couples retreat.
Beautiful cottage great location
Absolute gem of a spot! Felt like our own little oasis. Great communication with owners, great location and everything we needed was all there. We will be back!

Great location and property for a Barossa stay experience. Lovely rustic cottage with beautiful garden and outside spa bath, the beds were so comfy I could have slept all morning 😅 highly recommended.

Absolutely amazing host and property. Nick was brilliant from the time of booking until the morning of check-out. I booked Nick's place for my parents to get away for my mum's 60th, and Nick went above and beyond, even leaving a lovely birthday gift for my mum. I definitely recommend. Thanks again Nick.
Great location! Such a charming house with so much character. If you are lucky enough to have good weather during your stay, the outdoor area is perfect for entertaining in privacy.

A hidden gem in Tanunda! This place got so much character and uniqueness, but also warm and cozy. The bed is massive, sturdy and comfortable!
Nick and Aloe are great hosts, easy to communicate to and very welcoming (gave us wines, chocolates, eggs for breakfast). The jacuzzi is amazing!
We enjoyed our honeymoon stay in the Possum Cottage!
Make sure you try Barossa Bar & Brewery across the road for good food and drinks!

Very quaint, cute and well adapted cottage for a few nights stay! We made good use of the spa and wood burning fireplace and adored the character of the home. Very comfy beds, and location could not be better nestled right at the end of the main street. We would gladly stay again!
Very cute and great location! Will be back.
Perfect getaway for couples ! We had such a great time, the cottage is walk distance to a lot of good places. Would recommend for sure !
Amazing garden/decking. Loved the old cellar that’s now the dining room.
We had a wonderful stay in this gorgeous cottage, absolutely loved the character of the place and the outdoor spa is 10/10. Extras like fresh eggs and lollipops were provided and greatly enjoyed!
Great location and a lot of character in the cottage and grounds. Easy communication and stay in a beautiful part of the state.
Brilliant location, close to shops and wineries. The photos really dont do this place justice- what a fantastic stay! Absolutely stunning in every way
Everything was great. Great accommodation in the Barossa - would recommend to everyone 😁

The Little Possum Cottage was AMAZING! One of the nicest places we’ve stayed! A private oasis within a stone’s throw of everything the Barossa Valley has to offer.
The jacuzzi hut and secluded garden brought to mind memories of Bali. The beautiful colonial interior to the cottage was immaculately kept and provided the perfect setting for a romantic get away. The “cottage” was very roomy if you have a family as well with 2 comfortable king sized beds and 2 single beds. Lots of yummy eateries close by if you don’t feel like cooking in the well laid-out kitchen and of course the famed cellar door experiences of the Barossa can be extended in to the evening with the charming dining room located in the underground cellar which was particularly suited to carry on the luxury and spirit of the day’s wine touring. We plan on returning! Many thanks!

Wow. Just wow. We found Nick friendly and easy to communicate with, and the booking and check in process easy and hassle-free. The cottage was exactly as described, but the photos don't do it justice. It had so much more to offer but that's such a nice little surprise, as were the wines and other little extras provided by the host. A beautifully appointed character cottage. This is now our favourite place to stay in the Barossa!!

Amazing Airbnb!! Love the jacuzzi and the fireplace. Great for a couple's romantic escape. Hosts were very helpful and responsive to messages as well! Lots of thoughtful little touches to the accomodation. Although it's advertised as no kitchen, I'd classify what they have as a functional kitchen. Make sure you pack slippers and bathrobes with you because this place has amazing retreat vibes!
A great couples getaway. The jacuzzi is gorgeous and the house has amazing historic detail for enjoying the Barossa. Huge comfy Bed too! Thanks so much
Really nice little place, very comfortable and very homely.
Amazing location, gorgeous garden + house, and such a generous host! Definitely recommend
Sensational accommodation with wonderful little touches. Well equipped kitchen if you wish to cook.
really nice place and location

This cottage was beautiful. Lovely and close to food - walking distance to town.
The garden was a great place to sit and have my morning coffee.
It was a great place to sit and unwind after a day exploring the Barossa and all it has to offer.

We didn’t manage to spot the possum family unfortunately though - maybe the next people who stay will be lucky enough to!
Great place to stay with family....feel like  living in Bali.... specially Jacuzzi and outdoor garden.

The little possum cottage is definitely everything and more that we had hoped it would be!! Nick is so amazing, friendly, kind and generous. So many small details that was there for us that you just can’t get at a novotel in which we stayed many times now. Our only wish was that we could have found this little hidden gem 💎 earlier. It is our new favourite place in the Barossa and can’t wait to come back! Totally mind blown!! Thanks nick 👌👍😍🙌

The photos don’t do this place justice, the garden was mind blowing when we first walked in and were so excited by it all and the same as when we entered the house, we felt like we were in our own little paradise and the beds were also huge! we are definitely planning to stay again ⭐️

The Possum Cottage was a lovely, snug and relaxing stay. Walking through the garden entrance we were really impressed with the tranquility of the outdoor area, especially the jacuzzi, and we loved the cottage itself. The kitchen had enough facilities for basic cooking, we loved the fresh farm eggs for breakfast that waited for us and were also quite excited to see complimentary wine was also set out for us.

The bedrooms were super comfortable with lovely big beds with warm and cosy good quality linen and the underground cellar was fun to have a wine in after we’d put our baby to bed.

The accom was walking distance to the Main Street cafes and shops and it was also literally across the road from Barossa Valley Brewing which is a good pit stop for lunch.

A fantastic option for your stay in Tanunda, especially when the weather is cool, it’s a great winter stay to relax on the chesterfields in front of the fire with a wine and to warm up in the outdoor hot tub.

Thanks again for having us!

Beautiful cottage that sets apart from your typical accommodation. Nick and Aloe were easy to contact and prompt replies. Would 100% recommend to anyone looking to get away in the Barossa, definitely worth it!
What a lovely cool quirky cottage. Had everything we needed, would definitely recommend. 🥰
Beautiful spot to relax and enjoy. Great location, set up very well with everything you need.
Great accommodation and location. It was very close to all the wineries and restaurants we wanted to visit. The beds were very comfy and the whole house had a lovely cosy feel.
Amazing getaway in the heart of the Barossa, a heartbeat away from everything. For when you want to stay in, it's a romantic getaway with everything you need and more.
Beautiful little cottage

Lovely stay!

Very clean, quality linen and lovely touches throughout.

Easy stroll to restaurants and cafes.

We didn’t spot a possum, maybe next time!
Totally unique and beautiful place to stay. Close to the centre of town by car. Comfy and huge bed! And the courtyard and spa is charming.
beautiful place. very comfortable and makes you very relaxed.  Great location for all the wineries.
Nick’s place was just beautiful inside and outside. Great location just a short walk to the main shops and pubs etc. was very comfortable and had everything needed for a comfortable stay.

This is a little hidden gem.  On arrival it was fun exploring the place and had an awesome time. The spa was lovely with candles in there too.   The beds were comfy and big.  The cellar was lovely to enjoy a platter and a glass of wine, when it was quite warm outside.  Convenient to all facilities with a pub across the road which played live music, to the main street for breakfast.  Highly recommend. 5 stars from us.
Such a great spot, clean and tidy and the hot tub was a success with the guests
Great eccentric accommodation. Highly recommend 👍
Great spot- very convenient, gorgeous cellar for a meal with friends, great comfy beds and a nice touch with a welcome bottle of wine and eggs for breakfast!
Great location, gorgeous backyard, comfy beds and very cool space. Great value for money!

Great location, beautiful home and great entertaining space - probably more suited to cooler months however as the home remained very hot and uncomfortable throughout our stay (was the first heatwave of the Summer though - the aircon just couldn’t handle it unfortunately). Otherwise could not fault it!

Possum Cottage was just what we were after for our first time visiting the Barossa Valley! We were blown away by the garden as you entered the cottage and loved the luxurious spa addition! Perfect location in the heart of Tanunda ✨
Great location, close to all the Barossa has to offer.
Lovely place. Such a great spot and gorgeous outdoor area!
Beautiful cosy place, perfect place for a winter escape in the Eden & Barossa Valleys!

A cute little cottage a short drive away from the heart of the Barossa, Mt. Crawford and all the surrounding towns. The property has a beautiful, large yard equipped with outdoor fire pits and a dual hammock. We enjoyed the tranquility here! Mark was also very responsive to messages (even when we messaged him late). Highly recommend this one to anyone wanting a quiet little getaway.
Idyllic surroundings, quaint cottage, excellent communication, and lots of nice touches that made this an excellent stay.

This place is absolutely adorable!! So well restored but still maintaining its 1800’s charm. Bedrooms were so well put together and the fireplace adds such a nice atmosphere! The outside area is also absolutely stunning; if it hadn’t rained all weekend we would have loved to have utilised it more! Also quite close to all the great wineries but much better value than staying directly next to the wineries.. which is a big bonus :)
Great central spot lovely animals and frogs x close to fab pizza and forest walks

We wanted a cosy rustic character cottage with interesting features and this cottage ticked all the boxes.
Really enjoyed the garden with the eclectic array of animals to visit.
Enjoyed how the cottage was linked to historic events in Springton via the Heldig family tree.
The whole set up felt relaxed and welcoming. The hosts checked we had settled in but didn't impose upon us.
Great family holiday with all the mod cons.

A lovely stay that was cut short due to a lockdown! Mark and Fiona were very accommodating and everything was clean, tidy and welcoming. We brought our little toy poodle along with us with approval from the hosts and she loved sleeping by the fireplace. Springton is close to Mt Crawford for forest walks and relatively close to the Barossa so there's plenty to do. We would definitely recommend The Stables for a relaxing weekend away.

Mark and Fiona’s place is great! The bed is comfy, the fire place is so nice and toasty and the shower pressure combined with the shower head makes it hard to leave! We really enjoyed our stay and the recommendations on where to eat. Definitely great value for money. It is a lovely cottage that helps you escape reality and unwind!
It was a lovely place and was easy to get around to see lots in the area. And the communication was great from Mark and Fiona
Relaxing a atmosphere
Very clean and cozy cottage with all facilities you need, in the heart of many wineries! Highly recommended!
Great cottage. Very clean and tidy. Loved the relax feeling of the place. Enjoyed the sunny courtyard and warm wood fire at night.
Lovely retreat and great communication prior to check in. Wished we could have stayed longer!
We had an incredible one night stay in this gorgeous cottage. Beds were all super comfortable and we had everything we needed to make our stay calming and enjoyable. Absolutely loved it.
We loved our stay in the cottage! It's spacious and cosy at the same time and the pond out the front makes it very peaceful.
Great little cottage. Comfortable bed and quiet. Cockatoos can be noisy but not too bad. Lovely big bathroom with a nice monsoon shower
Mark and Fiona's stable cottage is just perfect for no fuss travellers with pets. Our favourite part was the huge claw tub.
Beauty of a spot, perfectly located and great for a quick getaway. Had an awesome tasting overlooking the vines at sunset. Hidden gem.
Clean and modern accommodation

Great spot close to Tanunda and Nuriootpa. The room was lovely and cosy - and quite spacious even with the (extremely comfortable) king size bed. Sheridan bathrobes provided which is always appreciated. A beautiful view just outside as well.
Great view from the cellar door terrace.
Really beautiful room, comfortable bed. Location couldn’t be more perfect, very cosy room. Heater works really well.

We loved our stay. The room was beautiful and the grounds were stunning. A perfect location and we loved the wine so much we purchased some bottles there but are considering getting more! Thanks for being such helpful hosts with the keys and our later check in.
Great location, nice setting and clean, comfortable room.
Lovely place to stay for a weekend getaway. Would strongly recommend.

Such a gorgeous place to stay. Looked exactly like the images and Frank at the cellar door was amazing! Beautiful even in the freezing cold winter and a fantastic history/wine selection. Accomodation was perfect for a short romantic getaway. 10/10!!!!
We stayed only one night (which was not enough). The location and accommodation was great, as was the wine tasting! Our only one suggestion would be to improve the cheese platter!

We enjoyed our stay and loved the comforts of the beautifully styled rooms that back onto the vineyard and are next door to the cellar door. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and had a lovely complimentary wine tasting by the fire place while enjoying the beautiful view of the vineyard during sunset. We even saw a Kangaroo family in the vineyard one evening!
Well equip, geat location, terrific wines and extremely friendly
Great location, clean and comfortable room. Felt like we had the place to ourselves. Deck access overlooking the vineyard is magic! We had a lovely stay and will be back again.
Cute room in a great spot.
Great room, amazing location
A well appointed room with lovely surroundings to enjoy as well 😊
Nice room in a very convenient spot. We didn’t get a chance to explore the winery like we wanted too but still enjoyed our trip.  Room had most things we needed and had no issues with anything
Fantastic spot to stay for a trip to the Barossa!

Thank you Hewitson Winery for having us this weekend. We enjoyed our stay in our beautiful room and also enjoyed a lovely evening on the deck of your gorgeous cellar door. Communication was wonderful and your wines were brilliant. We would recommend you to our family and friends. Thanks again!
We had a wonderful stay!
A very clean and well appointed room at one of our favourite cellar doors - perfect for your trip to the Barossa Valley!

We loved everything about our stay at Hewitson Winery, a very comfortable room with a lovely private yard. The views of the vineyards from the deck were breathtaking and close access to the cellar door was very convenient. Would love to stay here again!
Nice and comfortable place to stay with pleasant wines. Had a good time.
Beautiful location with a stunning view. We will be back
Beautiful modern room and stunning views
Great location clean tidy and modern
Amazing place to spend some time.
Such an amazing location with a very cozy quest room. Wines were incredible!
Beautiful outlook and friendly considerate service
Incredible location, and super friendly staff!
It was lovely to have access to the vineyard  after closing.  We enjoyed sitting on the deck watching the sunset with a glass of Hewitson Wine
Absolute gem! 💯 My wife & I enjoyed our short stay. Looking forward to coming back for a longer period, to enjoy the views of the winery on the deck.
An amazing place to stay in the Barossa. So central to everything and the view from the deck is spectacular! Very clean room and would highly recommend to anyone to stay at

Clean, comfortable and lovely place to stay. Check in was great and easy and the room was as advertised, except that the view was not of the vineyard, rather it was onto a car park which we didn’t expect. All in all, lovely stay. Thanks!
An incredible gem in the Barossa. The stunning cellar door boast incomparable views and a peaceful atmosphere.
Great location, great wine and great service.
Beautiful location, great service and so many delightful extras! This was the best place to stay, could not have picked better accomodation
Lovely place, very clean and comfortable.
Great central location to access the nearby small towns and many vineyards in the area.  A bonus was having access to the deck overlooking the vineyard. Absolutely beautiful and very relaxing!
Great place. Awesome decking
Great location, with great wine and a beautiful view over the vines. Worth checking out and staying for a few days
Nice room in the middle of Barossa. Pricing on the higher end.
Absolutely amazing place to stay! Wish we could have stayed longer, unfortunately the tasting room wasn’t open but that didn’t stop us from enjoying the view with a glass of wine. Highly recommend
Great air bnb. Nice room with plenty of wine from the winery in the fridge. The decking overlooking the  winery had a great view and was really nice in the evening

It’s a great little spot.
Frank so helpful and also helped us with taxis.
Wine in room came in handy too for enjoying their vineyard views

We stayed one night at Hewitson on a road trip from mclaren vale to Barossa. We were lucky enough to have the entire tasting deck and view of the vineyards to ourselves which is pretty special.  Great location with a hire car.  Nicely styled room and comfy bed. Slight noise of cars from the main road but wasn’t really a big issue.  Thanks for having us!
Lovely location, very clean and access to vineyard was amazing! We will definitely be back.
Fantastic stay. Beautiful location!
Quiet, clean and the perfect spot for a true boutique Barossa experience. Cellar door was excellent.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Hewitson Winery. Very easy to find the room, which was clean and well stocked. Nice to be able to walk a minute to the cellar door and to try all the wines. Would definitely stay again.

The guest room at Hewitson was clean, modern, and affordable. The check-in process was seamless, and the complimentary tasting upon check-in was a nice touch/welcome to the region. Would recommend to family and friends.
Great stay - we will be back! Location was fabulous in the middle of the vineyards- Great spot to explore the Barossa from. Friendly hosts with cheese platter on arrival!
Comfortable and modern accomodation, great location,  gorgeous vineyard views would definitely recommend
Great place

The room is located in a fabulous location, close access to pretty much everything.
The room is very nice, the photos do not do it justice.
Breakfast included, but only small - would be great if they had a toaster too.
Private access to the winery deck, which was absolutely phenomenal - an awesome surprise!
Was a great stay and beautiful outlook
Amazing venue. Supper clean and comfortable bed. Close to all great locations in the Barossa. Great views.

Perfect accomodation for our two night getaway. Loved every bit of this room from the plush carpet to the gorgeous lighting options; so much thought has been put in and it shows. Had the best sleep in the king bed, kitted out with quality linen, and enjoyed the giant waterfall shower-head. Could not ask for a better location, central to everything. Unfortunately the cellar door wasn’t open the weekend we stayed, so we weren’t able to try their wines, however this meant we had the grounds to ourselves which was lovely and private. Highly recommend and will be back to stay again!

Beautiful place very clean and so close to many beautiful wineries and cafes
The room was absolutely gorgeous highly recommend
Beautiful location. Easy to locate and nice setup.
Really enjoyed our stay at Hewitson. Our room and the winery were both lovely. Would highly recommend and book again :)
Thanks for a great stay
Very comfortable and modern stay- the deck is a beautiful place to have a wine and enjoy the view

Stylishly appointed and immaculately clean accommodation in a beautiful setting. The bed was super comfortable, and the heating made it very cosy for a winter getaway. Also it was great to just walk next door and taste their excellent wines.

Great accomodation
Great wine
A truly lovely spot to spend a weekend.

We loved it here. The room was clean and new and decadently furnished. The bed was crazy comfortable and the access to the back garden area really added to the experience. Also, the Chardonnay is legit.
Such a lovely area and beautiful winery, we really enjoyed our stay here. Such a cute and cosy room ❤️

We had a very enjoyable albeit brief stay at Hewitson Winery. The room was spotless and very well appointed.  Close to Tanunda and lots of good wineries. Unfortunately we didn't have time for a tasting at Hewitson this trip however the cellar door is lovely and we enjoyed the guest access to the balcony overlooking the vineyards!
Amazing room and location, access to the tasting deck out of hours is a perfect location for a glass of wine and snack. Photos true to the room. Very enjoyable stay all around
Comfy little room, king size bed a plus. Very modern and Frank was very accommodating at the cellar door
Clean stay with great host communication, great location.
Amazing location, great accommodation. Very clean and relaxing stay in Barossa. The wines also tasted amazing and the cheese platter was delicious
A fantastic spot drinking wine on the balcony and a great room to stay. The check-in was great.
The host was excellent the olives were amazing and the wine was delicious!

What an awesome place to stay!
Friendly and helpful staff, beautiful surroundings, modern comfortable accommodation with a heritage twist. Super clean. The deck near the tasting room has superb views across the vineyard.
We tried lots of the wine and couldn't find one we didn't like! 😁
I highly recommend staying here.

Beautiful location, great service and gorgeous room
Will definitely be returning
Good 😊
absolute beautiful room and scenery around the place. they were so accommodating letting us check in and get the key earlier. cannot recommend them enough 👍
Great value for money. Beautiful location. Really easy to communicate. Loved our stay at he wits on winery!

Couldn’t rate this accommodation any higher. Beautiful room and beautiful views out on the deck.
The owners were extremely accommodating.
Thank you again, we look forward to coming back.

My wife and I stayed for a week in Hewitson and it was a great accommodation to unwind. The place is lovely and clean, with a very nice view of the winery outside. We even had a barbecue dinner thanks to Frank who lent us the griller. The parking was also perfect for our big car, spacious and close to the room itself. We highly recommend staying in Hewitson if you travel around in Nuriootpa.
Fantastic accomodation with such high standards. the view of the winery was stunning. highly recommend
What a gorgeous spot! So quiet and tranquil, and so beautiful with the stunning vineyard views. The room has everything you need - we enjoyed a much needed mini break!
Nicely deecorated and clean room, with access to the vineyards via gate next to room.
Great place with good wines and an amazing view
Lovely place to spend a night. Fantastic views over the winery once you go out the gate to the back area.
Beautiful stay and amazing wine to accompany
Great stay at a beautiful cellar door. Surrounds are great; had a nice arvo tasting then enjoyed the deck after hours for sunset. Will stay again.
The deck is a lovely place to sit and enjoy the view.
Beautiful winery and convenient location between Tununda and Nuriootpa. Rooms are modern and clean - very comfortable bed.
Amazing views and wine, does not disappoint

Great location and hosts. You can expect a quiet night’s rest and an interesting and informal chat with your hosts if that’s what you like.  Very clean facilities and a lovely outdoor entertaining area that we would have used if it wasn't winter. Would book again when heading to the Barossa.
Great stay, Mai has a lot of knowledge of wine and nearby wineries which was very helpful. Very accommodating and pleasant stay.
Great location, quiet and peaceful surroundings, friendly and welcoming hosts, enjoyed the warm winter sun coming through the window and hot bath. Excellent heating and cleanliness
Wonderful hosts and great accommodation! If you’re worried about privacy, don’t be. Good privacy for any guest and Mai is lovely and very welcoming.  Perfect location to experience the Barossa! :)
A clean open place, friendly hosts, nice to have the bathroom & toilet so handy to the bedroom.

A very comfortable and peaceful place to stay. Handy location for visiting all parts of the Barossa. Mai and her husband are very friendly and welcoming and happy to recommend places to visit. We would recommend this place to others and certainly hope to go back again ourselves one day. Wendy and John
So super helpful and friendly. Great peaceful spot. Would definately stay again
Vitalii made us feel very welcome in their home. Perfectly located to enjoy the great wineries in the area. Thanks for the pleasant stay Mai and Vitalii.

Great central location to main street in Tanunda and surrounding wineries... a 20 to 25 min flat walk to town with so many beautiful houses to look at on the way. Living space is huge and Mai and Vitali very accommodating and helpful. A great bbq outside for cooking, if you don't want to share the kitchen area.

Mai and Vitalii are probably the best hosts I've ever encountered. Both of them are very welcoming and approachable. Beautiful house with lovely front and back yards, nice and friendly neighbourhood, and surrounded by tones of great wineries. Mai is an expert when it comes to wines and wineries, and knows the surroundings very well. Definitely recommend!
Comfortable place to stay, conveniently located in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Great hosts.

We loved our stay at Hewitson Wineries! The rooms are great and very comfortable with everything we needed provided. The grounds are beautiful and we enjoyed many nights relaxing on the deck with a gorgeous outlook over the vineyards. The location was also perfect, and was very central in the Barossa region, which meant we could easily venture out and explore.
Frank was also extremely helpful and responsive whenever we had any questions (even over the public holidays when we were there) which helped make our stay an easy one. We’ll definitely be back :)
Amazing property with stunning views across the valley. Too easy to sit, eat&drink, play games, read…….and relax enjoying a local wine. Heavenly ☺️
Great view & wonderful area of SA to explore.  Good place to stay for a family with young children.

Beautiful views of the area, spacious designed home, beds were very comfortable and clean, definitely a great place to get away from the City and enjoy the magnificent local wineries.  A little note dirt road for the last 3-4 km's (easy road) no problems, plenty of kangaroo's and cows for the kids to look at on the way !
A beautiful place with a great view and setting. Beautiful bedrooms well styled and comfy beds. Plenty of nice walks to be had a great places to visit in the area. A great place to take kids.

We absolutely loved our stay at the house, a gorgeous retreat close to lots of attractions in the the Barossa! Incredible views and the house is fully equipped with everything you need - especially well catered for kids! The house was very clean and Angela was a pleasure to communicate with!
Will definitely stay again!
Fantastic location in the best area of the Barossa and great facilities for a group of people.
A very large, clean and comfortable family home. Well appointed kitchen, a little bit remote up a windy dirt road, but beautiful Australian views all around. The sheep were fun to watch!
Incredible location as a nature getaway - here you can forget the bustling world and restore!

Ah, this property is a gem! Was absolutely perfect for our family group of 12. Thank you to Angela for the hospitality! So well equipped from the kitchen to the excellent kids play area. Our kids loved catching yabbies in the dam & we enjoyed the vista including some beautiful sunsets. Couple things to note, it's a dirt road for the final approach to the property. And in really hot weather, the AC struggles to cool the rooms. Would definitely stay here again.
Great location for large groups especially if you enjoy great wine 🍷 👍🏽

This is an extremely beautiful part of the Barossa Valley that this property is situated on. We were granted with one of the most beautiful sunsets we’ve ever seen on the neighbouring hill. The house it self is a real treat and you can see a lot of love has been put into it. We’d return again next time we are looking to stay in the Barossa as a larger group without hesitation.

Wow!  What a great place. Julie and Peter have obviously put a lot of love restoring this beautiful lodge over the past 3 years. Just a lovely place to stay. We will definitely visit again. It is great to share with work colleagues, friends and/or family. Location is great - close to Adelaide and on the doorstep of the Barossa. Julie was a perfect host. Can't fault it.

Mattner House was an absolutely beautiful place to have a weekend away. Everything was spotlessly clean and comfortable. There was plenty of room for each guest. The games room was lots of fun - we spent all evening doing karaoke - it was a blast. And to top this all off, the 360 degree views from the property were absolutely idyllic. What a special property! We’ll be back!

Amazing house for a large group of people, we loved the bedrooms, three with their own bathrooms! Plenty of space with stunning views and a fun outdoor area for karaoke and a wine overlooking the valley. Perfect location only 10 minutes from Tanunda. I would recommend this highly for large groups of people that want a comfortable get away with the space to party.
Fantastic property

An incredible property, lots of rooms and good amount of space for a big family group and things to do between the karaoke room, seeing the chickens and alpacas or just enjoying the scenery. Would happily stay again.
Peaceful location - great indoor fire. Comfortable home.
A lovely spot to stay with a great location.
Beautiful, quaint home. We loved our stay and Gina was super accommodating
Fantastic place to stay. Very clean and service was fantastic.
Nice place and great location, but unfortunately no hot water. Quite pricey too.
Beautiful stay!

We had a great time, lovely accommodation with a great deck to relax and admire the views. Found the place clean and tidy and couldn't fault anything. Gina was a great host and always gets back to your messages within the hour. 😊
Great location, close to town, house had most essentials required. Had a fun time exploring the Barossa thanks again
Lovely farmhouse in a great location close to wineries. Gina was very responsive to questions throughout the booking and provided great information on the area.
decent property, nice and simple house.. great views, very relaxing.. only criticism would be there's only 1 toilet and to make sure the pool is clean, very nice host tho
Great house for a group or family getaway in Barossa. Pool is beautiful and clean, and the location is perfect for exploring the region. Thank you, would stay again!
Fantastic, well-appointed house in great location. Kids had a ball in the pool while adults relaxed on the deck taking in the scenery. Highly recommend for a Barossa trip.
Excellent accomodation well located
An absolutely amazing place! Very thoughtful setup and convenient to Tanunda. Definitely looking forward to coming back soon.
Was so lovely to return, loved the stay
Max was an outstanding host. The accomodation is beautiful and we would recommend this to anyone interested in a luxury stay walking distance from Tanunda
We had a wonderful stay in the Barossa. Max is an excellent host and the house is fantastic!
A beautiful home set in an amazing location among the vines and only a short stroll to the town centre. With fabulous hosts to round it off this is a must stay in Tanunda.

Great location and the view is outstanding.  The 8 of us had a great weekend celebrating my husbands 60th birthday.  The house is very nice with everything you would need.  Plenty to do in the surrounding area. Excellent time had by all.

Our group was made up of 5 adults and a baby and the property had lots of space for all of us, plus 2 further beds. The hosts were very flexible and helpful, and the house was presented perfectly, with everything we needed and more. Sitting at the fire pit in the evening as the sun went down was very special and the views at all times of day were spectacular. The location is amazing and so close to so many places to visit. You could walk or cycle to several wineries or Tanunda if you wanted to. Wifi and mobile reception were excellent also, and there's a good choice of TV and streaming channels. We'll definitely be booking another trip, Thanks so much!

Fantastic stay in a beautiful location among the vines.
House had all the comforts and amenities and the firepit was a great way to finish the evening.
Would highly recommend.
An amazing and calming place to stay. Topped off with a gorgeous view. Anna and David provide a lovely home with all our needs catered for. Would be extremely happy to stay here again

This is an absolute gem, the location is sensational with a brilliant view, the house and bedrooms are all well appointed and is a great spot to visit the rest of the  Barossa from. Highly recommended!!

We would thoroughly recommend staying at Anna and David's property. It was comfortable and modern, spotlessly clean and well appointed with everything we needed. The house is located on a hill with stunning views of the vineyard below and an area outside to enjoy with a fire bucket and wood provided. The house is in a perfect location close to nearby towns and there is a great taxi service for those wanting to enjoy the wineries. Anna and David were easy to communicate with and even left us a hand-written welcome note with a bottle of wine on arrival. We would love to come back and stay at this property again.
Great stay at this lovely air bnb with amazing views

We had a fantastic stay in the Barossa and the house was all we needed and more. The house was clean, very well appointed and in a perfect location. The view from the house and from three of the bedrooms is just amazing and so peaceful. We would definitely go back and would recommend this property to anyone looking for a week-end gateway!
The property is in a great location, so quiet and serene with great view and in such a good central spot in the Barossa valley. Everything was clean and well equiped both inside and out.

Such a beautiful and relaxing weekend away. The house is comfortable and spacious. The outdoor area is amazing and the views are stunning! Once the paving is finished it will be truly magical. The hot tub is a lovely addition. Great communication from Anna and David. Will be back!

Some holidays are for rushing around sight seeing, but this year we desperately needed to relax and recharge. We found the PERFECT place to do just that!  We and our adult children had space to ourselves if we wanted it, and plenty of opportunity to relax together. Soaking in the hot tub at twilight was a favourite. The house had everything we needed and the stunning view over the vineyards was very peaceful. We should do a Covid-style holiday every year!
Beautiful house with amazing view, will be back for sure! Many thanks Anna and David!
Stunning place! Love everything in the house & the great view. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.
A gorgeous place to stay!
Beautiful house with a lovely view across vineyards. Very convenient location, close to town and wineries. House supplied with everything you need and lovely hosts who respond promptly.
Fabulous place to stay and a great base to explore the Barossa. Beautiful view over the vineyards and the hot tub is a great way to start and end the day!

This was our second visit to the property and we love it. It's always clean and tidy and communication from the owners is always very good. It's such a great set up with magnificent views and the property has all you need and more. Location is outstanding, with so much on your doorstep. We can't wait for our next visit!

Very nice place to stay.  Convenient location in the Barossa Valley, clean and tidy property with all the basic amenities.  Breakfast items provided as well as wood available for the indoor fireplace.  A large selection of entertainment options and information.  Bed was comfortable and the place heated well.
beautiful home and gardens  had a great time
Beautiful cottage

Just beautiful! A perfect little cottage to spend the weekend in. Very close to all the wineries in the Barossa. Very clean and comfortable with all the right touches. Wonderful sunset from the front porch. I would highly recommend.
We enjoyed our stay very much.
Very comfortable and peaceful stay with lots of little touches and a beautiful setting.
This is a gorgeous character cottage with a historic feel but all the modern amenities needed. The hosts are very responsive. Would highly recommend hiring bikes in Angaston to explore the area!

This is a gorgeous little cottage right in the heart of the Barossa, but far enough off the main track that it's also peaceful and quiet! If you choose to stay here, you'll be able to enjoy all the Barossa and surrounding regions have to offer, with your own little slice of tranquility to return home to. The front verandah is perfect for lounging around sipping any bottles of wine you may have picked up whilst out visiting the vineyards, not to mention the huge spa bath in the bathroom!

The place is easy to find, communication prior to check in was superb and we didn't have any drama's throughout our stay, would happily stay again.

The cottage, being quite old, is quite small but there are two bedrooms, a combined kitchen/dining, a living area with a large fire if it gets too cold, plus a laundry, bathroom and toilet which are all separate. It's on the smaller side when it comes to the kitchen/dining but the rest of the room is more than spacious enough with the living having two large couches.

The shower on our first morning was quite bad, not much more than a drip, however, this issue didn't seem to happen again so not sure what went on there. We did realise that if running the shower/bath the toilet would take forever to fill up, so perhaps being as old as it is it can really only cope with one thing running water at a time. Wasn't an issue once we figured it out and just made sure we didn't use anything when showering. We had a spa every evening as soon as our daughter went to bed, it's easily large enough for two adults and we found it the perfect way to relax with a glass of wine in hand to finish off a day exploring the region.

You WILL need a car if staying here. You can use taxi's but no other public transport heads that way. You're only a short, five minute drive from the nearest town, Angaston. It's got a few places to eat and most do take-away's. It's also not too much further to Narioopta with even more options for dining/drinking. We found the location was perfect but we had a car.

We went to the supermarket and got ourselves some staples for breakfast, turns out, we shouldn't have. The fridge and pantry were well stocked with bacon, eggs, bread, jams and all other sorts of stuff. I think there were even baked beans and some sausages. There was a glass of dessert wine on the shelf with some chocolates, a jar with some cookies and a few other nice little touches like these. We tried to just eat the stuff we had with us, but the cookies were delicious and my daughter found the chocolates!

All in all, if you're looking for a beautiful little cottage that stays true to it's era, with the added touch of a beautiful relaxing bath, look no further! We loved it! :)

Will definitely stay again if returning to the Barossa region.
An lovely quiet cottage in a perfect location. Pure bliss, the perfect place to relax.
Stay was amazing

Stepping in this cottage felt like time travelling. Beautiful old cottage with an authentic feel to it. The location is stunning, remote  yet close to everything the Barossa Valley has to offer. The property offers an amazing view. The host thought of absolutely everything to make the stay comfortable including supplies of local produce for breakfast and more!  Very grateful we could stay!
Great location, close to all things Barossa but peaceful & tranquil. The house is beautiful, full of character and every little detail is taken care of.

Lisa went above and beyond for our stay, not only was the house lovely, Lisa also provided ingredients for a full fry-up breakfast, wine, and a cheeseboard. The property was wonderful to take a wander through, with plenty of bird and wildlife sightings.  We especially loved the lounge room with the wood fire, it was cosy and well set out for game or movie nights. We can't wait to come back for a more extended stay!

This was the ultimate relaxing, peaceful and enjoyable airbnb! Lisa went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and introduce us to the house. The kitchen was stacked with breakfast foods and other delicious goodies, as well as everything you could possibly need to cook. The whole house has excellent amenities for a family or friends, including a fire place, tennis court and board games. Super clean and thoughtful. Very close, easy access to town and around the wineries.
Thank you for having us for the weekend!

Gorgeous, spacious cosy home in a pretty location.
Fully equipped with everything
Perfect time spent with a group of ladies enjoying the barossa hillside :) it was comfortable and accommodating for us! We loved every minute there! Thank you Lisa we will be back!
Great location! Loved it!!
Fantastic location and hospitality. Couldn’t have been happier with the whole experience. Definitely recommend.
This property was glorious! Perfect landing spot for a family or group of friends. Amazing beds and everything you need to chill out in the Barossa.

Terrific stay, great facilities, and right in the heart of the Barossa.  Engaging and responsive hosts, on a large private property (vineyard).  Perfect for relaxing, enjoying the amazing views, and soaking-up the local restaurants bars and cafes (and vineyards!).

A great house in a perfect location. Within walking distance to the Main Street. Loads of quaint shops and lovely restaurants close by. Very comfortable beds and all the amenities needed for a perfect getaway.

A lovely place with everything you need. We were working away and Stella’s place has everything you need including breakfast. Stella’s great communication made the process easy and even checking in during our stay. Will definitely stay again when in the area.

A well stocked and appointed space. Lovely decor and quality fixtures.
Stella was very helpful and responsive to communication
Thanks for a good stay

We loved this accommodation! It was very clean and cozy. Stella provided most of the items during the stay, even fresh eggs from her chickens! We will definitely stay here again when we are in this area!

a great, cosy yet modern place to stay to get away from everything and just relax.. plenty of adventures nearby and a short drive to anything you need.. would 100% recommend and will look to stay again..

Such a little gem. Felt like a home away from home, all the little touches and Christmas decorations made it wonderful and cosy. Fully equipped with everything you can thing of and a great location between the Barossa and Clare for visiting the wineries. Great communication from the host. Hopefully we can come back soon!
Our family had a wonderful staycation at Stella's place which was very cosy and clean. The breakfast and treats were generous and thoughtful.
Well appointed home with excellent breakfast options and very friendly hosts. Water system is on tank water, so be water safe. Had wifi, tv and easily fit the five of us.

We were very impressed with the accommodation and hospitality. So many lovely little homey touches from choc cake and bikkies on arrival to bacon, eggs, muschrooms, tomatoes, butter, juice, bread, cereal... everything you could need for a brekkie cookup! Beds were comfortable and the location was so peaceful. A perfect country escape close to the wineries, what more could you ask for?!

Amazing surrounds, beautiful gardens to explore, and hosts that were really helpful and made our stay great!  We’ve been to the Barossa many times, and are not quite sure why we’d not been to Anlaby Station before! Highly recommended.  If you’re a keen cyclist, a really scenic ride to Kapunda for coffee (although the ride back is harder!).
A wonderful historic property and magnificent garden - we will definitely be back!
What a perfect location and wonderful host. You definitely will not be disappointed if you stay here. Close to everything and a perfect setting.
Lovely cottage in a great location, very clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend.

Amazing accommodation and Deb was fantastic!
Would highly recommend to anyone staying
Great location, great cottage. Everything you could ask for. Highly recommend you stay here!
Beautiful cottage with all the amenities you could want. Grat location to explore the barossa from. would 100% stay again of in the area
Thanks for a great stay Debbie!
Great location, clean and well equipped cottage
Great little spot! Will definitely be booking again

Stunning location. Room was beautiful and clean, with authentic antique character. Location was perfect, so close to wineries and distilleries (especially with the cellar door next door). It was even lovely sitting on the verandah. Would highly recommend and will be back for sure!

This is one of the most well-equipped B&B we have ever stayed in!
Beautiful locally made bread and wine. A whole litre of fresh milk, Nespresso and a variety of teas. Sheridan and Gainsborough linens and towels. Sufficient heating, good pillows. Claw foot bath for my husband to soak in after visiting the Gin distillery next door. Gorgeous aesthetic. Very lovely and centrally located for wine tasting. Could not fault it.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Perfect location with easy access to everything in the Barossa.
Cute and comfortable cottage with good amenities and features. Great wine tasting adjacent and distillery a short walk.

“Oscars” was better than the photos. We can highly recommend a stay here, the place was lovely, clean, (comfy bed). Breakfast was simple but fresh and quite adequate. Debbie went above and beyond with a drop off and pick up at a local lunch so we could both have a drink. Would definitely stay again.

Thanks so much. Lochnagar was perfect for our group of 3 couples on a Barossa mini break. Located very close to some great cellar doors & a 20 minute walk to Tanunda’s main street. Perfectly presented with everything we needed, even cooked breakfast provisions. Thanks again for a wonderful stay, our 2 nights were too short. We most definitely will return.

Highly recommend staying at David and Ruth’s. The house is located within walking/biking distance to some wonderful wineries (you must have a cheese board at David Frances Winery overlooking the rolling vineyard views). The house was cosy and had 3 bedrooms each with its own en-suite which made the perfect home for 3 couples travelling together or a family. We made use of the bbq and beautiful outdoor setting  and even used the fireplace on our first night as the temperature was quite cool. Loved our stay!
Beautiful and convenient place with lots of thoughtful touches by David and Ruth. We loved the property and enjoyed visiting Barossa. Definitely stay here.

Absolutely fantastic stay!
Limited hot water is the only down fall - everything else was perfect 😊

Unreal location coupled with a unique winery only 5 minutes up the road.

Fantastic place to stay, felt very comfortable and at home

10/10 will be looking at staying here again if ever stopping through Tanunda/ the Barossa valley
A beautiful home in the perfect central location. Would highly recommend this property. Brett was very accommodating and we will definitely be back.

We loved our stay! Position is great, easy amble down the street to great morning coffee, cafes, restaurants, wine bars and shopping. Centrally located to so many wineries, gin distillery, breweries.
The home has a beautiful outlook with lots of light, lovely gardens, comfy beds, and well equipped kitchen. Great to have the 2nd separate toilet.
We had a fantastic two nights away. Great facilities and brilliant accommodation for a share house. Very clean and perfect location- we will definitely be back!
I lovely getaway, very spacious, clean and well ventilated with beautiful sights in the yards. Communication and access were easy and very prompt.
Lovely house in a great location.  Seamless check in and check out. Really enjoyed our stay
Perfect location, walking distance to all bars, shops and restaurants within Talunga. Really open and airy space and in a beautiful area of town.
Great location in Tanunda, the hosts were absolutely lovely and it’s pet friendly!! Could not fault anything 😋

Lovely cozy, comfortable and newly renovated cottage that was easy to settle in to. Loved that it was pet friendly and a part of the lounge room was perfectly provided for a dog. The kitchen was well stocked and the owners were friendly and very helpful.

Great location to explore the eating and drinking options Tanunda has to often as all are within walking distance. Comfortable clean and lovely outdoor area for breakfast or sitting and enjoying the early evening.
Great location in central Tanunda. Walking distance from everything on Main Street. Great outdoor area for nice weather 👍

A convenient and cosy cottage within walking distance of the main strip in Tanunda. Check-in / Check-out was simple and the views out back were lovely. We'll be sure to come back if visiting the area again!

We spent a couple of days in this delightful cottage and will happily return when we next visit the Barossa. The cottage has beautifully decorated bedrooms which were very comfortable and a fully renovated kitchen which has everything you could need. The new bathroom is gorgeous and has a large rain shower which was just lovely! Kate is a great host and communicator and we are happy to recommend this property.
Amazing location, gorgeous cottage, wonderful hosts who left us yummy breaky provisions (and ice creams in the freezer for the kids!). Can’t wait to stay again :)
beautiful place
Perfect location for exploring Barossa. Thanks Kate for a lovely stay

Charming cottage, excellent location.
Well presented, will definitely return for another visit.
Would recommend as a great choice for an AirBnb stay in Tanunada
Great place in a really good location. Everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Lovely cosy property within walking distance of Tanunda Main Street.
Comfy beds
Amazing location, the house was lovely even better than the pictures. Would love to stay again next time we’re here!

Absolutely gorgeous cottage with all the comforts of home. We had a lovely stay and wished we had booked longer. Communication with the hosts was excellent and check in a breeze. Liked that access to enclosed parking was available. Highly recommended.

Kiron Cottage is a new gem on the market of accommodation in Kapunda.
We loved being able to take our little dog.
The cottage, although quite old, is spacious and well appointed.
The lounge and bed were comfortable with nice quality linen.
We walked to the Main Street to the hotel and Foodland.
There are a few pleasant walks nearby and the Kapunda Bowling Club and Dutton sports complex are at the end of the street.
We enjoyed our time at Kiron Cottage.

Traditional Kapunda stone home located within walking distance of the local high street, and also the walking trail and parks. Comfortably appointed with everything you need, and a beautiful selection of herbs at the back door! Bed was very comfortable also. would definitely stay again. Kapunda is well
located between the Barossa and Clare Valleys, perfect spot to locate yourself and explore all the region has to offer.
Great little miner’s cottage with small comfy rooms and a lovely backyard and front porch where we enjoyed our G&Ts at sunset. Nice linens too!

We loved our stay! This historic house is very comfortable and has everything you need, and the location great. A bottle of wine on welcome was also much appreciated and enjoyed! The garden and yard is nice and secure for dogs - our pooch was very happy here too with plenty of space to explore. Thanks for being so helpful and great hosts, Steph & Mick.
Enjoyed our stay in a beautiful old home.

Nice and comfortable handy to town and ammenities
Host made us feel welcome

We stayed here for 16 nights. Fabulous, quirky, older home. Massive garden & completely dog friendly. Perfectly situated, a short walk to shops/cafes/parks & a short drive to wineries & other interesting little towns. The house itself is fully equipped with everything you could possibly need for a short or long stay. Bed linen & towels are a beautiful quality & the bright study area was perfect for work. Our little dog was obsessed with exploring the garden, she loved it!
A special mention to Steph, our host, who went out of her way to help & accommodate us during a very difficult period. Communication was excellent & her care & concern really touched us. I can’t recommend this property (& host) enough.

We were very impressed by the accommodation at Kiron. What a super charming Miners Cottage that has plenty of character and space to relax. There was not one element missed in this place from the cool and quirky retro design aesthetic through to all the amenities, inclusions as well as cleanliness. Communication with the owner was very comprehensive and we loved her attention to detail for our stay.

We had a great stay, a thoughtfully presented and renovated older property. Comfortable, plenty of charm and all the modern touches. Fully fenced back yard, our dogs loved exploring and relaxing on the grass. Walking distance to town centre, great walking trails.

Quirky place in a lovely town with a beautiful wetland with ducks just at the end of the street
Dogs absolutely loved it and
Steph’s attention to detail was appreciated
We loved staying here! Such a great cottage with a huge backyard for our dogs, would definitely book again ☺️

This historic house at Kapunda is central and enabled us to travel across to Clare and to the Barossa Valley. Spacious and separate living areas for us to spread out, all cooking facilities that you may require if you're staying in for dinner. As a reminder of how short in stature Cornish miners must have been our very tall 6ft 5 son was amused to have to duck his head through the doorways, he's glad he wasn't a miner.
Also a must see at Kapunda was the museum. Allow plenty of time to take it all in as you will be transported back in time.

Fantastic house in Kapunda, great base to explore the local area including Barossa Valley wineries. Loved the space. Even better that the property is dog friendly with a large secure fenced yard. Walking distance to the main street for cafes and shops. Great communication from hosts and so welcoming. Highly recommend.
Great little house, very enjoyable stay
A warm, welcome and a unique place to stay in such a beautiful town of Grenock.

The Winemakers had a warm and homely feel set up with a keen eye for blending old and new. It was an engaging and interesting tribute to history of a bygone era.
The beautiful selection of mainly local produce upon arrival together with set fireplaces was incredibly thoughtful and provided their guests with the opportunity to relax and enjoy their surroundings immediately.
A truly unique and wonderful experience.
A lovely and beautifully furnished cottage. The hosts are very hospitable and very prompt responding to queries.

Absolutely stunning cottage, a 5 star experience with timeless pieces reminiscent of its history but the benefits of modern luxury.
From making the booking to concluding our stay the hosts communicated regularly and timely. I was reassured (my first Airbnb booking) and welcomed. The place is just beautifully presented with very luxurious bedrooms and bathrooms, it has a quaint courtyard and secure parking. On arrival we were greeted with ambient lighting and music and a lovely bottle of wine and nibbles, perfect for a relaxing afternoon. Our every need was anticipated with all the little extras (fresh milk), tea, coffee maker etc supplied. We will be returning.
What an amazing home - perfect location - perfect hosts. Highly recommended.

Absolutely fantastic house just what was required, beautiful, quaint, quirky. Everything as it should be, nicely appointed & plenty of room.
The garden and outdoor space is perfect to enjoy beautiful days whilst enjoying great Barossa wine & food.
A perfect base to explore the Barossa and Greenock with El Stanco restaurant directly across the road for coffee & Food, Pub and cellars doors just a short walk. Couldn’t Highly recommend it more.

we loved this place! can't recommend it highly enough. close to all vineyards, quiet and so beautifully furnished with antiques, feels like you've stepped back in time.  would love to stay longer next time .

Wyndham and Patricia are great hosts, and the accommodation is super luxy. Greenock is a nice little town and the locals are friendly. You're within strolling distance of a good cafe, wineries and a brewery, plus you can take a wander around the nature reserve along the creek. Very relaxing.
Wyndham and Patricia are excellent hosts who are dedicated to providing a memorable stay for their guests. I would definitely recommend their property to any visitors to the Barossa.
Partner and I loved it, very romantic with a great attention to detail. Very convenient location. Highly recommended.

A perfect stay for our girls weekend away, everything we needed and more. Wyndham and Patricia were excellent hosts, great communication and very helpful with our last minute booking additions. The accommodation is beautiful and the beds are super comfortable. We look forward to staying again some time soon and enjoying some more of your delicious wine.

Our stay was perfect - the cottage was gorgeous & eclectic, very clean, and walking distance to a cafe, the pub & cellar doors. Wyndham’s communication was also fantastic - very easy to reach & had many great recommendations for local sites not to miss. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay & are looking forward to coming back again very soon!
Jon’s eco cabins were a great stay. Very cosy and comfortable with easy access to all of Barossa and eden valley. Perfect for a weekend or overnight stay.

Thanks for providing a lovely place for us to stay Jon. We don’t believe you need to change. From start to finish communication was great and we enjoyed the features the hut had to offer. Very easy booking, check in & check out process. Highly recommend for others to enjoy a stay also. Cam & Sara
good stay, got everything I need

Cute and cosy cabin with a country feeling that isn't far from the city or anything you need. Jon had fantastic communication throughout our entire three night stay and went above and beyond to make our new year's holiday a good one
Cute little cabin that had everything we needed. JB’s communication was great and he went above and beyond to ensure we were comfortable. It was a perfect spot for our little getaway - thanks JB!

This was an absolute oasis after a 37 degree day in the valley. The custom built accommodation feels really luxurious and there was local wine and cheese in the fridge when we stepped through the door. Jon was incredibly helpful setting up a bbq for us and it was great to hear about how he put the really unique pods together and his plans for the future.

We loved our stay! We had a great weekend exploring wineries and it was really nice to stay somewhere quiet and enjoy the Adelaide Hills. We were also appreciative of complementary wine and nibbles provided and recomendations of local places.

Quaint, cosy and perfect for a weekend getaway. Jon was kind enough to include some cheese, olives, cured meats so that we could have a platter, and a delicious bottle of red. Only a few mins drive from a selection of Eden valley cellar doors. Highly recommended!

What an exquisite place to stay. Steeped in history, sumptuously renovated, beautifully located, graciously hosted and wonderful in every other way. Couldn’t speak more highly of this property and can’t wait to return.

Abiding memories around the fire pit of shooting stars, planets in alignment and a beguiling harvest moon.

We absolutely loved our stay at at 1858, and Melissa and Brian were great hosts! The house was amazing (including all the restored furniture) and it had so many lovely details and everything you needed. The outdoor areas were perfect for our getaway with our group of friends and it had really nice views of the paddocks- perfect for evening meals. Thank you very much, we will certainly be back!
Great location and very comfortable accommodation - would happily stay again.

Excellent stay. The cottage was clean, tidy and in a very handy location. Well supplied with everything you need and more. The extras were very much appreciated, milk, eggs and fresh fruit. All small details have been thought of. Big comfortable bed and spacious bathrooms. Nice to sit on the deck with views of the hills.
Would definitely recommend.
Great location which is very accessible to Tanunda. Would definitely come again!

We were lucky to book this modern cottage over New Year, it was the perfect Airbnb for a couple and our 2 dogs. Great location on the main street of Tanunda, across from a huge park and a great brewery. Has everything you need including AC, 3 bedrooms, 2 showers, TV, parking, pet friendly, and full kitchen with extras like milk/eggs/fruit. We loved our stay :)

Great location and host was awesome.  Everything needed was available in the property and any questions were answered quickly.  Very pet friendly. Will definitely book again if available when we are visiting the Barossa.
Clean and tidy premises, comfy beds,  very relaxing sitting outside overlooking the caravan park and hills in the distance.

Birchwood on Bridge is a beautiful and very comfortable authentic SA cottage in a great location.  We loved our stay here, the beds were very comfortable and it was well fitted out.  Lovely touches included outdoor beanbags and Finska to play on the lawn under the magnificent Jacaranda tree.

A beautifully decorated and very well maintained home. Emma did a great job in making the place feels homely and welcoming. Only minutes from the main street and short drive to all those wonderful wineries, this little beauty ticked all the boxes.
We all agree this is the best air bnb we have ever stayed in!! Great location, immaculate property and a wonderful garden to relax in!! Can’t recommended this place enough

Emma was so so easy to communicate with replied so so quick to every question and was more then helpful! The house looks exactly like the photos and is super clean and fresh 😍😍 a quiet beautiful location! Would definitely recommend :)
The house was in pristine condition throughout , and the gardens immaculate . A great location . Will definitely visit again .
Highly recommend this place. Great communication with the host. Lovely spot to explore the Barossa from.

Spacious and comfortable private cabin with en-suite, located in quiet street on top of the hill in Springton, with friendly host Jon. We suggest checking on availability with the local pubs at Springton or Eden Valley if you are looking for a local meal, because their kitchens may only operate on limited hours / days.

Quaint little haven. Very clean and well presented, lovely welcome from Jon. The orchard is coming along nicely as is the shared kitchen space. Would love to come again to experience it in full glory. Highly recommend!!!

We were after a quiet getaway and we got exactly that nice quiet spot with great air conditioning to keep us cool and comftable throughout our stay, would love to re visit in the winter to try out the wood fire! Communication was amazing, cheers john

This is a beautiful cosy getaway spot if you’re looking for somewhere to stay and enjoy the Barossa from.

The accomodation is comfy, feels super spacious despite its size, and really well cared for and looked after. Jon was really helpful with any questions we had, and gave us great tips about the local area (Barossa Valley Cheese Company is a must visit in Angaston, 100% amazing local tip).

The eco-friendly nature of the accomodation is just another reason to stay there (plus, Maggie the dog is a great friendly face to see as you head to and from your car to the Hut).
Jon was a fabulous host. He was easy to communicate with and recommended places to eat. It was lovely sitting outside eating breakfast listening to the birds.

Very unique accommodation with fantastic facilities. Easy stroll to the main street and setback from the road so was very quiet. Will be recommending to any friends looking for a place to stay in the Barossa.
Such a gorgeous place to stay at! So calm and relaxing, such a homely yet villa feel. I’ll definitely recommend this to all my friends and family who are looking for a weekend away ☺️ Thank you!
Wonderful, clean place right next to all the popular venues
This is a perfect little place - very cute! And close to the main strip of shops. Nick was a great host. Can't wait to be back - fav air bnb spot so far.
This stay was more than we expected. The home is styled beautifully and the outdoor area is fantastic for family entertaining!! The bathroom is amazing. It truly was a hidden gem!
Thankyou so much for an amazing accomodation. Would definitely recommend this beautiful place. 10/10 ❤️
lovely place! friendly host!
Nick made everything very simple and accessible. Perfect stay in a great location!

Jane's house is central to everything in the Barossa Valley. The room is comfortable, with a bathroom and toilet just outside the bedroom. The houses common areas are spacious and inviting and Jane is a lovely host who made us feel very welcomed in her house with her bubbly, eccentric personality. We would stay here again 😊

Jane has a beautiful home with lots of nice touches, and plenty of room, she was very accomodating, flexible with check in and check out, we were able to use kitchen and outdoor facilities. We enjoyed her company, and also had our own space, would definitely recommend.
Jane is a very nice lady who provides a really nice and tidy place. The place is full of beautiful plants and a lovely little cat. No one would regret coming to Jane’s and stay for a few days.

We really enjoyed our stay.  Jane is a very friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating host who made us feel very welcome. The stay has good facilities and is located in a quiet area close to shops and cafes and in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Highly recommended.
